entry.sense:
the vowel a (a-kāra, q. v.). In the foll. places
(all metrical) the Cts assume a particle a without any
real meaning (nipāta-mattaṁ or padapūraṇa-mattaṁ):
a-punappunaṁ, Ja I 503,19*; a-majjapa, Ja VI 328,3*;
a-piḷandhana, Vv-a 279,5'; a-siñcati, ib.307,12'; a-puc-
chasi, Sn 1050; a-nantaka, ib. 311,5'; at other verbal
forms: a-māpaya, a-māpetvā (?), Ja VI 518,31-32*;
a-passato, ib. 552,8*. To this Tr. also refers a-yaṁ
phalaṁ, Ja II 112,19* [but ayaṁ (see [ā/a]ya) is probably
preferable], and tad-a-te [but see tadaṁ], Ja IV 404,11*.
Cf. 2a-, and the words above separately.

prefix used as augment in the aor. (resp. impf.)
tense of verbs as well as in the conditional forms, equal
to the same prefix in sa., but in Pāli it is very often
dropped (see Geiger § 158), which is probably due to
peculiar prosodical features. Even after the prohibitive
particle mā (q. v.) it often occurs, differently from sa.
— With a foll. or prec. a (ā) it is contracted to
â, e. g. âsi(ṁ), âsuṁ, ud-ânesi, apâ-nudi, avâ-cari,
upâ-gami, pâ-hesi; note also the lengthening of a in
pātvā-kāsi (from pātu-karoti), sacchā-kāsi (besides
sacchi-a-kāsi and sacchi-kāsi, from sacchi-karoti),
manasā-kāsi (besides manasi-a-kāsi and manasi-kāsi).
As seen from these examples the augment always im-
mediately precedes the verbal root, and thus we have
with prp. ati: acc-a-gā, with adhi: ajjh-a-gā, with
anu: anv-a-gā or ann-a-gā, with abhi: abbh-a-ññāsi,
with paṭi: pacc-a-bhāsi, with pari: pary-a-gā, and
with vi: vy-a-gamā, etc.; in ajjha-so-vasi, Bv III 26
= IV 19 (p. 20-22), the augment and the prp. are
separated from the verb (tmesis). — After the augment
an original double cons. is preserved, e. g. a-ggahiṁ,
a-cchidā (and after this analogy also a-bbhidā, from
√bhid), a-ññāsi, a-ṭṭhāsi, a-ddakkhi, ud-a-bbadhi
(√vyadh), a-ssosi (√çru), while ud-a-ddhari (v. l. ud-a-
bbhari) is perhaps a blending of uddhari and *ud-a-
hari. Likewise we find double cons. (: sa. single
cons. + ṛ) in a-ddasa (√dṛç, or after the analogy of
a-ddakkhi), a-ssaji (√sṛj, cf. sa. asrākṣīt); on the other
hand we find e. g. a-phassayi (√spṛç), a-bhassatha
(√bhraṁç), a-sāyisuṁ (√svād).
Rem. a. In some few instances the augment
is placed before the prp.: a-paribrūhayi, Ja V 361,16*,
a-vissaji (or corr. to avassaji), Ja VI 79,20*, a-pā-
pessaṁ, Ja II 11,18; or between two prp.: pacc-a-
niyyāsi, DN II 22,18 (also in the imp. -āhi(l), ib.
16; perhaps we have here pacca = sa. pratyak),
ajjhavodahi (?) Ja V 365,29*.
Rem. b. The augment is sometimes added to other
forms of the verb than those to which it properly be-
longs: ud-a-patto si, Ja III 484,22*, cf. so ca vegen'
ud-a-(p)patto, ib. V 71,11*; 73,15' (see Fsb. Bern
p. 35 (41)); vy-a-sanna (= visanna) Ja IV 399,6*,
480,7*, 486,9*; pacc-a-niyyāhi, DN II 22,16 (but see
above, rem. a); perhaps also in nir-a-ssajanti (= nis-
sajanti), Sn. 791, if not a blending of nirassati and
nissajati as suggested Pj II 717,6).
Rem. c. Sometimes we find augmented aor. with
the terminations of the present tense: a-pucchasi,
Sn. 1050; a-siñcati Vv-a 307,12' (with two pi path a)
(cf. 1a above); otherwise it deserves to be noticed
that as we have aor. directly derived from the special
present stems, e. g. sam-a-tiṭṭhata, pa-hiṇi, so we
have, vice versa, pres. pâheti (q. v.) after the ana-
logy of aor. pâhesi, where â contains the augment.
Rem. d. As for a-pabbaji, a-gaṇhi, a-labhiṁsu,
a-sakkhi, a-heṭhayuṁ, etc., where a has a negative
meaning, see below under 3a- (7).

(and before vowels an-), negative prefix.
This a-, e. g. in appamāṇa (cf. pamāṇa), is by comm.
explained as 'great', Ps ad MN II 13,19 (appamāṇān[ī/i]ti
vaḍḍhita-pamāṇāni; mahantān[ī/i]ti attho); Sp-ṭ ad Sp
22,8 (mahanto saṁvaro a-sarirvaro, vuḍḍhi-attho
hi ayam a-kāro cf. Sv 119,29); As 44,27 (vuddhipattā
sekkhā = a-sekkhā); Sadd (do.). — 1. In adj.
comp. with subst. = 'without that', e. g. a-kaṇa,
a-kāma, a-kopa, etc. q. v. — 2. comp. with subst.
to denote the opposite or the thing in question
destroyed: mahāpaṭhaviṁ a-paṭhaviṁ karissāmi,
MN II 27,11; do. a-gāma, a-nigama, a-janapada,
MN II 97,27 ≠ AN I 159,33; a-nagara, AN I 160,1,
Ps (MN I 139); a-raṭṭha, Ja IV 389,26; V 135,1;
a-brāhmaṇa, Ja IV 388,5 (cf. kulā a-kulataṁ gatā,
Ja V 117,6*); assa maraṇaṁ a-maraṇaṁ bhavissati,
Ja VI 81,8. — 3. The opposite is sometimes expressly
denoted by another prefix: a-vivitta: pa-vivitta,
Dhp-a II 77,2-5; a-kubbato: sa-kubbato, Dhp 51-52;
a-kataññurūpa: su-kataññurūpa, Ja IV 98,28-99,2.
— 4. In comp. the negated member comes last: katâkata,
Dhp 50; uddiṭṭhânuddiṭṭha, AN III 274,4, guttâgutta,
ib. 32. In a-takkagāha-takkagāha, Ja I 105,19', the
order is determined by the words commented upon
(cf. a-kappiya-kata). As to phalâphala, maggâmagga
(q. v..) cf. Tr. Pāli Misc. 74. — 5. Negation apparently
to the verb of a clause, but added to a subst. or adv.:
evaṁ no idhâpi a-vāso bhavissati, Ps ch. 56; an-
ācariyakule vasaṁ (= ācariyakule a-vasamāno) Ja
I 436,19*. — 6. Often added to infinite forms of the
verbs, part, inf., abs., grdv.: a-jānaṁ, a-passaṁ, MN I
288,6-7; a-passato, Ja VI 552,8* (cf. 1a); a-katena me
ettha kataṁ, a-vusitena me ettha vusitaṁ, MN I
515,22-23, suriye an-atthamite, Dhp-a I 86,9; a-kara-
ṇīya, a-kattabba, etc. (q. v.); a-gantuṁ, As. 156,17
(Ed. wrongly āgantuṁ), a-dātuṁ, Ja V 3,21, a-ppab-
bajituṁ (na sakkā), Dhp-a I 136,3, a-socituṁ (na
sakkā), Ja III 214,7* = 390,5*, an-āharituṁ, Dhp-a I
403,9; a-katvā, a-disvā, etc.; an-ūpaneyya, Sn 799,
an-abhineyya, Vin III 149,16. — 7. Also to personal
forms of the verbs a- is not rarely added (although
sometimes with na as v. l.): an-ajjhagaṁ, Th 405,
an-abhirami, Ja III 30,20, an-āgami, Mhv V 249 (v.
l., Ed. nâgami), a-kattha, Ja IV 401,15, a-gaṇhi,
Ja V 135,3 (v. l. na gaṇhi), a-pabbaji, Ja VI 129,13
(but here Tr.-proposes to read upacchinditvā na pab-
baji?), mā adaṁsu, SN II 200,17, a-parihāviṁsu, AN
III 310,19 (Ed. na), a-labhiṁsu, Ja V 229,22 (B. na),
a-labhissaṁ, Ja VI 35,10, 43,1i; a-sakkhi, . Ja VI
202,21*; a-heṭhayuṁ (B. na . . . aheṭhayuṁ) Ja "VI
591,17*; an-ajjhācarati AN IV 270,11 (v. l.); a-jānāmi,
Ja II 243,25 (B. āma jānāmi); a-ppabodhati (q. v.),
Dhp. 143 (?); an-uppajjati, Dhp-a III 376,15; a-sakkosi,
Ja I 116,24 (v. l.); a-sakkoti, Ja IV 122,5' (B. na), Dhp-a
I 51,1, IV 17,4; [cirass' apassāmi, Ja IV 446,29* ought
to be spelt cirassa(ṁ) passāmi]. — 8. The negative
prefix is doubled (with a positive result) in ana- or
combined with another negative prefix, e. g. an-a-kāma
(not unwilling), a-nipphala (not without fruit). —9. ana-
in ana-bhāva is negative of bhāva, a phenomenon
better known from Prakrit (cf. Pischel § 77); likewise
prob. ana-vajja, whereas anaññāta anappameyya (?),
anamatagga, anavaya, anavosita (q. v.( should be
explained otherwise. [Cf. Tr. Pāli Misc. p. 64.]

the base of several pronouns and adv.: ayam
(assa, etc.); asu (adu), amu (etc.); ato, atra, atha, atho,
cf. ajja.

the prp. ā (q. v,) shortened before double cons.,
e. g. a-kkamāti, a-ssama, etc.

in gramm. designation of the nasal sound
or ending of the accusative, Kacc. 8; 30 (cf. niggahīta).
entry.re: — °-vacanaaṁ-vacana, n. = acc. sg., Kacc-v. 188.

entry.sense:
m., [sa. aṁça] a share, part, portion,
Abh. 485, 1102 (only ifc.) see: atīta°, anāgata°,
Ambara°, āyata°, ubhaya°, eka°, thira°, dīgha°,
pacc-a°, paccuppanna°, paṭiviṁsa (?), pāpiya°,
puṭa-°, metta°, sira°, sukka°, seyya°, soḷasa°.

m. [sa. aṁsa] the shoulder, Abh. 264,
1102; ekena ~ena, AN I 62,1; ~ena ~aṁ, shoulder
to shoulder, Ja IV 98,16*; abl.- ~ato, Ja VI 557,3,
562,13*; ~e katvā (having shouldered) Ja I 9,18';
~e ṭhapitaṁ (°cīvaraṁ), Ja IV 114,21; pl. ubho ~e
pārupati (cf. ekaṁsa), Ss 101,8; Ps (MN II 245,28);
~ehi, Sn 609. — Ifc. v. antar-a°, eka°, samācita°.

m. [sa. °açra, açri], edge, corner (cf. 1assa
& aṁsi); eatūhi ~ehi yuttaṁ caturaṁsaṁ, As 317,23
— Ifc. see: aṭṭha°, catur-a°, chaḷ-a°, tiy-a°.

m., an ornament of a chariot (?), Vv 743,
Vv-a 275,25' (~eh[ī/i]ti kubbaraphale patiṭṭhitehi heṭ-
ṭhima-aṁsehi).

n., a special form of the robes of
a monk (?), Vism. 65,22 (cf. kāsāva).

(m.) [ts.] (the extremity of) the
shoulder, or the shoulder joint; ~e olambetvā (scil.
pattaṁ), Ja I 55,24 ≠ Ss 57; Pj II 52,30 (pattaṁ ~e
ālaggetvā); Vin III 127,4 (~ena pahāraṁ adāsi); Vv-a
123,25. — Ifc. see vāma°.

m. = aṁsa-vaṭṭaka (also
spelt °vaddhaka), both forms alternating in the texts;
a shoulder strap (one of the parikkhārā or requisites
of a monk): Vin I 204,10; II 114,6 = 117,10 (Olden-
berg proposes always to spell °bandhaka, ibid. 317,7);
II 177,6; Dhp-a III 452,17; Vv 350 (°vaṭṭaka), Vv-a
142,14 (°bandhana). — amsa-vaṭṭaka-maṇḍana,
n. adorning or furnishing with a shoulder strap, Dhp-a III 452,17.
m., a corner, Vv-a 303,29.

mfn. (cf. 3aṁsa) having edges or
corners, Vv-a 339,32 (pl. ~vanto). aṁsavat

pl. m. (?) [sa. arça(s), m. n. but taken as
f. by Nidd I 370,10], name of a disease, hemorrhoids,
AN V 110,7 (~ā, piḷakā, bhagandalā, etc.). Cf. arisa.

f. [sa. açri] edge, corner; ekamekāva ~iyā
ratanā satta nimmitā, Vv 861 (Vv-a 303,29); pācīna-
sākhāya (of a cotton-plant) ekam eva ... phalaṁ ahosi,
tassa cha ~iyo, chasu ~isu cha kappāsapiṇḍiyo pup-
phitā, Ps III 107,10 (a liar's tale).

m. (from 2aṁsa), one who bears upon the
shoulders, Kacc-v 352; Mogg IV,30 (Pay).

m. [sa. aṁçu], 1. a filament, thread, Abh
1121, Vism 622,34; As 317,7; 243,19 (°-abbhantara-
gataṁ malaṁ); gen. ~uno (of a cotton wick), As 316,7 ;
cīvare ~mattam pi, Vism, 380,28 ; As 334,18 (of the
beard of a feather). — Ifc. (°ṁsu) see kappāsa°,
kosiya°. — 2. a ray, sunbeam, Abh 64 (f.) & 1121
n. [sa. aṁçuka], cloth, Abh 290.
m., the sun, Abh 63. (cf. aṁsu,2). aṁsu-mālin

mfn. [sa. akarkaça], not hard or
rough; tender, mild, harmless; smooth, pure; Dhp. 408
= Sn 632 (Pj, Dhp-a = apharusa, Ps = niddosa);
Ja V 203,27* (bhāsitaṁ, = apharusaṁ, agaḷitaṁ, ib.
206,22'); Ja III 282,13* (sūci); Ja V 405,30* (pokkha-
raṇī); Ja II 418,22' (= 'a-kāca').

mfn., with smooth and pure limbs,
Ja V 204,15* (207,7').

(or °ḷa), mfn. [cf. sa. kakkhaṭa], not
hard; only in next, etc. (a-kakkhala)

f. 'not hardness', mildness, smooth-
ness; Dhs §44 > mudutā +); As 151,4 (= akakkhala-
bhāva, m.).

f., mildness in speech, As
397,18' (= 'apharusa-vācatā').

mfn. [cf. sa. kāṅkshā], free from
desire; anejo akhilo ~o, Sn 477 (Pj); so 'ham ~o apiho
anūpayo, SN II 81,15*.

mfn. [sa. akathya], not fit for dis-
course or conversation, AN I 197,18 (Mp).

mfn. [heretical dialect and Vin = a-kata,
sa. akṛta], not made, not created, not prepared; satt'ime
kāyā ~ā akatavidhā animmitā animmātā, etc., DN I
56,21 (Sv) = MN I 517,19 (Ps) = SN III 211,7. Ifc
kaṭâ-°.

m., prob. the bare ground of a
slope (used as a lodging-place, senāsana); Dhp-a II
82,20; Ps I 90,16; Mp. '

m., an uncultivated field,
Ps ch. 27 = Mp. ad AN II 209,28 = Sv I 78,26.

m. n., broth, not especially prepared
(without any admixture?), Vin I 206,30.

f., request omitted [or: request
of unprepared matters], only instr. (adv.) ~iyā, Tr.
from Pālim, prob. on Vin III 144,24 foll.

mfn., not caused to be created,
DN I 56,21 (akata+, q. v.) = a-kata-vidhāna, mfn.
Sv I 167,8.

mfn., who has not been
dealt with according to the law; Vin IV 137,4 ff
(anādara +) (Sp).

entry.re:
— °-pākimaa-kaṭṭha-pākima
mfn., do., DN III 199,31* (Sv), Ap 59,28, Anāg 27*.

entry.sense:
f., 'not stiffness', absence of rigidity,
Dhs § 44 > mudutā +); As 151,4' (= a-kaṭhina-
bhāva, m.).

mfn. 'free from kaṇa (i. e. the red coating
which underlies the husk, Child.), DN III 88,13 (~o
athuso, etc., scil. akatthapāko sāli = nikkundaka.
Sv); 199,33*; Anāg 27*; Mhv V 30 (Mhv-ṭ).

mfn. (opp. sa-kaṇika, cf. kaṇikā), free
from moles or freckles, DN I 80,18 (Sv) - MN II 20,1
(Ps) (v. l. akaṇikaṅga).

mfn. [ts.], 'free from thorns', fig. free
from enemies, troubles, or passions; agreeable, pleasant;
DN III 146,20 (Sv) = 177,12 (akhilaṁ animittaṁ
~aṁ (paṭhaviṁ), v. l. akaṇṭhaka); DN I 135,25 (khe-
maṭṭhitā janapadā ~ā); Ja II 118,9 (gumbe); V 260,13*
(~aṁ agahanaṁ mahāpathaṁ); Vv 163 (sikkhāpadā-
naṁ . . . maggo ~o agahano — rāga-kaṇṭakādīnaṁ
abhāvena ~o, Vv-a 96,1); AN V 135,6 (~ā viharatha,
nikkaṇṭakā v°, etc.). Cf. sa-kaṇṭaka.

mfn. [sa. akṛṣṇa], not black (dark),
i.e. not low, vile, bad (opp. a-sukka); MN I 389,23
(kammaṁ; Ps) = AN II 230,24 (Mp); ~aṁ a-sukkaṁ
nibbānaṁ (having nothing to do with either bad or
good), DN III 251,3 (Sv) = AN III 384,25.

(or a-kaṇhâsukka-
vipāka), mfn., having neither bad nor good result,
MN I 389,26 (scil. kammaṁ) = AN II 230,24; DN III
230,5 (Sv). a-kaṇha-a-sukka-vipāka

mfn., having light (yellow) eyes,
Ja II 241,11*, 16' (= piṅgalanetta).

mfn. (cf. akata) [sa. a-kṛta], 1. undone,
not made, Dhp 165; 314 = SN I 49,11*;Vin III 162,35;
AN III 38,2 ≠ IV 266,2; Ja II 276,6'; Mil 110,32; AN
V 163,11; Ud 80,31 (ajātaṁ +); Ja VI 223,23* (~aṁ
bhūmiṁ agate, where there was not made room for
them, = akatokāsaṁ bhūmiṁ, Ct.); Mil 137,3 (pubbe
~ena, not owing to former deeds, cf. pubbe katena,
ib. 136,30). — 2. not cultivated, not trained, Ja III
57,25* (pl. — akatabuddhino asikkhitakā). — Ifc. v.
katâkata.

n. (cf. akata, mfn.), 'the uncreated' =
Nibbāna, Abh 7 (cf. akata-ññu).

mfn., not made allowable, Vin I
215,25 (phalaṁ). Cf. kappiya-kāraka, akappakata.

mfn. (cf. sa. kṛtakarman), "one
who has not done his work", MN I 448,31 ≠ AN III
102,10 > mānavehi ~ehi opp. kata-kamma, q. v.); Mp
ad loc. explains it by corikaṁ kātuṁ gacchantā, i. e.
who are going plundering; cf. Vism. 180,21 (~ā corā).

mfn., having committed no good
deeds: ~ṇo akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo = katapāpo,
etc., AN I 155,12; II 174,15; It 25,1; MN III 165,6.

mfn., having committed no sin,
Vin, III 72,6 (akatapāpa +, = katakalyāṇa +) (Sp).
mfn. = akatakalyāṇa (q. v.).

mfn., knowing the uncreated (i. e.
Nibbāna, cf. 2a-kata); Dhp 97; 383; Dhp-a II 188,1
(akataṁ nibbānaṁ jānāt[ī/i]ti ~ū). 1a-kata-ññu

f. (sa. akrtajñatā), ingratitude;
AN I 61,22.

mfn. (sa. akṛtātman), having an un-
formed, uncivilized mind, rude; Ja V 351,24* (= asam-
pādita-attabhāva, mittadūbhi(n), ib. 352,1').

(m)f(n), unmarried; f. ~ā,
Ja IV 179,12' (= 'anāpādā').

mfn., who has not pronounced
his paritta (q. v.); Mil 152,30.

mfn., who has not committed any
sin; Vin III 72,6 (Sp) (~o akataluddo akatakibbiso,
= katakalyāṇo, etc.).

mfn., who has acquired no merit;
Mil 250,2 (nibbisesā ~ā buddhiparinīnā).

mfn., not honoured, Spk
(SN V 89,17 = 'a-bahukata').

mfn., who has not acquired any
intellectual training; Ja III 58,10' (~ino asikkhitakā,
= 'akatā').

mfn., who has not procured
a sure place of refuge; AN I 155,11, etc. (Mp) (v.
akatakalyāṇa +).

(m.), an ordinary scraper
(accord. to Sp without makara-dantaka (q. v.)); Vin
II 106,22.

mfn., unpractised; SN I 98,33
(Sp) (v. asikkhita +).

mfn., not shortened (as a vowel),
Kacc 116.
mfn., see akaṭavidha.

mfn., ungrateful; AN I 61,21,
etc. (akataññū +). a-kata-vedin

f., ingratitude; AN I 61,22 (aka-
taññutā ~ā).

n., 'manufacture [of clothes]
not yet existing' (opp. kata-paribhanda, q. v.); Ps
(MN III 110,6).

mfn., unacquainted, not
familiar; Ja III 63,12' (= 'asanthuta').

mfn., who has not made an
appointment; Ja V 436,20'.

mfn., who has not taken an
advocate, Vin IV 218,16.

mfn., untrained; SN I 98,33 (v.
asikkhita +).

mfn., free from clinging to the
world; Ja I 110,13' (āraddhaviriyassa ~assa vipassa-
kassa).

mfn., who has not done service,
unexercised; SN I 98,33 (Spk) (v. asikkhita +).

mfn., not honoured (but cf.
ajinūpasevita); Ja II 276,8' (°gijjhapattâdīhi ~ena).

mfn., having no room made; Ja VI
224,2' (Ed. a-kat'-obhāsa).

m., one who does no good (in return);
Ja III 26,27* (akataññū +). a-kattar

mfn. (grd.), what will not, or ought
not to be done; Ja V 237,22'; Ja VI 405,21 (n'atthi
tava ~aṁ, everything may be expected). — °-paṭi-kamma, mfn., on whom no cure is to be applied, in-
curable; Mp. (AN III 146,30 = 'atekiccha').
entry.re:
— °-rūpaa-kattabba-rūpa,
mfn. — akiriyarūpa (q. v.); Ja III 531,8'; Dhp-a III
103,8.

— °-viratia-kattabba-virati, f., unnecessary cessation or ab-
stinence (?); Rūp 130,18. — Cf. a-kātabbatta.

entry.sense:
m. [sa. Agastya, cf. Pāṇ II 4,?o & tamil
Akattiyan'], Npr. of a tāpasa; Cp 11,3*.
entry.re:
— °-cariyaAkatti-cariya,
n., title of the 1st chapter in Cp. Cf. Akitti.

entry.sense:
mfn. (part., v. √katth & vi-
katthati), not praising oneself (for: loc.); Sn 783 (sīlesu).

abs. (v. karoti); manasi ~ (v. manasi
karoti); Ja I 230,26; cf. a-manasikatvā, Dhp-a l 400,3.

f., not preaching, Pv-a 222,20 ( =
'nâcikkhanā').

mfn. (v. katheti); hence a-kathitatta,
n., the being undeclared, Kv-a 151,9.

mfn., free from mud; Ja III 289,8*;
290,6* 12* (rahado); SN II 269,11 (bhisamuḷālaṁ).
entry.re: — °ôdakaa-kaddamôdaka, mfn., with not muddy water, Th-a ad Th 7.

entry.sense:
1. m. pl. (~ā) [sa. akaniṣṭha, cf.
Vvu 161,5-6], a class of (the highest) divine beings;
DN II 52,24 (Sv), 268,23; MN I 289,23 (~ānaṁ devā-
naṁ). — 2. n, the world of those divine beings; Dhp-a
III 290,1 (~aṁ gacchanto); Pj I 166,15 (Yāmato
yāva ~aṁ). — °-gāmi(n), mfn., going to A°; (ud-
dhaṁsota+) AN I 233,29 (Mp), V 120,7 ; SN V 201,1s;
237,14; Pp 17,18 (Ct.); Pj I 182,26; Netti-a (Netti
190,3). — °-devatā, f. pl. = akaniṭṭha, 1, Pj I
120,8.
entry.re:
— °-brahmalokaA-kaniṭṭha-brahmaloka, m., the A°-heaven; Ps (MN
I 210,32).

— °-bhavatiaA-kaniṭṭha-bhavatia, n.; do., Ja III 487,1; Dhp-a
I 54,21 (yāva ~ā); also °-brahma-bhavana, n., Pj I
197,17.

entry.sense:
mfn., not beloved, disagreeable, unlovely;
Ja V 295,15*; VI 207,6*; aniṭṭho ~o amanāpo (vi-
pāko), AN I 28,26 ≠ MN III 66,12; do. AN II 213,27;
III 103,11; Vibh-a 9,1i (= a-kāmita;; Vibh 100,30
(Vibh-a 106,28, derivation from √kram); instr. ~ena,
~ehi, in an unpleasant manner, or in disagreeable
words, AN II 213,20; DN II 192,12. — Ifc. aniṭṭha-°.

or a-kantiya, mfn., disagreeable; SN
IV 71,6* (gandhaṁ); Pv 439 (= akanta, amanāpa,
jeguccha, Pv-a 193,5). a-kantika

mfn., not made legal (by kappa-
bindu, q. v.), Vin I 254,34. Cf. akatakappa.

mfn., 1. not fit, improper, unsuitable;
Vin III 20,19 (Sp) (an-anucchaviyaṁ +); MN I 460,30;
Vin I 251,1. — 2. not included (in the sum), not
numbered; Sn 860 (kappaṁ n'eti ~o, = pahīnakappo,
Pj). — °-aṭṭhena, instr., in the sense of being
unfit, As 208,17. — °-kata, mfn., not made allow-
able, or declared not to be a llowable, Vin IV 82,29
(Sp).
entry.re:
— °-bhaṇḍaa-kappiya-bhaṇḍa, n., unauthorized things, Vin II
169,31.

— °-maṁsaa-kappiya-maṁsa, n., unsuitable meat, Ps (MN I
369,9) (e. g. acchamaṁsa, dīpi-m°). — °sayanāni, title
of Khuddas XXV. — Ifc. kappiyâ-°.

entry.sense:
mfn., unshakable; Mhv XV 175;
Saddh 594.

mfn. (grd. v. kampati), not to be
shaken, immovable, Pj II 411,2. Cf. akampiya.

mfn., not hesitating; Ja IV
311,19'(~ā anosakkamānā); VI 293,13'.

mfn., not trembling; MN II 138,8
(acchambhī + ). a-kampin

entry.re:
— °-cittaa-kampita-citta,
n., a firm mind, Pj I 154,12.

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. akampya] = akampanīya
(q. v.); Mil 386,1 (acalo ~o asampavedhī); Thī 201
(~aṁ atuliyaṁ aputhujjanasevitaṁ . . . dhammaṁ)
(v. l. akampitaṁ); Mil 354,24 (°-aṭṭhena, in the sense
of being unshaken).

n. [sa. akarma], 1 something that is
not done, Mil 177,27; Vin I 316,9 (vaggakammaṁ ~aṁ
na ca karaṇīyaṁ). — 2. inactivity, Ja V 121,18-19*
(by Ct. ib. 123,7-9' explained as improper work, evil
deed: ayuttena (or ayutta-kamma-)karaṇena [Ed.
wrongly (a)kāraṇena]).

mfn. [sa. akarmaka], 1. having
nothing to do with karma, Mil 137,1 (~ena hetunā).
— 2. intransitive, Mogg V 60.

mfn., undutiful, AN IV 92,22*,
quoted Ja II 348,4* (f. pl. ~ā).

mfn., not originating from karma,
Mil 268,11.

mfn. [sa. akarmaṇya], not fit for
its work, indisposed; AN IV 333,3 (kayo kilanto ~o)
= DN III 256,2. Cf. akammanīya, °eyya.

f., indisposedness for work,
Mil 300,21 (kāyassa); Dhs § 1156, 1236; As 377,23
(= cittagelaññasaṁkhāto ~âkāro).

mfn. (cf. akamniañña & next),
unfit, AN I 5,8 (abhāvitaṁ cittaṁ); Mp. — °vagga,
m; title of AN I 5-6. — a-kammanīyatā, f., do.
abstr., Nett 86,19; 108,14. a-kammanīya

mfn. = prec. Ja IV 385,7*
(bāhaṁ pasāreti ~aṁ); quoted Ps III 79,21.

mfn. [sa. akalmāṣa], 'not variegated',
i. e. spotless, pure; MN I 322,21 (sīlāni
akhaṇḍāni+); Ps; DN III 245,25 ≠AN III 36,10;
132,14; 213,5; 289,7 (Mp) (ariyakantāni sīlāni ...
akhaṇḍāni +); SN IV 272,17 (do.); AN IV 54,8
(akhaṇḍaṁ +, scil. brahmacariyaṁ).

mfn., acting consistently,
consequent; AN II 187,30; 243,19 (akhaṇḍakārī +). a-kammāsa-kārin

l.v. karoti (part); Sn 65 (= akaronto,
Pj II 118,7). — 2. v. do. aor.

n. [ts.], 1. not doing; MN II 214,9 ≠
AN I 220,33 (navānaṁ kammānaṁ) (= anāyūhana,
Mp); MN I 93,5 (pāpassa kammassa); Dhp 183 (Netti
44,14); As 127,1 (pāpassa). — 2. improper deed, Ja I
106,32 (Ed. akāraṇa, cf. Ja V 123,7', see akamma).
— Ifc. see kalyāṇâ°.

mfn. (grd. v. karoti) [ts.], 1. not to
be done, Ja V 237,12* ( = akattabba); MN I 415,17
(tassa kiñci pāpaṁ ~aṁ); Vin I 96,23 (cattāri ~āni);
Vin III, 20,20 etc. (an-anucchaviya+ ; Sp). — 2. without
having any business, Vin I 154,25 (~o pakkamati).
— 3. to whom is nothing to do, or, who cannot be overcome,
DN II 76,2 (~ā Vajjī raññā Māgadhena; Sv) = AN
IV 20,29 (Mp); AN IV 109,3 = IV 434,1 (~o Mārassa);
Mp.

(f.) [cf. sa. akaraṇi, Pāṇini III 3,112]
Kacc-v 647 (akarāni te jamma kammaṁ = na
kattabbaṁ). (The Sutta of Kacc "akkose namhāni"
possibly originally meant °namhi ani, but Kacc-v
and Sadd take it °namhi āni).
aor. & a-karonta, part. v. karoti.

akalu, n. [sa. agaru, aguru, tamil akil],
the Agallochum, or the fragrant Aloe wood, used as
ointment; Abh 302; Mil 338,13; Ja IV 440,23* (~uṁ
candanaṁ ca = kāḷâkaluñ ca rattacandanañ ca).
— akalu-candana-vilitta, mfn., anointed with Aloe
and sandal Ja VI 144,27* = 154,1*. — Cf. agaḷu,
agaru. — Ifc. see kāḷâ-°.

mfn. [ts.], displeased, not glad, Sn 692.
Cf akalla.
f., v. akallatā.
mfn. = akalya, Sn 691.

mfn. [ts.], not handsome, not good;
Pj I 126,15 (°-mitta-saṁsagga).
entry.re:
— °-karaṇaa-kalyāṇa-karaṇa, n., bad
action, Pj I 157,24.

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. akalya], not fit, Sn 456 (°a[ṁ]
gottapañhaṁ, = appatirūpa Pj); not true, wrong,
DN II 68,13; unwell, Thī 439 (Ct. = gilāna, cf. next).

n. [perhaps to be taken as ākalla, cf. sa.
akalya], disease; Abh 323 (gelaññâkallam ābādho).

mfn., ill, sick; Vin III 62,20 (Sp,
quoted As 377,22); Ja III 464,4.

f. (v. l. akalyatā), illness, indisposition,
Dhs § 1156, 1157 (cittassa, kāyassa; = gilānabhāva,
As 377,20, 378,2) quoted Mp (AN I 3,19).

mfn. (cf. kavāṭa), having no door;
Vin II 148,8 (vihārā ~ā).

mfn., free from impurity or faults;
AN I 112,21 (avaṁka +); opp. sa-kasāva, cf. anik-
kasāva. — akasāvatta, n., abstr., AN I 112,23 (avaṁ-
katta +).

mfn., spotless, smooth, clear, pure; DN
II 244,10* ≠ Ja II 418,20* (veḷuriyo ~o vimalo
subho = akakkaso, Ct.); Sn 476 (suddho niddoso
vimalo ~o; Pj); Ja V 206,5' (= akhīlaka, q. v.);
Nett 55,21 (= niddosatāya akācaṁ, Ct.).
— a-kāci(n), mfn. do., °naṁ, Vv 689 (akācinan ti nid-
dosaṁ . . . ājāniyan ti pi pāḷī, Vv-a 253,2).

n. abstr. (see a-kattabba), Ja I
233,13' (with instr.).
ind. ( = a-katvā, see karoti), Kacc-v 566.

mfn., not frequented by evil
men (epith. to samādhi etc.), DN III 279,2 (Sv) =
AN III 24,17 (Mp); Th 649 (Ct.); Thī 189 (Ct.).

mfn. [ts.], 1, without desire, free from
lust, Sn 1096 (= nikkāma, Pj). — 2, involuntary,
not willing, Sn 445 (°assa te); MN II 178,19 = AN
III 384,12 (Mp); Ja V 183,25*; 295,15*; VI 397,4*;
508,8*; Ja V 121,4* (v. l. akāmasā, q. v.). Cf. a-kāmā,
ind.

mfn. (f. ~ikā), = akāma 2; DN I
115,18 (= an-icchamāna, Sv); MN II 57,4 = Vin III
13,6 (= anicchaka, Ps Sp); Vin II 181,18; Ja IV 31,13*,
35,20*; 439,25*; V 183,22; 237,26'.

mfn., to be done (or dealt
with) even against one's will, Ja V 237,14*; Mil 241,9
(~ā puttāmātāpitunnaṁ), 241,14 (~aṁ karonto).

mfn. [cf. kāmakāmi(n)], free
from lust, Sn 1096. a-kāma-kāmin

f., the state of being forced, ~āya, neces-
sarily, Ps I 268,30.

mfn., unwilling, Jal V 33,13'.
Ifc. an-°.

ind., against one's will, Ja V 121,4*
(v. l. C, Ed. akāmassa, cf. Sn 445).

ind. (a+kāma,m.), involuntarily, against
one's will, if one does not like; Ja V 237,13*; VI
397,3-4* (cf. v. l. akāma-vasino); 506,12*; Vin III
186,14 (Sp); I 128,31; 132,30; 282,24; 299,27 (nâ-
kāmā, not necessarily if not wished; Vv 90 (Vv-a 55,28).

mfn., not beloved, Vibh-a 9,11 ( =
'akanta', Ed. akāmika).

m. [ts.], the syllable or particle a (Gr.);
~o nipāto, Ja I 503,21, cf. above 1a.

mfn., innocent; °-bhāva, m., innocence,
Dhp-a III 157,16.

mfn., who does or has done nothing,
i. e. 1, having done no wrong, innocent, guiltless,
blameless; Jal V 29,20; Mil 186,16 (+ anaparādha);
Dhp-a III 27,15. — 2, who does no good, Ps (MN I
319,15) (duppatipanno ~o); being of no service, useless,
Vin I 302,2.

n. [ts.], 1. absence of a cause; instr.
~ena, abl. ~ā (adv.) = without reason, by accidence,
in vain, MN II 45,5; Ja I 423,17 (kiñca nâkāraṇena,
Tr.); V 336,11; VI 542,29; 316,3' (= 'adhicca').
— 2. a mistaken cause, Ja IV 242,4' (= 'anaya').
— 3. an impossible thing (= atthāna, anavakāsa), Mp
(AN I 26,30) cf. Pj II 105,1s; As 30,4 (aṭṭhānaṁ
akāraṇaṁ). — Cf. a-karaṇa.

mfn. (pp. caus., v. kāreti). °-pubba,
mfn. not applied before, MN I 446,7 (kāraṇā, training).

mfn. [sa. akārya], not to be done, that
may not be done; Dhp 176 = It 18,17*.

f., unkindness, the not being
compassionate, Mil 210,4.

m. [ts.] a wrong time (too early or too
late), Ja I 236,8 (bhattassa); 436,20*; Ud 7,31 (Ud-a);
Mil 155,22 (with dat., rañño dassanāya); MN II 23,4
≠ AN V 185,5 (Bhagavantaṁ dassanāya, too early);
DN II 115,5 (Tathāgataṁ yācanāya, do.); MN I 393,18
(with inf., ajja Bhagavato vādaṁ āropetuṁ, loo late).
Cf. akālaṁ, akāle, akālena, akālika.

ind. (acc.), at a wrong time, DN III
184,27* (v. l. akāle); (Ja IV 342,1: akālam eva, read:
saccakiriyā-samakālam eva).

m(fn), going (begging) at a wrong
time, Sn 386 (°iṁ), cf. vikāle. a-kāla-cārin

n., a robe offered at extraordinary
time, Vin III (202,34) 203,33 (Sp, Kkh, Kkh-t), IV
(245,22) 246,6.

mfn., not knowing the right time,
AN IV 156,12 (+ amattaññū, Mp).

n. pl., flowers out of season,
DN II 137,20; Ja II 105,13.

n. pl., fruits out of season, Ja II
105,13.

m., an untimely death, Kv 545,3
(arahato).

m. [ts.], a cloud out of season,
Ja I 51,16 (~o vassi); Mil 114,11; mahā-°, Vin I 32,7.

mfn., who makes noise out of
season, Ja I 435,20 (acc. ~iṁ bhikkhuṁ). — °i-kuk-kuṭa, m., a cock crowing out of season, Ja I 436,16
(opp. kālarāvi-k°). a-kāla-rāvin

f., a lightning out of season,
Ja VI 568,5'.

m., an unexpected or unusual
moment; ~e (loc.) Ja I 480,28.

mfn., 1. out of season, exceptional;
Mil 114,7 (~aṁ kadācuppattikaṁ). — 2. immediate,
present, at hand; Ja III 394,19'; in the formula:
sanditthiko, ~o, ehipassiko, etc., DN II 93,32 (Vism
216,16); AN I 156,28 (Mp), 227,13 (Mp); — Sn 567 (Pj)
= MN ch. 92 (Ps), Sn 1137 (Nidd II, Nidd-a, Pj)
(sandiṭṭhikaṁ ~aṁ); SN II 58,4 = IV 328,21 (dham-
mena ditthena viditena ~ena pattena pariyogāḷhena)
(Spk).

n., freedom from impurity; °-paccu-
paṭṭhāna, mfn., manifested by fr°; Pj II 144,5 =
As 120,18 (saddhā).

ind. (loc.), at a wrong or improper time;
Ja II 208,17* (nâkāle); III 534,20*; IV 291,22* (kale
akāle = diva ca rattiñ ca, ib. 25'); V 233,21* ( =
ayutta-appatta-kāle, ib, 234,13'); Mil 107,8; 200,28.

ind. (instr.) = prec.; MN I 287,3
= III 48,15; Ja II 208,18*; III 534,17*.

mfn., not from the Kāsi country (i. e.
not of the best quality); AN I 145,12 (candanaṁ, =
asaṇhaṁ candanam, Mp).

(?) m. pl. ~ā, Ja VI 212,7*, according
to the Ct. = certain royal functionaries (°-saṁkhātā
rājapurisā) who had to gather the taxes. (Etymology
doubtful; one might suggest ākāsiya = sa. ākarṣika, con-
troller of coins? cf. the reading ākāsiya-saṁkhātā of
the Ms. Ck at Ja VI 215,22').

mfn., useless, ineffective; Mil 66,4
(vāyāmo); 151,24 (bhesajjāni).

m(fn). [sa. akṛtyakārin], acting
wrongly; engaged in improper business; DN I 135,11
(Sv); Ja IV 260,23*; VI 527,17* (= a-kicca-kārika,
ib. 27', prob. wr. r. for °-kāraka); — MN II 180,27. a-kicca-kārin

mfn. [cf. sa. a-kṛcchra] =
akasiralābhi(n) (q. v. & the passages quoted there).

[wr. r. for ākiñcañña-° (q. v.),
DN I 35,20; AN III 363,25.]

mfn. [ts.], having nothing; calling no-
thing his own, disinterested; Abh 739 (poor); Vin I 36,26*;
Mil 220,7 (~o jīvikatthāya pāṇaṁ hanati); DN III
185,3* (adhano+); As 206,7 (nâssa kiñcanan ti ~aṁ);
Ja VI 45,3 (sakiñcanass' eva bhayaṁ nâkiñcanassa);
— Th 36; Dhp 88 (hitvā kāme ~o), 221, 396 = 421
(+ anādāna, Dhp-a, Pj); Sn 455 (= rāgādikiñcanā-
nam abhāvena ~o Pj); Ja IV 372,8* (= rāgākiñcanâ-
dīhi rahitaṁ, ib. 373,13'); Ja III 100,25* (~aṁ nippa-
libodhaṁ, ib. 101,3'); III 241,16' (~aṁ apalibodhaṁ);
381,12 (do.). — Used in describing nibbāṇa: Sn 1094
(Nidd. II, Nidd-a, Pj), hence Nett 55,28*. Cf. akiñ-
cañña, sakiñcana. — °bhāva, m., abstr., Ps (MN I
318,33).

n. [sa. akiñcid], nothing; Dhp 390 (na
~ seyyo, not a nothing better i. e. much better, the very
best. Dhp-a; or is akiñci = akiñcana (akiñcañña),
and seyyo = summum bonum?).

m. [ts.], no gambler; Ja V 116,22*;
117,31' (anakkhe ~e ajūtakare).

f. [sa. akīrti], ill-fame; Vin IV 216,12
(avaṇṇa +; = nindā, Sp).

m. [generally identified with sa. Agastya
: Jātakamālā p. 33—40, cf. Akatti], Npr. of a brāh-
maṇa; Ja IV 237,6; 242,24 (°-paṇḍito); Pj I 127; Ja
I 45,13 (°-brāhmaṇakāle); Ja VI 99,29* (Aṅgīrasa +,
enumeration of ancient sages). — °-jātaka, n. =
Jāt (490), Ja IV 236—42; Ja V 241,20.
entry.re:
— °-titthaAkitti-tittha,
n., a bathingplace at Benares (named after A°),
Ja IV 237,26.

— °-dvāraAkitti-dvāra, n., a gate in Benares (do.),
Ja IV 237,25.

entry.sense:
f., creating ill-fame, DN III
182,29.

mfn. [sa. akriya], inactive, Mil 250,23
(pāpā ~ā osannaviriyā, etc.), 251,14 (pākaṭā asaṁvutā
ahirikā, ~ā akkhantī), 300,9 (vivaṭaṁ pākaṭaṁ, ~aṁ
arahassaṁ).

f., the theory of non-existence of
(bad or good) action, Ps ch 60 (III 115,12: ~ kammaṁ
paṭibāhati). Cf. natthika-diṭṭhi ib.

mfn., not to be done, improper,
Ja III 530,14* (~o pamadāhi santhavo, = akattabba-
rūpo, Ct. 531,8').

1. m(fn). adhering to the theory
of non-existence of action; AN IV 174,13 foll. (Mp) =
Vin III 2,28 (Sp) ≠ Vin I 233,28; MN I 406,13 (dussīlo
purisapuggalo micchādiṭṭhi ~o (Ps)); pl. ~ā, SN III
73,4 (ahetuvādā +, Spk) = AN II 31,22 (Mp) =
MN III 78,13 (Ps).—2.m. = akiriyadiṭṭhi, Vism 522,7;
Sp I 34,10; elliptically akiriyā, q. v. — °vādi(n), mfn.,
id., AN I 62,21.

f., purification through inac-
tivity, Nidd I 98,14 (saṁsāra-suddhi +).

f. 1. the not doing; + akaraṇaṁ
anajjhāpatti, Dhs § 299 (As) = Vibh 285,11; akusa-
lānaṁ dhammānaṁ, AN IV 174,15 = Vin III 2,28;
sabbakammānaṁ, AN II 235,25; ~āya dhammaṁ
deseti, AN IV 180,16 = Vin I 233,30; inactivity, per-
haps AN I 175,22 (but see 3.). — 2. an improper action,
Mil 171,27 (: kiriyā), 220,20. — 3. = akiriyadiṭṭhi
(or °vāda): °aṁ vyakāsi, DN I 53,4; °āya santha-
hanti, AN I 173,15 (Mp), 175,22 (Mp).

mfn., not tired (or sleepy), alert;
Vv 878 (Vv-a 307,18) (~o cetasā).
entry.re:
— °-kāyaa-kilanta-kāya, mfn.,
whose body is not tired, DN II 13,14 (Sv) (f. ~ā, scil.
Bodhisatta-mātā).

entry.sense:
mf(n). [cf. kilāsu & sa. glāsnu],
indefatigable, untiring; Abh. 516 (diligent); m. ~u,
Ja I 109,17*; pl. ~uno, ib. 14* (= nikkosajjā ārad-
dha-viriyā); Vin III 9,2 (Sp) (~uno ahesuṁ . . . dham-
maṁ desetuṁ); instr. ~unā, SN I 47,30*; with dat.
dhammadesanāya, SN V 162,27 (Spk); f. ~u hoti
(paṭhavi . . . naranārī-gaṇaṁ dhārentī), Mil 382,22.

mfn. [sa. akliṣṭa], untroubled, not
dirty; Pj II 483,22 (°vasana, mfn., with bright clothes,
= 'sucivasana', Sn 679).

mfn., without wisdom (?); SN II 49,2*;
(Spk 'akissavan'ti, 'kissavā' vuccati paññā, 'nip-
pañño'ti attho), quoted Nett 132,14. Origin and
meaning of this word are doubtful, Tr. refers to kissa, q.v.
see a-kukkuccaka.

mfn., not (only) given for a time (?),
Vin I 255,11 (cf. SBE XVII 157, n. 7).

mfn., free from misbehaviour, Sn 850
(Nidd; Pj = hattha-kukkuccâdivirahita). Cf. kuk-
kuca and kukkucca.

mfn., 1. not entertaining doubt,
not scrupulous, Mp I 92,6 = Ss 24,19 (aññamaññaṁ
na codenti na sārenti ~ā honti). — 2. [indubitable,
exciting no doubt(?), only in the cpd.] °-jāta, mfn., grown
without fault or defect, MN I 233,18 (Ed. a-kukkuka-°,
scil. kadalikkhandhaṁ; Ps II 376 a-kukkuṭa-°)
= SN III 141,28 = IV 167,32 (Ed. a-kukkuka-°; Spk
II 392 a-kukkujaka-°) = AN II 200,21 (a-kukkuc-
caka-°, scil. sālalaṭṭhiṁ; Mp II 480, do. = bhaveyya
nu kho na bhaveyya ti a-janetabba-kukkuccaṁ).
Cf. kukkuc(c)a and kukku.

mfn., 1. not crooked, straight; Ja VI
535,21* (nikkha), 31' (= ujuka); Bv V 4 (Bv-a); Mil
105,30 (nārāca). — 2. straightforward, honest; Ja III
12,17' (ujukesu ~esu, = 'añjasa'); Dhp-a I 288,19'
(uju +).

f., abstr. from prec. Dhs. § 51, 1339;
As 151,20.
mfn., = a-kaṇa, Ct. on Anāg 27.

mfn., free from superstitious regards,
Ja I 387,3* (= a-vikiṇṇavāco, discreel, ib. 9'); cf.
a-kotūhala-maṅgalika.

ind. [sa. a-kutas] = a-kuto-ci, ind.,
not from any quarter; only in the foll. comp.s

mfn., free from attacks or
distress, Ja V 378,1 (raṭṭhaṁ anuppīḷaṁ+, = an-
upaddavaṁ, ib. 26') — a-kuto-bhaya, mfn. [ts.],
having no fear from any quarter, Sn 561 (= kutoci
abhayo, Pj, Ps); Dhp 196 (nibbuta +, Dhp-a);
It 122,17* (nibbānaṁ); Ja IV 71,21* = IV 344,18*
(appossukko +).
mfn., see a-kittima (v. l.).
etc., see akkuddha.

mfn. [Buddh. sa. akopya] 'free from
anger', immovable, imperturbable, firm, cool (of mind):
~ā cetovimutti, MN I 197,32 (Ps = arahatta-phala-
vimutti), 298,24; DN III 273,13 (Sv — do.); SN II
172,11; 239,6; AN I 259,11; IV 305,4; Vin I 11,30;
It 53,12*; ~ā vimutti, MN I 167,28 (Ps — akuppâram-
maṇatāya ~ā, etc.); III 162,24; 245,16; ~aṁ ñāṇaṁ,
DN III 273,9 (Sv); ~o vimokkho, Paṭis II 40,28;
dhammikena kammena ~ena (not subvertible), Vin II
68,33; guṇā ekarasā arogā ~ā, Mil 157,20. — a-kuppa
n. subst., ~aṁ paṭivijjhati, AN III 119,27 (Mp =
arahattaṁ); 198,15 (patitthātabbaṁ sacce ca ~e ca)
= Vin II 251,4; = khanti, Ja VI 260,23' (~saṁ-
khātā); ~aṁ avipariṇāmadhammaṁ (= asaṁ-
kuppaṁ', i.e. Nibbāna) Pj II 607,13. — Ifc. paṭi-
viddhâ-°.

n., a firm position, ~aṁ
dhuvatthānaṁ (= 'accutaṁ thānaṁ') Dhp-a III
321,4."
f., abstr. from a-kuppa., Th 434.

mfn., firm in morals, AN
III 128,2 (Ed. kuppadhammo; = khīṇāsava, Mp)
= Vin V 129,1 (Sp); — Pp 11,20.

neg. part, (see karoti), gen. sg.
a-kubbato, not doing, not acting, Sn 844, 913; Dhp 51
= Th 323 (~ato: kubbato or sa-kubbato); Dhp 124.
— a-kubbamāna, do. part, med, Sn 777-8 (Nidd), 897.

n., not a house, non-family, ~aṁ kāhati
khippaṁ attaiio, DN III 185,6*. cf. 3a, 2. — a-kulatā,
f. abstr., Ja V 117,6* (kulā ~aṁ gatā).

m., a person of not good family,
Ja II 223,22' (dujjātiko ~o = 'dukkulīno').

mfn. [ts.], not of good family, Ja I
338,20 ;V 367,19'.

mfn. [sa. akuçala], 1. unskilled, not
clever, Abh 734 (sotuṁ ~o); bālo ... ~o, Sn. 879
(= 887), Pj (= avidvā); bālo avyatto~o, SN V 149,27
(cf. DN I 85,16). — 2. bad, evil, sinful; unhealthful,
unlucky; Vin II 91,1 (kusalaṁ ~aṁ avyākataṁ), As
39,36 foll. (do.); ~aṁ kāyakammaṁ, MN II 26,10;
Nett 126,10; ~assa kammassa balavatā, Mil 101,10;
~ā dhammā, Dhs §30, etc.; DN III 56,20 (Sv);
73,20; AN IV 363,10, MN III 48,17 (abhivaddhanti,
parihāyanti); ~ānaṁ dhammānaṁ pahānaṁ, MN I
93,23; III 215,3; pāpakā ~ā dhammā, MN I 221,6
(Ps), Mil 226,15; ~ā cetanā, As 100,32; pāpakā ~ā
vitakkā, MN I 144,4; cuddasa cetasikā ~ā (moho,
etc.), Abhidh-s 6,10; — ~aṁ bhayabheravaṁ, MN
I 17,14 (= sāvajjaṁ akkhemaṁ, Ps). — n., sin,
evil deed, demerit, ~aṁ pajahati, kusalaṁ bhāveti,
Mil 37,2; Tathāgato sabbaṁ ~aṁ jhāpetvā sabbañ-
ñutaṁ patto, ib. 134,20; catubbidhaṁ ~aṁ, Pj I
143,5 (cf. DN III 182,1-2*, Sv); ten ~āni: MN I 47,3
foll. (Ps), etc.; Nāmar-s 16,2-4. — Ifc. kusalâ°,
yathâ°. Cf. akosalla.
mfn., inexperienced, Vin II 159,34.

n., evil action, bad works,
Ja VI 387,3'; Dhp-a III 349,11 (cf. v. l.).
entry.re: — °-pa-thakathāa-kusala-kamma-pa-thakathā, f., title of 5th ch. of As (p. 102,32).

entry.sense:
mfn., one who does evil, Mil
200,16 (gen. ~issa). a-kusala-kārin

n., evil thought, dvādasa ~āni,
Ps II 116,6; Abhidh-s 1,21 — do. title of Dhs
§ 402—430, cf. Nāmar-s 4; — ~aṁ, title of Vibh
p. 164—69. — mfn., nourishing evil thoughts, Ps I
115,26.
entry.re: — °-cetanāa-kusala-citta-cetanā, f. id., Dhp-a III 28,16.
— °-cetasikāa-kusala-citta-cetasikā, m. pl., title of Nāmar-s 16.

entry.sense:
m., bad character, pl. bad
qualities, Dhp-a II 110,3 (~ā). — [°-sutta, n., title
of a Sutta, SN V 18.]

f., element, of sin, sinful prin-
ciple (Child.), viz. kāma-°, vyāpāda-°, vihiṁsā-°, Vibh
363,20; cf. AN III 447,12. (Cf. a-kusala-vitakka &
°-saṁkappa).

or a-kusalūpaparikkhā,
f., investigation or circumspection of sin, Nett 126,10.

m., abandonment of sin,
Nett 50,27.

f., the question of 'wrong',
Nidd I 340,30 (= sāvajja-dhamma-pucchā, Ct.).

n., the root or principle of sin,
tīni ~āni (scil. lobha, dosa, moha), AN I 201,18 (Mp);
DNH I 214,19 (Sv); sg. ~aṁ, MN I 47,10 (Ps); It
45,10; cf. Sn 14 (= 369): mūlā akusalā (Pj); Dhs
§982; As 346,1; Nett 126,13. — mfn. ~ā dhammā,
SN II 263,5 (v. l., Ed. akusalā dhammā).

m., accumulation of sin, AN III
65,1 = SN V 145,26 (i.e. pañca nīvaraṇā, q. v.).

m., sinful thought, tayo ~ā
(viz. kāma-°, vyāpāda-°, vihiṁsā-°), It 72,21; 82,9;
DN III 215,3; Nett 126,2. (Cf. a-kusala-dhātu &
a-kusala-saṁkappa).

m., the consequence of sin, pl.
~ā avyākatā, title of Dhs §§ 556—65. — °-kathā, f.,
title of As § 589 (p. 292—93). — °-cetasikā, m. pl.,
title of Nāmar-s 17. — °-mūlaka, n., do of Vibh p. 190-92.
entry.re:
— °-saṁkhāra-mūlakaa-kusala-vipāka-saṁkhāra-mūlaka, n., do. of Vibh
p. 180—81.

— °-âhetuka-cittaa-kusala-vipākâhetuka-citta, n., satta ~ āni,
Nāmar-s 5,22.

entry.sense:
f., indifference (or
apathy) to retribution of sins, Ja V 271,21'.

n., = vera, 2 (q. v.) (: puggala-
vera) Mp III 98,13; 240,21 (ad AN III 254,21; IV
151,12).

m., = akusala-vitakka
(q. v.), MN II 27,27.

mfn., which is called
akusala; dhammā ~ā, AN IV 363,10.

m., 'compendium of evil
categories', Abhidh-s 32,4 (Trsl.).

mfn., connected with
consciously contracted akusala, AN V 292,7 foll. (~ā
dukkhavipākā).

f., sinful idea, Nett 126,3
(tisso ~ā, viz. kāma-°, vyāpāda-°, vihiṁsā-°, cf.
°-dhātu, etc.).

m. n., sinful (character or) practice,
pl. ime ~ā, MN II 25,20 (Ps akusalā sīlā).

m., cause of sin, Dhs §§ 1053—58
(tayo ~ū: lobho doso moho); Tikap 27,13.

f., rising of sin, Ps I 67,10
(°-padaṭṭhānā).
see a-kusala-parikkhā.

mfn. [sa. akusīda], not lazy or indolent,
undefatigable, Dhp-a IV 111,12 (+ atandita).
entry.re:
— °-vuttia-kusīta-vutti, mfn., do., Sn 68 (āraddhaviriyo . . . alīna-
citto +, Pj, Nidd).

entry.sense:
mfn. [ts.], not deceitful, honest, trust-
worthy, Sn 957 (Buddhaṁ asitaṁ tādiṁ ~aṁ); MN I
386,18*; Mil 352,14. — a-kuhaka, mfn. [ts.] do.,
Sn 852 (Pj = avimhāpako tīhi kuhana-vatthūhi);
SN II 40,6* = Th 1218 (~o nipako apihālu).

mfn., not creaking (of a carriage),
SN I 33,10* (ratho); Ja VI 252,20* (vācā-saññam '-
akūjano).

mfn. [ts.], not without horns, not polled,
Vin IV 5,26.

mfn. [ts.], not deceitful or cheating, not
false (as coins); Ps II 464,15 (cf. accheka).

a-keṭubhi(n), mfn. [cf. keṭubha], free from hypo-
crisy, MN I 32,17 = AN III 199,10 (a-saṭhā a-māyā-
vino +).

mfn., not deceitful, honest, Ja V
117,31' (= 'a-kitava').

mfn., not whole, not absolute, MN I
326,27 (: kevala; anicca, addhuva, asassata +).

mfn., not perfect, defective, Sn 878
(m. ~ī, Pj = hīna), 891 (m. pl. ~īno, B. ~ī te). a-kevalin

mfn., which has not attained its end,
or taken effect, Mil 305-2 6 (visaṁ).

mfn., free from super-
stitious views AN III 206,17 (cf. apagata-kotūhala-
maṅgalika, do., Mil 94,3l). Cf. a-kutūhala.
etc., v. a-kkodha, etc.
mfn., without anger, Sn 499.

mfn. [ts.], ignorant, without the right
knowledge (of the dhamma, gen. or loc.), SN II 62,34*
(dhammassa, Spk); Sn 793 (do.); Ja III 57,26* (do.),
58,14'; I 490,27 (dhamma-vinayamhi); II 180,4*
(gāma-dhammassa); I 192,15* (ariya-dhamme); Dhs
§ 1003 (ariya-dhammassa).

m. [sa. arka], 1. the sun, Abh. 63 (cf. 1102).
2. the plant Calotropis gigantea, 'swallow wort', Abh 581
(cf. 1102: rukkhantara = the ward tree); MN I 429,22
(Ps).
entry.re:
— °-daṇḍakaakka-daṇḍaka, m., a stick of a° wood, Mp III
356,16 (Cke).— °-dussa, n., cloth made of that plant, Sp
ad Vin I 306,8 (~-kadalidussa-erakadussāni).

— °nālaakka-nāla (or °-nāḷa) n., a stalk of that plant, or cloth
made thereof, Vin I 306,8 (~aṁ nivāsetvā).

entry.sense:
mfn. (pp. of akkamati), 1. trodden upon
(touched ), Mil 152,27 (pāso); AN I 8,2 (hatthena vā
pādena vā ~); Ja I 79,9; Dhp-a I 60,7 (°-sākhā),
200,14 (°-ṭṭhāne), cf. below akkamaṇa; ~aṁ padaṁ
(footprint), Ap 119,15. — 2. do. with active sense,
Vin IV 201,17 (Sp II 501,8).
m. Npr. of a thera, Ap 211-212.

3.sg. [sa ā + √krand], to cry or weep
aloud; ~ parodati, SN IV 206,25*.

n. [sa. arka-parṇa], the leaf of an
Akka-plant, Ja I 422,14.

n. [sa. ākramaṇa], stepping or
treading upon; ~a-akkamaṇa-pada-vāre, every time
he was taking a step, Ja I 62,31; ~ṭṭhāne, Ja I 339,23
(cf. akkanta).

3. sg. [sa. ā + √kram], 1. to step or
tread upon (acc.), Mil 220,21; Ja V 433,30 (pādena
pādaṁ); part. ~mantā, Ja III 374,7'; pot. ~me, Ja IV
206,9*; imp. akkama, Ja VI 126,10*; aor. l.sg. ~iṁ,
Dhp-a III 136,22; 2.pl. ~ittha, ib. 19; fut. ~issati,
MN II 93,2 (Ps) ≠ Dhp-a III 136,21; abs. (a) ak-
kamma, Cp III 7,3*; Ja III 141,3*; (b) ~itvā, Ja I
7,22'; 279,28; Vin II 289,6; MN I 324,14 (hatthena
vā pādena vā, = phusitvā, Ps); ger. ~itabba, Ps III
299,15. — 2. to make a kick at one, Vin III 38,33
(~itvā) (Sp.). — 3. to assault, assail, sāmanta-rājā-
naṁ ~itvā janapadaṁ gaṇhissāma, Pj II 353,13.
— Cf. akkanta, pp.

m. n., bast or bark of the Akka-plant,
Ps III 135,18 (ad MN I 429: ~e gahetvā jiyaṁ
karonti); Vibh-a 232,20 = Vism 249,29.

m., a particular kind of fence or
door, Vin II 154,15.

pp. (see akkosati), reviled, scolded,
abused, Sn 366 (Pj); MN II 3,33 (dhammakkosena);
Mil 222,3 (+ paribhāsito); Ja VI 187,20 (+ pari-
bhaṭṭha); Ja V 113,11* (read akkuddho?).— °-van-dita, n., abuse and respect, Sn 702 (Pj = akkosañ ca
vandanañ ca); Thī 388. — "akkuṭṭhasanta", Ja
II 348,24* = AN IV 93,16* (v. l. akkuddha-°, no
Ct., prob. means akkuṭṭhă (metrically for °ā) santā
(i. e. samānā) = being.

(or a-kuddha), mfn., not angry, Ja II
353,16*; V 113,11* (?Ed. akkuṭṭho, no v. l.) ; VI
14,12*. —°-mānasa, mfn., do., Dhp-a IV 164,3'.
— °-rūpa, mfn., do., Ja VI 533,11*. a-kkuddha

(m?), only in the exclamation ~o bakkulo
(v. l. pakkulo), prob. a shout to one in order to terrify,
Ud 5,5 (Ct. says: bhiṁsāpetukāmatāya evarūpaṁ
saddaṁ akāsi, anukaraṇa-saddo hi ayaṁ, referring
also to the etymology ākula-vyākula, and to a v. r.
akkhulo bhakkhulo (q. v.), cf. JPTS 1886 p. 98-99).
entry.re:
— °-bakkulikāakkula-bakkulikā, f.or m.n. (?), designation of that shout
Ud 5,5 (~aṁ akāsi).

entry.sense: aor., v. akkosati.

(or a-kodha) [sa. akrodha], m.,
freedom from anger, mildness, Dhp 223; Mil 116,27:
Ja III 274,2* (nom. ~aṁ, attraction by dānaṁ, etc.)
≠ SN I 240,13* (~o, = mettā, Spk); DN III 159,28*. a-kkodha

(or a-kodhana) [sa. akrodhana],
mfn., free from anger, Dhp 400 = Sn 624 ; Sn 19
(quoted Mil 187,8, = a-kujjhana-sabhāva, Pj), 850,
941; Ja II 195,25*; 348,26* = AN IV 93,21* (f.
~ā); Ja III 262,19*; 263,20'; V 222,15*; VI 295,22*;
473,5*-10' (f. ~ā, or ~ī); DN III 47,24 (+ anupa-
nāhī); 159,7 (+ anupāvāsa-bahulo); MN I 42,36; II
241,8; AN V 98,14; SN II 207,11; Vv 332 (f. ~ā ana-
timānī, cf. Vv-a 144, n. 21); Pp 22,17; Dhp-a III 313,
13' (v. l.). — n. subst., freedom from anger, Ja
II 192,14* (~aṁ adhiṭṭhito; cf. DN III 159,28*).

mfn., who does
not hurt being free from anger [the wise compared to
a chariot], Ja VI 252,25*; 253,23'.
n.], title of a sutta, SN IV 243.
n.], do., SN I 240.

m., freedom from the trouble
of anger, MN I 363,10 (Ed. akodh°). °-upāyāsi(n),
mfn., ib. 363,20 (gen. ~issa).

m. [sa. ākroça], abuse, scolding, reviling;
Abh 899 (= 'paribhāsana'), 1093 (= 'sāpa'); in
Dhātup giving the sense of the verbal-roots: √kur1,
√kus3, √khuṁs, √cit1, √sap; Dhp 399 = Sn 623 (Pj)
(~aṁ titikkhati); MN II 62,2 (~aṁ alattha); AN III
67,9 = 180,25 (aññamaññaṁ ~ā honti); + paribhāsā,
Mil 8,28; Ja VI 187,25'; catūhi ~ehi akkositvā, Dhp-a
II 61,16 (cf. II 53,14); dasa ~ā, Nidd-a I 236,17.
— Ifc. v. dhamma°.

mfn. [sa. ākroçaka], abusing, in
comp.s °-paribhāsaka, mf(n)., who abuses and despises
AN II 58,4 (gen. samaṇa-brāhmaṇānaṁ); III 252,1
(Mp); IV 156,12; V 169,12; f. akkosika-paribhāsikā,
AN II 58,8; n. pl. ~āni (kulāni), Vibh 247,6 (Vibh-a
340,29).
entry.re:
— °-Bhāradvājaakkosaka-Bhāradvāja, m. N.pr., SN II 61,32
(brāhmaṇo, Spk).

— °-vaggaakkosaka-vagga, m., title of a vagga,
AN III 252.

entry.sense:
3.sg. [sa. ā + √kruç], to abuse, scold,
revile; Mil 171,21; with .acc. (or gen.?) Ja I 225,27
(te, gen. used for an acc? v. below); V 108,2; +
paribhāsati, SN I 96,6* (Spk); DN III 81,3 (vo, gen.
for acc., Sv); AN IV 345,3 (bhikkhūnaṁ, v. l. bhikkhū
& bhikkhuṁ); Vin I 330,23 (gihī); II 296,23 (upā-
sake); do. + roseti, MN I 140,16; do. do. + viheseti,
MN I 189,12; — part. ~anta, Dhp-a IV 148,7; Mil
154,6; f. ~antī, Ja V 103,20 (rājānaṁ maraṇena,
imprecations); — imp. 2.pl. ~atha, MN I 334,7 (Ps);
— pot. ~eyya paribhāseyya (maṁ, + anatthaṁ pi
me kareyya), Pp 37,2; ~eyyaṁ, SN IV 118,22;~eyyuṁ,
MN I 140,25; — fut. ~issanti, SN IV 61,10 (Spk);
— aor. (a ) akkosi, Mil 221,29 (pharusāhi vācāhi; + pa-
ribhāsi); Dhp-a II 53,15 (catūhi ākārehi theraṁ); (b)
akkocchi, which by Kacc 500 is referred to √kudh, but
by Mogg to √kus3 (VI 34): Dhp 3 (Dhp-a I 43,20 = ak-
kosi); — grd. akkositabba (v. l. akkosetabba) AN
IV 277,14; — pass, akkosiyati, pp. akkuṭṭha (q. v.).

entry.re:
— °-āakkosana-ā, f.,
id. + -vambhanā, garahanā, ukkhepanā, etc., Vibh
353,6 (= 'nippesikatā'), for Ct. see Vism 29,5.

entry.sense:
m., abuse and blows, Ja III
230,5 (~e, acc. pl.).

n., title of Dhp-a
IV 161-64 (cf. Akkosaka-Bhāradvāja).
m., title of a vagga, AN V 77.

n., abusive speech, Mhv XXXVII
154.

n., = akkosa with numerals
[cf. (akusalakamma-)patha, (kāma-)guṇa]; dasahi
~ūhi, Ja I 191,5 (akkosanti); Ps II 303,17 (do.);
Dhp-a I 212,3, IV 2,2 (do.); Vibh-a 340,33 (do.); Spk
III 23,18 (akkosissanti); Dhp-a IV 164,1 (akkosanaṁ);
Pj I 149,2 (akkosante); Pj II 364,13 (abhisatto, =
'akkuṭṭho'); — dasavidhena ~unā akkosanti, Sv
III 58,7.

n., title of a sutta, SN II 61,
foll.; uddāna ib. 171,34. Akkosa-sutta

√Sadd II 61 (3. sg.
'akkhati').

m. [sa. akṣa], an axle, Abh 375, 893
(rathaṅge); ~o, Mil 27,3 ; 116,9 ; 238,18; 277,23
(bhijjati); ~aṁ abbhañjeyya, SN IV 177,2; ~e (telab-
bhañjite), Vism 362,26; ~ena ~aṁ paṭivaṭṭesi (with
axle to axle), DN II 96,11 ≠ Vin I 231,36; in dvandva
comp., Ja I 109,5 (°-yugâdīni).— Ifc. v. avihiṁsā-
sārita°, jhāna°.

m. [sa. akṣaḷ, 1. a die, Abh 532 (pāsako),
893 (pāsake); ~o naṭṭho, Ja I 379,26; ~aṁ mukhe
pakkhipitvā, ib. 25; ~ena kīḷanti, Vin II 10,20 =
III 180,25 (Sp); pl. ~ā, Ja III 541,23* (jitā, q. v.);
akkh' itthiyo, DN III 184,26*; instr. ~ehi, Ja VI
318,20-21* (otherwise explained by Ct., see akkhāti);
~ehi dibbiṁsu, DN II 348,19; loc. ~esu dhanaparā-
jayo, Sn 659 (= jūtakīḷana-akkhesu, Pj) = SN I
149,24* = AN II 3,28*'= V 171,19*, foll.; ~assa
phalakaṁ, Ja V 155,23* (156,18' = suvaṇṇa-pha-
lakaṁ) seems to denote a diceboard (split-compound for
*akkha-phalaka), but cf. Abh 893. — 2. a game (at
dice, and the like), DN I 6,25 (Sv — guḷakīḷā).
— 3. name of a tree, Beleric Myrobalan (Terminalia
Belerica), the seeds of which were used as dice, Abh
569 (= vibhīṭaka). — 4. a weight, two of which are
equal to five māsakā, and eight equal to one dharaṇa,
Abh 479; 893 (suvaṇṇasmiṁ). — Ifc. v. an-°.

n. [sa. aksa], an organ of sense, Abh 149
(= indriyaṁ), 893 (do.).

m. = akkhi, the eye, only ifc. °[a[kkha
[sa. °akṣa], see: (an-)añjita°, aḷāra°, āvila°,
utumattâ°, (kāḷa-)lohita-°, gava°, catur°, tam -
ba°, tiro°, nīla°, (a-)pacc°, pārevata°, paro°,
bhadda° (or bhadra°), (vanatimira-)matta°,
manda°, ratta°, rumm-akkha-rūpa, lohita°,
Virūpa°, visāla°, sadisa°, samāna°, Sahassa°,
sundara° (cf. Mogg III 49). [Cf. also apparajakkha].
= 4akkha, ifc. see mora°.

m. [sa. aksaka], the collar bone, Abb
278 (galantaṭṭhi); °-(a)ṭṭhi, n. id., Vism 254,2 (~īni,
dve); Pj I 49,8, 50,15. — Ifc. see adh'-°, ubbh'-°
(or uddh'-°), dakkhiṇa°.

n., 4a famine, during
which the unripe nuts of 2akkha (3) were boiled and
eaten, Mhv XXXII 29 (Mhv-ṭ; cf. pāsāṇa-chātaka).

n., title of a section of Jāt n°545
(cf. 2akkha), Ja VI 286,8'.

m., a linch-pin, Abh 374
(= 'āṇī'). Cf. 2akkha.

mfn., with broken axle, SN I
57,22-24* (Spk) = Mil 66,30*—67,2*.

n., lit. 'eye-bone' = akkhikūpatthi,
Vibh-a 237,5 "(Ed. akkhiṭṭhīni) = Vism 254,4~ (~īni,
dve); 255,16; Pj I 50;29.

m. [sa. a-kṣaṇa], wrong moment, in-
opportune time, misfortune, Ja IV 18,1* (= anokāsa,
ib. 7'); aṭṭha ~ā, AN IV 225,20 foll.; 227,21* (~ā
puggalass' antarāyikā); DN III 287,12; nava ~ā,
DN III 263,31 (+ asamaya); Saddh 6 (do.).
entry.re: — °-dīpana-gāthāa-kkhaṇa-dīpana-gāthā, f. pl. = Saddh I 4-52.

— °-sam-mataa-kkhaṇa-sam-mata, mfn., thus called, Saddh 16 (anokāsabhāvena).
— Ifc. v. Akkha-rukkha-paṭṭhakkhaṇa-vinimmutta.

entry.sense:
mfn., who hits the bull's eye,
hitting infallibly, Ja II 91,5*,11' ≠ AN I 284,15 (Mp);
II 170,30 (quoted Ps I 102,10); 202,7 (in both places
by Ct. explained by avirādhita-vedhi(n), or by refer-
ence to akkhana — vijju, cf. vijju-vedhi(n) — 'hitting
by (the light of the) lightning', Mhv XXIII 86); Ja I
58,27 (~i-vālavedhi-dhanuggahe); Ja III 322,22 (~iṁ
dhanuggahaṁ); IV 215,6 (°-dhanuggahe); VI 129,27
(~inaṁ dhanuggahānaṁ); Ja V 129,19 (+ vāla-
vedhi(n), saddavedhi(n), saravedhi(n)); Ja IV 494,21*.
— [The etymology is rather uncertain; the Ct.s'
reference to akkhaṇa (lightning) is doubtful, as this
word is not traced in the texts in that sense; PED
suggests derivation from sa. akṣan (eye), which also
might denote the bull's eye (on a target): sa. *akṣaṇi-
vedhin(?). In Vyu, Divy, Mvu, etc. it is written
akṣk[ū/u]ṇa-vedhin, — At any rate the meaning given
above must be right; perhaps there could be added,
with a slight variation: 'who always hits the mark',
if it is advisable to take a-kṣaṇa = perpetual (?)
(DA.)]. — °-itā, f. abstr., Nett 56,12. akkhaṇa-vedhin
see a-khaṇḍa.

mfn. [sa. a-kṣata], uninjured, unhurt,
safe and sound, AN I 294,8 (~aṁ anupahataṁ attā-
naṁ pariharati); III 373,24* (Mp = guṇa-khaṇanena
akkhato, anupahato); Vv 1006 (paccāgam uṁ Pāṭa-
liputtaṁ ~aṁ; Vv-a = anupaddutaṁ, or = anābā-
dhaṁ anuppīlaṁ, anantarāyenā ti attho) ; Mhv
XIX 56 (pakk'aṁ).

n. [sa. a-kṣata], fried (unhusked)
barley-grain, Abh 463 (= lājā), 1133 (do.).

m. [sa. akṣadarçaka & akṣadṛç],
a judge, Abh 341 (nyāsâdīnaṁ vivādānaṁ); Vin III 47,2
(maṇḍalikā antarabhogikā ~ā . . . rājāno, Sp);
Ap 44,20; one of the six classes of amaccā, Mil 114,28
(senāpati, purohito, ~o, etc.); Mil 343,27 (Bhagavato
dhammanagare ~ā).

n., title of Pv IV 13
(Pv-a 277-78, subscripts Akkha-rukkha-p°).

m. [sa. aksa-devin] = next
(q. v.) Abh 531. akkha-devin

m. [sa. akṣa-dhūrta], a gambler,
dice-player, Abh 531; Sn 106 (itthidhutta, surā-
dhutta, +), Ja III 58,9' (do.); MN II 106,24 (~ā
akkhehi dibbanti); III 170,7; 178,3; DN II 348,20
(~o kaliṁ gilati); III 183,20; Ja I 379,23 (= Bodhi-
satto); VI 274,10* (a partner in gambling). — Ifc.
v. kūṭa°.

(also a-khanti), f. [sa. a-kṣānti],
impatience, discontent [also used to explain the sense
of carahi, ind. q. v.], AN I 236,30 (= anadhivāsanā,
Mp) ; III 254,20 (pañca ādīnavā ~iyā); Vin IV
241,35 (~iyā ti kopena; Sp = asahanatāya kopena);
— do. mfn., impatient, intolerant, Mil 251,14 (m. pl.
~ī). — °-ja, mfn., born from intractability, Ja IV
11,13*,22' (anadhivāsika-jātikassa ~ito jāto kodho). a-kkhanti

mfn., fond of dice; Sp-ṭ ad Sp I
1,21* (pamudito ~o ca).

mfn., defeated in gambling,
Ja III 198,22* (jūte ~o).

m., the axle-rope of a chariot,
Ps III 292,12.
entry.re:
— °-bandhana-yottaakkha-bandha-bandhana-yotta, n., do., Ja I
192,2.

entry.sense:
n., lubricating of an axle (cf.
1akkha), Vism 32,17; Dhp-a I 375,12' — Pj II 58,6
≠ 342,5 (cf. Ja II 294,6* = Mil 367,8*).

mfn., with broken axle, Ja V
433,8 (yānaṁ). Cf. akkha-cchinna.

n., breaking of an axle, Pv-a
277,14.

mfn. [sa. a-kṣama], 1. unable to
endure (w. gen.), Vin I 78,21 (gen.); AN III 112,30,
etc. (gen.) (Mp); intractable: ~o appadakkhiṇaggāhī
anusāsaniṁ, Vin III 178,20 (Sp = ovādaṁ na sahati
na kkhamat[ī/i]ti ~o) ≠ MN I 95,14 ≠ SN II 204,4 ≠
Ja III 483,15. — 2. without endurance (cf. khamā, f.),
DN III 229,1 (~āpaṭipadā; Sv) ≠ AN II 152,11 (Mp);
153,13 ≠ Nett 77,18 (Nett-a). — Do. m., the not ap-
proving, Ps III 192,6-17.

m. [sa. akṣa-mada], intoxication
from dice, Ja VI 282,15* (~ena mattā, Ck has °mādena)

n. (from sa. √kṣam), not tole-
rating, Ps I 106,31 (°-lakkhaṇa, mfn., parasampatti-°,
= which has the characteristic of envy of others' suc-
cess, Ct. on 'issā').

mfn. (cf. a-vikkhambhiya, vik-
khambhati, chambhati), not to be shaken, immovable,
DN III 147,17* (Sv ad III 146,23: avikkhambhiyo,
na naṁ koci ṭhānato cāletuṁ sakkoti).

mfn. [sa. a-kṣaya], imperishable, un-
decaying, unfailing, Ps II 546,18 (nicca, dhuva, sas-
sata, acchejja +).
entry.re:
— °-paṭibhānaa-kkhaya-paṭibhāna, mfn., and
°-vicitra-paṭibhāna, mfn., possessed of (various and)
never-failing power of answering questions, Mil 3,10 &
21,18. — akkhayatā, f. abstr., Dhp-a I 136,25
(apariyantatā + ).

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. a + kṣayita], not yet
destroyed (ɔ: putrescent, decayed), mataṁ ~aṁ, Vin
III 29,36 (Sp); ~aṁ sarīraṁ, Vin III 36,38 (the w. r.
akkhāyita, in Sp (Ee) results from confusion with
vikkhāyitaka); ~e sarīre, Vin V 33,12.

n., game at dice, Ja VI 281,4'
(Ed. akka°).

m. & n. [sa. akṣara; cf. Nett-a 208,32],
1. a. sound, syllable, letter of the alphabet, (pl. also:
inscription), Abh 348 (~o), 1063 (~aṁ); the "letters"
(or sounds, vaṇṇā), beginning with a, are 41 in all,
viz. 8 sarā and 33 vyañjanā, ending with la & aṁ,
Kacc 2 (~ā a-kārâdayo eka-cattālīsaṁ), whilst at
Mogg I 1 we find the number 43, because distinction
is made between ē & ō and ō & ŏ (the latter before
conjunct consonant); the single letters are named a-kāra,
ya-kāra, etc., Kacc 606; — sg. = syllable, Ja III
46,26 (ekekaṁ~aṁ); in writing (lipi), Mil 79,28;
— m. pl. ~ā tāsaṁ [scil. gāthānaṁ] vyañjanaṁ, SN I
38,21*; aparimāṇā ~ā, Nett 8,29 (Nett-a); 8000 a°
= 1 bhāṇavāra, q. v. — n. pl. manāpāni vata ~āni
samasīsāni samapantīni caturaṁsāni, Ps III 682,15;
~āni chinditvā (with letters engraved) Ja II 90,15; VI
390,18; I 8,17; ~āni vācetvā, ib. 8,23; ~āni disvā,
Ja VI 407,19; ~āni likhitāni, Ja IV 7,20; 489,18;
tāsaṁ gāthānaṁ ādi-° ~āni, Pv-a 280,17 (cf. 10);
gen. pl. ~ānaṁ sannipātaṁ, Dhp 352 (Dhp-a IV
70,21, cf. akkhara-piṇḍa). — opp. to pada (a word),
~āni sampiṇḍetvā padaṁ vattuṁ sakkoti, Ps II 70,18;
Nett 38,17, 26; Kacc-v. Introd. v. 2; opp. to pada
(a quarter of a stanza), Pj I 117,20; Ps II 70,18; Spk
ad SN I 38,21*. — 2. n., DN III 86,25 (Sv) . . . 89,6
(≠ Mvu I 340,17) : porāṇaṁ aggaññaṁ ~aṁ anu-
patanti (or anupadanti), etc. = 'they follow (repeat)
that old saying (not recognizing the signification there-
of)'; DN III 93,11-14 (quoted As 390,32); 94,1-14-24;
95,6-15; here the meaning 'imperishable' seems to go
on along with that of (syllables) 'word' (cf. akṣara
in the Upanishads). —- 3. n. = nibbāna ('imperish-
able'), Abh 7 & 1063 (~aṁ). — Ifc. see anta°,
anvakkharaṁ, apara°, avyatta(pada)°, ādi-°,
catur-°, catuvīsat'-°, citta°, pamita°, pubba°
bavh-°, sâkkhara-, sañña°, soḷasa°. — Cf. ak-
khara, f.

m., title of a grammatical work,
JPTS '82 p. 36. Cf. Ekakkhara-kosa.

n., proficiency in "letters",
Kacc-v 1.

m., a grammarian, pl. ~ā,
Pj I 17,34; II 16,24; 432,16; Pv-a 120,31;Vism 310,20.

f., the game of 'recognizing
letters' (written in the air, or on one's back), Sv I 86,17
(= 'akkharikā').

m., the literal meaning of a word,
Ja II 108,1' (opp. adhippāya).

f., a small slip or plate with
inscription, Pj I 158,25 = Ps II 26,9 (with the v. l.
°paṭṭakaṁ).

mfn., metrically ar-
ranged, Pj I 117,20; II 142,20.

f., completeness (distinctness)
as to sounds (syllables), Ps II 341,2.

m., a designation of a
grammatical discipline. Mil 178,16; Sv I 247,15 = Pj
II 447,17 (= sikkhā ca nirutti ca), cf. Tr. PM 65
and Mmd 1. Ifc. see sâkkhara-ppabheda.

m., 'aggregate of letters', i. e.
how sounds do meet with each other, Dhp-a IV 70,23
(= 'akkharānaṁ sannipāto').

n. (in modern Pāli) title of
the introductory chapter in the Bangkok-Ed. of Ct.s,
giving rules for the orthography adopted in these Edd.s.
f., failure in "letters", Kacc-v l.

f., name of a gramm. work
by Paññāsāmi, Sās 154,22.

mfn., known or understood
by means of "letters", Kacc 1 (attho ~o; so Mmd,
but here °saññāto also might be abl. of saññā, and
thus we would have akkhara-saññā, f. = the sign
we call phonemes).

m., an aggregate of "letters"
(°rūpattā, scil. padānaṁ), Rūp 1.

m., reading system, the (con-
ventional) meaning of letters, ~aṁ na jānāti, Dhp-a
I 180,9 foll.

m., combination of sounds,
Nidd I 71,16 (Nidd-a); 139,27 (padasandhi +; quoted
Pj II 28,3).

f., name of a
gramm. work, M. Bode, Pāli Litt. of Burma p. 106.

f. [cf. akkhara, m. n.; ved. akṣarā has
another meaning], a syllable, Vin IV 15,12 (~āya vāceti,
akkhara-akkharāya āpatti pācittiyassa).

f., name of a certain game, DN I 7,1
(atthapada + , Sv = akkhara-jānana-kīḷā (q. v.));
Vin II 10,23 = III 180,28 (Sp) = Nidd I 379,13
(Nidd-a).

n., see Akkha-
dāyika-p°.

n., a particular
form of rhyme, exemplified Jināl 105—8.
(mf)n., see akhalita.
aor., v. akkhāti.

f., the linch-pin of a wheel; °-pāda,
m., one end of that, Ja I 192,24 (= akura(ka) æṇamula,
Ja-pota; Ed. akkhāni pādaṁ). Cf. 1akkha.

m. [sa. ākhyātṛ], one who preaches
or tells; nom. ~ā, one who fells (slanders); DN I 4,17
= MN III 49,3 = AN V 265,3 ≠ AN V 267,14 =
283,18 = Pp 57,32; a teacher: SN II 91,2 = III 66,17
(anakkhātassa maggassa); acc. ~āraṁ, Sn 167 ( +
pavattāraṁ); pl. ~āro: Dhp 276 (Tathāgatā); an
empirical subject (personality): SN I 11,24* = pug-
gala, (Spk) = It 54,4* (cf. akkheyya). akkhātar

mfn., completely told, Ja V 18,17*
(= sabhāvato akkhātaṁ).

3. sg. [sa. ā + √khyā; the suppletive
verb is ācikkhati, q. v.], to make known, announce,
teach, preach, Sn 87; Ja IV 197,22*, etc.; 2 sg. ~āsi,
Ja IV 42,7*; VI 507,30*; 1 sg. ~ām i, Sn 172; SN I
123,17*; 1 pl. ~āma, Ja VI 518,3*; part. ~āyanta,
Ja III 106,6'; imp. 2 sg. ~āhi, Sn 421, 489, etc.; SN
I 32,10*; Ja III 148,6*; V 42,2*; VI 325,17*, etc.;
[akkhehi Ja VI 318,20* is by Ct. taken = ācikkha,
see 2akkha]; 2 pl. ~ātha, Ja V 390,18*; VI 577,2*;
pot. 3 sg. ~eyya, Ja IV 226,9* (= ācikkheyya); fut.
1 sg. ~issaṁ, Sn 997; Ja IV 257,26*; VI 523,21*;
aor.1 3 sg. akkhā, Ja IV 271,17* = 394,29*; 2 sg.
akkhā, Ja VI 359,20* (= akkhāsi, vadesi); 1 sg.
akkhiṁ, Ja V 77,22* (= kathesiṁ) = 80,1*; 3 pl.
~aṁsu, Ja III 481,8* (= ācikkhiṁsu); aor.2 3 sg.
~āsi, Sn 251, 504, 1131; Ja IV 258,27*; VI 98,17* =
106,6*; inf. ~ātuṁ, Mil 269,28; abs. ~āya, Sn 829
(= dīpetvā, Pj, cf. Nidd I 169,19); pass, akkhāyati,
pp. akkhāta, grd. akkheyya (q. v.).

n. [sa. ākhyāna], announcing, preach-
ing; description, MN III 167,20 (na sukaram ~ena
pāpuṇituṁ, to describe it in full, Ps) ≠ Vv-a l 14,13;
esp. the telling of tales or legends (included in the series
of public amusements), DN I 6,12 (naccaṁ, gītaṁ + ;
= Bhārata-Rāmāyanâdi, Sv), III 183,13; also name of
the old epic literature, associated with the 3 (or 4) Vedas:
akkhāna-pañcama, mfn. Ja V 450,14* (vedaṁ ~aṁ,
= itihāsa-pañcamaṁ veda-catukkaṁ, Ct.; cf. DN I
88,6). — Ifc. see: an-°, abhūta°, utu-'kkhāna,
guyha°, dosa°, dhamma°, piya°.

3 sg. (pass, of akkhāti), to be declared,
MN I 24,28; II 231,31; AN I 286,28; Ja V 416,18
(evaṁ ~, evaṁ anusūyati); often in the phrase ag-
gam ~, is declared chief (among, gen.): It 87,19
(Tathāgato tesam aggam ~); DN I 125,15; III 83,18;
SN III 156,6; AN II 17,19 (cf. aggam pavuccati, ib.
23*); Pp 69,19; Mil 118,23; 182,20; Dhp-a I 228,17.
Cf. ved. ā-tamām-khyāyate.

mfn. [sa. ākhyāyin], announcing,
Ja III 105,20* (gen. pubb' ev' °~ino, a foreteller, cf.
pubbakkhāyi(n), ib. 106,6'). - Ifc., see: attha°, etam-°,
evam-°, kim-°, chandarāgavinaya°, pubba°,
magga°. akkhāyin

mfn. (cf. prec.), telling, describing,
f. ~ikā, Ja III 535,12' (piyakkhānaṁ ~).
f., a tale. Ifc. see: loka°, samudda°.

mfn., not consumed (w. r. for a-
kkhayita, q. v.).

mfn. (i. e. 1 akkha + āhata), firm
(fixed) upon an axle (said of a wheel), AN I 112,5
(cakkaṁ . . . ~aṁ maññe aṭṭhāsi; Mp: akkhe pa-
vesetvā thapitam iva); MN III 173,26 (cakka-
ratanaṁ) ≠ DN II 174,8; III 63,20 (cf. Pj I 172,18;
176,10).

n. [sa. akṣi], the eye, Abh 143 (nayana,
~, netta, locana, acchi, cakkhu); nom. ~iṁ, Ja VI
294,10* = ~i, ib. 294,21'; abl. ~imhā, Sn 197; [~ismā,
Mogg III 53]; pl. nom. acc. ~ī, Dhp-a I 9,18 (paggha-
rante), ib. 9,20 (vātā vijjhanti); 10,4; 11,1; ~īni,
Pv 274 (paggharanti); Ja I 279,24 (nimīlanti); Dhp-a I
425,12 (dhūmāyanti); Dhp-a III 196,13 (ummīletvā);
Vv-a 65,11 (bhamanti); Ja VI 187,3 (upacciṁsu?);
Ja V 286,11 (~īni pūretvā olokeyyāsi, you may gaze
your fill); Ps II 127,13 (dayhanti); instr. ~īhi, Sn
608; ~īhi, MN I 383,27; Ja I 223,17; gen. ~īnaṁ, Ja
VI 336,39 (animisatā). Cf. 4akkha, acchi (sacchi-) &
akkhika. — Ifc. see: eka°, biḷāla°, sa°.

n., ointing the eyes, Dhp-a III
354,2.

m., the socket of the eye, pl. ~ā,
Ps II 66,17 (cf. akkhikūpa).

mfn., °-eyed, ifc. see: an-°, añjana°,
aṇḍa°, tamba°, Maṇi-°, maṇḍala°. Cf. addhak-
khikena.

m. or n., a mesh (of a net), ifc. v.
jāla°.

[sa. ākṣika], 1. mfn., won at dice,
Mogg IV 29 (= akkhehi jitaṁ). — 2. m., a gambler,
dicer, Mogg IV 29 (= akkhehi jayati dibbati); Kacc-v
353 (do.). Cf. next.

(m.or f. ?), possibly the fruits of Ter-
minalia (see akkha (3)), hence: 4akkhikā

mfn., MN I 383,26 (puriso ~o
gantvā ubbhatehi akkhīhi āgaccheyya, i. e. one who
goes for akkhika, and comes back with his eyes torn
out; cf. aṇḍa-hāraka).

m., the socket, or the cavity of the
eye, Ja IV 407,8,11, (akkhi ~ato nikkhamitvā); MN I
81,17 = 245,36 (~esu akkhitārakā), cf. akkhi-āvāṭaka.
entry.re:
— °-kūpakkhi-kūpa-kūp'-aṭṭhi, n., one of the bones under the eye,
Vism 255,16 = Vibh-a 238,20 (akkhaṭṭhi); Abhidh-av
641.; Pj I 50,29 (akkhi-nāsa-°, the bones of the eye
and the nose).
— °-kūpakakkhi-kūpaka-kūpak'-aṭṭhika, n., = akkhi-kūpaṭṭhi, As 306,24.

entry.sense:
f., the corner of the eye, Ct. on Nidd
I 355,5 (= 'akkhi-kūṭa'); ~iyā oloketvā ('with a side
glance') Ja III 410,19, Dhp-a II 141,16; ~ito añjana-
salākāya nīharitvā, Ja III 419,22'; ~iṁ [v. l. ~iyaṁ]
pahari, Dhp-a II 240,23. (Cf. Thī-a 259,7: akkhimaṇ-
ḍale ubhosu koṭīsu).

mfn., being on the eye, Abh 259 (lo-
maṁ ~aṁ = pamha, pakhuma).

m., the eye seen as a globe (including
eye-lids and eye-lashes), Ps III 354,17 (~o); Ja VI
504,29' (visāl'-akkhigaṇḍā, adj. f. = 'aḷāra-pakhumā',
q. v.); cf. cakkhu-gaṇḍa. — °gaṇḍa-ka, id. ifc.
Saddh 103 (parininna-°! [w. r. for paribhinna°, and
a pun on gaṇḍa= a boil?]).

m. n., secretion from the eye,
Pv-a 198,16 (= 'akkhi-mala').
entry.re:
— °-gūthakaakkhi-gūtha-gūthaka, m., id.,
Sn 197 (Pj); Vism 195,9; Thī-a 259,6 (= 'pīḷikoḷikā').

entry.sense:
n., eye-split, palpebral fissure,
Pj II 248,21.

mfn., only ifc. see ruhira° (Ja IV 331,11*
B: °makkhita accounts for meaning, but not for metre).

f. [sa. akṣi-tārā], the pupil of the
eye, MN I 81,17 = 245,36; Ps II 66,17; As 190,32
(~āya, loc.).

mfn. [sa. a + kṣipta], not discarded,
not criticized, Sn p. 115,12 (+ an-upakkuṭṭha, with
instr. jātivādena, 'in point of birth') = DN I 113,26;
115,6, etc. = AN III 223,17; 228,27; Pj II 463,4 ( =
jātiṁ ārabbha 'kiṁ so' ti kenaci an-avaññāto); Sv I
281,20 (= an-avakkhitta).

mfn. [sa. ākṣipta, pp. of ā + √kṣip],
drawn away, pl. ~ā, Ja III 255,22* (vātavegena scil.
sakuṇā; = ākaḍḍhitā, Ct.). Ifc. see vāta°.

n., lit. 'twinkling of an eye',
moment, instant, Pay I 4 (= rassakālo nāma accharā-
saṁghāto) ≠ Mmd 4. akkhi-nimmīlana

n. pl. [sa. akṣi-paṭala], membranes
of the eye, As 307,16 = Vism 445,29.

m., a look, glance (of the eye), ifc.
manda°, mfn. Pv-a 57,30.

f., name of a festival, Mhv V 94
(~aṁ mahām ahaṁ; Mhv-ṭ); Sp. I 44,5 (Sp-ṭ).

mfn., filling the eyes, Ja VI 191,26
(~aṁ assuṁ niggahetvā).

n., the eye seen as a roundel
(cf. akkhigaṇḍa), Thī-a 259,7. Ifc. see visama°.

n., dirt from the eye. Pv 446 ( =
akkhi-gūtha, Pv-a 198,15).

m., eye-disease, Dhp-a I 9,12. Cf.
cakkhuroga.

n. [sa. akṣi-loman], eye-lash,
Nidd I 355,1 (pl. ~āni); As 306,25; Abhidh-av 642. akkhi-loman

mfn., not little of appearance:
~o dassanāya, DN I 115,23, etc. (Sv) = MN II
165,31 (Ps).
v. r. for akkula, v. next.

inf. [from ā + √khi, sa. ā -4- √kṣi],
to destroy, make an end of, Ud-a 86,18: ~ khepetuṁ
vināsetuṁ ulati pavattat[ī/i]ti akkhulo.

mfn., unsafe, Ps I 113,32 (sāvajjaṁ
~aṁ, = 'akusalaṁ').
entry.re:
— °-tāa-kkhema-tā, f., unsafe position, As
211,7 (Ed. akh°).
— °-bhāvaa-kkhema-bhāva, m., id., ib. 210,33 (do.).

entry.sense:
mfn. [grd. of akkhāti, sa. ākhyeya],
to be told, what may be expressed (by words); nām aṁ
evâvasissati ~aṁ petassa jantuno, Sn 808 (Nidd,
Pj); hence: an empirical object (what is arbitrarily
expressed by a certain term), SN I 11,22* foll. (Spk)
= It 54,1* (It-a).
entry.re:
— °-saññi(n)akkheyya-saññi(n), mfn., having only
the notion of the empirical, ~ino sattā (+ akkheyyas-
miṁ patiṭṭhitā), SN II 1,22*.

— °-sampannaakkheyya-sampanna, mfn.,
possessed of (full understanding of) empirical objects
[i. e. as being without reality], It 54,7* (It-a). — Cf.
SN trsl. I p. 17 n. 1.

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. a-kṣobhya], imperturbable,
Mil 21,21 (sāgaro viya).

f. [from *a-kkhobhaṇa, sa. *a-kṣo-
bhaṇa (cf. khobheti, grd.) and associated with akkho-
hiṇī (q. v.)], imperturbable, Ja V 322,21* (senā . . .
~ṇī apariyantā sāgarassêva ūmiyo, = khobhetuṁ
na sakkā, Ct.).

mfn., do. = 'a-ghaṭṭita', Nidd-a
ad Nidd I 353,11.

mfn. = akkhobbha, Ap 19,8
[˘ -˘˘ ].

f. [sa akṣauhiṇī], 1. a complete army,
Abh 384; °-(mahāsenā-)ghāta, m., slaughter of a
complete (great) army, Mhv XXV 103—108 (Mhv-ṭ,
giving the exact force of an a°); catuvīsati- °~i-pari-
vara, m., an escort of 24 a°, Ja V 320,2; °~i-saṁkha,
mfn., numbering an a°, Ja V 319,25' (catuvīsati-°,
soil, balakāya); Ja VI 395,15 (aṭṭhārasa-°, scil. senā).
— The relation to akkhobhaṇī (q. v.) is open to ques-
tion. Cf. catur-aṅginī. — 2. name of a certain high
numeral, a koti6 — 106 millions, Abh 475; Kacc-v
397 (Ee: akkhobhinī); Sadd III 833.
see Akhyātapada.
= a-kiriya, q. v.

(sometimes written akkhaṇḍa) mfn.
[ts.], 'not fragmentary', i. e. whole, entire; uninjured,
faultless; bījāni ~āni (+ apūtīni avātātapahatāni
sāradāni sukhasayitāni) DN II 354,1 ; AN I 135,3
(Mp); SN III 54,10; V 380,5; sīlāni ~āni (+ acchid-
dāni asabalāni akammāsāni, etc.) MN I 322,20 (Ps);
II 251,8; DN II 80,24; III 245,25; AN III 36,10;
132,13 (Ct. Vism 221,23); ariyakantehi sīlehi ~ehi
(+ do.) AN III 213,4; SN IV 272,16 foll.; brahmaca-
riyaṁ (~aṁ + do.) AN IV 54,8; ~āni pañca sīlāni,
Ja III 257,4; Dhp-a I 278,4; nirantara-m-akhandâc-
chidda- . . . °-sīla, mfn., Mil 382,17; cf. Ps II 534,2. a-khaṇḍa

mfn., doing in full, doing
nothing partially, AN II 187,30; 243,19 (+ acchidda-
kāri(n), asabala-kāri(n), etc.); Mil 94,13 (sakkacca-
kāri(n) +).
entry.re: — °-tāa-khaṇḍa-kāri(n)-tā, f. abstr., Nett 45,7.

entry.sense:
mfn., not offending against
the five precepts, Ja I 49,27 (~ā, Buddhamātā).

mfn., unbroken and unim-
pared, Dhp-a I 32,11* (sikkhāya padāni pañca ~āni
samādiyassu) — Pv 483. Cf. Vin II 286,3-8.

mfn., Sv III 187,20 (= 'ac-
chidda-vutti', q. v.).
see akkh°.

mfn., not hard, soft, smooth, Ja III 282,16'
(read kharena akharena ca [for arena] pāsāṇena).

(mf)n. [a + khalita], free from false
steps, Thī 512 (v. l. akkhalitaṁ against metre; =
khalita-saṁkhātānaṁ duccaritānaṁ abhāvena ~aṁ,
Ct.). — n. = right reading (opp. khalitaṁ 'blunder',
modern Pāli).

mfn. [ts., cf. khaṇati], not dug; n. ~aṁ,
a natural pond, Abh 680 (deva-khātakaṁ).

neg. part, (see khādati), not eating,
f. pl. ~iyo, Ja V 19,21' (gāvo).

mfn., not before eaten, AN IV
418,10; Ja I 102,3 ≠ III 200,13.

mfn., not sharp, not pungent, SN III
87,20; V 149,30.

mfn. [ts.;˘ ˘ ˘ , but cf. a-khīlaka,
vigata-khīla], 1. free from 'khila' (said to mean hard
barren soil between fields) i. e. (a) with no barren spots
(Ct.s: not infested by outlaws): ~aṁ animittaṁ akaṇ-
ṭakaṁ, etc. (paṭhaviṁ) DN III 146,20 (Sv) =
177,12; — (b) metaph. = free from the hardness or
harshness of mind, produced by the passions (rāga, dosa,
moha), or by the five 'hindrances' (pañca nīvaraṇāni
= pañca cetokhilā): Sn 212 (Pj = pañca-cetokhila-
abhāwna ~o), 477 (anejo ~o akaṁkho; Pj), 1059 (~o
akaṁkho), 1147; SN I 188,1* (Spk); AN II 23,17*
(Mp = rāga-khilâdi-wahito); DN II 261,10* (Sv =
rāga-dosa-moha-kh[ī/i]lānaṁ abhāvā~aṁ); SN IV 118,11* (~am scil. cittam, = mudu atthaddham, Sv);
Bv V 4 (Bv-a). — 2. 'free from gaps, not defective',
i. e. whole, complete, pl. all, Abh 702 (sabbam samat-
taih ~am); Mlw V 10 (aṭṭhārasâkhilā, eighteen al-
together), XXIII 13 (Damiḷe 'khile). °-jāta, mfn.,
one in whom no 'khila' (i. e. pañca cetokhilā) arises,
AN V 20,20 (v. l. na khilajāto).

mfn. [sa. a + kṣīṇa, cf. khīyati], not
ruined, not poor, Ja III 492,16* (Ct. bhoga-parik-
khayena khīṇaiḥ pi ~aṁ pi).
entry.re:
— °-vacanaa-khīṇa-vacana, mfn. &
°-vyappatha, mfn., Pj II 204,6-21 (v.r. ad Sn I 58-59),
see ākhīṇa : ākiṇṇa. —- °-âsava, mfn., one whose
āsavā (q. v.) are not destroyed, MN III 137,12 (adanta-
maraṇaṁ gacchati).

entry.sense:
mfn., sometimes v. l. for a-khila (q. v.)
on account of confusion of khila and khīla (kīla).

mfn., free from prickles (cf. khīla),
~āni rukkhaphalāni (v. l. B. akhila-°), Ja V 203,3*
(Ct. ib. 206,5' = akāca, akantaka, synon. from DN III 146,20).

mfn. [sa. a-ksetra], having no fields,
Ja IV 303,6'; — n., Ja IV 372,26' (no field, scil. for
alms).

mfn. [sa. a-kṣetra-jña], not
acquainted with the localities, Ja VI 507,12* (gen. f.
~āya, = abhūmikusalāya). Cf. AN IV 418,8.

mfn. [sa. a-kṣetra-jña], not
knowing the field (scope, scil. for alms), Ja IV 371,14*
(dānassa), 372,25'; not knowing the soil (for good deeds),
AN III 384,16 (Mp) (bāla, a-vyatta, ~,akusala) ≠
IV 418,22; ib. 418,8 (f. ~ū = akhettañña). a-khetta-ññū

mfn., without fields and rela-
tives, Ja IV 303,2* (~ū amamo nirāso).

m., the being no soil (scil. for
good deeds), Sās 72,29.
see akkhema-°.

m. [ts.], 'not going', a tree, a mountain,
Abh 539; 1117.

mfn. [ts., cf. gaṇeti], not reckoned
(counted), not included, Mil 114,8; 147,26.

n., not grasping, As 126,38 (sīta-
lassa); 127,1 (uṇhassa).

mfn. [ts.], not gone to, not attained, ~ā
disā = Nibbāna, Dhp 323 (Dhp-a); Nidd I 471,14
(agata-disā vuccati amata-nibbānaṁ, cf. Sn 960).
entry.re: — °-pubbatāa-gata-pubbatā, f. abstr. Ja I 401,21'.

entry.sense:
f. [ts.], 1. not coming, not admittance,
MN I 158,29 (Mārassa) ≠ SN I 133,21* (Spk); Ja V
255,16* (~ yattha pakkhinaṁ); — sometimes also
designation of Nibbāna, Dhp-a III 158,4 (sugatiṁ
c'e-va ~iṁ ca gacchanto); Ja V 489,10' (dhammo hi
sugatiṁ vā ~iṁ vā pāpeti, adhammo duggatiṁ), in
both places with v. l. (B) nibbānaṁ. — 2. (more fre-
quently) = wrong course, doing the wrong and neg-
lecting the good (= agati-gamana), catasso ~iyo
vajjetyā, Ja I 260,2; the four a° are conditioned by
chanda, dosa, moha, bhaya: Vism 683,28 ; Vin I
339,38 (chandā dosā mohā bhayā agatim gantum);
Sp 7,14 = Pj I 92,13 (do.); Ja I 339,26 (chandâdi-
-vasena ~iṁ gacchantā). — Ifc. see chandâ°, (chan-
dâdi-°), dosâ°, bhayâ°, mohâ°.

m., the depravity leading to the four-
fold agati, Ja III 442,22' (chandâdīhi ~ehi amucchito).

mfn., v. l. for gati-gata (q. v.),
Ja II 1,3 (wrongly explained by Child, p. 613).
[SN IV 59,12, read āgati-gati.]

n., following a wrong course, an
evil practice of life (cf. a-gati (2)); ~e ṭhito, Ja V 98,25;
~e patiṭṭhāya, Ja III 317,9; ~aṁ pahāya, Ja III
273,26; V 108,5; Dhp-a III 182,11; ~aṁ parihara,
Ja V 510,30; = 'chandagamana', Ja V 273,11'; cattāri
~āni, AN II 18,15 ; DN III 228,14; Nett 31,32, etc.;
Ja I 399,25, III 229,7; V 244,14' ~ena (= 'adhammena').

(alternating with a-gadhita) mfn.[ sa.
+ grathita], not tied (bound, ensnared): + amucchita,
anajjhopanna, ādīnavadassāvi(n), nissaraṇapañña,
DN III 224,27 (Sv -dh-, = vigatalobhagiddha);
MN I 369,28 (cf. gathita, ib. 162,8); SN II 194,7
(-dh-); 270,6; (do. pl.); AN II 27,23; Mil 401,2
(-dh-). Cf. gathita (gadhita). a-gathita

m. (sometimes n.) [ts.], medicine, anti-
dote; Abh 330 (bhesajjaṁ ~o); Ap 46,22; ~o, Sv I
67,18; = Ps I 51,19; Mil 278,6 (rogānaṁ antakaro),
319,1; ~aṁ (n.) Mil 121,1; 152,25; 172,15 (virasaṁ);
~aṁ (acc.), Mil 302,13; 305,22; Pv-a 198,18 (ārogya-
vahaṁ, = 'osadhaṁ'); Dhp-a I 215,8 (~ena dho-
vitvā). — °-gandha, m., smell of medicine, Ps III
625,20.— °-[a]ṅgāra, m.n., medical powder (for
a sore), MN II 216,16 (~aṁ vaṇamukhe odaheyya)
(Ps — jhāma-harīṭakassa vā āmalakassa vā cuṇṇaṁ)
entry.re: — °-samaa-gada-sama, mfn., like medicine, Mil 195,25; 354,3.

— °-harīṭakaa-gada-harīṭaka (or °-harītaka) m. n. & °-âmalaka,
m. n., the healthful fruits of two different species of
Terminalia (Myrobalan), Sp I 42,13 (Sp-ṭ); Mhv V
26; cf. Ja I 80,12 & Pj I 146,22. — Ifc. v. dhammâ°.

entry.sense: mfn., see a-gathita.

m., a person who shall not go (to, acc.),
nom. ~ā nirayaṁ, SN V 377,15 (Spk, v. l. agantvā),
a negative form of fut. II of gaechati. a-gantar

mfn., 'which does not tend to
become tied', Dhs 1142; 1483 (dhammā gantha-
vippayuttā ~ā).

f. abstr. [from do.], the being odour-
less, Ja III 253,24'.

mfn. [from a + gabbha-
seyyā], not conceived in a womb, ~ā sattā, Mil 128,26
(sabbe devā).

f. (adj.), not pregnant, Vin IV 317,33.
— °-saññā, f., impression of not-pregnancy, ib. a-gabbhinī

n., not going, Ja V 15,9' (padasā
addhānaṁ ~ena).

mfn., inaccessible, where it is not
allowed to go (e. g. for sexual intercourse): °-ṭṭhāna,
n., Ja I 500,4; Spk II 183,17 ≠ Vv-a 72,30; Ss 71,10
(cf. Vin III 139,21 (Sp)).

(f.), the not-going (or coming), ~te
jamma desaṁ, Kacc 647, see a-karāṇi.

mfn., not deep, Ja VI 110,7' (°-tīra,
mfn., = 'a-nikhāta-kūla', scil. nadī).

mfn. [sa. a + gṛhya], impossible to
grasp, Mil 387,20 (ākāso). — [a-gayh'] °-ûpaga (also
spelt °ūpaka), mfn., not fit for grasping, inaccessible,
Ja III 118,5' [-k-j; V 367,28' (°[a]ṭṭhena, on account
of their being ~, [-k-]); Ja l V 174,14' (°-ṭṭhānaṁ,
that part which is unfit).

mfn., not blamed, not blamable,
Pj I 140,12 (anindita +, = 'anavajja').

mfn., not blamable, SN I 240,2*
(Spk = agārayha).

n. [sa. agaru & aguru], Aloe wood,
Agallochum, Abh 302; Mil 382,3 (kappūra +); Ja VI
510,14* (+ candana); Pj II 248,17 (do.); Ja VI 530,3*
(+ bhalli). Ifc. see kāḷâ-°. Cf. akaḷu, agaḷu.

mfn. [cf. sa. a-guru], 'not heavy' [Abh
929, = lahu], i. e. 1. not important, Ps II 375,6 (taṁ
kāraṇaṁ). — 2. not honoured, unrespected, humble,
mean, AN IV 155,21 (appiya, amanāpa +). — 3. not
difficult, not disagreeable or inconvenient, DN I 89,26
(kathāsallāpo, = abhārika, Sv); sace te ~, Vin I
24,20; Sn p. 50,25; MN II 199,7; Mp II 284,19;
Dhp-a I 39,15. Cf. agārava, aguru.

[3 sg.], not to consider difficult
or troublesome; abs. °-karitvā, MN I 111,26 = AN V
257,15 (≠ 227,13); pp. °-kata, mfn., Sp ad Vin IV
6,17, = 'acitti-kata'.

mfn. not having dwelt in
a teachers house, Mil 288,18 = an-ācariya-kule vasaṁ
Ja I 436,19*. Cf. garu, m.

(or a-galita), mfn., 'not dropping', i. e.
fluent, distinct, agreeable (of speech), Ja V 203,27*
(~aṁ prob. interpolation from Ct. ib. 206,22' ('akak-
kasaṁ' = tassa bhāsitaṁ apharusaṁ ~aṁ); Ss 13,24
(-l-); Mp II 400,16 (niddosā vācā ~ā = 'aneḷagalā'),
cf. avisāri(n). — °-pada-vyañjana, mfn., distinctly
pronounced, Mp II 424,16 (vācā, -l-). a-gaḷita
(or āgalī), v. l. for aṭalī (q. v.).

or agalu, n. (another form of agaru, akaḷu,
q. v.), Agallochum, Aloe wood, Abh 302; Vv 621
(°-piyaṅg[ū/u]-candana); Vv-a 158,16. — Ifc. v. kāḷâ- galu. agaḷu

mfn., (= a-ggahita, q. v.), not seized,
not taken, Ps I 133,27 (saraṇaṁ).
entry.re:
— °-daṇḍaa-gahita-daṇḍa, mfn.,
'not with lifted stick', not severe or rigourous; Ja II
233,8' (= 'nâdinna-daṇḍa').

entry.sense:
mfn. [ts.], bottomless, very deep, Abh
669; Mil 105,10 (mahāsamuddaṁ gambhīraṁ vit-
thataṁ, ~aṁ apāraṁ); Pv-a 77,14 (= 'gambhīra').

m., not a village, cf. 3a, 2 ; MN II
97,27; AN I 159,33 (gāmā pi ~ā honti). — mfn. = next, Ja V 99,28* (read 'gāmā; cf. Ct.).

(ifc. also āgāra), n. [ts.], a house, house-
hold life, Abh 205 ; ~aṁ (ekādasa-dvāraṁ) MN I
353,4; acc. ~aṁ (ducchannaṁ, succhannaṁ) Dhp
13-14 = Th 133-34; ~aṁ āvasati, Sn 805; ~aṁ
ajjhāvasati, DN I 88,32 (Sv) ≠ Sn 1002; MN II
55,28; AN V 288,2; Mil 88,15; abl. ~ā anagāraṁ
eti, Sn 376 ; ~asmā anagāriyam pabbajati, DN
I 18,26 (Sv); MN I 161,30; 451,26; II 55,31; Mil
88,16; Th 46; Sn 274; ~ā paccupetassa, Ja III 214,3*
(cf. III 390,1*); loc. ~e, Ja V 174,3*; VI 288,11*
(vāsayemu); 301,25* = 311,28* (avasiṁ); pl. ~āni,
AN IV 390,23 foll.; dve ~ā sadvārā, MN I 279,12.
— II 21,25 = III 178,21. — °-majjhe, amid the cares
of a household life, Ja I 56,13; Dhp-a I 7,4. — Cf.
agāraka, agāri(n), agārika (~iya), etc. below. — Ifc..
°agāra or [ā]gāra, see: agyā°, ajjhā°, an-° (anā°),
āgantukâ°, āvasathâ°, itthâ°, uposathâ°, Kapila-
vatthâ°, kūṭâ°, koṭṭhâ°, kosa-koṭṭhâ°, cittâ°,
jhānâ°, tiṇâ°, dānâ°, dhaññâ°, naḷâ°, nivāsâ°,
pariyā°, pānâ°, bandhanâ°, bhaṇḍâ°, bhusâ°,
mahâ°, yaññâ°, rājâ°, vāsâ°, vāhanâ°, santhâ°,
Salaḷâ°, sâ-°, suññâ°. — Cf. also 2agga, ifc. agāra

n. (cf. agāra), a small house, a hut,
MN I 450,35; Ja II 269,22*; VI 81,26*. Ifc. (also
āgāraka): paṁsv-ā°, rājâ°.

m., — agāriya-muni, Nidd I 58,8
(so Nidd-a Ce Se; Nidd Ee āgāra-°),

mfn., not blamable, Spk I 417,6
(= 'agarahiya'); Ja VI 201,3' (= 'aggaravha', ib.
200,28*); Ja VI 36,4' (anaṇo hoti ~o).

mfn., without reverence, not respectful
(opp. sa-gārava); ~o appatisso, AN III 7,20; with
loc. MN I 469,12; AN IV 122,13 (Satthari), DN III
244,12, etc.; AN III 439,3; with gen. Ss 101,1 (tiṇ-
ṇaṁ ratanānaṁ); pl. ~ā appatissā asabnāgavuttino,
Ja I 218,20 (aññamaññaṁ) from Vin II 161,21 (cf.
I 84,5); Pv-a 54,30 (samana-brāhmanesu); cha ~ā,
DN III 244,12; Vin V 92,1; Vibh 381,1 (Vibh-a =
gārava-virahita); f. sg. ~ā, Ja V 435,12*; f. pl. SN II
224,33.— a-gāravatā, f. abstr., Dhs 1325; Pp 20,14.
m., house-life, Th 1107.

m., a house-snake, Ja I 372,17
(garavil-[kuṇa], Ja-pota).

m(fn)., [ts.], possessing a house, a house-
holder, lay-man, in poetry for gihi(n), q. v.; pl. ~ino,
Sn 376; Ja III 234,3* ( = gahaṭṭhā) quoted ib. 1401,
15*; Ja V 99,28* (opp. anāgārā); Th 1009 (~isu). °-inī,
f., a housewife, Vv 598 (= gehassām inī, Vv-a) =
Pv 441 (Pv-a = do.). Cf. next. agārin

(also āgārika, cf. agāriva), m., a house-
holder, Abh 446; Vin I 272,6 (~ā, m. or f. pl.); Ja
III 453,18 (cf. agāriya-muni)); Ps I 167,35. — āgā-
riko kāmabhogī, Pj II 540,2; pl. ~ikā kāmabhogino,
ib. 539,19. — Ifc. see: an-° (an-ā°), ekâ°, dvâ°,
pānâ°, bandhanâ°, bhandâ° (& Dhammabhan-
ḍâ°), sattâ°.

mfn., leading a household life,
SN V 89,16; Vin I 17,8; 194,33; Ud 57,22. Cf. agā-
riya°.

n., 'a jewel among householders',
a fair or excellent j°, Pj I 178,5 (°~aṁ anagārika-
ratanañ ca = purisa-ratanaṁ).

f., the ornament of laymen,
Pj II 112,11 (sāṭaka-veṭhana-mālā-gandhâdi, cf. Nidd
I 380,5 (āgāriyassa vibhūsā)).

m(fn). = agārika; ifc. an-agāriya or
an-āgāriya (q. v.) — °-paṭipatti, f., the practice of
laymen, Ps I 167,35. — °-bhūta, mfn. = agārika-
bhūta, MN I 504,18; 506,20; etc.; Dhp-a I 113,2;
— °-muni, m., a wise layman, Ja I 109,27' (~[ī/i]ti gihī
āgataphalo viññāta-sāsano) cf. agāra-muni & an°.
— °-vimāna-(vatthu) = Vv VI 1 (Vv-a 286—87);
dutiya-°, = Vv VI 2 (Vv-a 287—88).

mfn. [sa. a + gṛddha (gṛdhra)], not
greedy, free from desire, Sn 210 (muni vītagedho ~o),
845 (muni santivādo ~o, Nidd I 53,28; 203,14) ; It
92,5* (~o vītagedhassa passa yāvañ ca santike); Ja
VI 101,18 (isayo jivhā-viññeyya-rase ~ā).
f., see next.

m. [a-giddha + suff. man; cf.
Pāṇ V, 1,122 foll.] freedom from desire; so the 'pāli'
in Ja II 293,15*, according to Ja II 294,8', who prefers
the 'aṭṭhakathā'-reading, viz. a-giddhitā, f., abstr.
from *a-giddhin, see giddhi(n). a-giddhiman

m., [a + giddhi-lobha, q. v.],
abstinence from greed and desire, MN I 360,25; 362,19.
entry.re:
