— °-lobhi(a-giddhi-lobha-lobhi(n), mfn., free from greed and desire, MN
I 362,30 (gen. ~issa).

entry.sense:
mfn., not sick, Vin IV 200,9—206,22 (na
sayanagatassa ~assa dhammaṁ desessāmi, etc.).

[3 sg., v. l. for āgilāyati (ākilāyati),
q. v.

mfn. [sa. agṛha], houseless; Sn 456 (saṁ-
ghāṭivāsī ~o carāmi), 464 = 497 (ye kāme hitvā ~ā
caranti), 487 (kāsāyavāsiṁ ~aṁ carantaṁ); Pj II
403,1 (= ageha, adding nittaṇho ti adhippāyo); cf. It-a
461,18, etc.

mfn. [ts.], without bow-string, Ja V
433,8** (='jiyā-rahita, ib. 435,30').

entry.re: — °-pariye-sakaa-guṇa-pariye-saka, mfn., = do., Ja III 110,11.

— °-vādi(n)a-guṇa-vādi(n), mfn.,
telling one of his faults, Ja II 2,20.

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. a-gupta], not guarded, un-
protected, uncontrolled; Vin II 148,21 (vihārā); AN I
7,1 (adanta+, cittaṁ); SN IV 70,1 (adanta +, =
agopita, Spk).
entry.re:
— °-dvāraa-gutta-dvāra, mfn., whose doors (i. e.
senses) are not guarded, without self-control, SN II
218,18 (indriyesu); MN I 32,10 (do.) = AN III 199,3;
SN IV 117,20* (= asaṁvuta-dvāra, Spk).

— °-dvā-ratāa-gutta-dvā-ratā, f. abstr.; indriyesu ~: DN III 213,7; It 23,3;
AN I 94,28; Pp 20,24 = Dhs 1345 (As 399,32).

entry.sense:
f., non-protection, non-control, Pp 21,2
(indriyānaṁ ~ agopanā anārakkho asaṁvaro =
aguttadvāratā) = Dhs 1345.

mfn., not greedy; hence a-gedhatā,
f. abstr., Mil 276,9 (+ nirālayatā, cāgo, etc.).
entry.re:
— °-lakkhaṇaa-gedha-lakkhaṇa, mfn., characterized by absence of greed,
As 127,18.

entry.sense:
mfn., houseless, Pj II 433,1 (= 'a-giha'
q. v.).

m. [ts.], improper pasture (behaviour,
not to be indulged in), MN I 11,2 (= ayutto gocaro,
Ps) = AN III 389,23; SN V 146,22 (~e paravisaye);
Vin II 210,33; Nidd I 473,8 = Vibh 247,1 quoted
Vism 17,18; sixfold: As 151,32 (chasu ~esu carati),
Dhp-a III 275,8 (chabbidhassa ~assa), Pj I 237,2
(chabbidhe ~e, specified); fivefold: Ja IV 223,19'
(pañca-agocara-rahita).

f., the not-tending, Pp 21,2 (agut-
ti +) = Dhs 1345.

mfn. (cf. gopeti) = 'a-gutta', Spk
III 32,20.

√Sadd II 108 (kuṭila-gatiyaṁ); Dhatum
29 (gatikoṭille, = Mmd 671, cf. sa. aga: kuṭi-
lāyāṁ gatau, 19,31). Hence acc. to Gr. aggala, Kacc-v
667, and aggi, ib. 671. Cf. aggati.

[sa. agra and agrya], 1. mfn., first, fore-
most; — eminent, chief, most excellent; highest, best
(cf. adutiya +); Abh 1162 (giving the signification
'excellence or greatness' of prp. pa-); 696, 715, 843 (cf.
Ps I 136,26 = Sp I 173,5 (Sp-ṭ)); Vin I 24,14 (~o
pamukho pāmokkho); Pp 70,2 (~o seṭṭho pāmokkho
uttamo); DN II 15,10 (~o ahaṁ asmi lokassa, +
jeṭṭho, seṭṭho) = MN III 123,21, cf. Ja I 53,18;
Mil 216,22; — SN III 264,10 (~o seṭṭho [pā]-
mokkho uttamo pavaro) = AN III 219,16 =
V 182,5 = Vin I 278,28; MN I 383,15 (~aṁ +
seṭṭhaṁ, uttamaṁ, paṇītaṁ); — SN IV 315,12
(khettaṁ ~aṁ, + majjhimaṁ, hīnaṁ); It 98,12*
(~amhi khettamhi); AN V 63,3 (opp. hīna); AN II
35,3* (~aṁ dhammaṁ) = It 88,19* (cf. Sn 696:
dhamma-maggaṁ, by Pj alternatively taken = dham-
maṁ aggaṁ); Mil 162,27 (~o niyamo); Ps I 99,20
(desanā ~ā ca garukā ca) ; Vin III 90,20 (Sp:
'ayaṁ aggo mahācoro' ti = ayaṁ imesaṁ mahā-
corānaṁ jeṭṭhacoro). — 2. n., (a) the first portion,
forepart, beginning, Abh 843 (ādi-koṭṭhāsa-koṭīsu);
also first-fruits (cf. °-dāna); Pj II 270,6 (pañca ~āni);
— (b) point, tip, top (of a tree), summit (of a mountain),
Abh 542 (siro ~aṁ sikharo); MN III 94,1 (opp. inula);
Pj I 192,6 (phussitāni ~āni); — (c) the most excellent
or principal thing or person, AN III 202,7; AN II
17,14, 25, (Buddho); often in the phrase: ~aṁ akkhā-
yati (q. v.); — Ja V 377,19* (= a precious gift, if
not an error for agghaṁ (Tr.)); — 4 aggāni: AN II
79,1 (Mp; Ed. by error aṅgāni); — (d) the highest state
(of holiness), ~āya parenti, AN V 2,19 (= arahatta,
Mp) = 312,13; It 82,2 (~e pasannā); — loc. agge
(adv.), instr. aggena (adv.), and abl. aggato (adv.), see
separately; cf. agga° in agga-dvāra, aggaṅguli, etc.
— Ifc. ['gga] see: akkh'-a°, agg'-a°, agga-m-a°,
aṅgul'-a°, adh'-a°, an-a°, anamata°, anīka°,
anna°, ambila°, ayo°, aruṇa°, āyata°, āra°,
uccha°, ud-a°, uddha°, eka°, etad-a°, ettāvat-a°,
kaṭuka°, kanaka°, kaṇaya°, kara°, kalāpa°,
kalīra°, kāma°, kuñcita°, kunta°, kumbha°
(kumbhi-a°), kula°, kusa°, kūpa°, kesa°, koṭṭha°,
khala°, khalabhaṇḍa°, khura°, khetta°, gandhab-
ba-sura°, garuḷa°, gira°, chadana°-, chinna°,
jalaja°, jina°, jivha°, tikkha°, tikhiṇa°, tiṇa°,
tittaka° (tittika°), tūlika°, toraṇa° dāya°, dāy-
ana° (or lāyana°), duma°, dhaja°, dhana°,
nakha°, nata°, nara°, (nāna°-rasa), nāsika°,
pañca°, pañña°, pabbata°, pariveṇa°, pāta°,
pāda°, puthuka°, phala°, phussiṭa°, bala°,
bhatta°, bhava°, bhikkha°, maṇḍala°, mad-
da(na)°, madhura°, yasa°, (raja°?), rasa°, rāsa°,
rukkha°, rūpa°, lābha°, lāyana° (or dāyana°),
loka°, loma°, va° (vy-a°), vajira°, vāla°, vippa-
sūna°, vimutt'-a° vihāra°, veṇi-y-a°, veṭṭa°,
vedana°, veḷa°, vellita°, sañña°, satthavāha°,
sam-a°, samādh'-a°, sambodhi-y-a°, sayana°,
sāvaka°, sīla°, sukha°, (suta°-rūpa), sūna°,
sūla°, seyya°, harita°.

n., a house (perhaps related to agāra, as
sa. °jñu : jānu°; cf. Tr. PM 56); only ifc. [°gga], see:
uposatha°, uposatha-pavāraṇa°, khura°, gira°,
dāna°, dhamma-savana°, bhatta°, yāga°, vassa°,
salāka°. '

mfn., of utmost correctness
(with regard to the behaviour of a bhikkhu), Ps III 275,7.

m. & f. (~ikā), a believing lay
follower of the Buddha; dve ~akā, Dhp-a I 340,21
(Citto gahapati, Hatthako Aḷavako); AN I 88,26
(do.); f., dve ~ikā, Dhp-a I 340,22 (Velukaṇḍakī
Nandamātā, Khujjuttarā); AN I 88,29 (Khujjuttarā
ca upāsikā Veḷukaṇḍakiyā ca Nandamātā).

m., the tip (or edge) of a spoon,
As 376,11.

f., a first or best portion (of food
served up), Vin III 80,30 = °-kiriyā, f., Sp.

mfn. (cf. kula), of prominent
family, MN II 55,25 (kulaputto); Pv 443 (= seṭṭha-
kulika, Pv-a).

m., the most excellent musician
Ja II 248,22 (conjectured by Tr. instead of ayya-
gandhabba).

m., the beginning of summer, Ja V
203,18* (vanaṁ yathā ~esu phullaṁ, = vasanta-
samaye, Ct.).

mfn. (cf. 1aggam agga), very best,
most excellent, Ja III 473,22' (~am paṇītam deyya-
dhammaṁ, cf. Sp ad Vin III 80,30); As 110,1. — n.
the outmost tip, Dhp-a II 120,10 (khurānaṁ ~āni);
III 428,8 (~esu parimilātāni).
entry.re:
— °-nemi-vaṭṭiagg'-agga-nemi-vaṭṭi, f., the
outmost rim of a wheel, Dhp-a II 124,11.

— °-pādaagg'-agga-pāda,
m., the outmost tip of the foot, Ja III 489,4' (~ehi
ṭhatvā).

entry.sense:
m., top-shoot, Ja III 389,22'
(~ro); Vin II 161,29 (~akaṁ). agg'-aṁkuraka

f., finger-tip, Ja VI 404,22 (pasāri-
tahatthassa ~īsu).

mfn. [sa. agra-ja], first-bom (scil. a
sprout of a plant), f. ~ā, Ja V 404,3*, 10', (read: aggajā-
r-iva; = paṭhama-jātā, Ct. B aggi-jā(tā); but cf. aggi-
ja); Ap 229,21. — m. the eldest brother, Abh 254.

f., the tip of the tongue (opp. mūla-
jivhā), Vibh-a 247,8.

mfn., primitive, primeval, from former
times (prob. a collateral form of *agga-ññu > aggañño
[in formulas like porāṇo ~o] = 'knowing the first' (the
beginning itself), orig. about persons, later also about
impersonal things. For the interpretation of °-ñña,
with a pass, sense, cf. rattaññu, rattañña) [but cf. sa.
agraṇī, acc. agranyam, HS], Abh 695 (paraṁ ~aṁ
uttaraṁ, 'chief, principal'); n. sg. ~aṁ paññāpeti,
'the beginning of things', DN III 4,12 (Sv); ~aṁ pajā-
nāmi, DN III 30,23; ācariyakam ~am, DN III 28,15
foll.; porāṇam~aṁ akkharaṁ (q. v.) DN III 86,25;
porāne ~e arivavaṁse (q. v.) ṭhito, DN III 225,1 =
AN II 27,27; " Nidd II 107,13' (Ct.); + rattañña,
vaṁsaññā, porāṇa, etc., AN II 27,15 (Mp); IV 246,1.

n., title of the 27th ch. of DN (III
80—98); Vism 417,25; 419,8.

n., the highest position, Ap 31,8
(~e ṭhapesi); 85,4; 95,10. Cf. agga-nikkhitta.

f. (abstr. of agga), superiority, pre-
eminence, Abh 1168; Kv 556,2* (~aṁ gato) ≠ Ps III
710,10. — Ifc. see ati-°, guṇa°, parama°, sakala°.

pr. 3. sg., to go, proceed, behave, Mp III
205,12 (yasmā gahapati viya gehasāmiko viya hutvā
~vicarati, tasmā gahapataggī ti vuccati; etymol. of
aggi; w. r. aṅgati; cf. √agg.

ind. [abl. of 1agga, sa. agratah], 1. in
the beginning, in front, Abh 1194; ~ majjhe ante,
Sv II 296,20 (= Ps III 626,7 Ck; Ps (Se) purato =
Pj I 176,19). — 2. in the presence of, Abh 1148 (pure
~ purato). — 3. as abl. = from the top (the best or
most excellent), Sn 217 (+ majjhato sesato); — ~kata,
mfn. [sa. agrataḥ kṛtaḥ], put before (the eyes), i. e.
imagined, figured to one's self, Thī 386, 394 (Thī-a).
— ~pasanna, mfn., trusting in the highest or most
excellent (prob. = agge p° cf. It 88,2), It 88,18* =
AN II 35,3* = III 36,15* (quoted Ja I 96,25 ; III 414,
17')- Ifc.- see yad°.

n. (abstr.) = aggatā, Pv-a 9,7 (suṭṭhu-
aggattā 'saggan'ti, etymology of 'sagga'), 89,13 (do.).

mfn., deserving the first
oblation, Mil 224,19 (satthā); Dhp-a III 181,10 (~aṁ
Sammāsambuddhaṁ).
entry.re: — °-ttaagga-dakkhiṇeyya-tta, n. abstr. Sp 114,32.
— °-bhāvaagga-dakkhiṇeyya-bhāva, m. abstr., Dhp-a I 289,1'.

entry.sense:
mfn., most excellent among the self-
restrained ones, Th 354 (sambuddham ~aṁ samāhi-
tam).

m., the tip of a tooth; ~e vivaritvā
sitaṁ akāsi, Ja I 433,15; ~e dassetvāmandahasitaṁ
hasi, Pj III 259,10; dve pi ~e chindi, Ja I 321,12.

n., gift of the best, gift of first-
fruits, Vin III 39,18; 134,15 (methuna-dhammaṁ);
Dhp-a I 98,17 (ekasasse navavāre ~aṁ adāsi, cf. agga-
sassa-dāna) ≠ Ps II 253,6; pañca ~āni, Dhp-a IV 98,9
(cf. Pj II 270,7); Ap 208,10. Cf. Pañcaggadāyaka, bīja°.

mfn., giving the firstfruits, AN III
51,12* (~ī + vara-dāyī, seṭṭha-dāyī). agga-dāyin

n., prob. = the upper part of a door,
or gate, only instr. ~ena, by the way of ~, i. e. making
his way above the door; ~ena assamaṁ pavisitvā (scil.
Vepacitti asurindo), SN I 226,18 (v. l. andhavana-
dvārena, cf. ib. 226,22 dvāren'eva assamaṁ pavisitvā,
scil. Sakko); ~ena nikkhamitvā (i. e. above the town-
gate), Ja I 114,15 = Dhp-a I 240,5 (with v. l. uttara-
dvārena, cf. Ja VI 364,8); Ja II 140,10 (cf. the parallel
text Dhp-a IV 55,10, where the words ~ena nikkhamitvā
are omitted); ~ena palāyitvā, Ja III 337,15.

m., the most excellent bow-
man, Mhv XXV 82; Dhp-al V 66,16 (°-paṇḍitaṁ).

m., the highest condition (ɔ: per-
fection, qualifying or denoting arahattaṁ), Thī 432;
An III 433,17; Dhp-a I 97,9; the most excellent doc-
trine, Th 94; Ap 100,27 (cf. next).

mfn., whose dhamma is the
best or first one (the Buddha as first in the law),
Dīp IV 13 (~ā Tathāgatā).

m. Npr. of a Burmese
Scholar, M. Bode: Pāli Litt. of Burma p. 53; JPTS
1910-12 p. 115,

n , the chief town, Vin I 229,10
(Pāṭaliputta); Ja IV 245,23 (scil. Bārāṇasī).

n., the tip of the tail, Dhp-a
I 276,19.

mfn., proclaimed as a specialist
(viz. by Buddha in Etadaggavagga, AN I 23—26)
dhutaṅgune ~o, Bv I 59; Mil 343,24; Vinaye ~o, Ap
38,24.
entry.re: — °-kaagga-nikkhitta-ka, mfn. do., Dīp IV 5.

entry.sense:
[prob. - - ˘ ˘ ˘ - ] mfn.,
possessed of the highest nature, Ja V 351,25* (nom. m.
~mā, = agga-sabhāvo, Ct.). agga-pakati-mat

f., title of proeminence (as to
greatness, etc.); catasso ~iyo, AN II 17,12 (the four
examples given are Rāhu, Mandhātā, Māro, Tathāgato).

m. n. pr. of a grammarian (native
of Jambudīpa) in Burma (Arimaddana-nagare), author
of Lokuppatti-pakaraṇa, Gv 64,15; 67,21. Cf. Mahā°-,
Dutiya-°, Tatiya-°.
see agga-ppatta.

n., 'the highest word', i. e. the most
sublime matters, otherwise ' the highest state ' SN IV
379,20 (atthena attho .... saṁsandissati . . . yad-
idaṁ ~asmiṁ; Spk III 192,7): desanā hi idha agga-
padaṁ pi adhippetā ≠ AN V 320,32 (Mp = nib-
bāne).

f., the first of the four parisā
(assemblies), viz. that of the monks, Mil 163,10 (~aṁ
upagato).

n., a top-shoot, Ja III 389,20'
(māluva-latāyaṁ ~aṁ = 'alla-piṁka').
v. agga-ppasāda.

m., the fore part of the foot, Dhp-a
III 181,1 (ubho ~ā; ak-patul, Rt); Ps II 517,20.

n., the upper side of the. tip (scil
aṅgulīnaṁ, of the fingers), Vism 251,1 (~esu patiṭṭhi-
tā, scil. hattha-nakhā).

m., first or best food, MN I 28,17
(aggāsana +, q. v.); = saṁghattherapiṇḍa, Ps) = II
204,25; SN II 41,28*; Ja II 316,25* (= rasasampan-
naṁ rājarahaṁ aggabhojanaṁ); V 107,20*; Pj I
242,23; Sp ad Vin III 80,30 (= 'aggakārikā').

m., one who receives the best
oblations, Ja VI 140,4* (pl. ~ā = aggodakaṁ agga-
piṇḍ[ik]aṁ labhantā, Ct.).

m., the most excellent person
(Buddho), Sn 684 (Pj); Dhp-a II 39,12 (Satthā); III
113,6 (loke~o Buddho); Vv 768 (Kassapa-buddha);
Mil 111,9* (= Dhp-a I 147,13*); 156,13 (loke ~var-
assa).

n., choice flowers, Ja I 133,12
(aggam ālaṁ ~aṁ +).

m., Npr. of a thera, Ap 229,18
— 230,3.

m., the first among purohitas,
Ja VI 391,13.

mfn., having attained perfection,
DN III 48,10 (+ sārappatta); AN I 242,10 (do.); II
35,10* - It 89,8*; MN I 386,25* (aggapattassa); Th
94 (aggapattena). — Ifc. yasa°.

m., the highest grace, the best
thing to trust in; AN II 34,11 (cattāro ~ā, scil. Buddha,
aṭṭhaṅgika-magga, dhamma, saṁgha) ≠ It 87,15
(tayo ~ā: Buddha, dhamma, saṁgha).

n., the topmost fruition, Pv 595; =
arahatta: Nett 15,11; 82,20; As 12,16.

f., the fore-arm, Mp I 94,17 ≠ Ss
24,33 (bhikkhū pattaṁ ~āya pakkhipitvā [ṭhapetvā]
ādāya vicaranti). — aggabāh-'aṭṭhi, n., the bones of
the fore-arm, Vism 254,3 (dve dve ~īni).

n. [sa. agra-bīja], a plant propagated
by cuttings; (mūlabīja +), DN I 5,31 (Sv); SN III 54,8
(Spk); Vin IV 34,35; 35,9. Cf. bījagga.

(I), m. Npr. of a Sinhalese king
(AD 564—596), Mhv XLI 70, etc. — Npr. of eight
other kings (II—IX), Mhv XLII—XLIX. — Npr. of
a governor of Malaga under King Udaya, Mhv L III 36.
— Aggabodhi-pabbata- (vāpī, f.), Npr. of a tank,
Mhv LX 49.
m., the chief food, Ja VI 258,3.
n., the best goods, Ps II 535,7.

n., the first portion or choicest
food, Dhp-a II 245,1; Ja I 133,13 (aggam ālaṁ +).
Cf. bhattagga.

m., front, fore part; Ps II 283,11
(~e, opp. pacchābhāge).

m., abstr. from 1agga (best), Mp II
69,12 (ad AN I 81,24). Cf. anekaggabhāva.

f., the choicest food (of alms),
Ps II 59,13.

mfn. (cf. agg'-agga), the best of
each sort; ~āni bhojanāni, Vin IV 232,30; 234,7.

m., the highest path, or a still higher
path, Thī-a 20,1; Tikap-a 272,8.
entry.re:
— °-samaṅgi(n)agga-magga-samaṅgi(n),
mfn., possessed of arhatship, Yam I 50,21 (seil. arahā),
163,23, etc.

entry.sense:
f. [sa. agra-mahiṣī], the principal
queen (or wife), SN II 260,14 (Kaliṅgarañño); Ja I
262,5; III 187,17, etc.; Dhp-a l 384,17 (Dhanañjaya-
seṭṭhino); Mp I 189,11 (Kapilabrāhmaṇassa). — Ifc.
see pakati-°. — °i-ṭṭhāna, n., the position as chief
queen, Ja V 443,20;'bhp-a I 199,6. — °i-tta, n.,
Mil 291,14 = °i-bhāva, m., abstr., Ja V 443,17 (cf.
mahesitta, n.).

f., an excellent garland, Ja I 133,12
(~aṁ agga-pupphaṁ aggabhattaṁ).

n. [sa. agra-yāna], the chief vehicle
(i e. the state elephant), Ja VI 490,14* = 515,24*
(kuñjaraṁ).

m., a chief warrior, Mhv XXII, 44
(yodhānaṁ ~assa).

n., the most precious treasure, Dīp
XI 28.

mfn., Ja VI 200,28* (Ct. = a-gārayha
(q. v.); perhaps agga + *arayha [sa. arhya], HS).

m., the choicest delicacies, Ja II 97,
17*, 20'; Mp III 84,18 (pl. ~ā); ifc. see nānaggarasa.
entry.re:
— °-paritittaagga-rasa-parititta, mfn., satiated or surfeited of do., AN
III 237,14 (Mp).

entry.sense:
n., the most beautiful thing, ifc. see
suta-°.

or aggala, n. (Kacc-v 667; once m.)
[sa. argala (argaḍa cf. Vyu 226,88) m. n. or argalā, f.]
1. a bolt or bar of a door, connoting, besides, the ka-
vāṭa (q. v.), Sp (Kkh, Kkh-ṭ) ad Vin IV 47,22, and
often explained so by Ct.s: ~aṁ ākoṭeti, Vin I 248,2
≠ DN I 89,31 (Sv); MN I 161,22 (Ps); II 119,32 (Ps);
AN V 65,23 (Mp); — AN IV 359,1 (Mp: agga-nakhena
dvāra-kavāṭaṁ ākoṭesi); Ps II 560,19 ('paccaggaḷe':
~aṁ vuccati kavāṭaṁ); ~laṁ uppīḷetvā, Ja V 293,20
(opp. to kavāṭa); pl. ~lāni, Ja VI 276,3* (= nagara-
dvāra-kavāṭāni); instr. pl.(Ct.!) citr'-aggale-r-u(g)ghu-
site, Ja VI 483,5* (= dvāra-kavāṭehi ugghosite); acc.
pl. ~ḷe, Ja VI 444,10* (= sūci-ghaṭika-sam pannāni
dvāra-kavāṭāni). — 2. a patch (on clothes), ~aṁ
acchupeti (v. l. acchādeti), to patch: Vin I 290,2-16
(+ tunnaṁ, etc.; = uddharitvā alliyāpana-khaṇḍaṁ,
Sp); IV 121,10; Ja VI 71,8 (tehi paribhuttajiṇṇapi-
lotikaṁ ~ḷaṁ datvā rañjitvā sayaṁ paribhuñjati);
Sp ad Vin I 297,17. — Ifc. see: citra°, tiyaggaḷa,
niraggaṭa, phassita° (phussita°), rajata°; cf.
paccaggaḷe & Pañcaggaḷaleṇa. aggaḷa

f., securing with a bolt, Sp ad Vin
I, 298,18.
entry.re:
— °-vihāraaggaḷa-gutti-vihāra, m., a vihāra secured with a
bolt, Vin I 298,22.

entry.sense:
n., [Buddh. sa. argaḍa-
sthāpana, JAs 1913, 506,11], placing or fixing a door-
bolt, Vin IV 47,22**, 30', (Sp, Kkh, Kkh-ṭ).

m., the vertical post (of a
door), Abh 217; Sp (Vin II 120,17; do.). — °ttham-
bhaka, m., id., Pj I 54,9 (of a window).

n., setting a patch (cf. aggala (2)),
Bv-a ad Bv II 31 ≠ Ja I 8,31 (= As (Se) 51,12;
v. l. Ck aggaḷādāna). — aggaḷâdi-dāna, n., repairing
with patches, etc., Ps I 265,17. — aggaḷa-dānâ-
nuppadāna, n., patching and patching over again (1 ),
Ps III 565,12 (so Ck; Se: aggaḷa-ṭhānuppadāna).
f., chink of a door, SN IV 290,26.

m. [Amg. aggala-pāsaga], ac-
cording to Sp (Vin II 120,17) = kapisīsaka (the
quadrangular end of the bolt of a door, SBE XX p. 106).
n., Npr. of a city, Vin II 300,1.

n., the (panel of a) door, MN
III 95,23 (Ps = kavāṭa).

m., the bolt of a door, Sv II
244,8.

entry.re:
— °-karaṇaaggaḷa-vaṭṭi-karaṇa, n.,
the making of such one, Vin II 172,8 (°mattena).

entry.sense:
n. = kapisīsa(ka), cf. aggaḷa-
pāsaka; Mhv-ṭ ad Mhv XXX 85—86.

f., a pin to secure the bolt of a
door (also used for a key), MN I 126,3 (~iṁ gahetvā
sīse pahāraṁ adāsi).

mfn. [sa. agravat], a first class one,
exemplary; f. ~vatī (parisā), AN I 70,32 (opp. an-
aggayatī; Mp = uttamapuggalavatī or uttamāya pa-
ṭipattiyā samannāgatā); 242,32 (+ vaggā, samaggā). agga-vat

m. Npr. of a celebrated grammarian
(about 1150 AD), author of the Saddanīti-pakaraṇa,
G-v 63,12 (ācariyo); 67,12 (native of Jambudīpa and
working in Burma); Sās 74,4 (thero), 5 (= Tatiya-
Aggapaṇḍito).

n. or f. (~ā), the first salutation
(in the morning), Ja IV 188,3 (paronom. ~aṁ van-
dissāma).

mfn., = 1agga, 1. Dīp VI 68 (~a[ṁ]-
saṅgha-dassanaṁ).

m., the original doctrine (i. e. thera-
vāda), Dīp IV 13; V 14, cf. V 52.

mfn., one who proclaims the
highest good, Th 1142. agga-vādin
ind., from the best one, Dīp IV 13.
mfn., = °-pakatima(t), Ja V 352,2'.
n., firstfruits of the crop, Mil 8,22.
entry.re:
— °-dānaagga-sassa-dāna, n., a gift of that, Dhp-a l 98,14; Sv II
249,14 (pṭ).

entry.sense:
f., the topmost branch, Ja I 52,16;
218,29 (cf. Vin II 161,29).

m., a first or chief disciple; each
Buddha has two (DN II 4,10; Bv II 213; III 30, etc.);
those of Gotama were (1) Sāriputta and (2) (Mahā-)
Moggallāna, Ja III 191,4 (dve~e); Dhp-a l 95,21 (do.);
340,18 (do.); also called Upatissa (aggasāvako) and
Kolita (dutiya-sāvako), Ja I 15,23-24; Bv II 67 (aggā
hessanti sāvakā); Vism 234,3*.
entry.re:
— °-ṭṭhānaagga-sāvaka-ṭṭhāna, n., the
position as chief disciple, Dhp-a I 96,20 (dvinnaṁ
therānaṁ [scil. Sāriputta and Moggallāna] ~aṁ datvā
pātimokkhaṁ uddisi).

— °-vatthuagga-sāvaka-vatthu, n., title of Dhp-a
I 83—114. (Cf. sāvakagga, sāvakayuga).

entry.sense:
f., a first or chief female disciple
(cf. Bv II 214; III 31, etc.); dve ~ikā (Khemā, Up-
palavaṇṇā) Dhp-a I 340,21; Ja I 15,25; Bv II 68
quoted Ja I 16,14* (aggā sāvikā).

m., first or eldest pupil, Pj II 463,13
= Ps III 395,15 (jeṭṭhantevāsī +).

(mf)n., the void agga (i. e. Nib-
bāna), Paṭis II 179,3.

m., the principal merchant, Dhp-a
III 131,17. agga-setthin

mfn. (neg. pp. of gaṇhati), not seized,
not taken, Mil 83,26 (hatthena). See also a-gahita.

pp. (of ā + √gah [sa. √grah]; pr. 3 sg.
*aggaṇhati not traced), grasped, ifc. an-°. — agga-
hitatta, n. abstr., 'lack of generosity of heart', Dhs
1122; As 376,16; Pp 19,14; 23,13; Vibh 357,29. Cf.
Mvu II 376,6*; Çikṣā-s 28,7; Vyu 109,29. — agga-
hetvā, abs., seizing; Ja V 441,30 (v. l. āharāpetvā);
Dhp-a II 249,1 (v. l.) — aggayha, id., Bv II 63. 2aggahīta

ind. (abl. of 1agga), ifc. = from (the edge
of), see: vanaggā.

f., [aggi + ābhā], the splendour of
fire, AN II 139,16 (candâbhā+).

(mf)n. [cf. 2agga, and Āḷavī, Āḷava-
(ka)], together with cetiya Npr. of a shrine at Aḷavī
(transformed into a vihāra, Pj II 345,1 = Spk ad SN I
185,4, and explained Aḷaviyaṁ aggacetiye, ib. I
314,15): Ālavivaṁ ~e cetiye, Sn p. 59,14; SN I 185,4,
AN IV 216,27; 218,27; Vin II 172,4; III 145,4; IV
34,1 (quoted Pj II 3,4); Aggāḷave only, id. Sn 343 =
Th 1263; Aḷavinagaraṁ nissāya ~e cetiye, Ja I 160,21;
II 282,15; III 78,23; 351,23; Dhp-a III 299,14.
— Aggāḷava-cetiya, n., Dhp-a III 170,18 (w. r. for
°ve cetiye?). — Aggāḷava-vihāra, m., see above
Dhp-a III 171,24.

m. [aggi + āloka], the light of fire,
AN II 139,26 (candâloka +).

n. [1agga+āsana], a seat of honour;
labheyyaṁ bhattagge ~aṁ aggodakaṁ aggapiṇḍaṁ,
MN I 28,17 (= saṁghattherāsanaṁ, Ps) = II 204,24
≠ Vin II 161,6 (= Ja I 217,27) & II 162,20 (= Ja
I 219,23); ~e (: āsanapariyante) Ja VI 351,14; °-aggo-
daka-aggapiṇḍatthaṁ, Pj I 242,23. Cf. sāmīcikamma.
— °âdi-'raha, mfn., worthy of a°, etc., Ja I 217,33.

mfn. (cf. prec.), honoured with the
chief seat (or the first foodl), Ps III 81,4 (~ā brāh-
maṇā nāma; Se attāsanikā). [Cf. sa āgrabhojanika].

m. [sa. agni] (in comp, before vowels also
agy°-; acc. to Kacc 671 from √agg, see aggati, cf. also
gini, aggini), 1. fire, Abh 34; Sadd II 108; nom. ~i,
Mil 53,34; 54,5 (is produced by attrition, or by means
of a burning glass >maṇi)); loke ~i suñño hoti (is
wanting or missing), ib. 96,12; ~îva daḍḍhaṁ anivat-
tamāno (not returning to the burnt place), Sn 62 (cf.
AN V 337,9); otāraṁ labhetha, SN IV 185,19; tiṇâ-
gārā ~i mukko (v. l. mutto), AN I 101,9 = MN III
61,15; tiṇadāye~i mutto (v. l. phuṭṭho), AN V 337,8;
sa-upādāno jalati, SN IV 399,20; yaññad eva pac-
cayaṁ paṭicca ~i jalati, tena ten' eva saṁkhaṁ gac-
chati, MN I 259,24 — II 181,17; ~i accimā ca vaṇ-
ṇimā eapabhassaro ea, MN II 152,13; virocasi ghaṭa-
sitto (ɔ: ghata°) va ~i, Ja VI 171,8*; — acc. ~iṁ
karoti (to make fire), Ja II 102,21; ~iṁ jaleti (v. l.
jāl°, to kindle), Mil 47,1; ~iṁ ujjāleti (do.), SN V
113,2; ~iṁ abhinibbatteti + tejo pātukaroti (to pro-
duce), MN II 129,29; ~iṁ dadāti (to set light to), Ja I
294,17; ~iṁ dāpeti (do. caus.), Dhp-a I 223,17;
— instr. ~inā, AN I 136,1 (daheyya); — gen. ~ino,
SN I 41,22*; ~issa, AN IV 41,17. — loc. ~imhi,
Pj II 401,15; ~ismiṁ (pañca ādīnavā), AN III 256,12;
— pl. aggī, Pj II 29,10 (tayo ~ī scil. parikkhepa°,
dhūma°, dāru°); (aggayo, Abh 419); — Synonyms:
Abh 33—34 (cf. Vism 171,26); — Similes: JPTS'08
('09), cf. Dhp 31; Th 3; 461; Ja III 381,20*; IV 26,
20*; V 485,22*; VI 14,18*; MN I 487,11;— satta ~ī,
AN IV 41,1. — 2. pyre, funeral pile, Ja I 294,16 (~im
pavisitvā, as an ordeal); VI 304,3 (~iṁ pavisissãma,
as suicide). — 3. metaphorically = tormenting or
consuming evil, passion, tayo ~ī (rāga°, dosa°, moha°),
DN III 217,19; It 92,8; Vibh 368,19; Nett 126,8; cf.
Dhp 207 = 251 (n'atthi rāga-samo aggi). — ekādasa-
aggi-nibbāna, n., Ja III 411,24' (cf. Paṭis I 129,3,
ten fires). — 4. the sacrificial fire, ~i pajjalito,
Sn p. 21,7 (Pj); Thī 398; ~iṁ jūhati, Sn p. 79,21 (Pj);
~iṁ namassanti, AN V 234,15; 250,6 (see 5); ~iṁ pari-
care, Dhp 107; AN V 263,19; ~iṁ gahetvā anib-
bāyantaṁ ṭhapayiṁsu (at the birth of a son), Ja I
285,12, cf. Ja I 494,3 (jātaggiṁ gahetvā ṭhapesuṁ);
pl. tayo ~ayo (scil. gāhapacca, āhavaṇīya, dakkhi-
ṇaggi), Abh 419; do. (scil. āhuneyyaggi, gahapataggi,
dakkhiṇeyyaggi), DN III 217,20; ~ī, Vin I 31,6 (pari-
caritu-kāmā, jaṭilā); ~iṁ ādhento, AN IV 43,3.
— 5. the god of fire: Aggiṁ Bnagavantaṁ, Ja I 285,16
(namassamāno); 494,11 (gomaṁsaṁ khādāpessāmi);
II 44,1 (sappiyuttaṁ pāyāsaṁ pāyemi); VI 202,21*
(bhojetum ~iṁ; = Aggideva, ib. 29'). — Ifc. °(a)ggi,
v. [ajjhena°], ati-°, an°, anto-°, Avīc'-°, asani-°,
ahāpita°, āhavaṇīya°, āhuneyya°, āhut'a°, inda°,
udara°, ekādasa°, kacavara°, kaṭṭha°, Kaṇdara°
(-sama), kappuṭṭhāna°, kappavināsa°, kusa°,
gahapati-°, gomaya°, jaṭhara°, jāta°, ñāṇa°,
tiṇa°, tividha°, thusa°, dakkhiṇa°, dakkhiṇeyya°,
dāru-°, dāva°, dukkha°, dosa°, dhūma°, nala°,
nibbuta°, niraya°, paṭa°, padīpa°, parikkhepa°,
palāla°, peta°, bahi-°, bhava-dukkha°, moha°,
Yamat-° (Yamad-°), rāga°, vippaṭisāra°, saka-
lika°, saṁkāra°, sâggi, susāna°, soka°, hemanta°.
aggi-uṭṭhāna, n., arising of fire, Ps II 386,6;
entry.re:
— °-kālaaggi-kāla, m., the moment when a thing catches fire,
Ja IV 214,1.

entry.sense:
m(fn) [sa. āgnika], one who worships
the fire, DN II 339,25 (jaṭilo; Sv); pl. ~ā, Vin I 71,25
(jaṭilakā; Sp). — Aggika, m. Npr., see °-Bhāradvāja
below. — [°-sutta, n., title of SN I 166—67.] — Ifc.
see nir-°.

n., a fire-pan, pl. ~āni, Ja VI 8,18
(cf. aṅgâra-kapalla).

m., Npr. of a brahman at
Sāvatthī, converted by Buddha; Sn p. 21,6 (Pj: 'aggiṁ
juhati paricaratī' ti katvā Aggiko ti nāmena pākaṭo
ahosi, Bhāradvājo ti gottena); SN II 66,24 (Spk).
— Also Npr. of a jackal, Ja I 462,8 = Aggika, ib. 462,21*.
entry.re:
— °-suttaAggika-Bhāradvãja-sutta, n., title of Sn I, 7 (p. 21—25), alias
Vasala-sutta, cf. Pj II 174,7 foll.

entry.sense:
n., what can be effected by means
of fire, MN II 152,14 (Ps = sītavinodana-andhakāra-
vidhama[na]-bhattapacanâdi-aggikiccaṁ).

m., 'a mass of fire', a body of
fire; a great blazing fire, SN II 85,2 (mahā); MN
II 34,18 — 41,28 (do.); AN IV 128,4 (mahantaṁ ~aṁ
ādittaṁ sampajjalitaṁ sajotibhūtaṁ); MN I 236,5
(jalantaṁ); Mil 133,1; 283,24 (jalamāno mahā); Paṭis
I 125,3 ≠ Dhp-a III 213,19 foll. (opp. udaka-dhārā);
Th 1156; ~ena upametvā, Mp I 67,6; Vism 234 21;
Dīp VI 36. — pl. ~ā, Th 450; Ja V 269,15* (acci-
manto); VI 330,7 (cattāro); ~ā viya jalanti (mama
puttā), Ja IV 124,21 (i. e. 'they are full of tejas',
it is dangerous to touch them, cf. Dhp-a III 74,3)
— Ifc. see naḷa°, pajjalita-°, mahā-° (pajjalita-
mahā-°, mahati-mahā-°).

mfn. like a blazing fire
(cf. next), Thī 351 (kāmā ~ā dukhā, v. l. °kkhandha-
samā, Thī-a).

f., the parable of the
Burning Fire (in AN IV 128 foll.), Vism 55,17; with
gender attraction in loc. °upame dhammapariyāye,
Mil 164,19 foll (cf. Mp I 67,6, etc.), hence absolute
°ūpamena, Sp I 67,11* (quoted Sās 55,9, q. v.) ≠ Dīp
VIII 7 (Mhv XII 34).

(or °ḍpama°)-sutta, n.,
tittle of AN IV 128—135 (Mp III 235,13; for its
-aṭṭhuppatti see Mp I 55,3 foll); Mp (Ce and Se spell
°ḍpama°) 163,25; 70,2; 536,1 (Se). Separate Ce with
paraphrase, Pæliyagoḍa 1891.

mfn., put over a fire, Mil 260,3
(udakaṁ); fallen into fire, Mil 302,15 (~o . . . marati).

m. [cf. sa. agni-grantha], the text
or chapter treating of 'aggi', only in Pay (corresponding
with Mogg 111,2, cf. Pāṇ II 1,6 with Kāç. and Pada-
mañjarī): aggiṁ pi asesetvā' ti sâggi, ~aṁ pi asesetvā
adhīte, = he reads as far as the section of 'aggi', ind.
(Mogg: sâggi adhīte, q. v.; Mmd 321 has sḍṇâdim
adhīte).

mfn., searching for fire, MN III
141,32 (aggitthiko +). aggi-gavesi

mfn. [sa. agni-ja], 'fire-born', produced
by fire, Sacc 63; at Ja V 404,3*-9',io' aggi-ja & aggi-
jāta ought to be maintained in spite of Ct., see agga-ja.

n., kindling of fire, warming up by
fire, Pj I 242,18.

f. [sa. agnijvālā], 1. name of a plant,
Abh 589 (Lythrum fruticosum). — 2. a flame, Ja I
31,15 (~ā viya lohitadhāraṁ); Dhp-a II 28,12; Vism
l 71,11.

(or °-jūhana), n., fire-offering,
Ja II 43,10; Ja VI 522,26' (= 'aggihuttakaṁ');
— °-jūhanaka-kaṭacchu, m., a spoon for offering to
the fire, Ja VI 526,2' (= 'aggihuttaṁ [kamandaluṁ]'),
cf. ib. 529,9' (v. l.).

n., Npr. of a locality in
Burma, Sās 59,18.

n.(?) or f. ~ā [cf. sa. agni-ṣṭhā],
a fire place, Ja V 155,4* (= aggisālā); 202,3' (visī-
vana-°, q. v.). — °-ṭṭhāna, n., id. Vin II 120,23; 154,3.

tthika, mfn. (aggi + atthika), who wishes
fire, MN III 141,32 (puriso ~o aggigavesī aggipariye-
sanaṁ caramāno).

mfn. [sa. agni-dagdha], burnt
with fire, ~o va tappati, I 6 ≠ AN IV 97,2*; ~o
va ātape, Ja VI 437,9* = 442,18* ≠Pv 38 (Pv-a 37,5);
Vin V 129,14 (cīvaraṁ); Vism 62,24 (do.); 63,9'.

m. Npr. 1. of a brāhmaṇa, father
of the Buddha Kakusandha, DN II 7,12; Bv XXIII,
14; Ja I 42,25; — 2. of a bhikkhu = Gavharatīriya,
author of Th 31 (Th-a quoting an Apadāna ≠ Ap 282,
1-12). — 3. of a brāhmaṇa in Bārāṇasī, Dhp-a III
124,4. — 4. of the purohita of the Kosala king, Dhp-a
III 241,12. — °-brāhmaṇa-vatthu, n., title of Dhp-a
III 241—47.

n., prob, a fire-pan, Ja VI 529,9'
(= 'camasa' ib. 528,24*; dahana seems to stand for
duhana, a Sinhalese blunder for juhana, cf. v. l. of B.
aggi-juhana-kaṭacchu, and Lk aggi-jūhanaka-ka°).

(or °dāha), m., outbreak of fire,
conflagration, AN I 178,3 (mahā-°).

m., Npr. 1. of a prince, the fifth son
of Devagabbhā by Upasāgara, Ja IV 81,6; Pv-a
93,20; 111,18. — 2. the god of fire, Ja VI 202,25'-29'.
— 3. a cakkavatti, Ap 213,1.

m. = aggi (q. v., cf. gini), according to
Kacc 95 used in nom. sg. only [Sadd full paradigm,
cf. Pj II 480,10]; Kacc-v gives the instance "purato(-)
aggini ... vāmato(-)aggini", not traced; see °-sama &
nicc-aggini, and next. Cf. Mogg II 150 (Mogg-pd).

mfn., shining through with fire
(or heat), scil. the sun, Ja III 320,26'. — °-phālima,
mfn., who blossoms out in the sunshine, Ja III 320,18*
(padumaṁ yathā ~maṁ, = agginikāsinā suriyena
phālitaṁ vikasitaṁ). aggi-nikāsi

n., quenching of the fire, Mhv
XXX, 86 (cf. DN II 164,16).
m., a cakkavatti, Ap 159,15.

mfn., brimful of (blazing) fire,
Sn 668, 670 (~aṁ jalitaṁ, scil. kumbhiṁ, Pj); loc.
pl. f. ~āsu, ib. 670 (= aggi-samāsu, scil. tāsu kum-
bhīsu, Pj). Cf. aggi-samūdaka.

mfn. [sa. agni-pakva], cooked by
fire, pt ad Sv I 270,21; ifc. an-° (q. v.) and an-
aggipakkika.
m., light from fire, AN II 140,5.
mfn., inflamed by fire, Ja II 276,1i'.

f., a spark of fire, Mp 138,6
(khajjopanakamattaṁ ~aṁ); Ps II 139,6 (khajjū-
panakamattā °-pappaṭikā).

m(fn)., Sp ad Vin I 71,25 ( =
'aggika', q. v.); °-paricaranaka, m(fn)., id., Sv ad
DN II 339,25 (do.).

n., attendance of the sacrificial
fire, °-ṭṭhāna, n., the place for that, Dhp-a I 199,16.

m(fn)., one mho tends the sacri-
ficial fire, SN IV 312,6 ≠ AN V 263,8 (brāhmaṇā
Pacchābhūmakā).

mfn., [sa. agni + paricita; c: j,
cf. viceyya: vijeyya], injured by fire, Vin II 109,26
(phalaṁ; Ed. °paricita; Sp II 323,14: agginā pari-
jitaṁ (so Ce; Se paricitaṁ) abhibhūtaṁ, etc.). Cf. also
Vyu 126,62-63.

n. (or ~ā, f.), search for fire,
MN III 141,33 (~aṁ caramāno; aggitthiko +).

mfn., boiled by fire (cf. ādicca-pāka),
Sp αd Vin I 246,20.
entry.re:
— °-pāki(n)aggi-pāka-pāki(n), m(fn)., a class of
tāpasas (opp. an-aggī, this — anaggipakkikā), Ap 18,23.

entry.sense:
f. = aggiparicaraṇa, DN I
101,31 (~aṁ an-abhisambhuṇamāno); MN I 82,18
(°-pari-, v. l. °-pāri-); Dhp-a II 232,16 (Ee °-paricāriyā!);
Pj II 291,18 (°-pāri-); 456,18 (cf. v. l.).
= aggihutta-missa((pr.).

m. Npr. of a nephew of Asoka,
husband of Samghamittā, Sp I 51,16; 55,25; Mhv V
169,201; Mhbv 102,20. Aggibrahma

n., fear of fire, AN II 121,8 (Mp);
Mp II 214,17; Rūpas 130,17 (ad Kacc 329).

n., a fire-pan, Sp ad Vin I 3:1,37
(= 'mandāmukhī').

m. [sa. agni-mantha], the tree
Premna spinosa, the wood of which is used for kindling
fire by attrition, Abh 574; aggi anena manthyate 'ti ~o,
taṁ-kaṭṭhehi ghaṁsiyamāno aggi uṭṭhahati, Abh-ṭ;
Sp II 4:16,14 (Vjb = muñci (ɔ: muñjī?) cf. sinh. midi).

m. Npr. of a (mythical) ocean, Ja IV
139,25. — °māli(n), m. do., Ja IV 140,2*.

f., Npr. of a nun who accompanied
Saṁghamittā to Ceylon, DīpX V 78; XVIII 11.

n., only loc. (°mukhe used as
suffix) = in the furnace, As 300,21* = Pj II 458,12*.

m., a kind of snake, As 300,20*
(kaṭṭha-mukha +) ≠ Pj II 458,11* (cf. ib. 458,1:
kaṭṭhamukhâdi-āsīvisa-daṭṭho, and Spk III 64,9).

n. (aggi + ayana? cf. sa. agni-
çaraṇa), a house for keeping the sacrificial fire, Ja V
158,16* (Ct.: aggiyāyana- (Bd aggiyāyatana)-saṁkhā-
taṁ aggisālaṁ parivāretvā); Pj II 174,29 (cf. v. l.).
Cf. agyāyatana.

n., title of MN (ch.12)
I 483—89

(vāpī, f.), a tank in Ceylon
(Ak-vaḍunnā, Pūjāvaliya in EZ 168, n. 3) Mhv XXXV
95, v. l. Abhivaḍḍbamãnaka = Dīp XXII,8 (Abiva-
dunna, Rājāvaliya in EZ I. c. cf. ib. I 211 n. 3).

mfn. [sa. agni-varṇa], hot, glowing,
Ps I 266,26 (saṇdāsena °-patta-gahaṇe); SvI 264,14,

n. [sa. agni -ḷ- vrata], fire-service,
Nidd I 92,28 (Ed. °vatta).
entry.re:
— °-vatikaaggi-vata-vatika, mfn., devoted
to that, Nidd I 89,21 (hatthi-vatika +).

entry.sense:
n., an instrument for fanning the
fire, Ps II 308,10 (= 'vidhūpana', MN I 189,5).

m. Npr. of one of the guards of King
Eḷeyya, AN II 180,17.

m. Npr. [sa. Agniveçyāyana,
Amg. Aggivesāyaṇa, whilst the Pali Gramm, give the
forms Aggivessana, Aggivessāyana, Pay ad Mogg IV 2
≠ Kacc-v 347], 1. surname of Nigaṇṭha Nātaputta,
DN I 57,19. — 2. do. of Saccaka Nigaṇṭhaputta, MN
I 228,8; 238,12; 240,29 (quoted Kacc-v 308); 249,28
(quoted Pj II 163,4); 249,34 (quoted As 378,22).
— 3. do. of Dīghanakha (paribbājako), MN I 497,28;
500,34 (quoted Nidd I 284,7 & 303,28). — 4. do. of
Aciravata (samaṇuddeso), MN III 128,17.

m., 'named after Aggi', i. e. the
lead wort (Plumbago), Abh 580 (cittako ~o, ≠ Am-k
114,80).

m., the heat of fire, Mil 259,3
(°-vega, m., the impulse of . . .), Vibh 83,37 (Vibh-a).
Ifc. tividh'aggi-santāpa.

mfn. — aggini-sama (q. v.), Pj II
481,1; ~ã jālā, Ja VI 54,12*.
entry.re:
— °-samūdakaaggi-sama-samūdaka, mfn.,
id., Ja V 269,22* (tattaṁ ~aṁ, lohakumbhiṁ).

entry.sense: m., Npr. of 16 cakkavattis, Ap 156,25.

m., contact with fire, AN V
121,9 (+ daṇḍa-samphassa, sattha-samphassa).

f. [sa. agni-çālā], a fire room, a heated
hall; a house for keeping the sacrificial fire; Abh 214
(= jantāghara, q. v.); Vin I 49,6 = II 210,3; 1139,35;
II 154,6; Ap 215,9; loc. ~amhi (as from *aggisāla, m.)
Vin I 25,19* (≠ agyāgāre, ib. 24,2l); ~āyaṁ, Ja I
8,14' (part of a brahman's assama, containing aṅ-
gārakapalla-dāru-ādīni); Ja V 155,11' (= 'aggiṭṭhã').

m. Npr., 1. of a nāgarāja (among
names of various beings converted by Buddha), Sp I
120,19; Vism 207,25. — 2. of 3 cakkavattis, Ap 127,17.

f. [sa. agni-çikhā], a flame, Ja V
213,21* (= naḷa-jāla-kkhandha); pl. V 268,1* (pabhas-
sarā); Sv I 95,10 (°-ă-dhūma-sikhāhi ākulabhāvo).
— Ifc. see alāt'-°, kusatiṇ'-°, hemant'-°.

mfn. (cf. upamā), like flames,
burning or unsteady, Sn 703 (Pj); Dhp 308 = It 43,8*
= 90,13*; effulgent, splendent, Ja VI 537,4* (rucirā
~ā, scil. kaṇikārā pupphitā).

m. Npr.(1), traced only Kacc-v 364,
where it is given to illustrate the sense of subst, n.
with the suffix -kaṇ: ~assa bhāvo: Aggisomakaṁ
(Mmd Ce Aggihomakaṁ).

m. (from Jagga), 'foremost lord', epi-
thet to dhammasenāpati, captain of faith, Ja I 236,14.

n. [cf. sa. agnihotra], an oblation to
the fire, Dhp 392 (Dhp-a); Sn 249 (~ass' upasevanā);
428 (~aṁ jūhato); p. 79,23 (aggiṁ juhitvā ~aṁ pari-
caritvā; Pj II 401,13); SN II 66,21; Thī-a 136,20;
Vin I 36,17*, quoted Ja I 83,13* = VI 220,11*; ~aṁ
saraṇaṁ pavissa, Ja VI 211,25*; also = the fire-
worship and its rites, Ja V 205,8*; 207,23'. — n. an
instrument for the fire-worship, ~aṁ kamaṇḍalu(ṁ),
Ja VI 525,28* (Ct. = aggi-jūhanaka-kaṭacchu, q. v.)
= ' 542,22* (split-comp. = aggihutta-kamaṇḍalu?);
Ap 160,28. — aggi-huttaka, n., fire-offering, Ja VI
522,6* (= aggi-jūhanaṁ, Ct.). Cf. aggi-hotta, etc.

n., various tools for fire-wor-
ship, Vin I 33,6 (kesa-missa + ; dabbiādi aggipūjopa-
karaṇaṁ, Sp-ṭ).

f., a house for the sacrificial
fire, Ja V 4,27' (= 'agyāyatana').

n. [sa. agni-hotra, = aggihutta,
q.v.}.
entry.re:
— °-padhānaaggi-hotta-padhāna, mfn., Pj II 456,20 (= 'aggi-
huṭta-mukha', q. v.). — °-sālā, f., Ps III 198,6
(= 'agyāgāra').

— °-seṭṭhaaggi-hotta-seṭṭha, mfn., Pj II 456,20
(= 'aggihutta-mukha', q. v.).

entry.sense:
n. [sa. agni-homa, m.], an oblation
poured into the fire (in order to augur from if), DN I 9,5
(+ dabbi-homa, thusa-°, kaṇa-°, taṇḍula-°, sappi-°,
tela-°, mukha-°, lohita-°; Sv I 93,1 = aggi-jūhana).

m. (from 1agga), a first or chief
attendant, DN II 6,16 foll. (Vessabhussa Bhagavato ~,
scil. Upasannaka. cf. Upasanta, Bv XXII, 23; Ja I
42,13); II 51,9 (Vipassissa ~, scil. Asoka, cf. Bv XX,
28; Ja I 41,10); 52,9 (Gotamassa ~, scil. Ānanda);
MN II 46,3; 51,7 (Kassapassa ~, scil. Ghatīkāra, cf.
Ja I 43,17 [Bv XXV, 41]).
entry.re:
— °-upaṭṭhāyikāagg'-upaṭṭhāka-upaṭṭhāyikā, f., do.
female attendant, Dhp-a I 417,20 [Bv XI,26]; Ps II
399,7. — [Bv has always the forms aggupaṭṭhaka,
m. & aggupaṭṭhikā, f., Bv XXII, 25 (Bv II, 215,
III, 16—32; IV, 25, etc., are all unknown to Bv-a),
and cf. aggupatthākupāsaka, m. & ~ikā, f., ib.
XXVII, 19—20.]

entry.sense:
ind. [sa. agre, loc. of *agga], in front, at the
top; Abh 843 (= purato); Ja IV 156,1* (opp. majjhe,
pacchā); often ifc. = from that, since, etc., see: ajjat-
agge (ajjadagge), etad°, tad°, tamat'°, daharat°
(or daharad°), yad°.

ind. [sa. agrena, instr, of *agga], ifc.
in the sense of 'according to' (scil. to occurrence, or to
what is at hand), see: pariveṇaggena, bhikkh°,
yad°, vihār°, seyy°; also = along (the edge of), see
pavanaggena.

n. (*agga + udaka), the first or best
gift of water, MN I 28,17 (aggâsana -ḷ-; = dakkhinḍ-
daka, Ps) = II 204,24; Pj I 242,23; pl. ~āni, Ja III
432,12* (= aññehi paṭhamataraṁ apītāni anucciṭ-
ṭhḍdakāni).

√[sa. √argh]: agghane, Dhātup 32 =
Dhātum 39: 3 sg. agghati.

m. [sa. argha], price, value, worth, Abh
1048 (mule); Vin II 159,1 (~o kato, the price fixed
or charged); Mil 244,1 (na sakkā dhanena ~o pari-
māṇaṁ kātuṁ, the price cannot be measured in money);
Pj I 173,28 (yassa na .sakkā tulayitvā ~o kātuṁ);
~aṁ akāsi, fixed the price, Ja I 124,28; ~aṁ ṭhapeti
(do.), Ja I 98,27; ~aṁ eti (with gen., is of equal value
to) Ja IV 66,23* = 67,8* - SN II 9,18*; ~aṁ osāpeti
(v. l. osāreti), to put down the price, Dhp-a III 108,7;
~aṁ hāpeti (do.). Ja I 124,23; ~ena ~aṁ kayaṁ
hāpayanti, Ja VI 113,11* (to haggle about the price*!);
taṁ katvā ~aṁ agghe 'nagghaṁ ṭhapesi maṁ, Thī25
(perhaps to be read: taṁ katvā aḍḍhaṁ agghen' agghaṁ
ṭhapesi maṁ, = they cut down my tax to the half and
higgled still, cf. Aḍḍhakāsī, Npr.); in the Cf. Thī-a
33,2 agghe (so read for agghena) explained by aggha-
nimittaṁ, cf.nimitta); instr. ~ena, Vin II 51,28 (tassā,
gen., according to (the value of) that, cf. aggha-samo-
dhāna; [Ja I 253,6 read anaggho; Ja-pota]. — Ifc. see:
an-°, app'-°, koṭi-koṭi-dhan'-°, ṭhapit'-°, mah'-°,
mahatimah'-°, sam-°, sahass'-° cf. paccaggha
[for paccagga].

n. [sa. arghya], hospitality, respectful
reception of a guest, oblation of water, rice, etc., Abh
424, 1048 (pūjane); Ja IV 396,8* = DN II 240,17*
(Sv). Cf. 1agga, 2 c & agghiya, n.

mfn. (from aggha), worth, having the
value of, ifc. koṭi-°, koṭidhan'-°, Mhv XXX 72—77.

m., a valuator, Ja I 124,11 (in
the king's service).
n., fixing prices, Ja I 99,8.
~ikā, see agghanaka.

pr. 3sg. [sa. √argh], 1. to be worth,
cost (acc); to have the value of, to be equal to (acc.);
kiṁ ~ati, Ja I 125,20**; V 284,14; Dhp-a III 256,7;
adhika-satasahassaṁ ~, AN III 50,12; sata-sahassaṁ
~ Ja I 112,1i; koṭi-sahassaṁ ~, Mhv XXXII 28;
ekaṁ taṇḍula-nālikaṁ ~, Ja I 125,4; mama sāmikassa
pādarajaṁ ~, Ja VI 367,22; tassa paricārake pi na
agghāma, Ja VI 174,19; maṇiṁ nâgghāma, Dhp-a
III 35,19; kalaṁ n'agghati (or nâgghati), Ja IV
252,27* (cf. kalā); Ja IV 66,9*-25*, 67,10* - SN I
19,14*-20*-28*; kalaṁ n'agghati soḷasiṁ: Dhp 70; Vin
II 156,5*; SN I 233,2* (in prose 'text: SN V 343,23;
AN I 166,5; 168,7; V 22,12); Ap 245,22. — 2. to be
worthy, proper, becoming (dat. pers, with inf., cf.
vaṭṭati), Dhp-a I 439,19 (mayhaṁ). — grd. v. an-
agghaniya; caus. v. agghāpeti. — [Sn 834 w. r.
agghasi, see sagghati.]

n., value, valuation, the sense of √aggh
(q. v.); °-bhāva, m., the being so valued, Ja I 125,15.
Ifc. see an-agghana-°, mahagghana.

mfn. = prec. sata-sahass'-~aṁ
kāsika-vatthaṁ, Ja III 11,5.
grd. of agghati, see: an-°.

m., a particular form of the
samodhāna-parivāsa; odhāna-samodhāna +~ + mis-
saka-samodhāna: Sp ad Vin II 38,9-10, see Vin II 51,28
(tassā agghena samodhāna-parivāsaṁ detu); Kkh ad
Vin III 186,14 (Kkh-ṭ). See parivāsa.

or ~ika, m., a valuator, Ja I
124,14; 125,10; 126,13 (paṇḍita-°, bāla-°); V 276,5'
(kūta-°). — °-ṭṭhāna, n., the office of a valuator,
Ja I 126,7; VI 113,18' (see v. l.).

n., the charge or office
of a valuator, Ja IV 137,19.

pr. Ssg. (caus. of agghati), to value,
or to cause to be valued (with acc. of the thing and
acc. or instr, of the price); part. ~ento, Ja I 124,15;
Ja VI 546,26; Vin III 67,36 (in a passive sense); aor.
~esi, Ja VI 546,27; Dhp-a I 412,7; PsIII 676,11 ≠ Pj
II 577,25; inf. ~etuṁ, Mil 192,3 (na sakkā kenaci ~);
abs. ~etvā, Ap 108,21; Ja VI 577,10' (mam nikkha-
sahassaṁ); Mhv XXVII, 23.
~ikā, v. next (3).

1. mfn. [sa. arghya, ger. of √argh],
valuable, precious; [Ja VI 265,2, read maṇi-agghiyam,
q. v.]. Ifc. v. kim-agghiya. — 2. n., a respectful
oblation (of water, etc.) to a guest, Abh 424 (cf. 2 aggha);
Ja V 324,5* (sabbassa ~am kataih) = VI 516,8* ( =
nivediyaṁ) = 517,17* = 533,1*. — 3. n. (ifc. also
agghika & agghikā, f. (?) see EZ I 258), a column
of honour (decked with decorations of flowers, etc.), cf.
kūṭâgāra-sadisa-saṇṭhānāni (puppha-)cetiyāni, Sp-ṭ
ad Sp 198,13; ~am, Ap 101,26; pl. ~āni, Ja VI
580,18*. Ifc: kañcan'-°, kusum'-°, pupph'-°,
maṇi-°, ratan'-°. — (°-agghika): kañcan'-°, ku-
sum'-°, toraṇ'-°,toraṇa-māl'-°, dhaj'-°, pupph'-°,
pupphamay'-°, phaḷika°, ratan'-°, suvaṇṇ'-°. Cf.
sinh, pān-ægæ = dīpa-rukkha, q. v.

m. (aggi + antarāya), obstacle or
danger from fire, Vin I 112,37 (rajantarāya +),
169,36; II 244,16.

n. [sa. agny-ăgāra], a house where
fire is kept, DN I 101,22; 102,1 (v. l.); MN I 501,25
(= aggihotta-sālā, Ps); AN V 234,14 = 250,5; Vin I
24,25; IV 109,2; Ja VI 535,22*; V 3,10 (v. l. agyagāra).

n. [sa. agny-ādhāna], installation
of the Fire, Th-a ad Th 219 (Ce*339,36 w. r. agyāgāra).

n. = aggiyāyana (q. v.), Ja V 4,5*
(= aggihutta-sālā); Pj II 401,13.

√pāpakaraṇe; 3 sg. agheti, Sadd II (= sa.
Dhātup. 35,84 d). Cf. 1agha.

n. [ts.], sin, error; evil, misery, distress,
pain, adversity; Abh 84 (pāpam kibbisam verâghaṁ),
89 (nīgho vyasanaṁ ~), 940 (pāpasmiṁ gagaṇe
dukkhe vyasane ~, cf. √agh); SN I 22,21* (chandajam
~aṁ; Spk = pañcakkhandha-dukkhaṁ); I 134,24*;
Ja V 100,2* (= dukkhaṁ) = V 112,29* = 117,10*;
Ja VI 505,18* (= dukkhaṁ) ≠ 525,26*; Thī 491
(+ nighaṁ; Thī-a: dukkhuppādanaṭṭhena ~aṁ);
SN III 189,9 (rūpaṁ . . . aghan 'ti passa) ≠ AN II
128,17 (abl. ~ato, aniccato +) = IV 422,26 = MN I
435,34; 500,4, cf. Mil 418,29; + aghamūlaṁ, SN III
32,10; aghassa tātā (scil. Gotamo), Sp I 171,32 (Sp-ṭ;
cf. Sadd II 389) = Ps I 130,38 (hantā for tātā) =
Sv I 229,19 (pt) = Mp II 20,14 (v. l. ghātā) = Pj I
18,33 (do.). — Ifc v. an-° (cf. nĭgha).

n., sky, atmosphere, Abh 46 (devo vehā-
sayo tārāpatho surapatho ~aṁ), 940 (gagane); Dhs
§ 638 (ɔ: ākāsadhātu) = § 722 = Vibh 84,33 (As 326,2:
na haññatī 'ti agham, aghaṭṭanīyan 'ti attho), inter-
polated in MN I 423,6 (see v. l.); loc. ~e, Jal V 154,15*
(= appaṭighe ākāse) = 322,1*; ~asmi(m), Ja IV
484,12* (= ākāse); ~amhi, Ja V 14,24* (= appaṭighe
ākāse); loc. ~asi (cf. nabhasi) in, comp. °-gama, mfn.,
(q.v.). — mfn., aerial, without support, baseless, lo-
kantarikā ~ã asamvutā andhakārā andhakãra-timisā,
DN II 12,11 = MN III 120,9 = SN V 454,17 = AN
II 130,26 (= niccavivaṭa, Sv, Mp, Ps). (Cf Morris
1889 p. 200 & Mvu Index).

mfn., doing evil or harm; ~ā migā,
Ja VI 507,20' (= 'aghammigā'; synon, dukkhâvaha).

n., 1. the element ether, Dhs § 638,
722. [For gata see As 326,1]. — 2. = 1agha: abbūḷ-
harii ~am vijitaṁ, Th 321 (Ed. aghataṁl Th-a).

mfn., distressed, SN I 54,26* (Spk =
dukkha-jāta); cf. aghavinaya.

mfn. (neg. grd. of ghaṭṭeti), not
strikable, As" 326,2 (= '2agha'). — °-tā, f., Vibh-a 72,4.

mfn., undisturbed; anerito + ~o,
Nidd I 353,'ii (samuddo; = akkhobhito, Ct).

mfn., identical with pain; ayaṁ
kayo roga-bhūto +, MN I 510,12; ~aṁ, SN III 189,9
(scil. rūpaṁ).

m. (cf. ^gha), a wild and fero-
cious beast, Ja VI 247,26* (~ehi; = aghāvahehi
migehi dukkhāvahehi, sunakhehī 'ti attho); Ja VI
507,5* (~ā; = aghakarã migā, dukkhāvahā 'ti attho).

mfn., homeless, Ja VI 69,20 (gehaṁ
vikkiṇitvā ~ā hutvā).

m., putting away hatred or aver-
sion (i. e. dosa), SN I 22,22* (chanda-vinayā ~o, ~ā
dukkha-vinayo; = pañcakkhandha-vinayo, Spk).

mfn. (cf. 2agha, loc), going in
the sky, Vv 137 (= vehāsaṁ-gama, Vv-a 78,33).

mfn. (neg. grd. of ghāteti),
inviolable, Ja V 182,26' (= 'avajjha').

mfn. (1agha + apaha), destroying evil,
Abh, Introd. v. 2 (dhammaṁ ~aṁ; 2. ed. aghappahaṁ).

mfn. (2agha + āvaha), bringing or
causing pain, Ja VI 247,29' (synon, dukkhâvaha).

mfn., suffering, sorrowful, distressed;
Sn 694 (aṭṭo vyasana-gato ~ī; = dukkhito, Pj); pl.
~ino, Ud 15,2*; DN II 148,4 = 159,8 (~ino dummanā
cetodukkha-samappitā; = uppanna-dukkhā, Sv).

mfn. [sa. aghoṣa], voiceless (a gramm,
term, para-samaññā (q. v.), for the consonants k, kh,
c, ch, etc.), Kacc-v 9; ghosâghosā, pl. m., voiced
and voiceless consonants, Kacc 29.

m. [ts.], 1. prob. orig. = a hook (cf.
aṁkusa), hence: (a), the lap (the angle formed by the
thigh and the rump when sitting), Abh 276 (ucchaṅg'-
aṁkā); Ja V 322,12* = VI 218,3* (~aṁ pariggayha);
Ja IV 375,12 (itthiyā ~e nipanno); Ja V 298,18' (~aṁ
avattharitvā nipanna-sāmiko); VI 578,2* (~e karit-
vāna); Ja III 209,2* (~asmiṁ nisinno, ɔ: viṭabhiyaṁ,
said of a nigrodha growing on a palāsa tree); 209,16*
(~asmiṁ vaḍḍhesi, do.); Ja IV 435,12* (~e vaddho,
grown up as a baby); Ja I 262,12 (~e nisinnaṁ put-
taṁ); Vin II 114,21 (~e pattaṁ nikkhipanti); MN I
394,35 (~e nisinno; — ūrusu, Ps); DN II 20,20 (~e
nisīdāpetvā); —- (b) the breast, bosom (the arms); instr.
~ena, DN II 19,25 (pariharanti); 20,3 (~en' eva aṁ-
kaṁ, i. e. from arms to arms; Sv); Ja III 190,5* (maṁ
uddharī); VI 513,5 (dārake ~enâdāya); II 127,26
(do.); Dhp-a I 170,1 (vahitvā, opp. ure nipajjāpetvā).
— 2. a mark, sign, brand, Abh 55 ( = lakkhaṇa), 1043;
Dhātum 19 & 748 (dassana-aṁkesu, giving the sense of
√ikkh and √lakkh); ~ena (or aṁke na?) jānāti lak-
khanena jānāti, Mil 79,23;— °-yutta, mfn., marked,
Ja V 506,25' (Cs). — Ifc. v. Gokula°, tisūlâdi-°,
lohita°, hariṇa°, (cf. khalaṁka-pāda and balaṁka-
pāda).

mfn. [ts.] (pp. of aṁketi), marked,
signed, characterized, [Kacc-v 619?]. Ifc. v. cakka°,
dīgha-sutta°, majjhima-pamāṇa-sutta°.

mfn. (cf. kaṇṇa), whose ears
are marked (cut, or perforated), Ja II 185,10* (= vid-
dha-kaṇṇa).

m. [cf. sa. Akrūra], Npr. of a prince,
the 10th son of Upasāgara and Devagabbhā, Ja IV
81,7; 84,4; Pv 260 ... 315 [ - - ≃ probable in 283, 287
foll. 307 foll.]; Pv-a 93,21 foll.; as a devaputta,
Dhp-a III 219,17; IV 82,9; ~assa vatthu, ib. 82,8.
n. dimin, of aṁkura. — Ifc. agg'-°.

n., development of a sprout,
°-ṭṭhāna, n., place of ~, Ja II 105,1.

mfn., of the colour of a sprout,
Dhs § 617 (nīla +, v. l. ambaṁkura-vaṇṇa, cf. As
317,13).
[n., title of Dhp-a IV 80—82.

m. [sa. aṁkuça], a hook, crook, (a)
used to guide an elephant, Abh 367 (opp. tuttaṁ); Ja
VI 489,2; Vin II 196,3* = MN II 105 7*; Dhp-a IV
13,15 (: kunta-tomara); Sv II 398,19 (~o ti matthake
vijjhanakakuṭilakaṇṭako (: tutta, tomara); — (b)
used for plucking fruits from trees, one of the requi-
sites of Brahman ascetics, Ja VI 529,9' (phalānaṁ
ganhanatthaṁ ~aṁ; —= 'āsada'); Ja V 232,10*; V 89,4
(pacchi-khanitti-°); VI 520,31 (do.); — (c) = (a)
metaph, in the phrase ~aṁ karoti, to take as a direc-
tive (acc); so taṁ yeva ~aṁ katvā, Ps I 234,22 quoted
Ss 52,24; ovādaṁ ~aṁ katvā, Thī-a 173,19 (cf. pa-
toda, Thī210); attano vacanaṁ ~aṁ katvã, ib. 30;
do. n. (by gender attraction) Th-a (Ce 178,3l) ad Th 82
(idaṁ vacanaṁ . . . aṁkusaṁ jātaṁ). — (d) the fifth
naya in the Netti system, Nett 2,9; 4,25 (Ct. ib.
208,20); 127,19.— Ifc. v. acc-°, daṇdaṁkusapāda;
nir-°, piṇdapātapaṭikkhepa°, vajira°.

m., dimin, of aṁkusa, (a) Ja III
431,6; Ja IV 311,31' (rassa-pācanehi [Ed. dasa-°]
°kehi vā); — (b) Ja III 22,6' (~ena sākhaṁ name-
tvā); As (Se) 52,19 = Ja I 9,17' (aṁkusa[ka]-pacchi-
tidaṇḍakâdīni). — °-yaṭṭhi, f., a hooked stick, Ja
II 68,23. — °-lagga, mfn., hooked together, Sv II
215,15 (pt).

n., (abstr. of aṁkusa-ggaha), the
art of guiding (an elephant), MN II 94,13 (kusalo ~e
sippe, w. r. aṁkusa-gaṇha; = aṁkusa-gahaṇaka-
sippa, Ps).

m. [sa. aṁkuça-graha], an
elephant-driver, Dhp 326 = Th 77; Th 1139 (kusala-°).

(pr. 3 sg.) [denom, of aṁka], to mark,
to brand; abs. ~etvā, Ja I 451,25 (lakkhaṇena); II
399,4 (ambāni); pp. aṁkita, q. v.

m. [sa. id. & aṁkoṭ(h)a; Amg. aṁkolla,
Hc I 200] name of a tree, Alangium hexapetalum,
cf. Abh 557 (2. ed. aṁkola); Ja V 420,4*; VI 535,9*; Ap
15,22; 199,16, 287,19 ≠ ākulī, Th-a ad Th 213—14.
— °-ka, 71., its flower, Ja IV 440,7*; 442,4' (~âdīni
pupphāni).
m. Npr. of a thera, Ap 199,15—26.

m. Npr. of a thera, Ap 287,
16—25 (= Anūpama, Th-a ad Th 335—36).

m. [sa. id. & aṁkī], a sort of tambourine,
Abh 143.

√ gamane and gatiyaṁ, 3. sg. [aṅgati],
Dhātup 25; Dhātum 32; Sadd II 95.

ind. [ts.], a particle expressive of irony or
sarcasm = indeed, oh! Abh 1139. Cf. kim-aṅga.

n. [ts.], pl. ~āni & (acc.) ~e, 1. a limb
of the body, Abh 278; Ja II 150,4*; Cf. compounds below.
— 2. (a) integrant part or (b) subordinate division of
a whole; a sort, kind (cf. ekaṅga, theyyaṅga; Ct.s
= koṭṭhāsa): (a) rañño ~aṁ, AN I 244,10 foll., 284,13
(cf. rājaṅga, Vin I 219,5); ~aṁ etaṁ manussānaṁ
bhātā, Ja III 50,3* (quoted VI 297,22'); ajjhattikaṁ
~aṁ, AN I 16,23; It 9,13; SN V 101,16 (opp. bāhiraṁ
~aṁ, ib. 102,2); (b)esp. ~aṁ nava-vidham, in the ortho-
dox division of Buddhavacana (sutta, geyya, etc.; AN II
7,2, etc.), Gv 57,9 = navaṅgam Satthusāsanam, Dīp IV
15; Sp I 28,4-29,3 (Sp-ṭ); Sv I 23,30 (nṭ); As 18,16
(aṅgato nav' aṅgāni = according to the literary species,
opp. piṭakato, nikāyato). — 3. link, joint; factor, cause
(nidāna = hetu), Abh 955 (avayava-hetusu); = ni-
dāna (cf. paṭicca-samuppãda°), Vism 529,21; dvādas'
aṅgāni (avijjā, etc.), Abhidh-s 36.17 m. pl. caturo ~e,
Cp II 2,3; 10,2 (ɔ: uposathaṅgāni); ete ~e, ib* III
6,19; n.pl. pañca~āni pāṇâtipātassa, Pj I 31,5; instr,
sg. iminā p'aṅgena, DN I 113,22 (= iminā pi kā-
ranena, Sv); ten' aṅgena, on that account, in this
respect, DN III 123,6; MN I 492,2; AN III 391,19;
V 10,5; hence frequently — 4. attribute, quality, char-
acteristic sign, criterion (cf. dhamma); mostly with
numbers, instr, pl. ~ehi (samannāgata, etc.), Sn2 p.
78,8 (catūhi ~ samannāgatā, scil. vācā; = kāraṇehi
âvayavehi vā, Pj; cf. AN III 243,27); thus also: tīhi
~, AN I 115,15 (pāpaṇiko); 1.53,23 (mahācoro); 244,9
(rañño assājānīyo); III 282,20 foll, (do.); 1284,12
(yodhājīvo); 286,1 (mitto); — [cattāri ~āni, AN II
79,1, read aggāni]; cattāri sotāpannassa ~āni, DN III
227,6; catūhi ~ AN II 1.13,21 (rañño assājānīyo);
250,1 (do.); 116,24 (rañño nāgo); 170,26 (yodhājīvo);
— pañca ~āni pahīnāni, SN I 99,26 = AN I 162,8;
pañcahi ~ SN I 99,30 =. AN I 162,8 (samannāgato);
DN I 120,10 (brāhmaṇaṁ paññãpenti); AN III 128,12
(mahācoro); 147,25 (rājā cakkavattī); 20,27 (sammā-
diṭṭhi); 243,27 (vācā subhāsitā); — chahi ~ AN III
282,20 foll, (rañño assājānīyo); — sattahi ~, AN IV
10,1 (kulaṁ); 31,12 (mitto); — aṭṭhahi ~, AN IV
188,15 (rañño assājānīyo, cf. aṭṭhaṅga-samannāgata);
339,12 (mahācoro); — dasah' ~, Khp IV (Pj I 88,7;
arahā); SN III 83,26* (sampannā mahānāgā);
— ekādasahi ~, AN V 347,15; 359,1 (gopālako; cf. MN
I 220,6); — 5. characteristic signs on the limbs of the
body (= omens to augur from), DN I 9,3 = 67,14 (Sv).
— Cf. aṅgi(n), aṅgika (~ya).
Ifc. (a)ṅga, see: akaṇika°, aṅga-m-°, aṭṭha°,
an-°, anindita°, anujja° (f. ~ī), apaṇṇaka°, abbho-
kāsika°, asambhinnà°, ãraññaka° (~ika°),
uttama°, uposatha°, eka°, ekāsanika°, ekeka°,
oḷārika°, kaṭṭha°, kat'-°, kāya°, kārāpaka°, kūṭa°,
khalupacchābhattika°, catur-°, chaḷ-°, jhāna°,
ti-v-°, turiy-°, tecīvarika°, tad-°, theyya°, dasa°,
du-v-°, dhuta°, nava°, nesajjika°, paṁsukūlika°,
pace'-°, pañca°, paṭicca-samuppāda°, patta°,
patta-piṇdika°, [pārisuddhi-]padhāniy-°, pa-
yoga°, pāṇy-°, piṇdapātika°, puṇdarīkattaca°,
pubba°, bojjh'-°, bhava°, magga°, yañña°, yathā-
santhatika°, yoga°, rajja°, ratha°, rahassa°, rāja°,
rukkhamūlika°, vakka°, vara°, vāca°, yipassana°,
vissaṭṭh'-°, vīra°, veda°, sakaṇika°, satta°,
sadisa°, santa°, sabba°, samaṇa°, sambojjh'-°,
sāmañña°, sîsa°, sena°, sotāpatti-y-°, sosānika°,
haricandanalitta°. Cf. also pāmaṅga.

m. Npr. [ts.], 1. of a paccekabuddha,
MN III 70,9*. — 2. of a thera, Ps III 647,2 (Aṅga-
tthero = 'Lomasakaṅgiyo'). — 3. of several kings,
Ja IV 454,10 (Aṅgaraṭṭhe); V 316,13; VI 203,14*,21
(~o nāma Lomapādo Bārāṇasi-rājā). — 4. m. pl. (&
sg.), name of a country or its people (East Behar),
Abh 185, 995; DN I 111,2; II 235,21*; MN I 271,7;
281,2; SN V 225,5; AN I 213,1; IV 252,5; Th 484
(gen.pl. ~āna(ṁ)); Thī 110; Vv 960; Ja V 317,23* ;
VI 274,1*; Dīp I 39 (Aṅgā ca Magadhā ubho); Pj II
599,5; — sg. ~assa rañño, Ja VI 271,29* (rules also
over Magadha, ib. 272,9'; Th 632 (=Bimbisāra).
— Towns and cities of A°: Assapura, Apaṇa (cf. Aṅ-
guttarāpa), (Kāla-) Campā, Bhaddiya. — °~raṭṭha,
n., the kingdom of A°, Jal V 454,10; V 316,12;'vi
256,8; 317,1; Dhp-a I 384,16.—°~rāja(n), m., theking
of A°, MN II 163,8.

m. Npr. of a young brāhmaṇa, a sister's
son of Soṇadaṇḍa, DN I 123,4 (~o nāma māṇavako).

n., a particular kind of deceit in
weighing, Sv 1*79,2 foll. = Ps II 283,4 = Mp II 489,19
(rūpa-kūṭaṁ +, — 'tulā-kūṭaṁ'; explained by the
words: hatthena tulaṁ akkamati, i. e. by pushing the
balance with the hand).

āpī, f.), Npr. of a tank in Ceylon,
MhvLXXIX, 37.

n., rubbing the body, Pj II
265,2 (~atthāya).

n. [ts.], "α (certain) kind [cf. jāti] of
limb", i. e. organs of generation (of either sex), Abh
272 (~aṁ rahassaṅgaṁ); Vin III 20,28 foll.; 36,3 (of
both sexes); the male organ: Vin III 36,10 (opp. ni-
mitta); Vin III 37,11; 38,1; 113,10 (~aṁ kamma-
nīyaṁ hoti); Ja II 359,14 (of a makkaṭa); the female
organ: Vin III 118,15 (mātugāmassa); Vin III 205,33
= Mil 124,21 (bhikkhuniyā); Vin I 191,3 (gāvīnaṁ).

n. [sa. aṅgana], an open space, square,
glade (before a house, in a town, or in a wood), Abh 218;
859 (bhūmibhāge kilese ca male ca, cf. 2aṅgana &
Sadd II 95; Ps 1139,25; Vibh-a 498,9); Vin II 218,2;
Ja I 109,20'; 250,2; 328,7 (in a wood). — Ifc. see:
antonivesana°, Amba°, ākāsa°, Isibhūma°, ud-°,
eka°, cetiya°, tidiva°, Nigrodha-m-°, bodhi-y-°,
Madhu-°, Mahā-°, Mahācetiya°, Mahābodhi-y-°,
Mahi-y-°, Mutiya°, rāja°, vivaṭa°, subha°.

n., dirt (metaph, depravity, etc.); prob,
related to √añj (Sadd II 95, Pischel Gr. § 234 &
Franke DN Trsl. p. 76 n. 7); Abh 859 (see 1aṅgana);
MN I 24,1s foll. (Ps); AN V 92,1β; 94,22; 97,21;
103,25 (rajaṁ vā ~aṁ vā); pl. ~āni, Vibh 368,7
(tīṇi, scil. rāga, dosa, moha: Vibh-a 498,8-15); ~ā
ca upakkilesā ca, Nett 88,1. —- Ifc. see: an-°,
nir-°, sâ°.

m., the verge of an open
glade, Ja II 200,22 (= nuvara-keḷavara, Ja-pota).

m.) Npr. of a village,
Mhv XL 11,'63.

m., Npr. of a thera,
author of Th 219—-21 (in the uddāna: Aṅgaṇiko
Bhāradvājo).
°ifc. v. Culla° (Cūla°).
[see Aṅgaloka.]
[pr. 3 sg., see aggati.]

n. [ts.], a bracelet, Abh 287 (keyūra+);
Ja VI 590,7* (Ct. = aṅgadâbharaṇa, n.); Ps II
46,12 (Se keyūr'-aṅga-mālā-gandhâdi°). — Ifc. v.
citta°, dibba°, pāda°.

mfn., wearing bracelets, m. ~ī, Ja V
9,25* (= dibbaṅgada-samannāgato). aṅgadi

mfn., weak or failing with regard
to (one single) link (point) (during the jhāna), Vism
155.14; 164,22, etc.; Ss 83,33; Abhidh-av 962.
[Ja V 501,1*, read: aṅgaṁ dhanaṁ.]
f., a woman, Abh 230.

n. sg. & pl., one limb after the
other; all the limbs (or parts); MN I 133,37 (aññataras-
miṁ ~e); 365,9 (aññataraṁ ~aṁ); dhanaṁ, yasaṁ,
puttadāram, ~aṁ, Ja I 20,6; ~āni, Jal V 324,1β;
Dhp-a I 390,5; ~esu, Mil 302,13; ~ehi, Mil 303,20;
~ānam, MN I 395,32 (rathassa; sg. ib. 36); Thī-a 288,1.
— 2. mfn., according to Pv-a 158,10: with perfect limbs,
Pv 350. — Ifc. kisa-pharusa-kāḷa°, thūla°, das-
sanīya°, sabba°, suvlsuddha°.
entry.re:
— °-sannivesaaṅga-paccaṅga-sannivesa,
m., junction or connexion of the limbs, susaṇṭhita-
~o, Sv II 298,18.

— °-sampannaaṅga-paccaṅga-sampanna, mfn., perfect in
all limbs, Ja VI 20,25* . Cf. aṅga-m-aṅga.

entry.sense:
mfn., ifc. v. sabba°, sobha-
na-sabba°. aṅga-paccaṅgi

m., sacrificing of a limb (of
one's own), Ja I 25,19 (opp. bāhira-bhaṇḍa-p° &
jīvita-p°).

m., change of factors, As 227,26
(satt-aṭṭha°), 2 7 (~o).

n., enveloping (i. e. protecting
& quieting) by means of one's limbs (as a mother her
child), Ja V 330,7*; 331,21'.

n., instr. ~ena, Ja III
218,24*; 219,3' (= aṅga-sarikkhakena puttena; i.e.
by [sacrificing] a son dear as a limb; but more likely:
'by a limb, by a son, or by my head'). aṅga-putta-sira

(m.), Npr. of a place, Mhv LXX, 130
(cf. sinh. Am-gam(?) EZ I 243, and see Aṅgagāma).
n., the flesh of a limb, Ja III 50,8.

m. pl., the inhabitants
of A. and M., Ja I 87,13; II 211,1; Ps II 264,13; Dhp-a
II 62,1; III 242,10; Vv-a 332,1s; Pv-a 22,3. Aṅga-Magadha-vāsi

n. pl., limb by limb (cf. aṅga-
paccaṅga), ~āni, MN I 129,1β; Vin III 37,35; 119,29;
Vv 425; Pv 348; Ps II 308,3; Mp III 86,6. — °-ânu-
sāri(n), mfn. pl. ~ino vātā, tñe airs which permeate
the limbs, MN I 188,30 (Ps) - 422,31 = Vibh 84,10
(Vibh-a 70,26). Cf. aṅgânusāri(n).

m., = a man from Aṅga-
Magadha, Kacc-v 405; 407 (= Aṅga-Magadhehi
ãgato; Mmd = Àṅga-Magadhesu issaro).

m. [ts.], rouge for the limbs, Vin II
107,25 -30 (~aṁ . . . mukharāgaṁ karonti). — °-mu-
kharāga, m. rouge for the limbs and the face, ib. (Sp).

m. [Amg. Aṅgaloga], Npr. of a coun-
try, Nidd I 155,3; 415,9 (Ed. Aṅgaṇeka; v. I. Bha°).
mfn., = aṅgi(n); ifc. DN III 171,16*. aṅgava

n., the division into aṅgas
(of any given jhāna), Ps II 345,3; 470,3 (: ārammaṇa-
vavatthāna). — °-vavatthāpana, n., fixing the
(number of) jhãnaṅgas, Vism 374,5; 375,15 (:ãram-
maṇa-vavatthāpana).

m., rheumatism, P-assa ~o hoti,
Vin I 205,18 (cured by sedakamma). Cf. pabba-vāta.

mfn., deprived of a limb, mutilated
or deformed, Mp I 408,2. Cf. °-vekalla.

m., bodily defect, Kacc 293 (Kacc-v:
yena aṅgena . . . vikāro lakkhate).

m. [sa. aṅga-vikṣepa], gesture,
Abh 101 (= 'aṅgahãra').

m(fṅ)., conversant with aṅga-vijjā
(q. v.), Kacc-v 354.

f. [sa. aṅga-vidyā], the art how to
know a man's extraction, character, or fortune from
the characteristics of his limbs (cf. 2aṅga (5)), DN I 9,7
(Sv; + vatthu-vijjā, khatta-°, siva-°, bhūta-°,
bhūri-°, ahi-°, visa-°, vicchika-°, mūsika-°, sakuṇa-°,
vāyasa-°, pakka-jjhāna, sara-parittāṇa, miga-cakka);
SN III 239,24 (°-tiracchānavijjā; Spk); ~āya cheko,
Ja I 290,10; II 200,1i (°-ânubhāvena, by the power of
a°); III 122,23; 215,26 (°-vasena); Nidd I 372,21
(Ct.); Pj I 237,2; II 142,10.
entry.re:
— °-pāṭhakaaṅga-vijjā-pāṭhaka, m., an
expert in a°, Ja II 21,18; As 181,7;'Ps III 650,21.
— °-pāṭhakattaaṅga-vijjā-pāṭhakatta, n. abstr., Ja V 458,9.

entry.sense:
n., bodily deformity, Dhp-a II
26,13 (cf. aṅga-vikala).

entry.re:
— °-samkantikaaṅga-samkanti-samkantika, mfn., related to this (samā-
pajjanaṁ), Vism 375,1.

entry.sense:
n. (cf. 2sattha), the science of
prognostication, Sv I 92,11 (= 2aṅga (5)).

mfn., to be compared to a limb,
~ã vācā, Ja III 50,6'.
entry.re:
— °-sadisattaaṅga-sadisa-sadisatta, n. abstr., abl.
~ā, Ja III 50,5'.

entry.sense:
f., the being calm (i. e. imma-
terial) as to its factors [santa, sa. çānta], Mp III
363,1 (ad AN V 11,24; opp. ārammaṇa-santatã; cf.
aṅgavavatthāna, etc.).

mfn., as dear as one's own limbs,
Ja V 325,16' (bhātaro ~ā); VI 297,23' (do.); — as
inseparable as one's own limbs, Pj I 217,12 (thāvaro
jaṅgamo ~o anugāmiko, scil. nidhi); II 28,14 (°dhana,
scil. sippâyatanâdi). — °-samatā, f. abstr., Ja VI
297,23'.

mfn., with perfect limbs, Ap
313,5 (jātimā + ~o).

mfn., like (as dear as) one's
own body, Ja III 219,3' (~ena puttena).

[n., title of more suttas, SN IV, 247;
V 101; 102; 404.

m. [ts.], gesture, Abh 101 (= aṅga-
vikkhepa) ≠ Am-k I 7,16.

mfn. [ts.], deprived of a limb, Vin V
129,12 (addhãna-hīno+, na upasampādetabbā; Sp).

ind., for the sake of a limb of the
body, Ja V 500,28* (caje dhanaṁ).
entry.re:
— °-hetukaaṅga-hetu-hetuka, m. pl.
~ā, name of a certain kind of birds, Ja VI 538,12*.

entry.sense: v. l. for Aṅgati.

m., 'transcending the [jhāna-] fac-
tors', As 209,25* = Vism 338,31* = Abhidh-av 1039.

m(fṅ)., 'pervading the limbs',
name of one of the six airs contained in the human
body Abh [38—-]39 ([uddhaṅgamo, adhogamo], kuc-
chittho, kotthāsayo, assās'-aṅgānusārino ≠ MN I
188,30). aṅgânusāri

m. & n. [ts.], 1. charcoal, burning coal,
Abh 34 (~o); acc. ~aṁ, DN II 166,28 (haratha); MN I
324,14 (akkamitvā); Ja VI 108,4* (phunanti; unmetri-
cal); loc. ~e, Sn 668; Ja III 477,25*; Ja III 467,14 (~e
pakka-maṁsaṁ); m. pl. ~ā, Ja VI 248,18*; Ja I
73,14 (kiṁsuka-vaṇṇā); n. pl. ~āni, AN III 407,12
(ādittāni, etc.); acc. pl. ~e, Dhp-a II 271,2; Ja III
54,26 (dārūni saṁkaḍḍhitvā ~e katvā); Ps II 473,9
(chārikāya ~e pidhāya); gen. pl. ~ānaṁ va jalitaṁ
kāsuṁ sâdhikaporisaṁ, Ja IV 118,20* (cf. MN I 74,11
= 365,17 = SN II 99,28); loc. pl. ~esu pacāpetvā,
Dhp-a III 333,20; Ps III 423,7. — Ifc. v. agada°,
kula°, khadira°, jhāma°, naraka°, nibbuta°,
vīta°, vītaccika°. — 2., the planet Mars, see aṅgāra-
vāra & aṅgãraka.

m. [ts.], the planet Mars (of red colour,
cf. prec.), Sv I 95,8 (°âdi-). — (2) = aṅgāra, cf.
aṅgāraka-pakka, aṅgāraka-vassa.

n., a pot or pan for burning coal,
SN II 260,15 (sapattiṁ ~ena okiri); ~e aggiṁ katvā,
Sv I 261,6; Pj II 355,10.

mfn., fried on burning coal,
Spk III 86,19, quoted Ss 78,36 (tittira-maṁsaṁ). Cf.
aṅgāra-(pakka)-maṁsa.

m., a charcoal-burner,
Ja VI 209,25' (= 'aṅgārika').

m. n., rain or shower of burning
coal, Ja I 73,14 (~aṁ samuṭṭhāpesi, scil. Māro). Cf.
aṅgāra-vassa.

f., a charcoal-pit (with burning
coal), Sn 396 (~uṁ jalitaṁ); Th 420; Vin III 20,32
(Sp); MN I 74,12 (~u sâdhikaporisã) = 365,16 =
SN II 99,27 (Ps I 211,24) = IV 188,23 (cf. Ja IV
118,20*); — MN I 244,29 (~uyā santāpeyyuṁ) =
II 193,19 (cf. I 507,8) = AN III 380,16 = SN IV
56,31; — Ja I 233,5 (~uyā taṭe ṭhatvā); Ja VI 107,33*
(~uṁ p(h)unanti, cf. 108,4*) quoted Ps II 49,18*, Spk II
143,19*, Sp-ṭαdSpI 220,20; Thī-a 256,10 (='inghāla-
khū', q. v.); loc. ~uyã, ~uyaṁ, (and °-matthake),
Dhp-a I 442,11; 443,18-23; (pU) ~ū, Pj II 334,22.
— jalita-°, f., amass of burning coal, Ja IV 118,25';
paditta-°, f., do. Saddh 208. — °-sadisa, mfn., like
a mass of burning coal, Thī 491 (~ā kāmā). — °-upa-
ma, mfn., do., pl. ~ā (kāmā), SN IV 189,4 (Spk); MN
I 130,28 ≠ Ja V 210,9; MN I 365,26 = AN III 97,7;
AN IV 224,15 = V 175,7. — °-ūpamā, f., the simile
of ~, (as in SN II 99,27), Ps I 211,24; 213,3; Vism
341,18 (°ūpamena, cf., Aggikkhandhūpamā). aṅgāra-kāsū

m., v. l. for next (cf. aṅgāra-
puṇṇa-kūpa).

m., only loc. ~e (cf. gabbha),
amidst the burning coal, Ja III 55,1 (v. l. aṅgāra-kūpe).
entry.re: — °-gabbhakaaṅgāra-gabbha-gabbhaka, mfn., Cp I 10,14 (citakaṁ).

entry.sense:
n.(?) or aṅgāra-citā, /'., a pyre
of burning coal, Ja V 491,16 (the text is corrupt; per-
haps we ought to read: aṅgāra-citāyaṁ maṁ sūlaṁ
tacchantaṁ passati, for °citakaṁ maṁsa-sūlaṁ?).

mfn., turned (hot) like burning coal,
~ā paṭhavī, Ja III 447,15* (= vītaccikaṅgāraṁ viya
uṇha-jãtā).

m., a tope for embers (from the
Buddha's funeral pyre), DN II 167,20; Bv XXVIII,4.

mfn., roasted on a coal fire,
Vibh-a 470,28 (maṁsaṁ); Ss 53,22 (from Spk; cf.
aṅgāraka-pakka & aṅgāra-maṁsa).

f., a charcoal-basket, Dhp-a IV
191,4 (~iyaṁ kāko viya ahosi).

m., a mountain of (burning)
coal, AN I 141,17 (~aṁ ādittaṁ, etc.) = MN III 167,3
= 183,13, quoted Kv 597,29; — name of a hell, Mil
303,24; Saddh 195; — Ps II 18,19 (~aṁ āropeti);
— °-âropana, n., overheaping with ~, Pv-a 221,12.
m„ a lump of coal, Vism 172,2.

m., a pit filled with
burning coal, Sp I 220,21 (= 'aṅgāra-kāsu'; Sp-ṭ).

m., the state of being coal, Dhp-a
III 71,7 (suvaṇṇaṁ ~aṁ, scil. ãpajjati).

mfn., 'like charcoal' (said of de-
generated members of a family), Pj II 192,13 (na ime
amhākaṁ puttā, dujjātā ete kulassa ~ā); Dhp-a
III 350,3 (f. kulassa ~ā). Cf. kulaṅgāra.
n., roasted meat, Mhv X 16.

m. (or f.), soot, Dhp-a III 309,19
= Vv-a 67,22 (°-makkhita, mfn., smeared with ~).

n., the fixing of
(new) links and objects (during a jhāna), Vism 375,20.

f., passing over to
(new) links and objects (during a jhãna), Vism 374,4.
— °~ika, mfn., relating to that, ib. 375,10.

m., a heap or mass of burning coal,
Sp I 220,21 (= 'aṅgāra-kāsu'); Ja I 107,25 (~i viya
unhã, scil. °-vālikā); Ja III 55,14 (~imhi pati);
(Dhp-a II 271,2, v. l.).

m. n., a shower of burning coal,
Pj II 224,21 (~aṁ samuṭṭhāpesi); Vism 376,10
(Mārena ~e pavattite). Cf. aṅgāraka-vassa.

m., the week-day named after the
planet Mars (see aṅgāra (2)) i. e. Tuesday, (Childers
s. v. vāro, on Subhūti's authority).

m., a charcoal-burner, Ja VI 206,27*
(= aṅgāra-kamma-kara).

mfn. [ts.], having limbs; gen. ~ino,
Kacc-v 293 (vikāro). —> Ifc. v. catur-°, sam-°, cf.
aṅga-paccaṅgi(n). — See aṅginī, f. aṅgi

(or aṅgiya), mfn., ifc. having (a number
of) limbs or parts (= °fo/d), v. aṭṭha°, eka°, kat'-°,
catur-°, ti-v-°, dasa°, du-v-°, dva°, pañca°.
[Sv I 313,33, read aṅgato.]

f. (adj.) = aṅga-laṭṭhi-sampannā (q. v.),
Thl-a 226,11 (in a corrupt passage). Cf .kā]aṅgmī,Thī 297.

m. Npr. [sometimes_spelt Aṅgirasa,
but always scanned - - ˇ ≃ ; sa. Aṅgirasa], 1. of
the Buddha, Abh 1 ; Th 536; Vin I 25,32* (-i-); DN
III 196,7* (Sakya-putta); SN I 196,3* = Th 1252;
SN I 81,15* (= Sammāsambuddha, Spk) — AN III
239,25* (Mp: Bhagavato aṅgamaṅgehi rasmiyo niccha-
ranti, tasmā ~o ti vuccati; cf. Pv-a 122,12), quoted
Ja I 116,14* = Dhp-a I 244,5* = MpI 230,16* =
Vism 388,3*; cf. Ap 104,19. — 2. of an old sage (isi,
tāpasa), Abh 109 (one of the ten Rishis, authors of the
Veda, Atthaka +): DN I 104,14 (-i-, Atthaka +) =
238,22 - MN II 169,30 = 200,6 = AN III 224,6 =
229,30 = Vin I 245,21 (-i-); — Ja VI 99,29* (among
eleven old sages, Yāmahanu+);— ~aṁ Gotamaṁ,
Ja V 1.44,1* (against him king Ajjuna sinned, cf. ib.
135,24 & 1.45,7' (etymology)). — 3. of an old phy-
sician, Mil 272,11 (Nārada +). — 4. of Asayha-setthi,
Pv 270, 275 (Pv-a 124,8). — 5. of a mythical king,
Mhv II 4 (v. l. Bhagīratha, cf. Aṅgīsa).

f. [sa. Āṅgirasī], a woman of the
Aṅgiras-tribe, DN II 265,19* (= Bhaddā suriyavac-
casā, daughter of Timbaru; Sv).

m. Npr. of a king (cakkavatti), Dip III 6
(~o nāma khattiyo; reading doubtful, Oldenberg sug-
gests Bhagīraso, against metre, cf. Mhv II 4).

m. [sa. aṅguṣṭha], the thumb (or the
great toe), Abh 266 (~o, etc. see aṅgulī); Vin III 34,34;
119,8; MN II 261,8; Mil 230,1. — Ifc. v. pāda°,
hattha°.

m. = prec. Pj I 159,9 (~ato c'assa
khīraṁ nibbatti). — Ifc. v. pāda°.

f., counting on the fingers,
Ja I 462,11 (ahaṁ ~aṁ jānāmi); 462,22'. Cf.
aṅguṭṭhi-gaṇanā.

n., a mark or impression of a
thumb, ~àṁ, AN IV 127,8 - SN III 154,29 (v. l.
°pāda).

m., the moistness of the thumb,
~ena yāpesi rattiṁ, Pv 445 (cf. Pv-a 198,4 and Pj
I 150,9; he supported life during the night by the mi-
raculous milk of his thumb).

f. = aṅguṭṭha-gaṇanā, Ja I
462,21* (n' ~aṁ yāti; Ct.), see, however, naṅguṭṭha.

(in comp., from aṅga + uttara, q. v.),
one link (or subject) more, see next &. — n. = Aṅgut-
tara-nikāya, Sp 127,20*; As 25,30*;Mp 13,3* (°-nissita).

f., the commentary on the
Aṅguttara-Nikāya, i. e. Manoratha-pūraṇī (q. v.), Ja
I 131,23'; Vism 315,24; Sās 11,31; Ss 30,32; quoted
(ɔ: Mp I 283,18) by Th-a ad Th 201-2.

m. scil. nipāta, the 1st book
of AN., Ss 21,28; 49,31; 115,6. — °-vannanā, f., its
Ct, Ss 44,6 (Aṅgottara-°).

f., the Ct. on
the 3rd book of AN., Ss 50,30.

f., the Ct. on the
2nd book of AN., Ss 32,5.'

m., title of the fourth division
(the 'add-one' division) of the Sutta-piṭaka; as the
name indicates, the numerical system commands its
subdivision, cf. the Ekuttaraka, Vin V 115-141, the
Saṅgīti- and Dasuttara-suttanta, DN III 207-71,
272-93 (see also AN V p. VII); it comprises 11 books
(nipātā: Eka-°, Duka-°, etc.) or 169 sections (vaggā)
containing about 2344 chapters (suttāni, suttantā);
this is at variance with the old tradition, which says
that the whole work contains 9557 suttas: Sp I 27,20*;
As 25,29-30*; AN V 361,10-ii*; Sv I 23,21-22* (cf. ib.
17,9); Mp I 3,8-9*; Pj I 12,6; Gv 56,29-3i*; — it is
also quoted under the name Ekuttara-nikāya, Mil
362,17, or Ekuttarika-n° (cf. Vyu 65,97) Mil 392,2,
or only Ekuttarika, As 1.5,26; Ekuttariya, As 9,27;
— cf. also Sv I 15,11; 22,30; Mhbv 94,16 (vīsati-
bhāṇavāra-sata-parimāṇaṁ ~aṁ). —- Quotations from
AN are found e. g. Ja I 148,29 (AN I 24.28); Ja I
228,24 (Velāma[ka]sutta, IV 392); Kv (see Transl.
Index I); Nett (see Appendix IV), etc. etc. — Quota-
tions in AN: I 133,6 (Pārāyana Punnaka-pañha);
I 134,9 (do. Udaya-pañha); III 399,22 = 401,23
(do. Metteyya-pañha); IV 449,8* (SN I 48,31*);
V 46,21* = 47,26* (Kumāri-pañhā, SN I 126,14*);
V 54,27—58,6 (Mahāpañhā, AN V 48—54 ; cf. Khp
Kumāra-pañha). —- Allusion to ancient history:
AN III 57,22 (Muṇḍassa rañño Bhaddā devī).
— The Ct. on AN is Manoratha-pūraṇī (Mp) by Bud-
dhaghosa, Gv 59,23 ; 68,18; sub-Ct.s (ṭīkā) are: Lī-
nattha-pakāsinī by Dhammapāla (pt), Gv 60,12, Sārat-
tha-mañjūsā by Sāriputta (t), Gv 61,32; 71,12 (cf. Sās
33,22). — Ed.s: London 1885—1900 (AN I—V);
I—VII, Colombo 1893—1900 (do. I, ib. 1901).
— Trsls: by Nyānatiloka, vol. I, Leipzig 1907; Sinhalese
transl. of the gāthās, Welitara 1907; Ambalangoḍa
1908; — Mss.: Westergaard, Catalogus p. 28; JPTS
'82 p. 33, 48, 60, 72; '83 p. 139; '88 p. 109; '96 p. 23,
29.
entry.re:
— °-aṭṭhakathāAṅguttara-nikāya-aṭṭhakathā, f., Commentary on AN (i. e.
Manoratha-pūraṇī), Sās 30,17; 73,10. — °-pāli, f.,
the text of AN (opp. aṭṭhakathā), Sās 148,15.

entry.sense:
m. scil. nipāta, the 5th book
of AN; Ss 44,10 (Aṅgottara-°); 63,34; °-vanṇanā,
f., its Ct; Ss 60,24.
f., Ct. on AN, Ss 30,36.

mfn., collected or con-
tained in the AN; AN V 361,11* (~ā, scil. suttantā).

m., = Aṅguttara-nikāya (cf.
āgama), Mp 11,12* (°-vara); 3,4-9*.

[nikāya], m., = Aṅguttara-nikāya,
Pj I ll,21*.

n. [ts.], 1. a finger or toe, only ifc. for
aṅgulī, Mogg-v III 52. — 2. a finger as measure,
a finger's breadth, an inch, Abh 195 (= 7 dhaññamāsā);
Vibh-a 343,28 (satta-dhaññamāsa-ppamāṇaṁ ekaṁ
~aṁ); Abhidh-av 1066. — Ifc. [a]ṅgula, v. aṭṭha°,
eka°, eka-dva°, catur-°, ti-v-a°, tettiṁsa°, dva°
(duva°), nir-°, pañca°, vaṁka°, sugata°, soḷasa°.
Cf. aṅgulí, ifc.

m., 'inch-time', i. e. the moment
when the shadow shows the length of an inch (which
is measured by means of a kāla-tthambha), Ps I 122,21
(cf. 24). Cf. dvaṅgula-kāla.

n. (aṅguli + agga), finger-tip;
ten'eva ~ena taṁ ~aṁ parāmaseyya, untraced quota-
tion in Sp I 173,8 =: Mp I 124,21 — Ps I 136,29 =
Sv I 235,33; cf. Ps III 497,9.

n. (aṅguli + antara), the interval
of the toes, Sv II 501,8 (ad Vin IV 201,17; chattadaṇ-
ḍake ~aṁ appavesetvā).

f. (aṅguli + antarikā), the space
between the fingers, Pj I 246,5; Mil 180,6 (udakaṁ
pāṇinā gahitaṁ~āhi paggharati); Vin III 39,24 (~āya
ghaṭṭehi); Sp ad Vin I 91,1i.

n., the breadth of one aṅgula
(q. v.), acc. ~aṁ (adv.), As 84,33; aṅgula-dvaṅgula-
caturaṅgula-mattaṁ niccharati (scil. khajjopanakassa
ābhā), Ps III 253,11.

f. [ts.] a finger, Abh 266 (pañca ~ī:
aṅguṭṭho, tajjanī, majjhimā, anāmikā, kaniṭṭhā);
~ī chijjatha, Th 1055 quoted Mil 395,12*; ~iṁ jāletvā,
Dhp-a III 322,2 ≠ Vin II 76,24 (~iyā jalamānāya,
with his finger for a light, cf. Dhp-a II 59,2l); ~iṁ
gahetvā vicaranto, Dhp-a IV 211,10 (a boy holding
his father's finger); instr. ~iyā sāyi (tasted with his
finger), DN III 85,20; loc. Dhp-a II 86,18; ~iyā pīḷiya-
mānāya, Dhp-a IV 69,20 (as the sore point, cf. ruja-
naka-°); pl. ~ī poṭhesuṁ, DN II 96,22 (snapped their
fingers, = aṅguliṁ cālesum, Sv); dve ~iyo ukkhi-
pitvā, Ja I 56,9 (indicating two alternatives); ~iyo
dukkhā bhavissanti, Vin I 77,18; instr. ~īhi, Sn
610; gen. ~īnam, MN II 98,2. Cf. aṅgula. — Ifc. v.
agga°, addha°, eka°, kaniṭṭha°, cūla°, dasa°,
dīgha°, pāda° rujanaka-°, vaṁka°, vaṭṭa°. aṅguli

mfn., doing something with the fingers,
Kacc-v 352 (cf. Mogg IV 30). — Ifc. for aṅguli v.
pañca°, vicitra-vaṭṭa°. — aṅgulikā, f. dim. of
aṅguli, Sp ad Vin I 71,34.

n., the flesh of the finger-
tip, Vism 251,2* = Vibh-a 233,30.

m., a thimble, Vjb ad Vin II
117,7 (= 'paṭiggaha').

mfn., whose fingers are cut off,
Vin I 91,10 (Sp).

m. n., tickling with the fingers;
Vin IV 110,32 = III 84,21 (bhikkhum ~ena hāsesum);
IV lll,1-10 (Sp: aṅguli-patodako ti aṅgulīhi upakac-
châdi-ghaṭṭanam); DN I 91,17 (aññam-aññam ~ena
samjagghantā samkīḷantā) ≠ AN IV 343,4 (aṅguli-
paṭodakena (Ed. ~ehi); = aṅguli[m] patodalaṭṭhim
katvā vijjhanena, Mp III 320,16). — °-sikkhāpada,
n., title of Pācittiya 52 (Vin IV 110—11).

n., a mark or impression of a finger,
SN III 154,30 (~āni) - AN IV 127,8.

entry.re:
— °-temana-mattaaṅguli-pabba-temana-matta, mfn., so
much as to wet a joint of a toe, MN I 187,36 (udakam)
= AN IV 102,10 (Ed. omits °temana-, but see v. l.).

entry.sense:
n., the flesh on the upper
side of the fingers,Vism 251,3 = Vibh-a 233,31 (°piṭṭhi°).

m., clapping the hands, acc. pl.
~e, Ja V 67,16 (pavattesi); °-sahassāni, Ja III 348,8
(paribbhamimsu).
entry.re:
— °-poṭhanaaṅguli-poṭha-poṭhana, n., [sa. °sphoṭana,
Amg. °phoḍana] id., Ja I 394,24'; Thī-a 76,15 (°-mat-
tam pi kālam; cf. accharāsamghāta).

entry.sense:
n., a finger's breadth, Dhp-a IV
210,9, (cf. aṅgula-matta).

mfn., of a finger's measure, Mhv
XXVIII, 14.

m., Npr. of a robber, brāhmaṇa by
caste (MN II 104,13; Gaggo Mantāniputto ib. 102,8),
who became an arhat at Sāvatthi; author of Th 866
—-891; etymology MN II 98,2 (aṅgulīnaṁ mālaṁ
dhāreti); his real name was Ahiṁsaka, Th 879; Ps III
305,4 (his biography, ib. 304—319). — MN II 97,25
(coro, luddo lohitapāṇi); 101,23 (āyasmā); Vin I
74,26 (coro ~o bhikkhūsu pabbajito hoti); Ja IV
180,22 (pharusaṁ ~aṁ arahatte patiṭṭhāpesi);
— Ja VI 329,24 (~âdayo core, cf. Mhv XXX, 84; Mhbv
83,3); Pj II 202,15; 440,β; Dhp-a II 41,8; — in
former births: Ja l 275,30; III 330,8; V 36,5; 511,20;
— °-tthera, Ja V 456,19; Dhp-a III 185,15; Mp II 141,2.
— °-ttherassa vatthu, Dhp-a III 169—70; IV 231—32.

m., Npr. s=e prec. Ap 47,25
(Upāli's apadāna, but in Mil 410,7 ascribed to Sāri-
putta) & Th-a ad Th 249—51 ≠ Dhp-a I 146,14* ≠
Ps II 521,9* (corassa °~mālino). Cf. Pj II 202,15.

n., name of an apocryphal
text (of the Rājagiriya school, see Nikāya-s 9,10),
Spk II 253,16 (ad SN II 224,11).

n., title of MN (ch. 86) II
97—105;
entry.re:
— °-suttantaAṅgulimāla-sutta-suttanta, m., Dhp-a III 169,15.
— °-sutta-vaṇnanā, f., its Ct., Ja V 456,20. (Ms.
JPTS '82 p.'32; Ed. with Sinh. trsl. Colombo 1891).

entry.sense: m. — Aṅgulimāla, Ps II 521,9*. Aṅgulimāli

f. [sa. aṅguli-mudrā], a seal-
ring, Abh 287.
entry.re:
— °-muddikāaṅguli-muddā-muddikā, f. [sa. °-mudrikã],
id., Vin II 106,36 (na dhāretabbā); Ja I 121,27;
134,1s; III 416,10; IV 298,9; V 439,27; 467,2; Ps II
261,17 (pl. ~ā); Pj II 138,3 (pl. ~āyo).

entry.sense: f., mark of a finger, Sp II 420,16.

m., gesture of the fingers,
As 299,28 (hattha-pāda°+).

n., bending the fingers, Mil
352,25.

n.(?), a (little, spiral) finger-
ring(7), °-saṇṭhāna, mfn., shaped like that, As 310,23
= Abhidh-av p. 66,22 (°-veṭhaka-) = Vism 446,5.

f., a braided finger-chain (?),
Ps II 113,7.

n., snapping the fingers,
Sv I 256,28.

n. [ts.], a finger-ring, Abh 286
(= aṅgulyābharaṇa).

n. (cf. prec.) a finger-ornament,
Ja II 444,7' (pañcahi suvaṇṇehi kataṁ, = 'nikkham').

n. (aṅguli + ābharaṇa), =
'aṅgulīyaka', Abh 286.

[Sv I 93,18 read with pt Abbheyya or
Ambheyya.]

f. (abstr. from 2aṅga + olārika),
materiality as to (some) jhānaṅgas, Vism 327,16, cf.
ib. 155,14.

mfn., making blind, depriving
of insight, SN V 97,17 (andha-karaṇa + ; but = paññā-
cakkhussa akaraṇā, Spk); AN I 216,20; It 82,10.

mfn., bad for the eyes, AN III
250,19 (~aṁ; = na cakkhūnaṁ hitaṁ, cakkhu-
visuddhiṁ na karoti, Mp) = Vin II 137,30; — AN
III 256,14 (~o, scil. aggi); Vin II 148,27 (vihārā
avātapānakā ~ā [i. e. dark] duggandhā).

m., a place not good for walking,
Th 1174 (~aṁ jimha-pathaṁ ku-maggaṁ).

mfn., not shaking; steady, considerate;
Ja VI 293,32 (~ena suṭṭhu ṭhapitena cittena).

n., absence of rudeness (or violence),
Dhs § 1341; °-lakkhaṇa, mfn., having the character-
istic of this, ~o (adoso), As 127,22.

mfn., 'not looking up to
the moon', Sadd III (Ce 778,38): ~āni mukhãni. [Cf.
sa. a-sūryam-paçya].

mfn., notwanlon, not inconsiderate (esp.
in speech), MN I 32,18 (anuddhata, anunnaḷa, + amu-
khara, avikiṇṇavāca) = AN III 199,10 ≠ AN I 70,11;
MN I 470,10 (anuddhata +); Ja V 203,28* (~aṁ assa
bhāsitaṁ; patiṭṭhitatāya ~aṁ, ib. 206,24'); Ja VI
293,28* (anuddhato + ~o = amaṇḍana-sīla), bor-
rowed Jināl 244 (accapalo [ - ˇ ˇ - ], v. l. appacalo).

[cf. carati, aor.), title of a Sutta, SN
II 171—2 (cf. 177, uddāna).]

mfn., not subsequent, not last; apub-
baṁ ~aṁ: AN I 28,1 ^z£ DN II 225,5; Pp 13,26 ; Mil
40,30 ; Dhp-a I 12,17 (simultaneously).

mfn. [ts.}, 1. immovable, unshakable, ~ā
diḍḍha-selā, Ja VI 212,26* (pabbatā); AN IV 109,6
(esikā gambhīra-nemā ...+); DN III 177,12 (w. r. for
akhila, q. v.); Ja VI 546,6* (yāna-nāvā); ~aṁ sukhaṁ,
Th 264; Ud 93,26*; SN I 232,23*; Thī 350; ~aṁ
ṭhānaṁ, Vv 591; ~ā hi sā pabbajjā, mahatī accug-
gatā, Mil 164,11 (with allusion to 'pabbata', = like
a mountain); Pj II 146,27-28 (+ asithila, etc.).
— 2. m., a mountain, Abh 605. — Ifc. v. kulâcala,
calâcala, samaṇa-m-acala.
m. Npr. of a thera, Dip XIX,8.

n. Npr. of a sacred place, Dhp-a
III 515,2 (App. ad p. 225).

f. [sa. acala-dhṛti], name of the
metre ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ Vutt 37.

mfn., who has reached the state of
firmness, according to Mp in an-abhisitta-m-°, not
anointed and confirmed (?), AN II 87,2 (rañño jeṭṭho
putto).

m., the serenity of firmness (of
mind), ~ena sampanno, Mp III 400,19 (= 'avecca-
ppasanno'. AN V 120,13) ≠ Sv II 327,2.

mfn., preserving the equilibrium
of his mind, Mil 300,26 (ṭhita-dhammo+).

mfn., firm by nature, Ja VI
296,9' (= 'niyato').

mfn., immovable, Ja V 454,10* (Nibbā-
naṁ); 455,33' (= kilesehi akampitaṁ); Nidd I 353,11
(samuddo, anerito +; = na kampito, Ct.).

mfn., not subject tore-birth,
SN I 142,13 = MN I 326,9 = Ja III 358,22.

mfn. [ts.], without understanding, Ja IV
254,3* (sabbo loko para-citte ~o); senseless, ~aṁ
kaliṅgara-kaṇḍaṁ, Ja III 273,19 (Cks ~aṁ apitta-
kaṁ, cf. Rt sit-pit næti = 'acetana', Dhp-a II 249,12);
opp. sa-cittaka, ib. 20.

mfn., without mind, senseless, uncon-
scious, Mil 77,28; Dhp-a II 142,8; Ja IV 58,3' ( =
'aceta(s)') ; Dhp-a III 356,21 (= 'acetasā') ; Ps II
493,6; III 49,13; °-kāla, m., the time of uncon-
sciousness, Ps II 493,4; °-saraṇa-gamana, n., taking
the refuge without consciousness (before the birth),
Ps III 303,20; °-âpatti, f., unconscious offence, Ps
II 540,21, —- Cf. sa-cittaka.

m(fn.), (having) a body without
intelligence, Ja VI 210,1' (an-indriya-baddhaṁ ~aṁ
= 'a-sañña-kāya').

mfn., not in the power of the
mind, controlling the mind, Ps II 345,17 (cittaṁ
attano vase vattetvā).

mfn., thoughtless and dis-
tracted, Mil 308,28 .

mfn. (cf. citti-karoti), disregarded,
discarded, considered insignificant, despised, Vin IV
6,17' (oñāta + ; = agarukata, Sp); Mil 288,14 (do.);
DN II 356,2 (~aṁ dānaṁ; see asakkaccaṁ) ≠ MN III
22,20 (abs. acitti-katvā) ≠ AN III 171,30 (do., v. l.
acittiṁ katvã; = acittīkārena agārava-vasena, Mp).

m. (cf. prec), disregard, Vibh 371,9
(Vibh-a 499,30); Mp III 63,11. —- °-kata, mfn., Nidd I
228,12, etc. (= bahumānakiriyā-rahita, Ct.).

mfn., not thinking (or sorrowing),
Pj II 82,21 (nâhaṁ cintemi, ~o 'mhi jāto).
mfn., unimaginable, Pj II 154,16.

mfn. [ts.], never thought of, °-pubbaṁ
(before), Dhp-a III 71,1 (adiṭṭha-assuta-°).

mfn. [sa. a-cintya], — acintanīya,
Vv 972; Sp I 89,8*; Mil 189,1; = °-ânubhāva, mfn.,
Vv-a 340,25 (of unimaginable magnificence, v. l. acin-
teyya°).

mfn. = do., ~āni (cattāri), AN II
80,15 (Mp); Dhp-a II 199,3 (cf. 288,11 = Mp ad AN
II 80,15: cintetuṁ ayuttāni, na cintetabbāni).
— a-cinteyyatta, n. abstr., Mp ib.

mfn., who has lately
attained arhatship, SN I 196,8.

mfn., lately built, navaṁ ~aṁ
(santhāgāraṁ), SN IV 182,16 (= adhunā nitthāpitaṁ,
Spk) = MN I 353,21.

mfn., of no long permanence,
Ja V 507,28* (an-addhaneyya +, scil. vāri (thale
vaṭṭaṁ)).

mfn., lately gone away, Sn
p. 124,23 (~assa Kokāliyassa = pakkantassa sato
naciren' eva, Pj); SN I 153,27 (~e Devadatte = naci-
rass' eva gate); MN I 68,6 (imasmā dhammavinayā);
II 253,26 (gāmā, abl.); AN IV 360,25; SN V 346,6.

mfn., who has lately entered
the fraternity; navako ~o, SN I 185,7; navo ~o adhu-
nāgato imaṁ dhamma-vinayaṁ, Vin I 40,20, quoted
Dhp-a I 92,11; pl. MN I 458,1; AN III 138,11; ~ānaṁ
bhikkhūnaṁ, Dhp-a III 424,2.

mfn., having lately attained
Nibbāna, Sn p. 59,17 (scil. Nigrodhakappa); SN V
