163,27 (scil. Sāriputta-Moggallānā); MN III 7,14 (scil.
Bhagavā); DN I 204,3 (do.; Sv, pt, at).

f. [sa. acira-prabhā], lightning,
Abh 48.

m. Npr. of a novice (sāmaṇera),
MN III 128,10 foll. (~o samaṇuddeso); also called
Aggivessana, ib. n foll.

f. [sa. Ajirăvatī, Pāṇ VI 3,119; c:j,
cf. aggiparijita, vijeyya: viceyya] Npr. of a river (prob,
the present Rāptī), Abh 682 (one of the five great
rivers, acirarḥ sīgham gamanam etissam atthī ti A.,
Abh-sūci); SN II 135,2 (Gaṅgā+); V 38—40 (do.);
AN IV 101,6 (do.); V 22,19 (etc. do.); Vin II 237,35
(do.); Mil 87,13 (do., quoted As 142,25); Pj II 439,20
(do); DN I 235,6 (on its shore the village Manasākaṭa
in the Kosala-country); AN III 402,15 (Daṇḍakappaka,
do.); Vin I 191,1 (at Sāvatthī); Vin III 63,17; IV
111,33; 259,33; Ja I 418,8; II 96,5; 366,2; III 137,8;
IV 167,3 (°-tīre); Pj II 19,11; 308,4; 511,5 (°nadī-
tīre); Dhp-a I 336,9; II 264,4 (°-nadim); III 449,22;
IV 41,2; 87,3; 160,7; Thī-a 54,6; Vv-a 248,17.
— °-tittha, n., a ferry place on the A., Ja III 228,8.

mfn., who has lately seceded
from the Saṁgha, f. ~ā, Vin IV 216,8.

mfn., who has lately got up
(after a sickness), DN II 99,15 (Bhagavā gilānā
vuṭṭhito ~o gelaññā) - SN V 153,3; Ja V 424,15.

(abl.) ind. [sa. acirāt], soon, shortly;
Ja VI 153,27* (= a-cirena).

(instr.) ind. [sa. acireṇa], = 'acirā',
Ja VI 154,17'; 573,14'. Cf. nacirena.

m(fn)., who has not a monk's dress
(cf. cīvara), ~o, Vin I 90,18 (na upasampādetabbo).

mfn. [ts.], unconscious, senseless;
(and rarely: thoughtless); MN I 296,8 (kaṭṭham; Ps);
Mil 96,10 (aggikkhandho); 97,11 (vāyodhātu); 173,4
(rukkho); 179,8 (mahā-pathavī); 268,5 (opp. sa-
cetana); Ja VI 311,9 (rukkho); Ja III 24,1*, quoted
Mil 172,24*; Ja I 46,18*-20 (for -âbhãva read acetana-
bhāva m., = the being unconscious); Dhp-a II 249,12
(opp. sa-cetana; = sit-pit næti, Rt); Ja III 92,7*
(ajānanatāya ~am, Ct.); VI 210,1'; Thī 453 (bālā
duppaññā ~ā; Thī-a); Vibh-a 57,20 etc. [Ja VI
12,27', misprint for acetaso, Ck].

mfn. [ts.], — prec. (or subst, n.); instr.
~asã, Ja IV 57,5* (= acittakena, ib. 58,3').

mfn., = acetana, Dhp 248 (v. r. for
asaññata, Dhp-a III 356,21 = acittaka); Ja V 66,12*
(mūḷho ~o); VI 12,24* (mūgo pakkho ~o; = acit-
tako); SN I 198,30* (appapaññaṁ ~am; Spk =
kāraṇa-jānana-samatthena cittena rahitaṁ).

mfn. [a + cetasika, q. v.], uncon-
scious, 'automatic', 'not involved in the life of sense',
Dhs p. 5,12 and §§584, 1190, 1513 (dhammā ~ā);
Kv 433,29 (sīlam ~aṁ; Kv-a); Vibh 12,24; 67,5.

m. = acela; Abh 440, 1110; Vin IV
92,4**, 8'; Ja V 18,25'(= 'acela');pZ.~ā,Dhp-a I 400,13;
Ja III 246,18; Dhp-a III 489,17 (apaṭicchannehi ~ehi);
— Dhp-a I 309,3 (+ ājīvako, nigaṇṭhako, tāpaso);
Ja VI 229,7' (Kassapa-gotta); Mil 201,30 (Kāram-
bhiyo, cf. Ja V 86,2* & Karambiya-°, ib. 76,28 ); — adj.
~o hoti muttâcāro hatthâpalekhano, MN I 307,23 =
342,25 = 412,4 = II 161,26 = DN I 166,2 (Sv; tt); III
40,27 = AN I 295,8 = II 206,7; do. pl. MN I 238,15 (cf.
AN III 384,5: scil. Nando Vaccho, Kiso Saṅkicco,
Makkhali Gosālo); — nâhaṁ ~assa °-mattena sāmañ-
ñaṁ vadāmi, MN I 281,33. — °-laddhi, f., the doc-
trine of the naked ascetics, Ps III 254,4. — °-vagga,
m., title of AN I 295—299; Vin IV 91—108; V 19—21;
39_40. — °-vāda, m. = °-laddhi, Ja III 246,19.
— °-sāvaka, m., a lay devotee of the A.s, pl. ~ā, AN
III 384,2 (gihī odātavasanā+). — °-sikkhāpada,
n. = Pācittiya 41 (Vin IV 91—92).

m., Npr. of a naked ascetic,
converted by the Buddha, DN I 161,3 foll, (acelo Kas-
sapo); MN III 124,28 foll. (Mp I 310,1); SN II 19,3
foll.; IV 300,8 foll. Cf. Kassapa.

[n., title of SN II 18—22; IV
300—02.

m., not a thief, Ja I 385,16; °-bhāva, m.
abstr. ib. 386,13. — a-corikā, adj. f., Vv 295 (cf. v. r.).

mfn., not to be carried off by
thieves, Khp VIII 9 (nidhi, v. l. a-cora-haraṇa, Pj I
224,20, cf. App. p. 255); Mil 320,30 (duppasaho+,
scil. ākāso).

prp. ati before vowels except î, (cf. ajjh-°,
anv-°, pacc-°); thus [with 2_3a] = acca-°: accaya;
in words of more than 3 syllables we find accā-°:
accābhikkhaṇa, accāsana, accāhita (accāyika, accā-
sarā); accūpasevati; cf. ty-āhaṁ, khv-āhaṁ.
Rem. acc, as an independent word, in the v. r.
acc-āyaṁ to Ja III 334,22* (quoted Dhp-a III 141,18),
is given as pratīka in the form accā ti, Ja III 335,3',
[like iccā ti, Nidd I 139,26].

acc-a-gā, acc-a-guṁ, aor. v.
[atigacchati].

mfn., lit. 'beyond the hook', i. e.
who does not care for the hook, ~o nāgo, DN II 266,5*
(= aṁkusaṁ atīto, Sv).

n. [sa. atyaṅgula], more than one
inch, Mogg-v III 44 (cf. Kāçikā ad Pãṇ V 4,86).

[3. sg. (√acc, sa. arcati), to honour, praise,
worship; inf. accituṁ, Ja VI 180,15'; pp. accita, see
also [2acceti].

n. [sa. arcana], praising, worshipping,
Dhātum 54 (= √acc). Ifc. v. deva°.

f. [sa. arcana], homage, worship, Abh 425
(~ā pūjā).

(mfn.) [sa. atyanta] 1. absolute;
— perpetual, uninterrupted (cf. ekaṁsa, ekanta, parama,
etc.). — 2. n. (subst.1}) 'the absolute', i. e. Nibbāna,
Ja V 454,10* (against metre for accutaṁ(?), but already
ib. 455,32' — antâtītaṁ avināsa-dhammakaṁ); Mp
III 432,19; Mil 413,25 (w. r. see accanta-suññatā).
— 3. ~aṁ, (adv.), (a) thoroughly, exceedingly, ex-
tremely, Rūp p. 87,7 (= atikkante, signification of prp.
ati); Ja III 515,23*; Pj I 180,7 (read accanta-virattā,
v. l.); Saddh 85, 288; — (b) in temporal sense: per-
petually, always, Ja VI 36,13*; 517,13*; Ja I 223,26*
(nâccanta[ṁ] = na accantaṁ, niccakāle . . . na);
Sp I 107,29 (Sp-ṭ); —. absolutely, SN I 130,20*
(hataputtâmhi; Spk). — °-kāmânugata, mfn.,
extremely obsequious, Ja V 444,4* (cf. 448,19*). __ °-kodhana, mfn., very passionate, Abh 732.
— °-(k)khaya, m., complete destruction, Ps I 54,11; Mp
II 61,4. — °-khāra, mfn., always salt, ~e udake,
Mp II 433,13 = Ps III 586,1. — °-dāliddiya, n.,
extreme poverty, Ja IV 65,2'. — °-dussīlya, n., Dhp
162 (Dhp-a). — °-niṭṭha, mfn., of absolute perfection
(or firmness), ~o + accanta-yogakkhemī, accanta-
brahmacārī accanta-pariyosāno, MN I 251,1s; AN I
291,25; IV 88,9; V 326,26; do. pl. ~ā, etc., DN II
283,1; SN III 13,7 (Ps II 401,3; MpIII 432,19; Sv
II 449,3; Spk II 319,12); also epith. to Nibbāna:
MN III 4,24 (or °niṭṭhā, f.?). — °niyata, mfn.,
'possessing final assurance', Kv 586,15. — °-niyāma-
kathā, f., title of Kv XIX,7 (p. 586—9). — °-niyā-
matā, f., 'final assurance', Kv 586,13. — °-nirodha,
m., absolute destruction, annihilation, Ps II 403,6
(: khaya-nirodha). — °-pariyosāna, mfn., who has
attained to the absolute end or to completion, accanta-
niṭṭha + q. v. above. — °-piya-vādi(n), mfn, always
kindly speaking f. ~inī, Ja VI 473,3*. — °-pemânu-
gata, mfn., with unlimited love, Ja V 448,19* (cf.
444,4*). — °-brahmacāri(n), mfn., of absolute cha-
stity, accanta-niṭṭha + q. v. above. — °-yogakkhe-
mi(n), mfn., of absolute safety (security), do. ib.
— °-lāmaka, mfn., exceedingly low (or vile), Saddh 28.
— °-vaṇṇa, mfn., exceedingly beautiful, f. ~ā, Ja
V 446,9* (= abhirūpavatī, ib. 447,22'). — °-vip-
pavāsa, m., absence for ever, Ja VI 151,4'. — °-vi-
mutta, mfn,, finally emancipated, Ps III 566,19.
— °-virāga, m., the absolute absence of passion, Ps II
403,1 (: khayavirāga). — °-vodāna, n., complete
purification, Pj I 181,8 (kilesa-mala-samuccheda-ka-
raṇato ~aṁ). — °-samyoga, m. [cf. PāṇlI 3,5],
perpetual continuance ('full duration'); kāladdhānaṁ
~e dutiyā vibhatti hoti, Kacc 300; Sadd III 581;
~e upayogavacanaṁ, Vv-a 71,25; Pv-a 73,3; 135,26;
266,5; Sp I 177,11 (Sp-ṭ) = Ps I 151,18 = Pj II 139,4;
°-attha, m., the sense of ~, Sp I 107,28 (Sp-ṭ); Ps I
9,26; Pj I 106,20. — °-saṁghika, mfn., exclusively
appointed to the order (cf. saṁgha), Ps II 121,6 (vihāro).
— °-santa, mfn., absolutely tranquil, Vism 58,17*.
— °-santi, f., absolute tranquillity, Nidd I 74,1i foll;
Pj II 338,21 (+ tadaṅga-santi, sammuti-santi).
— °-sīla, mfn., Utt. 'highly honest', but according to Ct.
= immoral, of bad morals, Ja V 448,18* (loc. f. pl.
~āsu (nārisu) = atikkantasīlāsu, ib. 449,18' [quasi
atisīlanta? Tr.]). — °-sukhaṁ, (adv.), in perpetual
happiness, na ~aṁ edhati, Ja I 488,21* (= niran-
taraṁ sukhaṁ na paṭilabhati) = Ja III 323,20* (= na
ciraṁ sukhaṁ labhati), cf. Ja I 223,26*. — °-sukhu-
tnāla, mfn., extremely delicate, AN I 145,7 (parama-
sukhumālo + : — satata-niddukkho, Mp); Mil 26,26;
Ps III 688,9.
entry.re:
— °-suññatāaccanta-suññatā, f., 'absolute emptiness',
(Mil 413,25); Ps III 691,9 (~aṁ vipassanã-lakkhanaṁ
ācikkhituṁ āraddho). — °-suddhi, f., complete purity,
Sn 794 (Pj, Nidd I). — °-seṭṭha, mfn., absolutely
the best one, Saddh 29 (opp. accanta-lāmaka).
— °-âdhamma-bahula, mfn., exceedingly devoted to
unrighteousness, Saddh 11.

— °-fiparataaccanta-fiparata, mfn., who
has for ever given up (all lust or desire), Ps II 518,11.

entry.sense: mfn., see a-capala.

m. [sa. atyaya], 1. (a) passing, lapse
(of time), instr. ~ena, 'at the end of (with gen. or ifc):
tassārattiyā~ena, Snp.llO,23; MN II 50,8; Mil 88,29;
catunnaṁ māsānaṁ ~ena, Sn p. 102,9; DN II 21,15;
ifc. e. g. ekāha-dvīha°, Ja I 253,22; katipāha°, Ja
I 291,25; — loc. ~e (ahorattānaṁ) SN I 69,28*; Ja
VI 581,28*; hemantānaṁ himaccaye, Ja V 302,26*;
phalānaṁ ~e, (= 'phalaccaye'), Ja III 491,28'. — (b)
passing away, end, death, Abh 404; instr. ~ena, DN
II 101,1 (etarahi vā mamaṁ vā ~, 'now or after my
death'); pitu ~ena, Jal V 137,13; tesaṁ ~ena, AN
III 179,3. — 2. transgression, Abh 1117 (= atik-
kama, dosa); (= aparādha, Sv I 236,18 = Spk I 10,2
— Sp II 301,15); maṁ ~o accagamā, (paronom.: 'a
transgression has happened to me'; cf. atigacchati):
DN I 85,15; AN I 54,23; II 146,27; IV 377,16; ~am
~ato passati, 'to realize the transgression', Vin II
192,19; I 5,23; AN I 59,15; 103,10; etaṁ pas-
sāmi ~aṁ, Ja VI 299,8*; ~aṁ deseti (to confess),
Vin I 314,23; SN I 24,22*; AN I 59,15; ~aṁ ~ato
yathādhammaṁ paṭikaroti (to confess and atone
according to the law), Vin I 315,17; SN II 205,22;
~aṁ paṭigaṇhāti (to accept the confession, to forgive),
SN I 24,22*; ~aṁ ~ato paṭigaṇhātu āyatiṁ sarh-
varāya (do.), DN I 85,19; Vin II 192,15; SN II 205,15;
cf. accayena [v. l. accaya-] desanaṁ paṭigaṇhanto,
Ja V 379,22; ~aṁ khamati (to pardon), Mil 420,9.
Ifc. v. attha°, — thulla°, dur-°, nāna°, pāṇa°,
phala°, vassāna°, hima°.
[3. sg., see acceti.

n., pardon, absolution,
Ja V 380,17'.
[n., title of a sutta, SN I 239.
aor., see ati-rocati.
f., see accāsarā.

~im, ~o, accasā, accasāri, aor.,
see [atisarati].
aor., see ati-harati.

m. (ati + ādara), great care, ~ena,
carefully (with great emphasis), Pj II 418,8 (sapathaṁ
karoti).

abs. (ati-ā + √dhã), having placed
. . . upon: pāde pādaṁ, lying with the feet (slightly
overlapping) one upon another, DN II 134,30; 137,17
(Sv = ati-ādhāya, īsakaṁ atikkamma thapetvā); III
209,22; SN I 27,18 (Spk = do.); IV 184,13 (Spk = do.).

ind. (ati + abhikkhaṇaṁ,
for ā see acc°), too frequently, in comp. °saṁsagga, m.,
meeting to often, Ja V 233,20* (= ativiya abhiṇha-
saṁsaggo).

mfn. (ati + āyata), stretched or
tightened too much, too sharply tuned, Vin I 182,30
(vīṇāya tantiyo ~ā) — AN III 375,10 (opp. ati-
sithilā; = ati-āyatā, khara-mucchanā, Mp).

mfn. [sa. ātyayika, see acc-° above],
cf. Tr. PM 75), 1. not suffering delay, urgent, pressing,
(n. an urgent business); ~aṁ karaṇīyaṁ, Vin I 139,13;
MN I 149,1 (Ps); II 112,27; pl. tīṇi ~āni karaṇīyāni,
AN I 239,29 (Mp = atipātikāni); ~am kiccaṁ, Ja I
338,31; mayhaṁ ~aṁ n'atthi, Dhp-a I 18,8.
— 2. excessive, extraordinary (cf. also accāhita), ~ena
luddena, Ja VI 549,6* (— ativiya luddena) = 555,13*
≠ 553,15* = 584,32*. — Cf. acceka, Sp II 275,20.

mfn. (ati + āraddha), too much
strained or exerted, overtaxed, Th 638 (viriyamhi,
allusion to AN III 375,10); Ja IV 131,2 (viriyena);
Pj II 146,12 (°-âtilīna-).
entry.re:
— °-viriyaacc-āraddha-viriya, n., too great
exertion, too eager determination, Vin I 182,38 (opp.
atilīna-°); AN III 375,19; MN III 159,21; Pj II 21,15;
— do. mfn., exerting oneself too much, Vin I 182,1.
—- °-viriyatā, f. abstr., Ps I 298,18 (opp. atisithila-°).

entry.sense:
3. sg. (ati-ã + √vad), 'to talk down',
i. e. (a) to surpass or overnoise in dispute, (b) to
fascinate or seduce (by flirting): (b) Ja V 433,28** (cat-
tālīsāhi ṭhãnehi ittḥī purisaṁ ~) quoted Dhp-a IV
197,1; (a) part. ~ante (aññamaññaṁ sutena, cf. suta,
n.), SN II 204,8 (= atikkamma vadante, Spk); imp.
(a or b) ~atha, Vin IV 224,10 (= atikkamitvā va-
datha, scil. bhikkhuniyo, acc; Sp); (a) aor. 1. pl.,
~imha, SN II 205,12; 2. pl. ~ittha, ib. 19.

n. (ati + asana, cf. sa. açana & āça),
eating too much, too much food, gen. ~assa (puriso
tappati), Ja I 185,4* (= ati-asanena atibhuttena).

mfn. [sa. aty-āsanna], too near,
nâtidūraṁ nâccāsannaṁ (senāsanaṁ), AN V 15,24
(Mp); loc. (adv.) ~e, Vin I 39,3 (n'eva ati-dūre [or
avidūre] na ~); 46,20; II 158,27; Ja VI 294,7* (cf.
Pj I 117,3*); AN IV 339,17 (Mp).

3. sg. [sa. ati-ā + √sṛ], to go too
far, to pass beyond legitimate bounds, Pj II 21,18 (opp.
paccāsarati).

f. (from prec), falsification, deceit,
Vibh 358,3 (+ vañcanā nikati, etc., v. l. accasarā;
= katvā pãpaṁ puna paṭicchādanato aticca āsaranti
etāya sattā, Vibh-a 493,17) — Pp 19,30; 23,30 (with
the reading acchãdanā on both places).

mfn. (from a Pali standpoint: ati +
a-hita, see acc-° above; cf. (secondary*!) sa. aty-ã-hita),
excessive(ly bad), ~aṁ kamma karosi luddaṁ, Ja
IV 46,24* = VI 306,26* (Ct. hitâtikkantaṁ ati-ahi-
taṁ) ≠ Ja V 146,18* (do.).

f. (once m.) [sa. arci, m. & arciṣ, n.], flame;
Abh 35; 1102 (jāl'-aṁsūsu); nom. ~i, Ja V 213,22*
(pabbatagge va~?, cf.Ct.&v.L); SN IV 399,26 (vātena
khittā); AN IV 103,5 (do.); V 9,27 (aññā); MN III
183,30; Mil 40,23 (sā); ~ī, SN IV 290,27; MN III
273,17 (aniccã); m. nom. sg. ~ī, Sn 1074 (vāta-vegena
khitto, B. khittā); acc ~iṁ paṭicca ābhā paññāyati,
MN I 295,33; pl. ~iyo, Vin I 25,30*. B-spelling nearly
always acchi. — Ifc v. dīpa°, vîtaccika. acci

f., blazing flame (if not dvandva), Mil
357,16 (°-mālaka, mfn., with garlands of bl. flames).

mfn. (pp. of accati, or 2acceti), praised,
honoured, worshipped, Abh 750, 841; ~o + mahito,
Ja VI 180,9*,17' (supaciṇṇa +). — Ifc. v. brahmâ-
sura-sura°.

mfn., lit. 'ray-bound' (1), i. e.
divided into stripes(1), Vin I 287,8 (Magadha-khettaṁ
~aṁ pāḷibaddhaṁ, etc., B-reading °-bandhaṁ; Sp =
caturassa-kedāraka-baddhaṁ, cf. Vin Trsl II 207 n. 3:
'divided into short pieces').

mfn. [sa. arci(ṣ)mat], shining, blazing,
nom. m. ~mā (aggi + vaṇṇimā pabhassaro), MN II
152,13; 183,30; 203,22; acc ~mantaṁ pabhassaraṁ,
Ja VI 279,20*; Vv 431; plur. ~mantā, Ja V 266,17*;
f. pl., ~mantī pabhassarā, Ja VI 448,32* (Ed. and B);
m. pl. ~manto pabhassarā, MN I 337,26*; Ja VI
248,18*; Th 527 (dumā; = dīpasikhāvanto viya jalita-
aggī viya ca, Ct.), — m., fire, As 300,11* (mṭ); Abh 34.

m. Npr. of a mythical king, Mhv
II 5 (nom sg. ~o, Mhv-t); Dīp III 8; gen. ~massa,
ib. III 14.

mfn., with garlands of flames,
Ja V 63,17* (pāvako ~ī). acci-māli

f. Npr. of a half-sister of Bhūri-
datta, Ja VI 190,29; 195,1-4* (Ed. Accī° against metre).
m., see acchiva.

°m., Mil 148,23 (sata-yojanânu-
pharaṇa°, with the violence of flames, pervading 100
yojanas).

m., mass or multitude of flames,
Ja V 267,27* (°-pareta, mfn., surrounded by ~).

mfn. (ati + ukkaṭṭha), dragged
or pulled too much up, too high, MN II 139,21 (cīvaraṁ,
opp. acc-o(k)kaṭṭha); Ps III 393,11 foll.

mfn. (ati + uggata), high, tall,
elevated, loud, insolent, Bv I 53 (Bv-a); Mil 346,8*
(~aṁ giriṁ); 234,17 (uttara +); 283,14 (pañca-
yojana-sataṁ ~o, scil. Himavanto); with acc Se abl.:
AN IV 100,12 (caturāsīti-yojana-sahassāni mahā-
samuddā ~o, scil. Sineru); Ap 21,12-13; Sp I 119,12*
(Sp-ṭ); — Dhp-a II 65,2* (kayo ~o pañcavīsati-
yojanaṁ); — Ja I 432,12* (~ā vācā); VI 133,21*
(saddo; = ati-uggato, Ct.); — Mil 164,12 (mahatī
~ā, scil. pabbajjā, cf. acala); — Ja VI 516,27* ( =
atikuddha, note that uggata and uddhata are inter-
changeable).
entry.re:
— °-aṭṭhenaacc-uggata-aṭṭhena, instr., in the sense of
'elevated', As 372,29;— °-dhaja, m., a flag elevated
above others, As 372,28 (bahūsu dhajesu ~o = 'ketu');
— °-sarīra, mfn., of tall stature, Ja IV 111,6' (read:
ko nu si tvaṁ accuggata-sarīrā 'ti).

entry.sense:
ind. (ati + uggamma, abs. of
uggacchati), in a position raised above (with acc or
abl.), MN I 169,17 (udakaṁ (or udakă) ~ tiṭṭhanti
[read thitāni], scil. uppalāni, etc.) = DN II 38,33
= SN'i 138,15 = MN I 169,17 (= udakaṁ atikka-
mitvā tiṭṭhanti, Ps); ~udakaṁ (or udakā-m) ~ṭhāti
(or titthati), scil. uppalaṁ: AN II 38,32; V 152,1s;
SN III 140,1s; Mil 375,7.

mfn. (ati + uṇha), too warm, too hot,
Sn 966 (Nidd); Ja III 423,6; IV 44,8; Dhp-a II 85,17
(~ °atisīta-atiambila°). Cf. ati-uṇha, abbhuṇha.

mfn. [sa. acyuta; cf. cuta], not fallen
(away from, abl.), permanent, unchangeable, AN IV
295,5 = 327,4 (saddhamma, abl.); — Sn 204 (nibbā-
napadaṁ), 1086 (do.); Dhp 225 (~am ṭhānaṁ, =
sassataṁ, i.e. Nibbāna); Dhp-a III 320,15 (~aṁ
amata-mahā-nibbānaṁ); Th introd. v. 3 (~aṁ padaṁ);
Saddh 47 (~aṁ santaṁ padaṁ). —- n. = Nibbãna,
Abh 8. — °-gata, mfn., who has gone to Nibbāna,
Nidd I 20,31 (Nidd-a here accutippatto). — °-ppatta,
mfn., id.; ib, (Nidd-a, Ce prints accutigato); Nidd I
84,11 (Nidd-a Ce : ~an ti acalabhāvappattaṁ).

m. Npr., 1. of a seṭṭhi, Bv XXIII 22;
Ja I 94,16. — 2. of an isi, Ja VI 532,2*; 540,16
(°-tāpasa), 593,26 . — 3. of a paccekabuddha, MN
III 70,16*. — 4. pl. of a class of gods, DN II 260,8*.
— 5. of an elephant. Ja VI 135,26* (read: Accutaṁ
Aruṇadantaṁ; Se Accuggataṁ Varuṇadantaṁ).

m. Npr. of a pacceka-
buddha, MN III 70,16* (Ps).

m. Npr. of one of Vijaya's
companions, Dīp IX 32,36 (cf. Mhv VII 45).

mfn., maintaining the view of
Nibbāna, Nidd I 203,12 (santivādo muni tāṇavādo +).

f., 'not falling', i. e. not passing into a
new existence (see cuti); Th-a ad Th introd. v. 3.

mfn. [ati + uddhumāta], self-
conceited, °-bhāva, m. abstr., Ps I 107,6 (°-paccu-
paṭṭhāna, mfn., producing that).

m., too high self-conceit, Mp
III 173,3 (= 'atimāna'), v. l. acc-uṇṇati-°.

aor. 3. sg. Ja IV 250,14* (meṇḍan-
taraṁ ~, = atigantvā upapati, Ct. [Ed. uppati]),
metrical haplology for accupapati from [acc-upa-
patati], to fly near by.

mfn., very imposing, Mhv XIX 7;
Dāṭh V 64.'

(3. sg. [ati + upasevati], to have
too much intercourse with (acc), part. gen. ~ato, Ja
III 526,1* (bālaṁ ~, = a-paññaṁ atisevantassa).

mfn. (see accāyika, (2)), extraordinary,
esp. of something given at an occasion of some im-
portance to the giver (Tr.), 77. ~aṁ, Vin III 261,33'.
— °-cīvara, n., 'a robe presented to a priest not at
the usual time', Vin III 260,34 foll.; Sp II 274—5
(cf. Trsl. I 29). — °-cīvara-sikkhāpada, n., title of
Nissaggiya 28 (Vin III 260—62).

(or *accayati), 3. sg. [sa. aty-eti, ati + √i],
3. pl. ~enti, ~ayanti; [accetha Ja VI 17,5*, read
appetha, see appeti and abbeti]; pot. 3. sg. ~ayeyya;
1. to pass beyond, Ja VI 359,23* (velaṁ); — 2. to
pass by, to be lost for (acc), DN III 185,14* (atthā
~enti māṇave) ≠ Th 231 (khaṇā, cf. khaṇâtīta);
— 3. to neglect, to miss, Ja IV 165,22*; 166,9' (appam
pi nâcceti); — 4. to pass away, elapse, Th 145 (acc-
ayanti ahorattā) = SN I 109,4*; SN I 3,3* = 62,32*
= Ja IV 487,18* (accenti kālā); — 5. to die, Ja IV
127,14* (opp. jãyate); — 6. to surpass, Ja VI 359,23*
— 363,8* (paññaṁ nâcceti sirī);—-7. to get over, over-
come, Sn 183—4 (dukkhaṁ); SN I 214,27*, quoted Mil
36,17* (do.); Sn 781 (sakaṁ diṭṭhiṁ); Ja V 153,18*;
Pj I 195,8. — abs. aticca, q. v. — pp. atīta, q. v.

[3. sg. = accati [sa. √arc, arcayati], to
honour, worship; aor. 3. sg. med. accayittha, Dāṭhāv
V 66.
[n., title of SN I 3,1-10.

mfn. [thus generally spelt, after
the analogy of acc-ukkaṭṭha, instead of acc-okaṭṭha
(from ati-avakṛṣṭa)], dragged or pulled too much down,
MN II 139,21 (cîvaraṁ; Ps).

mfn. (ati + ogālha), too extravagant,
prodigal, AN IV 282,21 foll. = 323,25 foll, (jīvikaṁ
kappeti na ~aṁ na atihīnaṁ).

n., (ati + udaka), too much water,
Dhp-a I 52,20 (opp. an-odaka). See ati-udaka and
cf. cases like accodara and paccora, Mogg-v I 29.

n., (ati + udara), a still greater belly,
a super-belly Ja IV 279,19* (= ati-udaraṁ, Ct.).

mfn. (ati + odāta), very white, of
too fair skin, DN II 175,24; Ja VI 3,6 (gen. f. ~āya,
scil. dhātiyā; atidīgha +).

= acchi, n. [sa. akṣi, °-akṣa], eye (cf. akkhi),
ifc, v. Gavaccha, cf. setaccha, setaccha-kūṭa.

mfn. [ts.], pure, clean, clear, transparent,
Abh 670, 1025; DN I 76,22 (maṇi) ≠ MN II 17,9 (Sv
= tanu-cchavi); MN I 38,14 (udakaṁ ; = vippa-
sannaṁ, Ps); + vippasanna, anāvila: DN II 129,22
(nadikã); MN II 22,5 (udaka-rahado); Ja I 339,23
(udakaṁ); Mil 35,1 (cittaṁ), 35,13 (udakam), cf.
Ja II 100,26*; ~aṁ vāriṁ anāvilaṁ, Ja IV 351,28*;
~e uda(ka)-patte (as a mirror), DN I 80,17 = MN
II 19,32 — SN III 105,20; ~aṁ pattaṁ, SN II 281,5
(= vippasanna-vaṇṇaṁ mattikā-pattaṁ, Spk); f. pl.
~ā, Ja IV 287,1* (giri-vara-nadiyo); n. pl. ~ā Ja
VI 278,2* (haplol., with ambūni). — Ifc. v. an-°.

f. or accha-kañjikā, f., 'clari-
fied gruel', Vin I 206,29 (instr. ~iyā, & acc ~ikaṁ).

m. pl., Ja V 406,5* =
VI 277,22* ≠ V 71,1* (Ct. 73,9' gives the v. l. Cks
acchā kok°) cf. 416,20**; Ap 17,7; bears, wolves, and
hyenas.

or Acchagallaka-vihāra, m. Npr.
of a monastery in Ceylon, Mhv XXI,6; XXXIII,67.

m. = Acchagalla(ka)-vihāra,
Mhv-ṭ ad Mhv XXI ,6.

n.,, a bear-skin, Vin II 174,25;
Ss 113,26.

3. sg. (√ās, Sadd II, Mogg V 173; Geiger
§ 135), to be (on a place), to remain, to sit (auxili-
ary with part, like sa. āste; it may be compared with
greek è'txxε, latin escit, etc , see J. Bloch, Form, de
la langue Marathe, Index: asṇeṁ ; Tr. PM 61,3
suggests derivation from the aor. acchi [from *ātsītḷ,
cf. also Johansson Idg. Forsch. III 205, and Pischel
Gr. § 480); pr. 3. sg. ~ati: DN I 101,23; Ja II 365,5*;
IV 213,10; VI 20,32' (= 'sammati'); V 44,22* ( =
vasati); VI 117,8*; 313,8*; 500,18* (v.I. for gacchati);
557,13*; Ap 269,16 (~ati vane, scil. thflpo);
— 2. sg. ~asi: DN I 103,7; Ja IV 25,10* (sibbam ~);
V 3,26' (= 'sammasi'); VI 78,25' (nilīno ~, =
'nilīyasi'); [Ja VI 518,6* = fut., see below];
— 1. sg. ~āmi: Ja VI 419,35' (pañjare ~, = vasāmi);
Mil 88,1e; — 3. pl. ~anti: Vin l 160,5; II 195,17;
289,6; III 195,8; DN III 94,19 (Ed. . ~enti; Sv ~anti
— vasanti); Ja II 67,21' (~anti nisīdanti «= 'samac-
chare'); — 3. pl. meet. ~are: SN I 212,28*; Ja VI
45,30* (= vasanti); VI 557,18* (= acchanti); — 1. pl.
~âma: Ja III 214,22 '; 390,19'; — imper. 2. sg. accha:
Ja VI 522,17*; Dhp-a I 183,11. — 2. sg. med. ~assu,
Ja VI 18,27*; 423,7*; 516,16*; — 3. sg. ~atu: Ja IV
306,16; VI 506,13* ; —3. sg. med. ~ataṁ: Ja VI 506,8*
(= acchatu, Ct.); 549,7* (idh'eva ~, = idh'eva hotu);
— 3. pl. ~antu: Ps III 381,16 (= paṭivāsentu, or
paṭimānentu); — 2. pl. ~atha: Ja IV 306,12; — pot.
3. sg. acche: It 120,10* = AN II 15,6* (care.,
titthe . . ~ . . saye); — aor. 3. sg. acchi: Vin III 35,4
(nilīno ~); Ja III 28,8 (do.); VI 76,4 (do.); Ja III
416,28 ; Pj II 519,13; Dhp-a I 424,14;—1, sg. acchiṁ:
Ja VI 17,8* (acch'āhaṁ = acchiṁ ahaṁ, avasiṁ);
3.pZ. ~iṁsu: Ja VI 6,29; 436,8; Dhp-a I 314,10 (bhū-
miyaṁ). — fut. 3. sg. ~issati: Ja IV 336,26 ; VI 439,6;
— 2. sg. acchasi [from *ātsyase], Ja VI 518,6* (v. l.
Bd Lk vacchasi; Ct. = vasissasi); — 3. pl. ~issanti: Vin
III 159,20 = II 76,3; — inf. ~ituṁ: Dhp-a II 3,7 ( =
to rest,, to be exempt from work); — grd. ~itabbaṁ,
Ja III 244,2'; — caus. see acchāpayati, ~eti, āsayati,
~eti. — Cf. samacchati.

n., not a parasol, Kacc-v 438 (~aṁ
chattaṁ iva ācarati = chattīyati, q. v.).

n., want of desire for, only ifc.
bhattâ-°, n., Vin I 200,8 (q. v.). Cf. next.

(°aka), mfn., having no desire for,
or no delight in; assaddha +: AN III 436,3; Pp 13,10
(Pp-a); Nidd II 269,11; Vism 177,12-19 (= apacca-
nīka-paṭipadāyaṁ chanda-virahitā).
entry.re: — °-bhāvaa-cchandika-bhāva,m. abstr., SvI 97,30; Pp-a 185,8.

entry.sense:
mfn., uncovered, without roof, Kacc-v
584; Ps II 290,17 (= 'abbhokāsaṁ') — °-tala, mfn.,
without roof, ~ã dvibhūmikā kuti, etc. Sp ad Vin
IV 46,1 (Sp-ṭ).

mfn. [sa. ā-cchanna], covered, clothed
(with instr.); Vin III 215,26 (tena [cīvarena] ~o);
Ja III 323,23* (semānaṁ ~aṁ samhi lohite, =
nimugga, Ct.(!) or = 1acchanna(?)). Cf. acchādita.
— Ifc. v. bhasmâ°.

n., bear's flesh, As 383,18 (mis-
taken for sūkara-maṁsa); PsIII 46,11 (sūkara-maṁsa-
sadisaṁ).

m. pl., the bear and the phan-
dana-tree, Dhp-a I 50,13 (v. l. for issa-phandana q. v.).

mfn. (from chambhati, q. v.),
fearless, nom. m. ~ī, [ ˇ - - ] Sn 42 (= thaddhabhāva-
karabhayâbhāvena ~ī, Pj, cf. Nidd); SN I 99.11
(abhīru +); Mil 339,13 (visārado, amaṁkubhūto +);
MN II 138,8 (~ī + akampī avedhī aparitassī viga-
talomahaṁso, vivekâvatto); Ja VI 322,1i* (+ abhīto
alomahaṭṭho; = nikkampo, Ct.); — a-cchambhitā,
f. abstr., Pj I 33,26; = a-cchambhitatta, n. abstr.,
Dhp-a IV 231,21. a-cchambhi

sometimes in comp, for acchara (see
below).

n., = acchariya, n., Kacc-v 633; ~e,
Pj II 155,12* = Sp I 170,24* (= acchere, Sp-ṭ).

f. (comp, also acchara-; Amg ac-
charā; acchaṭā Vyu 138,42; etymol. unknown; Tr PM
76 compared sa. ācchurita, n. — nakhavādya, no-
ting v. l. acchurā- Thī 67; the Aṭṭhakathā derived
acchariya from this, see accharāyogga), 1. a snapping
of the fingers (like to sa. pucchaṭī, mukuṭī, mucuṭī),
Abh 66; in the phrase ~aṁ paharati, (a) as signal
of command: Ja IV 336,3 (to a peacock); IV 438,5 (to
dogs); Ps III 153,6 (to a horse); —- (b) expressive of
reprimand: Ja II 447,28; IV 124,20; Dhp-a I 38,4;
III 8,22; 414,6; — (c) do. of dismissal or refuse:
Ja III 191,21; V 314,14; VI 542,7; Dhp-a I 424,2;
— (d) do. of disregard or contempt: Ps II 524,5; — (e) do.
of satisfaction or joy: Ja VI 336,25. — 2. the two or
three fingers by which a pinch is taken, ~āya gaṇhitvā
(gahetvā), Dhp-a III 19,10-14 (cf. ib. 18,9: tīhi aṅgu-
līhi gahetvā). Cf. accharā-gahaṇa. — 3. a pinch,
~aṁ sakkharāya (of sugar), Ja V 385,19. —< Ifc. v.
ekacchara-kkhaṇa, ekacchara-matta.

f. [sa. apsaras & apsarā], a celestial
'nymph', Abh 24; sg. ~ā, Thī 374 (Cittarathe va ~;
Thī-a); Ja VI 269,28* (tidivokacarā); VI 590,16*
(Tāvatiṁsā); Vv 318 foll, (kāmavaṇṇinī, cf. Ps II
24,3); gen. ekissā ~āya, MN I 253,10; pl. ~ā, Ja V
153,28* ; V 454,3* (sovaṇṇa-vyamha-nilayā); VI
289,27*; MN I 337,27* (nānattavanniyo, naccanti;
Ps); pl. ~āyo, MN II 64,10 = Vin III 17,22; Vv 94;
Ja II 93,7 (kakuṭa-pãdiniyo, cf. Ud 22,24); Mil 169,27
(do.); instr. ~āhi, Mhv XXV,102 (vibhūsite); gen.
~ānaṁ, MN II 64,12; ~āsaṁ gaṇena, Vv 971 (no
doubt w. r. for accharasaṁ [sa. apsarasām, cf. Vv 152],
and note that the metre would recommend *accharaso
in Vv 94); — cf. Ja V 469,5) in a pun with iaccharā).
—. Ifc. v. deva°.

m., a troop of nymphs, Ja IV
224,10 (correction' by Fsb. cf. ib. II 93,5). — °-gho-
sita, Vv 514 = °-saṁghuṭṭha, mfn., resonant with
troops of nymphs, SN I 33,7*" (Spk); Saddh 298.

mfn., so much as may
be taken by the fingertips (cf. 1acchara), Dhp-a II 273,14
(siddhatthakaṁ). accharā-gahaṇa-matta

(cf. (ā)ghāta), m., a snap with
the fingers, °-kālika, mfn., of a moment's duration,
Saddh 490 (anicca-saññaṁ ~aṁ). — °matta, mfn. =
accharā-saṁghāta-matta, metrical v. l. Th 405 = Thī 67.

mfn. worthy of 1acccharā (e),
Atthakathā (explaining acchariya) quoted by Sv I
43,15, Mp I 113,14, Ud-a 159,19; cf. Ps II 71,18;
III 2,19.

m. id., Vv 35; Dhp-a III 292,2.
— °-parivuta, mfn., surrounded by ~, SN V 342,7
(Spk); MN I 505,14; Ja l 58,16.

m., 'a snap with the fingers',
a little moment, Pay ad Mogg 14 (rassa-kālo nãma~o,
= akkhi-nimīlana); Mmd 4.
entry.re:
— °-mattaaccharā-sarhghāta-matta, mfn., of
very small measure or extent, Th 405 = Thī 67 (v. I.
accharãghāta-°; Thī-a = ghaṭikā-mattam pi khaṇaṁ
aṅguli-pothana-mattam pi kālaṁ); AN I 10,19 (Mp);
34,29 (quoted Mil 142,6); 35,3; 38,1s; IV 396,1; Ps
I 102,24. — °-vagga, m., title of AN 110—11.
— °-sutta, n., see Cullaccharā-s° and Mahaccharā-s.

entry.sense:
m., the smack produced by
snapping the fingers, Ja III 127,8 (~ena vassati, scil.
moro); Dhp-a I 424,2; Vism 264,25 = Vibh-a 247,34. acchara-sadda

mfn., surrounded
by thousand(s of) nymphs, Dhp-a I 26,17, 20 (see new
Ed.); 60,10; Vv-a 142,17.
[n., title of SN I 33,6-14.

f., dimin, of ^ccharā (q. v.); MN III
299,25 (appakasirena ~aṁ pahareyya); AN IV
263,20; 265,4 (~aṁ vādesi, made music by snapping
the fingers; = pāṇitalaṁ vādesi, Mp); Vism 48,3
(~āya saññaṁ adāsi, made a sign by snapping the
fingers). — °-sadda, m. = accharā-sadda; ~aṁ
karonto, Pj I 67,31 (aṭṭhikāni kaṭakaṭāyanti).

mfn. [sa. āçcarya; said to be related
to 1accharā, see references s. v. accharā-yogga; "na
niccam" in Sv I 43,14, etc. ≠ Pāṇ VI 1,147; the etym,
of Pāṇ ib., ã + √car is reproduced by Kacc-v 633;
see also acchera], wonderful, marvellous, magnificent,
charming, surprising, Abh 736; DN III 191,3 (~ãnaṁ
rasānaṁ; Sv = madhurarase); Ja IV 197,25* (bho-
janaṁ); Dhp-a I 122,22 (Buddha nāma ~ā); — ~o
abbhuto dhammo, AN IV 65,15; ~ā abbhuta-dham-
mā, MN III 119,17 foll.; cattāro ~ā abbhutā dhammā,
DN II 145,3; AN II 130,19; Nett 119,22 foll.; attha
~ā . . . (do.), Vin II 237,17; Ud 53,6 = AN IV 198,3;
AN IV 213,3 foll. — n. (a) a wonderful thing, a
marvel, prodigy, frequently in exclamations: ~aṁ
bhante, abbhutaṁ bhante! MN I 83,21 (Ps); do.
foll, by yatra hi nāma . . . (how wonderful, that . . .)
MN I 254,4; do. + yāva ... DN II 133,31; — ~aṁ
vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, DN II 107,7; 129,23
(scil. Tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā, etc.); do. + yaṁ
vata ... Sn p. 94,11; — ~aṁ bhante buddhānaṁ, etc.
+ yaṁ . . ., Mil 118,30; do. + yāva . . . ib. 273,8;
— Ja VI 41,4 (na idaṁ jānituṁ ~aṁ); Ps II 3,17
(anekãni ~āni disvā). — (b) surprise, Ja VI 529,30*;
~aṁ pavedeti, to express one's surprise, Ja VI 513,20.
— Ifc. v. an-°, anu-°, garaha-°, pasamsa°, saṁ-
jāta-°. Cf. acchera.

n., Acchariyabbhu-
tadhammasutta (q. v.). Ed. by W. Rūpasingha. Co-
lombo 1897. Cf. Bakkulatheracchariyabbhutasutta,
MN ch. 124.

f., title of Ss II (p. 21: Tathā-
gatassa ~); do. of Ss VII (p. 44: Dhamme ~); do. of
Ss VIII (p. 60: Saṁghe ~).

mfn., only with magga =
the path which leads to the wonderful, SN IV 371,10
(~gāmiṁ maggaṁ).

mfn., Ja VI 243,32' (= 'ac-
chariya-rūpa', q. v.).

m., a wonderful quality,
Pj II 449,10 = Ps III 337,5 (catūhi ~ehi + catūhi
saṅgaha-vatthūhi, see AN II 32,18 and 133,2).
— °-sutta, n., see Acchariyabbhutadhamma-sutta.

mfn., filled with
surprise, amazement, and wonder (cf. 2citta), MN I
254,2 (Ps); 330,16 (Ps); SN II 56,20.
entry.re:
— °-abbhuta-acchariy'-abbhuta-citta-jāta-abbhuta-
jāta, mfn., do., Mil 122,8; Dhp-a IV 52,23.

entry.sense:
n. = MN
(ch. 123) III 118—124 (v. l. Acchariya-dhamma-sutta,
cf. Acchariya-abbhuta-sutta).

m., a wonderful (miracu-
lous) man, ~o (ekapuggalo), AN I 22,14 (Mp); Vism
93,9; Ja I 277,7 (Buddha nāma ~ā).

mfn., wonderful, miraculous,
Ja IV 264,8 (pāṭihāriyaṁ); 452,28*; VI 243,27* ( =
acchariya-jātika); cf. acchera-rūpa.
[n., title of SN IV 371,8.

mfn. (cf. 2accha),
with the colour of pure liquid lac, Vibh-a 245,5 (sarii-
saraṇa-lohitaṁ) = Vism 261,30.

f. (3accha + vasā), bear's grease;
pañca vasāni bhesajjāni: ~aṁ maccha-vasaṁ susukā-°
sūkara-° gadrabha-°, Vin I 200,23; V 129,5 (cf. Sp
II 255,16).

m. Npr. of a monastery in Ceylon
Mhv-ṭ ad Mhv XXI 6.

m. Npr. of a hill, Mhv XLVIII 94
cf. Accha-galla and °giri.
f., see ajjhā.

m. [sa. ãcchãda] = acchādana (q. v.)
— Ifc. v. ghāsa°.

n. [sa. ācchādana], covering, pro-
tection, shelter; clothes, mantle, cloak; Abh 290; 1104;
as a verbal noun giving the sense of √kap & √3vas,
Dhātup & Dhãtum; Th 698 (ghāsaṁ ~aṁ); Ja I
307,3-io (itthiyā sāmiko ~aṁ nãma); Mil 279,12; Ja
III 302,5*; VI 118,20* (= Vv 208); 316,26* = 320,25*
— AN III 50,19*; SN V 150,14 (v. l. acchāda);
DN III 160,11*; Dhp-alI 79,4; As 210,3 (pāna-
bhojana-sayana-°); pṝ.~āni, MhvXXXIV 6(—=cīvara-
sāṭakāni, Mhv-ṭ). — Ifc. v. ghāsa°, bhatta°, vattha°,
sātnika°.

f., 'covering, concealing', i. e. deceit,
Pp 19,30 = 23,30 ≠ Vibh 358,3 (+ vañcanā,
nikati, etc.); most likely a w. r. for accāsarā (q. v.),
see the explication in Vibh-a 493,17.

3. sg. (caus. of acchādeti), to let
somebody put on (clothes), abs. ~etvā (vatthāni), Vin
I 22,12 (quoted Pj I 14,10 = Ss 69,12).

mfn. (pp. of acchādeti), clad in
(with instr.), DN II 134,18*.

3. sg. (sa. ā-cchādayati, ā + √chad),
to cover (acc), to clothe or present (a monk [acc] with
clothes [instr.J; to put on (clothes: acc); imper. ~ehi,
DN II 133,15 (mam ekena, scil. siṅgi-vaṇṇena yu-
gena; Sv); —- [pot. ~eyyaṁ (aggaḷaṁ), Vin I 290,2
v. l.]; — aor. ~esi, DN II 133,18 (with instr.); MN
I 353,14 (ticīvarena; Ps); Vin III 11,20 (do.); pl.
~esuṁ, Pv-a 50,9 (dvīhi vatthehi); —- fut. ~essāmi
= dassāmi, Vin III 216,14**, 29'; ~essasi, Ja IV 172,3
(vattha-yugāni); — abs. ~etvā, Vin II 253,23 =
AN IV 274,31 (kāsāyāni vatthāni); do.: DN I 60,18;
63,7; 115,20; 131,32; MN II 55,31; AN I 107,4; It
75,7; Pp 57,15; — Ja I 254,6 (ahata-vatthāni);
III 189,5 (dibba-vatthehi); IV 318,20 (ticīvarena).
Mil 88,3 (kambalena); — ~ayitvāna. Pv 61; 62;
Pv-a 49,19; 50,7. — pp. acchãdita & acchanna (q. v.);
caus. acchādāpeti (q. v.) — [Obs. the aor. a(c)chādesi
with different meanings: from chādeti, to please, DN
III 85,21, and from chādeti, to cover [ ˇ - - ˇ ], Ja
VI 581,21*].

(~ayati), 3. sg., caus. of acchati, to
get seated, Pay VI (ad Mogg V, 20?).

n. [sa. akṣi, cf. 1accha], eye, also mesh
(in a net), Abh 149. — Ifc. v. ubhayacchi-kāṇa,
ekacchi-kāṇa, kakkaṭaka° (cf. gavacchita & next).
[Note the Burmese spelling acchi for acci, SN IV
290,27 (see Sv (Ee) I p. XIII), and acchi, aor. of
acchati.]
°mfn. ifc, v. uddha°, sukhuma°.
abs., see acchindati.

3. sg. (pass, of acchindati), to be
robbed; part. loc. ~ante, Nidd I 50,22 (Nidd-a).
(w. r. acchidda), aor. v chindati.

mfn. [sa. a-cchidra], uninjured,
without flows or defects; solid, compact, dense; AN V
79,17 = Vin II 248,22 (parisuddha + ~ appaṭi-
maṁsa); sīlāni akhaṇdāni (q. v.) +, DN III 245,25;
MN I 322,21 (Ps); ÁNIII 36,10; IV 54,6; SN IV
272,17 (= yesaṁ vemajjhe ekam pi na bhinnaṁ,
Vism 222,2); Dhp-a III 329,8 (sikkhā, jīvitavutti);
pabbato ~o asusiro ekaghano, Vin I 184,28; SN II
181,26; — SN IV 316,9 (udakamaṇiko, ~o hārī pari-
hārī).

mfn. (from acchidda), unbroken,
uninterrupted; °-gaṇanā f., counting (of numbers) in
unbroken series, Sv I 95,20 (Sv-pṭ, Sv-nṭ; = 'ga-
ṇanā').

mfn., doing something per-
fectly (i. e. without break or defects), akhanda-kārī +,
AN II 187,30; 243,19.

m., a counter (of numbers)
in unbroken series, Sv I 157,19 (Sv-pṭ, Sv-nṭ; =
'gaṇaka').

mfn., leading a faultless mode
of life, Dhp 229 (Dhp-a III 329,9); DN III 192,13* (Sv
III 187,20 (Se writing acchinna-) = akhaṇḍa-vutti).

3. sg. [sa. ā + √chid], to tear off,
tear from, rob, plunder, deprive of; Vinl V 247,13;
pot. ~eyya, Vin IV 247,21**, 28'; Ps III 327,9 (yaṁ am-
hākaṁ deti taṁ ~); aor. acchindi, Vin IV 247,7;
Ja III 384,17; IV 343,1 (gāmaṁ); pl. ~iṁsu, Vin I
88,34 = III 212,2 (corā bhikkhū; Sp); Ps II 313,21
(ath'assa corā vatthāni ~), — Sv I 142,25; fut.
acchindissati, Vin IV 247,10 (cīvaraṁ); abs. (a) ~itvā,
MN II 109,30 (tassā sāmikaṁ); Ja II 422,5 (aññe-
saṁ yasaṁ); III 179,7 (hatthato kumāraṁ); 386,1
(yasaṁ datvā . . . sabbam ~); III 487,18 (rañño
rajjaṁ); Dhp-a I 56,6 (do.); Mil 20,14 (paresaṁ
bhoge); Dhp-a I 349,1 (parihāraṁ); ~itvā ganhati
- to tear from: Vin IV 245,9'; Jal V 358,10'; Pv-a
241.,5; Ps III 252,19; Ja VI 544,30' (~itvã gahaṇassa
bhāyāmi); (b) ~itvãna, Saddh 122; (c) acchejja (or
acchijja), SN I 127,3*-6* (Spk); —- pp. acchinna;
caus. acchindāpeti; pass, acchijjati (q. v.).

n. (nom. act. from prec), depriving,
abolishing, Dhp-a III 70,22' (senāpati-ṭṭhānâdi-°,
= 'rājato upassaggaṁ'). — Ifc. v. cīvara-°.

3. sg. (caus. of acchindati), to
cause to rob or deprive; pot. ~eyya, Vin IV 247,21**;
fut. ~essanti, Vin IV 224,6; aor. ~esi, Ps III 57,10
(taṁ ṭhãnantaraṁ ~, abolished that office (Tr.)).

mfn. [ts.], (a) not cut off, Ja II
78,7* (Ct.); in the phrase ~e theve (i. e. before it has
ceased to drop), Vin I 50,11 (Sp) — 53,25 = 286,32 =
II 227,11 = 230,35. (cf. acchinna-dhārã below).
— (b) not torn, not ragged (of cloth), v. °-dasa & a-cchin-
naka below.

mfn. [sa. ā-cchinna,pp. of acchindati],
robbed, plundered, Vin I 343,35 (balaṁ . . . koṭṭhā-
gāraṁ); IV 245,22 (bhikkhuniyo ~ā); Nidd I 50,23
(n. loc. ~e; Nidd-a). — Ifc. v. matthakâ°(?).

(mf)n. (from acchinna), untorn
(pieces), Vin l 287,1; 297,26.

mfn., with unshaven hair, Vin
I 71,24.

mfn., who has been robbed of
his garment, Vin III 212,17; 213,4 (Sp); Ja V
212,10-12.

mfn., having no abrupt banks,
Ja V 406,25' (= 'apabbhāra').

mfn. 1acchinna + dasā), with
fringe or border of untorn cloth, Vin I 306,25 (~āni
cīvarāni).

mfn. (1a-cchinna + dhārā),
uninterruptedly streaming, with continual streams of
water, loc. ~e deve vassante: Ja II 269,10; III 37,6;
73,12. — °-dhārā, f. (or ~aṁ; adv.1), an uninter-
rupted stream (of water,); Ja I 330,21 (~aṁ devo vas-
santo); Ps II 342,6 (~aṁ katvā nadīsoto viya pavat-
teti . . . nirantaraṁ kathaṁ pavatteti).

mfn. (2acchinna + raṭṭha),
who is deprived of his kingdom, Ja VI 397,2*; 398,21'.

f. (2acchinna + *lajjitã, see
lajji(n)), absence of bashfulness, Dhp-a I 188,13 (vipat-
tiyā ~āya alajjamānā).

[mfn. w. r. for acchidda-vutti
(q. v.).]

m., the noise made of one who
has been (or pretends to have been) robbed, Ja IV 45,19.

m. [sa. akṣība, Hyperanthera Moringa],
a certain kind of tree, Ja VI 535,19*, 29' (v. l. Cks ac-
civa, Lk acchipa); Sp II 418,4 (Ce accīva).

a-cchupitvā, neg. part. & abs.,
not touching, see chupati.

3. sg. pass of next, to be inserted,
Vin II 112,36 (bahalāni maṇḍalāni na ~anti).

3. sg. (ā + √chup, to touch), to insert
(aggalaṁ, q. v., a patch in a garment); pr. 1. sg.
~emi, Vin I 290,8; 2. sg. ~esi, ib. 9; part. ~entaṁ,
ib. 5; pot. ~eyyaṁ, ib. 2; aor. ~esi, ib. i; pass.
~īyati, q. v.

mfn. (neg. of cheka), 1. not clever,
not skilful, Mil 250,30 (~ā a-sikkhitā a-sippino mati-
vippahīnā). — 2. not genuine, false (of coins), Ps II
464,15 (ayaṁ kūṭo, ayaṁ accheko [or read cheko(?),
cf. Vism 437,16]).'

(wrong spelling acchejji), aor. of
chindati, q. v.
abs., see acchindati.

mfn. (neg. grd. of chindati), not to
be severed or divided, Ps II 546,18 (nicca, etc.,
+ akkhaya).

neg. abs. = not having cut off, MN I
434,30 (see chindati).

n. [sa. ā-cchedana], robbing, plun-
dering, Ja VI 544,27* (~assa bhāyāmi).

mfn., in fear of being rob-
bed, Nidd I 50,22 (Nidd-a).

mfn. = acchariya (q. v. and cf. ācera,
macchera); ~o (dhammo) Th 552; ~aṁ lomahaṁ-
sanaṁ, Bv I 27; ~aṁ vata, Th 1085; Ja VI 97,14*;
513,28*; °-sata-maṇḍita, Saddh 244, 298; Kacc 633.

(mf)n. (from prec.) — acchariya; ac-
cherakam maiii paṭibhāti, Ja VI 24,25* (= mama
acchariyaṁ upaṭṭhāti, Ct ; Ed. accherakammaṁ
paṭ°); Ja VI 275,23'; 513,26*; ~aṁ pātihīraṁ, Bv
I 9 (Bv-a); Vv 965. — Ifc. v. ati-°.

mfn. compar. of acchera; ito pi
~aṁ, Vv 966.

mfn. = acchariya; SN I 181,5*
(~aṁ paṭibhāti mam idaṁ); Pv 444 (Pv-a 197,20).
cf. acchariya-rūpa.

mfn. ( accha + udaka), with clear
water; in the formula: ~, sātḍdaka, sītḍdaka, setaka,
sūpatittha, ramaṇīya: MN I 76,27 (pokkharanī)
— 283,36 = SN I 91,6 = AN III 190,5 (Mp); 238,11;
DN II 128,28 (Kakutthā nadī ~ikā [not ~akã] =
pasannḍdakā, Sv); — Vin III 108,15 (daho ~o, etc.
— pasannḍdako, Sp), quoted Ps III 645,15; — f. ~ā
Vv 901 (pokkharaṇī); f. pl. ~ā (pokkharañño), Vv
482. (Rem.: Kakutthaṁ acchôdi-sãtôdika-vippa-
sannaṁ, DN II 135,4*, haplology as in somana-
domanassaṁ, Sn 67, see Sadd III 158).

mfn., = acchḍdaka; m. pl. ~ikā
(selā), Th 113 = 601 ('acchḍdaka' ti vattabbe liṅga-
vipallāsena acchodikā ti vuttaṁ, Th-a).

sometimes spelt instead of the more frequent
acch°, e. g. a-chatta, a-chambhi(n), a-chinna.

√ gamane, Dhātup 58; Dhātum 71; gatikhe-
paṇe or gatimhi or visaraṇe, Mmd 640; (gamane)
khepane ca, Sadd II 188: 3. sg. ajati. Hence: acchā,
Kacc-v 640; aja, Sadd.

m. [ts.] = prec. (dimin.), Vin II 154,10
(~ā pi pasukā pi); Ud-a 82,2 (~e viya satte lāpetī
ti Ajaka-lāpako). Cf. ajikā, f.

m. (= ajagara, q. v.); ~aṁ medaṁ,
acc, Ja III 484,16* (= ajakara-medaṁ, Ct., = pim-
buru-mas, Ja-pota), the fat of serpents [a split-com-
pound like timiraṁ pupphaṁ, mūlā akusalā, q. v.].
f. Npr. of a river, Th 307—-8 (nadī).

m. Npr. of a yakkha, Ud 4,30
(Ud-a 81,17, with two etymm.). — Do. n. Npr. of a
cetiya, ii.

m., goats as a part (of the offering),
Ud-a 81,18."

m. [ts.; see also ajakara], the Python
or rock snake (= pimburu, Ja-pota, Bt, IIīnaṭ, cf.
Mil Trsl II 349, n. 2); Abh 651; Ap 129,3;.pl. ~ā, Ja
VI 507,2* (avisā mahabbalā); Mil 364,11 (~assa ekaṁ
aṅgaṁ gahetabbaṁ) = 406,17; As 375,19 (mahā, cf.
Dhp-a III 60,12).
entry.re:
— °-parivāritaajagara-parivārita, mfn., surrounded
by snakes, Mil 23,21. —- °-peta, m., a peta in the
shape of that, Dhp-a III 60,12; ~assa vatthu, n., title
of Dhp-a III 60—-64.

— °-mukhaajagara-mukha, n., the mouth of
a snake, Mil 303,15 (~en'eva ~aṁ parivattitvā).

entry.sense:
mfn. (cf. jaggati), not taken care of,
Ps II 362,12 (°-ṭṭhānaṁ jagganto).

n., the skin of a goat, Vin I 196,5
(eḷaka-camma +, cf. attharaṇa).

mfn., not decaying; n. = Nibbāna,
SN IV 369,23 (v. l. ajjaraṁ), cf. the uddāna ib. 373,20*
= Nett 55,8* (uppāda-jarãhi anabbhāhatattā ~aṁ,
Ct.); also title of the sutta SN IV 369 — °-gāmi(n),
mfn., leading to N°, SN IV 369,23.
[v. l. (v. r.) for ajaddhuka, q. v.].

mfn. [sa. a-janya, see jaññajañña],
(unfit for men), disgusting, dangerous, Ja II 437,17*
(= paṭikkūla, amanāpa, Ct., cf. Ps ad MN I 30,29),
quoted Ja III 244,6*. — n., aportent, bad omen, Abh 401.

m., the open space (of the universe),
Ps II 249,2 (~aṁ pakkhannā, scil. rasmiyo); As 14,25
(~aṁ pakkhandiṁsu, scil. rasmiyo); Mhbv 55,16,23;
As 314,21 (opp. kaṇṇacchiddâkāsa); 315,4; 346,21.
[3. sg. see √aj.]

n. or °kā, f. (?, cf. next), the practice
of abstaining from food, MN I 245,13 (= abhojanaṁ,
Ps); cf. Tr. ib. p. 550 and Ps II 391, note [the v. l.
ajajjitaṁ may mean *ajajjhitaṁ, with jjh << kṣ,
cf. Pischel § 326, Geiger § 56, if not eyen~ikaṁ from
*a-jajjhikā, f., cf. a-jānikā, HS].

(and °-mārikā), f. (a+ *jagdhu
[cf. sa. jagdhvā, √jakṣ] + māri), death from starvation,
Ja VI 63,15* (°-māri(ṁ) va khudāya mīye ṣ= anāsaka-
maraṇam eva, Ct.); — °-mārikaṁ marissati (cf.
°-khādikā, °-cārikā, etc., paronom.), AN IV 283,6 =
287,14 = 324,10 (— anātha-maraṇaṁ, Mp). — Cf. E.
Leumann, Göttingische gelehrte Anzeigen, 1.899 p. 594.

n. [ts., cf. √aj], the act of instigating or
moving, Sadd III 1259 (— 'acchā', cf. ajjhā, Kacc-v
640, where Mmd (Ce) has acchā).

m., not-country (see 3a, 2); MN II
98,1 (janapadā pi ~ā katā, depopulated) ≠ AN I 160,2.

mfn. (neg. part, of janeti), not
producing, Nidd I 51,23 (Nidd-a).

mfn. (neg. grd. of janeti), that
cannot be produced, Mp II 480,8 (°-kukkucca, see
akukkuccaka-j āta).

mfn. (see japati), not muttering prayers,
Ud-a 65,16 (in etym, of Ajapāla-nigrodha).

m. [ts.], a goat-track, Mil 280,23
(+ saṅku-patha, vetta-patha); Mp II 73,2 (°-saṅku-
pathâdayo); Nidd I 155,6 (= ajehi gantabba-mag-
gaṁ, Nidd-a).

mfn. [ts.], Utt. goat-footed, said of a
forked stick, MN I 134,17 (~ena daṇḍena); Ja IV
457,17 (do.). — °-daṇda, m. [cf. Vyu 273,94], a stick
cleft like a goat's hoof,'As 173,22 = Vism 161,30 (cf.
Ja I 241,9*, but see Ct.).
entry.re:
— °-saṇṭhānaaja-pada-saṇṭhāna, mfn., shaped
like a goat's hoof, Abhidh-av 66,27 (~e padese, the seat
of the smelling in the nose) ≠ As 310,29.

entry.sense:
m. [ts.], a goatherd, or a breeder of
goats, Dhp-a I 176,23; Ja IV 250,4; °-brāhmano, Ja
III 401,13.

m. Npr. of a purohitaputta, Ja IV
476,8; 482,9 (°-kumāra); 491,4.

m. = 1ajapāla, Dhp-a I 176,26;
Ja IV 476,8; f. ~ikā, q. v.

n., a kind of bush, Costus speciosus,
Abh 303; 1120 (= 'kuṭṭha').
f. —= Vin I 2,28—3,10 (see next).

m. = Ajapāla-nigrodha, Jina-c
283 (°mūlakarḥ).

m., a banyan tree near Uru-
velā on the Nerañjanī, where the Buddha passed (a) the
fifth and (b) the eighth week after the bodhi [according to
Ja I 78,1i—80,1; 81,5-13 ≠ Bv-a introd., As 35,9;
cf. Tuneld, Recherches (1915) p. 98 foll.]; here
lake place the interviews with (a) Mara, DN II 112,22;
SN II 03,2, 24 (104,18); (Mara and) his daughters, SN
I 122,27(—127,20); Ja l 469,15; Dhp-a I 201,1s; III
195,24; Pj II 544,20; the huhuṁkajātika-brāhmaṇa,
Ud 3,8 (Ud-a, three etymm.) ≠ Vin I 2,27 (Sp one
etym.); (b) with Brahma Sahampati (brahma-yācana):
Vin I 4,30 ≠ SN I 136,4 (138,31); SN V 167.~6; 185,5
(quoted Kv 559,29); 232,15; AN II 20,6 (Mp, one
etym.); Dhp-a I 86,15. See besides DN II 267,23 (Pan-'
casikha, 'in the eighth week', Sv); Bv II 63.

m., 'named after Ajapāla' =
prec. (cf. saññi(n) & saññita), Dāṭh I 55,60 (~ino,
scil. vaṭassa). Ajapāla-saññi
f., a female goatherd, Vin III 38,14.

mfn., born as a goat, SN II 188,17
(gen. pl. ~ānaṁ, a paraphrase to ajānaṁ sataṁ).

m.(?) [cf. sa. ajamodã and the Sinhalese
spellings ajamojaka, ajamodaka; thus -j- may be a
Sinhalese hyperpalism, HS], name of a plant, Vv-a
186,24 (tikaṭuka-° -hiṅgu-jīraka-lasuṇâdīhi kaṭuka-
bhaṇḍehi).

n., a combat of goats, DN I 6,15
(hatthi-yuddha + . . .) quoted Nidd I 366,26 (v. l.).

n., a herd of goats, Ja III 401,14,2 3*;
V 241,23*.

mfn. [ts.], not subject to old age or decay,
Ja VI 589,28* (~o tvaṁ amaro bhava); AN II 247,28
(~aṁ anuttaraṁ yogakkhemaṁ nibbānaṁ); Thī
511—12; Th 32 (opp. jīramāna).

m., a carriage drawn by goats, acc. pl.
~e, Ja VI 48,20*; 52,6'.

m., lord of goats, Ja III 279,6*; Sīmāv
24,6 (Bodhisatto).

mfn. [ts.], undecaying and immortal,
Ja III 515,23*; V 186,31'; 236,6; VI 82,28*; 300,6';
Thī 512 (read: idan tam ajarâmaraṁ padam asokaṁ,
see Thī-a 293,26); Mil 268,6; Dhp-a I 229,5.

mfn. [sa. ajaḍa], not stupid, DN III 265,16
(paññavā ~o aneḷamūgo); AN III 137,16; 175,22;
176,11; 437,4; IV 227,3 (do.); AN I 35,20 (do. pl. =
amūḷhā, Mp).

f., a ball of goat dung, Ja I 419,16 foll.
(nāḷimattā [sukkhā] ~ā, acc. pl.; = elu-beti, Ja-pota)
≠ Dhp-a II 70,11 foll.; Pv-a 283,3-7; Mp II 259,5.
f., abstr. of ajaḷa, AN III 441,7.

mfn., living after the practice of goats
(as certain ascetics), in the comp. °-govatā, m. pl.,
Ja IV 318,8. Cf. ajasīla.

mf(~ikā)n., with points
like goat's horns (said of a certain kind of shoes),
Vin I 186,12 (Sp, quoted Trsl II 15, note 6; B. reads
°-bandhikā).

f. [sa. ajavīthī], the part of the sun's
and the moon's path (from Mūlā to Uttarāsāḷhā) cor-
responding to the dry season; + nāgavīthi, govīthi,
Sp-ṭ ad Sp I 119,26.
m., a crowd of goats, Ps III 453,11.
m., the cry of a goat, Ud-a 82,3.

n., the practice of goats (as a way of
tapas), PsII 19,10; Pj II 522,15 (°-gosīla-kukkura-
sīla-°); cf. ajavata.

mfn. (cf. jahāti, pp.), not abandoned,
not forsaken, Ja VI 14,19* (siriyā ~o hoti yo mit-
tānaṁ na dūbhati).

f. [ts.], a she-goat, Abh 502; Ja III 125,6*
(~ kānā, cf. kāna-elako, ib. 10'); Ja III 401,14,19,27*;
IV 251,23* (cf. Mhbh II 2193 [66,8]); Dhp-a I 176,24.
Cf. ajī, ajikã.

mfn. [ts.], unborn, not yet developed,
Ja IV 26,6*; Dhs §1036 (~ā abhūtā asañjātā, etc., scil.
dhammā anuppannā); ~aṁ abhūtaṁ akataṁ asaṁ-
khataṁ, said of Nibbāna, Ud 80,23 (Ud-a 449,14) ≠
It 37,5 (It-a 211,2).
entry.re:
— °-pakkhaa-jāta-pakkha, mfn. [sa. ajāta-
pakṣa], whose wings are not yet developed, Ja IV
280,14*.

— °-buddhia-jāta-buddhi, mfn., who has not yet come to
years of discretion, Vism 437,10-23 (dārako).

entry.sense:
m. [sa. Ajātaçatru], Npr. of the king
of Magadha, son of Bimbisāra, and contemporary of
Buddha, generally styled rājā Māgadho ~Vedehiputto,
DN I 47,4, etc.; instr. ~unā, MN II 116,29; Ja IV
343,1; gen. ~uno, Mp II 141,2; ~ussa, DN I 49,9; Ja
IV 343,2; MN I 231,5 ; legend about his name and short
biography, Sv I 133,28 — 139,6; 153,9-27; his mother
Vedehi-kumārī (Kosala-devī, or Kosalarāja-dhītā) was
a sister of king Pasenadi, JalI 403,1β; III 121,17
(her death: Ja II 237,20); he reigned 32 years, Dīp
III 60; Mhv II 31; his capital Rājagaha, DN I 47,1;
49,31. — As a little child (Ajātasattu-kumāra) he
accompanies his father to see Jotika's palace, Dhp-a
IV 211,10; admirer and friend of Devadatta, Vin II
185,1 foll.; Ja I 185,28; 508,10; SN II 242,2; Deva-
datta incites him to kill his father and to attempt
Buddha's life, Vin II 190,15 foll., Dhp-a I 140,5 foll.;
II 164,7; Ps III 480,3; Pv-a 105,23 ; he kills his father
Bimbisāra and attacks Jotika's palace, Dhp-a IV
221,25 (cf. ib. 211,10); ~ussa pitughāta-kammaṁ,
Ja V 261,33 (cf. Mp II 141,2: ~uno kammaṁ kusala-
cchedakaṁ ahosi); his remorse, Sv I 140,13; attempts
the life of his brother Sīlava-kumāra, Th-a ad
Th 608—9; prepares an attack on the Vajjī, DN II
72,4; AN IV 17,15; he fights Pasenadi, SN I 83—85;
Ja IV 343,1 (cf. II 237,17; 403,16 foll; III 406,1);
Dhp-a III 259,7; he marries Vajira-kumāri(kā), the
daughter of Pasenadi, Ja II 404,20; his son Udāyi-
bhadda (or Udaya-bhaddaka), DN I 50,25; his fear
of king Pajjota, MN III 7,14; his enmity with the
Licchavī, SN II 268,2; he takes the refuges, DN I
85,6 foll.; his anger against Upaka, the pupil of
Devadatta, AN II 182,24; he punishes the murderers
of Moggallāna, Dhp-a III 66,20; in the 8th year
of his reign Buddha dies, DīpIII 60; Mhv II 32
(Mhv-ṭ); Mhbv 85,1i; he asks the Mallas for a portion
of the relics of Buddha, DN II 164,29 , and erects a
thūpa for that purpose, ib. 166,31; Sv II 274,3—276,3;
279,18—284,9 (cf. Bv XXVIII,2; Vv-a l 70,1; 200,2;
Pv-a 212,4); protector of the first Buddhist council (of
Mahãkassapa) at Bājagaha [a post-canonical tradi-
tion], Mhv III 16; Pj I 94,24 foll.; Sp 110,6 foll. (Sp-ṭ);
Kv-a 2,8; Sās 5,11; murdered by his son, (a tradition of
this dynasty), Sv I 153,23; Mhv IV 1—5 (Mhv-ṭ); goes
to hell in spite of his conversion and will be re-born
as a pacceka-buddha under the name of Vijitāvī (so
Bm and Sv-nṭ), Sv I 237—38.

mfn., where there is no birth, n. sg. (subst.)
~iṁ, Bv II 13 (= nibbānaṁ, Bv-a), quoted Ud-a
493,21 (where Ce confirms the reading ajātim (a)pi).

mfn. (for a-jātima(t)), base-born,
Ja VI 356,18* (gen. ~assa, opp. su-jātima(t)).
[Ja V 433,3*, see ayānaka].
or a-jānanta, neg. part, of jānāti, q. v. a-jāna

n., ignorance, Mil 266,1i (anādariyena
vā ~ena vā, scil. āpattiṁ āpajjanti); — used as a
participle in the following combinations: °-kāla, m.,
Ja VI 177,19 (tadā supaṇṇānaṁ nāge gahetuṁ ~o,
i. e. it was not known to them at that time how to catch
the snakes); — °-tā, f. abstr., Ja III 92,10' (~āya
acetanaṁ);
entry.re:
— °-bhāvaa-jānana-bhāva, m. id., Ja V 199,8 (methuna-
dhammassa).

entry.sense:
mfn., not to be known (or perhaps better
~ikā, f. secrecy (mystification), HS; Tr. suggests ajā-
niya), Ja VI 368,22 (~aṁ katvā, stealthily, without
his knowledge).

mfn. (neg. grd. of jānãti), Nidd I
360,16 (Nidd-a); Paṭis I 134,27*.
m. = aja, Vibh-a 494,13* (mṭ).

f. [ts.], a young she-goat, acc. sg. ~aṁ,
Ja III 278,1; V 243,24 (= 'ajiyaṁ', see ajī); acc. pl.
~ā, Ja I 240,18; in comp, ajikã-°: °-kkhāyita, mfn.,
gnawed by goats, Vin V 129,15 (go-khāyita+, scil.
paṁsukūla). — °-khīra, n., goats milk, Vin IV 88,34'.
entry.re:
— °-gopakaajikā-gopaka, m., a goatherd, Ja I 240,18 (pl. ~ā).
— °-sappi, n., butter of goats milk, Vin III 251,20'; IV
88,34' (go-sappi +). — Ifc. v. dhenu-°.

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. ajīrṇa, cf. jīrati], not digested
(as food), in the comp. °-âsaṁkā, f. i. e. fear of
constipation, Ja II 362,20 (v. l. B. ajīrako rogo).

mfn. [ts.], not conquered, invincible, Anāg
Ct. 67 (= 'a-parājita', synon, jetuṁ asakkuṇeyya).

m. Npr. 1. of one of the six famous leaders
of heretical sects at the time of Buddha, with the sur-
name Kesakambalī or Kesakambala, DN I 48,10
(Pūraṇa-Kassapa+); his maxims: ib. 55,14 foll. (cf.
Ja VI 225,19-31* and see Franke, Trsl. p. 50 n. 4;
58 n 12); DN II 150,29; Sn p. 92,2 (Pj II 423,6 :Ajito
ti nāmaṁ, appicchatāya kesakambalaṁ dhāresi, tena
Kesakambalī ti vuccati, and more explicitly Sv I 144,6,
quoting AN I 286,28); MN I 198,10; 250,34; II 2,30;
SN I 68,1s; IV 398,22; Vin II 111,5; Ja l 509,13;
V 246,11 ; Mil 4,18. — 2. of a brāhmaṇa, the sister's
son of Bāvari, = Ajita-mānava: Sn 1006 — 1124,
1016, 1031, 1032 (quoted As 351,16), 1035; Mp I 335,20;
Ap 335,14—337,27; author of Th 20 (Th-a); see
Ajitapañha, etc. — 3. of a bhikkhu, at the time
of the second Council, Vin II 305,33 (saṁghassa
pātimokkhuddesako); Mhv IV 51. — 4. of a general,
DN III 15,2 (~o Licchavīnaṁ senāpati). — 5. of an
ascetic, AN V 229,27 foll. (~o paribbājako). — 6. of a
brāhmaṇa, Bodhisatta at the time of the Buddha
Sobhita, Ja l 35,16 (? according to Bv VII,12 his
name was Sujāta). — 7. of a brāhmaṇa, at the time
of the Buddha Sikhī, Ap 243,21. — 8. of a pacceka-
buddha, Th-a ad Th 17.
m. Npr., v. l. for Abhitatta, Dīp III 17.

m. id. (better reading), Mhv-t(Ce 81,36)
ad Mhv II 7—11.
m. = next; SN II 47,11.

n. Npr. of a country, Dhp-a I
169,14 (v. l. Áḥakappa-raṭṭha).

n. = Ajita-māṇava-pucchā, Pj II
588,5 (°-vaṇṇanā, subscriptio); 588,13; 601,31.

n. [ts.], a skin of a deer (esp. of the black
antelope), generally used by ascetics for covering and
dress, Abh 442; Ja V 380,2* (+ dantabhaṇda); Sn
1027 (ekaṁsaṁ ~aṁ katvā); Ja V 380,6' (= ajina-
miga-cammaṁ); 407,29'; pl. ~āni, DN I 167,1 = MN
I 78,12; 308,7 = 343,10 — AN I 240,32 = 295,29
= II 206,29 = Pp 55,28 (Sv I 405,2: ajinaṁ ajina-
miga-cammaṁ = Ps II 60,6; Mp II 293,1i: ajinānī'ti
ajina-miga-cammāni); Ja VI 563,3* (~āni paridahitvā);
III 236,8' (~ehi); IV 387,9* (jaṭā ca kesā, ajināni
vatthā = sakhurāni cammăni vatthāni, Ct.); +
jaṭā-vākacīrāni, Ja I 12,32. — Ifc. v. Kaṇhâjinā,
kharâ°, gavâ°, jaṭâ°, dantâ°, Migâjina, cf. Me-*
ḷajina.
m. Npr. of a thera, author of Th 129—30.
neg. part. m. of jināti (q. v.).

m. or n.(?), only found in acc.
~aṁ (ajina + khipa (q. v.), a dress of ajina, used by
ascetics (said to consist of one whole skin, with hoofs
and hair, and split in the middle); DN I 167,1 (v. I.
°kkhisaṁ) = MN I 78,12, etc. = AN I 242,32, etc. (Sv
[Se] I 402,2: [ajinaṁ] majjhe phālita(ka)ṁ (nṭ) = Ps
II 60,6 = Mp II 293,11); Vin I 305,32 (~aṁ nivāsetvā,
v. l. °-pakkhi[ka]); III 34,30 (Sp (Se) I 322,11 : salo-
maṁ sakhuraṁ ajina-miga-cammaṁ). — °-nivattha,
mfn., who has put on a°, SN I 117,20; 118,10 (Spk I
213,3: sakhuraṁ ajina-cammaṁ ekaṁ nivattho, ekam
pāruto).

n. = ajina, Ja V 316,2; Ps III
10,6 (sakhuraṁ); Dhp-a IV 156,2 (do.); Ja IV 300,1
(kharehi ~ehi); III 85,17' (= 'ajina-sāṭī'). — °-dhara,
mfn., wearing a°, Ja VI 529,10' (= 'camma-vāsi(n)').
— °-parikkhaṭa, mfn., adorned, clothed, or furred with
that, Vin I 186,20.
entry.re:
— °-saddaajina-camma-sadda, m., sound or noise of
a°, Ap 19,4 (~ena muditā [Ed. moditã] honti devatā).

— °-sāṭikāajina-camma-sāṭikā, f., a garment made of that, Dhp-a IV
156,12' (= 'ajina-sāṭī').

entry.sense:
m. designation of a thera, Ap
213,23—214,9.

f. [sa. ajina-pattrā], a bat (vesper-
tilio), Abh 646 (≠ Am-k II 5,26). Cf. jatukā.

f., a series of skins sewed together,
DN I 7,11 (āsandi + ; Sv) = AN I 181,23 (Mp) =
Vin I 192,9 (Sp); Ja I 53,9 (sukhasamphassāya ~iyã);
Ps III 592,10.(do.).

m., a sort of deer (antelope), whose
skin is used, °-camma, n., a deer skin, Sv [Se] I 400,2
= Ps II 60,6 = Mp II 293,11 (= 'ajina'); Ja V
380,7' (do.).

m. [ts.], the family of furred animals,
Abh 617 (≠ Amarakoça II 5,8, but see ib. II 5,9).

f., a garment made 'of skins, Dhp 394
(instr. ~iyā; = sakhurā . . . ajina-camma-sāṭikā,
Dhp-a IV 156,12') = Ja I 481,28* = III 85,13* (ajina-
cammena, Ct.).

mfn., having a skin for
upper garment, Ap 19,17 (jaṭā-khāribhārikā ~ino),
cf. 129,14 (v. l.) and 244,9 (°vasano, for °vāsiko?). ajin'-uttara-vāsi

mfn. (ajina + upasevita [prob,
rather from upa-√sīv, than from upa-√sev, cf.
°upasevi(n), Ja II 275,25*, & citta-sibbana, Sn 300;
see also a-katūpasevana, HS]), covered with a skin
seating, Ja V 407,4*,2 8' (≠ Mvu II 61,2*).

mfn. [sa. ajihma], not crooked, straight,
Abh 708 (+paguṇa, uju); Mil 105,29 (+ avaṁka,
akutila, scil. nārāca). — °-tā, f. abstr., Dhs §50—51
(ujutā + ; As 151,19), 1339 (ajjavatā+).

mfn. (a + jiyā), without bow-string, Vv-a
277,13 (°-dhanu-daṇḍaka, q. v.). [ajiyaṁ, Ja V
241,24*, see ajī, f.].

[aor. l.sg., Ja VI 155,3* √Bdsajeyyaṁ),
read avajiyyaṁ with Cks in the Ct.]

n. [ts.], a court, an area, Abh 218 (+ cac-
cara, aṅgaṇa).— Ifc. v. kucchi-ãjira, gharâjira,
[Migâcira?].

mfn. [sa. ajihva, cf. jivhā], tongueless,
in the abstr. °-tā, f., Ja VI 16,27* (abl. ~ā mūgo, Ct.
ib. 17,18'); VI 295,16-17'.

mfn. (a + jivhāva(t), q. v., cf.
paññava(t)), tongueless, Ja VI 295,11* (maccho ~vā). a-jivhava

f. (cf. ajā, ajikā), a she-goat, Abh 502; acc.
ajiyaṁ, Ja V 241,24* (= ajikaṁ, ib. 243,24'; as to
this acc. form cf. nadiyaṁ [ved. nadṁ: nadyam],
DN II 135,3*; bodhiyaṁ, Ap 108,9; Bv II 183 (this
last quoted by Sadd), and itthiyaṁ = itthiṁ, Mogg-v
II 75); gen. ~iyā, Ja I 241,9* (Ct. ajāya); Thī-a 270,25
(= 'eḷakiyā').

mfn. (cf. a-jiṇṇa, jīrati), not growing
old, free from decay, Dhp-a III 122,13 (sattā ~ā nāma
n'atthi).

m. (a + pres. stem of jīrati, cf.
a-jānikā), (the symptoms of) indigestion, Ja II 362,21
(kākānaṁ ~o nāma n'atthi); ~o rogo, indigestion,
ib. 20 (v. l. for ajiṇṇâsaṁkā); Ja I 404,7 (~ena maris-
sati); II 181,9 (do.); 291,26 (atibahum bhuñjitvā
~ena kālakatam); III 213,26 (~ena kālam akāsi);
225,7 (~ena nipanno); 389,6 (~ena dubbalo ahosi).

n. (cf. jīrati), absence of old age and
decay, Spk I 112,6 (~ena = 'ajarasā').

mfn., indigestible, Pj II
153,20.

m., a fictitious Npr., 'having no long
life', Ja I 402,27 (Jīvako pi marati, Ajīvako pi
marati); 403,14 (pl. maranti ~ā pi).

m. [cf. sa. dyūta-kara], not a
gambler, Ja V 117,81' (an-akkha, a-kitava +).

mfn. (cf. jigucchati), 1. not feeling
disgust for others, Sn 852 (Nidd I 232,6). — 2. not
provoking disgust, Nidd I 232,2; Pj II 549,23 (= sam-
pannasīlāditāya a-jegucchaniyo [this prob. w. r. for
a-jigucchaniyo, neg. grd.] asecanako manāpo).

mfn. [sa. ajeya; neg. grd. of jināti,
jīyati], 1. [√ji] (of things) not losable (e. g. in
gambling): Ja VI 323,16* (ajeyya-m-esā tava hotu
mettī, = ajeyyā hotu, Ct.); [√jī] that cannot be
taken away: Khp VIII,8 (nidhi; = parehi jetvā
gahetuṁ na sakko, Pj I 223,4 [ib. 5: ajjeyyo ti pi
pāṭho, q. v.]). — 2. [√jī] (of persons) inviolable, Sn
288 (pl. ~ā, scil. brāhmaṇā, Pj); AN IV 7,15*; Ja
V 509,19* (na so rājā yo ~aṁ jināti; ~ã nāma mātā-
pitaro, ib. 510,1')..— 3. [√ji] invincible, in the comp.
°-vikkama, mfn., of invincible strength (said of
Buddha), Mhbv 33,5.
[Ja VI 155,3*, see ajiyyaṁ.]

m. pl. (aja + eḷaka), the goats and the
sheep, DN III 72,1i (~ā kukkuta-sūkarā sona-sigālā)
≠ AN I 51,24 (Mp) = It 36,10, quoted Ps'II 423,8;
cf. Mil 147,25; — AN II 42,21; 43,5* — SN I 76,22*;
— also n. sg. [sa. ajaMakam] Kacc-v 325 (ajo ca
eḷako ca ajeḷakaṁ, ajeḷakā vā, cf. Pāṇ II 4,1i); MN I
162,5 (~aṁ jātidhammaṁ, coll. goat and sheep); do.
title of a sutta, SN V 472,5.
entry.re:
— °-paṭiggahaṇaaj-eḷaka-paṭiggahaṇa, n.,
accepting goats and sheep, abl. ~ā pativirato, DN I 5,15
(Sv I 78,22) = MN I 180,12 = AN II 209,26 = Pp
58,11; ~ā appaṭiviratā, SN V 472,8.

— °-pālakaaj-eḷaka-pālaka,
m., a goat- and sheep-tender, Ps II 562,2 (= 'pasu-
pālaka').

entry.sense:
√[cf. sa. √arj]: ajjane; 3. sg. 1. [ajjati],
Dhātup 73, Dhātum 87, Sadd II 189 (cf. sa-Dhātup
7,49); — 2. [ajjeti], Dhãtup 548, Dhātum 769 (Sadd
II patisajjane; cf. sa-Dhātup 33,52). Cf. ajjita, ajji-
tabba, ajjeyya.

ind. [sa. adya], to-day, now, at this day,
Abh 1155 (= atrâhe); Kacc-v 573 (— imasmiṁ kale);
Sadd III 1167—68; Sn 153 ≠ Vin I 102,34**; Dhp
326 (ajj'ahaṁ); Pv 78 (= idāni, Pv-a); DN II 134,10
(rattiyā pacchimayāme); 148,30 (do.); MN I 393,18
(akālo kho ~... sve dānâhaṁ . . .) ; Ja I 207,13
(ajjâpi tāva, until this day, with the verb in pr. 2 sg.);
279,8; 286,18 (~ ādiṁ katvā, from to-day); Dhp-a
IV 76,16 (do., cf. Pj II 157,7); ajja paṭṭhāya, Dhp-a
I 12,8 (cf. ajjappabhuti); Ja III 217,8 (ajjâpi . . . na
. . ., not yet); 425,27* (read with Cks tassa pahūnam
ajjã, cf. bahūna); VI 309,2*; 561,20*, 21* (ajj'eva
imaṁ rattirh); ajj'etarahi, Mil 144,10; 276,4; ajja
ajj'[eva], Dhp-a III 159,19 = PsI 277,1; opp. sve:
Ps I 57,30; I 115,15 (ajja vā sve vā). — Cf. apa-
rajju, alam dān' ajja, sajju.

n. [sa. ājya], clarified butter for sacrifices,
conjectured by Kern p. 66 in Ja VI 207,2* (see
ajjhena).

or ajjuka, n. (or m.) [sa. arjaka, m.],
name of a plant (Ocimum gratissimum), Abh 579
(= sitapaṇṇāsa, sinh, hela-aṅdu); n. ~aṁ, Vin IV
35,9' (-U-; no v. l.; + phaṇijjakaṁ hiriveraṁ =
'agga-bīja') = Sv I 81,21 ' (Ed. -u-, MSS -a-;
= setapaṇṇāsa, nṭ) ≠ Spk II 331,4 (Se ajjakaṁ);
cf. ajjukaṇṇa. ajjaka

[m.], this time; abl. ~ā (yāv'), Dhp-a
I 53,9; Bv-a introd. v. 4 (CP ~aṁ); As 32,22; this
morning, acc. ~aṁ (adv.), Ja VI 180,3* (= pāto va).

mfn., born to-day, Dhp-a I 174,20
(°-dārako).
ind., v. r. for ajjuṇho (q. v.).

v.r. ajjadagge, ind., from now, hence-
forth (t: d cf. s. v. kukkuṭa-sampātika, etc.); prob.
— *ajjato agge, see anamatagga, mfn., and daharatagge,
and cf., otherwise, āyatagga, ettāvatagga, tamatagge;
Ctt. take ajjatagge = ajjatā + agge; ajjataṁ ādiṁ
katvā (Sp I 173,14 = Sv I 236,6, etc.) and explain
-d- in ajjadagge as a sandhi consonant; gramm, regard
-t- as a sandhi cons., Kacc-v 35; Sadd III 56; Pay
ad Mogg I 45). — (a) in the usual formula upãsakaṁ
mam Bhagavā dhāretu ~ pāṇupetaṁ saranagataṁ:
Vin III 6,12 (Sp see above);' DN I 85,14 (Sv do.);
MN I 24,9 (Ps); SN I 70,13 (Spk); AN I 56,10 (Mp);
Sn2 p. 16 note 1 (Pj II 157,5); Ud 49,29 (Ud-a); simi-
larly: ~ maṁ āyasmanto brahmacāriṁ (etc.) dhāretha,
AN III 216,5—-217,1; ~ maṁ Bhagavā dāsīsamaṁ ...
dhāretu, ib. IV 94,1; — (b) in other phrases (with the
foll, verb in pres. or fut.): esâhaṁ ~, AN II 199,25;
III 392,19; ete mayaṁ ~ upavasissāma, ib. V 86,12;
~ āvarāmi dvāraṁ niganthānaṁ, MN I 380,17
(quoted Sp I 173,6; Sv I 235,81; Ps I 136,27; Mp II
28,4); ~ dãn' āhaṁ uposathaṁ karissāmi, Ud 60,21
= Vin II 198,21; cf. Dhp-a I 142,11 = III 154,11;
tâhaṁ ~ paṭikkhipãmi, Vin I 56,7 ; ~ maṁ dassa-
nāyôpasaṁkama, Th 485 (here the Ct. gives ajjadagge
as first reading, and ajjatagge as pi-pãṭha); ayaṁ
~ mama putto, Ja VI 344,18.

mfn. [sa. adyatana], referring to
to-day, modern; Mogg-v VI 5* (~o kālo); Th 552
(dhammo; = adhunâgato, Th-a); n. ~ām iva (in
sandhi for ~aṁ, opp. porāṇaṁ), Dhp 227 (= adhunā
uppannaṁ, Ct.); yãv'ajjatanā (abl.), until to-day,
Ja II 409,7; III 264,21; f. ~ī (q. v.). [For ajjatana,
Vin II 275,17, read ajj'attanā, cf. ib. 275,4,6 attanā
pavāretvā; ajjattanā ti ajjatana, Vjb]. — Ifc. v.
an-°.

f. [sa. adyatanī], the aorist tense, Kacc
421 (its use; samīpe ~) ≠ Sadd III 887 sg., 891; Kacc
430 (its endings); Sadd 29,20; III 901; cf. Mogg
VI 4, Būp 452—3.
entry.re: — °-vibhattiajjatanī-vibhatti, f., id., Kacc-v 421.

entry.sense:
f. abstr. of ajja, the time of to-day, an
artificial word only used in the phrase ~taṁ ādiṁ
katvā, explaining the sense of ajjatagge (q. v.):
Sp I 173,14; Sv I 236,6; Spk I 159,20; PsI 137,1;
Mp II 28,12; Pj II 157,β; Ud-a 288,14; ajjatañ ca.
SN I 83,29 (no Ct.), is prob. w. r. (cf. v. l. ajj'eva),

[pr. 3 sg. [sa. √arj], to get, obtain, Ja III
263,4*, doubtful conjecture by Kern p. 67 for majjati,
q. v.]. Cf. √ajj.

ind., from to-day, Mhv XLVII 28; cf.
ajjatagge.

v. r. for ajjatagge (q. v.), cf. yadagge,
tadagge, and the v. l. daharadagge.

m. [sa. adya-divasa], the present
day, Ja IV 109,3' (opp. hiyyo-divasa): Ps TI 249,7
(yāv'~ã); III 378,5 (do.); MhvXXXII,23 (do.). Cf.
ajjekadivasaṁ.

n. [sa. arjana], getting, acquiring, = √ajj
& √sajj2, Dhātup 73, 548; Dhātum 87, 769; Sadd II
189; Saddh 98 (~âdīni dukkhāni).
entry.re:
— °-ârahaajjanâraha, mfn.,
worthy of being acquired, Pj I 223,6 (= 'ajjeyya').

entry.sense:
ind. [sa. adya-prabhṛti], from
or after to-day, Kacc-v 421.

[prob, for *accabhamu, mfn.; see
acc°, ajjha°, and cf. sa. atibhrū, 'highbrowed', frown-
ing; Ja VI 476,12* (Ed. ajja bhamuṁ, Se accabha-
muṁ, Ja-pot ajjābhamuṁ; = evaṁ atikkamitvā
ṭhitabhamuṁ, Ct.). [ajjābhamu]
[w. r. for ajajjara (q. v.).]

f., this night, last night; acc. ~iṁ
(cf. ajja-kālaṁ), Ja III 506,6; Dhp-a II 265,13; loc.
~iyaṁ (or ~iyā), Ja III 23,3 (~ paccūsasamaye, this
(coming) morning); cf. ajja . . . rattiyā, DN II 134,10;
148,30; ajja rattibhāge, Ja VI 370,25V

m. n. [abstr. from uju, sa. ārjava; Kacc-v
404 ājjava (Ee ājava), criticized by Sadd III 857,
admitting ajjavo (cf. gārava, m.) and 'rarely' ajjavaṁ;
Mogg IV 139 only ajjavaṁ], straightness, rightness,
honesty: nom. sg. (a) ajjavo ca maddavo ca, Dhs
p. 7,29 (As 53,13; quoted Sadd III 857); Dhs 1339
(see Vyu 126,14-15, but also Mvu I 133,8-9);
— (b) ajjavañ ca maddavañ ca, khantī ca soraccañ ca,
AN I 94,24 (Mp, Mp-ṭ); Sn 292 (acc); Ja III 274,1*
(do.?); ajjavañ ca lajjavañ ca, khanti ca soraccañ ca,
DN III 213,1 (Sv) cf. Mhv LXXXIV, 23: addava . . .
lajjidhamma [addava blending of ajjava and mad-
dava]; instr, ajjavena javena maddavena khan-
tiyā soraccena, AN II 113,24 = III 248,10 (Mp III
94,3). — Ifc. v. an-°. — °-tā, f. id., Dhs 1339.
— °-maddava, n. (dvandva), honesty and kindness,
Sn 250 (~e rato, = ujubhāve ca mudubhãve ca rato,
Pj). — °-lakkhaṇa, mfn., characterized by straight-
ness, Abhidh-av 20,30 (cf. As 131,9).

ind. (from ajja saṭṭhī, to-day is
the sixth day), six days ago, SN I 170,20*, 34* ( =
ajja cha-divasa-matthakā paṭṭhāya, Spk).

ind. (i. e. ajja + sve (suve), two
words cf. Pāṇ V 2,13), to-day or to morrow, Ja III
260,12* (~ ti puriso sadatthaṁ nâvabujjhati); Ja V
66,9* (Ed. ajja suve ti saṁseyya); Pv 512 (ajja suve;
but--------).

mfn. [pp. of √ajj; sa. arjita], acquired,
gained, Saddh 98 (cf. ajjana). — ajjitabba, mfn. [do.
ger.], Pj I 223,5 (synon, ajjanâraha).
n., see ajjaka.
m. Npr. of a bhikkhu, Vin III 66,25 foll.

m., name of a certain tree, Ja VI
535,15* (ajjukā ~ā ca, Se; Ee ajjunā °kannā; cf.
Ap 346,3). Cf. Kern p. 68.
f., a courtesan, MTD (from Am-k I 7,11).

(or ajjaṇho), ind., (only) this day (ɔ:
the rest of the present day-and-night), Vin I 25,19*
(viharemu ~ aggisālamhi); III 220,29 (~ bhante
āgamehi; Sp = bhante ajja ekadivasaṁ amhākaṁ
tiṭṭha, adhivāsehîti attho; Sp-ṭ: ~ ti pāṭhe ajjaṇho
ti pi paṭhanti; Vmv: ajjaṇho = ajja ekadivasaṁ;
cf. also Mogg III 118); Vin IV 80,2. According to Kern
p. 68 haplology for ajja + *juṇho 'this evening', but
more likely representing *adyu (= adya, cf. aparajju,
sajju) + ahnaḥ, cf. ved. idā(nīm) ahnaḥ- Cf. ajj'eka-
divasaṁ and see aṇha ifc. ajjuṇho

entry.re:
— °-'rukkhaajjuna-'rukkha,
m. id., the Bo-tree of Buddha Anomadassi(n), Bv
VIII 23; Ja I 36,6; Dhp-a I 105,25.

entry.sense:
m. Npr. 1. of the seventh son of Deva-
gabbhā, Ja IV 81,7 ≠ Pv-a 93,21; 111,18. — 2. of
the Pāṇḍu-son Arjuna, Ja V 424,20*; 426,10', 31'
(°-kumāra). — 3. of a king of the Kekakā (Arjuna
Kãrtavīrya, Mhbh), Ja V 135,24 (sahassabāhu);
143,12*-27* (≠ Mvu III 368,15*; 369,6*); 145,7' (sa-
hassabāhurājā . . . Mahiṁsakaraṭṭhe); 267,5* (Keka-
kâdhipo sahassabāhu); °-vatthu, n., Ja V 119,15'
(Mvu III 361,4—ll). — 4. of a thera, author of Th 88
(= Ajjuno isi, Uddāna ib.) ≠ Sālapupphadāyaka,
Ap 169,6-19. — 5. of a Buddha, Ap 446,19.

m., designation of a thera,
Ap 450,16—451,3 (= Sambhūta, Th-a ad Th 291
— 94). Cf. ajjunaṁ pupphaṁ, ib. 450,20.

ind. (= ajja + ekadivasaṁ),
for to-day, only this day, Ps I 161,7; III 412,18. Cf.
ajjuṇho.

ind (= ajja 4- ekarattiṁ), for
this one night, Ps I 233,11

ind. (= ajja + etarahi), nowadays.
Mil 152,18.

[pr. 3 sg. (cf. √ajj), to acquire, gain,
see next],

mfn. (grd.), v. r. for ajeyya, Khp VIII 8
(= ajjitabba ajjanâraha Pj, but probably = *a-jyeya
(√jī), cf. sa. (brahma-)jyeya).

prp. = adhi (this often takes the place
of sa. abhi) before vowels, Kacc 45; Sadd III 58.

[adhi + 2a] tends to independence: 1) [cf.
2a Rem. b] in ajjhagata ajjhapatta, °patvā; this and
other phenomena have contributed to the 'new set of
prefixes': acca-(yanti; -bhamuṁ, see ajjăbhamu),
ana-(bhāva), anva-(gū mfn.), antara-(hita, antara-
dhāyati), uda-(patta), nira-(ssajanti), pacca-(niyyāhi,-
cf. pacca-m-etha; PED's paccagū is w. r.), vya-
(mhita, vyasanna). — 2) in agāraṁ ajjha so vasi
('tmesis'), Bv [II 208 III 26 IV 19] V 22 [VI 17]
etc. (in V 22, Bv-a Ce prints agãra-majjhe so vasi,
against metre and CP), quoted Sadd III 132. — [ajjha,
AN I 279,26* (Ck ajjhā) w. r. (?) for addhā (Sc) q. v.].

m. [sa. adhyakṣa], a superintendent,
Abh 343. — Ifc. v. vaṇṇa°.

[Ja V 255,19*, read dīpam so n'
ajjhagā, 'gacchi agati yattha . . ., cf. adhigacchati.]

pp. of adhigacchati (see ajjha above)
= adhigata (q. v.). Only ifc, v. veda°.
ajjhagā, ajjhagū, see adhigacchati.

[(v. l. ajjhagāhāsi), Ja V 255,16*
(samuddaṁ ~, read: samudda-majjhagā 'hãsi, cf.
harati).] Cf. Mvu III 454,2.

mfn., from ajjhattaṁ, ind. (q. v.),
attracted by nouns in certain formulas: pl ~ā dhammā,
bahiddhā dhammā, ajjhatta-bahiddhā dhammā, Dhs
p. 2,17 (As 46,3 foll.), 1044-46; ~ ā kāmā, Nidd I l,is;
vedanā~ā, Vibh 3,29; acc ~e dhamme, Vibh 327,42
(but bahiddhā dhamme, ib. 328,4); f. sg. sabbā va
paññā siyā ~ā, siyā bahiddhā . . ., Vibh 327,39
(Vibh 3,8); m. sg. vedanākkhandho atthi ~o, atthi
bahiddho . . . Vibh 17,22 (cf. ~aṁ saṁyojanaṁ, ib.
361,14), etc.; Abh 1040 takes ~aṁ as subst, n.,
~aṁ sasantāne visaye gocare. — Ifc. v. ajjhatta°,
gocara°, niyaka°, visaya°

ind [sa. adhyātmam], within one's
self [the ambiguous yaṁ rūpaṁ . . . ~ vā bahiddhā
vā, etc., gave rise to vedanā ~ā vā bahiddhā vā,
whence "ajjhatta, mfn"; Ct.s often gloss by an adj.,
but Vism 349,22 compares adhitthi (ɔ: sa. adhistri, see
Kāçikā ad Pãṇ II 1,6); gocarajjhatta, etc. are subst.s];
often used as an attribute to a subst, following, cf.
bāhirena nahānena . . . ajjhattaṁ nahānaṁ, SN V
390,21; ~ eva jalayāmi jotiṁ, SN I 169,21* (cf. ib.
27*); + paccattaṁ: MN I 185,16 (Vism 349,19);
Dhs 1044; Vibh 3,30 (cf. also ajjhāgāre). — Selected
passages to show various combinations: A. with verbal
forms: (a) of √ṭhā [sthā] in expressions of repose,
or balance of mind, ~ me cittaṁ ṭhitaṁ susaṇṭhitaṁ,
AN IV 299,22; ṭhito kayo hoti, ṭhitaṁ cittaṁ ~
susanthitaṁ, SN V 74,7; cittaṁ ~ yeva santiṭṭhati,
etc., 'AN I 254,29 (Mp) = II 157,22 (Mp); ~ eva
cittaṁ saṇṭhapemi ... ekodikaromi, MN I 116,14;
III 112,16 (quoted As 46,7); likewise: ~ sampasādanaṁ
cetaso ekodibhāvaṁ, Vin III 4,9 (Sp) = DN I 37,12
(Sv; Vism 156,9) = Dhs 161 (As 169,9) = Pp 59,30,
etc. ≠ Mvu I 228,5 (2nd jhāna); ~ susamāhito, AN
II 29,2l* (Mp); Th 431 (visayajjhatta-°, Th-a); 272
(gocarajjhatta-°, Th-a); — (b) with forms of √sam1
[cam], expressions of peace or tranquillity (cf. ajjhatta-
santi): ~ eva upasame . . . ~ upasantassa, Sn 919;
~ samayaṁ cittaṁ, It 82,7*; ~ vūpasantacitto,
AN IV 437,11; [~ avūpasantaṁ hoti, AN I 79,31
scil. taṁ adhikaranaṁ?]; ~ cetosamatham anuyutto,
MN I 33,10 (Ps) = AN V 133,2 (Mp) ≠ It 39,10;
nânuyuñjati ~ cetosamathaṁ, AN III 86,30 (Mp);
lābhī ~ cetosamathassa, AN II 92,14 ≠ IV 360,4;
— (c) with katḥaṁkathī, expressing 'doubt': MN
1 8,13 (Ps); SN II 27,5 (Spk); cf. Sn 7 (vitakkā . . .
~ suvikappitā); — (d) with manasi-karoti, ex-
pressing 'reflection, consideration': itthī ~ itthin-
driyaṁ manasikaroti, AN IV 57,5; ~ suññataṁ m°,
MN III II 2,1 (cf. ~ suññataṁ upasampajja vihari-
tuṁ, MN III 111,7, quoted As 46,14); — (e) with
upaṭṭhapeti, expressing 'carefulness, attention': pañca
dhamme . . . ~ upaṭṭhapetvā, AN V 79,9; maraṇa-
saññā ~ sñpaṭṭhitā, AN II 156,1; ānâpāna-sati ~
parimukhaṁ sūpaṭṭhitā, It 80,12; kãyagatāya satiyā
~ sūpa[ti]ṭṭhitāya, Ud 28,3 (Ud-a); pañcasu dham-
mesu ~ sati upaṭṭhapetabbā, AN V 335,30; cf.
~ payuttassa, Ja V 121,15*; — (f) with uppajjati,
atthi, etc. = something is met with: kati . . . purisassa
dhammā ~ uppajjamānā, SN I 70,21 (Spk); kāye
sati kāya-sañcetanā-hetu uppajjati~sukha-dukkhaṁ,
SN II 40,1 = AN II 158,1; yā kāci taṇhā ~, Sn 916;
~ kāmacchando, SN V 110,4; atthi me ~ (on my
body) aṅganan ti, MN I 24,18; atthi me ~ kãma-
cchando ti, AN I 272,16; atthi me ~ rāga-dosa-moho
ti, SN IV 139,14; ~ cakkhuṁ suññaṁ, Paṭis II 181,4;
~ dhamme vavattheti, Palis I 76,15; — (g) with
paṭisaṁvedeti, expressing 'enjoyment': ~ anavajja-
sukhaṁ (avyāseka-sukhaṁ) p°, DN I 70,5 (22) (Sv)
— MN I 180,26 = 269,1 = 346,10 = AN II 210,4
≠ DN I 70,22. — B. Next to instances like AN V
79,9-10 (pañca dhamme ~ paccavekkhitvā . . . paro
codetabbo) & AN II 92,14 (ajjhattaṁ : adhipaññā),
ajjhattaṁ stands opposed to bahiddhā (see also
ajjhatta, mfn.): [in āryā]: ~ athavā pi bahiddhā,
Sn 917; [in vaitālīya]: ~ bahiddhā ca, Sn 516—532;
[in çloka]: ~ ca bahiddhā ca, Sn 203; 738 (= SN IV
205,3*); Sn 1111; 1113; Th 172; 439; [triṣṭubh-stple]:
ajjhatta-cintī na mano bahiddhā nicchãraye, Sn 388,
and the like; —- more elaborate antitheta: ~ ca na
jānāti (ca pajānāti) bahiddhā ca na passati (ca
vipassati), AN II 71,18* (22*) = Th 470 (472);
~ saṁkhittaṁ . . . bahiddhā vikkhittaṁ, AN IV
32,21; SN V 263,21, cf. It 94,2; ~ rūpasaññī bahiddhā
rūpāni passati, AN I 40,11 (Mp); IV 305,9 = V 61,5;
MN II 12,32; DN II 110,7 (Sv). = III 260,8 (the
eight abhibhāyatanāni), cf. Vibh 342,33; ~ dhammesu
sati . . . bahiddhā dhammesu sati, Vibh 228,2; vivā-
damūlaṁ ~ vā bahiddhā vā, AN III 334,22 ; ~ vā
kāye kāyânupassī viharati bahiddhā vā . ., MN I
56,27; ~ vā dhammesu dhammânupassī . . ., ib.
60,28 (quoted As 46,10); SN V 143,14; 297,β; DN II
292,1 foll.; Vibh 193,3 (the four satipaṭṭhānāni); yaṁ
kiñci rūpaṁ ~ vā bahiddhā vā . . ., AN I 284,25
= II 171,12 = MN I 138,37 = 234,34 = 421,4 =
III 16,33 = SN II 252,19 = III 47,13 = IV 382,28;
Vibh 1,4.

mfn., having his thought oc-
cupied with internal things, m. ~ī, Sn 174 (Pj: niya-
kajjhatta-cintana-sīlo); 388. ajjhatta-cinti

mfn., personal, in the strict
sense of the word, As 46,5 (opp. gocarajjhatta, etc.)
(mt); Pj II 21,9 (°-bhūte citte). — °ika, mfn., id.,
Sv III 294,3.

n., the triplet beginning with
ajjhatta, = Dhs p. 2,17-18 (As 46,1-22) ≠ Tikap
335,28; Nidd-a ll 6,19 (ad Nidd II,is).

f., the question or theme of
'ajjhatta', Nidd I 340,27 (+ bahiddhā-p°, ajjhatta-
bahiddhā-p°).

mfn., = 'ajjhatta-saṁyo-
jana' (q. v.), Pp-a 203,30.

mfn. (cf. next, & ajjhatta,
mfn.), (partly) internal and (partly) external, Vibh
17,24; 327,40. — °-ā, ind., MN I 56,29 (Ps I
249,24); III 112,8; SN V 297,9; 315,4 (Spk); Vibh
193,5; 194,11 (Vibh-a 260,32); DN II 292,2 (Sv).
— °-ârammaṇa, mfn. (see ajjhattârammaṇa below), Dhs
p. 2,20; 1049; Vibh 328,7; Vism 430,1 . . . 435,8;
— °-pucchā, f., Nidd I 340,28 (ajjhatta-pucchā +,
q. v.). — °-rūpa, n., Vin III 112,31'; 113,9' (see
ajjhatta-rūpa).
entry.re:
— °-vatthukaajjhatta-bahiddha-vatthuka, mfn., having both an
internal and an external base, As 191,8 (°-esu kasiṇesu).

entry.sense:
mfn. = ajjhatta-bahiddha
(dvandva), in the uddāna SN IV 6,22* (tayo ~ā, scil.
aniccaṁ dukkhaṁ anattā ca).

m., one's own brother, a full
brother, Mp I 226,14 (Se; Ce ajjhattika-bhātiko, see
ajjhattika (c)).

mfn., 'delighting in one's own self
i. e. in the practise of meditative exercise, ~o samāhíto,
Ud 64,30* ( = niyakajjhatta-rato, Ud-a) — DN II
107,5* (- do., Sv) = SN V 263,3* (= do., Spk)
= AN IV 312,3* (= do., Mp) (quoted Nett 60,32
(Nett-a), As 46,8); Dhp 362 (= gocarajjhatta-saṁ-
khātāya kammatthānabhāvanāya rato, Dhp-a) ≠ Th
981 (= do., Th-a).

n., something of one's self, Vin
III 112,31' (= ajjhattaṁ upādinna-rūpa, ib. 113,7',
Sp); Ps I 219,24.

n., analysis of internal
factors, Paṭis I 76,13 (~e paññā).

m., personal emanci-
pation, SN II 54,1 (abl. ~ā; = ajjhatta-saṁkhāre
pariggahetvā patta-arahattena . . ., Spk II 82,3
— 83,18). ajjhatta-vimokkha

m. (gender attraction), (being)
a discarding of internal factors, Paṭis II 36,15 (~o
vimokkho = cattāri jhānāni, opp. bahiddhāvuṭṭhāno
vim° = catasso arūpa-samāpattiyo).
n., see ajjhattika-vera.

mfn., having fetters within
one's self, AN I 63,22 (~aṁ puggaiaṁ; Mp: ajjhatta-
saṁyojanena payutto puggalo); Pp 22,11 (= ajjhatta-
bandhano, Pp-a); — n., internal fetters,Vibh 361,15 (Ed.
ajjhattaṁ s°; Vibh-a 495,9: ajjhatta-saṁkhāte kāma-
bhave bandhanaṁ); Mp II 45,10 (= ajjhatta-saṁ-
khãte kāmabhave chandarāgo).

m. pl., internal dispositions,
Spk II 82,3.

f., inner peace, Sn 837—38
(= nibbāna, Pj; cf. Nidd I 185,1 (Nidd-a)).

mfn., originating from
within, f. ~ā (hirī), Ja I 207,17 (opp. bahiddhā-
samuṭṭhānaṁ ottappaṁ) ≠ Ps II 422,20; Sv ad DN
I 204,10 (do. scil. rogo).

[mfn., id., Th 1126 (~ o,
a doubtful reading; metre requires - - ˇ - - ˇ ].

n., the personal void (unsub-
stantial), Patis II 181,3 (cakkhuṁ, etc.).

mfn., taking something in-
terior (personal) for its object, Dhs p. 2,19; 1047
(~ā dhammā); Vibh 63,16 (cattāro khandhā ~ā);
327,41 (~ā paññā + bahiddhârammaṇā p°, ajjhatta-
bahiddhârammaṇā p°). — °-ttika, n., Tikap 335,30
(cf. Dhs p. 2,19-20).

mfn. [from ajjhattaṁ, q. v.; sa. ādhyāt-
mika], 'belonging to one's self (opp. bāhira), Vism
450,26 (cakkhādi-pañcavidhaṁ attabhāvaṁ adhikicca
pavattattā ~aṁ); SN I 73,2 (bāhirā h'esā rakkhā,
n'esā rakkhā ~ā): (a) belonging to the body or indivi-
duality: ~assā upādāya, AN II 212,9 = Vibh 392,20
(= ~aṁ khandha-pañcakaṁ upādāya, Mp, Vibh-a;
quoted Ps I 219,27); tayo khandhā bāhirā, viññāṇa-
kkhandho ~o, Vibh 67,24; rūpaṁ ~aṁ, Vibh 13,12;
Dhs 673; 751; — paṭhavī-dhātu siyā ~ā siyā bāhirā,
MN I 185,14-22 (quoted Vism 348,3l); 421,33 = AN
II 164,28 (+ āpodhātu, etc.; Mp); Vibh 82,5; dvādasa
dhātuyo ~ā, Vibh 96,13; — cha ~āni āyatanāni
(ɔ: cakkhāyatanaṁ . . . manāyatanaṁ, opp. cha
bāhirāni ā° ɔ: rūpâyatanaṁ . . . dhammâyatanaṁ),
MN III 216,9; Khp IV 6 (quoted As 46,12); DN III
243,14 (Sv); AN V 52,31; MN III 32,3; châyatanā
~ā, châyatanā bāhirā, Vibh 79,27; their assāda: SN
IV 7,2 foll. (Spk); they are dukkhaṁ ariyasaccaṁ,
SN V 426,8 (cf. Vibh 119,25); they are styled piyarūpa-
sātarūpaṁ, It 114,12 (It-a), αndvaṇo, MN II 260,15,
eko anto, AN III 400,25;— pañcannaṁ viññāṇānaṁ
vatthū ~ã, Vibh 319,25; — ~aṁ cakkhuṁ apari-
bhinnaṁ hoti . . ., MN I 190,20 foll.; cha indriyã
~ā, Vibh 131,41; — ~ā dhammã, Dhs p. 5,24;
1530; ~o lobhacoro, Dhp-a l 312,10 (Ed. ajjhan-
tiko); — n. — cittaṁ, Nidd I 346,24. — (b) inte-
grant, indispensable, in ~aṁ aṅgaṁ (conditio sine qua
non): It 9,13; SN V 101,17; AN I 16,23 (Mp: niya-
kajjhattavasena). — (c) belonging to one's own house
or relationship, ~aṁ janaṁ, Ja III 402,21'; ~o
ekapitaro, Ja VI 446,2'; (cf. ajjhatta-bhātika, aj-
jhattika-saṅgaha). — — °-kammaṭṭhāna, n., one's
own (special) spiritual exercise, Dhp-a I 375,14 (~aṁ
sammasanto); II 226,18 (do.). —- °-karaṇa, n., a
personal instrument (e. g. the eye), Clough, Pali
Gr. p. 133,21, cf. Sadd III 552; Rūp 287b. — °-dāna,
n., a gift of something of one's self (one's own body),
Ja IV 402,11. — °-duka, n., a chapter of Dukap,
Tikap 337,9. — °-bāhira, mfn., — ajjhatta-bāhira,
MN I 61,12 (Ps); III 32,28; 63,1s; Dhp-a I 158,24;
Mil 69,2; Nett 191,17 (Nett-a); Vism 368,25.
— °-vatthu, n., an object forming part of one's self
(Ghilders, cf. Ja IV 402,12).
entry.re:
— °-vatthukaajjhattika-vatthuka, mfn.,
having its physical base in the interior, individual, Vibh
307,16; 319,24 (scil. viññāṇa). — °-vera, n., enmity
(malice) from within (one's self), i. e. from fear of
revenge (opp. bāhira-vera), Spk II 93,17; 94,3 ( =
ajjhatta-vera, ib. &).

— °-saṁgahaajjhattika-saṁgaha, m., kindliness
to one's own people, Ja III 402,26 (opp. āgantuka-s°).
— °-santati, f., personal subsistence, Ps I 209,8.
— [°-sutta, n., = SN III 180—1.]

entry.sense:
mfn. [ajjha (q. v.) + *patta =
patita, pp. of adhi-patati, sa. abhipatati; metrically
- ˇ - ≃ (cf. udapatta), but Mss often spell ajjhappatta,
and Ct.s take it from pra + √āp (see below), perhaps
under influence of the formula idha-m-ajja patto,
Ja III 529,1*; V 137,28*, cf. Pv 78], I. who has flown
at (over), rushed on, 'pounced upon' (said of birds
and beasts of prey), with acc.: lāpa(ṁ)-sakuṇaṁ sahasā
~o, SN V 147,11 (= lobhasāhasena patto, Spk) ≠
Ja II 59,21; lāpaṁ . . . sahasā ~o, Ja II 60,10*; so
maṁ patitvā sahas' ajjhapatto, Ja V 198,1* (= sam-
patto); atha naṁ so sakuṇo ~o, Dhp-a I 164,13;
bhujaṅgamo kakkaṭaṁ ~o, Ja III 296,2* (= sam-
patto); vanam ~ ā, DN II 259,1* (= do. Sv); ma-
hodadhiṁ haṁsa-r-iv' ~o, Sn 1134; tam uttamāsu
veṇīsu ~o parāmasi, Ja V 158,6* (= sampatto;
Ed. ajjhapatto, Ck ajjhāpanno and (158,23') aj-
jhepatto); without object: Ja II 450,27* (= upagato
... pakkhanto). — 2. fallen down (in a swoon): tarn
~aṁ rājaputtiṁ udakena abhisiñcatha, Ja VI 566,30*
(see Ct. and ib. 566,8* papatā chamā). Cf. next.

abs. of prec. hastening to, Bv X 3
(read with Ct.: tam ~ upanisīdi [and scan ˇ - ˇ - -
ˇ ˇ - ˇ ];
= patvā adhipatvā upagammā ti attho).
Cf. udapatvā.

[SN V 218,19, w. r. for accasarā,
see atisarati.]

ajjhabhī, ajjhabhū, aor. see adhi-
bhavati.

aor. 3 sg. of adhi + √bhās1, to
address, Sn2 p. 13,20 (Bhagavantaṁ gāthãya ~,
