= abhāsi, Pj); 32,10, etc.; Vin I 7,3; II 195,27;
SN I 5,3; 103,14 (paccabhāsi, ib. 103,1s; v. l. paccaj-
jhabhāsi); IV 117,14; DN II 39,9; Dhp-a I 433,10;
Pv-a 56,10, etc. —- 3 sg. med. (a) °-bhāsittha, Ja IV
234,29*; VI 22,27* (Cks), 448,14*; (b) °-bhāsatha, Ja
IV 210,19* (quoted Mil 173,2*); IV 258,25*; V 344,20*
= 348,12*; 349,12* (paccabh°, ib. 349,13*), etc.

n. [sa. adhyayana; cf. ajjhãna,
I ajjhayana & ajjhena below], reading, learning (by
heart), studying (the Vedas), Mil 225,31 (+ ajjhāpana,
etc.); Dhātum 759 ( = √cacc); Sadd III (Ce p. 775,
31*, 3 6), Pay II 37 (giving the sense of prp. adhi,
e. g. vyākaraṇaṁ adhīte). Cf. ajjhāyati & 1ajjheti,
adhīyati (adhīte).

ajjhayitabba, mfn. grd., see
iajjheti.
aor., see adhivāseti.

aor. 3 sg. [ajjha (q. v.) + -v-odahi,
cf. odahati; or perhaps blending of ajjh-odahi and
*ajjh-ava-dahi, cf. anavosita, nirassajanti]; pañjare ~,
he put (them) into the cage, Ja V 365,29* (= odahi
ṭhapesi).

(or acchā), f. = ajana (q. v.), Kacc-v 640
(from √aj); Sadd III 1259.

in yāvat-ajjhā-vinīta, (v. r. to yāvatā ca
vi°) AN I 285,33, prob, represents ajjhāya, as aññā
for aññāya in sammad-aññā-vimutta and pariyā for
pariyāya in pariyāgata, sajjhā for sajjhāya in sajjhā-
magga (Ai Gr I § 241, b).

ind. [loc. of adhi + ăgāra; as to
'governing prepositions' see (besides cases reported
under agga-, anto-, bahi-, pāra-, cf. Schubring ad
Kalpasūtra I 11 p. 37) (a) loc.: ajjhācāre ajjhājīve
ajjhārāme ajjhokāse, adhi-citte (adhi-cetasi, JAs
1912,243) adhi-sīle adhi-paññãya adhi-pātimokkhe,
abhi-dhamme abhi-vinaye; (b) acc. m.: adhi-Brah-
mãnaṁ, pl. adhi-deve; (c) acc. n. (as in sa.): ajjh-
! attaṁ ajjh-āsayaṁ adhi-cittaṁ adhi-jegucchaṁ adhi-
paññaṁ adhi-vimutti adhi-sīlaṁ, abhi-dassanaṁ
(Ja VI 193,22*), abbh-atthaṁ, — hence comp, nouns
as ajjhokāsa-gata ajjhiṇa-mutta adhisīla-sikkhā abhi-
dhamma-kathā (paron, in MN I 214,24, etc.) adhi-
deva-ñāṇa-dassana, and secondary nouns as abhi-
dhamma (abbhokāsa); Ct.s (see also Nidd on adhi-
deve, Sn 1148, and cf. abhivinayo . . . adhipātimok-
khaṁ, Vin V 1,17-18) mostly: "adhisīlaṁ = uttama-
sīlaṁ", and the like, Sv ad DN I 174,15], at home,
AN I 132,2 (= sake ghare, Mp) = II 70,14 = II
109,21 (It-a = do.).
grd. of next, = ajjhācariya, q. v.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. adhy-ā + √car], 1. to
practise (something bad), commit (acc.), AN IV 270,1i
(yaṁ bhattu amanāpa-saṁkhātaṁ, opp. bhattu
manāpaṁ carati); As 89,24 (dussīlyaṁ); inf. ~ituṁ,
Vin II 301,6; DN III 133,13 (nava ṭhānāni); MN I
523,4 (pañca ṭhānāni) ≠ AN IV 370,2 (= pañca
kāraṇāni atikkamituṁ, Mp); Mil 266,31 (yaṁ kilesaṁ
lokavajjaṁ); pp. ajjhāciṇṇa, grd. ajjhācariya (ajjhā-
caraṇīya) q. v. — 2. to have intercourse with, aor. 3
pl. ~iṁsu, Ja IV 231,18 (aññamaññaṁ; cf. ajjhācāra).

grd. of prec; °-vatthu, n., object
of offence, Pj I 31,1i (v. l. ajjhācaraṇīya-v°, ib. Ap-
pendix Pj II 866).

m. (cf. ajjhācarati), transgression, fault,
Abh 430 (= vītikkama); kāyika-vācasika-°, Sp I 19,1
(= saññamavelaṁ abhibhavitvā pavatto ācāro ~
vītikkamo, Sp-ṭ); esp. in an erotica! sense, Vin III
121,8' (= 'kāya-saṁsagga', Sp ad Vin III 120,34**,
Sp-ṭ); 128,35' (explaining 'obhāseyya'; Sp); Mil 127,20;
Sp I 216,8 (°-malinatta, n., q.v.);Ja I 396,4; V 429,22
[in Ja V 318,18* w. r. for ajjhãvara, q. v.; in Sv III
129,15 read with pt: tasmiṁ anajjhācāro acalo].
[Nett-a reads ajjhācāro for sampādanaṁ, Nett 44,18
and explains adhiṭṭhahitvā ācaraṇaṁ, thus making
it a counterpart to an-ajjhācāro, Nett 44,15.] — Ifc.
v. an-°, punappuna°, vatthu°, sulabha°.

ind. [loc. see under ajjhāgāre], in
matter of conduct; adhisīle sīlavipanno ~ ācāravipanno,
atidiṭṭhiyā diṭṭhivipanno, Vin I 63,33 (Sp); 67,9;
114,25,36 (Vjb Sp-ṭ ad Vin II 3,8; in atidiṭṭhiyā
ati- for adhi- may be due to the later analysis referred
to s. v. ajjhāgāre, cf. ajjhāsayaṁ ādibrahmacariyaṁ;
according to Sp adhisīle here means 'as to Pārājikā
and Saṁghādisesā', while ajjhācāre is 'as to the other
five āpattikkhandhā').

mfn. (pp. of ajjhācarati), practised,
accustomed, committed; bahuṁ assāmaṇakaṁ ~aṁ,
Vin II 80,34; MN II 248,15; 250,3 foll'.; idaṁ me
upajjhāyena ~aṁ, Vin II 301,5; vasalavādo dīgharat-
taṁ ~o, Ud 29,1 (v. r. for samudāciṇṇo, Ud-a 194,13).

ind. (adhi + ājīva, loc; see under
ajjhāgāre), with regard to the rigours of the regimen;
~vā adhipātimokkhe vā, MN II 245,17 (= ājīva-
hetu, ājīvakāraṇā, Ps).

n. = ajjhayana (cf. ajjhāyana, ajjhena),
Dhātum 580 (= √i).

pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ā + k'pad), 'to go
too far', incur, commit (an offence), As 219,6; part.
~anto, Vin III 164,16' foll, (pārājikaṁ dhammaṁ);
f. ~antī, Vin IV 237,13' (saṁghādisesaṁ); inf. ~ituṁ,
As 219,7; pp. ajjhāpanna, q. v.

f. (cf. ajjhãpajjati), the becoming
guilty. — Ifc. an-°, q. v.

n. (from caus. of adhi + √i), teaching,
instruction, Mil 225,31. Cf. ajjheti (ajjhāyati),
adhīyati.

n. (cf. jhāpeti), not burning, not
scorching, Ja VI 311,7' (allahatthassa, q. v.).

mfn. (pp. of ajjhāpajjati, very often
confounded with ajjhopanna, q. v.), 1. (in an active
sense, with acc) who has committed (some offence);
garudhammaṁ ~, Vin II 255,17 = AN IV 277,6; Vin
III 164,17'; Mil 255,1 (pārājikaṁ); — 2. (in a passive
sense), which has been committed, Vin I 103,37' (āpatti),
[the v. l. ajjhāpanno Ud 35,24 is unknown to Ud-a
and Mp-ṭ ad AN IV 356,1s]. — Ifc. v. an-°, ñatta°.

mfn. = ajjhāpanna (1); antima-
vatthuṁ ~o, Vin I 121,2 = 135,29 = II 173,18
(sikkhaṁ paccakkhātako ~ ummattako).

mfn. (cf. jhāpeti, pp.), not cremated,
Vism 76,20 (matasarīre ~e).

mfn. (adhi-ā + √pīḷ, pp.), tormented,
emaciated, Pv-a 180,21 (khuppipāsāya).

(pr. 3 sg. [ajjha + apekkhati,
q. v.], to abandon, neglect (?); aor. 3 pl. ~ irhsu (yena
kiccena sampattã), Ap 181,13 (or w. r. for ajjhupek-
khiṁsu?).

m. (from next), intercourse, contact
with (gen.), Ja II 357,6*,15'.

pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ā + √bhū), to have
to do with (acc), Ja II 357,16' (where Ct. takes it =
abhibhavati, but see Kern p. 67).

m. [sa. adhyāya], a chapter or section
of a book, Abh 911 (= 'sagga'). — Ifc. (a reader,
student) v. manta° & cf. 2ajjhā.

m. (from ajjhāyati, cf. sa. ādhyāyika,
adhyāyin), one who studies (the Vedas), skilled in the
Vedas, a brahmanical teacher, DN I 88,4 (mãṇavo ante-
vāsī . . . ~o + mantadharo tinnaṁ vedãnaṁ pāragū,
etc.; Sv); 121,1 (+ do.); 130,'u (do.); AN I 163,10
(do.; Mp); 166,18 (do.); III 223,17 (do.); Th 1171
(tiṇṇaṁ vedāna pāragū); Bv II 6 (+ mantadharo,
etc; quoted Ja I 3,17*); Ap 24,12; Ja VI 199,27* (~o
yācayogo āhutaggi ca brāhmaṇo); 201,27* (~ānaṁ);
204,31* (~aṁ mantaguṇūpapannaṁ); 498,22* (dāna-
patiṁ yācayogaṁ amacchariṁ); MN II 154,4 (+ upa-
nīto); DN III 94,24 (taken as a + jjhāyaka); Sn 140
(v. r.). — Ifc. v. an-°, manta°.

n., a family of Veda teachers,
Sn 140 (~e jātā brāhmanā; v. r. ajjhāyakā kule jātā,
Pj II 192,2).

pr. 3 sg. (prob, denom, from ajjhāya
[sa. adhyāya], cf. sajjhāyati), to study, learn by heart;
Sv I 247,16; Sadd II 13, 242. — Cf. ajjheti, adhīyati
ḷ (adhīte).

n. = ajjhayana; Rūp Ce p. 86,15
Dhātum 759 (v. l.); Sadd II 1343. — Ifc. v. eka°,
veda°.

mfn. [sa. adhyāyin], engaged in study.
— Ifc. v. magga°. ajjhāyi

ind. (adhi + ārāme, loc; see ajjhā-
gāre), within the ārāma (q. v.), Vin I 187,31; III
239,7'; IV 182,16**.
mfn., sometimes for ajjhārūha, q. v.

[pp. of ajjhārūhati q. v.], (a) in a
passive sense: yehi (scil. ajjhārūhehi) ~ā rukkhā
obhaggobhaggā vipatitā senti, SN V 96,7; — (b) in
an active sense: ~âbhivaḍḍhanti brahantam pi vanas-
patiṁ, Ja III 399,3* (scil. ajjhārūhā rukkhā, ib. 14'),
cf. Mp ad AN III 63,12. — Ifc. v. an°.

m(fri), which grows in and up over
(sometimes spelt ajjhāruha); (a) parasite (on, with
gen.): mahārukkhā . . . rukkhānaṁ ~ā, SN V 96,8
(scil. assāttho, nigrodho, etc. ≠ Ja III 398,27* foll.;
= abhiruhanaka, Spk); Ja III 399,14; — (b) metaph.:
āvaraṇā nīvaraṇā cetaso ~ā, SN V 96,21—97,1 (scil.
kāmacchando vyāpādo, etc.) = AN III 63,12 ( =
cetaso ajjhārūḷhā, Mp), quoted As 382,22 (Ed. ajjho-
rohā i. e. ajjhārohā; cittaṁ abhibhavantā ārohantī
ti cetaso ajjhārohā, mṭ). Cf. Amg. ajjhāroha.

[adhi-ā + √ruh] 1. to grow in and
up over (as a parasite plant splitting and choking
a tree, see Ja III 208,18 foll, 398,4 foll), found in
the pp. ajjhārūḷha q. v.; — 2. to tyrannize, to bully,
SN I 221,34* (v. l. ajjhoruhati; = ajjhottharati, Spk)
= 223,19*, quoted Nett 173,3*.

m., companion, company, retinue,
train, Ja V 318,18* (Ee here ajjhācāra); 322,23*;
324,7*; 326,3*; 327,29* (Ct. always = parisā; [perhaps
it ought to be corrected into ajjhācara, representing
*abhi-ā-cara]).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. adhi-ā + √vas], to
inhabit (as a ruler), to dwell in (as an owner) (acc);
to hold (a position); to lead or enjoy a certain mode
of life (very often with the object agāraṁ, acc, a house-
hold life): Sn 1002 (Pj) ≠ DN II 16,13; AN V 288,2;
Vin IV 224,31'; Sn p. 106,10-18 (imaṁ paṭhaviṁ);
It 75,23 (saṁgāmasīsaṁ abhivijiya ~); AN I 106,30
(saṁgãmasīsaṁ ~; = abhibhàvitvā [ā]vasati, Mp);
— 2 sg. ~asi: MN II 71,21 (phītaṁ Kuruṁ); — 1 sg.
~ãmi, MN II 71,23 (do.); DN I 134,27 (paṭhavi-maṇḍa-
laṁ abhivijiya); Mil 88,15 (agāraṁ); — part. m. ~anto,
MN I 515,28 (putta[dāra]sambãdha-sayanaṁ); Mil
243,4; 348,13 (do.); AN III 302,18 (mahantaṁ bho-
gakkhandhaṁ); instr, sg. ~atā, DN I 63,4 = MN II
55,28 = Pp 57,13 (Ed. °~ato); instr, pl. ~antehi, Dhp-a
I 6,25 (gehaṁ); gen. pl. ~ataṁ, AN I 49,15; part. med.
m. ~amāno, Ja I 56,10; — pot. 1 pl. ~eyyāma, MN II
72,1 (taṁ abhivijiya); —- aor. 3 sg. ~vasi, Ja I 145,27;
V 177,13 (taṁ, scil. nagaraṁ); 3 pl. ~vasiṁsu, ib.
31.2,9' (phītaṁ dharaṇiṁ; = 'āvasuṁ'); fut. 3 sg.
~vasissati, Ap 94,6; — abs. ~itvā, DN III 76,24
(= tattha vasitvā, Sv); — pp. ajjhāvuttha (q. v.).

ind. (adhi + āvasathe, loc cf.
ajjhāgãre), in a house, Vin III 239,7' (opp. ajjhārāme).
n., a dowry, MTD.

mfn. (pp. of prec), inhabited,
occupied, Vin II 21.0,32; SN II 106,1; Ja II 333,20
(pāsādo; cf. °-pāsādo, ib. 4); Pv-a 24,21 (sāmibhāvena
°-gharaṁ); Ja VI 95,19 (°-pubbo, scil. bhūmippadeso,
inhabited before). — Ifc v. an-°.
m., = 2ajjhāsaya (q v.), Ap 85,6-10.

pr. 3 sg. med. [sa. adhi + √ās], to sit
upon, Mogg-v II 2 (with acc rukkhaṁ).

mfn. (cf. next), inhabiting, resorting
to; ifc. v. arañña°, bila°.

m. (from adhi-ā + √çi, cf. āsaya
[as to adhi- cf. adhimutti, adhippāya]), orig, meaning
'place, seat, domicile, receptacle' (cf. sa. pakvāçaya,
āmāçaya), hence esp. (a) said of the mind as a
store of dispositions, i. e. the mental disposition (of
the hearer): Dhp-a I 6,6 (°-vasena, scil. Buddha
dhammaṁ desenti), cf. III 216,2; Ja I 88,17 (tesaṁ
~aṁ oloketvā); Dhp-a III 217,9 = IV 202,1l (tassa
~aṁ viditvā); Dhp-a I 249,2 (tassa ~aṁ ajānanto);
II 139,21 (nâhaṁ puttassa ~aṁ bhindissāmi); III
95,15 (do.); Ps I 15,26; II 343,16; III 484,11; Spk
II 167,10; Mp II 318,9 (ad AN I 285,33); — (b)
inclination, intention, aspiration, wish: Abh 766; Ja
IV 266,29 (Satthu ~aṁ gaṇhituṁ) ≠ Dhp-a III
228,13, cf. Ps II 346,1s; Ja V 382,19 (Bodhisattass'
ev' assa ~o); VI 222,29 ' (eso mam' ~o); As 314,19
(~aṁ karoti, to entertain a wish for); 334,24 (abl.
~ato); Pv-a 88,7; 168,4; cha ~ā, Vism 116,22 (alo-
bha° + )..—- Ifc. v. atta°, adāna°, adosa°, aneka°,
amoha°, alobha°, ahita°, ākāsa°, upādinnaka°,
uḷāra°, eka°, evam-°, kalyāṇa°, gāma°, jhāna°,
dāna°, nāna°, nissaraṇa°, nekkhamma°, paṇīta°,
para°, paviveka°, puggala°, purisa°, maha°,
yathā°, (yuddhā°?), visama°, veneyya°, hita°,
hīna°.

ind. (cf. prec & ajjhāgāre), as to
the state of mind; DN II 224,9 foll. (~ ādibrahma-
cariyaṁ, q. v., i. e. ajjh-(āsayaṁ + ādibrahma-
cariyaṁ) if ādibrahm° does not stand for adhi-brahm°,
see note on atidiṭṭhiyā s. v. ajjhācāre; Sv = uttama-
nissaya-bhūtaṁ); III 39,14—40,5 (do.).

n., Ja II 352,17 (sabbesam
°~gahaṇatthaṁ, in order to have the assent of the
assembly).

f., the element 'mental dis-
position', Spk II 1.74,18 (ad SN II 153,24: 'dhātuṁ
paṭicca uppajjati saññā' = ajjhāsayaṁ paṭicca saññā
uppajjati; cf. SN II 154,20-21 (Spk)).

mfn., fulfilling one's desire,
Ja VI 15,34'; 528,17' (both in connection with puṇṇa-
patta).

n., reaping of one's desire,
Ja VI 16,18'.

mfn., with the right
(friendly, liberal) intentions, Dhp-a III 97,9 (Rt
sædāT-æti); Pv-a 116,10.

mfn., 1. according to one's
mental dispositions, Pv-a 61,4 (°-kammaṭṭhāna);
106,11; 128,4. —- 2. according to one's wish, Ja III
437,19; VI 301,31' (tava ~aṁ karoma = 'yathā-
matiṁ').

m., that form of sequence
between the dhammakkhandhā in a sutta which
is commanded by the hearer's mental disposition:
pucchânusandhi + ~ + yathânusandḥi, Sv I 122,22
—123,10 (giving as an instance MN III 19,10-23 );
Ps 12,25; this anusandhi does not occur in Ud,
Ud-a 4,30.

mfn. (pp. of adhi-ā + √çi, cf. ajjhā-
saya), intent upon; ifc. v. jhāna°, brāhmaṇattha°.
— ajjhāsitatta, mfn., whose mind (attā) is set upon;
ifc. v. vimutti-°.

pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ã + √hṛ, sa. adhyā-
harati), to supply, Sadd 339,9, 25 (padaṁ);

m. [sa. adhyãhāra], supplying (an
elliptical expression), Pay fol. khe v. 7.

mfn. (pp. of ajjhesati, cf. ajjhesita),
asked, requested (to preach the dhamma, or to give a
sentence (as a judged)); Sn p. 218,13 (= yācito, Pj);
DN II 289,2 (°-pañhā, w, r. ~ā pañhā; = ajjhesita-
pañhā puṭṭha-pañhā, Sv); Sp I 103,3; Ud-a 310,36
≠ Dhp-a IV 101,22 (v. l. abhijjhittha, cf. samijjhit-
ṭha, Ja VI 12.25*); — Ja VI 292,28* (= āṇatta).
— Ifc. v. an-°. See also sam-ajjhiṭṭha.

mfn. (i. e. adhi-iṇa-mutta), free
with regard to debt, Kacc-v 46; Sadd III 59.

[pr. 3 sg. (adhi-upa + √gam,
cf. sa. abhyupagam°), 'to enter, arrive to', to assent,
agree to (an opinion, view, and submit to the con-
sequences); pot. 3 sg. "gacche, Thī474 (= sampa-
ṭiccheyya, Thī-a); aor. 3 sg. ajjhupāgami, Ja II 403,3*
(saṁyamaṁ); VI 129,8* (do.); 3 pl. °āgamuṁ, Ja V
323,10* (with gen. isīnaṁ [or read isinaṁ, acc. sg.?]
= isīnaṁ santikaṁ upagatā, Ct.); pp. v. next.

mfn. (pp. of prec. also ajjhūpagata,
Vv 151, cf. majjhūpagata; another rythmic variant is
ajjhupagata (q. v.) justified by taking ajjhupāgami
as from adhi-upa-ã + √gam, cf. (secondary) sa.
abhyupāgata and see ajjhupeti), who has attained
to, entered upon, agreed to; resorting to, dependent of;
Th 587 (in āryā: - ˇ ˇ ˇ ≃ ; sāmaññaṁ); vevaṇ-
ṇiy[am] amhi ~o, AN V 87,31; 210,9 (cf. parapiṇ-
ḍaṁ ~o, Mil 243,9); tad eva . . . allīno, tad eva . . .
~o, AN V 187,7; ~o kapiniddaṁ, Mil 300,31; seṭṭhiṭ-
ṭhānaṁ ~o, ib. 291,10.

n. (cf. sa. abhyupagamana),
acceptance, assenting to, Vin II 97,34; 104,5 (upaga-
manaṁ + ~aṁ adhivāsanā apaṭikkosanā).

mfn., = ajjhupagata. Th 1109
(in jagatī); Ap 47,1; 322,14 (in çloka).
aor. v. ajjhupagacchati.

aor. [of adhi-upa + √viç, to
sit down], Ja V 377,5* (thus Tr. for ajja pāvekkhi,
Mss. & Ed.).
aor. v. ajjhupaharati.

mfn. (cf. next & upekkhaka),
disinterested, impartial; As 133,22 (ājānīyānaṁ °-sā-
rathi, a charioteer, treating (his horses with imparti-
ality). — abstr. f. ~tā & n. ~tta, As 196,17 (Ed.
ajjhūpekkhākata°) = Vism 321,25.

pr. 3 sg. [adhi-upa + √īkṣ], to
look on without interfering, to tolerate, to be indifferent;
~ati, AN I 257,14 (= pakkâpakkabhãvaṁ upadhā-
reti, Mp!); Patis 161,24 (saṁkhāre); 168,6 (visuddhaṁ
cittaṁ); II 24,14; Ja I 147,21; Nidd I 508,12*
(Nidd-a); 2 sg. ~asi, Vin II 78,34 = III 162,14; 3 pl.
~anti, Ss 53,8; 2 pl. ~atha, Ja V 229,5 (tolerate);
part. gen. ~ato, MN II 223,1β; 224,30 (with gen.);
pot. 3 sg. ~eyya, Nidd I 508,22* (Nidd-a); 1 pl.
~eyyāma, MN I 155,25 (= avyāvaṭā bhaveyyāma,
Ps); Dhp-a IV 125,3; aor. 3 sg. ~i, Mil 275,9 (did not
interfere); 3 pl. ~iṁsu, MN I 155,25 (let in peace); fut.
2 pl. ~issatha, AN III 194,22; abs. ~itvā, Bv I 52
(cf. Ap 320,23); grd. ~itabba, AN I 126,8 ≠ Pp 36,23
(~o na sevitabbo); — nomen agentis ~ita(r), m.,
SN V 69,11 ≠ Vibh 227,23 (Vibh-a 313,32); SN V
324,29 = 331,1 = MN III 85,1 (Spk III 383,11 reads
~ito for ~itā); Ps I 82,1; — nomen actionis ~aṇă,
f. or n. (q. v.).

mfn. (pp. of next), who has attained
to, Dāṭh IV 5 (saṁyamam; cf. Jail 403,3*).

(pr. 3 sg. [adhi-upa + √i, cf. sa.
abhyupa-i° and abhyupâ-i°], to go. to meet; to go to
lie on a place (in one's abode); pot. 1 sg. ~eyyaṁ,
DN III 23,25 (tam eva āsayaṁ; = upagaccheyyaṁ,
Sv); aor. 3 sg. ~esi, ib. 23,34; fut. 1 sg. ~essaṁ, Ja
IV 440,10* foll. (= upăgamissāmi, Ct).

pr. 3 sg. = ajjhāyati (q. v.); Pj II 447,23
(vyākaraṇaṁ ~ vedeti ca); grd. ~etabba, Pj II 456,21
(abl. ~to, because it must be recited); ~eyya, ajjhā-
yanīya, ajjhayitabba, Kacc-v 637. Cf. adhīyati
(adhīte).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. adhy-eti, adhi + √i; cf. Pāṇ
113,52 &sa-Dhātup 24,38], to long for, regret; to mourn;
Sn 948 (na so socati nâjjheti; = abhijjhati, Pj; cf.
Nidd I 433,11: na upanijjhāyati na nijjhāyati na
pajjhāyati).

n. = ajjhayana (q. v.), Dhātup 354
(= √i, cf. Dhātum 580; Sadd II 13); 545 (= √cacc);
MN II 199,17 (~aṁ brāhmaṇā catutthaṁ dhammaṁ
paññāpenti; = manta-gahaṇaṁ, Ps); loc. ~e, MN III
1,12 (Ps); Ja II 327,16* (Ed. ajjhesanaṁ, Cks ajjhena
ca, read ajjhenaṁ ca); VI 201,9* = 207,25* (~aṁ
ariyā . . . upāgu); [VI 207,2* (~am aggiṁ tappayitvā,
see below and 2ajja)]; pl. ~āni patiggayha, Ja V 10,15*
(= vede paṭiggahetvă adhīyitvā, Ct.); Ja III 114,28'
(~ena = 'japena'); Nidd I 80,23 (~ena, = ajjhāyana-
vasena, Nidd-a); Vibh 353,18,34; cf. also ajjhayana,
ajjhāna, pariyajjhena). — Ifc. v. chanda°, jhāna°,
manta°.

m(fn), who reads, recites, prob, so
assumed Ja VI 209,27' in the sense of mantajjhāyaka
(read: ajjhena-m-aggin ti ajjhena aggiṁ) but cf.
ajjhena-m-aggiṁ below.

n., futile studies or doctrines,
Sn 242 (v. l. °-kutt(h)aṁ; = niratthaka-anattha-
janaka-gantha-pariyāpuṇanaṁ, with v. l. °-kuṭṭaṁ
(ɔ: °-kūṭaṁ), Pj).

Ja VI 207,2* (prob. w. r.
for ajjena-m-aggiṁ idha tappayitvā, i. e. feeding the
sacred fire with clarified butter (see 2ajja). The blunder
may be due to ajjhenam ariyā, ib. 201,9* and 207,25* ;
Ct. ib. 209,27' is corrupt, see 2ajjhena.
grd., see 1jjheti.

m(fṅ). (from next), asking for; ifc.
v. dhamma°.

pr. 3 sg. [adhi + √eṣ]; to ask, request
(mostly: to ask one to preach the dhamma, cf. Sp ad
Vin I 113,5; with acc. of the person or the thing asked
for); ~ati, AN IV 153,8 = 155,3 (sāmaṁ vā dham-
mam bhāsati paraṁ vā ~); 3 pl. ~anti, Vin I
116,25; AN IV 299,15; Dhp-a IV 18,11; 1 pl. ~āma,
MN III 10,13; aor. 3 sg. ajjhesi Vin II 200,10; Ud
59,21 (= āṇāpesi, Ud-a) = Vin I 196,34; 3 pl.
~esiṁsu, Vin I 116,13-16; fut. 3 sg. ~esissati, Mp
I 240,25 (taṁ . . . dhammaṁ ~); inf. ~esituṁ, Vin
I 113,9 (paraṁ); abs. ~esitvā, Ps II 182,9 (dham-
madesanaṁ); pp. v. ajjhiṭṭha & ajjhesita.

f. [sa. adhyeṣaṇā], request, sollicitation
(esp. to preach the dhamma); Abh 427 (sakkāra-
pubbaṅgama-niyojanam; cf. Sp-ṭ ad SpI 2,13*:
garuṭṭhānīyaṁ payirupāsetvā garutaraṁ payojanaṁ
uddissa abhipatthanā); Vin I 6,23 (Brahmuno ~aṁ
viditvā) = DN II 38,19 (= yācanaṁ, Sv; cf. Bv I
1-2; II 211) = SN I 138,1 (= do., Spk) = MN I
169,5 ≠ AN II 21,27; Dhp-a I 86,1β (Brahmuno
~aṁ adhivāsetvā); do. (to write a commentary work):
Sp 12,13* (Vjb); Vism 712,2*.

mfn. (pp. of ajjhesati, cf. ajjhittha),
asked, Nidd II 78,29 (= 'ajjhiṭṭha', Sn p. 218,18);
Pj I 131,27 (ekaṁ ~o pi, appaṁ yācito bahudāyako
uḷãrapuriso viya. . .); do. (to write a ṭīkā, cf. ajjhe-
sanā), Sp-ṭ conclusion v. 3; see also As-mṭ conclusion
v. 2. Cf. also yācita, āyācita, abhiyācita. — Ifc. v.
an-°.

mfn. (see next), abiding in the
open air, SN II 230,20.

loc. (adhi + okāsa, [see under
ajjhāgare], — abbhokāse, q. v.), in the open air,
Vin I 15,24; 152,21; SN I 104,2; 112,14; 212,6; III
100,6; Dhp-a III 15,20; IV 101,20 (cf. Ud 59,17); Ja
V 195,5' (opp. udakaṭṭhãne).

pr. 3 sg. [adhi-ava + √kf, cf. sa.
abhyava + √kṛ], to strew, sprinkle, throw on, cover,
3 pl. ~anti, DN II 137,21 foll, (okiranti ~ abhippa-
kiranti, scil. Tathãgatassa sarīraṁ; ajjhottharantā
viya kiranti, Sv); fut. 3 sg. ~issati, Anāg 102 (pup-
phāni).

(ajjhogaheti), frequent spelling for
ajjhogāh° (mostly non-presential forms). ajjhogahati

mfn. (pp. of next), who has entered
or dived into, AN IV 100,11 (mahāsamudde) ≠ Sp I
119,12* (mahaṇṇave) = Pj II 442,29*; Mil 348,1*
(dhute guṇe, keeping the dhutaṅgas); Ps III 124,21
(mahāsaraṁ, scil. mahānāvā).
entry.re:
— °-ppattaajjhogāḷha-ppatta, mfn.
[blending of ajjhapatta and ajjhogāḷha], who has
taken up (his abode) within, SN I 201,17 (aññata-
rasmiṁ kule ativelaṁ ~o; = ogāhapatto, Spk).

entry.sense:
pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ava + √gāh, cf. sa.
abhyava-√gāh), to dive or plunge into, to enter or go
far into; ~ati, DN I 101,5-13 (vanaṁ); Nidd I 152,24
(pagāhati ogāhati ~ati pavisati); Ps III 625,19 =
Pj I 176,14; 2 sg. ~asi, DN I 102,19; 3 pl. ~anti,
DN I 222,25 (samuddaṁ); AN III 368,24; V 133,20;
aor. 1 sg. ajjhogahiṁ, Ap 20,2 [as ārūhati: ãruhi,
āyūhati: āyuhe; cf. sa. gūhati: aguhat]; inf. ~ituṁ,
Ps I 112,14; abs. ajjhogãhitvā (Mss. generally and
Edd. sometimes ajjhogahetvā or °gāhetvā, where -e-
prob. is due to confusion with °ganhati (√grah)): Ap
20,7 [ - - ˇ - ≃ ; Vin I 23,4; III 18,30; DN II 134,21;
173,15; III 62,24; SN III 91,11; AN III 75,20; IV
356,10; MN I 79,1 (cf. note p. 536); 108,18; 147,10;
152,5; 156,21; 229,22; 359,15; 447,21; 501,29; II 8,29;
9,4; Mil 87,10 (cf. note p. 422; quoted As 142,23);
300,27; Ja I 7,4; Dhp-a I 375,1; Pj I 185,29 (ariya-
saccāni paññāya); Ps I 192,19 (nadiṁ vā taḷākaṁ
vā); pp: ajjhogāḷha (q. v.).

n. (from prec.); ifc. v. attha°,
gahana°, salila°.

mfn. (pp. of next, also spelt °tthata),
covered, flooded; overcome, overwhelmed; Pv-a 55,15
(gehena); As 15,4 (Buddha-rasmīhi); Pj II 437,11
(udakena); Dāṭh V,5 (sokena); Ja I 363,17' ('āsīno'
= abhiniviṭṭho ~o); 410,13'; V 91,25' (= 'adhi-
panna'); 379,19' (= do.); Pj I 153,19 (= 'phuṭṭha').
entry.re:
— °-hadayaajjhotthaṭa-hadaya, mfn., with the heart overwhelmed (by
love, pemena, mahoghenêva), Dhp-a I 278,18.

entry.sense:
n. (nomen actionis from next),
ifc. v. an-°.

pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ava + √stṛ, some-
times spelt °ottarati as from adhi-ava (or ut-) + √tṛ),
generally meaning 'to cover, to spread over' in various
combinations; thus: (a) to fall and remain lying,
covering something: Ja I 61,20 (turiyāni ~itvā nipaj-
jiṁsu); AN III 92,2 = Pp 67,26 foll, (abhinisīdati
abhinipajjati ~ati; — avattharati, Pp-a); part. pass.
~iyamāna, AN III 92,3 = Pp 67,28; — (b) to flow
over, overspread: Mil 296,14-17 (sadevakaṁ lokaṁ;
dvādasa yojanāni); Sv II 232,9 (expl. 'ajjhokirati');
Ps II 330,9 (Vajjiraṭṭhaṁ); Ja III 289,14 (~itvā);
— (c) to fill (with): Dhp-a I 426,4 (aor. ~ari, nagaraṁ
gandhena; Ed. avatthari); III 30,17 (seṭṭhidhītaraṁ
pubbasineho ~ari); Ja I 330,20 (Ee °ottari); do.
with pass, sense (= was flooded), Vv-a 48,1 (gāma-
padeso); — (d) to cover (with), to spread out: Ps II
563,16 (khip[p]aṁ gahetvā macche ~ante); II 260,11
(pāsa-rāsim ~itvā); III 291,3 (dānaṁ mahantaṁ
~itvā); — (e) to transgress (boundaries): Vin I 111,15
(sīmāya sīmaṁ ~anti, 'to encompass', Trsl; Sp); ib.
20 (pot. ~eyya; grd. ~aritabba); Ps II 215,17 (vatiṁ
ajjhottharantā pavisanti, 'passing over'); — (f) to
overcome, overwhelm: Ja I 410,11' (atibhavati +
~ati — 'ativattati'); Dhp-a I 75,12 (abhibhavati
+ ~ati — 'pasahati'); Mil 338,22 (abhibhavati +
~ati); Spk I 402,12 (= 'ajjhārūhati'); Ja I 163,19'
(= 'atibhoti'; vañcetī ti attho); As 400,18 ('anvā-
ssaveyyuṁ' = anuppabandheyyum + ~eyyuṁ);
Ja I 333,3 (inf. ~ituṁ asakkontā); Ja I 72,5 (part,
med. ~aramānā); 73,4 (udakena naṁ ~itvā, 'to
deluge'); Mil 336,27 (atikkamitvā atisayitvā + ~itvā,
'to surpass').

m. (nomen agentis from prec):
Kkh (Ce) 5,28 (sīmãya sīmaṁ ~tā; cf. Vin I 111,15). ajjhottharita

mfn. (pp. of adhi-ava + √pad; Amg.
ajjhovavaṇṇa, cf. Vyu 110,6-7 and see adhipanna;
often confounded with ajjhāpanna (q. v.)), addicted to
(loc), mostly in the formula: gathita mucchita +,
DN I 245,25 (kāmaguṇe; Sv, pt; cf. Sv III 28,7 ad
DN III 46,28: ajjhāpanno ti āmise atilaggo) = MN I
173,27 (= taṇhāya ajjhogālhā, Ps); MN I 162,9 (cf.
note p. 543); II 203,16; AN I 74,5 (Mp); 274,20 ( =
taṇhāya gilitvā pariniṭṭhapetvā pavatto, Mp, Mp-t);
III 68,14 (itthiphoṭṭhabbe rattā +); V 178,6 (ga-
thita +); SN II 270,1 (do.); IV 332,28 (bhoge gathito
mucchito+); Ud 75,10-26 (kāmesu sattā rattā +;
Ud-a); Sv I 59,24 (kāmaguṇesu rattā gathitā muc-
chita +); cf. Nidd I 159,24; II 156 (nissita). — Ifc.
v. an-°.

(pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ava + √bhū),
I to overcome; aor. 3 sg. ~bhavi, Ja II 80,16* (taṁ
maṁ paṁko ~ [ - ˇ ˇ ≃ ; thus Bi ajjhabhavi may
be a good conjecture] = adhibhavi, Ct.).

pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ava + √mṛd),
to tread down (upon); AN IV 191,11 = 193,15 (rathī-
saṁ ~, scil. assakhaluṅko; = dvīhi purimapādehi
īsaṁ maddanto tiṭṭhati, Mp).

mfn. (pp. of adhi-ava-√mūrch,
but prob, a blending of adhimucchita and the formula
mucchito ajjhopanno), clinging to (loc.) in longing
or regret; AN III 57,27 (= adhimucchito gilitvā
pariniṭṭhapetvā gahaṇasabhāvāya atirekamucchāya
taṇhāya samannāgato, Mp; see under ajjhosāya).

[mfn., w. r. for ajjhārūḷha (q. v.),
SN V 96,8. — ajjhorūhati, pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ava +
√ruh), w. r. for ajjhārūhati (q. v.), SN I 221,34*.
— ajjhoroha, mfn. = ajjhārůha, As 382,22-25 (v. l.
ajjhārūḷha)].

pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ava + √lamb),
to hang down on (loc. or acc.); 3 pl. ~anti, MN III
164,28-30 (paṭhaviyā olambanti ~ abhi(ppa)lambanti;
quoted Nett 179,4); Saddh 284, 296 (mānasaṁ); pot.
3 pl. ~eyyuṁ, SN III 137,19 foll. (Spk).
ind., see ajjhosāya.

[or *ajjhoseti], pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ava +
√so; *ajjhosiyati would correspond to sa. adhyavasyati,
and Sadd gives siyati as pr. 3 sg. of √sā antakammani),
to determine (a place), catch, take hold of; to conceive,
ascertain (during meditation); fut. 2 sg. ~issasi, MN
I 328,16 (paṭhaviṁ, etc.; = paṭhaviṁ ajjhosāya
gilitvā pariniṭṭhapetvā taṇhā-māna-diṭṭhīhi gaṇhis-
sasi, Ps); 1 sg. ~ issāmi, ib. 21; inf. ~ituṁ, MN II
263,8 (abhinandituṁ abhivadituṁ +); abs. (a ) ~itvā,
Ps II 99,7 (v. l. ~etvā); (b) ajjhosāya and ajjhosa
(q. v.); grd. ~itabba, MN I 109,36 (v. l. ~etabba;
abhinanditabba + ; quoted As 5,4); pp. ajjhosita, q. v. [*ajjhosati

mfn. (pp. of adhi-ava + √sad, cf.
osanna, avasanna), Sv I (Se) 460,4 (w. r. for ajjho-
panna, DN I 245,25, = ogālha); Mp II 64,4 (do.,
AN I 74,5).

n. [sa. adhyavasāna], catching at,
grasping, coveting, DN II 58,34 = III 289,4 = AN
IV 400,26 (chandarāgaṁ paṭicca ~aṁ, ~aṁ paṭicca
pariggaho; '— ahaṁ maman ti balava-sanniṭṭhānaṁ,
Sv Mp); MN I 191,4 (chando ālayo anunayo +;
= ajjhogāhitvā gilitvā gahaṇavasena ~aṁ, Ps);
411,21 = 498,16 (sārāga +); pl. ~ā, SN III 187,4;
V 89,3 (saṁyojana-vinibandhā +-; Spk); AN I 66,10
foll. (kāmarāga [or ditthirāga]-vinivesa- + ; Mp); Dhs
1059 (As 363,9), 1136 (cf. Trsl. p. 277); Dhp-a IV 63,2
(ālaya +); — °-lakkhaṇa, n., character of a°, Nett
23,29; mfn. ib. 27,11 (~ā taṇhā). — Ifc. v. an-°,
ekanta°, kāma°, diṭṭhi-°, bhava°.

(and ajjhosa), ind. (abs. of ajjhosati ;
sa. adhyavasāya and adhyavasya), having grasped,
mostly in the phrase ~āya (or ~a) tiṭṭhati, to continue
grasping, SN IV 159,8 (cf. Nett 155,25, Nett-a) ≠
MN I 266,30 = II 265,2 (abhinandati +; = taṇ-
hâjjhosānena gilitvā pariniṭṭhapetvā gaṇhāti, Ps;
as for gilitvā here and below see SN IV 159,8, cf.
ajjhomucchita); MN I 270,15 (do. with negation:
nâjjhosāya); SN III 14,7 (do., = gilitvā pariniṭṭha-
petvā gaṇhāti, Spk); IV 36,5; 60,15; 79,20 (do.) 71,11*
(nâjjhosāya [ɔ: *ajjhavasāya - ˇ ˇ - ˇ] bhuñjati);
Mil 69,3 (abhinandanti +); Mp II 64,4 (ajjhopannā
ti ~ gilitvā pariniṭṭhapetvā ṭhitā); an-ajjhosāya
titthato, MN I 270,17; tañ ca ajjhosa tiṭṭhati, SN IV
73,20* = Th 98 (Th-a); 794; nâjjhosa tiṭṭhati, SN
IV 74,23* (= taṁ ārammanaṁ gilitvā, Spk) =
Th 806. ajjhosāya

mfn. (pp. of ajjhosati , sa. adhyava-
sita), (a) in an active sense: adhering to, catching hold of,
grasping, MN I 65,18 (allīna, upagata +; with acc.
bhavadiṭṭhiṁ); 233,10 (do., = taṇhādiṭṭhivasen' eva
veditabbo); Nidd I 75,7; Thī 470 (with loc.; =
taṇhāvasena abhiniviṭṭhā, Thī-a); Pv 761 (toe; =
do'. Pv-a); AN II 25,28*; Mil 76,24; — (b) in a pas-
sive sense: what is adhered to, grasped, occupied;
taken for granted, Nidd I 411,13 (Nidd-a); SN II
94,15 (~aṁ mamāyitaṁ parāmaṭṭhaṁ; = taṇhāya
gilitvā pariniṭṭhapetvā gahitaṁ, Spk) = 96,7; AN
II 25,24*; 26,1* (diṭṭhaṁ sutaṁ mutaṁ + ; = gilitvā
pariniṭṭhapetvā gahitaṁ, Mp). —- Ifc. v. an-°.

mfn. (pp. of adhi-ava-√hṛ; cf. sa.
abhyavahṛta), eaten, swallowed, Abh 757; As 330,16
(taṁ hi . . . ~aṁ kucchiṁ vitthambheti); Ss 148,4;
Saddh 610 (with active sense: ~o va balisaṁ maccho
ɔ: the canonical vaṁkaghasta; cf. bhattaṁ bhutto,
Kacc-v 628).

n. (from ajjhoharati), (a) putting
into, applying (of a goad-stick), AN V 324,18 (pato-
dassa ~aṁ; = attano abhimukhassa patodassa
~saṁkhātaṁ patanaṁ, Mp); — (b) eating, Ps I 256,24
(dva-tikkhattuṁ °-matten'eva, by eating only twice
or thrice). — Ifc. v. brāhmaṇa-°.

mfn. (grd. of ajjhoharati), what
is to be, or can be eaten, Ja II 8,6'; VI 258,23' (°âhāro);
Dhp-a I 284,4 (°-mattaṁ, only so much). — Ifc. v.
gala°; cf. ajjhoharitabba.

pr. 3 sg. (adhi-ava + √hṛ, cf. sa.
abhyava + √hṛ), (a) to put into, to pour into, ~ati,
MN I 423,8 (= anto paveseti, Ps; but more likely to
c below); pot. 3 sg. ~eyyuṁ, MN I 245,14; fut. 1 pl.
~issāma, ib. 11; — (b) to drag down, Ja VI 198,4*;
— (c) to swallow, to eat, pr. 3 sg. ~ati, As 401,26 (pari-
bhuñjati ~, = 'āhāreti'); Mil 366,28 (ajjhohāraṁ);
1 sg. ~āmi, AN IV 318,10 (saṁkhāditvā ~); 3 pl.,
~anti, SN II 269,11 (do.); aor. 3 sg. ~ari, SN II
270,27; Ja II 293,21' (= 'ajjhupāhari'); VI 205,2*
= 213,6* (taṁ sā gar'~); Pv-a 283,11; abs. ~itvā, Ja
I 460,24 (maṁsaṁ khāditvā [ɔ: saṁkhāditvā] ~);
pass. 3 sg. ~īyati, As 330,4 (kabaḷiṁkatvā ~); grd.
~itabba, As 330,13 (galena ~aṁ = 'galajjhohara-
ṇīyaṁ'); Mil 366,30 (yoginā . . . ajjhohāraṁ ~aṁ);
pp. ajjhohaṭa (q. v.); cf. ajjhoharaṇa and next.

m. [cf. sa. abhyavahāra], (a) the
act of swallowing, eating, taking food, Dhātup 379
(= √bhuj1); Vin IV 233,22' (~e ~e āpatti saṁghā-
disesassa); — (b) food, Mil 176,5; 366,28-30 (~aṁ
ajjhoharati . . . ~aṁ ajjhoharitabbaṁ).
m., see Ajjhāroha.

mfn. (pp. of adhi-ava-√dhā; cf. sa.
abhyava + √dhā), laid upon (or into); uṇhaṁ ~aṁ
mukhe, Ja II 7,27* (= uṇhaṁ ajjhoharaṇīyaṁ mukhe
~aṁ ṭhapitaṁ, Ct.).

sometimes written for 1aññāṇa,
1aññāta (q. v.). a-ñāṇa

√ gamane, Dhātup 45; pūjāyaṁ, ib. 48 (cf.
√acc); pūjā-gate, Dhātum 48; Sadd II 129 [√añc, sa.
Dhātup 21,2] (the meaning 'to shrink' see añcati (b),
not mentioned by Gramm.s).
√ vyayagatiyaṁ, Sadd II 160.
√ visesane, Sadd II 1334.

m. [ts.], bristling (of the hairs), only ifc,
v. romañca.

pr. 3 sg. (√añc), (a) to pull, drag, hoist
(evidently associated with siñcati), Th 750 (~āmi naṁ,
scil. my chain; v. l. añchāmi); Ja I 417,14' (udakaṁ
~anti etāyā ti udañcanī, cf. ussiñcana-ghaṭikā, ib.);
cf. añchati; — (b) to contract, shrink, As 376,7 (kaṭuka-
bhāvena cittaṁ ~ati saṁkocati); — (c) to twist, to
bend, Th 750 Ci see above); pp. añcita (q. v.).

[n., w. r. for Añjana-°, SN
V 73,1.

m. [ts.], the fringe of a garment; MTD &
prob. Ap 255,12 (Ed. añjalim).

mfn., shrinking; ifc. v. kaṭukañcu-
katā, f. abstr.

m., designation of a
Tamil chieftain, Mhv LXXVI 95. — °~rāyara, m.,
do., ib. 98.

√ āyāme, Dhātup 53 = Dhātum 64 (&
v. l. ib. 66 for √uñch); Sadd II 167 [cf. √āñch, sa.
Dhātup 7,29]. See next.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. āñchati; Amg. añchaí;
cf. añcati], to drag, pull; DN II 291,17 (Sv II 482,7)
— MN I 56,24 (dīghaṁ ~āmi, rassaṁ ~āmi, 'to make
a long (or a short) turn', said of a turner (bhamakāra),
in a simile to assasati; v. l. añjāmi, cf. note p. 532);
part. ~anto, ib. (= kaḍḍnanto, Sv); cf. añchāmi,
Th 750 (v. l for añcāmi). Cf. Griebson, Bihar
Peasant Life, p. 85 (plate). See also añja below.

ind.(l) [cf. the interj.s haṁje, handa,
ambho : hambho], a shout to an ox: 'go on, pull on';
only Ja I 192,5 (añja kūṭa, vahassu kūṭa, Ck reads
añjana, corrected in C to añja, Ss añcha (imper, of
añchati); Ja-pota: aṁjana kūṭaya usulava kuḷa) ≠
Vin IV 5,20 (gaccha kūṭa vahassu kūṭa).

pr. 3 sg. (√añj), to smear, besmear; 3 pl.
~anti, Vin I 203,33 (aṅguliyā); imper. ~āhi, Dhp-a
I 21,10 (bhesajjaṁ); pot. 2 sg. ~eyyāsi, SN II 281,12
(akkhīni); abs. (a ) ~itvā, SN II 281,4 (do., Ck, Se;
~etvā, Ee); (b ) ~etvā (as from añjeti), Ja I 483,15
(akkhiṁ ukkhalimasiyā); IV 219,16 (akkhīni); As
138,31 (do.); pp. añjita; caus. añjāpeti (q. v.).

n. [ts.], 1. smearing, anointing; DN I
12,9 (~aṁ paccañjanaṁ; Sv) ≠ MN I 511,16.
— 2. ointment, collyrium (esp. for the eyes): (a) used
for the sake of decoration, Abh 306; DN I 7,20 (Sv);
in Thī 411 read añjaniṁ (= añjana-nāḷi, Thī-a);
— (b) as a cure for disease of the eyes, Vin I 203,13
(five different kinds allowed); gen. pl. ~ānaṁ khayo,
evaporation of collyriums, Dhp-a II 25,14* = Ps III
649,1*. — 3. a mineral substance, antimony, Ja V
416,27**. — Ifc. v. akkhi-°, alaṁkāra°, kaṇha°,
kāḷa°, khāra°, tela°, rasa°, sota°; cf. also 2aṅgana,
abbhañjana, paccañjana. [Cf. MTD añjana, n., col-
lyrium, night; — m., a tuktoo; — f., a chameleon.]

m. Npr. [ts.] of the elephant of the
western quarter, Abh 30 (Erāvaṇa +).

m. Npr. of a Sakya prince, son of
Devadaha-Sakka at Devadaha, and father of Māyā
and Mahāpajāpatī; Mhv II 17. Cf. Pj II 357, note
2 & Añjana-Sakka below.

m. Npr. of an officer of king Parak-
kamabāhu I, Mhv LXXII 206 (kamma-nāyakaṁ,
cf. next).

m., designation of a
chieftain, Mhv LXXIV 168.

mfn., whose eyelids are dyed
with collyrium, pl. ~ā, Th 960.

m., = añjana-pabbata; Ja VI
264,27' (Kāḷapabbataṁ nāma ~iṁ; cf. Añjanā-giri).

n., añjana powder, As 13,33
(°-samokiṇṇa).

f. Npr. of the daughter of Deva-
gabbhā, Ja IV 80,21 foll; Pv-a 111,17 foll.

m., an antimony mountain,
pl. ~ā, Ja VI 528,27* = 533,32* (nīlā); — do. Npr.
Ja V 133,22; 415,23 (cf. añjana-giri).

m., a mass of collyrium, Ja II
369,21 (°-samāna-vaṇṇa, mfn.); Saddh 286 (°-ābha, mfn.).

mfn., smeared with collyrium,
Th 772 = MN II 65,1* (nettā ~ā).

mfn., consisting of antimony,
Ps III 33,11 (Kālakūtaṁ; cf. añjana-giri) — Ud-a
300,22 ≠ Pj II 437,24.

m., a kind of mineral (cf. añjana
(3)), Ud-a 103,28 (cf. Amg. añjana-pulaga).

m., a kind of tree, Ja I 331,20
(°-sāra-ghaṭika-vaṇṇa, mfn., like to a stick of the
heart-wood of ~, scil. °-mahā-maccha).

mfn., with hairs black as
collyrium, Ja V 204,13* (~ā bāhā; = añjana-sadisehi
romehi samannāgatā, Ct.).

mfn., dark, black; Ja I 138,1
(~ānaṁ kesānaṁ); 194,10 (said of a bull); II 369,17*
= Dhp-a IV 89,2* (designation of the elephant Añjana-
vasabha); Pj II 137,20 (ekacce [goṇā] kāḷā ~ā yeva);
Nidd-a II 83,18 ad Nidd I 354,29 (kaṇho vaṇṇo).
—- Ifc. v. bhamara°. — °-kesa, mfn., with black
hairs, Sv I 284,14.

n. Npr. of a deer-park near
Sāketa; Th 55 (Añjanaṁ vanaṁ, a split-compound
after the analogy of Nandanaṁ vanaṁ (Ja III 494,13*));
Thī 147 (do.); Ja III 272,5* (do. = ~aṁ nāma uyyā-
naṁ, Ct.); 274,11* (with rhythmical lengthening:
Añjanāvane, cf. Añjanāvaniya below & see Añ-
janāgiri); ~e migadāye, SN I 54,9; V 73,2 (Ee
Añcana-°); AN IV 427,26; Sāketaṁ nissāya ~e viha-
ranto, Ja I 308,25 = Dhp-a III 317,11; Pj II 531,16;
Thī-a 137,7.
see Añjanāvaniya.

mfn., like to collyrium, Ja V
207,4'.

mfn., id., Ap 320,11; Dhp-a
IV 88,17 (p. I. for °-vasabha).

[f., see añjanisalākā; Ja III
419,22' read añjanaṁ salākāya nīharitvā.]
[f., (MTD) see 1añjana.]

m. = Añjana-giri, Kacc-v405;
Sadd III 858 [cf. Pāṇ VI 3,117; as to 'rhythmical
lengthening' see Wackernagel Ai. Gr. II, 1 § 56,
Gauthiot, La fin du mot p. 166 foll., and cf. ajā-
miga, Añjanā-vana, anūpama, nirūpadhi, etc., rūpiyā-
maya, etc., dhāretum āraho (Ja VI 180,13*), varam
ābhijeti (Ja VI 273,3*); the rhythm ˇ ˇ ˇ ≃ is avoided,
otherwise, in aghammiga, amatapphala, bahujjana,
etc., in pāvacana, veramaṇī, etc., in ajakaraṁ medaṁ,
Añjanaṁ vanaṁ, etc., and in gamanaṁ-pathe (Bv
II 16), etc.].

n. Npr. = Añjana-vana (q. v.);
cf. prec.
f. [ts.], a white-bellied mouse, MTD.

f., a little bag or purse for the
collyrium box, Vin I 204,8.

f., a little stick or pencil for
anointing with añjana; Vin I 203,34; II 135,19; IV
168,5.

f., (a) a box for ointment; Vin I 203,19; II
135,19; IV 168,5; Th 773 = MN II 65,3* (= añjana-
[or añjani-] nāḷikā, Ps; in the shape of a woman (?),
cf. sa. lepyanārī = añjanī); Thī 411 (Ed. añjanaṁ,
but = añjana-nāḷī, Thī-a 267,17); Khuddas XXIV,1
(& title of the chapter ib.). — (í») [ts.], name of a
certain plant, Ap 16,3.

n., admixture (of perfume)
to the ointment; Vin I 203,14 (Sp-ṭ); II 112,15 (Ed.
in both places °pisana); Mp III 30,12 (Se añjana-
piṁsanatthāya). añjanûpapisana

m. [ts.], (a) the open hollow hand; MN II
75,12 (mamaṁ ~ismiṁ patiṭṭhāpehi, 'put it into my
hand'); AN III 188,13 (~inā pivissāmi, 'to drink
from ~'); — (b) more frequently: the two hands joined
(by putting the fingers together) and raised to the head
(as a token of reverence or sollicitation); Abh 268;
~iṁ panāmetvā, Sn p. 79,2; Vin II 188,27; DN I
118,31 (Sv); II 37,13 (≠ Vin I 5,23); 163,27; MN I
401,17; II 74,21; 250,16; do. with gen., DN I 50,34
(bhikkhu-saṁghassa; Sv); nom. ~ī suppaṇāmito, Sn
352 (Pj); acc. ~iṁ kariya, Ja VI 291,16* (with. acc.
pers.); ~iṁ kareyya, Ja VI 298,13' (with gen.); ~iṁ
akariṁ, Vv 947 (Tathāgatassa; quoted Dhp-a I
31,21*); mayhaṁ ~iṁ akatvā, Pv-a 178,1; ~iṁ
paggahetvā, Vin I 57,6; MN II 248,25 [in Pv-a
93,23 read with Ja IV 84,13 aṭaniṁ pariggahetvā];
paggahetvāna ~iṁ, Ja VI 299,2* ≠ Bv I 56; ~iṁ
paggayha, Dhp-a IV 212,5; Vv-a 312,8; ~iṁ pagga-
hesi, Ja I 54,30; dasaṅguliṁ ~iṁ paggahetvā, Ja
IV 447,11* = V 166,24*; ~iṁ paggaṇhāpetvā, Vin
I 22,14; dasa-nakha-samodhāna-samujjalaṁ ~iṁ
sirasmiṁ ṭhapetvā, Ja III 245,27; Vv-a 7,15 (do.
paggayha); sirasi ~iṁ patiṭṭhāpetvā, Ja VI 46,8';
Ja IV 218,7* = V 234,21* (yācamānānaṁ ~iṁ nâva-
bujjhasi); ~iṁ bandhitvā, Mhbv 37,25; gen. ~issa,
Ap 80,15 = 123,20 ≠ 281,17 (~iyā, against metre).
—- Ifc. v. udaka°, eka°, kata°, paggahita°, pagga-
hita-tuccha°, sukkha°, & cf. pañjali, pañjalikā.

mfn., with the two hands raised (for
salutation), Vin I 3,24 (purato aṭṭhāsi ~o Bhagavan-
taṁ namassamāno; w. r. (?), no Ct.; v. l. pañja-
liko, and so Ud 10,16). —. Ifc. v. eka°, ṭhita°,
(ni)panna°, & cf. pañjalikā.

mfn. = prec; m. pl. ~ā, Ap 46,15
etc. (read pañjalīkatā?); f. Pv 358 [- ˇ - ˇ - ] v. l. pañjalīkatā].

mfn., worthy of being honoured,
respectfully saluted, DN II 94,4 (Bhagavato sāvaka-
saṁgho āhuneyyo +; Vism 220,26) = III 5,23 =
MN I 37,27 = AN II 34,32 — It 88,12; AN I 244,17
(bhikkhu; Mp, Mp-ṭ) — III 134,12, etc.; AN IV 13,11
(satta puggalā āhuneyyā +).

f. = añjali; Ja III 175,3' (= 'pañja-
likā'); Vv 5 (~ikaṁ akāsiṁ).

mfn., raising the hands for
respectful salutation, Mhv XXX 90.

m., respectful salutation, Mil
242,17* (ascribed'to Sāriputta); Ps II 368,19 (°-matta-
karaṇa, n., salutation only by añjali).

f. Npr. of a nun who accompanied Saṁ-
ghamittā to Ceylon, Dīp XVIII 24 (but see note on
v. 25 ib.).

m(rí). (from prec), the direct path or
way, Pj II 34,26* ≠ Abh 190 (*.); Th 179 (~aṁ
amatogadhaṁ; cf. Vv 576, etc., above); Bv II 16; 41
(maggo ~aṁ vaṭumāyanaṁ; cf. ib. 44 & Pj II 34,26*);
Jināl 17—18; Mil 217,12 (purāṇaṁ maggaṁ. purāṇaṁ
~aṁ; cf. purāṇañjasaṁ, SN II 106,1 foll.; Spk);
ākāsa-dhātu ~o hoti, Sv I 201,12 (pt). — Ifc. v.
anila°, ariya°, pāvacana°, purāṇa°, magga°,
siva°.
m., a Cakkavatti, Ap 45,11.

ind. [ts.], straight on, Sv ad DN I 235,17
(~ā ujukam eva).

mfn., having missed the straight
course, Paṭis I 129,19 = Ud-a 143,23 (vipatha-pak-
khanno +).

m. [in sa. mfn.], the straight course,
DN I 235,17 (uju-maggo ~o; Sv: ujumaggassa veva-
canaṁ).

pr. 3 sg., caus. of añjati (q. v.); aor. 3 sg.
~esi, Dhp-a I 21,10.
m. [sa. añjiṣṭha], the sun; MTD.

mfn. (pp. of añjati), smeared, anointed
(with collgrium); Ja I 483,18 (ekaṁ akkhiṁ); IV
421,5' (~ehi akkhīhi). — Ifc. v. an-°, su-°.

mfn., with (as it were) anointed
eges, Ja IV 421,2* (= añjitehi viya akkhīhi saman-
nāgatā [scil. migā]). — Ifc. v. an-°.
n. [ts.], the fig tree or fruit; MTD.
(& añjetvā, abs., see añjati.

mfn. [sa. aṇya], 1. other, another (different
or similar); somebody else; one more, a new; pl. others,
or the others, the rest; with pronominal inflexion, thus:
n. sg. aññaṁ, AN V 193,7 (opp. idam eva); the old
form aññad also occurs, e. g. aññad-eva, MN I 372,20;
SN II 95,9, and in some compounds (see below); m. pl.
(nom. acc.) aññe, Sn 201; 189; n. pl. aññāni, Ja IV
129,25; also aññā, Sn 677 (haplol., with koṭisatāni);
gen. pl. aññesaṁ, Vin I 248,16; —- f. sg. aññissā (instr.,
gen. or loc), MN I 30,27; Vin I 15,10; Ja II 27,16;
some forms are used adverbially: aññena (instr.), and
aññato (abl.), see separately below; — compar. añña-
tara, and superl, aññatama, see below. — (a) Abh
717 (other); 802 (different); Rūp 207 act Kacc 180
(añña-saddo adhikatâparavacano, i. e. 'denoting
something different from what is appointed', = Pay
I; cf. Sadd 266,27 reading adhigatâparavacano =
'denoting something that is different from what is under-
stood, or experienced'); AN IV 394,8 (different, opp.
ahaṁ, ib. n; cf. Mvu I 290,3-4, etc., the old formula
of a jātaka-samodhāna); AN IV 276,3 (aññena pi
pariyāyena); Ja IV 278,1 (~aṁ katipâhaṁ, some days
more); —- with abl. (= other than): MN I 119,8 (tamhā
nimittā ~aṁ nimittaṁ); Ja VI 293,24 (rañño ākap-
pato ~aṁ eva ākappaṁ kareyya); ~aṁ ito, Sn 891.
— (b) with negation (= nothing else, only that), Ja III
212,4*; often in the formula ~aṁ n'atthi . . . pana): Ja
I 292,1; 503,15; Dhp-a I 393,15; 402,12; do. as epexe-
gesis: Dhp 274 (es' eva maggo, n'atth' añño); Ja VI
305,22 (māṇavo yeva, na añño; cf. an-añña).
— (c) combined with other pronouns: tayi amārente añño
ko māressati, Ja III 540,15; kā tassa aññā gati
bhavissati, MN II 60,7; añño koci daṭṭhuṁ na labhati,
Ps III 683,6; aññaṁ kiñci n'atthi, ib. 730,21; vinā
saddhamma n'atth' añño koci nātho loke vijjati,
Kacc-v 274 (a corrupt çloka from some canonical
text (?); ns ad Sadd III (Ce 789,33), explains
'natthi' as a nipāta = 'not'; cf. Sadd III 566;
atth' is not likely representing atra). — (d)
'pleonastic' (cf. greek ăUog): DN II 151,22 (suññā
parappavādā samaṇehi aññe) = AN II 238,9 =
MN I 64,1 (w. r. aññehi, cf. note p. 534); Mil 36,23
(~ena dārunā). — 2. repeated (= one . . . another
(different)): ~aṁ jīvaṁ, ~aṁ sarīraṁ, MN I 426,13,
etc.; this also title of a sutta, SN III 215; Ja III
230,21* (añño . . . añño); Dhp-a III 72,10 (rattiṁ
~aṁ . . . diva ~aṁ); 123,17 foll; Mil 32,24 (na hi
~o manasikāro, ~ā paññā); 65,12 foll.. (aññe . . .
aññe; cf. app-ekacce . . . app-ekacce. Sn p. 104,22);
171,14-15 (aññaṁ . . . aññena); see also añña-gocara;
— do. at the same verb (or noun): ~en' aññam paṭi-
carati, i. e. to meet one question with an answer of
quite different contents, DN I 94,23; Vin IV 1,5 (etc.
see paṭicarati); ~en' aññena cittena, Ja IV 57,25'
(= aññam-añña (2), q. v.). — Ifc. v. an-°, tad-°.

mfn. [sa. a-jña], ignorant, Sadd 271,10
(na jānātîti ~o; from Ud-a 426,29, see añña-jana).

n., another motive, Ja III 425,23'
(Bd perhaps better aññaṁ kāraṇaṁ).

[f., another course or existence, Ap
464,28 (v. l. better: aññaṁ gatiṁ).]

mfn., having recourse to others,
Sv II 193,2 = Spk III 302,3 (atta-gatikā hotha, mā
~ā; = 'attasaraṇā').

mfn., living by another or different
pasture, Ja II 362,4 (mayaṁ ~ā, tvam pi ~o [or read:
tvaṁ 'si]).

m., others, other people (the vulgar,
cf. puthujjana, ito aññe, etc.), Ud 91,10* (misso ~ena
vedagū; Ud-a 426,29 assumes 2añña, q. v.).
f., another existence, Ap 394,20.

mfn., of another nature (origin),
Nidd I 265,11 (kilesā~ā aññavihitā; — añña-sabhāvā,
Nidd-a).

mfn. (añña + añña), one . . . another,
Ja V 267,13* (~aṁ musale hantvā). f. aññam-añña.

ind. = aññathā; Sadd III 844
(sabbanāmehi thā-tatthā pakāravacane, tatthā-pac-
cayo pāvacane appasiddho; cf. Kacc-v 400, Rūp 405
(w. r. aññathattā).

mfn. [sa. anyatama], a certain one
(among many); with gen. tesaṁ ahaṁ ~o, MN I
17,19-29 (= eko, aññataro, Ps); Mhv XXXVIII 14;
cf. Rūp 207 (ad Kacc 180): aññatara-aññatama-saddā
aniyamatthā = Sadd 266,27.

mfn. [sa. anyatara; with pronominal
inflexion like añña, but cf. m. pl. ~ ā, SN IV 341,23],
1. either of two (with gen. pl.), Ja IV 253,14* (dvin-
naṁ ~aṁ ñatvā [ɔ: prob, jhatvā]); VI 283,2* (āyūha-
taih ~assa hoti, scil. jayo, parājayo). — 2. some
(among more than two), any; one, certain (see Spk I
15,12 quoting MN I 255,16); (a) with gen. pl.: Sn 35;
210 (~aṁ pi tesaṁ); Sn p. 16,11 (~o arahataṁ;
= eko . . . abbhantaro, i. e. '•one more prominent
among them*, Pj) ≠ DN I 177,8 (Sv); DN III
37,17 (ayaṁ tesaṁ ~o; = ayaṁ tesaṁ abbhantaro
eko sāvako vā, Sv); MN II 23,28 (tesaṁ ~o Pañca-
kaṅgo); Ja III 492,18* (so 'haṁ sataṁ ~o 'smi);
IV 261,13* (~o sataṁ so); Dhp 137 (dasann[aṁ]
~aṁ ṭhānaṁ); 157 (tiṇṇam ~aṁ yāmaṁ); Pj I 174,3
(paññādīnaṁ ~to, abl.); cf. aññatama; — (b) attribute
to a subst.: Sn p. 80,1 (~asmiṁ rukkhamūle; Pj);
DN II 104,10; Ud 3,12 (~o huhuṅkajātiko brāhmaṇo;
Ud-a); 4,4 (~o brāhmaṇajātiko bhikkhu; Ud-a);
38.13 (~aṁ rukkhamūlaṁ; Ud-a); 71,15 (~issā gaṇi-
kāya); It 103,6 (~aṁ sāmaññaṅgaṁ; It-a); Vin I 128,34
(~asmiṁ āvāse); IV 246,31 (~issā bhikkhimiyā sad-
dhiṁ); III 37,14 (~issā itthiyā paṭibaddhacitto;
quoted Sadd 217,29); DN III 89,15; MN II 3,16 (~o
Kassapassa sāvako); SN I 1,3 (~ā devatā; Spk); 140,20
(~issā brāhmaṇiyā); 208,20 (~issā upāsikāya); IV
180,23 = AN IV 461,13 (~aṁ devanikāyaṁ); SN IV
191,26 (~o bhikkhu yen' ~o bhikkhu ten' upasaṁ-
kami); Dhp-a I 54,23 (ath' [eko] aññataro bhikkhu);
Pj II 421,10 (aññatarassā paribbājikāya, w. r. for
~issā). — 3. other, another {different), Abh 717; SN IV
191,26 (cf. above); DN III 92,6 (~aṁ bhāgaṁ, opp.
sakaṁ bhāgaṁ); ~o pi, again another, AN IV 317,13
. . . 318,21; pl. ~e pi sattā, DN I 17,33 (≠ aññe pi
sattā, ib. 32); III 85,21 (v. l. aññe); ~vā . . . ~vā =
one or the other, SN IV 173,4; 178,1; MN III 114,18-19.
— In titles of suttas: ~aṁ, SN II 75 (cf. 80,16); ~o
bhikkhu, SN V 7—8 (cf. below). — Ifc. v. āmisa°,
kāya°, ñāta°, thera°, deva°, paññāta°, vedanâ-°,
sippa°.

n., title of Dhp-a II
201—2. — °-upāsaka-vatthu, n., title of Dhp-a III
261—64. — °-kutumbika-vatthu, n., title of Dhp-a
III 276—78 (cf. Ja III 162 foll.). — °-kumārika-
vatthu, n., title of Ras II 177—79. — °-kuladārika-
vatthu, n., title of Dhp-a III 260—61. — °-kula-
putta-vatthu, n., title of Dhp-a III 348—51.
— °-purisa-vatthu, n., title of Dhp-a II 1—-19.
— °-brāhmana-vatthu, n., title of Dhp-a III 284—86;
III 338—41; 392—3.
entry.re:
— °-bhikkhussa vatthuAññatara-itthi-vatthu-bhikkhussa vatthu, n.,
title of Dhp-a I 281—83; 290—97 (297—300); III
299—302.

— °-manussa-vatthuAññatara-itthi-vatthu-manussa-vatthu, n., title of Ras I
31—32.

entry.sense:
mfn., one or other, or every
single of more, pl. all kinds of..., DN III 45,27
(~ena, opp. sabbehi); MN III 250,9; AN IV 56,5;
Nidd I 68,15 (~ena vatthunā; Nidd-a); pl. ~esu
adhikusalesu dhammesu, DN III 145,28 (Sv).

m. pl. ~ā, diverse Elders,
Ja II 9,8.

[v. l. for aññātaka-vesa (Cks) in
Ja IV 230,27; V 385,23.]

m(fn). [Buddh, sa. anya-tīrthika;
Jain forms aṇṇa-utthiya, aṇṇa-titthiya; from añña +
tittha ɔ: laddhi, Sp ad Vin I 101,2], belonging to
another (non-Buddhistic) way of salvation, subst, a non-
Buddhist sectarian; (a) adj.: ~ā samaṇa-brāhmaṇa-
paribbājakā, SN IV 316,1; aññatitthiya-samaṇabrāh-
maṇa-paribbājakānaṁ adhigamo, SN II 139,13; — the
~ā paribbājakā are represented as ignorant: ~ā andhā
acakkhukā, Ud 67,34; anassuṁ ~ā, AN I 65,30;
— eclipsed by the Ruddha: asakkatā honti, SN II 119,26;
Ud 12,12; 72,26 foll. (quoted Mp II 227,12; cf. Dhp-a
III 181,1; Ja III 126,6; cf. 128,8*); — they have ārāmas:
SN II 32,31; V 108,6; 115,16; AN IV 35,2; 378,12;
V 48,11; 185,9; — they rehearse their dhamma on
uposatha days: Vin I 101,4 (Sp; the Buddhists adopt
this custom); — their tenets: tīṇi pavivekāni pañña-
penti, AN I 240,25; cf. Pp-a 172,9; —their puffery: pa-
ṭākaṁ parihareyyuṁ, DN III 115,25 (cf. AN V 185,14);
— their topics of conversation: ~ānaṁ kathā udapādi,
AN II 176,15 (on brāhmana-saccāni); ~ā... tiracchāna-
kathaṁ kathenti, AN V 185,15; 189,22; DN III 37,28
(Sv); — their questions and how to refute them : ṭhānaṁ
vijjati yaṁ ~ā vadeyyuṁ, MN I 64,3; SN IV 228,13;
evaṁvādino ~ā evam assu vacanīyā, SN V 109,21;
112,6; sace ~ā puccheyyuṁ, AN I 115,1; 199,17;
IV 338,9; 351,10; V 106,13; SN IV 138,5; V 27,14;
326,3; esp. SN III 116,6 ... 118,3 ≠ IV 380,8 ...
382,2; IV 51,1-17; V 6,22; ~ānaṁ evaṁ puṭṭhānaṁ
evaṁ v(ey)yākaraṇaṁ hoti, SN IV 392,26. — (b)
subst. ~ā (ɔ: ~ā paribbājakā): maṁ ~ā sāvakaṁ
labhitvā, AN IV 185,14; Gotamo ~ánaṁ sāvake
āvaṭṭeti (a Nigaṇṭha speaks), MN I 375,25 ≠ AN II
190,27; ~ā ācariyassa ācariyadhanaṁ pariyesissanti,
AN V 347,5; ~ānaṁ dhammassa attho vipallāsam
āpajjati, Vism 214,35; ~ā upāraddhā . . . AN V 230,1;
~e ārabbha kathesi, Ja III 74,19; m. sg. ~o, Pj II
436,12. — Cf. titthiya, esp. nānā-titthiyā, puthu-
titthiyā.

m., one who has formerly be-
longed to another (non-Buddhist) sect, an ex-sectarian;
SN II 219,13 (Mahā-Kassapo; ≠ Mvu III 49,12); they
must submit to a period of probation before ordination:
Vin I 69,1 foll. (cf. ib. 60,1); DN I 176,16 = II 152,15;
MN I 391,28 ≠ 494,6 ≠ 512,26 ≠ SN II 21,13 = Sn
p. 102,1 (~o = aññatitthiyo eva, Pj). —- °-kathā,
f. title of Vin I 69,1—71,32 (Sp has Aññatitthiya-
vatthu).
m., title of SN V 27—29.

n., (taking) refuge to the
heretics, Ja I 96,4 (~am bhinditvā Buddhaṁ saraṇaṁ
agamaṁsu).

n., a heretical milieu, Ps
II 9,8 (evam eva imesu samaṇesu eka-samaṇo pi na
~e uppajjati); cf. titthāyatana.

ind. [sa. anyataḥ], (a) as abl. of añña:
from another (person or quarter), Sn 790 (Pj); 919
(opp. ajjhattaṁ; Pj); — (b) to another place, in another
direction, Ja III 376,27 (~ olokento); —- (c) otherwise,
from another point of view, SN IV 50,20 (~ passati;
Spk).

n. (cf. sa. anyatā, f.), the being another,
difference; Abhidh-av 86,18 (duvidhaṁ: lakkhaṇa-
kataṁ, desantara-kataṁ).

ind. [cf. sa. anyatra], 1. elsewhere, any-
where else, Dhp-a III 134,5 (~âpi); 351,13; IV 69,14;
As 163,19; Pv-a 45,24; Mhv XXII 14; also re-
presenting loc. of añña: ~ cittikāraṁ karoti, Pj I
170,24 (cf. aññatra, ib. 171,2). —-2. to another place,
somewhere else, Ja II 154,25 (~ yāhi); Dhp-a I 212,6
(ito ~ gacchāma); II 82,5 (~ gacchantassa); Mhv IV
37; Ja I 291,16 (kiṁ te ~gatena). — Se also aññatra
below.

, mfn. [sa. anyârtha, and anyapadârtha-
(pradhāna)], 'viewing something else', a gramm, term
for the function of bahuvrīhi-comp. (whose parts
combine to form an epithet to another word), Mogg II
159; 188; III 86 [78] (~e aññapadatthavuttimhi
samāse, Mogg-v). Cf. Franke, Gesch. u. Kritik d.
einh. Pāli-Gr. p. 43; see also bāhirattha, Sp-ṭ ad Sp I
174,24. — m. something other, other object or aim
dat. ~āya, Ps I 250,9 (cf. aññadattha).
& °-yoga, see aññatra-°.
mfn., see aññathâ-°.

ind. [sa. anyatra, f. aññattha above),
1. adv. elsewhere, in another place, Vin I 301,5
(~...~); Ja V 252,17 (opp. idha); Pv 569 (scan
siyâññatra 'sa ved°; Pv-a); Mil 50,3; 244,21; 248,25;
Pj I 171,2 (≠ aññattha, ib. 170,24). — 2, adv. or
prp., according to Sadd III 565, Mogg II 32 with foll.
instr, or abl. (or acc, Mogg; cf. Vin I 317,2, v. r.),
though these cases are not always dependent of it, as it is
as well followed by a gen. (see below): (a) apart from,
in the absence of, out of; without; DN I 168,29 (instr.);
II 76,3 (abl.); AN I 187,38 foll. (annatr'eva, instr.);
SN I 62,10 = AN II 48,20 (abl.); SN II 115,23 ≠ IV
139,6 (abl.); AN I 35,13 = SN V 466,8 (~ manussehi,
elsewhere than among men); MN III 16,15 = SN III
100,30 (instr., or abl.pl., different from); Ud 60,21 = Vin
II 198,22 (quoted Dhp-a I 142,12, III 154,12; instr. &
abl.: ~ Bhagavatā~ bhikkhusaṁghā); Mil26,19; 27,11
(acc.); Ja IV 35,4* (~ kāmā = vinākāmena, anicchāya);
MN I 504,36 (instr.); — Vin I 317,2 (~ dhammā,
against the dhamma, v. r. dhammaṁ); SN IV 239,11
(aññatr' eva purisehi, in contradistinction to);
— (b) with the exception of, except, but; Sn p. 15,5 ≠
DN II 127,25 (gen., yassa taṁ paribhuttaṁ sammā-
pariṇāmaṁ gaccheyya ~ Tathāgatassa); Sn 291
(abl, ~ tamhā samayā; cf. Vin III 212,29**); 886
(~ saññāya); Sn 765 = SN IV 128,6* (aññatra-
m-ariyehi); Vin III 112,17** (abl., = ṭhapetvā, ib.
25'); Ja IV 33,9* (do.); 53,22* (instr., 'except with them',
= ṭhapetvā); MN I 473,8 (aññatr' eva rattibhojanā
bhuñjāmi, i. e. only by day); — in this sense frequently
used in interrogative clauses, or after a negation: Sn 206
(kim ~ adassanā); DN I 90,21 (kim ~ avusitattā);
SN III 1,22 (kim ~ bālyā); V 14,28; AN V 82,11
(instr.); Ja IV 71,2*; V 173,21* (abl.); 296,21 (~
Kusarājato, cf. 296,25*); 343,10* (~ etassa jīvitā);
Dhp-a III 80,4 (instr.); Vin I 134,24 (~ saṁghena,
without a saṁgha; ~ antarāyā, except in cases of
emergency); MN I 143,18; 148,13 (instr.); 1124,28
(abl.); Mil 113,7 (instr.) = 272,9; Dhp-a II 243,19
(do.); ib. 21 (~ pāto bhikkhācāra-velaṁ); AN I 125,7
~ anuddayā, ~ anukampā, except from); — (c) kim
aññatra = in short, AN IV 166,20 = 168,17 (kim~:
Nando indriyesu guttadvāro; = kim aññena kāraṇena
kathitena, Mp).

f., passing into another existence;
°-vasā, abl. (see vasa), because of being forced to
pass into a different form of existence, Ja II 242,7
(pakatiyā ca paralokaṁ gatā nāma ~ puna ten' eva
sarīrena na āgacchanti).

m(fṅ), a thing (belonging
to one place, but) used in another place, Vin II 174,7-9
= III 66,3-5 (~aṁ aññatra paribhuñjanti).
v. aññathâcariyaka.

n. (abstr. of aññathā), (a) differ-
ence, alteration, variation, change, SN IV 40,23 (kā-
yassa; — aññathā-bhāva, Spk); V 216,22(indriyānaṁ);
MN II 106,12 (indriyānaṁ; = vivaṇṇatāya aññathā-
bhāvo, Ps); Ja I 147,10 (indriyānaṁ); MN II 110,17
(jīvitassa); AN I 152,8 (uppādo, vayo, ṭhitassa ~aṁ;
- jarā, Mp; cf. Nett 22,32); SN III 37,31 (do. ṭhitā-
naṁ, v. l. ṭhitassa); V 365,18 (catunnaṁ mahābhū-
tānaṁ) ≠ AN I 222,27 (= bhāvaññathatta, Mp);
AN V 60,2 (Mahābrahmuno pi atth' eva ~aṁ, atthi
vipariṇāmo); MN I 83,13 (n'atthi Tathāgatassa pañ-
ñāveyyattiyassa ~aṁ); II 253,2 (Ps); —- (b) in the
same sense, esp. the change of mind into delusion,
depression, anxiety, remorse, etc.: AN III 66,17 =
179,22 = 256,2 ≠ Vin I 45,18 = II 2,11 = III 21,8
(synon, appasāda; = pasādaññathābhāva, vippaṭi-
sāra, Sp) ≠ It 11,8 (It-a); MN I 334,9 (cittassa ~;
cf. Mvu III 114,8); 366,7; 448,9 (+ domanassa; =
cittaññathatta, Ps); 1151,2, 9 (+ domanassa); Mil
209,7 (na bhaveyya arahato cittassa kiñci ~aṁ);
MN I 457,34 (+ vipariṇāma) ≠ SN II 191,17 (Spk);
IV 329,1; Cp II 2,9 (na karomi citt(e) ~aṁ).
— (c) variation, i. e. inconsequence, or unreliability, Ja
I 19,13 (n'atthi Buddhānaṁ kathāya ~aṁ, cf. Bv II
110). — Ifc. v. citta°, pasāda°, bhāva°, lakkhaṇa°,
vipariṇāma°.

[ind. = aññathā, according to
Kacc-v 400, see aññatatthā.]

ind. [sa. anyathā], (a) otherwise, differ-
ently; Sn 588 = 757 (tato taṁ hoti ~) ≠ SN IV 23,26;
SN III 16,9 (vipariṇamati ~ hoti); Ja III 522,14*
(tato me~); Pv-a 133,4 (ito ~); Mil 30,14 (~bhaṇati);
As 163,20 (evaṁ ~ pi attho hoti); opp. to tathā
(cf. below (c)): As 153,1 (tathā vā ~ vā); repeated:
DN II 160,14; MN I 340,30 (Ps); 360,12; ~kho ...
~ ca pana, DN III 37,28; AN I 163,15; V 234,20
= 251,20; 263,24; SN I 24,3*; — (b) in an unwelcome
manner, disagreeably, Ja V 91,8* (ayyaputtassa mano
hessati ~, cf. cittassa aññathattaṁ [see aññathatta
(b)]; the two phrases contaminated in cittassa aññathā
n'atthi, Gp I 8,15 and a verse in the style of Cp quoted
Ja I 46,15*). — (c) in opposition to reality, falsely, It
122,1 (tath'eva hoti no ~) = AN II 24,5 ≠ DN III
135,15; Ja III 457,1* (yo jānaṁ pucchito pañhaṁ ~
naṁ viyākare) ≠ IV 116,24*; VI 288,14'. — Ifc. v.
an-°, and cf. an-aññathă, ân-aññathatā.

mfn. (aññathā + ācariyaka,
n. (q. v.); cf. aññathā-dhamma), adhering to another
system of teaching; aññadiṭṭhika +: ~ena, DN I
187,18 (aññattha te ācariyakaṁ . . ., Sv); III 35,1;
40,9 — MN I 487,9 (. . . aññesaṁ ācariyānaṁ santike
vasantena, Ps); II 43,12; the reading is doubtful, Ct.s
seem to be in favour of v. l. aññattha° (or aññatrâ°,
influenced by aññatrâyoga which precedes?)
mfn. = aññā-disa, q. v.

mfn., of different morals,
SN IV 341,29.

m. [sa. anyathābhāva], the
becoming otherwise or different, change, variation (opp.
itthabhāva, synon, viparināma); Abh 776; Sn 729
(itthabhāva°; Pj); It 94,17* (do.); Sn 740 (do.) =
It 9,3* = 109,14*; MN I 328,34* (do.; Ps); AN II
10,10* (do.; = anāgatattabhāva, Mp); DN II 118,29
(nānābhāvo vinābhāvo+); MN II 110,16 (vipari-
nāma°); III 111,4 (do.; Ps); SN II 274,14 (do.);
ill 8,10 (do.); 107,1 (do.); SN III 16,10 (rūpa-vipari-
ṇāma°); 42,22 (do.); Vibh 379,16 (vipariṇāma°).
— Ifc. v. pasāda°.

mfn., inconsistent, change-
able; SN III 225,1; IV 67,28 (anicca+); ~ī bhava-
satto (v. l. bhavappatto; cf. Mvu II 418,6: bhave
saktah), SN IV 23,26; 67,2 = Ud 32,31 (Ud-a; quoted
Nett 156,24). — Ifc. v. an-°. aññathā-bhāvi

mfn., of different opinion;
pl. m. ~ino, DN III 138,18; 140,12-31.

mfn., given by another, Saddh 394.
Cf. aññadatthika.

m., according to Ct.s = another
object, aim, or advantage, Sn 828 (na h'annadatth'
atthi pasaṁsalābhā; Pj = na hi ettha pasaṁsalābhato
añño attho atthi; cf. Nidd I 168,27). Cf. aññattha.

mfn. (cf. prec), appointed to the
benefit of another, Vin IV 251,6** . . . 254,22** (~ena
+ aññuddisikena; = aññass' atthāya dinnena, ib.
251,10', Sp). Cf. aññadattika.

ind. (sometimes written ~uṁ),
lit. 'let be the rest what it may' [see Tr. note to Mil
133,17; thus cf. sa. āstām (tāvat) rather than astu]:
(a) in the canonical texts as a rule combined with
eva (yeva, va) = only, exclusively, absolutely (ex-
plained as ekaṁsa-vacane nipāto, Sv I 111,24; =
ekaṁse, Abh 1140; Sadd (Ce) III 786,8), thus only
strengthening the sense of 'eva': DN I 91,17 (~ mamaṁ
yeva maññe anujagghantā); 91,31 (tayo vaṇṇā ~
brāhmaṇass' eva paricārakā sampajjanti); II 284,21
(~ mamaṁ yeva sāvakā sampajjanti, na câhaṁ
tesaṁ); MN II 139,15 (~ dhammiyā [Ck adds va]
kathāya parisaṁ sandasseti); SN IV 118,21 (~ māṇa-
vakānaṁ yeva sutvā; quoted Sadd (C) III 786,11);
AN IV 233,34 (~ uyyojanika-paṭisaṁyuttaṁ yeva
kathaṁ kattā hoti); I 252,20 (~ pañjaliko va naṁ
yācati); Sp I 65,12* (~ tav' ev' assa vighāto, it
would only be trouble to you); — (b) ~ kho, at least,
surely, certainly (without 'eva'): DN III 53,1 (~ dān'
ime aññatitthiyā Bhagavato bhāsitaṁ sussūsanti);
— (c) as antithesis = rather, on the contrary (with
foll. 'eva' or alone): MN I 177,12 (~ samaṇañ ñeva
Gotamaṁ okāsaṁ yācanti); Ja V 50,23' (~ sak-
kātabbo garukātabbo yeva); As 170,11 (na virujjhati,
~ saṁsandati c'eva sameti ca); before compar. Mil
133,17 (~ vimalataraṁ yeva bhaveyya); ~ pana:
Ja III 354,1 (~ muditā va honti); — Ja III 92,22
(~ sokābhibhūto āḷāhanaṁ gantvā paridevamāno
vicari); Dhp-a I 389,21 (na sobhati . . . ~ garahaṁ
labhati). — f. ekadatthu (Ja III 105,20*, v. l.
aññadatthu). See also Kern p. 27.

m, the absolute victory, SN
V 6,16* (~aṁ jayaṁ, paron., where jayaṁ stands for
part. pl. jayantā (so Spk, taking aññadatthu =
ekaṁsena); originally *aññadatthujayañjayā, adj.
pU).

m(fn)., 'seeing all (at once)'
by Ctt. explained as 'one who sees everything' (Tr.
suggests 'one who needs only to cast a glance for
having his will'; perhaps better: who only sees,
the absolute seer, cf. draṣṭā dṛçimātraḥ, Yoga-sūtra
II 20); DN I 18,7 foll. (abhibhū anabhibhūto ~o
vasavattī issaro, etc., scil. Mahā-Brahmā; aññadatthu
ti ekaṁsavacane nipāto, dassanavasena daso, sabbaṁ
passāmîti attho, Sv = Ps II 545,18) = III 29,15
— MN I 327,1 (Ps); AN III 202,10 (do. Brahma); IV
89,10 (do.) = 105,4 = It 15,10 (It-a); — DN III
135,21 (do. scil. Tathāgato; quoted Nidd II ad Sn
1114) ≠ AN II 24,12 (quoted Ps I 51,17; Mp: añña-
datthun ti ekaṁsatthe nipāto, dakkhatîti daso)
— It 122,7 (It-a: yaṁ kiñci ñeyyaṁ nāma sabbaṁ taṁ
hatthatale āmalakaṁ viya passatī ti daso; cf. Rāmāy.
VII 37,5-12).

mfn., one who only takes
(without giving in return), DN III 185,20 (~o amitto
mitta-paṭirūpako veditabbo; = ekaṁsena hārako
yeva, Sv); 186,1*; 186,26* (quoted Ja II 390,18*); Ja VI
378,15-17 (read: evaṁ sante ~ā santā ekaṁsena
yācakā c'eva laddhaṁ harantā ca samānā; in 378,8*
the words ~ā santā are interpolated from the prose,
according to Fsb.). Cf. Amg aṇṇadattahara.

ind. [sa. anyadā, Amg aṇṇayā], at
other times, else; (a) before, formerly: Ja IV 204,4
(withpresenl time); 437,24; Ja V 12,21; Mp II 234,21
(Se añño); Dhp-a IV 125,9 (na ~ . . . pakkapubbā);
129,19 (~âpi samuṭṭhita-pubbo bhante, scil. udara-
vāto, = ever before); Ps II 152,12 (etarahi pi ~âpi);
— (b) once again; SN IV 285,15.

mfn. (from añña + diṭṭhi),
having different views; + añña-khantika, añña-rucika,
aññatrăyoga, aññathâcariyaka: DN I 187,17; III
35,3; MN I 487,8; II 43,11.

mfn. [sa. anyadīya], belonging to
another, Pay fol. ke 7 (see under atidesa below).

mfn., to be guided by somebody else,
ifc. v. an-°.

entry.re:
— °-samāsaañña-pad'-attha-samāsa, m., a
comp, of that kind, pt ad Sv I 313,31 ('aṭṭhaṅgika');
cf. Sv-pṭ ad DN II 55,19 (aññapadattha-vacanicchâ-
bhāvato kammadhāraya-samāso); Kkh-ṭ ad Vin III
112,4** ('sañcetanika', quasi sat + cetanā + ika).

entry.sense:
(m)f(n)., charmed by
another man; f. pl. ~ā Ja V 449,21'.

mfn., belonging to another (or to
something other), Vin III 167,26; 167,38** foll. (~assa
adhikaraṇassa; Sp II 108,1).

mfn. (sg. Se pl.) [cf. sa. anyonya
& aññoñña below; cf. also aṇu-ṁ-thūla, eka-m-eka,
etc.), 1. one . . . another, each other; most frequently
acc. sg. ~aṁ: (a) as an acc. object, (b) as an
adv. before verbs or nouns = mutually, reciprocally:
(a) Sn 597 (na sakkoma saññattuṁ ~); 825 (dahanti
mithu ~); 882 (yam āhu bālā mithu ~); DN I 20,16
(upanijjhāyanti); 56,23 (vyābādhenti) = SN III
211,8; DN II 154,9 (āvusovādena samudācaranti);
MN I 86,24 (pāṇīhi upakkamanti); 214,25 (pañhaṁ
pucchanti); II 243,20 (mukhasattīhi vitudantā); SN I
15,21* (aññamaññâbhigijjhanti, = aññamaññaṁ
abhigijjhanti, Spk); Ja III 477,29* (pihayeyyuṁ, or
read piyāyeyyuṁ?)); IV 211,3* (aghātayuṁ);
— (b) Bv II 170 (~ paghaṭṭitā; = ~ pahaṭā, Bv-a; quoted
Ja I 26,18* with the reading aññamaññůpaghaṭṭitā);
Ja IV 115,11 (tumhe ~ kiṁ hotha); V 111,10 (avaha-
santi); 231,1 (vicāretvā); IV 126,15 (roditvā paride-
vitvā); VI 33,1 (parideviṁsu); Dhp-a I 57,17(accayaṁ
desetvā); AN II 59,11* (piyaṁvadā, cf. Ja IV 288,19*);
III 247,17 (agāravā); Ja I 218,20(do.); II 353,23 (veraṁ
bandhiṁsu); AN IV 429,7 (vipaccanīkavādā); Ja I
316,5 (sahāyakā); III 31,10 (vissāso); 188,2 (paṭi-
baddhacittā); IV 56,14 (piyasaṁvāsaṁ); 211,3* (vivā-
dena); Ps III 2,10 (vigatasallāpā); Mil 131,15 (dūraṁ
vivajjitā); — — gen. m. ~assa, Sn 148 (dukkhaṁ
iccheyya); DN I 1,13 (uju-vipaccanīka-vādā); 56,24
(nâlam ~ sukhāya); MN I 32,33 (subhāsitaṁ sama-
numodiṁsu; = añño aññassa, Ps); Mil 89,15 (do.);
MN I 295,9 (gocaravisayaṁ, cf. Vibh 319,36; 320,24);
214,25 (pañhaṁ ... vissajjenti); Ja III 390,12* (ro-
dāma ~assa ñātake); IV 288,19* (piyaṁvadā);
— gen. f. ~issā, Vin IV 239,8-18**, 240,1' (vajjapaticchā-
dikā); — loc. ~amhi, DN I 20,17; III 32,18 (cittāni
padūsenti); III 72,13 (tibbo āghāto paccupaṭṭhito);
— instr, pl. ~ehi, Sn 936 (vyāruddhe, against each
other); Mil 57,16 (anallāpo tesaṁ, with each other).
— 2. (without reciprocal sense), one after another, now
one and now one, various, different; acc. sg. ~aṁ, MN
III 45,19 (kāyasamācāraṁ); Ja I 200,12 (Ed. in two
words: aññam aññaṁ hatthiṁ ānayiṁsu); II 259,6'
(ārammaṇaṁ); Mil 36,28 (scil. senaṁ); gen. sg. ~assa,
Ja III 158,1 (Cks ~assâpi rañño, Ed. aññassâpi); IV
251,15 (Cks; read: vissajjetha naṁ, puññaṁ assā
(so Se) atthi); f. pl. ~ā, Sn 600 foll. = MN ch.
98 (= aññā aññā, nānappakārā, Pj & Ps); instr, pl.
~ehi, Ja I 185,3* (titthehi, = aññehi aññehi, Ct.); SN
II 54,18 (~padehi~pariyāyehi); Nett 23,15-31; 24,1.

f., the eating or devouring
each other, MN III 169,24 = SN V 456,9 (+ dubbala-
khādikā, or °mārikā; = aññamañña-khādana, n.,
Ps, Spk).

mfn. pl. ~ā, mutually
guarded or watched over, SN V 169,1 (+ aññamañña-
rakkhitā).

n., title of Vibh 158
— 164; Vibh-a 206,28.

mfn., fickle-minded, Ja IV
57,1* (57,25'), Ee añña-sacitta°.

mfn., depending one on
the other, Mil 49,22-25 (ubho p'ete ~ā, scil. nāma and
rūpa). Cf. aññoñña-nissita, aññamaññůpanissita.

mfn. = prec, Paṭis II
49,13 foll.; —- m. interdependence, Tikap 1,12; 3,27-2 9
(quoted Vism 535,21) Tikap-a 14,30. — °-kathā, f.,
title of Kv XV,2 (p. 510—11). — °-tā, f. abstr., Vibh-a
206,30.

n., the respective food
(of two animals), Ja VI 354,25* (vītihāram ~ānaṁ).

mfn., pl. ~ā, mixed together,
Ps II 492,5 (ime saṁkhārā ~ā ālulitā avibhūtā
duddīpanā).

mfn. = aññamañña-
gutta (q. v.).

n., mutual converse, Vin
III 178,13** (= aññamaññassa hitavacanaṁ, Sp).

n., mutual help to get
out of immorality or guiltiness), ib. (= [aññamaññaṁ]
āpattito vuṭṭhāpanaṁ, Sp).

n., sg. & pl., synonymous
words, Ja IV 35,22' (ārā dure ti ~aṁ); Ja III
217,13' (kuhiṁ katthā ti ~āni); Ps III 90,10 (aggan-
ti ādīni [ɔ: aggaṁ, seṭṭhaṁ, uttamaṁ . . . MN I
383,17] sabbāni ~āni); 430,10; 501,10.

m. pl., the respective
teachers, ~ārâdiṁ nissitā, Pj II 541,7. aññamañña-sattha

mfn., pl. ~ā, mutually
harmonizing, Ps III 213,3.

[mfn., pl. ~ā, knocking
against one another, Ja I 26,18*, quoted from Bv II 170,
where text and Ct. read aññamaññaṁ paghaṭṭitā.]

m., mutual support,
Ja I 329,10' (~ena ṭhitā, scil. rukkhā). — °-ůpat-
thambhaka, mfn., mutually supporting, Vism 535,19
(tidaṇḍakaṁ viya); Tikap-a 14,31.

mfn. = aññamañña-
nissita (q. v.), Mil 49,18.

mfn., who may be delivered by
another, pl. na ~ā, Sn 773 (= aññena mocetabbā na
honti, Pj; Pj & Nidd explain it alternatively in an
active sense: aññe mocetuṁ na sakkonti).

mfn., one who prefers to speak
about something else, shuffling and evading the thing
in question, Vin IV 37,1; — n. ~aṁ, the offence of
such a person, ib. 36,3-14 (saṁgho Channassa ~aṁ
ropetu, cf. 2ropeti); ~e pācittiyaṁ, ib. 36,18**; ~e
vihesake pācittiyaṁ, ib. 36,37**; V 15,5. — f.
an-añña-vāda.

n., title of Vin IV
35—37 (Pācittiya1 12).

mfn., professing another (non-
Buddhistic) doctrine, Th 86. añña-vādi

(or aññā-vi°, q. v.) mfn., thinking
about, or occupied with, other things, otherwise disposed,
Vin IV 269,11' (a-rahopekkhā + ; Sp = raho-assādato
~ā; in both places aññā-°); Ja VI 62,27 (Bd aññā-°);
Ps II 120,3; 309,14 (do.); III 248,19 (aññā-vihita-
kāle); Nidd I 265,11 (kilesā~ā; Nidd-a: añña-vihitakā
= aññenâkārena ṭhitā); Ps II 397,17 (aññāvihita-
bhāvo). — °-tā, f. abstr., Dhp-a I 181,21.

mfn. = prec, DN III 134,7
(~aṁ ñāṇadassanaṁ; Sv aññā-° = aññaṁ ārabbha
pavattamānaṁ); Ja IV 389,20; Ps II 355,10 (aññā-°).
n., see aññā-°.
[w. r. for aññamañña-citta, q. v.]

m., another teacher; ~āraṁ na
uddisati, Ps I 135,21 (= Sv I 234,21: aññaṁ s°,
see next); Ps I 135,18 = Sv I 234,18, quoted Ss 68,30
(°-satthārâdisu). añña-sattha

m. (a vb-noun from the
phrase: aññaṁ satthāraṁ uddisati, for instance AN I
27,35 (Mp); MN I 265,23; Mil 94,32), adopting another
teacher (one among the six great crimes, abhiṭhānāni,
q. v.), Pj I 189,22 (mātughāta +).

mfn., of another nature, Nidd-a
αcṝ Nidd I 265,11 (= 'añña-jātika').

mfn., 'like the other' (designation
of 13 mental properties, phassa, etc., which become
kusala or akusala if combined with kusala or akusala
elements resp.); terasa cetasikā ~ā, Abhidh-s6,8;
cf. Trsl. p. 95 n. 4.

mfn. 1añña + 2sita), relying on, or
having recourse to, others, Sn 825 (vadenti te ~ā
kathojjaṁ; = aññamañña-satthārâdiṁ nissitā, Pj).
fut., see ājānāti.

f. [sa. ājñā, cf. āṇā] (the arriving at)
thorough knowledge, esp. the perfect insight of a
Buddhist saint, i. e. Arhatship; Abh 436 (arahattaṁ);
SN I 24,11* (~āya nibbutā dhīrā; = kilesa-nibbānena
nibbutā, Spk; cf. however aññāya, abs.); ~āya, Nidd
I 300,3 (aparaddhā; = aññāṇena, Nidd-a, v. r.
ñāyâparaddhā, cf. Nidd I 312,13); ~ā, It 104,10*
(read with It-a tato ~ā anantarā); diṭṭhe va dhamme
~ā, Sn p. 140,14 (= asmiṁ yeva attabhāve ara-
hattaṁ, Pj) ≠ MN I 62,36; 63,6 ≠ SN V 129,19;
181,17; 236,23; 285,6 ≠ AN III 82,10; 143,11; V
108,15 ≠ It 39,17, etc.; diṭṭhe va dhamme (paṭi-
hacca) ~aṁ ārādheti [Mvu III 53,9; Vyu 245,1194],
SN V 69,19; 237,8; 285,14; 314,17 ≠ AN III 192,16
(Mp); aṭṭhamiyaṁ ~ā udapādi, MN III 127,8 ≠ SN
II 221,2; ~āya saṇṭhahiṁsu, MN I 445,4 (= arahatte
patiṭṭhahiṁsu, Ps); SN II 224,4; aññā[ya] cittaṁ
upaṭṭhapeti (printed editions as a rule prefer aññācit-
taṁ, q. v.), Vin I 10,9 (sussūsati +; cf. Sp-t); DN I
230,13 (Sv, Sv-pṭ); MN II 253,22; 255,2; III 117,23
(Ee aññaṁ!); 133,2 (said of an elephant); 221,8 (Ps);
SN II 267,8; AN I 72,28 (Mp); II 131,33; III 437,13,
etc.; Nidd I 447,10 (= ñātukāma-cittaṁ paṇidahati,
Nidd-a); often in the phrase ~aṁ vyākaroti = he
proclaims Arhatship, Vin I 183,20 (Bhagavato san-
tike); 185,10 - AN III 359,24; Vin III 91,1 (adhimā-
nena; Sp); 100,30 (do.); V 189,30 (mandattā + do.) ≠
AN III 119,9 (= arahattaṁ patto 'smîti katheti, Mp);
SN V 222,9 (khīnāsavo bhikkhu ~); Ja I 140,15; II
333,6; As 375,5; Dhp-a III 168,24; 187,4; Dhp-a I
308,13 (~ abhūtaṁ vadati); abhūtaṁ vatvā ~,
Dhp-a IV 116,13; 175,15; 179,18; 183,21; 191,23;
221,9; 223,20; the same phrase foll. by the formula:
khīnā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, etc.: MN II
252,3; III 29,24 (Ps); SN II 51,2 foll.', 120,30; IV
139,1; V 222,14; AN V 155,27; 162,4. — Title of a
sutta: SN V 181. — Ifc. v. samma-d-°-vimutta.
v. l. Ja V 219,23*, see aññātaka.

or Aññāta-Koṇdañña [cf.
Buddh, sa. Ajñāta-Kauṇḍmya], m. Npr. of a thera,
the first who arrived at Arhatship (cf. aññā), formerly a
brāhmaṇa Koṇḍañña; maternal uncle of Punna, Th-a
(Ce) 37,31; author of Th 673—688; Ap 48,24—50,5;
origin of his surname, Vin I 12,18 = SN V 424,10
(Aññāta-°, v. l. Aññā-°); — SN I 193,31 foll. (£«
Aññāsi-K°, cf. Vin I 12,17); AN I 23,17 (cf. Mp I
136—148); Ja I 82,11; Ud 77,1 (Aññāta-°; Ud-a);
Ps II 37,19; Dhp-a I 97,1; Thī-a 3,8 (°-pamukhā
aṭṭhārasa Brahmakoṭiyo); Dhp-a I 87,1 (do.); As
35,21 (do.), cf. Dāṭh I 62 (°-nāma-dvija-muni-pamukh'-
aṭṭhārasabrahma-koṭī), Mhbv51,27; cf. Mvu III 345,3.
— Cf. Koṇḍañña.

n. [Vyu 245,853], in the phrase ~aṁ
upaṭṭhapeti = to hold in readiness one's citta pre-
disposed to aññā, prob, to be taken as one word instead
of aññā[ya] cittaṁ, which may have crept into the
texts from Ctt. (as Sv ad DN I 230,13: aññācittaṁ
upaṭṭh° = aññāya ājānanatthāya cittaṁ upaṭṭh°);
see aññā and cf. abhiññācitta, (Buddh, sa.) bodhicitta.

mfn. ( a + ñāṇa), not knowing, igno-
rant, witless; Ja I 315,21 (pamlite ~e karonti); III
269,27' (bālena ~ena purisena); 291,21' (°-manussā);
V 233,29' (~assa tava, Bds aguṇaññussa).

n. [sa. ajñāna], ignorance, lack of
insight (understanding, knowledge), Abh 168; Sn 839
— 40 (adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā ~ā [ ˇ - -]; Pj); MN I 54,25
(dukkhe, etc. ~aṁ ɔ: avijjā; Ps); SN II 4,12 (do.)
= IV 256,23 ≠ Vibh 135,10 (Vibh-a 138,20); MN I
487,2 (etthâhaṁ ~am āpādiṁ, sammoham āpādiṁ);
II 219,33 (avijjā ~ā sammohā); AN II 11,10 (avijjā
+ ); SN II 92,14 (~ā ananubodhā appaṭivedhā); III
258,9 (abl. ~ā; also title of 5 suttas ib. 257—60;
V 126,27, 31 (~āya adassanāya; Spk); Pp 21,19 (~aṁ
+ adassanaṁ, etc. ɔ: asampajaññaṁ) = Dhs 390
(ɔ: moho); 1061 (do.); Dhp-a III 351,1 (aṭṭhavatthu-
kaṁ ~aṁ, = 'avijjā'); Ja V 230,1 (attano ~ena,
because he himself was ignorant); Kv 173,2 foll. (atthi
arahato ~aṁ).

n. [sa. ājñāna], perceiving, knowledge;
°-atthaṁ, for the sake of Arhatship (cf. aññā), DN
III 57,17 (= jānanatthaṁ, Sv; ājānanatthaṁ . . .
vīmaṁsanatthaṁ, pt); AN I 199,13* (= do., Mp).

n. dimin. = 2aññāṇa; Vin IV 144,10
—-145,1' (~ena āpanno, i. e. transgressing on account
of ignorance [scil. of something that is a fault acc. to
the Pātimokkha]); 144,29** (~ena mutti, impunity
on account of ignorance); Ps I 56,10 (~ena, scil. Bhaga-
vato vacanaṁ nânumodiṁsu).
f.. title of Kv 173—80 (cf. Kv-a 55,5-15).

mfn. paññāṇa or 2aññāṇa],
causing ignorance, SN V 97,14 (andhakarana+) ≠
AN I 216,20 (Mp) ≠ It 82,10 (It-a) ≠ Nidd I 454,15
(Nidd-a); Ja I 305,29 (~ā kilesā).

f., the behaviour of ignorance,
Paṭis I 79,1; 80,27-82,15.

mfn., belonging to the unintelligent
ones, Ja III 387,23'.

f. abstr. [sa. ajñānatā], ignorance,
Ja I 230,26; II 232,24; III 57,15; Mp II 222,19.

mfn., as to which lack of know-
ledge is pain, MN I 303,6 (adukkhamasukhā vedanā
ñāṇasukhā ~ā).

m., a doctrine of ignorants;
Nidd I 192,9 (bāladhammo +).

mfn., (making something, or
being thus disposed) from lack of knowledge, Kv
173,28.

m., one associated with (parti-
san of) ignorance, Sn 347 (ganthā mohamaggā +)
= Th 1267.

m., the state of ignorance, Mp II
80,1 (= 'asampajaññaṁ').
entry.re:
— °-karaaññāṇa-bhāva-kara, mfn., causing
ignorance, Ja I 303,24 (~ā kilesā; cf. aññāṇa-karaṇa).

entry.sense:
mfn., originating from
the root of ignorance, or a 'tautological comp.' see
atita-gata-sattha(r) below (cf. Nidd I 256,1-e), SN I
181,13* (Spk).

mfn., characterized by añ-
ñāṇa, Vibh-a 136,25 (avijjā); As 249,9 (moho).

mfn., overcome by ignorance,
inattentive, Dhp-a III 260,17.

n., title of 5 suttas SN III 257
— 260 [aññāṇā abl. sg. 258,9, etc.].

mfn. [sa. ajñānin], 1. ignorant, foolish,
Ja III 228,6 (bālo ahosi~ī); 243,25' (= 'manda'); Ps
ad MN I 326,24 (= 'avijjāgato'). — 2. perplexed, out
of hit wits (or aññāṇī-hutvā from 1aññāṇa), Vv-a
76,6 = Dhp-a III 106,10 (v. l. aññamano). aññāṇi

f., indifference due to ignorance,
Ps ad MN III 219,9 (= '[gehasitā] upekkhā'); As
193,23 (gehasitāya ~āya).

mfn. [sa. a-jñāta], (a) not known, not
understood; (b) a stranger; (c) without renown (un-
tried). — (a) Mil 42,6 (°-pubba, not learnt before);
209,28 ; Ja III 363,8' (Buddhānaṁ~aṁ nāma n'atthi);
Dhp-a II 107,13 (~aṁ ñāpanatthāya, ñātaṁ anugaṇ-
hanatthāya); — MN I 430,1 (~aṁ tena purisena);
AN IV 384,18 (~aṁ + adiṭṭhaṁ apattaṁ asacchika-
taṁ anabhisametaṁ ≠ MN I 475,28 (. . . asacchika-
taṁ aphassitaṁ paññāya; quoted Nidd I 178,11 (Ee
aphusitaṁ); cf. Dhp-a II 186,21); — (b) DN II 83,11
(~ānaṁ nivāretā) = SN IV 194,12 = AN IV 107,19
= V 194,25; see also Sadd 97,6; — (c) Ja VI 292,18*
(— apākaṭaguṇo, aviditakammâpadāno); — (d) per-
haps 'living incognito'; or 'having no relatives', said
of the bhikkhu (cf. aññātuñcha), Ud 4,27* (anañña-
posiṁ ~aṁ; see also Sn 65; Ud-a alternatively to
2aññāta).

m. [sa. ājñātṛ], one who understands
or knows (the truth); nom. sg. ~ā (viharissāmi), DN II
286,14* (= ājānitukāmo hutvā viharissāmi, Sv; v. l.
aññātāvī viharissāmi); pl. ~āro (dhammassa), MN II
177,9; DN II 38,16 = 46,30 = MN I 168,23 = III
261,28 = SN I 106,1 = Vin I 5,26; desetu Bhagavā
dhammaṁ, ~āro bhavissanti, DN II 39,18* = SN I
137,33* = 234,4* — MN I 169,4* = Vin I 6,4* =
Mvu III 316,5*-18*; ahaṁ . . . dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ,
~āro ca dullabhā, AN I 133,19 (= paṭivijjhanaka-
puggalā, Mp; quoted Kv 561,4). aññāta

mfn. [sa. ajñātaka], 1. unknown,
Vin I 133,29-30 (~aṁ pattaṁ, etc.; = aññesaṁ santa-
kaṁ, Sp); Ja V 219,23* (~aṁ sāmikehi padinnaṁ,
v. l. aññā-kataṁ, Cks [as to -ā- cf. Pāṇ V 4,57-67];
Ct. 'aññātakaṁ' = aññesaṁ santakaṁ tehi sāmi-
kehi padinna-dānaṁ). — 2. not a kinsman, Vin III
206,14; 212,28**, 34'; 214,19** foll.; f. ~ikā, Vin III
206,14, 20**; IV 59,23-29** foll.; Dhp-a I 223,13 (m.
pl. ~akā); Mhv XIV 20 (do.).

n., title of
Nissaggiya1 6, Vin III 210—13.

m., disguise, only instr. ~ena,
in disguise, incognito: Vin I 344,7 foll.; Ja I 14,1; III
116,22; 417,3; 487,19; IV 230,27 (v. l. Cks añña-
tara-°); V 385,23 (do., cf. VI 364,7 Ee aññatara-
vesena, Ja-pot ektarā vēçayakin); VI 369,26 (= apra-
siddha-vēçayen, Ja-pot); Dhp-a I 56,6; II 133,16;
IV 144,4; Ps II 320,16; III 308,1; II 397,12 (°-vesen'
eva).

mfn., thinking that the person
in question is not a kinsman, Vin III 217,14. aññātaka-saññi
see Aññā-Koṇḍañña.

mfn., entertaining the conceit
of having understood (cf.2aññāta) something (loc.); an-
aññāte ~ī, AN III 175,14 (Mp); pl. ~ino dhamme,
Th 953. aññāta-māni

m. = aññātaka-v°; ~ena, in-
cognito, Bv II 55 (quoted Ja I 14,8*); Ja V 307,21*.

mfn. (from 2aññāta), possessed of
perfect knowledge, Dhs 555 (As 291,30); Vism 491,21. aññātāvi

m. [sa. ajñāti], not a kinsman, .la I
388,1 (~īhi dinnake paccaye; opp. ñāti). Cf. aññāt'-
uñcha.

f., not a female relation (opp. ñātikā),
see aññātaka (2).

mfn. [inf. aññātuṁ of ājānāti
+ kāma], desiring to know (the truth), AN III 192,1
(v. l. ñātu-kāma; = jānitu-kāmo hutvā, Mp); DN III
158,15*.

m. [aññāti, q. v. + uñcha] (the
gleaning i. e.) support or food from people who are
not relatives, or [see *annata (d)] the gleaning in-
cognito, SN II 281,20* (~ena yāpentaṁ; Se & Spk
(Se) w. r. aññābhuñjena); Bu. takes uñcha = piṇ-
dapāta, and explains aññāta + uñcha opp. to ñāta
(= abhilakkhita) + uñcha, Spk II 291,11 foll., where
read with Ce: aññātuñchenā ti abhilakkhitesu issa-
rajana-gehesu kaṭuka-bhaṇḍa-sambhāraṁ sugandhaṁ
bhojanaṁ pariyesantassa uñcho ñātuñcho nāma,
ghara-paṭipāṭiyā pan a dvāre ṭhitena laddhaṁ missa-
kabhojanaṁ aññātuñcho nāma (cf. Amg. aṇṇā(ya)-
uṁcha, aṇṇāya-piṇḍa, aṇṇā'-esi(n) and aṇṇāya-
caraya-, Aupap. Gloss, s. v.).

mfn. [sd. anyā-dṛç], like another, of
another kind; añño viya dissatîti aññādi, aññādikkho,
aññādiso, Mogg-v V 44 (cf. Kacc 644).

mfn. [sa.- anyā-drksa] = prec,
(q. v.).

mfn. [sa. anyā-dṛça], id., DN I 107,2
(v. l. aññathādisa) = MN II 136,2 (kacci pana so
tādiso, no ~o); Ja II 108,24 (saddo pan' assa ~o);
Ja VI 212,26* (~ā acalā diḍḍhaselā); Ja III 503,18
(mayhaṁ mātu mukhaṁ aññăsadisaṁ (!), but see Sadd
291,29). — °-tā, f. abstr., Pv-a 243,18 (acc. ~aṁ, v. l.
asadisataṁ).

m., beginning
the exposition of a new subject, Pj II 138,30 (= the
meaning of 'atha'); cf. adhikārantara.

mfn. [sa. anyâdhīna], subject to
others; ifc. v. an-°.

m., attainment to Arhatship,
AN IV 426,9 '(Mp); Vin II 238,30 ≠ AN IV 201,5
foll. (Mp).

m. (añña + apadesa), reference to
something other (allegorically), Pj II 32,13; 33,21
(~ena).

mfn. (aññā + ape(k)kha), desirous
of knowing; ~o va pucchissati, no vihesâpekho,
DN II 150,15 (= ñātukāma, Sv); with acc.: ~ā catu-
saccaṁ, scil. dhammaṁ suṇanti, Mil 334,30. aññâpekha

mfn., resulting in perfect knowledge,
AN IV 428,11 (ayaṁ samādhi ~o vutto Bhaga-
vatā; Mp).
abs., v. ājānāti (ā + √jñā).

f. (aññā + ārādhanā), attainment
or accomplishment of knowledge, MN I 479,35; 480,1
(= arahatte patiṭṭhānaṁ, Ps).

m(fn), i. q. sammad-aññā-
vimutta, It 53,10* = 104,11* (Ee: tato aññā vimut-
tassa!).

m., deliverance by knowledge,
Sn 1105; 1107 (Pj; quoted AN I 134,13*). aññā-vimokha

— anna-vihita(ka) q. v. (rhyth-
mical lengthening, see under Añjanāgiri).

n., the signification of one's
knowledge (Arhatship), cf. the phrase aññaṁ vyākaroti
(see aññā); sometimes written añña-v° or aññaṁ v°;
Ja I 370,9; five modes of °: pañca ~āni (or ~ā),
AN III 119,7 (Mp) ≠ Vin V 189,29; aññaṁ vyā-
karaṇā tayo, Vin III 100,14* (ɔ: Vin III 103,35
— 104,5).

title of SN V 129,16-31 [. . . diṭṭhe
va dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese . . .].
mfn., see aññā-disa.

aor. 3 sg., see jānāti & ājānāti. — Do.
3 pl. ~aṁsu, ~iṁsu.
v. l. = Aññā(ta)-Koṇḍañña.

n. (aññā + indriya), the faculty
attained by thorough knowledge, DN III 219,10 (an-
aññātaṁ-ñassāmîtindriya + ; Sv) = SN V 204,10
(Spk) = It 53,3 (cf. aññā ib. 53,9*; It-a); Pp 2,10;
Vibh 122,8; 402,22; Yam II 61,18, etc.; Nettl5,11;
54,1, etc.; Vism 491,22; 492,33; — Dhs 362 (As
239,14); 505.

mfn. (from the phrase aññaṁ
uddissa? cf. v. l. below), destined or appointed to an-
other, Vin IV 251,1** foll. (aññadatthikena + ; =
aññaṁ uddisitvā dinnena, Sp; Sp Ce writes aññuddis-
sikena, Sp-ṭ Be aññuddesikena).

ind. (instr, of añña), by another way,
on another side; repeated: aññen' eva . . . aññena,
DN II 30,20; SN II 231,10; vikkhittakaṁ ~ hatthaṁ
~ pādaṁ ~ sīsaṁ, As 197,32.

f., title of Kv XIV,5
(p. 499—501; Kv-a 149,20).

mfn. = aññam-añña; ~aṁ paṭicca,
Vism 521,22*; ~aṁ vadanti, Nidd I 291,26 (Nidd-a).
— °-nissita, mfn., interdependent; ubho ~ā, It 111,20*;
Vism 595,16* = Abhidh-av 115,4*; — Ja V 251,8*,16'
(pl. ~ā, scil. mahāsālā, entangled one in another).

√ gamanattho, Dhātup 84; gamane, Dhātum
102 (cf. Sadd II 272); aṭane, ib. 525 [sa-Dhātup 9,8].
Cf. aṭana, aṭanaka (& sa. paryaṭati).

n., name of a certain high numeral, a
koṭi12 = 1012 millions; Abh 475; Kacc-v 397 (Rūp
401); Sadd III 833 (see Sn p. 126,17 and Pj II
476,27—477,8).

m. Npr. of a certain hell; Sn p. 126,17
(~o niray'o) = SN I 152,10 = AN V 173,14.

n. [ts.], roaming, Dhātum 525 (giving the
sense of √aṭ).

mfn. roaming, in the comp. °-gāvī, f.,
a cow which has the habit of wandering about, Ja V
105,25* (caṇḍā ~ī, a wild and savage cow; = palā-
yana-sīlā, Ct. [metre and Ct. support the reading
caṇdā aṭanakā gāvī]).

f. [cf. sa. aṭani], one of the four rails which
form the frame of a bed (or a seat), or, (coll.) the
frame as a whole; Abh 309; Vin IV 168,26** (aññatra
