heṭṭhimāya ~iyā); Ja II 337,15 (mañcakassa ~iṁ
gahetvā nipajji); 424,15 (mañcassa ~iṁ upagūhitvā
nipajji, quoted Ss 144,21); Ja IV 84,13 (mañcassa ~iṁ
pariggahetvā nipajji) = Pv-a 93,23 (Ee añjaliṁ in-
stead of aṭaniṁ); Dhp-a I 234,12 (heṭṭhā ~iyaṁ);
pl, ~iyo, Dhp-a III 365,3 (catasso, of a dhammāsana);
Sp (Se) II 332,20 foll. (ad Vin IV 40,5'); — °-pāda-
vilīva, pl., the different materials for making a simple
bedstead (viz. frame, legs, and bottom), Ps III 159,19
(so read with Ck for vattanī-° Se).

f. (adj.) [cf. sa. aṭala?], pl. ~iyo upāhanā,
a certain kind of shoes; ~ upāhanā ārohitvā (scil. Asita-
Devalo), MN II 155,1 (v. l. paṭaliyo, āgaliyo; Ps);
SN I 226,16 (scil. Vepacitti; p. I. āṭaliyo *(°~iko);
Spk); ib. 20 (scil. Sakko); both Ctt. explain = gaṇaṅ-
gaṇůpāhanā, cf. Vin I 185,26 (Sp); see also Ap 303,19
(pāṭalī, v. l. āṭalī; ˇ ˇ - ).

f. [ts.], a large forest, Abh 536 (= mahâ-
raññaṁ); nom. ~ī, Dhp-a I 13,15 (amanussa-parigga-
hītā), acc. ~iṁ, Ja II 335,10; gen. ~iyā, Mp ad AN I
178,21; abl. ~ito, ib.; Ja II 117,16; loc. ~iyam,
Pv-a 277,12 (cf. °-majjha, & °-mukha below). — pl.
~iyo, in the sense of 'forest inhabitants, savage tribes,
or robbers': Ja VI 55,14* (~iyo samuppannā; =
aṭavicorā, Ct.; cf. Mp ad AN I 178,21 [explaining aṭavī-
saṁkopa, q. v.] aṭavîti aṭavī-vāsino corā); instr. ~īhi,
Cp III 2,6 (kupito ahosi paccanto ~ † parantihi [for
vicarantihi?]); loc. °-pabbata-pādesu, Pj II 283,26.
— °-gata, mfn., arrived to, or being in the forest, As
329,27-31). — Ifc. v. Kāḷamattika-°, Kāḷasilâ°,
corâ°, Mahâ°, Mahāvattani-°, Viñjhâ°. (Cf.Āḷavī).

m., a guardian of a forest,
Ja II 335,13 (°-kule); loc. pl. ~esu, ib. 14.

m., a forest robber, pl. ~ā, Ja VI
55,16'(= 'aṭaviyo'); Mp ad AN I 178,21.

m., a forest country; ekaṁ ~aṁ,
Ja III 463,15 (prob, in the great tracts of wood called
Mahā-aṭavī, Ja V 133,22).
m., a forest path, Ps III 231,21.

n., the middle of a forest, Dhp-a
III 69,2 (~aṁ); loc. ~e, Ja II 335,21; III 220,2 (opp.
atavi-mukhaṁ); abl. ~ato, Ps III 308,1.

n., the edge of a forest; ~aṁ
abhirūhi, Ja III 220,1; ~aṁ āgantvā, Ps III 308,7
(opp. aṭavi-majjha); loc. ~e, Ja I 271,1; 306,28 (opp.
anto aṭaviyaṁ); II 335,15. — mfn., directed towards
the forest; Sp (II) 324,3-5 (= araññâbhimukha, Sp-ṭ).

mfn., living in a forest, Mp ad
AN I 178,21 (~ino corā). aṭavī-vāsi

m. (cf. paccanto kupito & aṭa-
viyo samuppannā above under aṭavī), unrest in forest
districts; AN I 178,20 (explained as 'inroad from forest
tribes' by Mp = aṭaviyā saṁkopo, etc.); Ill 66,9 (w. r.
°-saṁkhepo)
√ anādare, Sadd II 1382 [aṭṭeti]

m [ts.] a watch-tower, Abh 204; 1126 ( =
aṭṭāla, q. v.); Vin III 200,6'; 201,1' (= paṭirājâdi-
paṭibāhanatthaṁ iṭṭhakāhi kato bahala-bhittiko catu-
pañca-bhūmiko patissaya-viseso, Sp = Vibh-a 366,3);
Vin I 140,29; Vibh 251,11 quoted Ps II 289,11 =
Mp II 496,13 = Sv I 209,2; abl. ~ā nikkhamissāmi,
Nidd I 67,15 (= dvāraṭṭālakā, Nidd-a); loc. ~e vasati,
Nidd I 226,24, quoted Vism 25,32 (mhṭ). Cf. aṭṭaka.

m., case, cause, lawsuit, litigation; [v. l.
aṭṭha misread addha; if from artha (cf. 2aṭṭha) the
deaspiration must be due to dravidian influence; or
perhaps a loan-word, cf. Tamil āṭṭam, āṭu- (play, sport,
game), also Canarese āṭa, āḍu-]; Abh 1126 (= yutti);
Dhp-a III 298,18 (~o uppanno); Ja V 229,12 (~o
vinicchito); acc. ~aṁ: Vin IV 225,1' (karissāmi;
Sp ad Vin IV 224,30'); Ja V 2,1 (karontī); As 31,11
(asakkhikaṁ ~aṁ karonto viya; Ee atthaṁ); ~aṁ
vinicchināti, Ja III 258,17; IV 129,32; V 395,21; VI
131,26 (cf. ib. 2 4); ~aṁtīreti, Ja III 292,20-23; IV
150,11; ~aṁ pacchinda, Ja I 405,5; ~aṁ sutvā, Ja
VI 336,39'; ~aṁ ñatvā, Ja VI 398,10'; loc. aṭṭe
sahassaṁ parājito viya, Ja II 75,3; acc. pl. ~e, Ja
V 229,18 (cattāro); Ja III 292,20 (tīresi); — °-atthāya,
Ja II 2,11; — a lawsuit may be carried on before
several courts, Ps II 339,13 foll. (aṭṭe uppanne gāma-
bhojakaṁ . . . janapada-bhojakaṁ . . . (mahā)vinic-
chayâmaccaṁ . . . senāpatiṁ . . . uparājaṁ . . . rājā-
naṁ pāpuṇāti, raññā vinicchita-kālato paṭṭhāya aṭṭo
aparāparaṁ na sañcarati, rāja-vacanen' eva chijjati;
cf. Sv II 152,1 below s. v. aṭṭa-kulika). — Ifc. v.
kūṭa°, vimāna°.

mfn. [sa. ārta, cf. aṭṭita, addita], hurt,
afflicted, tormented, desperate, Abh 1126; Sn 694 (~o
vyasana-gato aghāvī); Ja IV 293,14* (puttā mam'
aṭṭā; = āturā, Ct.) = 295,5*; V 53,20* (bhayadditā
nāgavadhena~ā; = dukkhitā, Ct.); Vv 893 (aṭṭo 'mhi
du(k)khena pīḷito; = aṭṭito upadduto, Vv-a); Ap
531,8 (icc-aṭṭā vilapiṁsu tā, quoted Thī-a 145,18* Ee
reading icchaṭṭā, quasi icchā + aṭṭa); [kiminā vaṭṭo,
Thī 439 (kiminā va aṭṭo = . . . kimiparigato va hutvā
aṭṭo aṭṭito, Thī-a Ce) cf. ib. 441 andho v'atto =
kāṇo va hutvā aṭṭo pīḷito, Thī-a]. — Ifc. v. iṇa°,
chāta°, bhaya°, vedana°, sīta°, soka°.

(m.) [ts., dimin, of 1aṭṭa], an elevated
platform or estrade, scaffold; also a sort of hiding
place on a tree for a hunter; Vin III 81,36 (nava-
kammaṁ karontā ~aṁ bandhanti; = vehāsa-mañco,
Sp); Ja II 416,24 (sarīraṁ āmakasusāne ~aṁ āro-
petvā) = Dhp-a III 476,17; Ja III 372,22 (saṁghā-
ṭaṁ ṭhapetvā tattha ~aṁ [Cks aṭṭhakaṁ] bandhā-
petvā); Ja I 173,19 (upari-rukkhe ~aṁ bandhitvā);
ib. 2 9 (luddako ~e nisinno).
[m. Npr., w. r. for Aṭṭhaka.]

n. [cf. 2aṭṭa], action, legal pro-
ceeding's, Mp II 198,4.

n., 1. carrying on a lawsuit, Ps II
406,7 (etesaṁ atthāya ~aṁ n'atthi). — 2. seat of
judgement, court-room, DN II 20,19 (rajā ~e nisinno ;
v. l. aṭṭha-°, Ed. attha-°); III 63,19 (Ed. attha-karaṇa-
pamukhe); MN II 122,1 (Ed. attha-karaṇe nisin-
nassa); SN I 74,16 foll. (do.). See also attha-karaṇa.

m., a hunter who makes use of
aṭṭaka (q. v.), Ja I 173,18 (gāmavāsi-°).

mf. (~ikā), who carries on a law-
suit, one of the parties in a lawsuit (prosecutor or
prosecuted), an adversary; Ja V 230,1 (°-manusse);
Vin IV 224,30' (~ikā, = 'ussayavādikā'); Ps II 13,13
(dvīsu ~esu); Mp II 198,2 (~ena saddhiṁ).

m., a judge (perhaps a member of
a council of judges, *aṭṭakula?), so only Mp Ce 712,29
(°-senāpati-uparājūhi parikkhitaṁ = Se III 187,5
reading attha-kusaia-°; = paramparābhatesu aṭṭhasu
kulesu jātā agatigamanaviratā aṭtha mahallaka-purisā,
Sv-pṭ ad Sv II 152,1 = Mp-ṭ); Sv II 152,1 (acoro
ce vi(s)sajjenti, coro ce aṭṭhakulikānaṁ [so Ce Se]
denti, te pi . . . senāpatissa, etc., quoted by D'At/wis,
Introd. p. 99; cf. note (§) ib. 100 & Lassen, Ind.
Altertumsk. 1II,8l, who suggests a sa. form *aṣṭa-
kulaka). Explanation of this term remains rather un-
certain.

3 sg. — aṭṭiyati (q. v.), Mogg I 49 (Pay)
(given as an instance of the assimilation ṭy > ṭṭ).

mfn., who has lost his suit, Ja VI
131,17 (cf. II 75,3).
m. (cf. 2aṭṭa), litigation; MTD.

m. [sa. ārta-svara], a cry of pain;
~aṁ karoti, Vin III 105,17 (= āturassaraṁ Sp) =
SN II 255,14, foll.; Ja I 265,1 (~aṁ sutvā); II 117,8
(~aṁ karonto); III 361,32' (~aṁ sutvā); V 270,27'
(mahantena ~ena viravante); Mil 357,25 (~aṁ
karoti, scil. samaṇa-peto); Ps I 168,12 (~aṁ karonto
vicarati, do.; cf. Pv-a 284,23 & 285,10); Ud-a 67,1
w. r. ? see next).

m. [sa. aṭṭa-hāsa, cf. 1aṭṭa], a loud
laughter, Abh 175; bhūtānaṁ ~aṁ, Ud-a 67,1 (v. /.).
m. [ts.], the wild jasmine; MTD.

n. (or aṭṭhāna?), Vin II 105,28 (~e
nahāyanti) & II 106,5 (na ~e nahāyitabbaṁ), ac-
cording to Sp (quoted Vin II 315,27) 'a sort of sham-
pooing stand', erected at the bathing-place (~aṁ
nāma rukkha(ṁ) phalakaṁ viya tacchetvā aṭṭha-
padâkārena rājiyo chinditvā nhānatitthe nikha-
ṇanti). Reading and etymology uncertain; spelt aṭṭhāna
in Sp Ce and in a Vin fragment from Nepal, see
Bendall, Verh. d. XIII Orient. Kongr. 1902 p. 60;
this, however, may be due to the gloss containing
aṭṭhapada, if not commentators understood it as <
*aṭṭhaṭṭhāna.

m. [ts., cf. 1aṭṭa], a watch-tower (esp. above
a gate),' Abh 1126 (= 'aṭṭa'); Ja III 477,18* (makasa
dāṭhānaṁ ~o sukato); 478,11'; Dhp-a III 488,16
(°-uddāpa-parikhâdīni) ; in adj. comp.: daḷha-m-aṭṭāla-
koṭṭhaka, Th 863; Ja IV 106,16*, 22'; V 373,25*; VI
46,27*; 51,23'. — Ifc. v. dvāra°.

m. [ts.] = aṭṭāla, Abh 204; Mil 66,20
= 81,14 (acc. ~aṁ; pākāra, gopura +); Ja III 160,9
(abl. ~to); Ps III 311,15 (~e āruyha); acc. pl. ~e,
Ja VI 276,4*; Ap 43,18; rukkha-pākāra-°, Ps III
685,9; ~ā oṭṭhagīviyo, Ja VI 269,7*; 270,14'. — Ifc.
v. antara°, gopura°, dvāra°, viriya-°.

f. [sa. ārti], disease, sickness, Sp I 175,4
(explaining the v.r. setaṭṭikā in Vin III 6,19).

mfn. (denom, pp. of 3aṭṭa: aṭṭiyati; misread
addhita, w.r. aṭṭhita; in mss. alternating with addita
(q. v.) [sa. ardita] and the v. l. of this: aḍḍita), pained,
worried, distressed, afflicted; Abh 1126 (— 3aṭṭa);
Th 157 (kāmarāgena); Ja VI 524,16* (do.; = upad-
duto upapīḷito, Ct.); Ja II 436,19 (paṇḍurogena);
IV 85,4* (bhātusokena); IV 469,13* (puttasokena);
VI 91,15* (do.); Mhv VI 21 (do.); Ja V 70,18* (duk-
khena); Ja II 269,21* (sisirabhayena); 407,17' (bha-
yena; = 'bhayadditā'); V 71,27* (pariḷāhena); Vv-a
311,17 (= 'aṭṭo'). — Ifc. v. atibhaya°, dukkha°,
pipāsāvedana°, bhaya°, bhūta°, makasa°, ve-
dana°, hima-sisira°. (Cf. Kern Bijdr. 1886 p. 66.)

3 sg. (denom, of 3aṭṭa; also spelt aṭṭīyati,
w. rr. aṭṭhīyati, aḍḍhtyati; cf. addiyati), to be worried,
bored, or incommodated (by: instr.); generally followed
by harāyati, jigucchati: AN I 145,28 (= atto pīlito
hoti, Mp); MN I 423,24 = AN IV 374,29; MN III
300,32; AN IV 435,5; V 111,9; Ja II 143,16; V 280,20;
Vin I 87,1 (nāgo nāgayoniyā); 88,5; III 68,16 (3. pl.
sakena kāyena ~anti; = aṭṭā dukkhitā honti, Sp);
Vism 195,30; 2. pl. ~atha, AN I 115,1; 1. sg. ~āmi,
DN I 213,22 (= aṭṭo pīḷito viya viharāmi, Sv); Thī
140 (Ed. addiyāmi) ≠ Pv 58 (~āmi harāyāmi; = aṭṭā
dukkhitā amhi, Pv-a Ed. dātukkhittā amhi); Ps I
233,21* = Vism 48,27*; part. m. aṭṭiyanto, Ja V
114,26' (dussanto appiyāyanto -ḷ~); part. med. aṭṭi-
yamāna: Vin III 24,26' (= aṭṭaṁ pīḷitaṁ viya
attānaṁ ācaramāno, Sp, cf. Pāṇ III 1,10); Vin II
292,17 (brahmadaṇḍena); MN III 269,11 (kāyena ca
jīvitena ca); SN IV 62,25; V 320,23 (= tena kāyena
dukkhitā honti, Spk); It 43,21; Ud 23,21 = Dhp-a
I 120,2; Ja I 66,17; 292,12; Paṭis I 159,13; As 273,21;
pot. 3 sg. ~eyya, MN I 120,1; 2. pl. ~eyyātha, AN I
115,5; abs. ~itvā, MN I 419,28; grd. ~itabba, ib. 27;
AN I 115,11; pp. aṭṭita (q. v.).

[3. sg.] = aṭṭiyati; only part, aṭṭiyā-
yanto (bandhanena), Pj II 41,6 (opp. tuṭṭho), per-
haps a blending of appiyāyanto and aṭṭiyanto (Ja V
114,26') cf. also the formula aṭṭiyamāno harāyamāno.

n. abstr. of aṭṭiyati, Dhp-a II 179,15
(attano kāyena).
[3. sg. of √aṭṭ, q. v.]

m., another spelling of 2attha (cf. 2aṭṭa),
mostly used in comp.s [Sadd III 107]: nom. °-aṭṭho,
Ps I 49,21 foll.; numerous exx. are found Paṭis I 15,21
foll.; 88,14 foll. etc.; instr. °-aṭṭhena = in the sense of,
in the capacity of. e. g. As 208,17; 209,5; ken' aṭṭhena;
Nidd I 457,20 = Paṭis I 174,1 (quoted Pj I 14,32);
Paṭis II 115,9 (quoted Ps I 83,23); Vibh-a 3,30; Mhbv
1,15* (Sadd 58,34; 59,4-li: aṭṭhena in the question,
atthena in the answer); numerous exx. found Mil
353,29 foll; Dhp-a I 316,6-10; IV 231,22; also
°-atthena, see 2attha. — Ifc. v. attaṭṭha-pañña,
appaṭṭha, indaṭṭha, ekaṭṭha, kaṭṭhaṭṭha, nānaṭṭha,
paramaṭṭha, pīḷana°, mahaṭṭha, samkhata°,
saccíkaṭṭha, and cf. aṭṭha-kathā, aṭṭhi(n), 1aṭṭhika,
aṭṭḥuppatti.

numeral [sa. aṣṭa(n): aṣṭau], eight; nom.
acc. pl. mfn. aṭṭha puggalā, Sn 227; ~ parisă, AN IV
307,14; ~ vatthūni, Pj II 469,5 = Dhp-a IV 186,1;
aṭṭhiindriyāni, Dhs 58, 161; ~ nāma kiṁ, Khp IV (8);
instr, abl. pl. aṭṭhahi, Mil 291,12; also atthāhi (abl),
Ja I 414,5* = III 207,14* (catubbhi . . . m . . . soḷa-
sāhi, v. l. attha(b)hi); (dat.) gen. pl. atthannaṁ, Sn
p. 87,1; Sv I 1,9*; loc. pl. aṭṭhasu, SN IV 325,1;
— repeated in distributive sense aṭṭhiaṭṭha = eight of
each, eight every time; Dhp-a II 41,2 (~ kahāpaṇe
labhati); Mhv V 249 (~ there 'macce ca pesayi);
Mp I 172,22 (~ katvā); Abhidh-av 52,1* (evaṁ ~
katvāna); cf. Ja V 450,19*; — aṭṭha kahāpaṇā is
generally used to denote a (low) price or salary, or
(the lowest) amount of penalty: ~ahi kahāpaṇehi, Mil
291,12 (scil. kese vikkiṇitvā); ~ kahāpaṇe dāpesi,
Ja IV 138,1 (= nahāpita-dāyo, ib. 18); ~ kahāpaṇe
daṇḍāpessāmi, Ja I 483,21; — very frequently used
in numbering groups of dhammā, of which exx. are
found AN IV 150—-350 (the Atthaka-nipāta; see Index
AN VI 185—87), DN III 254—262, 284—288, Vin
V 136—-7; further see e.g. uposatha-kamma, kappa-
rukkha, kāmāvacara-kusalacitta, tāpasa-pabbajjā,
pāna, purisa-puggala, purisabhūmi, petī, Malla-
pāmokkha, rūpa, lobha, vata-pada, vatta, vatthu,
vimokkha, saṁvega-vatthu, samāpatti, and comp.s
below. — Ifc. v. addha°, satta°.

mfn., eight u° (in length), Ja IV
21,1. Cf. aṭṭhůsabha.

mfn. (2aṭṭha + 3aṁsa, cf. sa. aṣṭāçri),
with eight edges, octogonal; DN I 76,22 (maṇi veḷuriyo
subho jātimā ~o +) = MN II 17,9 ≠ III 121,21 ≠
Mil 282,19; Ja VI 127,3* (~ā sukatā thambhā) =
173,28* = Vv 861 (Vv-a 303,29); Pj II 265,2 (~e
thambhe); Dhs 617 (rūpaṁ); Pv 677 (jīvo; Pv-a
253,21'); — Ps III 617,2 (ad MN III 166,26) = Mp
II 155,16 (ad AN I 141,8).

m.n. [sa. aṣṭaka], a group of eight, an
octad; MN III 1,20 (attha ~ā); Vv 788 A (do., dibbā
kaññā; Vv-a) = 821 = 828 = 887; As 343,1 (aññaṁ
~aṁ); 316,18 (tīṇi ~āni); Vin V 137,24*; esp. a sutta
consisting of 8 stanzas, see Aṭṭhaka-vagga; cf. comp.s
below. — Ifc. v. aṭṭha°, antar- °, ahetuka°, indriya°,
Kusa°-dāyaka, Guha°, Duttha°, Parama°, sabba°
Suddha°.

m. [sa. Aṣṭaka], 1. Npr. of one of the
ten Rṣis, authors of the Vedic hymns, Abh 109 (Ed.
1865 Áṭṭako); DN I 104,13 (~o + Vāmako, Vāmadevo,
Vessāmitto, Yamataggi, Aṅgīraso, Bhāradvājo, Vā-
seṭṭho, Kassapo, Bhagu [t/ie last five names form a
haíf-çloka, see Bhăradvāja (Sadd 80 note 6) and cf.
the pāda Vyu 180,20-22]; Sv); do. Vin I 245,20 (the
v. l. ib. 386,32 = Abh 109); MN II 169,29 (Ps);
200,5; AN III 224,5 (v. l. Aṭṭako); 229,29; IV 61,17;
Vv-a 265,15 (~ādīhi). — 2. of an old king; Ja V
135,21; 137,3* (= Mvu III 366,1*; cf. ib. 375,7*: Ja V
151,28*); 149,30*; VI 99,10*; 251,14*.

f. (sinh: aṭuvā; 1aṭṭha = 2attha [sa.
artha] + kathā, paron, aṭṭha-kathaṁ kathentā, Sp (II)
483,19; cf. attha-vaṇṇanā), lit. 'exposition of the sense'
(cf. sa. arthavāda), i. e. commentary, esp. (a): the general
name for the oldest Ct.s on the Pali Canon, said to
have been composed (saṅgīta, Sv I 1,15*) at the first
Council, and to have been rehearsed (anugīta, ib.) at
the 2d and 3d Council, brought to Ceylon by Mahinda
(ib.), and done into old Sinhalese (Sīhaḷabhāsā), and
forming the chief authority of Buddhaghosa and his
school, who pretend to translate it into Pali (tantinayâ-
nucchavikā bhāsā, Sv I 1,20*; cf. Sp I 2,11*; 3,5*) with
some additions only, following the tradition of Mahāvi-
hāra, ɔ: Mahā-aṭṭhakathā (parts thereof, or other pre-
Buddhaghosean ./ion-pāli Aṭṭhakathā.s, see: Kurundī,
[Mahā- and Cūḷa-] Paccarī, Andhaṭṭhakathā, Paṇṇa-
Vāra, Sīhaḷaṭṭhakathā): — Pj I 151,12 (aṭṭhakathikā
~aṁ sākacchanti); Dhp-a III 139,2 (+ vinicchaya,
kāraṇâkāraṇa); — opp. to pāḷi: Ps II 356,18 (pāḷim
vā ~aṁ vā . . . na sikkhāpenti); Vism 107,16 (n'eva
pāḷiyaṁ na ~āyaṁ āgataṁ); 384,1; 450,1; Ja I 66,32
(Pabbajjā-suttaṁ saddhiṁ ~āya); cf. Mhv XLIV 114;
XCI 27; Ja I 345,15' (saṅgīti-kārakā . . . tīṇi padāni
~aṁ āropetvā); —opp. to pakaraṇanaya(cf. Nett31,27;
83,29, etc.): Ps I 240,1; — taṁ (vyañjanaṁ) ~āya
n'atthi, Ja I 488,29'; II 299,5'; — A° presents a
reading different from the text: Ja II 241,17'; 334,15';
395,10'; IV 34,23+469,23'; V 95,1' (opp. potthakesu);
170,32'; 318,2'; VI 279,29'; cf. Ps II 252,3 (taṁ ~ăya
paṭikkhittaṁ); 476,18 (~āyaṁ sanniṭṭhānaṁ kataṁ);
— references to and quotations from A°: Tikap-a 241,33
(a kārikā in Pali); 242,1, etc.; Ja I 44,1; Pj II 180,11;
Mp I 3,3* (= Sv I 2,9*); II 201,18 (eke ekaṭṭhe ..., cf.
Kv 26,20); 298,21; Vism 61,28; 82,26; 225,19; 316,6;
409,29; 449,10; — A°spoken of in pl.: Ja V 413,16'(puri-
manayo bahūsu~āsu āgato); VI 36,26' (~āsu n'atthi);
Vism 121,33 (a kārikā in Pali); 138,17; 172,10; 180,31;
193,3; 285,9; 375,20; 432,1-20; 527,6. — — (b) the
antique Pali commentaries (from Buddhaghosa, etc.,
representing the Mahāvihāra tradition), containing not
only verbal-commentary on the holy text (pāḷi), but also
other explanations and expositions; the running commen-
taries on these A°, in pure Pali (cf. however Vajira-
buddhi-ṭīkā esp. on Sp (Se) II 413,14 foll.), are styled
ṭīkā: mūla-ṭīkā, purāṇa-ṭīkā (mahā-ṭīkā), anuṭīkā,
navaṭīkā, or abhinava-ṭīkā; they occasionally complete
the A° in commenting directly on the text; — otherwise
difficult words were explained, in Pali or Sinhalese,
by means of several gaṇṭhipadas (see Sp-ṭ ad Sp introd.
v. 12); — the A°s of the canonical scriptures may be
named after the titles of these, e. g. Aṅguttara°,
Majjhima°, etc., but as often the bear special titles,
see the abbreviations As, Kkh, Pj, Ps, Mp, _ Vibh-a,
Sp, Spk, Sv; — ifc. see also: Andha(ka)°, Ágama°,
Kurundī-°, Khandhaka°, Pañcappakaraṇa°, Pa-
ritta°, Mahā-°, Mahāpaccarī- °, Samkhepa°,
Sīhaḷa°, & sāṭṭhakatha (mfn.). — — °-kaṇda, n.,
title of Dhs 1368—1599, containing a resume ascribed
to Sāriputta, As 6,38 (cf. atthuddhāra); °-kaṇda-
vaṇṇanā, = As 409—-29. — °-gantha (written
°-gandha), m., a commentary-book, Gv 68,5 foll.; Sās
28,1 (Buddhaghoso . . Sīhaḷabhāsāya likhite ~e
Māgadhabhāsāya parivattitvā likhi). — °-gāthā, f.,
a stanza from A°, Tikap-a 243,11; — °-âcariya, m.,
a teacher of A°, pl. ~ā; their opinion adduced after
another explanation: Pj II 23,16; 43,23; As 123,17;
Ps I 125,6; 255 33; Vism 103,17; 332,32; — Sp-ṭ
ad Sp I 13,8 (~ehi ṭhapita-pucchā). — °-naya, m.,
a method (of explanation) indicated by A°; Vism 433,26
(ayaṁ ettha ~o); Ps I 38,1 (opp. sāsana-naya ɔ:
SN III 44,8); 245,23 (opp. to Vibh 195,8); III 2,19
(opp. tantinayo; etymol. of acchariya, q. v.); Pp-a
171,28 (pāḷimuttakena ~ena).
entry.re:
— °-pāṭhaAṭṭha-kathā-pāṭha, m., a
reading in A°, Ja II 294,9' (ayaṁ ~o va sundarataro).

— °-muttakaAṭṭha-kathā-muttaka, mfn., independent of A°, Pp-a 173,5
(~ena ācariya-nayena); 174,26 (do.); As 223,33 (~o
ekassa ācariyassa mati-vinicchayo).

entry.sense:
m. pl., they who study or have
interest in the Aṭṭhakathā, Pj I 151,12.

sense.hi: n. Npr. of a city, see next.

entry.sense:
m. Npr., a surname of the
householder Dasama, MN I 349,10 = AN V 342,17
(Ps & Mp = Atthaka-nagara-vāsī). —I °-sutta, n.,
title of MN I 349—353 = AN V 342—347; Ps III
246,1; Mp II 421,11.

m., an eightfold refutation,
Kv-a 15,28; °-peyyāla, (m.), formula of a°, Kv 69,21
(subscr.).

m., title of Pp VIII (p. 73);
cf. aṭṭha (puggalā).

m., title of the 8th book of AN
= AN IV 150—350; quoted Vism 322,13; Ms. in the
India Office Library, see JPTS 1896 p. 24. Cf. Aṭṭha-
nipāta.

n., eight-ticketfood, Dhp-a III
104,22 (= aṭṭha-salāka-bhatta, ib. 16); Vv-a 75,10 foll.

m., title of the 4th section of
Sn, = Sn 766—975 (Pj II 511—574), containing, as
Nr. 2—5, the four aṭṭhakas, Guhaṭṭhaka, etc., = Sn
772—803, each of which is made out of eight Triṣṭubh-
verses; otherwise explained by S. Levi, J. As. 1915
p. 413; Pj II 370,12 (Aṭṭhaka-Pārāyana-vagge); there is
an old commentary to this section, viz. Niddesa I (Mahā-
Niddesa).
entry.re:
— °-vaggikaAtthaka-vagga-vaggika (or °vaggiya), mfn., belonging
to that section; soḷasa ~āni [scil. suttāni] abhāsi (scil.
Sono Kutikanno), Vin I 196,36 (Sp-ṭ) = Ud 59,23
(Ud-a) ≠ Dhp-a IV 102,1 ≠ Mp I 241,19; cf. Sn
p. 189,11; ~e Māgandiya-pañhe, SN III 9,19 (Sn 844
quoted; Spk); °amhi, prob. w. r. Nidd I 510,19 (v. l.
aṭṭhakathā-maggamhij. ..

entry.sense:
n., the eightfold kasiṇa (q. v.),
Dhs 203 (~aṁ soḷasa-kkhattukaṁ).

[n., title of two suttas, SN IV
221—22.

mfn., amounting to eight kahā-
paṇas see 2aṭṭha), Vv-a 76,21 (~o daṇḍo).

f. [sa. aṣṭakā], the 8th day after the full
moon in the two winter months (Māgha-Phaggunānaṁ
antare), or the festival held at that time, only ifc. v
antaraṭṭhaka.

mfn., having eight huts, Sv I
313,31 (~o gāmo).

m., so to be read accord, to the
ṭīkās instead of aṭṭa-kulika (q. v.).

mfn. [sa. aṣṭa-koṇa], with eight
edges, 'Sp (II) 290,22.

mfn., free from the
eight misfortunes (a-kkhaṇa, q. v.), Saddh 4; 16.

ind. [cf. sa. aṣṭa-kṛtvas], eight
times, Kacc-v 648 (eka-kkhattuṁ, dvi-kkhattuṁ, ti-
kkhattuṁ, etc., with -kkh-, prob, after analogy of last
[sa. triṣ-kṛtvas], while k(h)attuṁ phonetically repre-
sents sa. *kartu-, cf. palæoslav. tri kraty, etc.; see
also aṭṭhavīsatikkh° and aṭṭhārasakkhattuṁ below;
cf. dasa c'attha ca khattuṁ so, Ap 86,3), Dhs 222
& 224.
entry.re: — °-kkhattukaṁaṭṭha-kkhattuṁ-kkhattukaṁ, id. (or adj.?), ib. 243 foll.

entry.sense: m., a spider; MTD.

mfn. [sa. aṣṭa-guṇa], eightfold; tato
~aṁ hiraññaṁ, Thī 153.

mfn. [sa. aṣṭāṅga] = aṭṭhaṅgika
(q.v.), scil. magga or uposatha; Abh 780 (~e uposatha-
dine),

mfn., endowed
with a voice of the eight qualities, Bv XXIII 26 ( =
aṭṭhaṅga-samannāgata-saro satthā, Bv-a; *vācā
would suit the metre better than vacana).

mfn., exclusive of its
eight parts or constituents, Pj I 85,10 (~ maggo nāma
n'atthi); see Sv I 313,31-33.

mfn., 1. connected with
the eight precepts (cf. aṭṭhaṅga); AN IV 255,18;
V 83,17 (uposatha); — 2. possessed of eight (good)
qualities; MN II 138,28 (~aṁ āhāraṁ āhāreti; Ps);
Ps I 259,28 (do.); AN IV 237,5 foll. (~aṁ khettaṁ);
237,14 (~esu samaṇa-brāhmaṇesu); DN II 211,22
(Brahmuno saro); Vv-a 217,18 (brahmassaraṁ); MN
II 140,5 (Gotamassa mukhato ghoso, viz. vissaṭṭho
. . . ninnādī); Dhp-a III 114,2 (~aṁ dhamma-desanā-
ghosaṁ); cf. DN I 137,14 (aṭṭh' aṅgehi [w. r., see Sv
I 298,1] samannāgato) & aṭṭhaṅgupeta.

or °-susamāhita, mfn.,
= prec. (1); AN IV 271,23*; Thī 31 = Ja IV 320,20*
= VI 118,23* = Vv 130 (Vv-a) = Dhp-a IV 21,6*.

mfn. (from 2aṭṭha + aṅga), having
eight constituents, eightfold: (a ) ariyo ~o maggo (viz.
sammādiṭṭhi +, = majjhimā paṭipadā; cf. sattaṅ-
gika, Ps I 108,5 and pañcaṅgika, Vibh-a 123,14), the
noble eightfold path: Vin I 10,20 = SN V 421,13;
DN I 157,3 (Sv); 165,24; MN I 15,30 (Ps); AN I
177,29 (Mp); Nidd II 222,1 (ad Sn 1130); — cf. also
Khp IV (= ariyāni aṭṭha maggaṅgāni, Pj I 85,9);
Thī 158 (ariy' atthaṅgiko maggo, v. l. bhāvit' aṭṭh°);
Dhp I 91 = It 18,1* = Thī 186, etc.; Dhp 273
(maggān' ~o settho); MN I 508,31* (~o maggā-
naṁ; quoted Pj I 181,1); Vin III 93,8'; DN II 120,6;
151,11; MN II 12,24 (~aṁ maggaṁ bhāveti); SN
V 3,24 (do.); III 109,1 (= 'dakkhiṇa-maggo'); Mil
37,12; Vibh-a 123,11; Th 349 (°aṁ sotaṁ). — (b)
as opp. to (a) there is also spoken of 'the wrong eight-
fold path' (scil. micchādiṭṭhi +): kummaggo ti ~ass'
etaṁ micchā-maggassa adhivacanaṁ, MN I 118 6;
vāmamaggo ti ~ass' etaṁ micchā-maggassa adhiva-
canaṁ, SN III 109,1. — (c) ~aṁ uposathaṁ (acc),
the fast with maintaining the eight precepts (viz. the
first eight of the dasa-sīla, q. v.), Sn 401 = AN I 215,5*
= IV 254,23* (258,2*; 262,5*). — (d) ~o musāvādo
(q. v.), Vin V 136,36. — [Title of SN II 168 & IV 367.]

mfn. (paron.), using
the eightfold vehicle; ifc. f. magg°-°yāyinī. using the
eightfold vehicle which is the way , Thī 389 (Thī-a
257,6). aṭṭhaṅgika-yāna-yāyi

mfn. 'possessed of eight
qualities', i. e. fit in all the eight respects (for talking
over a matter), Mil 91,13 (suññe okāse).

mfn., 1. = aṭṭhaṅga-samannā-
gata (1); Sn 402 (uposathaṁ; Pj); ~assa uposathassa,
AN I 215,15* = IV 255,5* (258,12*; 262,15*); ~aṁ
upavass' uposathaṁ, AN I 215,19* = IV 255,9*
(258,16*; 262,19*). — 2. - do. (2); ~aṁ giraṁ
abbhudīrayi, Sv I 61,29* = Mp I 105,14* = Ps I
47,3* = Bv-a ad Bv I 2.

m., the fast with main-
taining of the eight precepts (cf. aṭṭhaṅga & aṭṭhaṅ-
gika (c)); Mp III 395,3 (imasmiṁ sutte Satthā ~assa
guṇaṁ kathesi, scil. AN V 83—86).

mfn. (from prec), fasting,
keeping the eight precepts; Mhv XXXVI, 84. aṭṭhaṅguposathi

mfn. (2aṭṭha + aṅgula), of eight
inches' (fingers') breadth, or length, or thickness; Vin I
297,13 (āyāmena ~aṁ, scil. pacchimaṁ cīvaraṁ);
Mhv XXIX 11 (~aṁ bahalato lohapaṭṭaṁ).
— °parama, mfn., eight inches at most (in length), Vin
II 138,1 (danta-kaṭṭhaṁ); 150,8 (mañca-paṭipāda-
kaṁ). — °-bahala, mfn., eight inches thick; Ja II
91,16' (~aṁ udumbara-padaraṁ); V 131,2 (do.).

or °-cattāḷīsa (sometimes
-1-), numeral (without gender inflexion), = 48; Sn 289
(~aṁ vassāni [unmetrical, seetālīsa]; Pj); AN III 227,6
(~rīsa vassāni, v. l. -1-); Dhp-a II 235,9 (do.); As 213,3
(~līsa gottacaraṇāni); Mil 82,14 (~līsa yojana-sahas-
sāni); Th-a introd. ad Th: ~līsa gāthā contained in
Th II, Thī VI, Thī XV. aṭṭha-cattārīsa

mfn., for every eight days Ci),
Dīp VI 56 (~aṁ niccabhattaṁ).

ṭhāna, mfn., = aṭṭha-vatthuka (q. v.);
Pj II 411,4 (~āya kaṁkhāya).

(or °-tiṁsā, f.), numeral [sa.
aṣṭatriṁçat], thirty eight; ~a maṅgalāni, Pj I 154,19;
~a kammaṭṭhānāni, Ps II 115,19; ~ā rājaparisā, Mil
359,6 (or mfn.); loc. sg. ~āya ārammaṇesu, Dhp-a
III 421,1'; As 158,8; Ps II 319,10 (cf. ~ârammaṇesu,
Ps I 168,25); ~āya kammaṭṭhānesu, Ps II 556,14;
— mfn., (a) the 38th; ~e ito kappe, Ap 133,22, 134,3,
etc.; — (b) consisting of 38 parts, Mil 359,6(7). aṭṭha-tlmsa

mfn. with eight pillars;
Kacc-v 385.

(m.) (from 2aṭṭha + 1danta), an
eight-toothed rake; Sp II 44,2 ad Vin III 131,1 (~ena
samīkataṁ).

mfn. (from 2aṭṭha + dasa), prob.
18 years old, Kacc-v 384.

mfn., divided into eight measures;
~aṁ cakkhumato sarīraṁ, satta-doṇaṁ Jambudīpe
mahenti, etc., DN II 167,22* (cf. Sv II 287,2); [Bv
XXVIII 5].

mfn., encumbered with
eight faults; Bv II 32 (paṇṇasālakaṁ).

n., a joint action
of eight factors; Ja I 14,19* = 44,22* (~ā abhinīhāro
samijjhati) = Bv II 59 (prob, interpolated from Bv-a
= Ja) = Pj II 48,17* = Tīi-a Introd. (Ce 9,37*;
note 5 dhammā, ib. 10,10 foll.); Ps I 113,21.

ind. [sa. aṣṭadhā], eightfold, in eight
parts; DN II 166,14 (~samaṁ suvibhattaṁ vibhajāhi)

mfn., having eight hoofs; Ja VI
354,21* (meṇḍo ~o); cf. aṭṭha-khura.

(or aṭṭhiā-navuti), numeral = 98;
Sn 311 (aṭṭhā-navuti-m-āgamuṁ, scil. rogā; = °-bhā-
vaṁ pāpuṇiṁsu, Pj); Mil 100,20 (ime ~ rogā kāye
nibbattantu); Ps I 213,24 (°-rogâdivasena); Th-a
Introd., Ce 3,8 (~ gāthā contained in Duka-nipāta
of Th). aṭṭha-navuti

m., (a) title of Th VIII (containing
eight gāthā by each thera, vv. 494—517); — (b) of
Thī VII (containing vv. 196—203); — (c) of Ja III
422—-482 (with eight or more gāthā in each jātaka;
referred to Ja I 153,24; II 113,14; IV 360,24; 401,12).

n. [cf. sa. aṣṭāpada], lit. 'having
eight squares (in each row)', a chess-board, game of
chess; DN I 6,23 (~aṁ + dasapadaṁ, etc.; ekekāya
pantiyā aṭtha attha padāni assā ti ~aṁ, Sv) =
65,24 ≠ Vin II 10,17 (~e kīḷanti, etc.) = III 180,22
(Sp: aṭṭhapada-phalake jūtaṁ kīḷanti); °-âkārena,
crosswise, as the lines on a chess-board, Sp ad Vin II
105,28 (quoted Vin II 315,28; = jūtaphalaka-sadi-
saṁ, Sp-ṭ). — Cf. aṭṭha-pāda & aṭṭhā-pada.

n. (from prec), something like a
chess-board, a net-work (?); Vin I 297,23 (v. l. aṭṭhā-
padakaṁ or aṭṭhapādakaṁ); II 150,12 (~aṁ vetuṁ).
entry.re:
— °-cchannaaṭṭha-padaka-cchanna, (mf)n., covered with ~; ~ena patta-
mukhaṁ sibbituṁ, Sp ad Vin I 297,23 (= 'aṭṭha-
padakaṁ dātuṁ').

entry.sense:
n., a mode of dressing
the hair see atthāpada-kata below; Ja II 5,14 (massu-
karaṇa +). Cf. Vin Trsl. Ill 167 n. 1.

n., a chess-board, Sp ad
Vin III 180,22 (= 'aṭṭha-pada').

f. (from ā + √sthā, cf. sa. āsthāpana;
sometimes also written āṭhapanā), arranging; Vibh
352,23 (+ ṭhapanā, saṇṭhapanā, etc.; = ādi-ṭhapanā,
ādarena vā thapanā, Vibh-a; quoted Vism 23,1; cf.
kuhanā) ≠ Nidd I 226,6; — Vibh 357,12 - Pp 18,21
(= paṭhamuppannassa anantaraṭṭhapanā, mariyā-
daṭṭhapanā vā; cf. upanāha).

mfn., possessed of the eight
requisites (see parikkhāra); Ps II 286,10 foll.

mfn., consisting of eight items;
AN IV 304,22 (~aṁ adhideva-ñāṇadassanaṁ; as to
its eights constituents, dibbacakkhuñāṇa . . . pubbe-
nivāsañāṇa, see Mp).

mfn., eight-footed; Ja V 377,2*
(pitthaṁ [ɔ: pīthaṁ, see Vv 1] ~aṁ). — m., a kind
of (fabulous) deer, Ja VI 538,6* (Ee without Ct., but
Lk & Se insert: aṭṭhapādā ti sarabha-migā, cf. sa.
aṣṭapada). — m., a spider, MTD (cf. aṭṭhāpada).
[w. r. for aṭṭhāpada-kata.]

mfn., who does not refuse the
yoke; Mp ad AN III 432,12 (= 'a-nikkhitta-dhura').

m. (from prec), a person who has
entered into the eighth stage of sanctification, i. e. the
lowest of the eight ariya-puggalā (q. v.); Kv 243,20
foll.; Paṭis II 193,34 (puthujjana-kalyāṇakaṁ upā-
dāya ~o assāmantapañño); Yam I 322,11 foll.; II
197,27 foll.; Nett 19,2; 49,33 (= sotāpattiphalasac-
chikiriyāya paṭipannassa, Nett-a), 50,1 (= anāgāmi-
maggaṭṭhassa, Nett-a); Pj II 409,4 (lokiya-manussā-
naṁ paññaṁ upanidhāya ~assa paññā adhikā); Mp
III 137,12 (~aṁ atikkamitvā pavattarucitāya sotā-
panno accaruci, ad AN III 346,18*). —- °-kathā, f.,
title of Kv 243—47. — ~assa indriya-kathā, f.;
title of Kv 247—251. — mfn. = aṭṭhama, Ap 557,29
(~e dine); ifc. v. att'-°, ājīva°, oja°.

n., [sa. aṣṭa-maṅgala], eight
lucky things; ~ena samannāgataṁ, Ja V 409,19' (said
of a celestial chariot).

(n.), eight months, Ap 523,26 (~e
asampatte).

mfn., eight months old, Nidd
I 120,13

f. [of aṭṭhama; sa. aṣṭamī], 1. adj.
the eighth; SN IV 325,1 (aniccatā yeva ~ī, scil. h tu,
paccayo); MN III 222,27 (~ī disā). —2. (a) the eighth
day; Sn 570 (ito ~ī); loc. ~iyā or ~iyaṁ, SN II 221,2
(aññā udapādi; Spk) = MN III 127,8; — (b) esp.
the eighth day of a half lunar month; Sn 402 (cātud-
dasiṁ +); yā ca (v. l. yā va) pakkhassa ~ī, Thī 31
= SN I 208,25* = AN I 144,1* foll. = Vv 130 =
Ja IV 320,19* = VI 118,22* (Ed. ~iṁ) - Dhp-a IV
21,5*; ~ pakkhassa, MN I 20,29 (Ps); AN I 142,23
(= aṭṭhamī-divase, Mp); cātuddase paṇṇarase ~iyaṁ,
Ps II 327,1; comp. °-uposatha, m., the eighth day's
fast, Mp II 157,6; °-cātuddasa-paṇṇarasa, m. pl.;
Ja IV 402,5 (loc ~esu [v. l. ~īsu], scil. divasesu?);
°-cātuddasī-paṇṇarasī-bhedena (tividho, scil. upa-
vasitabba-divaso), Ps III 483,15. — 3. ~ī (vibhatti),
the vocative case (in the system of Niruttipiṭaka), Sadd
60,13(-33).

mfn., 'eight-faced', with eight main
points; As 4,6 (~ā vādayutti); Kv-a 15,26-32*.

mfn., extending over eight yojana
(q. p.); Mp III 190,18.

mfn., measuring eight cubits; Mp
III 225,14.

mfn., id.; Mil 312,20 (hatthi-
nāgaṁ).

mfn., eight cubits in
height; Mil 282,28 (nāgarājā); cf. aḍḍhaṭṭhama mfn.

(n.) sg. (usually pl. aṭṭha
lokadliammā, q. v.), the eight worldly conditions (viz.
lābha, etc.), Ja III 169,27' (but see v. l.).
entry.re:
— °-vātaaṭṭha-lokadhamma-vāta,
m. pl, the 'winds' [i. e. attacks] of a°, Mil 354,24
(~ehi akampiyaṭṭhena).

— °âtikkamaaṭṭha-lokadhammâtikkama, m., Ud-a
336,3.

entry.sense:
mfn., lit. 'eight-crooked', i. e. octo-
gonal (said of the jewel Verocana, cf. Ja V 310,17*,
etc.), Ja VI 388,4*; 403,29. Cf. aṭṭhaṁsa.

mfn., founded upon, or related
to eight subjects; Dhp-a III 78,6' (kaṁkhā) ≠ IV
186,7' = Pj II 469,5 (vicikicchā); cf. Dhs 1118;
Dhp-a III 103,8' (avijjandhakāra) ≠ 351,1 (~aṁ
aññāṇaṁ = 'avijjā'); cf. Dhs 1061; — esp. to daṇḍa:
°-âdibhedaṁ daṇḍaṁ, a penalty imposed on account
of resp. eight, etc.. delinquencies, Ja III 442,12'; °-hetu,
ind., ib. 19' (aparādha-kārakassa ~, because the
delinquent has committed eight delinquencies); guilty
on one of eight points; Vin IV 221,4** (f. ~ā).

mfn., eight years old, Nidd I
120,17*.'

mfn., connected with an eightfold
course of proceedings; f. ~ā upasampadā (q. v.), Vin
V 137,1 (Vjb: aṭṭhavācikā bhikkhunīnaṁ upasam-
padā ubhato ñatti-catutthattā; cf. Vin II 273,20 foll.
& 274,8 foll.).
= next; comp. °-sata, q. v. aṭṭha-vīsa

f. [sa. aṣṭā-viṁçati], twenty-eight;
nom. acc. ~i, Mil 139,24 (patisallāṇa-guṇā); As 340,6;
Nidd I 382,4 (nakkhattāni)'; Mhv XXXIV 37 (vas-
sāni); instr. ~iyā aṅgehi, Mil 207,11; gen. ~iyā yak-
khasenāpatīnaṁ, Ps II 329,11 (cf. Ja IV 474,27: ~i
yakkhasenāpatīnaṁ; uninflected, cf. Whitney Sa.
Gr. §486c); loc. ~iyā, Ja VI 476,8' (nakkhatta-koṭ-
ṭhāsesu).
entry.re:
— °-kkhattuṁaṭṭha-vīsati-kkhattuṁ, ind., 28 times, Ap 36,5
[ - ˇ - ˇ ˇ - -, thus = °ti-khattuṁ, cf. pkr.
-huttaṁ, Pischel § 451]; cf. aṭṭhā-rasa-kkhattuṁ[.

entry.sense:
n., = 128; nom. ~aṁ padāni,
Ss 13,22.

f. [sa. astā-ṣaṣṭiḷ, sixty-eight; ~i
gāthā'('m Saṭṭlii[ka] nipāto ofTh ɔ: Th 1146—1208!),
Th-a introd.; ~i bhikkhu-sata-sahassaṁ, DN II 45,22
foll. (v. l. ~iṁ); nom. acc. also ~iyo, Mhv XVI 12
(leṇāni; Mhv-ṭ).

n. [sa. astă-çata], 1. = 108; ~aṁ,
SN IV 231,88; 232,20 (vedanā) ≠ Mil 46,1 (cf. MN
I 398,1); ~ taṇhā-vicaritaṁ, Nidd I 49.2 4; Vibh
349,32; 392,20—400,15; Ps I 183,1; 219,27; Pj I 108,11
= Sp I 123,26; cf. also Sn 227: ye puggalā aṭṭha,
sataṁ pasatthā, where the Ct. also admits aṭṭha-
sataṁ = 108; see enumeration Pj I 182,20—-183,5;
cf. aṭṭhuttara-sataṁ. — 2. = 800; Kacc-v 395; ~aṁ
brāhmaṇe, Ja I 55,32; ekena ūnaṁ ~aṁ (scil.
naṅgalāni), Ps II 392,2 ≠ Ja I 57,24; Ja V 377,12'
(read aṭṭhasata- [pala]-suvaṇṇa-pāti-pakkhittaṁ).

m., the text on vedanās j
up to 108; ~o dhamma-pariyăyo, SN IV 231,21 foll.
(= atthasatassa kārana-bhūtaṁ, Spk). — °-vagga,
m., title of SN IV 230—37.

mfn., having 108 subdivisions;
Pj II 363,22 (taṇhā-nissaya).

mfn., whose wealth
amounts to 800,000; Dhp-a IV 7,5.

n., title of SN IV 231—32
(ɔ: Aṭṭhasata-pariyāya).

mfn., 78 years old; Ap
584,17 (°vassâhaṁ, f. sg).

n., the vehicle of the
eight attainments (= 'devayāna'), Pj II 184,25.

n., eight ticket-foods, Dhp-a
III 104,16 (cf. aṭṭhaka-bhatta).

(n.), Npr. of a district, Mhv
LXI 24 (°avhaṁ, called A°).
entry.re:
— °-kaAṭṭhasahassa-ka, (n.), id., Mhv
LXXV 154.

entry.sense:
mfn., with 8000 spread-
ing shoots (secondary stems of a nyagrodha), Ja V
47,28* (v. l. °pora).
burmese spelling for Atthasālinī.

mfn., eight cubits long (cf. hat-
tha(2)); Dhp-a I 301,5 (~aṁ, scil. sāṭakaṁ).
m., title of Mil 113,9—-119,10.

1. = 2aṭṭha in comp., see next etc. — 2. aor.
= aṭṭhāsi, see tiṭṭhati.

numeral [sa. aṣṭādaçan; the middle-
indian form proper is atthārasa, q. v.], eighteen;
Kacc-v 384; MN I 398,3 (vedanā); III 216,3,29; 217,5
(manôpavicārā); ≠ AN I 175,30 (aṭṭhārasa); ~ahi
vatthūhi, DN I 13,1; 30,5; 40,28.
entry.re:
— °-manôpavi-aṭṭhā-dasa-manôpavi-
cāra, mfn., who applies his mind (to things) in 18 ways,
MN III 239,11-28 (~o ayaṁ puriso; cha-dhātura +).

entry.sense: n., v. l. = aṭṭāna, q. v.

ṭhāna, n. [sa. asthāna], (a) wrong place,
time, or occasion; loc. ~e: Ja VI 566,15 (~e videse);
I 256,15 (anupāyena ~e parakkamaṁ karonto); AN
IV 32,12*; V 269,12 (ṭhāne upakappati no ~e; quoted
Pv-a 27,24); Mil 141,1 (n'atthi Tathāgatānaṁ ~e
gajjitaṁ). — (b) impossibility (with foll. yaṁ and pot.,
= it is impossible that . . .), Sn 54 (~a taṁ . . . yaṁ
phassaye . . . ɔ: aṭṭhānaṁ taṁ; Pj = akāraṇaṁ
taṁ); As 30,1 (~aṁ akāraṇaṁ); 194,33 (~aṁ etaṁ);
very frequent in the phrase ~aṁ etaṁ anavakāso . . .
n' etaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati: Vin III 23,22 (Sp: ubhayam
p'etaṁ kārana-patikkhepa-vacanaṁ); II 199,28; DN
II 225,3 (Sv) - AN I 27,38 (quoted Mil 236,27); MN
I 375,26; 381,30; III 21,1; 64,16 (Ps; quoted Sv III
218,7) ≠ AN I 26,30—29,35 (= Aṭṭhānapāḷī); AN I
187,14; Pp 11,24; Ap 61,18 (with aor.); — ~aṁ ca
~ato yathābhūtaṁ pajānāti, SN V 304,13; AN III
417,18; 419,1 (quoted Ja I 104,10'). — (c) loc. ~e =
on wrong object, or wrong person: Ja IV 208,8 (kopaṁ
bandhitvā); 209,27 (āghātaṁ bandhitvā); Dhs 1060;
1231. — (d) instr. ~ena akāraṇena = without reason:
Ja III 442,13' (cf. aṭṭhānaso below). — Ifc. v. ṭhānâ-
ṭhāna.

f., the having an eye for what
is impossible, understanding of impossibilities (as ex-
pressed SN V 304,13); Dhs 1338; DN III 212,21 (Sv,
where we find two explanations: (1) quoting Dhs
1338 = the faculty of determining what cannot be the
cause of what, and (2) quoting MN III 64,16 foll. = the
faculty of determining what is absolutely impossible).
Cf. ṭhānaṭṭhāna-kusalatā, As 395,14.

[m., groundless anger, Mp III
331,1, read with Ce aṭṭhāne kopaṁ bandhitvā.]

f. = Sn 54; °-vannanā, f., its
Ct. in Pj II 103—105.

m., assumption of impos-
sible conditions; Ja III 478,22; Ps II 213,11-17;
— °-(sutta), n., As 336,12 (reference to SN V 365,17-21
≠ AN I 222,27-30).

entry.re:
— °-van-Aṭṭhāna-pālī-van-
ṇanā, f. = Mp (Se) I 495—513. Cf. Aṭṭhāna-vagga
& Aṭṭhāna-sutta-pālī.

entry.sense:
f. (abstr. of the ex-
pression atthānam anavakāso), the being impossible,
Mil 209,8.
m. = Aṭṭhāna-pālī, AN I 30,3.
see aṭṭha-navuti.

f., = Atthāna-pālī; Ss
115,6.

ind. (from 2aṭṭhāna), insuitably, im-
properly; Ja III 441,16* (+appatirūpam attano; cf.
ib. 442,13')-

mfn., not worthy to stand (or be
continued), deserving to be abrogated; Vin I 111,12
(kammaṁ adhammikaṁ kuppaṁ +); 313,17; 314,13;
316,19; 337,16; II 70,22 foll.

f., an impossible assertion,
nonsense; Ps III 106,2 (cf. ib. 105,18).

n., a chess-board, Abh 532; (cf.
MTD aṭṭhāpada, m. n. [sa. aṣṭāpada], a picture frame;
a chequered board for dice, etc.; spider, worm; safety
pin; gold). — Cf. aṭṭha-pada & aṭṭhapāda above.

mfn., arranged after the mode
of a 'chess-board; ~ā kesā, Th 772 = MN II 65,1*
(Ps: rasodakena makkhetvā na[hā]tvā nalāṭa-pari-
yante āvatta-parivatte katvā aṭṭha-pada-karaṇena
racitā (Ck aṭṭha-padaka-racanāya racitā).

numeral [sa. aṣṭādaça(n)], eighteen
(the proper middle-indian form, cf. aṭṭhādasa): Ja VI
395,15 (°-akkhohini-saṁkhā senā); Kv-a5,13 (~an-
naṁ ācariya-vādānaṁ); As 212,36 (kamma-dvārāni);
Dhp-a II 43,3 (°-koṭīsu); Mil 20,1 (~annaṁ brahma-
koṭīnaṁ); Ja I 92,22 (°-hirañña-koṭīhi); Ja IV
378,24 (°-koṭi-dhanaṁ); Ja I 227,4 (°-koṭi-saṁkhaṁ
dhanaṁ); As 213,1 (khattiyā, brāhmaṇā, vessā,
suddā); Vibh 392,20 (taṇhā-vicaritāni, cf. Ps I 219,23
foll.); Vism 121,31 (~annaṁ dosānaṁ); Ja VI 542,9
(purisadose, cf. 549,14'-i5'); MN III 62,10 (dhā-
tuyo, cf. Ps III 512,13); As 395,1 (~annaṁ dhā-
tūnaṁ); Mil 106,2 (~ahi Buddha-dhammehi); 216,14
(do.); Vv-a 213,13 (āveṇika-Buddhadhammā); Vibh-a
388,5 (bhāsā); MN III 216,29 (manôpavicārā; aṭṭhā-
dasa) = AN I 175,30 (do.; aṭṭhārasa); Ps III 662,11
(vitakka-vicāra-saṁkhātā manôpavicārā); Ps III
661,19-20 (vaṭṭapadā, vivaṭṭapadā); Vin II 204,24
(~ahi vatthūhi); Ps III 454,6 (~ahi vatthūhi viva-
dantānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ yo vivādo); Mp (Se) I 497,15
— Ps III 517,5 (bhedakara-vatthūni; quoted Ss
115,35); Dīp V 55 (anāgate vassasate vassān' aṭṭhāra-
sāni ca, cf. aṭṭhasaṭṭhiyo and aṭṭhārasaṁ s. v. aṭṭhā-
rasa-kkhattuṁ, °-vassa); Ja I 259,13 (~annaṁ vijja-
tthānānaṁ); 356,14 (tayo vede + ~ vijjatthānāni);
463,28 (do.); SN IV 224,31; 232,10 (vedanā); Ja VI
22,20 (seṇiyo); Vibh-a 466,4 (do.); — mfn., the
eighteenth, Ap 144,20 (~e kappasate).

ind , 18 times; Ap 92,23
[tmesis: aṭṭhārasañ ca khattuṁ so]; cf. aṭṭha-
kkhattuṁ.

mfn., eighteen cu-
bits in height; Ps II 2,14.

mfn., eighteen years old, Ap
58,26 (tmesis: aṭṭhārasañ ca vasso 'haṁ).

mfn., (a) of eighteen kinds,
Ja I 186,11 (~aṁ khajjakaṁ); — (b) with eighteen
divisions, or conditions, Mp (Se) I 537,7 ad AN I 39,3
(imasmiṁ ~e kāye: ānâpāna-pabbaṁ, etc.).

or °-hatth'-ubbedha, mfn.,
eighteen hatthas in height, Ja VI 432,4-31.
aor. v. tiṭṭhati.

f. [sa. aṣṭâçīti], eighty-eight; °-hattha,
mfn., 88 hatthas in height, Anāg 105 (tmesis: aṭṭhâsīti
bhave hattho).

n. [cf. sa. aṣṭâha], eight days; dat. ~āya,
DN III 90,10. — °-paṭicchanna, mfn., concealed for
8 days, Vin II 51,21 (āpatti).

f. [sa. aṣṭi], a class of metres, Vutt 96
(vāṇinī only). —> Ifc. v. atyaṭṭhi.

n. [sa. asthi, cf. aṣṭhi, /.], 1. a bone (in
comp, sometimes aṭṭhī-°), Abh 278; Ja III 26,2 (sīhassa
~i gale laggi); acc. ~iṁ, Ja III 184,10; generally used
in a collective sense = the bones of the (human) body;
nom. ~i, most frequently written ~ī (sometimes with v. l.
~i), which sometimes might be considered as nom. pl.
(cf. As 198,9) or f. sg.: SN I 206,9* (kut' assa aṭṭhī
yakapiṇḍam eti); MN I 481,2 = SN II 28,25 = 276,13
= AN I 50,9 (kāmaṁ taco ca nahārū ca ~ī ca
avasissatu, [a half çloka] quoted Ja I 71,24; 110,3';
Pj II 391,17; Nidd I 66,26, by Nidd-a (Se) explained
= sabbā aṭṭhiyo, f. pl., showing the tendency of m.
n. -i- stems towards f.; cf. accī); — in the formula
atthi imasmiṁ kāye: kesā, lomā, etc.: Khp III(atthī,
Childers); DN III 105,8; MN I 57,16; SN V 278,10;
Mil 26,8 ; — acc. ~iṁ, Vin I 83,3; MN I 190,17; III
185,5; SN II 238,1; AN IV 129,14; Ja VI 107,6'; — pl.
~ī, Ja I 483,29* (bhinnā); Dhp-a I 165,19; ~īni, Dhp
I 49; DN I 55,27 = MN I 515,15; III 184,12; Ja I 101,21;
Sv III 174,3 (bhijjanti); Vism 253,25 foll. = Vibh-a
236,23 foll; instr. ~īhi, Ja IV 158,22* = Dhp-a I
147,13* = Mil 111,9*; gen. ~īnaṁ, Dhp I 50; Thī
496—-7; there are 300 bones in the human body besides
the 32 teeth: Vism 253,30—-254,6 (ṭhapetvā dvattiṁsa
dantatthīni . . . timattāni aṭṭhi-satāni) = Vibh-a
236,28'.'foll.; cf. Pj I 49,1 foll.; Dhp-a III 118,15 (tīṇi
aṭṭhi-satāni); Ps II 116,21 (ayaṁ āttabhāvo nāma tīhi
aiihi-satehi ussāpito, so Ce); Dhp-a III 109,10 (tīhi
aṭṭhi-satehi samussitaṁ, scil. kāyaṁ). — 2. the stone
of a fruit, Ja II 105,2; acc. ~iṁ, Ja II 104 23; IV
264,32; Mil 77,14; abl. ~ito, Ja II 104,29. — Ifc.
(1.) v. akkha°, akkhaka°, akkhikūpa°, aggabāha°,
aṅgul'-°, ānisada° ura°, ūr'-°, oṭṭha°, kaṭi-°,
kaṇṇa°, kaṇṇacūḷika°, koṭṭha°, gaianta°, gīva°,
gopphaka°, gosīsa°, jaṁgha°, jaṇṇuka°, danta°,
nalāṭa°, nāsakūpa°, nāsika°, paṇhika°, (majjha-,
mūla-)pabba°, pāda°, piṭṭhi-kaṇṭaka°, piṭṭhi-
hattha°, phāsuka°, bāha°, maṇibandha°, mu-
du(ka)°, muddha°, sañcuṇṇita° (mfn.), sīsa°,
sīsakapāla°, hattha°, hadaya°, hanuka°; — (2.) v.
amba°, eka° (mfn.), kataka°, kappāsa°, kappāsa-
phala°, kola°, tāla°, timbaru-, panasa°, madhu-
kaphala°.

mfn. [sa. arthin], useful; only ifc. v.
idam-°. See also atthi(n). aṭṭhi

mfn. [sa. arthika] = prec., ifc. v.
anna°, idam-°. See also atthika.

n. dimin, [sa. asthika] = 2aṭṭhi;
l.~aṁ, As 198,9; pl. ~āni, Vin II 115,14 (calakāni + );
III 37,15 (susāne chaḍḍitāni); DN II 344,22 (~ān' eva
sesesi); MN I 58,28 = 89,8 = III 92,5; Mil 67,29;
85,11; Pj I 67,31 (kaṭakaṭāyanti); Pv-a 41,2; brachy-
logically for °-saññā (q. v.), Vism 110,31 (uddhumā-
takaṁ -f ); 178,6 foll.; 191.31—193,15; 194,11. — Ifc. v.
akkhikūpaka°, ūra°, eka°, kaṭ'-a°, khandha°,
(go)jaṁgha°, danta°, pāda°, bhamuka°, sīsa°,
seta°, hattha°, hanuka°. — 2. ifc. v. an° (mfn.),
amba°, tāla°, madhukaphala°. — °-kadalī, f., see
aṭṭhi-kadalī.

m. (2aṭṭhi + kaṅkala, cf. sa.
kaṅkāla), a skeleton; SN II 185,11 (+ aṭṭhipuñja,
aṭṭhirāsi; v. l. aṭṭhi-(saṁ)kalo; Spk: ~o ti ādīni tīṇi
pi rāsi-vevacanān' eva) = It 17,8 (v. l. aṭṭhi-k(h)alo;
It-a = aṭṭhi-bhāga; v. r. aṭṭhi-khala = aṭṭhi-sañcaya).
— °-kuti, f., a skeleton-hut, Pj II 31,16* (v. l. °kaṅ-
kāla°) = Th-a (ad Th 1). — °-kuṭikā, f. a little hut
of bones; loc. (by attraction) ~e, Th 1150 (acc. to Thī-a
77,6 said to a courtesan; quoted Th-a (ad Th 1).
— °-sannibha, mfn., like to a skeleton, Thī 488 (m. pl.
~ā, scil. kāmā; v. l. °kaṅkāla°; Thī-a). — °-ůpama,
mfn. id.; Vin II 26,23 = IV 135,10 (Sp: appassā-
daṭṭhena) = MN I 130,26 (Ps); 364,22 = AN III 97,2
(v.l. °saṁkhalů°; Mp); Ja V 210,8.

m., a certain great tree, Spk III
236,1 (= 'kacchako', SN V 96,13).

m., a kind of tortoise, Spk II
258,13 (mahantaṁ °-kulaṁ, = 'mahā-kumma-kulaṁ',
SN II 227,4).

(or °katvāna), abs. [according to Ct.s
from 2aṭṭha — 1attha + karoti, q. v. ifc], realizing the
nature or value of an object (for further consideration),
making something open for consideration, or making one-
self receptive (of what is preached), having been attentive,
mostly in the formula ~ manasikatvā sabba-cetaso
[with v. l. sabbaṁ cetasā or cetaso] samannāharitvā:
DN II 204,27 (Māgadhake paricārake ārabbha ~
paññatte āsane nisīdi); MN I 325,6 (dhammavinaye
desiyamāne ~ ohitasoto dhammaṁ suṇāti; Ps =
atthikabḥāvaṁ katvā atthiko hutvā); 445,33 (do.);
AN II 116,32; III 163,4 (do.); MN III 201,22 (deva-
putto ~ +); Ud 80,6 (cf. Ud-a 389,1-16) ≠ SN I 112,5
(Spk) = 189,32 (te ca bhikkhū ~ +); V 95,19—96,1
(ariyasāvako ~ +; Ed. aṭṭhiṁ katvā); SN II 220,25
(yam kiñci dhammaṁ siissāmi . . . sabbaṁ taṁ ~ + ;
Spk = attānaṁ tena dhammena atthaṁ [Ce aṭṭhi -
kaṁ] katvā taṁ vā dhammaṁ 'esa mayhaṁ attho'ti
atthaṁ katvā [Ce aṭṭhikatvā]); Ja V 151,12* (yo koci
imā ~ [- ˇ - -] suṇeyya; Ct = Ps above); Vin IV
144,32** (na sādhukaṁ ~ manasikarosi; Sp = atthi-
kabhāvaṁ katvā); Vin I 103,20' (sādhukaṁ suṇo-
ma ~ ... samannāharāma); Vism 300,3 (ohitasoto
~ kāyena vā vācāya vā cittappasādaṁ karonto
dhammaṁ sunāti); — °katvāna: Sn 317 (Pj);
Saddh 220.

f. (also aṭṭhika-k°), a banana-tree
with kernelled fruits; Ja V 406,20' (= 'moca', which
may be a fault for 'coca', cf. Nidd I 372,3-4 & Nidd-a).
— °-phala, n., the fruit of that tree; Nidd-a ad Nidd
I 372,3 (aṭṭhika-kadalī-phalehi katapānaṁ 'coca-
pānaṁ' [opp. anaṭṭhika-kadalī = moca]).

(mf)n., the disagreeable (loath-
some) of the bones, Vism 192,29.

mfn., filled with bones, Ja I
399,8 (nivesanaṁ ~aṁ disvā).

n., beauty of bones (ɔ: of the teeth)
(cf. aṭṭhi); Dhp-a I 387,15-23 (kesa-kalyāṇaṁ +).

f., a chain of bones, a
skeleton (cf. atthi-saṁkhalikā); MN I 58,24 — 89,4
= III 92,2 - DN II 296,11 = AN III 324,11; SN II
255,12 (cf. uddāna ib. 258,22) = Vin III 105,15 (Sp
= setaṁ nimmaṁsalohitaṁ aṭthika-samghātaṁ);
As 198,9 ≠ Vism 179,19; 192,27; Ja I 433,17.

f., the contemplation or notion of
the skeleton (as meditative exercise); SN V 129,5 foll.;
AN II 17,3 (+ puḷavaka-s°, vinīlaka-s°, vipub-
baka-s°, vicchiddaka-s°, uddhumātaka-s°); V 106,6
= 310,4 (anicca-saññā +); Vismll2,6; As 69,30;
Ja I 433,16 (~aṁ uppajji or upapajji?); cf. 2aṭṭhika
above. — °-sahagata, mfn., accompanied by that,
Dhs 264 (paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ . . . vinīlaka-saññā-
sahagataṁ + ; As 198,8); SN V 129,19 (satisam-
bojjhaṅgaṁ; quoted As 69,29). — Cf. atthi-saññā.

[n., title of SN V 129 (on
Aṭṭhikasaññā).

n., a play with bones, Pj II 113,17
(°-sadisaṁ naccaṁ).

m., = aṭṭhi-kacchapa, Spk III
92.13 ad SN IV 177,26 ('kummo'ti ~o; 'kacchapo'
ti tass'eva vevacanaṁ).
f., the point of a bone, Ja III 26,11.

m. = atthi-sañcaya {q. v.); It 17,8
(v.r.).

entry.re: — °-âvasesaaṭṭhi-cammâvasesa, mfn. id., Ja II 199,24; Dhp-a III 43 6.

entry.sense:
m(fn)., who breaks the bones (of
others); pl. ~ā, Ja III 488,13* (Ct. 489,14'; Cks
°-cchiddā, B. °-chinnā) = MN III 154,14* (°-cchidā,
do., Ps) = Vin I 350,1* (C. °-chiddā; Sp: -chidā (C);
B. & Ed. °-cchinnā).

mfn. [sa. a-sthita], (a) without stopping,
uninterrupted, see °-kāri(n), °-padhāna below. — (b) not
firm (according to Ct.s), see °-dhamma below. Cf,
aṭṭhitaṁ, ind. — Ifc. v. an-°.

ind. (from. 1atthita (a)), always, con-
stantly; Sn 1058 (= sakkaccaṁ sadā vā, Pj; =
sakkaccaṁ abhiṇhaṁ punappunaṁ, Nidd).

mfn. (cf. 1aṭṭhita), acting stead-
fastly, Dhp-a III 452,25 (satata-kari(n) +, = 'sātacca-
kāri(n)'); Nidd I 59,17 (aṭṭhita-karaṇena ~ī, Nidd-a);
376,16 (nirantara-kāritāya ~ī, Nidd-a). aṭṭhita-kāri

f., the acting steadfastly, Dhs
1367 (sakkacca-k°, sātacca-k° +). Ifc. v. an-°.
see aṭṭhi-ttaca.

mfn. (cf. 1aṭṭhita (b)), incon-
sistent with regard to doctrine, DN III 133,1 (~ā
samaṇā Sakya-puttiyā viharanti; = aṭṭhita-sabhāvā,
Sv); prob, a + ṭṭhitadhamma q. v.

n., the exertion (worthy) of a
steadfast man; MN II 212,22 (tmesis: aṭṭhita vata
bhoto Gotamassa padhānaṁ . . . sappurisa vata
bh° . . . padhānaṁ; Ps: aṭṭhita-padassa padhāna-
padena saddhiṁ sambandho).

mfn., of no firm character,
Sv III 129,9 (= 'aṭṭhita-dhamma', q. v.).
f., see atthitā. Ifc. v. idam-°.

f. [sa. a-sthiti], want of rest, unsteadiness,
Nett 88,2 (yā ca iñjanā yā ca cittassa ~).

m. [sa. asthi-tunda], a bird;
MTD.

m. [sa. asthi-toda], bone-disease;
MTD.

n., bones and skin; Th 770 (°-tacena
onaddhaṁ [rūpaṁ]) = MN II 64,28* (Ed. aṭṭhi-
tañcena). — do. mfn., who has bone for skin (said
of a crab); Ja III 295,18* (aṭṭhim eva taco assa, Ct.).

m. [sa. asthi-sthūna], the body;
MTD.

mfn., held together by
bones and sinews; Sn 194 (~o kayo; v. l. n(a)hāruhi
saññ°).

mfn., dependent or relying on the
bones; Ps II 172,20 (pāṇā).

mfn., with wings of bones; Sv II
122,15 ('pakkhino'ti ye keci ~ā vā camma-pakkhā
vā loma-pakkhā vā).

m., 'the wall of bones' (i. e. the
body); Ja III 377,8 (bhinno~o; cf. atthīnaṁ nagaraṁ,
Dhp I 50).
m., the concavity of a bone; Pj I 52,9*.

in SN II 254,9 (Ee) given as title
of the sutta ib. 254,10—-256,4; but the uddāna ib.
258,22 means: Aṭṭhi (= 254,10 foll.), Pesī (=
256,6-12), both were butchers ; cf. Vin III 100,16.

m., the bony portion (of a body),
It-a 109,17 (= 'aṭṭhi-kaṅkala').

n., the flesh which is nearest to
the bones; Ja IV 39,24 (opp. thūla-maṁsa, majjhima-
maṁsa); V 292,29 foll.

mfn., of which the bones
only are left; Dhp-a III 32,13. (Cf. aṭṭhi-saṁkhalika-°
below.)

mfn. [sa. asthi-maya], made of
bone; Vin I 203,25 (+ danta-maya, etc.); II 115,31
(do.); Nidd I 5,16 (Nidd-a).

f. [sa. asthi-m°], a rosary of bones;
MTD.

f. or n. [Amg. id., Sinh, miduḷu;
cf. sa. majjan, m.], the marrow of bones; ~ā, Khp
III & parallel passages quoted under 2atthi; — Vin
I 83,4 (~aṁ āhacca tiṭṭhati); AN IV 129,15 (do.);
Dhp-a I 181,11; III 361,21 (do.), cf. Pj II 86,8; DN
II 339,16 (~aṁ chindatha); Ja VI 107,8' (~aṁ khā-
danti). — n. ~aṁ, as v. l. DN II 293,14; AN III
323,24, etc.; likewise n. Vism 255,32; 356,3; Vibh-a
59,35; 239,9; Pj I 52,13-18. °-nissita, mfn., depen-
dent or relying on a°, Ps II 172,20 (pāṇā).
— °-meda, n. (or ~ā , f.), marrow; MTD. — Ifc. v.
taruṇatāla°.
see 1aṭṭhika; ifc. v. matta°, maha°.

m., a mass of bones; SN II 185,11
(aṭṭhi-kaṅkalo + ; Spk) = It 17,9 (It-a).

m. or n. (cf. 2aṭṭhi), according to Sp =
gojaṅghaṭṭhika, 'a bone from a cow-leg' (used to mas-
sage), Vin II 266,22 (~ena jaghanaṁ ghaṁsāpenti).
[Kern p. 94 refers to sa. aṣṭhīlā(!)].

mfn., (paron.) hurt into
the bones; AN II 114,33 (assājānīyo . . . loma-vedha-
viddho . . . maṁsa-vedha-viddho +; = aṭṭhiṁ
bhindantena vedhena viddho, Mp).

mfn. (cf. prec), deeply wounding,
Ja VI 448,28* (senā tikhiṇaggā ~ino). aṭṭhi-vedhi

m. [sa. asthi-s°], the adjutant
bird; MTD.
f. = next; see ~lůpama.

f. [cf. sa. asthi-çṛṅkhalā &
atthika-saṁkhalikā above], a skeleton; DN II 296,13
(v. l. aṭṭhika-s°); Ps I 174,5 (v. l. for aṭṭhika-s°, MN
I 58,24); Pv 349. — °-peta, m., a ghost in the shape
of a skeleton; Dhp-a III 479,6-10; Spk II 269,7.
— °-matta, mfn., reduced to a skeleton; Pv-a 152,21.

mfn., like to a skeleton
AN III'97,2.

(or °samghāta), m., 'a frame
of bones', i. e. a skeleton; Nidd I 181,13 (Nidd-a);
Vism 21,10*; 193,14; Pj I 48,28* = II 247,16*;
152,1; Ja V 256,19'; Ps I 260,29 (~o); Dhp-a III
112,10; loc. pl. ~esu, the joints of the body, Dhp-a
II 28,14. — °-ghaṭita, mfn., linked together by a°,
Th 570 (pūtikāyo). — °-jaṭita, mfn., with entangled
bones; petā hi appamaṁsalohitattā ~ā ekena passena
sayituṁ na sakkonti, Ps II 427,1 = Mp II 512,4
(quoted Ss 14,9). — °mattâvasesa, mfn., reduced
to a mere skeleton; Pv-a 206,28 (cf. aṭṭhimattâvasesa).

m. [asthi-sañcaya] a heap of
bones; It 17,13* (It-a = aṭṭhi-khala = SN II
185,18*; quoted Thī497 and Abhidh-av 87,18* (v. 783)
(puggalass' ~o).

f. — aṭṭhika-sañña (q. v.); Th 18
(kevalaṁ ~āya aphari paṭhaviṁ imaṁ).

n., the structure of the bones; ifc,
mfn. v. dissamāna° (Saddh 101).

m., an aggregate of bones; It-a
109,18 (= 'aṭṭhipuñja').

mfn., 'bone-headed', with a head as it
were consisting (only) of bones; Sv II 61,1 ad DN II 19,3
(aparipuṇṇasīsa + ; cf. note in Se: etth'antare 'keci
hatthisīsā'ti dissati; pt: ~ā ti maṁsassa abhāvato,
ativiya-aṭṭhitāya patanubhāvato vā, taconaddha-
aṭṭhimattasīsā).

[Asthisena, Mvu, see below], m. Npr.
of a brāhmaṇa_(Bodhisatta); Ja III 352,5, 22, 28*;
355,19. (Cf. sa. Arṣṭiṣena, see Indische Studien III
128). — °-jātaka, n. = Ja (403) III 351—355 ≠
Mvu III 418,19—420,5.
mfn., except the bones; Ap 542,19.

m. [sa. asthi-çoṣa], disease causing
the bones to dry up; MTD.

m. Npr. of a paccekabuddha ( =
Devadatta in a future existence); Mil 111,16 ≠ Dhp-a
I 148,2 (v. l. Saṭṭhissaro, see Hardy, Manual 340);
cf. imehi aṭṭhīhi in Mil 111,9* = Ja IV 158,22*).
[w. r. for aṭṭíyati.]

n., (the auspicious number)
108; Ja I 456,20.

f. (raṭṭha = 2attha + uppatti;
sometimes also written atth'-°), occasion, esp. an occur-
rence giving occasion to a dhamma-desanā; Pj I
216,24; Ud-a 30,10-32 (attn'-°); Dhp-a I 285,12 (do.);
Pj I 75,26 (do.); instr, imissā(ya) ~iyā, Ja I 83,28;
89,2; Ps II 390,20 (atth'-°); Pv-a 6,28 (do.); katarāya
~iyā, Sv I 51,25; abl. ~ito, Pj II 46,17 (attajjhā-
sayato + ; cf. Pv-a 2,7; Mp I 125,6 (+ āgamanato
ciṇṇavasito guṇâtirekato); Vv-a 203,24 (pāḷito ~ ca
sadisaṁ); loc. ~iyaṁ, Mp I 63,23; 82,1; Pv-a 244,8
(atth'-°); ~iṁ katvā (taking the occasion of), Dhp-a
III 302,1; Vv-a 197,30; Pv-a 78,3 (atth°-°); Sv I
51,27.

mfn. (from prec), due to an
occasion; ~o nikkhepo, Sv I 51,21; Ps I 87,31; Mp I
82,1; Spk II 5,7 (atth'-°); ~āya dhammadesanāya,
Mp II 148,6 (do.); cattāro hi sutta-nikkhepā: attaj-
jhāsayo+, Sv I 50,25 = Ps I 15,25 ≠ Ud-a 29,26
(atth'-°).

m., the time of an aṭṭhup-
patti '(q. v.); Sv I 242,24; Ps II 203,5 (atth'-°).

mfn., measuring eight
usabha (q. v.); Ja IV 142,25 (~aṁ ṭhānaṁ).
— °-ūsabha-vitthata, mfn., id.; Ja V 319,26' (~aṁ
maggaṁ). —- °-ůsabha-vitthāra, mfn., id.; Ja I
64,22 (~āya nadiyā); 70,27 (~ena maggena); VI
580,14 (~aṁ āgamana-maggaṁ).
°instr.; ifc. v. 1aṭṭha.

a-ḍañchi, aor. v. ḍasati. — Ja IV
32,21*, Cks Ed. aḍatthi, Bsf(Bd) aḍâssi, read a-ḍañchi,
or a-daṁsi (as Ja IV 330,9*; Ed. & B-Mss. aḍassi(ṁ);
Cks andajiṁ ɔ: adañchiṁ); Cp III 11,8 Cf. Tr PM
72 n. 3.

[Sp (Ce) ad Vin II 134,1, V. I. for
aḍḍharuka, q. v.].

(& 1addha, of which all exx. are taken
here), m.n., a half; Abh 53, 995 (m.); 54 (n.: ~aṁ
vuttaṁ same bhāge); 1039 (m. or n.); Thī 25 (taṁ
katvā . . . ~aṁ, so read for agghaṁ, cf. 1aggha); AN I
38,11 (~aṁ idaṁ lābhānaṁ, by Mp (Se I 535,1) taken
= addhā, 'certainly': ekaṁsâdhivacanam etaṁ, addhā
idaṁ lābhānaṁ, ekaṁso eva lābhānan ti vuttaṁ hoti;
cf. Abh 995 [addho bhāge, pathe kale ekaṁse 'ddhâ-
vyayaṁ bhave[); instr. ~ena, Kacc-v 389 (giving the
sense of aḍḍha In compounds, e. g. ~ena catuttho =
'aḍḍñuḍḍho'); — m. = aḍḍha-kahāpaṇa, Ja III
448,14 (kahāpaṇo +); Dhp-a III 108,11 (do.);
Ja I 340,30 (kahāpaṇa-aḍḍha-pādamāsaka-rūpâdīni);
Dhp-a I 256,10 (~aṁ vā kahāpaṇaṁ vā); °-aggha-
naka, mfn., having the value of ½ kahāpaṇa, Dhp-a
II 132,8. — Mostly in comp, (see below), thus before
cardinal numbers: aḍḍhaṭṭha, aḍḍhatelasa, aḍḍñekā-
dasa, or before ordinal numbers: aḍḍhaṭṭhama (7½),
aḍḍhanavama (8½). — Ifc. it is said to be n. when
denoting equal parts (otherwise m., see Abh 53; cf.
Pāṇ II 2,2): apara°, pacchima°, pubba°, purima°
(Pj II 255,27-28; 593,6-7); cf. also upaḍḍha, das'-
aḍḍha, diyaḍḍha (divaḍḍha), duvaḍḍha.

mfn. [sa. āḍhya; cf. ālhiya and subālhika],
rich, wealthy, opulent; Abh 725; 1039; Vin III 15,11
(~ā mahaddhanā mahābhogā, etc.; = upabhoga-
paribhogûpakaraṇa-mahantatāya ~ā, Sp); DN I
113,33 (+ mahaddhana, mahābhoga, etc.; = issara,
Sv); 134,22; 137,19; III 163,1; SN I 71,1 (+ do.;
= issara, Spk); IV 324,20 (kulāni ~āni + do.; cf.
aḍḍha-kula, n.); V 402,14 (+ do.); AN III 152,1
(+ do.; Mp); IV 7,1 (kīva-° + do.); V 290,23 (+
do.); Pp 52,8 (+ do.); Dhp-a I 3,8 (+ do.); Vv-a
322,15(+do.); Pv-a 78,13 (+ do.); Mil 106,29; 128,6
(+ do.); Ja III 299,1 (+ mahaddhana); Th 783
(Ed. addhā daliddā ca); Ja III 70,6* (f. ~ā; = VI
508,21*; SN I 35,1* (~e ājāyare [Ed. ajāyare] kule);
Vv 293 (~e kule); AN V 45,1 (~o + dhanavā ...
bhogavā); Ja V 214,14' (suṭṭhu ~o, = 'subāḷhiko');
— °-kāle, (loc.) 'as long as he was rich', Ja III 70,9'.
— Ifc. v. kīva-°, guṇa°, satasākha°.

n., half an usabha (a certain
measure of length), Ps I 257,19.

mfn. = 2aḍḍha; Pv 239 (tattha
ahaṁ gahapati ~o ahuṁ, see v. l.; = aḍḍho mahāvi-
bhavo, Pv-a); Ja IV 495,20*; 498,25'; Ap 75,10 =
77,6 = 439,4 (mahāsālesu ~e, metr. haplology'for ~esu;
cf. however v. l. ad 77,6: mahāsāle su-v-aḍḍhake).
— Ifc. v. tad-°.

mfn., half a karīsa (q. v.)
in extent; Vv-a 64,20 (~aṁ ṭhānaṁ kasitvā).

m., half part of the body; MN II
137,20 (v. l. for adharakāyo). — Ifc. v. (sīha)-pubba°
(ib. 136,25).

mfn. (from prec), being of half
the size of a man's body; Vin II 150,18 (~āni bimbo-
hanāni; = yesu kaṭito paṭṭhāya yāva sīsaṁ upada-
hanti, Sp; Sp-ṭ).

mfn., only Vin I 281,28 foll. ~o
kambalo, which seems orig, to mean a sort of 'half-
muslin' (cf. kāsika), but here taken in the sense of
'a piece of stuff sufficient for half the people of Kāsī'
(~aṁ kambalaṁ pāhesi upaddha-Kāsīnaṁ khama-
mānaṁ; accord, to Sp Kāsi means 1000, and aḍḍha-
kāsika: worth 500).

(or Aḍḍhakāsikā), f. Npr. of a
courtesan in Benares (Kāsi-raṭṭhe), who adopted the
religious life; author of Thī 25—26; ~ikā, Ap 610,6
— 611,13 (quoted Thī-a 31,11 foll.); Vin II 277,3 (~ī
gaṇikā bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā hoti, quoted Thī-a 30,29
foll.; cf. Vin II 282,37 (~ikā, in the uddāna); the name
of A. seems to be a nickname on account of her high
taxes ('half the revenue of the king of Kāsī'), and
Ja V 447,22' (cf. ib. 446,9*) alludes to this fact. Aḍḍhakāsī

n. [cf. sa. kuḍya(ka)], a half-
wall, Vin II 152,17.

mfn., like a half-filled
pitcher, Sn 721 (~o bālo, rahado pflro va paṇḍito).

n., a rich family; DN I 115,33
(Gotamo ~ā pabbajito mahaddhanā mahābhogă;
compound instead of adăhā kulā; note the rhythmical
correspondence [ - ˇ ˇ -, - ˇ ˇ - ] with Sakyakṁā
pabbajito, DN I 111,11, etc.); Dhp-a II 37,10; Ps II
283,14.

f., 'an intermediate cross-seam' (on
the robe of a bhikkhu); Vin I 287,23 (Sp: ~ī ti anta-
rantarā rassa-pattānaṁ nāmaṁ; cf. Trsl. II 209); II
177,7 (~i dātabbă).

m. [sa. ardha-kroça], half a kosa (a
certain measure of length); Ja VI 81,26* (ito gantvā
~aṁ, = aḍḍha-kosantaraṁ, a distance of ~, Ct.; but
Qks & $e rea(ḷ aḍḍha-ghosa, q. v.).

mfn., 'living on half a cup
(or spoon)-full of food', MN II 6,35 (kosakâhāra +;
Ps explains kosakâhāra by piṇḍa. i. e. a bite, morsel,
mouthfull).

or °-akkhika, n. [sa. ardhâkṣi],
'half an eye', i. e. a side-glance; Ud-a 171,5 (ad Ud
22,16 [apaloketvā]; ~inā ābandhantī viya oloketvā,
w.r. °-akkhikā); Dhp-a IV 98,23 (°-akkhikena olo-
kesi; v. l. anvaddhakkhikena, Ck); Vism 76,28 (°-ak-
khikena); Ps (Ee) II 183,23.
mfn., half-eaten, Ja III 200,25.

/:, a half-stanza, Pj I 89,18; II
72,1, etc.

n., half a gāvuta (a certain
measure of length); Ja VI 55,29 (°-mattaṁ gatakāle,
having walked only~); Ps II 223,18 (°-ppamāṇa, mfn.,
measuring ~).

m., half the distance of a shout,
Ja VI 81,26* (v. l. Cks & Se for aḍḍha-kosa, sa. kroça
and ghoṣa being orig, synonyms?).

mfn., of the size of half a
finger, Ps II 135,2 (Se reads aṭṭhaṅgula-mattaṁ).

(m.), a little figure of the half-
moon, Sp (II) 290,8 (Tr's transscript of Pālim gives
°-candalikā); 292,11.

m. designation of a thera, Ap
231,6-15 (cf. aḍḍhacanda).

n.(?), in a doubtful passage Mil
102,10, quoted Mp I 59,22 (Mp-ṭ reports various ex-
plications: 13 ½ (ɔ: aḍḍha-cuddasa), 3 ½ (ɔ: aḍḍha-
catuttha, cf. cūḷāsīti), and, with approval, not a full
half (cf. cūḷa = culla); cf Trsl. 1154 note 4.

m. designation of a thera, Ap
134,10-2 3 (cf. upaḍḍhadussaṁ datvāna, ib. 134,13).

mfn., five and a half; As 31,34
(~esu Jātaka-satesu, in the 550 Jātakas; Ja-Ed.
numbers only 547).

mfn., half roasted, Ja I 405,12
(~ena sarīrena) = °-jjhāmaka, mfn. ib. 20'. aḍḍha-jhāma

mfn., 'having the half of
eight feet', i.e. fourfooted (cf. aṭṭha-nakha); Ja VI
354,20*-28' (said of a ram: ~o [ - - ˇ ˇ -] catup-
padassa meṇḍo; Tr corrects into aṭṭhi-aḍḍha-pāda
[cf. Bd aṭhaḍḍha°] which is not necessary).

[mfn., w. r. for aḍḍhaṭ-
ṭhama-ratana, see prec.}

f. (from 2aḍḍha), richness, wealth, Saddh
316 (~ā hi anantā me paraloke bhavissati).

mfn. (haplol. < *aḍḍh[at]atiya, sa.
ardhatṛtīya; see next), two and a half, Abh 477; Mogg-v
III 113 (= aḍḍhena tatiyo); Kacc-v 389 (do.); Ja I
49,16 (~āni yojanasatāni); 206,7 (~ānaṁ nāṭaka-
koṭīnaṁ); 254,26 (~āni purisasatāni); Vv-a èβ,2 9
(~esu māsesu); Ja VI 582,23' (°-gāthānaṁ);
— °-sata, mfn. = 250; Ja I 255,22 (acc. m. pl. ~e).

mfn. (query < ardha + *tray-ya;
cf. aḍḍhatiya), two and a half; Abh 477—-8 (tatiyo
'ḍḍhatiyo tathā aḍḍhateyyo); Mogg-v III 113; Vin
I 39,25 (~ehi paribbājaka-satehi); 42,27 (~āni
paribbājaka-satāni); IV 117,35 (°-māsā); 256,27**
foll. (°-kaṁsaparamaṁ); DN III 70,1 (°-vassa-sa-
hassâyukā); Dhp-a III 108,9 (~āni satāni); Pv-a
20,23 (~ehi purisasatehi).— °-koṭiya, mfn., number-
ing 2 ½ X 10 millions, Ps III 205,10 (~āni aṅgāra-
kapallāni). — °-koṭisamkha, mfn.-id., Ja V 152,27.
— °-sata, mfn., =*250, Ja II 129,5-7. — °-sahassa,
n., = 2500; Pj II 138,12 (v. l. ~ā, adj. f. containing
2500 persons, scil. parisā).

mfn., sometimes written for aḍḍha-
teḷasa (q. v.), e.g. Sv (Se) ad DN II 6,11; Ps III
197,19; 366,15.

(or °-telasa; also written °-terasa),
mfn. [sa. ardha-trayodaça], twelve and a half; Sn
p. 102,20 (~ehi bhikkhu-satehi); Vin I 220,20 (do.);
243,30 (do.); DN I 47,1 (do.); II 6,11 (do.); SN I
192,10 (do.), etc.; Pj II 447,3.

m., a short stick, a cudgel, or a
split rod; MN 1*87,10 (~ehi tāḷenti; Ps) [≠ III 164,1]
= Nidd I 154,1 (Nidd-a = Mp); 403,15; II 254,5
≠ AN I 47,14 (Mp; cf. II 122,25) ≠ Mil 197,2 (~ehi
tāḷanaṁ); ~ena, Vin III 47,7'.

n., half a piece of cloth, Ap 436,6
(cf. upaḍḍha-dussa). •

mfn., eight and a half; Mhv
XV 201 (°-sahassāni = 8500).

mfn., of a measure of
half a nāḷikā (q. v.), Ja VI 366,28 (~aṁ taṇḍulaṁ).
— °-nāḷi-matta, mfn., id., Dhp-a I 311,8 (~o varaka-
corako).
f. [sa. ardha-niçā], midnight, MTD.

mfn., with half-ripe fruits,
Ja V 169,5' (~ā, scil. amba-rukkhā).

m. [sa. ardha-paryaṅka], the
sitting half crosslegged (i. e. with only one leg bent
inward); Vin II 280,10 (= ekaṁ pādaṁ ābhujitvā
kata-pallaṁko, Sp); Ap 539,27 (~aṁ ābhujja, quoted
Thī-a 153,20*).

n., a half fruit of the Bilva tree,
Ja V 72,2* (°-sādisā, scil. gaṇḍū; cf. also Sn p. 125,3);

m. [sa. ardha-bhāga], one half,
half a share, Vv 114 (bhāga°, = attanā laddhapaṭi-
vīsato upaḍḍhabhāgaṁ, Vv-a).

mfn., half eaten, Dhp-a IV 99,10
(~aṁ bhojana-pātiṁ); with an active sense = one
whose meal is (only) half finished, Mp III 185,10 (~ā
aḍdhâlaṁkatā).

n., a semi-circular seam, Vin
I 287,24 (= khuddaka-mandala, Sp); II 177,8
(kusi +).

mfn., half dead, DN II 336,7 ( =
dara-mato marituṁ āraddho, Sv).

mfn. (from 1aḍḍha + 1mat-
taka), half mad, Ja V 367,25' (= 'aḍḍh'-ummatta').

n., half a māna (a certain measure,
see 2m'āna); Ja I 468,1* (Ct).

m. [sa. ardha-māsa], half a month,
a fortnight; ~o seso gimhānaṁ, Vin III 253,2**, 12';
tiṭṭhatu ~o, DN II 315,4; MN I 63,10; AN V 85,25;
~o atikkanto, Dhp-a I 393,19; acc. ~aṁ, Vin III 68,8
(patisallīyituṁ) = SN V 320,14; Vin IV 117,31 (oren' ~);
MN II 54,1; Ja VI 10,15; 288,20; 536,9*; 588,8; Pv-a
55,9; Vv-a 67,8; instr. ~ena, during a fortnight, Ja
VI 574,3; gen. tass' ~assa accayena, SN V 320,26
(Ed. uḍḍhamāsassa); pl- ~ā, AN IV 139,20; aṭṭhi
°-satāni, ib. 139,4. — °-matta, n. (or ind.), just a half
month (cf. 2matta); Ja III 218,6 (~aṁ atikkamitvā);
124,24 (~e vītivatte); acc. (adv.) ~aṁ, during a
half month, Ja I 156,15; V 430,28; Dhp-a I 14,22; IV
129,12. — Ifc. v. atiṛeka°, ūnaka°, māsa°, cf.
anvaḍḍhamāsaṁ.

m., a half māsa (a certain coin,
cf. 2māsa); Ja VI 346,28*. — Ifc. v. loha°. Cf. next.

m. = prec; ~o, Ja I 111,27;
III 448,16 (≠ Mvu III 186,15*); αcc.~aṁ, Ja I 112,13
(~ na agghati); Ja III 446,17; 448,20; VI 346,26
(gīvāya baddha-°); °-pemena, from love to ~, Ja III
449,5; °-mattaṁ pi adisvā (only ~), Ja III 129,19.
— Ifc. v. māsaka°, loha°.

mfn., worth half a
māsaka (q. v.), Ja I 112,24.

m. Npr. of a king, the
hero of Gaṅgamāla-jātaka (cf. Mvu III 182—197); Ja
III 449,6 foll.; 454,3; IV 174,9'. Aḍḍhamasaka-raja

mfn., with an interval
of a half month, Sv ad DN I 166,15 (= 'addha-
māsika'); Ps ad MN I 78,5 (do.).

mfn. [sa. ardha-māsika], half-
monthly, DN I 166,15 (~aṁ °-bhojanânuyogaṁ; =

= '238,27 = 307,36 = Pp 55,21.

mfn., worth ½ māsa; Rūp 360
≠ Pay ad Mogg IV 42.

f. (cf. puṇṇamāsī, cātumāsinī), the
half-moon day, only loc. °siyaṁ, Ja I 391,22 (Ed.
kāḷapakkhe addha°, no v. l., = kaḷuvara-pohoyehi,
Ja-pot; Se āmāvasiyaṁ).

mfn., shaven over half the head
(as a sign of loss of freedom?), Mhv VI 42 (satta
satāni purise kāretvā ~e).

m., 'half-construction', i.e. a certain
form of house (with a pentroof?), Abh 209 (ekapasse

pakkhena sadisa-chadana-gehaṁ, Abh-sūci); Vin I
58,19 (vihāro +; = dīghapāsādo or garuḷasaṇṭhāna-

II 146,29 (quoted Ps I 90,19); 172,27; 177,33*; Nidd I
67,12 (= nikuṇḍa-geha, Nidd-a); Vibh 251,10 (quoted
Ps II 289,10 & Mp II 496,12; = supaṇṇa-vaṁka-geha,
Vibh-a 366,1 = Sp ad Vin II 146,29; = garuḷa-
pakkhasaṇṭhānena katagehaṁ, Sp-ṭ; differently Vin
Trsl. I 174 note); Vism 34,4 (~âdim'hi).

n., a space or distance of half a
yojana (q. v.); Ja I 59,15; V 155,2*; As 142,32; Sv I
35,13; Ps II 134,19; Dhp-a I 147,4. — °-ppamāṇa,
mfn., having an extent of ½ y°, Ja I 54,8; 72,31.
— °-matta, mfn. id., Dhp-a I 392,8; do. n. — a space
of V 2 y°> Dhp-a II 74,20.

mfn. (from prec); having an
extent 'of half a yojana; Sv I 284,9; Ps II 223,17.

mfn., measuring half a ratana
(q. v.), Ja I 7,24'.

f. = prec, Vv-a 315,25; °-samaye,
Vv-a 255,4; Pv-a 155,8.

(mfn.?), only Vin II 134,1-12: ~aṁ
kārāpenti; form and derivation of this word is quite
uncertain, v. l. °-dukaṁ; Sp explains: ~aṁ [B.
aḍhadukaṁ, Ce aḍḍurakaṁ] ti udare lomarāji-ṭha-
panaṁ, i. e. leaving a stripe of hairs on the belly. aḍḍharūka

m., the half of a sail; ~aṁ katvā,
going under halfsail, Vism 137,4.

mfn., like to half a gourd,
Ja V 155,27* (~ā thanā). — °lābu-samāna, mfn.,
id., ib. 156,25'.

m., title of Jāt (371—75), Ja III
211—227 (the last vagga of Pañcanipāta, containing
only 5 jātakas).

m. (cf. 2aḍḍha), 'speaking of wealth',

samāno ~aṁ vadeyya (paron.); Mp: aḍḍho 'ham
asmī ti vādaṁ vadeyya) — 45,1.

mfn., half opened, Ja V 293,19
(dvāraṁ ~aṁ katvā); 295,13 (do.).

mfn. [sa. ardha-sama-vṛtta,
cf. 4vutta], said of a class of metres (having 1st and
3rd, 2d and 4th pāda equal); Vutt 106—116.

mfn., being only of half the value
indicated (said of coins), Vism 437,16 (cheko, kūṭo +).

mfn., half dried up, Ja II 19,20
(~aṁ hatthi-laṇḍaṁ).

[n., title of two suttas, SN V
402 (= Mahaddhana-s°).

mfn., fifteen and a half, Pj II
447,4 (~ānaṁ, scil. bhikkhu-satānaṁ).

mfn., half dressed, Mp III
185,10.

mfn., in a measure of half
an āḷhaka (q. v.); Dhp-a III 367,5 (~e acc. pl. scil.
dhaññe?).

n., half an āḷhaka of rice,
Vin III 243,27' (Sp); IV 243,24'.

mfn., in which only a half part
is left, Pj II 272,9 (~āya kumbhiyā).
[pr. 3. sg., see aṭṭīyati.] [aḍḍhīyati

mfn. [cf. sa. ardha-caturtha
and Amg. aḍḍhuṭṭha, Pischel § 290, 450], three
and a half, Abh 477 (— catuttho 'ḍḍhena); Kacc-v
389 (= aḍḍhena catuttho); n. pl. ~āni, Ja V 417,2**
(~ itthi-sahassāni = tīṇi sahassāni pañca satāni,
ib. 418,24'); 420,14 (itthi-satāni); Ja I 82,30 (pā-
ṭihāriya-sahassāni) = IV 180,15 — Dhp-a I 87,21,
cf. °-pāṭihāriya-sahassāni, Vin I 34,10; Mhv XII 53
(sahassāni). Cf. also sa. adhy-uṣṭa.

mfn., half mad, Ja V 367,3*
(= aḍḍhamattako, Ct.).

mfn., half combed (or dressed);
~ehi kesehi, with her hair half dressed, Ud 22,16
(pi-pāṭha to upaḍḍhullikhitehi, Ud-a 171,3); Dhp-a
I 116,8; 118,17; Ja II 92,11 (Bp aḍḍha-likhita).

mfn., ten and a half, Ps III
512,13 (°-dhātuyo; cf. MN III 62,10 foll).

mfn., of which half (the flowers)
has been plucked off, Ja I 120,26 (~e puppha-gacche).

√ saddattho, Dhātup 114; sadde, Dhātum
169; Sadd II 355; pr. 3. sg. see aṇati.

[sa. ṛṇa] = iṇa, ifc, v. an-aṇa (cf. ānaṇya),
which is also spelt aṇaṇa (v. l. aṇ-iṇa), sâṇa.

pr. 3. sg. (of √aṇ), to recite; only in the
etymology of the word brāhmaṇa: brahmaṁ aṇatîti
'brāhmaṇo', mante sajjhāyatîti attho, Sv I 244,10 =
Ps I 109,23; Ud-a 58,13; 377,29; cf. Ps III 404,18
(brahmaṁ āneti ≠ Pj II 472,21) & Mil Trsl. II
26 n. 1.

m. [ts.], the edge of a weapon, extremity,
limit of field or province; MTD.

m. [ts., cf. aṇu], (a) minuteness, the
nature of an atom; (b) one of the 'powers' (issariya)
of a yogi, viz. the power to make himself as small as
an atom; Mogg IV 63 (+ laghimā, mahimā, cf. ka-
simā; = aṇuttaṁ, aṇutā); Sadd III 1277 (giving
fern.gender). Cf.Yoga-sutra III 45. —°-laghimâdika,
mfn., beginning with the 'powers' of minuteness and
lightness, Pj I 108,29 = Sp I 124,9 (Vjb, Sp-t) =
Vism 211,20 (Ee aṇimālagh°). aṇima
[w. r. for Aṇimaṇḍavya.

mfn. [ts.], 1. small, minute, atomic; fine,
subtle (sometimes wrongly spelt anu), Abh 705; Kacc-v
673 (derivation from √am1 or √am2, Mmd); opp. to
thūla (while sukhuma is opp. to oḷārika): MN I
129,27 (~uṁ vā thūlaṁ vā); Mil 270,26 (do.); Ja IV
203,20* (aṇūni thūlānica); Dhs 617; n'atthi aṇū pi
saññā, 'not the least', Sn 802; aṇum pi saññaṁ, Sn
841 (Pj); aṇuto aṇuṁ, 'by imperceptible degrees', Sn
299 (Pj); nâṇu pi khāyati, AN I 249,20 (= aṇum pi na
khāyati, Mp); mahapphalaṁ hoti aṇum pi tādisu, Ja
III 12,8* (= appamattakam pi, Ct); saṇha-sukhuma-
+ , Mil 181,5 (scil. rajo); nipuṇaṁ gambhīraṁ dudda-
saṁ aṇuṁ, scil. dhammaṁ, 'subtle', Vin I 5,10* = DN
II 36,17* = SN I 136,23*, cf. Mvu III 316,20* codd.
— 2. m. (or n.), (a), a certain measure of length (=36
paramāṇū), Abh 194; Vibh-a 343,18; gen. ~uno,
ib. 24 (chattiṁsa paramāṇavo ekassa ~ pamāṇaṁ);
pl. chattiṁsa aṇū (v. l. aṇūni) ekāya tajjāriyā pa-
māṇaṁ, ib. — (b), an atom (in non-Buddhist philo-
sophy), Pp-a 172,9 (titthiyānaṁ °-pakati-purisâdi-
kassa paññāpanā).

mfn. [ts.] = aṇu; pl. (dvandva) °-thūlā,
Sn 146 = Khp IX, 4 (Pj I 246,8); Ap 532,11; cf.
aṇuṁ-thūla.

f. [ts.] = aṇutta, n. [sa. aṇutva], abstr.
of aṇu = aṇima(n), Mogg-v IV 63.

m., insignificant or mean reli-
gious practice, Sn 313 (eso aṇudhammo [or aṇu
dhammo, ˇ -, - -]; = lāmaka-dhammo, hīna-
dhammo, a-dhammo, Pj).

mfn., with a body of atomic
size, Mil 312,18 (~o sālaka-kimi).

mfn., of the most minute measure,
Ps I 52,25 (Buddhānaṁ ~aṁ pi saṁkhāra-gataṁ
ñāṇena adiṭṭhaṁ . . . n'atthi).

mfn., with very small seeds, SN V 96,7
(mahārukkhā ~ā mahākāyā).
m., splitting into atoms, Ap 21,14.

(mfn., slender-waisteal; f. ~ā,
Ja VI 456,24* (so Cks with spelling anu-°, B. and
Edd. tanumajjhimā; sihin vū madhya-pradeçaya
ættāha, Ja-pot).

mfn. [sa. aṇu-mātra], of a very small
size, minute (often spelt anu-°); Sn 431 (~ena pi
pnññena attho mayhaṁ na vijjati); Dhp 284 (vanatho
. . . ~o pi); ~esu vajjesu bhaya-dassāvī, Vin IV 51,22
(= appamattakesu, Sp II 352,8); DN I 63,14 (Sv do.);
MN I 33,8; 355,3; AN II 14,14; SN V 187,17; It
118,6; cf. Vibh 247,25 (Vibh-a); ~am pi dukkataṁ,
Ja VI 477,10*; ~am pi kalaṅkaṁ, Dhp-a III 53,16;
~am pi ṭhānaṁ, Ps II 434,4.

m. [ts.], an atomist; mṭ ad As
60,33 (pakati-vadi(n)+1. aṇu-vādi

mfn., 'accompanied by a mini-
mum', of which only a minimum is left (w. r. anu°) ;
SN III 130,30 foll. (~o asmîti māno; = sukhumo,
Spk); Kv 81,16 (~o kāmarāgo pahīno, scil. anāgā-
missa); Pj II 150,17 (~e, scil. kilese; opp. oḷārike);
Mp II 374,6 (do.); Ps I 288,31 (~assa, scil. kāmarāga-
paṭighasaṁyojana-dvayassa).
[& Aṇojā, see anoj[ā/a], Anojā.] [aṇoja
√ aṇḍatthe, Dhātum 158; Kacc-v 665 (Mmd).

n. (m., see under b) [sa. ăṇḍa; Kacc-v 665]
(a), an egg, Abh 627; nom. acc. ~ aṁ, Ja III 269,9*;
IV 333,8 (~aṁ pātetvā) foll.; Mil 49,21 (:kalala);
51,6 (kukkuṭiyā aṇḍam aṇdato kukkuṭī, cf. Plutarchus
Quæst. conviv. Ill 3); n. pl. ~āni, Vin III 3,31 (a
simile: kukkutiyā ~) = MN I 104,3 = 357,6 = AN
IV 125,19 = 176,7 = SN III 153,14; also of insects,
Ps II 348,18 (Ck aṇḍakāni); — (b) pl. (m., cf. the ved.
dual āṇḍau) the testicles Abh 273, 1092; acc. pl. ~ e
SN II 258,13 (cf. kumbhaṇḍa and aṇḍabhāri(n) =
Vin III 106,32; instr. ~ eh'i,' MN I 383,1; 5 (cf. aṇḍa-
hāraka). — Ifc. v. kumbha°, camma°, (phala°),
mora , vāta°, cf. aṇḍī, below, and apuccaṇdatā.

n. (ts), (a) an egg; pl. -āni, Ja III
267,24 'foll. (of birds); Dhp-a I 60,4 (of bees), cf. Ps II
348,18 (s. v. aṇḍa a.) -— (b) excrescence, tumor (on
trees), Ps II 447,8 (sadose rukkhe ~āni) = As 396,18
(mṭ : sadosavaṇe rukkhe niyyāsapiṇḍiyo ahicchatta-
kāni vā uṭṭhitāni ~ānī ti vadanti, pheggurukkhassa
pana kuthitassa aṇḍāni viya uṭṭhitā cuṇṇapiṇḍiyo
gaṇṭhiyo vā ~ānī ti veditabbāni). — Ifc. v. vāta°,
sakuṇa°.

mfn., rude, rough, harsh (of speech),
only in the formula: pharusavāco . . . hoti, yā sā vācā
~ā kakkasā parakaṭukā parâbhisajjanī kodhasāmantā
asamādhisaṁvattanikā . . ., MN I 286,36 (opp. to
nela + ib. 288,16; v. l. kandakā, sometimes changed
to gaṇḍakā; Ps) = III 48,11' = AN V 265,1 = 283,23
— 293,13 — Dhs 1343 (~ā asātā kakkasā, etc.; As);
Bu. referring to 1aṇḍaka (b), explains: yathā sadose
rukkhe ~āni uṭṭhahanti, evaṁ sadosatāya khuṁsana-
vambhanâdi-vacanehi ~ā .jātā, scil. vācā, Ps II 447,8
(ad MN I 286,36; Se reads gaṇḍakā) = As 396,17 (ad
Dhs 1343). Cf. aṇḍaka-vāca.

n. [sa. āṇḍa-kapāla], an egg-shell,
Sp I 140,4 (~ ānaṁ tanubhāvo) = Spk ad SN III
153,27 = Mp III 233,1, 254,8.
v. l. for aṇḍa-hāraka, q. v.

[Ps II 247,3, so Ck; CeEe have
addha°, see aḍḍhakkhika.]

mfn. [ts.], 'egg-born', said of oviparous
animals as birds and snakes (fishes); (a) of one of the four
yoniyo (sattā, kulāni): + jalābuja, saṁsedaja, opa-
pātika, MN I 73,3 (~ā yoni); Mil 127,9; 267,16; Ps I
217,20 (°-jalābuja°); II 546,1 (do.); Vibh-a 160,28;
cf. Ap 92,3; — (b) esp. of snakes: SN III 240,18 (~ā
nāgā + jalābujā, etc.; = aṇḍe jātā, Spk); Jail
53,15* (~ena, scil. nāgena, Ct.) = V 85,4*. — m.,
a bird, Abh 624 (vihaṅgama-khagâṇḍajā); 1079 (also
= 'fish': mīna-pakkhisu); nom. ~o, Ja IV 293,2*
(andaj' āyaṁ vihaṅgamo); V 351,23*; acc. ~aṁ, Ja III
520,19*; pl. ~ā, Ja II 383,9*; V 353,1*; VI 539,6*
(citrapekhuṇā); Saddh 275; voc. pl. -ā Ja III 520,29*
(kam aṇḍajaṁ, ~ā mānusesu; v. r. aṇḍaja-mānusesu,
ib. 521,5'); instr. ~ehi, Ja V 189,33* = 190,4* (pok-
kharaṇī sañchannā ~ vītikiṇṇā).

m(fn.), one who bears his testicles
upon his shoulder; SN II 258,27* (in the uddāna: ~ī
ahu gāma-kūtako) = Vin III 100,19* (cf. 106,32 and
above under aṇḍa); Spk II 271,1; Sp (II) 510,6);
— °-vatthu, n., title of Vin III 106,30-35 (Sp). — °-sutta,
n., title of a sutta, SN II 258 ≠ Aṇḍabhāri-vatthu
(Spk II 270,19). aṇḍa-bhāri

mfn., 'being in the egg', i. e. enclosed
all round, without free moving, unfree, kept free from
influence of the outer world, unexperienced; in a phrase
combined with pariyonaddha (entangled, ensnared,
(a) after avijjāgata (ignorant): Vin III 3,38 (avijjā-
gatāya pajāya ~āya pariyonaddhāya avijjaṇḍakosaṁ
padāletvā) = AN IV 176,16 (Sp I 138,23 —. Mp III
253,1); (b) after ātura (feeble, fragile): SN III 1,20 (āturo
h'āyaṁ kayo ~o pariyonaddho; v. l. addhabhūto, cf.
addhagato, ib. 14; Spk II 304,12: aṇḍaṁ viya bhūto
dubbalo); —in a similar sense (a) it is used Ja I 293,24*
(~ā bhatā bhariyā, ɔ: he had kept his wife like an
egg (so that she should remain unexperienced), by Ct.
etymologically explained — bījabhūtā mātukucchito
anikkhantakāle yeva ābhatā ānītā bhatā vā puṭṭhā
vā, whence the adaptation of the prose tale ib. 290,1
foll.). Cf. Hindi aṇde kā sahzāda, an unexperienced
youth, a greenhorn (Platts).

n. = Ja (62) I 289—295.
A scene of this Jātaka is figured on the Bharhut-Stūpa
pl. XXVI,8 (cf. A. Cunningham, the Stūpa of Bharhut,
Lond. 1879 p. 65—67); a painting illustrating the same
Jātaka is mentioned Mhv XCVII 42 (Andhabhūta-°,
cf. the colophon to this Jātaka in Ms. Cv: porāṇa-
potthakesu Aṇḍabhūta-jātakaṁ ti dissati, abhina-
vesu katthaci potthakesu Andhabhūta-iti dissati).

f. [sa. aṇḍa-vṛddhi], swelling of
the testicles, Sp ad Vin I 216,25 (°-roga; = vātan-
ḍaka, Vjb).

m., 'originating from an egg',
a bird, Th 599 (apaṇḍaro ~o); cf. JAs 1912, 216,30.

mfn., one who is going (searching)
for eggs (scil. in the forest); puriso ~o gantvā ubbhatehi
aṇḍehi [prob, a pun on anda (b)] āgaccheyya, MN I
383,25 (Ps III 90,15). Cf.'akkhika-haraka.
m. [ts.], a fish, MTD.

f. (i. q. aṇḍa; cf. the ved. dual āṇḍyau);
only ifc, v. maccha°.
m. [ts.], a man, MTD.

n., a roll (of cloth, hairs or the like),
Ps ad MN I 150,17 (aṇḍukaṁ = cumbatakaṁ, cf.
Spk αɔZ SN I 117,20. — Ifc. v. cela°, vāla° (v. l. always
°aṇḍůpaka-, cf. aṇḍuva).

n., a particular mode of
dressing the hairs, Ud-a 171,4 (Ee andukā°).

n. = aṇḍuka (or andūpaka), only ifc, v.
jaṭa°.

n., a circular roll of cloth used as a
stand for a vessel, Abh 458. -— Ifc v. tiṇa°.

m. [sa. arṇa(s), m. n.], flood, stream; Abh
661; Mogg IV 99 (explaining annava; = Candra IV
2,113).

n. = anna, food; only ifc, v. apara°,
pubba°.

m. [sa. arṇava] the sea, Abh 659; Mogg
IV 99 (see iaṇṇa); loc. ~e, Ja III 521,12* ( = sara,
Ct, cf. DN II 89,26* below); 522,4*; V 158,22* ( =
mahaṇṇave, Ct.); gen. pl. ~ānaṁ, Nidd II 51,24 (any
great lake or sea, cf. Ud-a 424,18); — often metaph,
for saṁsāra: in parallelism with ogha: Sn 173, 183—84
(= saṁsāraṇṇava, Pj) ≠ SN I 214,25-27* (quoted
Mil 36,16*); asyndetically with (acc.) saraṁ [cf. samu-
dram arṇavaṁ, etc., RV I 19,7; III 53,9]: Vin I
230,23* - DN II 89,26* = Ud 90,14* (opp. pallalāni;
aṇṇava = (saṁsāra)samudda, sara = (taṇhā)saritā,
Sp Sv Ud-a); atarī [read atari] ~aṁ, Ja III 453,10*
(= saṁsārasamuddaṁ, Ct.) ≠ Mvu III 195,5*. -
— Ifc v. udaka° (odaka°), khīra°, pāraṇṇave,
bhava°, maha°, vyasana°.

f., the interior or depths of the
ocean; ~i viya (scil. °nivesanaṁ ekasaddaṁ ahosi),
Ja VI 189,16; ~iṁ obhāsayamāno bālasuriyo viya,
Ja I 119,25; ~iṁ khobhetvā bālasuriyuggamanakālo
viya, Ja I 501,31; ~iyaṁ pavattantā vicaranti, Ja I
227,8.

m. [sa. arno-bhava], a bomb, shell,
MTD.

√ gamane, Dhātum 177; sātacca-gamane,
Sadd II 392 [sa-Dhātup 3,1].

mfn. [a + takka, sa. takra], without
buttermilk (not acidified), Ja VI 21,16 (aloṇaka+).

mfn., dubious reading Ud-a 52,27
(sabbaṁ ~aṁ passitvā jigucchanto, scil. huhuṁkajā-
tiko brāhmaṇo), the v. l. acokkha-jātikaṁ (also in

note 7) suggests the meaning: unclean (as to caste or
manners); if not a blunder for a-taj-jātika, cf. Cana-
rese takka, 'ftt, proper' ≠ cokka, 'purity, clean-
ness' (?).

m. [a + takka (sa. tarka) +
gāha (sa. grāha)], grasping or choosing without reason-
ing, Ja I 105,19' (+ takka-gāha).

mfn. [sa. atarkâvacara], in-
accessible to (discursive) thought (takka, opp. ñāṇa);
