mostly (preceded by santa paṇīta) in the formula
gambhīra + : Vin I 4,35 (dhammo, cf. Mvu III 314,2)
= DN II 36,3 = 37,24 (dhammo, = takkena ava-
caritabbo ogāhitabbo na hoti, ñāṇen' eva avacari-
tabbo, Sv; cf. Nidd-a II 316,19) = mn I 167,32 (Ps)
= SN I 136,10 (Spk) ≠ MN I 487,7 ≠ II 172,31; AN
II 189,15 (atthapadaṁ; = takkena nayaggāhena
gahetuṁ na sakkā hoti, Mp); DN I 12,20 (dhammā;
— uttama-ñāṇavisayattā na takkena avacaritabbā, Sv).

m(fn)., free from sophistry; Mil 248,30
(cf. Trsl II 67 n. 4).

mfn. [sa. a-tathya], untrue, unreal;
DN I 3,16 (abhūtaṁ + ~aṁ) ≠ AN I 202,21 (~aṁ
+ abhūtaṁ); DN III 134,14 (abhūtaṁ ~aṁ anattha-
saṁhitaṁ); MN I 395,9 (do., scil. vacaṁ); Ja I 270,3'
(abhūtā ~ā, scil. kathā); Sv I 72,19 = As 99,1
('musa'ti abhūtaṁ ~aṁ vatthu) = Ps I 200,5 ≠
Vv-a 72,21; Ja VI 207,21* (hassaṁ anijjhānakhamaṁ
~aṁ). Cf. atatha.

[m. [ts.], a mountain precipice, MTD (see
chinna-taṭa).]

mfn., devoid of rice(-grain), Cp III 2,4
(thusarāsiṁ va ~aṁ).

pr. 3 sg. (√at), to go, Sadd II 392 (ex-
plaining atta(n)).

mfn. [cf. sa. a-tathā] — ataccha; DN II
64,14 foll. (~aṁ santaṁ); MN II 256,14 = 258,2 (~aṁ
samānaṁ, acc abs., cf. Tr. Notes p. 67 n. 28; Ed.
atthaṁ); Sv I 72,20-31 = Ps I 200,6-16 = As 99,3-13
(~aṁ vatthu).

mfn. [sa. a-tandrita; cf. tandī], un-
wearied, undefatigable, industrious; DN III 107,3 ( =
nittandī kāyâlasiya-virahito, Sv); ahorattam ~, MN
III 187,28* = 190,27* = Ap 506,7 ≠ AN II 40,29*;
rattindivam ~, AN IV 245,4* = Ja III 401,24* ( =
analaso); Th 354 (~o rattidivaṁ); Ja V 121,11* (kā-
luṭṭhāyī ~); Dhp 305 (eko caram ~o; Dbp-a); 366
(suddhajīviṁ ~aṁ; = akusītatāya ~o, Ct.) ≠ 375
(Dhp-a); Th introd. 2; Saddh 46; 100 (āhāratthaṁ
~ā); 336 (dhīra+); 450 (abhinibbāti ~o ghaṭanto);
Vv 332 (atthenâtanditā dāsī, cf. a-tthena); Mil 390,29
(alīnam ~aṁ). —- °-âcāra, mfn., behaving industri-
ously, Vv-a 142,6 (~ā dāsī).

mfn., not conducing to remorse; AN
I 49,35 (dve dhammā ~ā); It 25,17 (do.); AN V
243,2-7 (dhammo, i. e. sammādiṭṭhi +); Dhs (p. 7,10)
1305 (dhammā ~ā, i. e. kusalā dhammā).

m. pl. (~ā), a class of divine beings
[Buddh, sa. Atapa; Mvu II 319, 6-7* read: Bṛhat-
phalā ca Atapa-Sudarçanā ca; a + √tap or √trp?];
DN II 52,18 (Trsl. II 41 = 'Cool gods'; Sv: na kañci
sattaṁ tapentîti ~ā (tapanti, Se and pt Bc) =
Vibh-a 521,10, Ee tappenti, v. l. tappanti)'; MN III
103,1; Vibh 425,14-28; Kv 207,21; Pj I 182,26 (°-Su-
dassa-Sudassīsu). — n. (or m. scil. loka or kāya),
the world of those gods, Pp 17,21 (Avihā cuto ~aṁ
gacchati, ~ā cuto Sudassaṁ gacchati).

mfn. [cf. sa. tarpanīya], insatiable,
Ja VI 209,14'. Cf. Ja III 342,18 (v. l.'; Ee atappiya°).

mfn. = atappanīya, Ap 548,10
(°-rūpena, scil. samanvitā).

mfn. [a + present stem of √tṛp, cf.
duppamuñca, suvānaya, dunnivāraya, dussamuṭṭhā-
paya, see Wackernagel Ai. Gr. II, 1 § 76 b], not to
be satiated or satisfied; Mp ad AN I 87,9 ('duttap-
payā' ti ~ā tappetuṁ na sukarā; so Ce, Se duttap-
payā). Cf. next.

mfn. (a) = prec; Ja III 342,18
(°-vatthūni, v. l. B. atappaṇīya-°). — (b) = atappaka,
Bv VII 26 (dassanena ~o = a-titti-karo a-titti-janano,
Bv-a).

mfn. [cf. sa. tan-maya], not absorbed
in things, free from desire; AN I 150,8* (sabbesu
dhammesu ~o muni; = sabbesu tebhūmika-dham-
mesu taṇhā-saṁkhātāya tammayatāya abhāvena ~o
khīṇāsava-muni, Mp; cf. Sn 846); III 444,8 (sabbaloke
~o bhavissāmi; = tammayā vuccanti taṇhādiṭṭhiyo,
tāhi rahito, Mp). — °-tā, f. abstr., MN III 42,27 ( =
nittaṇhatā, Ps); 220,33 (quoted Ps II 153,7 & Vism
671,9; = vuṭṭhānagāminī vipassanā, Ps); Nidd I
21,24 (so Nidd-a quoting AN I 150,8*; Ee akammañña°);
189,14 (= nittaṇhabhāvo, Nidd-a); °-âpajjana, n.,
entering into atammayatā, Pj II 545,34 (see ib. 547,26).

m., Npr. of a
village, Mhv LXXV 97 (v. l. Arandāma-Mahā°, Ce).

neg. part: of 2tarati [√tvar], walking
slowly; DN I 89,30 (= ataranto v. l. aturito, Sv) =
MN II 119,25 = AN V 65,19 (= aturito, Mp) = Vin
I 248,1; Vin II 208,3 (~ena ārāmo pavisitabbo); Ja I
136,19* (~ānaṁ; aturitvā avegāyitvā . . . kammaṁ
karontānaṁ, Ct.) = VI 16,14*.
aor., see Harati.
n. [ts.], name of a hell below the earth, MTD.

mfn., bottomless, Abh 669
(agādhaṁ ~aṁ; cf. agādham atalasparçe, Am-k I
10,15; Abhsūci: na heṭṭhima-talaṁ phusati yatra
taṁ ~aṁ).
m. [ts.], the wind, body, a weapon, MTD.
see a-ttasitāya.

f. [ts.], common flax, Linum Usitatissimum,
Abh 452 (ummā + ; cf. Nidd-a ad Nidd I 355,2, read
atasī- for dakasītala- Ce Se?). — °-puppha-vaṇṇa,
mfn., having the colour of the flowers of that plant, Ps
III 486,3.
see attāṇa; atāyanatā, see attāyanatā.
atāresi, aor., see Harati & tāreti.

ind. [ts.], prefix to nouns (subst., adj., adv.)
or prp. to verbs, before vowels generally taking the form
acc-, e. g. acc-uṇha, acc-odāta, sometimes with lengthe-
ning of the foll. vowel, e. g. accāhita = ati-ahita, but
also ati (or at'), e. g. ati-ambila, ati-iṭṭha, ati-ucca &
at'-ucca. —- 1. (a) prefixed to a subst, implying 'abun-
dance, excess, superiority, transgression, above'; — (b)
to an adj. or adv. = too (much), very much, quite.
— 2. to verbs and their derivates = too much, very much;
over, through; by, away (far away); beyond, too far;
also 'into' (e. g. ati-neti, ati-harati). — 3. as govern-
ing prp. v. ati-diṭṭhiyā (cf. adhi-° & abhi-°). -
— 4. sometimes inserted (like adhi) in an iterative comp.,
implying 'cumulation', v. cakkâticakka, chattâtic-
chatta, balâtibala, mañcâtimañca, mānâtimāna
cf. Sakkānaṁ ati-Sakko, devānaṁ atidevo etc. (but
differently devâtideva, q. v.). —- Cf. ativiya (atīva),
by which it is generally rendered in Ctt. — Sometimes
alternating with or corresponding to adhi- (see ati-
deva), or abhi- (see atikkanta, cf. atijāta). — Com-
bined with an other prp., see upâti-°, pâti-°, vîti-°.
— The sense of ati ts given Abh 1138 (= atisaye); 1182
(antobhāva-bhusatthâtisaya-pūjāsu atikkame || bhū-
tabhāve pasaṁsāyaṁ daḷhatthâdo siyā 'ati'); Būp
87,8 ('ati'ti atikkamana, atikkanta, atisaya, bhusattha,
etc., see these words); Ud-a 224,29 (atī ti accantatthe
nipāto); cf. Sadd III Ce 774,17.

f., extreme supremacy, Mil 278,18
(Buddho ~āya anupamo).

m. [cf. sa. atyagni], too hot a fire, Mil
277,29 (~inā odanaṁ uttarati).

(mf)n., very wonderful, Ja I
279,30.

pr. 3 sg. [ati + √añj), to charge too
much, demand too high a price; inf. ~ituṁ, Mp I 244,8
(= ativiya ākaḍḍhituṁ, Mp-ṭ; cf. sinh añdina-;
v. l. ativaḍḍhituṁ as in Th-a (Ce) 136,12).

mfn. [sa. atyamla], too sour; Dhp-a
II 85,17 (accuṇha-° +).

m., one who is superior to an Arhat;
Mil 277,13 (arahantānaṁ ~ā bhaveyya). ati-araha
n. = accāsana (q. v.) Ja I 185,7'.

mfn., = accāhita (q. v.); Ja V 147,9';
VI 307,1'.
mfn., = accāyata (q. v.); Mp III 153,4.

mfn., very much desired; Sp I 170,28

atisundaraṁ).

n., a very expensive medi-
cine (only for very rich people, Tr.), Ja V 441,22. Cf.

mfn. = accuggata (q. v.); Ja I
432,14'; VI 133,24'.

ind. [ati + ucca], too high; ~aṁ
gacchasi, Ja III 255,24' (= 'atuccaṁ'); Pj I 172,17
(nâtiucca-nīcaṁ); 176,2 (nâtiuccaṁ nâtinīcaṁ).

mfn. = accuṇha (q. v.); Th 231 =
DN III 185,11* ≠ 184,4; Ja I 87,5*; VI 3,6.

mfn., by far the best, most excellent;
Vv-a 80,27 (= 'anadhivara').

n., too much water, Dhp-a I 52,18.
Cf. accodaka.
n. = accodara (q. v ); Ja IV 279,24'.

pr. 3 sg. (ati + ud-√hṛ or √dhṛ),
to lift too high; Ud-a 414,17* (nâtiuddharati pādaṁ,
cf. MN II 137,14),

ind., too much above; Sv I 252,26
(dvāraṁ kira ~ amanussā . . . koṭṭenti). Cf. ati-
heṭṭhā.

ind. (ati + ussūra, toe), too early
in the morning, Vv-a 65,10.

pr. 3 sg. [cf. sa. ati + √kṛṣ], to
have objection to, to take in bad part; pot. 2 sg. sace

pemaṁ patiṭṭhitaṁ, taṁ kodhavasena na ~eyyāsi);
Mp-ṭ ad Mp I 244,8 (see ati-añjati).

mfn. [sa. ati-kṛṣṇa], too dark, Vin IV
7,9-11' (opp. accodāta).

mfn. [sa. ati-kṛta], too much done in
return, AN I 62,15 (kataṁ . . . paṭikataṁ +).
f. [ts.], meaningless words(1), MTD.

mfn. [sa. ati + kānta], very beautiful;
Sp I 170,28 (see atikkanta below).
see ati-kāra.

mfn., very pitiful, Ja I 202,29 (~o
ravo); — °am, ind., very pitifully, Ja VI 53,10 (pari-

cry, Ja IV 142,5 (~aṁ muñciṁsu).

(pr. 3 sg. [sa. ati + √kṛṣ], only abs.

mfn. [ts.], of extraordinary body, Ja V
267,5* (~o, scil. Ajjuno; = bala-sampanna-mahā-
kāyo, Ct.); 269,5* (kimayo ~ā; Ct. ib. 274,22')-

m., doing to much, Ja I 431,1* (paron.:
~am akarâcariya [ ˇ ˇ - ˇ ˇ ˇ - - ˇ] = atireka-

m., very early time, too early a time;
adv. (acc.) instr, gen. (as ciraṁ cirena cirassa): instr,

kkamati, Vin I 70,4; MN I 469,26-28 (with diva for

mfn., too dark; f. ~ī, DN II 175,24

pr. 3 sg. [sa. ati + √klam], to be
over-exerted); 1 sg. ~āmi, Ja IV 284,19' (= 'nitam-

mfn. (ati + pp. of √klid), too much
boiled, said of odana, bhatta, and opp. to uttandula

mfn. (ati + pp. of √krudh), very

mfn., very clever or skilful, given as

m., excessive anger, given as ex. of the
sense 'bhusaṁ' of prp. ati, Rūp 87,9; Sadd III 774,20

mfn. (pp. of atikkamati; often
ˇ ˇ - ˇ, see cpd.s below), 1 (a) intrans.: passed

420,13 (= 'abhikkantā'); arrivedÇl), Th 1037—38

(bhayaṁ); — (c) pass.: overcome, Th 707 (~ā bhayā

plaining 'abhikkanta': Sp I 170,28 = Sv I 228,15

130,1; cf. Vv-a 53,3]. — Ifc. P. an-°, kālâ°, pa-
māṇâ°, māsâ°, yāmâ°, rattâ°, lokâ°, velâ°,

mfn., who has passed over
the four floods (cf. caturogha, see DN III 276,19),

mfn., who has missed his profit,

mfn., superhuman; dib-
bena cakkhunā visuddhena ~ena, Vin III 5,1 ( =

mfn., according to Ct.:

ˇ ˇ - ˇ - ˇ - - - ; so Bv-a; Ee abhikkantabhaga-

mfn., who has overcome

mfn., who is above (granting)

mfn., who is aware of the

mfn., of which there is no

mfn. = 'accanta-sīla' (q. v.),

m. [sa. atikrama], transgressing,
transgression, surpassing, overcoming, Abh 776; 1182

aṅgâ°, (aṭṭha)lokadhammâ°, an-°, apagamâ°,
ākāsâ°, ārammaṇâ°, upacārâ°, kālâ°, dur-°,
majjhaṇhâ°, rūpanimittâ°, vassānâ°, viññāṇâ°,
himapātâ°.

[Pv-a 159,2, read atikkamma
caraṇato.]

pr. 3 sg. [sa. atikrāmati, atikramate],
1. intrans. (a) to pass away, elapse (pañca vassasahas-
sāni); (b) to pass (near) by (avidūre); —2. trans, (c) to
pass, cross, transgress (maggaṁ, sīmaṁ; āṇaṁ, vacanaṁ,
sikkhāpadaṁ); (d) to transgress against, or to be unfaithful
to (bhariyaṁ); (e) to transgress, or to commit adultery
with (parassa dārāni; cf. aticarati); (f) to surpass
(devānaṁ devânubhāvaṁ); (g) to overcome, to escape
from (saññojanāni, bhavaṁ): — pr. 3 sg. ~ati, Pv-a
67,18 (dvārasamīpena maggena, b); Ja III 243,26'(<f);
3 pl. ~anti, Sn p. 48,2 (avidūre, b); Ja IV 53,21*
(amhe, d); VI 115,6* (parassa dārāni, e); AN IV
201.12 (sikkhāpadaṁ, c); 1 pl. ~āma, Ja IV 53,20*
(d); — pot. 3 sg. ~eyya, Sn 396 (e); Dhp 221 (sañño-
janaṁ sabbaṁ, g); [Mil 265,4 see atikkameti, caus.];
— aor. 3 pl. ~iṁsu, DN II 130,14 (nissāya nissāya ~,
b; for story cf. Mahābhāṣya II 120,20); ~amuṁ, Ap
68,18 (tiṁsa vassasahassāni, a; quoted Th-a (Ce) 21,18*
ad Th 1); — part. ~manta, DN II 130,19 (b); Ja IV
141.13 (c); Mil 227,15 (āṇaṁ, c); an-atikkamantā,
Ud-a 346,31 (g); — inf. ~ituṁ, Ja I 437,13 (tassā
vacanaṁ, c); — abs. (α) atikkamma, Sn 361 ( ˇ ˇ - ˇ ;
bhavaṁ, g); It 51,11* (metre corrupt, read ati[k]kamma
< so > māradheyyaṁ(?), g); MN III 120,12 ≠ DN
II 12,10 (devānaṁ devânubhāvaṁ, f); Ja I 147,30
(maggaṁ, c); VI 592,25 (do.); = after, besides, Rūp
87,8 (giving the sense of ati-); Ja I 262,19; MN I
200,17; III 195,1 ≠ AN V 226,20; — Ja III 472,12*
( ˇ ˇ - ˇ ;g); Kv-a 35,5* (paññattiṁ an-atikkamma
(b); — (β)~itvā, Ja I 137,3' (f); 263,22 (sīmaṁ, c); IV
139,25 (c); Pp 17,2 (c); Mil 336,27 (f; + atisayitvā
ajjhottharitvā); Dhp-a I 96,7 (pabbajita-divasato
addhamāsaṁ ~, a fortnight after his pabbajjā); Pv-a
15,14 (+ laṁghitvā, d); 168,19 (c); an-atikkamitvā,
Ja I 348,11 (kālaṁ, without coming too late, at time);
IV 246,3 (Bhadda-nakkhattaṁ ~; better v. l. °kka-
metvā, caus.); — grd. (a ) ~amitabba, SN I 29,2 (d;
viheṭhetabbaṁ ghaṭṭetabbaṁ, Spk); (β) ~amanīya
(q. v.); — pp. atikkanta; caus. atikkameti & atik(k)a-
māpeti (q. v.).

n. [sa. atikramaṇa], overstepping,
transgressing, overcoming; Abhidh-av 983 (tassâtikka-
manatthāya); Rūp 87,8 (= prp. ati-, e.g. atirocati
amhehi [Pv 316], atīto). — Ifc. v. an-°, sīmâ°.

mfn. (from prec), overstepping,
Ja I 153,9 (paṇṇa-sañnaṁ °-migo).

n., thinking on transgression,
Saddh 64.

mfn. (grd. of atikkamati), only
ifc. an-°, dur-° (q. v.).

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of prec), to cause
to let pass; abs. ~etvā, Ja VI 5,3 (pakativelaṁ, after
the proper time).

(or atikkameti, q. v.), pr. 3 sg. (caus.
of atikkamati), to cause to pass, to let pass; imper.
~ehi, Ja I 151,5 (mayhaṁ vāraṁ); —- pot. ~eyya,
Mil 265,4 (divasaṁ); Spk I 138,2 (= 'atipāteyya');
— fut. ~essāmi, Ja I 151,10; — inf. ~etuṁ, Mil
265,1 (na so divaso sakkā ~); — abs. ~etvā, Ja IV
247,6 (ajja; if you miss this day); an-°, Ja I 162,29
(vutta-velaṁ, without missing); Ja IV 246,3 (v. l.)
Cf. next.

m., (gradual) loss or destruction,
Cp III 10,4 (cf. Ja I 329,30; 331,16).

ind., too soon; ~aṁ Sugato
parinibbāyissati, DN II 140,1 = 148,7 ; ~aṁ Bhagavā
parinibbuto, DN II 157,22 = 158,17, 22 = 159,11 =
162,21 = Vin II 284,16. ati-khippam

pr. 3 sg. [ati + √khan], to dig too
deep; pot. ~aṇe, Ja II 296,15* (nâ°); pp. atikhāta,
q. v.

n. (from prec), digging too deep,
Ja II 296,20' (read atikhaṇanena for atikhaṇena; =
'atikhātena').

mfn. [ts.], too sharp; Ud-a401,25 (scil.
ābādho, cf. ib. 401,6) = Sv ad DN II 128,10*; Ja II
249,6 (~aṁ katvā vādemi, said of too sharp tuning
of a lute).

n. (pp. of atikhaṇati), digging too
deep; ~aṁ hi pāpakaṁ . . . ~ena nāsitaṁ (scil.
dhanaṁ), Ja II 296,15*-l6* (= atikhaṇana, Ct.). (Cf,
ati-dhanta).
mfn., blunt, Abh 1067 (= 'mudu').

mfn. [ati + √kṣi(?), cf. khepeti], the
sense is not quite clear, perhaps 'destroyed, consumed,
i. e. quite worn out or slackened'; only Dhp I 56
(cāpâtikhīṇā; Dhp-a III 132,24: cāpāto ~ā, cāpā
vinimmuttā sarā, 'arrows shot from the bow'(!) cf. Sadd
II 1236).

mfn., too short or very small,
Vin IV 171,6 (~aṁ nisīdanaṁ). Cf. ati-khuṭaka =
'atimaṭāhaka', Sp ad Vin II 138,10 (see Vin II 319,34;
Sp Ce omits this passage).

mfn. [ts.], who has passed beyond, over-
come, escaped from; only ifc. v. 4asitâ°, oghâ°, catu-
yogâ°, pañca-saṅgâ°, yoga°, saṅgâ°, sabba-
saṁyojanâ°, sīmâ°.

[pr. 3 sg. [ati + √gaṁ or √gā], (a)
to overcome, to conquer; no forms of the present tense
are found, see acceti; aor. 3 sg. accagamā, Sn 8 (imaṁ
papañcaṁ; = atikkanto samatikkanto, Pj); frequently
in the phrase accayo maṁ [no] ~, Vin I 315,10; II
192,13; DN I 85,16 (Sv = maṁ atikkamma atibha-
vitvā pavatto); MN III 246,33, etc., see accaya (2);
— accagā, Sn 1040 √sibbaniṁ; Nidd II 10,15); Sn
638 = Dhp 414 (mohaṁ); 3 pl. accaguṁ, It 93,14*
(asesaṁ dukkhaṁ) = 95,4*; accagū, Th 663 (sibba-
niṁ; Ed. ajjhagū; — atikkamiṁsu, Ct.); — (b) to
pass away, to die, aor. 3 sg., Mhv XL I 3 (navame
hāyane 'tigā); — pp. v. next.

mfn. (pp. of atigacchati), who has
passed beyond or away, who has overcome; [Ja III
484.2 9* (nasakkh'atigato poso punar-eva nivattituṁ;
ib. 485,25' v. l. Cks atihaṭo)]. — Ifc. v. (sabba-)saṅgâ°
n. abstr. of prec, Dhp-a IV 159,15.

mfn. [ts.], strong smelling; m. lemon
grass, champak, brimstone; MTD.

mfn., highly reverend, venerable; gen. m.
~uno, Ps III 324,18 (Sammāsambuddhassa). — °-ga-
ruka, mfn. id., Ps II 104,1.
aor. of ati-gacchati (b) q. v.

mfn., who passes beyond or con-
quers; ifc. v. yogâ°. ati-gami

(also written °gāḷayati), pr. 3 sg.
[ts., caus. of ati + gal], to cause to perish (drop by
drop); 3 pl. ~anti (vittaṁ), Ja VI 211,28*; 215,15'
(= vināsenti, viddhaṁsenti; cf. atigāḷhita below).

mfn. [sa. ati + gāḍha, pp. of √gāh],
very tight or close, intensive, Ja I 62,7 (kappanā ~ā);
Pp-a 215,24 (~ena, = 'āgālhena', Pp 32,34 = AN I
283.3 2).

mfn. (pp. denom, from prec), hard
oppressed; m. pl. ~ā, Ja V 401,14* (= paccatthikehi
atipīḷitā vilutta-sāpateyyā viddhasta-vāhanā hutvā
[cf. viddhaṁsenti = 'atigālayanti' above]).

mf. (~ikā), a great benefactor,
whose benefits (kāra, [√kṛ], cf. bahu-kāra) are not
calculable, Ja V 329,14 (mātā nāma ~ikā; but cf.
dukkara-kārikā, ib. 329,26-3 0).

f. (abstr. of ati + guṇa), extra-
ordinary virtue, Mil 278,9.

pr. 3 sg. (ati + √ghṛṣ), to rub out;
abs. ~itvā, Paṭis II 196,8 (Buddhañāṇaṁ deva-
mannssānaṁ paññaṁ pharitvā ~ tiṭṭhati, v. l. atikka-
mitvā).

mfn., very terrible, Saddh 285 (aniṭṭha-
nimittāni ~āni).
v. cakkâticakka.

mfn. [ts.] very violent, ~o, Dhp-a IV
14,2; ~aṁ, ind., Ja VI 34,17 (gantvā).

n. [ts.], transgression (esp. adultery);
Ps III 427,8-12;
entry.re:
— °-bhāvaati-caraṇa-bhāva, m. id. (abstr.), Dhp-a III
349,10 (itthiyā ~o).

entry.sense:
pr. 3 sg. [ati + √car], Utt. to go beyond
the bounds (to graze too much): ~antaṁ goṇaṁ tuṇḍe
paharati (proverbially), Ja IV 300,17 (Ja-pot: sæpa-sē
kannāvū); most frequently = to transgress, to commit
adultery (with: saddhiṁ or acc pers.; also with acc
of the person cuckolded); 3 sg. °rañño mahesiyā
saddhiṁ ~ati, Ja III 303,17; itthiratanaṁ rājānaṁ
manasā pi no ~ati, kuto pana kāyena, MN III 175,12
≠ DN II 176,3; [Pv-a 57,24 read: kuñjesu vā ra-
mati caratī<ti> kuñjaro]; 2 sg. ~āsi maṁ (sub-
junctive; v.r. ~asi; Pv-a), Pv 353; 1 sg. nâhaṁ
taṁ ~āmi, ib. 354; 3 pl. ~anti sāmikaṁ, Ja V
453,1*; part. ~amāna, Pv 353 (loc. f. ~āya); pot. kaṁ
vā itthī nâticare tadaññaṁ, Ja V 444,6*; aor. 3 sg.
~cari, Ja III 417,11 (Parantapena saddhiṁ); aticāri,
DN II 176,3; inf. ~ituṁ āraddhā, Ja I 496,3; abs.
~itvā, Dhp-a I 327,4 (parassa dare); Ja I 463,5; pp.
aticiṇṇa (q. v.).

mf. (nomen agentis or fut. II of
prec), one who transgresses, or who commits adultery
(after a verb of the sense 'to remember'); AN II 61,25
(after nâbhijānāmi [see abhijānāti] with acc. pers.;
v. l. aticaritvā); AN IV 66,11 (do., Ed. aticarittā, v. l.
aticārittaṁ, aticarituṁ, aticaritvā). ati-carita
f., transgression, adultery; ifc. v. an-°.

m. [ts.] — prec; Vv 132 (= aticca
cāro, Ct); Dhp-a III 348,16 (tassā ~ena lajjito); 350,1'
(= 'duccaritaṁ').

mfn. (pp. of ati-carati), transgressed,
against whom is offended, Ja V 265,2* (~o mayā
dhammo; = mayā sucarita-dhammo atikkanto, Ct.).

mfn., very splendid or brilliant, Mil
28,10-2 6 (~āni pañha-paṭibhānāni).

ind. [ts.], too long a time, Vin II
182,12-23; Ja V 18,25'; Sv I 113,6 ( = 'ativelaṁ').

m., dwelling (inhabiting,
staying) too long, or very long time, MN I 329,4 (aticira-
nivāsena sā sati muṭṭhā); Ja IV 217,18* = V 233,24*
(aticiraṁ-nivāsena piyo bhavati appiyo); cf. ati-
nivāsa. aticira-nivāsa

pr. 3 sg. (denom, from aticiraṁ), to
be too late, or very late, Ja II 444,2'; IV 459,1; VI 124,2;
part. ~anta, Dhp-a I 359,21; abs. ~itvā, Ja V 438,27
(tvaṁ ~ āgatā).

ind. (abs. of acceti), 1. having passed
beyond or through, having overcome, surmounting (acc),
Sn 519 (saṁsāraṁ; Pj); 527 (saṅgaṁ jālaṁ; = atikka-
mitvā, Pj); 529 (sabbaṁ vedaṁ; Pj); 531 (niraya-
du[k]khaṁ); 373 (kappātīto, aticca suddhipañño;
cf. the paronomastical schema . . . upasaṁkami,
upasamkamitvā . . . nisīdi, nisinno . . ., Vin III
1,23; 2,1 [Oldenberg, Gesch. d. Altind. Prosa, p.
49—52 = Gött. Abh. XVI. 1916—17]); Ud 71,11* (taṁ
saṅgaṁ); Ja V 396,22* (sabbāni bhūtāni). —2.beyond,
more (than) (cf. atikkamma), Sn 804 (~ jīvati, scil.
vassasataṁ; opp. oraṁ vassasatā); Vibh-a 493,17 ( =
prp. ati- in 'accāsarā' ɔ: ~ āsaranti etāya).
— 3. (used in the sense of aticarati, q. v.) having cuck-
olded (acc), Ja V 424,22* (ete patī pañca-m-aticca);
Vv-a 72,28 (~ cāro = 'ati-cāro).

(pr. 3 sg. [Amg. aīcchaī (with full
flexion), from sa. ati + √i, after the analogy of
ati-gacchati (atîta = ati-gata); Tr. (cf. Sp-ṭ below)
refers to ati-√iṣ (eṣati) confounded with ati-√iṣ
(icchati); PED ati + ṛcchati] to pass on, only used
in imper. 2 pl. aticchatha (bhante)! a phrase by
which a mendicant is refused alms in a civil way (the
inverse phrase is tiṭṭhatha bhante, Ja V 212,15):
Ja III 462,12; VI 70,26; Dhp-a I 401,6; 402,6; IV
98,25-26 (Ed. aticcha); Ps III 71,13; Mp I 412,20;
II 137,3; Vv-a 101,1; Mil 9,13 ≠ Sp I 37,12-26 (cf.
Mhv V 132: gacchā ti); Ss 105,21; Vism 343,27; Sp-ṭ
ad Sp I 37,12: aticchathā ti atikkamitvā icchatha,
idha bhikkhā na labbhati, ito aññattha gantvā
bhikkhaṁ pariyesathā ti adhippāyo. Cf. Tr. notes
p. 65 & Oldenberg in Kuhn's Zeitschr. XXV (1881).

f. (absír. of ati + icchā), desiring too
much, greediness, Vibh 350,36 (= attano lābhaṁ
aticca icchanabhāvo ~ā, . . . atricchatā ti pi etissā
eva nāmaṁ, Vibh-a 470,13).

n., a pre-eminent umbrella, As 2,19
(= atireka-ppamāṇaṁ visesa-vaṇṇa-saṇṭhānaṁ ca
chattaṁ). — Ifc. v. chattâ°. — m. [sa. Lexicogr.
aticchattra ɔ: ahicchattra], a mushroom; f. ~ā, the
anise plant; MTD.

f. (ati + icchā), avidity, Kacc-v 640
(from √is), cf. atricchā.

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of aticchati), to ask
to pass on; imp. 2 sg. ~ehi, Ja III 462,11.

mfn., too hungry, DN III 184,6 (opp.
ati-dhāta).

mfn., too clever, to keen; Vism 136,11,
19, 30; very skilled (in, loc), Sās 30,27.

f., a class of metres, Vutt 87—88
(pahāsinī [sa. praharṣiṇī] and rucirā).

f. abstr. (from ati + jāti), the being
of powerful nature, Mil 278,6 (v. l. ati-jaññatā, f. =
the being very wholesome; cf. a-jañña).

[pr. 3 sg, Ap 179,16 (= Thi-a (Ce)
214,33* ad Th 107), w. r.; read dhūpāti jalate
tathā.]

mfn., very quick; Vv-a 253,6 (~aṁ
sīghagāmiṁ, = 'mahājavaṁ').

mfn. [= sa. abhijāta], 'more advanced'
(said of a son who excels his parents), opp. anujāta,
avajāta (q. v.): It 63,1 foll. (tayo 'me puttā . . . ~o
anujāto avajāto); Ja IV 321,27' (= 'abhijāta', noble,
ib. 24*); VI 380,24' (anuppannaṁ yasaṁ uppādento
atijāto nāma).

mfn., of noble nature; f. abstr. °-tā,
Mil 278,15 (sīho ~tāya vigatabhayo).
mfn., very hungry, Ja VI 258,11'.

f. abstr. (from ati + joti), exceeding
heat, Mil 278,1 (aggi ~āya ḍahati).

mfn. (a + tiṇṇa, pp. of tarati), who has
not yet crossed, Ja III 230,20* (= paratīraṁ atiṇṇaṁ,
Ct.). Cf. a-pāra, mfn.
entry.re:
— °-pubbaa-tiṇṇa-pubba, mfn., which has
not before been crossed; oghaṁ ~aṁ, Sn 273 (Pj) =
SN I 208,4* (Spk); ≠ Ud 74,18* (Ud-a).

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. ati-tṛṣṇa], very covetous,
Abh 729 (= 'lolupa').

pr. 3 sg. [sa. ati + √tṝ], to pass over,
cross; to overcome; 3 pl. ~anti (taṁ paññāya; = atik-
kamanti, Pj); aor. (a ) accatari, Sn 948 (kāme); (b)
accatāri, SN IV 157,23* (samuddaṁ . . . duttaraṁ;
Ed. & Mss. accatari; cf. atari, ib. 157,8) = It 57,21*;
abs. atitariya, Sn 219 (Pj: 'atitiriya' atitaritvā
atikkamitvā).

mf(~ī)n., very young or juvenile, ~o,
Ps I 153,2 ;f. ~iṁ, Ja IV 35,8'; pl. ~ā, Dhp-a 1168,18.
m., too much heat, Mil 277,25.

mfn. [ati + tikkha = tikhiṇa, sa.
ati-tīkṣṇa], too sharp; too severe, very efficient, Ja
IV 192,16*; 193,12'; Ps II 305,4 (opp. ati-manda).
— °-bhāva, m., abstr., Ud-a 310,4.

mfn. [sa. ati-tīkṣṇa], too sharp, very
sharp, Mp III 180,8 (nâtitikhiṇena asinā); — f. abstr.,
°-tā, Mil 278,10 (vajiraṁ ~āya vijjhati).

mfn. [cf. sa. tikta], very bitter, Nidd
II 129,16 (= atikkanta-tittakaṁ, Nidd-a Ce; Se ati-
tittikan ti atikkantaṁ tittikaṁ).
abs. v. atitarati.

mfn., quite empty, Saddh 430 (~e
dese).

mfn. (pp. of ati-tussati), exceedingly
pleased, Ja VI 464,28 (°-pahaṭṭho).

/., extreme joy, Ja I 207,14 (~iyā
hirottappaṁ bhinditvā; v. l. atuṭṭhiyā).

mfn., hastening too much, Ja VI
342,17 (f. ~ā).

mfn. (from ati + tulā), incomparable,
Sn 561 = Th 831 (= tulaṁ atīto, upamaṁ atīto,
nirupamo, Pj; Ps III 372,8); Sn 563 = Th 833.

pr. 3 sg. [ati + √tuṣ], to be very
pleased or satisfied, Pj II 496,5 (v. l.; Ed. atīva tussati,
explaining attānaṁ abhitosayaṁ); pp. ati-tuṭṭha, q.v.

mfn. [sa. a-tṛpta], unsatisfied; ~o kālaṁ-
kato, Thī 486 [unmetrical; read kāmâtitto kālakato (?),
cf. Thī-a 278 n. 2]; ~ā va maranti narā, Thī 487; ūno
loko ~o taṇhā-dāso, MN II 68,29, quoted Paṭis I
127,2 = Ud-k 142,18; (a) with loc: Dhp 48 (kāmesu);
Ja III 275,22 (do.); — (b) with gen.: AN I 78,1 (dvin-
naṁ dhammānaṁ ~o appaṭivāno); 279,18, 29*, (dassa-
nāya, ib. 20);— (c) with instr.: AN II 132,23-31 (bhāsi-
tena pi sā attamanā hoti, atittā va . . . hoti); Ja III
520,6 (tenâ°); 520,17 (tehi ~o); IV 70,3 (cīvarâdīhi);
V 354,15 (dhamma-savanena); Dhp-a IV 118,3 (°das-
sanena ~o).

mfn., unsatisfied, Ja IV 172,18*;
173,24' (tena ~o).

f. [sa. atṛpti], insatiability, Ud-a 157,16.
—- °-kara, mfn. (a + tittikara), of which one cannot
be satisfied, Ja III 376,25. —- °-karaṇa, n., non-
satisfying, Ps III 383,6 (divasaṁ pi pàssantānaṁ
~ato dassana-yogo, = 'dassanīyo'); Ud-a.172,12.
— °-janaka, = a-tittikara; passantānaṁ ~, Pj II 453,3;
Ps III 369,11.

n. (a + tittha — sa. tīrtha), the wrong
ford or passage; MN I 225,9 (~en' eva gāvo patāresi);
Ps (Ee) II 259,28 (so ~ena gāviyo otāreti); — metaph.
= the wrong way, unconduct, wrong (heretical) views:
Ja V 66,14* (~e na-ppatāreyya; misprint in Ee ppāta-
reyya; unmetrical v.r. na otāreyya, ib. 67,7'); VI
241,21 (mā ~ena pakkhandi); ~ena pakkhanno:
Sv I 38,27 (Ed. pakkhanto); Ja IV 379,17; Ud-a
415,4 (Ee pakkanto!); ~e pakkhanno, Ps III 126,16;
mahājanaṁ ~e (v. l. ~ena) pakkhandāpentaṁ, Dhp-a
III 242,23 (leading astray); Ja I 343,30 (~e pakkhaṁ
dāpenti, read pakkhandāpenti = apāyamārgayehi
pavatvati, Ja-pot). — °-pakkhandana, n., choosing
a wrong fording place, Dhp-a III 347,20.

mfn., highly praised, Mogg-v III 13
(abhitthutaṁ ~aṁ; = atikkamma thutaṁ, Pay).

mfn. [ati + sa. stabdha], very
obstinate, Mil 180,29 (~o anisedhanatāya). — °-tā,
f., great violence, Ja I 328,26 (so Fsb. ib. note 7, con-
firmed by Ja-pot itā tada-bævin; mss. atitaddha°).

m. [ts.], a guest, Abh 424 (synon, āgantu,
pāhuṇa, āvesika); nom. ~i, DN I 117,7-8 = 133,17-18 =
MN II 167,31; Ja VI 542,2* (~ w -); Pj I 222,6 (n'atthi
assa ṭhiti yamhi vā tamhi vā divase āgacchatî ti ~i,
taṁkhaṇe āgata-pāhuṇakass' etaṁ adhivacanaṁ);
Vv-a24,8 (opp. abbhāgato; kataparicayo āgantuko
~i); acc. ~iṁ, Ja IV 31,29*; loc. ~ismiṁ, Ja V
388,1*; pl. nom. ~ī, DN I 117,4 = 133,14 (~ī no te
honti = te amhākaṁ āgantukā navakā pāhunakā,
Sv) = MN II 167,28 (Ps = Sv); AN III 260,4 (~ī
pāhuṇā); acc. ~ī, Ja IV 274,23' (pāhuṇake, Ed. atithi-
pāhuṇake); gen. ~īnaṁ, MN II 186,25 (atithikaranī-
yaṁ); Ja III 307,6' (Ed. ~inaṁ); loc. ~īsu, Khp
VIII, 7 (Pj, see above). — Cf. ātitheyya, sabbâtithi.

n., hospitality, duty towards
guests, MN II 186,25 (atithīnaṁ ~aṁ kātabbaṁ).
f. [sa. atithi-kriyā] = prec, MTD.

m., oblation to a guest, AN II 68,9
(ñātibali +; = āgantukānaṁ bah, Mp) = III 45,28.

mfn. [sa. ati-sthūla], too fat; f. ~ā,
DN II 175,24 (atidīghā+, opp. atikisā); MN I 88,9
(do.); gen. ~āya, Ja VI 3,5 (atidīghāya+).

mfn., very little, too little, MN II
138,20.

mfn. [ati + dappita, sa. darpita],
too proud or arrogant, Ps II 514,19 (~o vafāyaṁ
āyasmā).

ind. [cf. daḷha = sa. dṛḍha], very
firmly, Ud-a 236,13 (giving the sense of prp. sam° in
saṇṭhāti = ~ patiṭṭhāti).

mfn., dearly beloved, Ap 581,2 =
Thi-a 71,10*.
mfn., beyond ken, invisible, MTD.

mfn., very handsome, Ap 610,19
(uncertain reading, see v. l. and Thī-a 31,23*).

mfn., too tender or young; n. abstr.
°~tta, Pj II 240,4.

n. [ts.], excessive liberality; Ja VI
525,15* = 527,13*; Pv 293; Mi] 277,18. — °-dāyi(n),
mfn., (paron.) giving exceedingly, Mil 278,3-20 (~ī loke
kittiṁ pāpuṇāti).

mfn. [ati + √ḍī (dī), to fly] (w.r.
atipāyi(n), only ifc, see kākâ° (MN I 450,34). ati-dayi

ind. (ati + ditthi, loc), as regards
belief, Vin I 63,34 = 64,3 = 67,9 - II 4,25 (~ diṭṭhi-
vipanno hoti). Cf. adhisīle, ajjhācāre, and ati-mīḷha-ja
below.

ind., (too) late in the day (ɔ: in the after-
noon); Vin I 70,5 (patikkamati; opp. atikālena; Sp)
≠ SN I 200,29 (Spk) ≠ AN III 117,4 (Mp: diva
vuccati majjhantiko, taṁ atikkamitvā) ≠ MN I
469,29 (with reading diva for atidivā); Ps II 27,2
(patikkamati); as a subsLɔ!), Ja I 310,12 (hoti);
318,20 (jāto). Cf. vikāle.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. ati + √diç], to give
further explanation; imper. °-disa, Mil 304,6 (iṁgha
me tattha kāraṇaṁ ~; Se apadisa).

mfn. [sa. ati-dīrgha], too long, very
tall (in stature); f. nâtidīghā nâtirassā nâtikisā nâtikālī
nâccodāta (scil. itthiratanaṁ, cf. Sadd 96,29) DN
II 175,24; MN I 88,8 (do., scil. khattiyakaññā + ;
Ps: ~ā ti ādīhi cha-dosa-virahitaṁ sarīra-sampattim
dīpeti); Ja I 394,7 (do., scil. janapada-kalyāṇī); Vv-a
103,18 (do., quoted from DN II 175,24 explaining
sabbaṅga-kalyāṇī); gen. f. ~āya + atirassāya, etc.,
Ja VI 3,2 (cf. atidīghâdi-dosa-vajjita, ib. 2,30);
Ja VI 86,19' (nâtidīgho nâtirasso); 457,2*; V 202,14*;
Vin IV 7,9' (~aṁ+, scil. liṅgaṁ); [Pv 324: kesā
c'assa ~a, unmetrical, read with v. l. kesā c'assa ahū
(or ahuṁ cf. DN II 256,8*) dīghā].

mfn. [ati + sa. dīrgha-sūtra], too
cautious or provident, Ja IV 165,1.

mfn., very miserable, down-cast; Ap
540,18 = Thī-a 154,12* (sokena câtidīno va).

mfn. [sa. ati-duṣkara], very diffi-
cult, Pj I 11,12*; Ap 551,18 (Ed. °dukkharaṁ) =
Thī-a 193,10*; n. pl. ~āni, hard penances (of a Bodhi-
satta), Sp I 1,5* ≠ Ud-a 211,14 (cf. sa. duṣkaracaryā).

mfn., exceedingly painful, Saddh 95
(apāyo). — n., excessive suffering or sorrow, Pv-a 65,4.
— °-pareta, mfn., overcome by that, Ja V 274,27'.

mfn., of very hurtful speech;
Pv-a 15,15 (v. r. to dukkha-vāca, Pv 8; prob, the first
reading should be ati-duṭṭha-vāca (ati-ruṭṭha° ?) and
the vā-pāṭha: ati-rukkha-vāca, q. v.).

mfn., very hard to find out, Ud-a
391,32.

n., much dearth and
famine, Ja I 87,5*.

mfn. [ts], too far; AN V 15,25(~aṁ,
scil. senāsanaṁ, opp. accāsannaṁ); n. acc (αdo.)~aṁ,
Ja III 484,7 (uppatati); Sp I 129,15 (~aṁ: accāsan-
naṁ + uparivātaṁ: unnatappadesaṁ, atisammu-
khaṁ: atipacchā); loc. (adv.) ~e, Pv 314 (v. l. suvi-
dūre; — Pv-a 137,16*: Ed. avidūre) quoted Dhp-a III
220,7* (v. L; Ee suvidūre); Ja IV 35,22'; neva ~e na
accāsanne, Vin I 39,3 (Ed. avidūre); II 158,27 (do.);
nâtidūre . . . nâccāsanne, Vin I 46,19; Ja II 154,17;
VI 294,7*; Pv-a 42,16; Abhidhi-av 92,7; nâtidūrâtisan-
tike, Mhv XV 8. — °-tā, f. abstr., Ud-a 323,15 (nâti-
dūratāya nâccāsannatāya).

m., a god above the gods (epithet of the
Buddha); Th 489; Mil 277,11 (devānaṁ ~o); As 2,26;
Nidd II 173,17; Vv-a 284,14 (devānaṁ ~aṁ = 'devâ-
tidevaṁ'); Pay fol. ghau 7 (= adhidevo adhiko devo).
— Ifc v. devâ°.

m. = atideva (said of a Bodhi-
satta), Mil 203,20; 209,11.

mfn., who has won his way above
the gods, SN I 141,18* (v. l. atideva-putta; Spk: devā-
naṁ atideva-bhāvaṁ Brahmānaṁ atibrahma-bhāvaṁ
patto).

m., abstr. of atideva, Spk I
241,6.

m. [sa. atideça], extended application
(Gr.); aññadīya-dhammānaṁ aññattha-pāpanaṁ ~o,
Pay (see Rūp 120 ad Kacc 272; sixfold: vyapadeso
nimittañ ca taṁ-rūpaṁ taṁ-sabhāvatā | suttaṁ c'eva
tathākāriṁ atideso ti chabbidho). Cf. Trilocanadāsa
ad Kātantra II 2,60.

m. [sa. atidoṣa], excessive anger; ~ena
vajjho hoti, Mil 277,26.
m., a preeminent flag, As 2,20.

mfn., happy, Mhbv 16,2* (~ā vata
dharaṇī . . . yā te alattha . . . pādatala-samphassaṁ).

n. (of pp. from next), too hard blowing
on trumpet, Ja I 284,22* (applied to a drum, ib.
283,27-28*). Cf. ati-khāta.

pr. 3 sg. [ati + √dhmā], to blow on
a trumpet (beat a drum) too hard; pot. 3 sg. nâtidhame,
Ja I 283,27* (Ct.: atikkamitvā nirantaram eva katvā
na vādeyya) = 284,22*.

m., overburdening by
dhamma, Mil 238,12 (~ena paṭhavī calati).

mfn., oversatiated, DN III 184,1 (opp.
ati-chāta; v. l. atitāta & atipipāsita). Cf. Ja II
247,12'. — °-tā, f. abstr., Ja II 293,1 (v. l. B. atibhā-
ratā).

pr. 3 sg. [ati + √dhāv], to run past,
transgress, deviate, go too far; 3 pl. ~anti, It 43,14
(opp. olīyanti; It-a) ≠ Ud 72,2 (Ud-a); SN IV 230,24;
part, dhamma-cittaṁ ~anto, As 24,26; an-atidhā-
vanta, Ud-a 151,2; pot. 3 sg. samaññaṁ nâtidhāveyya,
MN III 230,21 = 234,30 (= ṅâtikkameyya, Ps);
Kv-a 35,3, 7*; aor. 3 sg. nâtidhāvi, Pj II 21,14 ( =
'nâccasāri'); 1 sg. ~issaṁ Ap 176,10 (vanantaṁ ~,
where Th-a ad Th 113 has vajjha-ppatto tadâhosiṁ);
abs. ~itvā, Ps I 291,31; grd. ~itabba, MN III 19,17
- SN III 103,32.

f. [sa. ati-dhṛti], a class of metres,
Vutt 101—-102 (megha-vipphujjita, saddūla-vikkī-
ḷita).

mfn., extravagant, intemper-
ate, only acc. m. ~inaṁ saka-kammāni nayanti dug-
gatiṁ, Dhp 240 (quoted Nett 129,29*; Nett-a =
Dhp-a); Dhp-a III 344,2, referring to Nidd I 77,22
(dhonā vuccati paññā), explains: 'transgressing the
reason which commands a considerate use of the four
necessaries of daily life', but the etymology of dhonă
(q. v.) in this comp, is rather questionable. ati-dhona-cari

mfn. (ati + pp. of √naç), quite lost,
or at a loss, Spk ad SN IV 45,5 (Ce: panassassan ti
panaṭṭho assaṁ atinaṭṭho).

pr. 3sg. [ati + √nam, caus.], to
spend, to pass or let pass (time); to surpass, omit;
3sg. AN I 206,3 (divasaṁ); III 116,24 (do.); MN II
139,14 (anumodanassa kālaṁ, to let the opportunity
for anumodana pass; Ps); Th-a ad Th 451 (+ khepeti;
= 'vijahate' or 'viharate'); 1 sg. ~emi (rattiṁ),
Pj II 606,2 (= 'vivasemi'); 3pl. ~enti, AN IV 227,20*
(khaṇaṁ, to miss); Mil 345,5 (rattindivaṁ); aor. 3sg.
~nāmayi, Th 366 (rattiṁ abbhokāse); — also of food:
to make it pass down, MN II 138,22 (na ca vyañjanena
ālopaṁ ~eti, i. e. but he does not use the curry in
order to make the food (rice) slip down; Ps III 360,1);
— esp. to lead somebody into (with two acc): aor.
lsg. ~esiṁ (ārāmaṁ . . . lokajeṭṭhaṁ); Ap 251,5; abs.
~etvā (assamam), Ap 254,12; cf. atineti.

(pr. 3sg. [ati-ni + √grah], to
rebuke very hard; part. ~gaṇhanto, Ja VI 417,1,
prob. w. r. for atiniggaṇhanato (abl. of atiniggaṇhana,
n.); Se reads so rājā tena ativiya niggaṇhito va
kujjhitvā.

n. (cf. nijjhāyati), too intent
gazing on, MN III 160,23.

m., self-underrating, AN III 430,5
(māna + ; = hīnassa hīno 'ham asmī ti māno, Mp).

entry.re:
— °-nīcakaati-nīca-nīcaka, mfn. id.,
Dhp-a I 310,19 (cakkavāḷaṁ atisambādhaṁ Brahma-
loko ~o) = III 310,13; 313,1 ≠ Vv-a 68,1 (reading
atinīco).

entry.sense:
pr. 3sg. [ati + √nī], to lead over (as
water over a paddy-field), to lead into (as a guest into
a house); aor. lsg. ~esiṁ, Ap 160,11; 249,9; 360,23
(sakaṁ gharaṁ; cf. atināmeti); abs. ~etvā, Vin II
180,25 (udakaṁ; opp. ninneti); Ja IV 52,10 (gharaṁ;
Ed. ānetvā, but read with Cks atinetvā as ib. 219,20);
~etvāna, Ap 249,10; grd. ~etabbaṁ (udakaṁ), Vin
II 180,25.

mfn. (ati + indriya), beyond the reach
of the senses, Abh 716.

mfn., mixed with too much
alcohol; Vin I 205,5 foll. (telaṁ).
see ati-ppageva.

mfn., too much strained (opp.
atilīna); SN V 263,20 foll. (chando ~o, viriyaṁ ~aṁ,
cittaṁ ~aṁ, vīmaṁsā ~ā); 271,9 (vīmaṁsā); 288,17
(do.).

ind., too much behind, Sp I 129,16-2 2
(atidūraṁ +).

mfn., very noble, Ud-a 391,33
(Nibbānaṁ); Dhp-a I 70,19 (v. l. for ati-pīṇita).

mfn., too clever, overwise (contempt-
uously), Mil 81,9; cf. Ja I 405,15*. —- °-tā, f. abstr.,
Dhp-a II 29,20.

m. designation of a merchant, Ja I
404,21 foll.

f., excessive pride in know-
ledge, Dhp-a IV 38,1 (~āya).

f. [ts.], passing by (Gr.), only ifc. v.
kālâ°, kriyâ° (kiriyâ°). Cf. atipanna.
n., see ati-ppadāna.

mfn. (pp. of ati + √pad), past (Gr.),
only ifc. v. kriyâ° (kiriyâ°).

m., too great diffuseness, Ps I 198,24
(atthe vitthāriyamāne ~o hoti); too great delay, Ja I
64,18; II 93,16.

ind. (ati + pabhāta, loc), too late
after day-break (opp. ati-rattiṁ), Ja II 307,16.

mfn., very glad; f. ~ā, Vin I
294,14* (unmetrical; v. l. dadāti pamoditâ suggests yā
annapānaṁ dadatī (part, f.) pamoditâ).

m., too great liberality, Dhp-a III
11,19 (abl. ~ato oramitvā).

m., intense vibration
(said of mental thrill), As 115,6 (cf. a-paripphanda-
bhūta).

f., exceeding purity, Mil 278,8
(~āya na upalippati vārikaddamena, scil. padumaṁ).

f. (abstr. of ati + pavara), extra-
ordinary virtue, Mil 278,4.

pr. 3sg. [ati + √paç], to behold, to
discover; abs. ~itvā, MN III 132,4 (so Bu. who ex-
plains only with disvā, but the context seems to require
*ati-passeti (ati-passetvā), denom, of ati + pārçva
(cf. sa. ati-hastayati, etc.) = to ride alongside of).

m. [ts.], (a) verbal noun to atipāteti (2),
Sv I 69,20 (pāṇassa ~o = 'pāṇâtipāto'; saṇikaṁ
patituṁ adatvā sīghaṁ pātanaṁ, pt); —< (b) flying
into (verbal noun to *ati-patati), Ps III 159,1 (ad
MN I 450,34) note, quoting a ṭīkā : kākehi °-vasena
[daṇ]ḍetabbaṁ. — Ifc. v. pāṇâ° (cf. adhipāta, v. l.).

m(?), fugacity, Saddh 49 (khaṇag-
gassâ°; perhaps better v. l. khaṇaggassâtipātanaṁ).
see ati-pāteti.

mfn. [ts.], 1. (from atipatati or ati-
pāteti (2)) offending, transgressing; pl. ~ino, Sn 248
(punappuna ajjhācāra-ppattiyā ~ino, Pj); — ifc. v.
pāṇâ°. — 2. (from atipatati) fugitive, Saddh 50
(dullabhaṁ ~iñ ca . . . ṭhānaṁ). — 3. (from ati-
pāteti (1)) shooting through(1), only ifc. y.nagakkhan-
dhâ°. ati-pati

pr. 3sg. [caus. of ati + √pat], 1. to
let fly through, to shoot (an arrow) through something;
pot. 3sg. ~eyya, MN I 82,36 (lahukena asanena
tiriyaṁ tālacchāyaṁ or tālacchādiṁ (AN) cf. Ja IV
353,1') = SN I 62,3 = AN II 48,15 = 49,30 = IV
429,20 (= atikkameyya, Ps, Spk, Mp); SN V 454,3
(tāḷacchiggaḷena asanaṁ); fut. 3pl. ~essanti, ib. 453,15
(do.); part. acc. pl. m. ~ente, ib. V 453,11 (do.). — 2. to
injure, destroy, mostly as v. l. for atimāpeti (q. v.), Ps I
187,35 (pāṇaṁ ~entī ti pāṇâtipātī); also atipātayati,
w. r. for atimāpeti.
w. r. for ati-māpeti (q. v.).

mfn., w. r. for °-atidāyi(n), see
kākâ°. ati-payi

mfn., charming; DN III 141,19
(pāsādiko + ; v. l. supāsādiko, scil. ayaṁ dhamma-
pariyāyo ɔ: the Pāsādika-sutta).

[mfn., very thirsty, DN III 184,1
(w. r. for atidhāta).]

mfn., in good condition, well-fed,
Dhp-a I 70,19 (~aṁ etaṁ rūpaṁ, v. l. atipaṇītaṁ).

mfn., hard oppressed or vexed, Ja V
401,31' (= 'atigāḷhita').

f. (abstr. of ati + puñña), ex-
cellence of merit or good deeds, Mil 278,16 (rājā ~āya
adhipati).

n. (abstr. of ati + puṇṇa), the
being too full or overflowing, Ja VI 328,25' (abl. ~ā
pagharamānāhi = 'palissutāhi').

m., overfilling, Mil 277,28 (~ena nadī
uttarati; atibhārena +).

m. the being too early, Sv (Se)
I 415,15 (so Ce and pt; Se atippāta°). Cf. next.
ati-(p)pageva, ind. (ati + page [sa. prage,
according to Pāṇ loc. of pra-ga] + eva), too early,
very early; Ja I 335,35 (~ āgato si); III 48,24 (kiṁ
~ nivattatha); 119,6 (tatrâpi ~ gatattā kiñci na
labhi, v. l. ati-pagevaṁ & ati-page). Cf. next, and
see also pageva & adhippâgā (Ja V 59,13*).

ind. = prec, when used as a subject
case [atiprāgaḥ, Mvu I 54,12; 56,6; cf. Senart ad
loc.]; only in the phrase ~o kho tāva Sāvatthiyaṁ
(Rājagahe, etc.) piṇḍāya carituṁ, DN I 178,10 (quoted
Kacc-v 36, where -o is styled an āgama, cf. pageva
Kacc 43); DN III 1,6 (= ativiya pāgo [cf. Mvu above],
Sv; this = ativiya pāto, pt); MN I 84,2; 481,19; II
1,9; III 7,19; SN II 32,29; 35,15; V 108,5; 109,4;
115,14; 117,14; AN IV 35,1; 378,11; V 48,10; 49,14.
(This phrase is quite parallel to: ativikālo kho ajja . . .
[with inf.], DN I 108,2; II 159,26.)

n. (ati + padāna [sa. pradāna]),
spending too much, Pv 292 (~ena kulā na honti;
Pv-a: °-ppasaṅgena kulāni na honti, na-ppavattanti,
ucchijjanti).

f. (abstr. of *atippabha, mfn. -<
ati + pabhā [sa. prabhā]), intense brilliancy, Mil
278,14 (suriyo ~āya timiraṁ ghāteti).

mfn., split in many sub-
divisions, Ps I 239,17 foll. = Sv II 468,13.

mfn., enormous, Ja III 146,13*
(kūṭaṁ ~aṁ).

m., 'too extended connection' (a
term used by Gr. = too general applicability (of a
rule), Mogg-v I 55; 58.

mfn., highly praised, very ex-
cellent, Abh 918.

mfn., very beloved, too dear, Vism
296,2-6 (°-sahāyaka).

mfn., very harsh, Ja III 368,1 (~aṁ
kathesi). — °-vacana, mfn. = ati-rukkha-vāca, q. v.

mfn. [cf. sa. sphīta], very well off,
Ap 555,8 (loc. kule . . . nâtiphītamhi).

mfn. (ati + pp. of √bandh), tied
together; sakaṭa-sataṁ ~aṁ, Vin IV 5,15 ≠ Ja I
191,22-27.

pr. 3sg. (ati + √bandh), to tie
together (in a row); abs. ~itvā (sakaṭa-sataṁ), Vin
IV 5,19 = Ja I 192,21.

mfn. [ts.], very strong or powerful, m.
~o, Ja IV 103,13*; acc. f. ~aṁ (aniccataṁ), Mhv XX
58; pl. ~ā, Ja III 499,22*; V 268,26* (amanussā);
VI 539,14* (pākahaṁsā; or name of a species of
birds'!). — Ifc. v. balâ°.

f. (abstr. of prec), abl. ~ā, Ja I
432,12* (Ct. takes it as an adj. = atibala-sabhāvā).

f. (abstr. of ati + balava(t)),
superiority of strength, Mil 278,15 (~āya paṭimallaṁ
ukkhipati).

mfn., too thick, quite thick; ~ā yāgu,
Ja VI 365,15;
entry.re:
— °-oṭṭha-kapolaati-bahala-oṭṭha-kapola, mfn., with too thick
lips and cheeks, Dhp-a I 194,20 (~aṁ mukhaṁ).

entry.sense:
mfn. [ts.], too much; ~uṁ bhojanaṁ,
Dhp-a IV 16,5; ~uṁ bhuñjitvā, Ja II 291,26; kiṁ
~uṁ bhaṇitena, Mil 227,29. — °-bhaṇda, mfn.,
having too many implements, Dhp-a II 173,1.

mfn., too numerous; acc. m. pl. ~e,
Ja III 519,17' (= 'subahū').

ind. (from ati + bāḷha), too much,
violently; ~ pamatto MN I 253,33 (= ativiya, Ps);
~ nimmādeti, DN I 92,6—93,18; 95,34; ~ apasādesi,
Mil 279,29.

pr. 3sg. (see bāheti, paṭibāheti),
to remove (violently); abs. ~etvā, Mhv XLV 30 ( =
'to offer violence to', Geiger).

pr 3sg. [prob. iv. r. for ati-vāheti,
caus. of ati + √vah], to guide or escort through; 3pl.
~enti, Ja IV 366,27' (satthe cora-aṭaviṁ; so Ct. on
'abbāhayanti', ib. 364,13*).
mfn., very subtle; Mil 90,1*.
mfn., id., Mil 207,16.

mfn., of too large stature; m. nâti-
brahā, Ja VI 86,15* (= nâtidīgho nâtirasso, Ct.). ati-braha

m., a still greater Brahma(n)
(an epithet of the Buddha); nom. ~ā (Brahmānaṁ),
Ps I 51,15 = Mp I 111,4 = Ud-a 132,3; Vism 2,8
(do.); Mil 277,11 (do.); As 2,26 (tathārūpo Brahma
pi ~ā ti vuccati, comparing with ati-dhajo . . . ati-
devo); Dhp-a II 60,16 (Brahmuṇā pi ~ā).

m., a brāhmaṇa superior to the
brāhmaṇā; Mil 277,13 (brāhmaṇānaṁ ~o).

m., a state superior to that
of Brahma(n); Spk I 241,7 (ad SN I 141,18*).

pr. 3sg. (ati + √bṛṁh (vṛṁh), cf. sa.
abhibṛṁhayati), to strengthen, encourage; aor. 3sg. ~esi,
Ja V 361,23' (= 'a-pari-brūhayi' q. v.; by adding the
synon, mahāsaddaṁ nicchāresi the Ct. seems to derive
this verb from [sa-Dhātup 17,85] bṛhi çabde).

m., somebody more dear than
a sister's son; Ja I 223,8.

n., excessive (or exaggerated) fear,
Mil 277,28 (~ena nirujjhati). — °-bhayaṭṭita, mfn.,
very terrified, Mhv I 25 (yakkhe ~e; but Mhv-ṭ takes
'ti = iti and comments: iti = evaṁ bhayaṭṭite āha,
iti vā āha = evaṁpakāraṁ kathesī ti).

pr. 3sg. (ati + √bhī), to be much
afraid; fut. ~issati, Mhv XIV 6.

m. [ts.], an excessive burden; Ja VI
234,29* (~aṁ samādāya); Th 659 (mathito, or
maddito, ~ena, scil. ājañño); Mil 277,22 (~ena saka-
ṭassa akkho bhijjati, + ati-bhuttena, ativassena, etc.).
— °-ga, m. [ts.], a donkey, mule, camel; MTD. —.
°-tā, f. abstr., Ja II 293,1 (~āya, v. l. for atidhāta-
tāya).
entry.re:
— °-bharitaati-bhāra-bharita, mfn., (paron.) overloaded, Mil
116,8 (sakaṭassa ~assa).

entry.sense:
f. (abstr. of ati + bhārika; cf.
bhārita, bhāriya; sinh, bæri, bæra), the being of ex-
traordinary weight, Mil 278,13 (Sineru ~āya acalo).

mfn., overloaded; Vin IV 47,6 (~o
vihāro paripati).

mfn., too heavy, very difficult or
serious; Dhp-a I 70,8 (~aṁ kammaṁ).

mfn. [cf. sa. ati-bhīṣaṇa], very
terrific; Dāth III 47 (Ed. ati-bhāsanena, cf. JPTS
1886 p. 136,9).
mfn., much alarmed, Mhv IV 39.

mfn., very timid,. Ja VI 79,13'
(kiṁpurisā ~ā).

pr. 3sg. (ati -f √bhuj), to eat too
much; abs. ~itvā, Mil 153,25 (v. l. abhibhuñjitvā).
Cf. next.

mfn. (pp. of prec), only n., over-
eating; instr. ~ena, Ja I 185,7' (= 'accāsana'); Mil
135,18 (sītena +, scil. vāto kuppati); 153,28 (+ usmā-
dubbalatāya, scil. bhojanaṁ jīvitaṁ harati); 277,23
(~ena bhojanaṁ visamaṁ pariṇamati).

ind. (ati + bhūmi); ~ gantvā,
going beyond the (prescribed) limit, Ja III 484,10.

mfn., fear-inspiring, ghastly; n.
abstr. °-tta, Vism 187,1 (abl. ~ā).

n. [ts.], eating too much; Ps I
284,10 (~e nimittaggāho); 284,17 (~e nimittaṁ gaṇ-
hantassa). Cf. atibhutta.
see ati-hoti

1. m(fn)., needing no bed(1), Mogg
III 14 (atikkanto mañcaṁ ~o, Pay) ≠ vārttika ad
Pāṇ II 2,18 (atikrāntaḥ khaṭvāṁ atikhaṭvaḥ; cf.
Mahābhāṣya vol. I 416,21). —> 2. m., a bed over another
bed, see mañcâtimañca.

(or ~eti, q. v.) pr. 3sg. [ati +
√man], to despise, disdain; to refuse (acc); ~ati, Dhp
366 (salābhaṁ); Th 1026 (appa-sutaṁ sutena); SN I
187,14 (attano paṭibhānena aññe pesale bhikkhū ~;
= atikkamitvā maññati, Spk); II 229,14; Ja III
260,13* (= do. Ct.); V 269,25* (do.); AN III 38,14*
= IV 269,1*; Vibh 355,17 (Vibli-a 488,5); Pv-a 36,1
(cf. avamānito, ib.); AN IV 153,9 (ariyaṁ tuṇhībhā-
vaṁ nâtimaññati); — 3sg. med. ~ate, AN IV 92,13*
(Mp) = Ja II 347,24*; — 2sg. ~asi, AN I 149,29*
(Ed. ~esi against metre; = atikkamitvā maññasi, Mp);
— 1 sg. ~āmi, SN I 187,17; Ja IV 134,24*; VI 193,30*
(sippavādena); 557,30*; — 3pl. ~anti, DN II 186,19;
— part. ~anto, Ja IV 331,19' (= 'atihīḷayāno'); Ps I
107,30; — part. med. ~amāno, MN II 180,13;
— pot. 3sg. ~e, Sn 931; ~eyya, Dhp 365; SN II 228,26
(Spk); Ja V 448,3* = VI 310,23*; med. ~etha, Sn
148 (Pj); — 2sg. aor. med.: mâtimaññittho, Ja II
29,17* (Bl ~ivho, 2pl.; cf. mâtimaññavho, Sadd
156,25); — lsg ~ittho, Ja IV 319,28* (nâbhijānāmi
. . . ~, so Cks; Ed. with Bd ~ittha, by Fsb. taken =
atimaññi 'ttha, but see the list of confusions ~itā, ~itvā,
~ittha s. v. abhijānāti; in Ct. ib. 320,28' read: ati-
maññin ti idaṁ atikkamitvā maññanaṁ na jānāmi
na sarāmi). — 1 sg. ~issaṁ, Pv 40 ( ˇ ˇ - ˇ - ; cf.
Th 424; sāmikaṁ, = atikkamitvā avamaññiṁ, Pv-a);
do. augmented accamaññissaṁ, Ja IV 178,10* ( =
atikkamitvā maññissaṁ, Ct.) & 3pl. ~isuṁ, Ja IV
154,26* (= atimaññiṁsu atikkamiṁsu, Ct.); — fut.
3sg. ~issati, Vin III 7,2 (sālimaṁsodanaṁ); — grd.
~itabba, mfn., MN II 242,12 (= atikkamitabba, Ps).

f. (from prec), despising, Mil
122,27. Cf. atimāna.

mfn. (etymology and meaning
doubtful), too brittle (1), too short(1); Vin II 138,10
(~aṁ dantakaṭṭhaṁ; Sc ati-mandāhakaṁ; Bu.
(quoted by Oldenberg, not in Sp (Ce), v. l. atipaṭāha-
kaṁ) explains with ati-khuṭakaṁ, which perhaps
means ati-khuddakaṁ).

mfn. (ati + matta, pp. of √mad),
very conceited or arrogant, Ja VI 193,31* (atimatt'asi
sippena).

mfn. [sa. atimātra], above measure,
excessive, Abh 41. Cf. adhi-matta.

mfn., very lovely or delicate, aggree-
able, Sv I 228,15 = Sp I 170,28; Pj II 155,15 (atik-
kantaṁ atiiṭṭhaṁ+) = Ud-a 286,11 = Ps I 130,2;
Pv-a71,7 (+ abhirūpa; — 'abhikkanta'); Ja I 269,1
(~ā surā); I 221,3 (pilotika-cīvaram).

mfn., very charming, Ja I 60,26
(~ena sirisobhaggena; Ck atimanoharena; cf. next).

mfn. = prec. (q. v.), Pv-a 46,23
(°-kesa-kalāpā).

mfn. — prec, Saddh 273 (aṁ-
kuraṁ ~aṁ).

pr. 3sg., to make too much of,
Ja II 316,17 (tāpasaṁ). [Cf. mamāyati, lit. to treat
as one's own, to make to one's own.]

mfn. [sa. ati-maryāda], exceeding
the limit, MTD.

& ati-mahanta, mfn., too great,
or very large; Ja I 221,24 (nâtimahante sare); f. ~atī,
Pv-a 75,20 (~iṁ sampattiṁ); Ja IV 238,4 (read:
ayaṁ [mahā] lābhasakkāro ati-mahā, parivāro pi
mahanto). ati-maha
f. (abstr. of prec), Mil 278,11.

mfn., very blameable, Ps I
145,36 (icchā nâti-°~ā).

[pr. 3sg.], w. r. for atipāteti & ati-
māpeti (q. v.).

m. [cf. atimaññati; mostly following
māna, thus prob, secondary in respect to mānâtimāna,
q. v.], high opinion (of one's self), self-conceit, pride; Sn 853
(~e ca no yuto; Nidd I 233,27); 942 (~e na tittheyya;
Nidd I 424,1); Nidd I 490,5 (~assa mūlaṁ); DN II
243,2* (kadariyatā +; atikkamitvā maññana-lak-
khaṇo ~o, Sv); MN I 16,1 (māno + ; Ps: abbhunnati-
lakkhaṇo ~o); 37,7; 360,27; 363,24 (opp. anatimāna);
AN I 100,17 (~assa = atikkamitvā maññana-
mānassa, Mp); = 299,24 ≠ IV 148,26 ≠ 350,2 ≠
465.26 ≠ V 310,23 ≠ 361,4; III 430,1 (māna,
omāna +; Mp: atikkamitvā pavattaṁ accunnati-
mānaṁ); 445,1 (do); Vibh 346,15; 355,14 (Vibh-a
488,3); Th 428 (~o ca omāno); Ja VI 287,20 (~aṁ
akatvā nīcavutti); Mil 289,11. — Cf. atimaññanā,
adhimāna. — Ifc v. an-°, omānâ°, kodhâ°, mānâ°,
vaṇṇâ°, saggâ°.

mfn., 'spoilt by his pride', Th 424
(cf Trsl.; = atimānena khatůpahata-kusalâcāro,
Th-a).

mfn. [sa. ati-mānuṣa], super-
human, MTD.

pr. 3sg. (caus. of ati-māpeti),
to cause to injure or kill, DN III 48,21 (Ed. adhipā-
tayati).

mfn. (pp. of next), injured, killed,
SN IV 319,22 (pāṇo).

pr. 3sg. (caus. of ati + √mī), to
injure, destroy, kill; Dhp 246 (yo koci pāṇaṁ ~eti;
= parassa jīvitindriyaṁ upacchindati, Dhp-a with
v. l. atipāteti) = AN III 205,27* (Ed. atimāteti, v. l.
atipāteti); DN III 48,20 (Ed. atipāpeti, v.I. atimāteti,
atipāteti); SN IV 317,27 = 319,15 (yo koci pāṇaṁ
~eti sabbo so āpāyiko nerayiko); 343,19; part. gen.
~ayato, DN I 52,24 (pāṇaṁ; according to Sv and
pt = killing and making kill , hence v. l. atipātā-
payato) = MN I 405,3; 516,6 = SN III 208,23; DN
II 148,21 (Ed. atipātayato); pp. atimāpita (q. v.);
caus. atimāpayāpeti (q. v.). -— Cf. ati-pāteti (2).

m(fn)., designation of a child
(quem prægnans concepit), AN III 226,10 (= ati-mīḷhe
mahā-gūtha-rāsimhi jāto, Mp; ati- for adhi-(?) cf.
ati-diṭṭhiyā).

mfn., very talkative; Ja I 418,26
(+ bahubhāṇī) ≠ Dhp-a II 70,9. — °-tā, f. abstr.,
Ja I 419,27 ≠ Dhp-a II 70,21.

m. [sa. ati-mukta], name of a plant,
a kind of jasmine, Gaertnera Racemosa, Abh 577
(= vāsantī); Ap 15,21; 346,3 (v. l. adhimutta). (MTD:
the soap acacia creeper.)

m. Npr. of a thera, SN V 76,11 (v. l.;
Ed. Sāriputta).

m. [sa. ati-muktaka], name of a
creeper, Dalbergia Ujjenensis (sometimes named together
with yūthikā (yodhikā)), Abh 555 (= tinisa); Ja IV
440,8* (v. l. B. adhi°); V 420,1**; 422,30' (suṭṭhu-
kusumita-°); Mil 338,15; Ud-a 203,1 (°-âdi-latā-maṇ-
ḍapo). (MTD: the persimon tree.)

f., a garland of atimuttaka-
flowers; Vin II 256,1 (uppala-mālā +) = MN I 32,28
= AN IV 278,1 (Ed adhi°).

n., a cemetery near Be-
nares; Ja IV 28,21 (v. l. B. adhi-° ɔ: avi-°; Ja-pota
Avimuttaka, cf. sa. Avimukta[tīrtha]); Ps III 223,1
(Se adhi-°).

mfn., very soft, mild, or feeble;
Ja I 262,22; Dhp-a III 412,14.
m., excessive joy, MTD.

pr. 3sg. (ati + √mud), to rejoice still
more, Dhp-a I 132,23 (idha loke pi modati . . . paraloke
pi ~ati yeva).
f., the jasmine plant, MTD.

m., excessive stupidity; Mil 277,27
(~ena anayaṁ āpajjati); Mhv XX 58 (°-jāla-balatā).

= imbara (q. v.). — Ifc. Lakuṇṭaka-
atimbara, alias Gotha-imbara (see Mhv XXIII
(50)—54), Dhp-a IV 50,19-24.

m., only pl. ~ā, Ja VI 502,26*, an
exorcist(?); according to the Ct. ib. 504,22' — bhūta-
vijjā (prob, for bhūtavejjā, Lk) ikkhaṇikā.

mfn. (from ati + √yāc), asking or
begging too much; Ja II 284,21-25* (Ct.) = Vin III
147,3-6* (Sp = ativiya yācako).
mfn. — prec, AN III 136,15.

f. (cf. prec), the asking or begging
too much; Ja II 285,21* (desso hoti ~āya), metre
defective, see Vin III 147,21* (videsso hoti ~āya).

pr. 3sg. (ati + √yā), 1. to pass by; 3pl.
~yanti [cf. however sa. ati-yanti], Ud-a 318,27 ( =
'atikkamanti'). — 2. to (re)enter into the town (said
of a king); inf. ~ātuṁ, AN I 68,23 foll. (bahiddhā
janapadacārikaṁ caritvā icchiticchitakkhaṇe anto-
nagaraṁ pavisituṁ, Mp; opp. niyyātuṁ).

mfn., who cannot be re-
born as an animal; pl. ~ino, SN I 154,31* (sota-
samāpannā +; Spk: desanāsīsaṁ etaṁ, avinipāta-
dhammā ti attho). a-tiracchana-gami

m., too great a weight of
precious things, Mil 238,19.

mfn. [sa. ati-rātra], from over-night,
Mogg-v III 53 (atikkanto rattiṁ ~o).
m., a chariot army, MTD.

mfn., very delightful, (untraced
quotation in) Sadd 327.11.

m., a very delicate cake, Ja V
288,23 (acc pl. ~e; atirasa kævum, Ja-pota).

m. = prec, Ja V 294,2' (°-saṇ-
ṭhāna-mukhī, f., with a mouth like that; sakuru puva,
Ja-pota).

mfn. [sa. ati-hrasva], too short (opp.
ati-dīgha), Vin IV 7,9'; DN II 175,24 (quoted Vv-a
103,18); Ja V 202,14*; VI 3,3; 86,10; 457,2*.
m., excessive lust, Mil 277,26.

m. [ts.], a supreme king, Mil 277,10
(rājūnaṁ ~ā); Dhp-a II 60,1 (do.). — °-kumāra,
m., the most excellent prince, As 2,24 (v. l. abhi-°). ati-raja

pr. 3sg. [ati + √ric], to exceed, sur-
pass (acc), Saddh 126; pot. 3sg. ~eyya, Saddh 23;
abs. atiricca, Jināl 72 (nādena nādam ~ upavī-
ṇayanti); pp. v. next. Cf. atireka.

mfn. [sa. ati-rikta, pp. of ati + √ric],
exceeding, remaining, left; Abh 712 (+ adhika); n.
~aṁ, Vin IV 82,33' foll; Dhp-a III 262,20 (bhikkhu-
saṁghassa ~aṁ); m. pl. ~ā, Vin V 137,4 (aṭṭha, scil.
dhammā); 188,5 (pañca). — °-saññā, f., thinking
(some food) to have been left over, Mil 266,9. — °sañ-
ñi(n), mfn., Vin IV 83,9'. — Ifc v. akatâ°, an-°,
katâ°, gilānâ°, Sugatâ°.

mfn. (from prec), id. Mhv App A 1
(p. 326,1: bhattaṁ ~aṁ).

ind. [ati + iva, in verses of the type
- - ˇ - - ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ - ˇ - -, cf. yatha-r-iva and
sarada-r-iva; sa. atīva, = ati-viya, cf. atīva & ateva]
exceedingly, very, highly; Sn 679 (thomayante); 680
(kalyarūpo); 683 (kalyarūpā); — in prose, [cf. Mvu
III 147,3]: DN II 264,17, 24 (obhāsa-jāto; v. l. atīva).

mfn. (ati + 2rukkha + vācā;
cf. ati-lūkha), speaking very harshly, Abh-sūci ad
Abh 977 (~o ti atipharusa-vacano, quoting Pv 8:
'samaṇo ayaṁ pāpo atirukkhavāco'; Ee of Pv &
Pv-a reads (unmetrically ) samaṇo ahaṁ pāpo duk-
khavāco, cf. atidukkhavāca above).

mfn. [ts.], very lovely; DN III 153,21*
(°-suvaggu-dassaneyya; = supāsādika, Sv).

mfn., very beautiful; f. ~inī, Ap
548,11, quoted Thī-a 133,7* (Ee Ce abhirūpinī; v. l.
(aho ram)aní rūpinī). ati-rupi

mfn. (from ati + √ric; cf. sa. atireka,
m.), exceeding, surpassing, still more, too much, more
than; remaining, left (giving the sense of 'bhiyyo': atire-
katthe nipāto, Ps I 114,18); Th 424 (na ... kañci
~aṁ ca maññisaṁ); Ja III 193,23 (with instr., aññehi
~aṁ katvā passati, regarded him better than the others);
Dhp-a III 395,16 (~aṁ ce hoti, harati; opp. ūnaṁ
ce hoti, pakkhipati); Ps I 207,5 (aññaṁ ~aṁ pañhaṁ
pucchiṁsu); MN I 515,26 (~aṁ imassa bhoto sat-
thuno naggiyaṁ, etc.); Dhp-a II 185,9 (~aṁ aphāsu-
kaṁ); AN III 215,16 (etaṁ samasamaṁ, n'atthi
kiñci ~aṁ, handâhaṁ atirekāya); Dhp-a I 79,12
(~aṁ jātaṁ); Ja II 196,23 (°sāṭako ~o); m. pl. ~ā,
Mil 216,6 (tena aṅgena); 257,5-7 (visesena); Vin I
128,36 (cattāro vā ~ā vā, or more); n. pl. ~āni,
Ja I 109,4 (akkha-yugâdīni); IV 4,19* (satasahassāni
~āni vīsati); instr, pl. ~ehi, Ja I 441,8 (hīnehi, sa-
mehi+, scil. mitta-santhavo kattabbo, cf. Sn 47);
— comp, with numerals = above, see °-dasa, etc. below;
— hence ~aṁ (adverbially) more: Ps (Ee) II 165,2
(ekaṁ dve ālope ~aṁ bhuñjati, i. e. more than
usually); ~ena (instr.), do. (forming an analytical
comparative), Ja V 99,21 (appamattena); Ps I 96,14
(~ena pūjanīyo = pujjataro). — Ifc v. dham-
mâ°, sâ°.

n. Ja I 431,4' (= 'atikāra',
q. v.). — °-catumāsa-niviṭṭha, mfn., settled for
more than four months, Vin III 46,26' (sattho).
— °-cīvara, n., an extra robe, Vin I 289,11; III
195,18**; 196,10** (dasâhaparamaṁ dhāretabbaṁ)
≠ V 139,25; Vin III 196,7 = I 289,25 (quoted Ps
(Ee) II 251,27). — °-[a]ddhamāsa, m., something more
than a half month, Vin III 253,16'. — °-tara, mfn.
compar., still more (with abl.): Ja VI 317,32' (dānato
~aṁ puññaṁ); Dhp-a II 98,10 (catūhi samuddehi
~ena assunā; cf. SN II 179,26-30); 196,13 (raññā
dinna-dānato ~aṁ); III 80,11 (samuddānaṁ udakato
~āni); — n. ~am, ind., Dhp-a I 21,5 (rujanti; opp.
thokaṁ); Ja VI 94,12' (muyhāmi); 318,19 (tuṭṭho);
348,27 (bhītā; v. l. atirekatarā bhītā); 378,3 (añña-
maññaṁ piyāyanti). — °-tarapañña, mfn., still
more clever or cunning, Ja VI 397,28' (tehi paṇḍi-
tehi ~ā rañño mātā, so Fsb; Ck atirekataraṁ paññā,
Bd °tarā p°). — °-tara-vaṇṇa, mfn., still more
beautiful, Ja IV 109,10' (= 'bhiyyo vaṇṇavatī'; Cks
atirekatarā vaṇṇā). — -tā, f. abstr., superiority, ifc.
v. hīnâ°. — °-tiyojana-sata, n., more than 300
yojana, Ps (Ee) II 136,13. — °-dasavagga, mfn.,
forming a group of more than ten, Vin I 58,37
(~ena gaṇena). — °-dasa-vassa, mfn., (ordained)
for more than ten years ago, Vin I 59,33; 62,11;
65,31. —- °-dhamma, mfn., which ought to be
considered superfluous, MN I 13,3 (piṇḍapāto ~o
chaḍḍiyadhammo; = atireko, Ps). — °-pañcaka,
n., more than one of the five parts (see pañcaka), Vin I
255,2. — °-pañca-māsaka, mfn., of a value or weight
of more than five māsaka (q. v.), Vin II 147,4'; 54,16'
(cf. ib. 22'-28'). — °-pañca-ratana, mfn., a little
more than five ratana (see 2ratana; ṝ. e. a man's height),
Ps (Ee) II 37,30 (= 'sādhika-porisa'). — °-paññā-
veyyattiya, n., excessive cleverness, Pj I 173,22 (~ena
samannāgato). — °-paṇṇāsa or °-paññāsa, numeral,
more than fifty; ~ vassāni, Ja II 382,16 (°nn°);
IV 28,2; 31,18' (°ññ°); ~ dhammā, As 152,33 (°nň°);
155,19 (°ññ°); Vibh-a 123,17 (do.). — °-patta, m.', an
extra alms-bowl, Vin III 243,3**-2i**, 24'. — °-pada-
sata, n., more than 100 verse-quarters, Ja I 72,10.
— °-pāda, mfn., exceeding the worth of a pāda (q. v.),
Vin II 146,37'. — °-(p)pamāṇa, mfn., of extraordinary
size, As 2,18 (~aṁ chattaṁ); n. ~aṁ, ind., beyond
measure, Ja III 103,21' (bhāsati). — °-pūjā, f.,
especial worship, MN I 220,12 (~āya pūjetā, paron.;
Ps). — °-bhāga, m., more than the due portion,
Vin I 285,29. — °-māsa, m., more than a month,
Vin III 253,14'. — °-lābha, m., extra allowance, Vin
I 58,13 foll. (Kammav 5,31); Ps III 223,5 (~aṁ
paṭikkhipitvā samādinna-piṇḍapātikaṅgā = 'piṇḍa-
pātikā'); Vism 66,8; 67,2. — °-vīsati-vagga, mfn.,
containing a group of more than twenty, Vin I 319,26
(~o bhikkhu-saṁgho). — °-vīsati-vassa, mfn., more
than twenty years old, AN IV 280,6.
entry.re:
— °-saññi(n)atireka-karaṇa-saññi(n),
mfn., conscious of something being too much, Vin III
253,23'.

— °-sattaatireka-karaṇa-satta, numeral, more than seven, Ja V
319,31 (°-divasâdhikāni, ~ days in addition).

entry.sense:
pr.3sg. [ati + √ruc], to outshine
(somebody, acc. [once abl. pl.]); to be prominent (by
virtue of some attribute, instr.); to be foremost (among,
loc); by Gr. given as ex. of the sense atikkamana of
prp. ati, Rūp Ce 87,8 (Pay); Dhp 59 (saṁkārabhūtesu
andhabhūte puthujjane ~ati paññāya; = atikka-
mitvā virocati, Dhp-a, but andhabhūte puthujjane
is prob, haplol. for °bhūtesu °janesu [cf. Th 602; Vv433;
Ap75,10; Sn 704; Pv 288; Vin V 226,6*]; Ud 50,30(aññe
deve . . . vaṇṇena; Ud-a) = DN II 210,14 = 226,15; Pv
316 (with abl. pl. amhehi; thus quoted by Rūp Ce 87,8,
Pv-a 139,13 explains amhe (acc.) + hi (nipātamattaṁ)
cf. tāragaṇe in the same stanza); Dhp-a III 219,12*
(with gen. Sambuddhassa for acc.; v. l. for virocati);
Ja V 63,5* (sabbe tārāgaṇe loke ābhāya ~) = AN III
34,20*; Ja V 358,24; AN III 239,16 (Bhagavā ~
vaṇṇena c'eva yasasā ca); Mil 336,25 (disam pi . . .
tiriyam pi virocati +); — 2sg. ~asi, Th 1252 (~ī
yasasā sabbalokaṁ); 2sg. med. ~ase, Vv 765 (v. l. for
abhirocase; = abhibhavitvā vijjotasi, Vv-a, cf. Pv-a
139,14); — 3pl. ~anti (aññe . . . vaṇṇena), DN II
208,19*; — aor. 3sg. accarucī (sabbe), AN III 346,18*
(Mp) = Th 692 (Ed. accanta-rucī); 3pl. atirocisuṁ,
Ja V 311,25 (samānavaṇṇarūpena aññam-aññâ°); 3sg.
med. ~atha (paññāya), Sp I 63,3*; —- abs. ~etvā(?).
Dhp-a I 446,10.

mfn., very hairy; m., a wild goat,
MTD.

ind. (ati + lahu, sa. laghu), too
quickly, too inconsiderately, Vin I 59,27 (~ kho tvaṁ
bāhullāya āvatto, quoted Ud-a 266,17).
ind., too soon; Vin II 215,10.

ind., no more the time
for a light dress, Mogg-v III 2 (lahu-pāpuraṇassa
nâyaṁ upabhoga-kālo ti attho; cf. ati-taisṛkaṁ,
Kāçikā ad Pāṇ II 1,6).

mfn., too weak or slack; iti me chando
na ca ~o bhavissati na ca atipaggahīto (+ do.
viriyaṁ . . . cittaṁ . . . vīmaṁsā), SN V 263,20; 271,9;
288,17; Pj II 146,12 (accāraddhâ°).
entry.re:
— °-viriyaati-līna-viriya, n.,
too weak an exertion, MN III 159,32 (Ps; opp. accā-
raddha-°); 160,1 (°âdhikaraṇaṁ = on account of ~);
AN III 375,19 (or ~aṁ viriyaṁ; = atisithilaṁ, Mp)
= Vin I 183,1; SN V 279,2.

entry.sense:
mfn. [cf. ati-rukkha], very rough or
coarse (said of clothes, etc.), Ja V 171,10 (nivāsana-
pārupanaṁ); Saddh 409 (~e paccaye).

mfn., too salty; accuṇhaṁ, atisītaṁ,
~aṁ, aloṇaṁ, Ja III 423,5 (yāguṁ); IV 44,9; Nidd
II 129,15 ad Sn 35 (s. v. kappo).

m. [ts.], excessive greediness, Mil
277,27; Ja II 231,1* (atricchā atilobhena atilobha-
madena ca (cf. mada, m.), quoted Vibh-a 470,35*,
reading atricchaṁ, etc., q. v.).

mfn., too hairy; Ja VI 457,2* (~ā,
so Ck; Se nâtilomakā; Fsb. nâtilom' assa).

mfn. [sa. ati-vakra], very crooked,
Ja I 160,1' (~āni siṅgāni) explaining ati-vaṁki(n),
mfn., in the comp, vaṁkâtivaṁki(n), q.v.

pr. 3sg. (denom, of ati + vaṇṇa
[lit. colour]), to be in disharmony with, DN II 267,18
(tantissaro ~ati gītassaraṁ, gītassaro vā tantissaraṁ).

mfn. (pp. of ati-vattati), (a) pass.,
passed, surpassed, overcome; Mil 146,21 (~ā loka-
dhammā); — (b) intrans., having passed to another
side, Ja I 58,6 = Ps II 392,10 (chāyā); — (c) trans.,
surpassing, having overcome or conquered, Ja III
485,22' (°ṭṭhānato paraṁ ~o); Ps II 558,17 (mama
vasaṁ ~āni). — Ifc. v. velâ°, sabbabhayâ°.

(mfn.) from the pres. stem of ativat-
tati, only ifc. dur°, svâ°.

m. (nomen agentis of ati + √vac),
one who blames or abuses; pl. ~āro (isīnaṁ), Ja V
266,24* (= pharusa-vācāhi atikkamitvā vattāro, ib.
272,21'). ati-vatta

pr. 3sg. [ati + √vṛt], to pass beyond,
surpass; to overcome, overwhelm, conquer; to try to
escape or avoid; Ud 5,9* (= atikkamati, abhibhavati,
Ud-a); 18,4* = Ja I 410,1* (= abhibhavati, ajjhot-
tharati, Ct. = Ud-a) = Pv 791; Sn 740 = 752 =
It 9,4* = 109,15* = AN II 10,11* (saṁsāraṁ); Ud
70,30* (do.); DN II 55,17 = SN II 92,17 (apāyaṁ +
. . . nâtivattati); Th 659 (saṁ yugaṁ nâtivattati);
MN III 219,12 (rūpaṁ); AN IV 57,15—59,1 (itthat-
taṁ, purisattaṁ); IV 198,14 (velaṁ nâ°, scil. ma-
hāsamuddo) ≠ Vin II 237,25; Ja I 280,4* — II 206,9*
(diṭṭhaṁ); I 282,17* (do.); [Ja III 465,15*, 17' read with
Cks nânuvattati]; — 3sg. med. ~ate, Th 412 (jāti-jarā ~
taṁ); — 3pl. ~anti, SN IV 158,17 (saṁsāraṁ); Ja IV
134,6* (= abhibhavanti, Ct.); VI 113,35*—114,13*
(khandhâ ~ sajotibhūtā, i. e. aggi-kkhandhā (q. v.),
but Ct. = jalitā pabbatakkhandhā); — 3pl. med.
~are, Ja VI 226,20* (taṁ khaṇaṁ nâ°, they do not
miss at that moment [of emancipation, accord, to the
doctrine of saṁsāra-suddhi]); Ap 21,22 (ete ñāṇaṁ
te nâ°); — pot. 3sg. ~eyya, prob, from ativatteti
(q. v.); —i aor. 3sg. med. accavattatha, Ja III 484,27*
{with pleonastical paraṁ); —. aor. 3pl. ativattisuṁ,
Ja VI 99,12* (Petaṁ; = ativattiṁsu, Ct.); grd.
itabba, mfn., Pj II 522,9 (sukhena ~ā, = 'svāti-
vattā'); — pp. ativatta, caus. ativatteti (?) & ati-
vattāpeti (q. v.).

n. (from prec), surpassing, over-
coming; escaping from; Ud-a 346,2 (saṁsārato °-ânati-
vattana-dīpanaṁ udānaṁ). — Ifc. v. an-°.

pr.3sg. (caus. of ati-vattati), to
let pass away (time); pot. 1 sg. ~eyyaṁ, Ps I 95,10
(khepeyyaṁ +, = 'vītināmeyyaṁ').

pr. 3sg. (caus. of ati-vattati); to
let pass by, to let go astray; pot. 3sg. ~eyya, Ja
IV 5,4* (Ct. takes it from ativattati, = avatthareyya,
ativattetîti pi pāṭho, avattharatîti attho); V 66,13*
(attānaṁ).

mfn. [sa. ati-vṛddha], old, full-
grown; Ja VI 591,4*, 6* (nâtivaddhañ ca kuñjaraṁ,
= taruṇa-hatthiṁ, Ct.).

mfn., thoroughly subject to, in the power
of (gen.), Dhp 74 (mam' evâtivasā assu, = mam' eva
vase vattantu, Dhp-a [should we expect adhi-°? cf.
ati-diṭṭhiyā]).

n., excessive rain, Mil 277,24 (~ena
dhaññaṁ vinassati).

pr. 3sg. [ati + √vṛṣ], to rain violently,
to rain into or through, Th 447 = Vin II 240,24*
(channaṁ ~ati) = Ud 56,33* (Ud-a), quoted Pj II
31,21*.

n. (ati + 2vassita, pp. of √vāç),
crying too much (aloud)) Ja I 432,13* (vācā hanati
dummedhaṁ tittiraṁ vâtivassitaṁ).

pr. 3sg. [ati + √vah], to carry over,
metaph, [like sa. pratārayati, and ativatteti above]
to lead astray, to deceive; 3pl. ~anti, Ja VI 206,4*
(nâtivahanti paññaṁ; = na vañcenti, Ct.).

n. (from ati-√vac), unkindly speech,
abuse, reproach, Abh 122 (anariya-vohāra-vasena yā
pavattitā . . . vācā); Dhp 320—21 (quoted Dhp-a I
212—-13; = aṭṭha-anariya-vohāra-vasena pavattaṁ
vītikkama-vacanaṁ, Dhp-a IV 3,10'); Ja VI 508,16*
(= garahā-vacanaṁ, Ct.).

m. [ts.], too much wind, storm; Mil
116,13 (~ena); 277,29 (~ena asani patati). — mfn.,
exposed to the wind; Mil 91,31 (loc. ~e, where it blows
hard, cf. paṭivāte); 92,3 (do.); 92,8* (~o); — °-ṭṭhāna,
n. id., Mil 91,27.

pr. 3 sg. [ati + √vā], to blow forth
Mil 333,12 (vāyanti ~anti, i.e. blow hither and
thither).

m. (from ati-vahati), (a) guide, con-
ductor, or means of conveyance, Th 616 (prob. ˇ - - - ,
cf. sa. atīsāra, atīreka; sīlaṁ seṭṭho ~o, = yānaṁ,
Th-a). — (b) driving or carrying too much, Ja V 433,4*
(~ena hananti puṅgavaṁ).

m(fn)., (from prec), one who guides
or escorts, Ja V 471,23 (°-purisehi parivuto); 472,17
(m. pl. ~ā, v. l. B. °-ka-purisā).
see 2ati-bāheti.

m., too late (inconvenient) a time or
moment; DN I 108,2 (~o kho . . . ajja Gotamaṁ
dassanāya upasamkamituṁ; = suṭṭhu vikālo, Sv);
II 159,26 (~o kho . . . ajja sarīraṁ jhāpetuṁ); Ja III
475,19 (ajja ~o jāto). Cf. atippago above.

pr. 3sg. [ati + √vyadh], to pierce
through, penetrate, see through; 3pl. ~anti (cittaṁ,
scil. sabbakilesā; v. l., Ed. ativiya vijjhanti) Dhp-a
I 122,15; abs. (a ) ~itvā, Ud-a 306,27 (attabhāvaṁ);
Spk ad SN I 193,20*; (b) ativijjha (sometimes written
ativijjhā): paññāya naṁ [scil. parama-saccam] ~
passati, MN I 480,10 (pativijjhati passati, Ps) = II
173,25 = AN II 115,13; Bhagavā paññāya ~ pañ-
ñāya passati, MN II 112,1; pajjotakaro~ sabba[ṭ]ṭhi-
tīnam atikkamam addā, SN I 193,20* (= ativij-
jhitvā, Spk); te [dhamme] paññāya ~ passāmi, SN V
226,13—227,1; ~ passati, SN V 230,19 (scil. pane' indri-
yāni, etc); paññāya c'assa atthaṁ ~ passati, AN II
178,28; gambhīraṁ atthapadaṁ paññāya ~ [Ed.
paṭivijjha] passati; AN IV 362,2.

m., too much diffusedness or pro-
lixity; °-bhayena (for fear of), Pj I 227,3 (saṁkhit-
taṁ); II 15,7; 131,10; 171,29. — °-tā, f. abstr., excess-
ively wide extent, Mil 278,13 (ākāso ~āya ananto).

mfn. (ati + pp. of vitthāreti), too
diffuse; Mhv I 2 (opp. atīva saṁkhitto).

mfn. (from ati + vipphāra), of
very great (luminous) pervading force; Mp III 201,21
(kayo pana tesaṁ [i. e. devā brahmakāyikā, AN IV
40,2] ~o va hoti).

mfn. (ati + pp. of vi-√smi), highly
wondering, very astonished; ~o, Ap 607,18; Mhv XIV
49 (°-mānaso).

ind. (ati + viya, cf. sa. atīva; another
form is atiriva (q. v.); cf. also atīva & ateva), ex-
ceedingly, very (much), highly; in Ctt. often used to
give the sense of prp. ati-, e. g. Sp ad Vin III 147,3*;
Sv ad DN III 1,6; (Ps I 107,5); Pv-a 139,13, etc. (cf.
Ja II 148,24, v. /.). — (a) before verbs: DN II 171,26
(~ dippissanti, v. r. to ativyā; Sv III 48,18); Mil 274,16
(suriyassa tāpo ~ tapati); Ja I 61,30 (~ pabbajjāya
cittaṁ nami); Dhp-a III 114,10 (~ me bhātikassa
vaṇṇaṁ kathenti); Pv-a 284,23 (~ vissaraṁ karonto);
— (b) before an adj.: Ja I 263,11 (~ dhammiko);
VI 542,8 (~ pharuso); Dhp-a II 71,17 (~ upakārako);
Ja VI 549,25' (~ bhiṁsanako; Edd. ativiya, Ck omits);
after the adj. with foll. instr, (abl.) = much more
(than), DN II 177,19-28 ≠ MN III 176,11-19 (abhi-
rūpo . . . ~ aññehi manussehi); — (c) before a corn-
par, with instr, (abl): DN II 136,1 (~ aññehi piṇḍa-
pātehi mahapphalatarā), quoted Mil 174,14-29.

n., too great exertion, Mil 245,8 (~aṁ
karonto).

pr. 3sg., to shine excessively; Ps II
474,20 (Se ativiya virocanti); aor. 3sg. med. ~ittha,
Ps III 23,2 = Ud-a 415,24.

mfn. [sa. ati-viṣa], very poisonous,
Cp III 11,9 (saha-daṭṭho ~ena, i. e. by the snake,
styled āsīvisa ib. 11,7). — n. [cf. sa. ativiṣā & next],
name of a plant; Vin IV 35,1 (belonging to mūla-bīja
(q. v.): haliddi (haliddaṁ?) +) = Sv I 81,17 (atîva
visati bhesajja-payogesū ti ~am, ativisā vā, nṭ); Vin
I 201,2 (~aṁ, acc; used in medicine: mūlāni bhe-
sajjāni: haliddaṁ +; quoted Sp ad Vin IV 35,13).

f. [sa. ativiṣā, cf. prec.], name of a
medicinal plant, Abh 586 (MTD: 'able to counteract
poison', garlic, dried ginger).

mfn., too wide, too broad; huge; Ja I
7,25' (~e caṁkame); VI 422,12' (~o, makkaṭako).
— °-tā, f. abstr., Ja I 7,16-26' (opp. atisambādhatā).

mfn., very pure or bright; ~ena
maṁsa-cakkhunā, Ps III 11,11; ummā-puppha-sadi-
sena ~ena nīla-vaṇṇena, Ps III 354,9.

mfn. (ati + pp. of vi-√sṛj), too
cursive or abundant; only in the comp. °-vākya,
mfn., talking too fluently, Ja V 204,3* (bindussaro
nâtivisaṭṭhavākyo; cf. DN II 227,22-24).

mfn. (ati + pp. of vi-√çvas), very
trusting or confident; Pj II 316,4 (mātāpitusu viya
~ā manussā ahesuṁ); Ps ad MN II 52,22 (= 'abhi-
vissattha'; Se abhivissaṭṭho 'ti ativissaṭṭho).

mfn., very intimate or familiar,
Ja I 86,14 (rañño sabbattha-sādhako abbhantariko
~o). Cf. prec.

mfn. (ati + pp. of vi-√çru), very
renowned, Saddh 473 (khantiyā ~o).

f. [sa. ati-vṛṣti], excessive rain; Ja IV
381,10' (°-kāle); Ps III 405,10 (avuṭṭhi-°); Rūp Ce
87,9 (Pay) (along with atikodho as ex. of the sense
'bhusa' of prp. ati).

mfn, [sa. ati-vṛddha], very old,
Abh 918 (= 'jeṭṭha').

m., great haste; Mil 245,22 (~ena
gaccheyya). _

pr.3sg. (denom, from prec), to
make too much haste; aor. 2sg. mā ~āyi, Mp I 428,18.

pr. 3sg. [ati + √veṣṭ], (a) to insnare
(once more, in return); MN II 248,11 (taṁ enaṁ so
nibbeṭhentaṁ ~eti) = 249,7 = Vin II 101,13;
— (b) to insnare (and choke); 3pl. ~ayanti, Ja V 452,26*
(= ativiya veṭhenti, pīḷenti, Ct.; cf. ajjhāroha).

mfn. [ts.], passing the proper limit,
excessive, improper, unseasonable; SN I 210,11* (f. ~ā,
scil. piyāyanā; = velâtikkantā pamāṇâtikkantā,
Spk); Sn 973 (vācaṁ kusalaṁ nâtivelaṁ, = atītave-
laṁ, Pj; cf. Nidd I 504,10); — acc n. ~aṁ, adv.,
excessively, too much; improperly; of time: too late, too
long; DN I 19,12 (= atikālaṁ aticiraṁ, Sv); III 32,16
= 88,25 (~ aññamaññaṁ upanijjhāyanti); MN I
122,14 (bhikkhunīhi saddhiṁ ~ saṁsaṭṭho; = velaṁ
atikkamitvā, Ps); AN III 259,8 (bhikkhuno ~ kulesu
saṁsaṭṭhassa; = atikkanta-ppamāṇa-kālaṁ, Mp);
SN I 201,17 (aññatarasmiṁ kule ~ ajjhogāḷhappatto;
= atikkantaṁ velaṁ, Spk; cf. ib. 201,4*); II 268,22
(~ kulāni upasaṁkamati); Ud 75,9 (kāmesu ~ sattā,
etc.; = velaṁ atikkamitvā, Ud-a); Ja I 432,12*
(~ pabhāsitā vācā); III 103,12* (~ pabhāsati, quoted
Nidd I 504,15*); V 100,3* (~ pamajjasi); VI 100,10*
(~ namassissaṁ; = niccakālaṁ, Ct.); 295,20* (nâtive-
laṁ pabhāseyya); 388,30* (rattiṁ giraṁ nâtivelaṁ
pamuñce; Ct.); 472,21* (~ pajagghati); 475,18* (do.);
555,11* (~ nūna ammāya uñcho [Edd. uñchā] laddho
anappako, i. e. too late). — °-cāri(n), mfn., who is
out too long (too late), SN I 201,4* (metre corrupt); Ja V
18,26' (v.r. for ativelasāyi(n) ib. 16,5*); — °-bhāṇi(n),
mfn., talking unseasonably, Ja IV 247,25*; 248,6*-io';
— °-sāyi(n), mfn., who sleeps too long (in the morning),
Ja V 16,5* (= aticiraṁ pi niddaṁ okkameyya, ib.
18,25-26', ativelacārī ti pi pāṭho); — °ânurakkhi(n),
mfn., too much attentive (to, loc), MN II 139,12 (pat-
tasmiṁ, opp. anatthiko pattena).

ind. = ativiya [cf. (evaṁ) vyā (kho) . . .],
DN III 71,26 (so Sv; see ativiya (a)).

m. Npr. of a man, Mogg-v III 23 (Pay)
(~o ca Bhāradvājo ca Atisa-Bhāradvājaṁ [dvandva
n.], cf. Candra-v II 2,50, etc.).

m., a super-Sakka (an epithet of the
Buddha), Ps I 51,15 (Sakkānaṁ ~o) — Mp I 111,4
= Ud-a 132,2; Vism 2,7 (do.).

mfn., very much honoured; f. ~ā,
Ap 556,6 (= Thī-a 193,26*, Ee abhisammatā); 589,6.

f. [sa. ati-çakvarī], a class of
metres, Vutt 92—95 (sasikalā +).

m. [sa. ati-sarga, Pāṇ III 3,163],
'dismissal', granting permission or leave, Kacc 637
(Mmd); Sadd III 882; Mogg-v V 33.

m., excessive abridgement, Pj II
334,12 (~ena vuttaṁ).

n. [sa. ati-sarjana], giving a directive,
instructing; given as sense of √dis [sa. √diç], Dhātup
303,493; Dhātum 475, 572; Sadd II 980 ( — pabo-
dhana, Sadd-ns); MTD (= a present).

m. [ts.], too much wandering about,
Mil 277,30 (~ena na ciraṁ jīvati; Se ati-sūrena(?)).

mfn. [sa. ati-çlakṣṇa], too fine or
terse, i. e. too abstruse or subtle; Dhp-a III 326,13 (~ā
abhidhamma-kathā; = siyum, Rt, cf. Ud-a 9,24).

mfn. (ati + 1santa [pp. of √çam]),
too calm; Ja IV 56,24* (loc. ~e; anto upasame avijja-
māne yeva bahi upasama-dassanena atisante viya,
Ct.); —- very calm or tranquil (cf. accanta-santa):
Saddh 496 (asokaṁ ~aṁ); [atisanto, Ap 461,22, read
atisento; see atiseti].

ind. (ati + santike, loc), too near,
Mhv XV 8 (nâtidūrâ°, neither too far nor too near).

mfn. [sa. ati-sarva], superior to all,
Mogg-v II 142 (te sabbā, te piyasabbā, te ~ā; cf.
Mahābhāṣya I 87,9).

m., a chief among the samaṇā,
Mil 277,12 (samaṇānaṁ ~o).

mfn., too narrow, too restricted;
~aṁ (cakkavāḷaṁ, q. v.), Dhp-a I 310,18; III 310,12
(313,1) - Vv-a68,3; Ja III 244,2' (~e okāse); IV
430,15 (senāsanaṁ ~aṁ). — °-tā, f. abstr., Ja I 7,
l5'-25' (opp. ativisālatā).

and °-khā, ind., too much in
front, too near (face to face); ~aṁ (opp. atipacchā),
Sp I 129,16 (atidūraṁ+), cf. ~âdike cha nisajjā-
dose vajjetvā, Ud-a 53,24; — abl. (adv.) ~ā, Sp I
129,20 (~ nisinno).

mfn. (ati + pp. of sam-√muh),
too bewildered or stupid, Sv I 117,31 (= 'momuha').

m. [sa. atiçaya], excess, excellence,
Abh 41; 761 ≠ 771 (ukkaṁso ~o); = √vi-sis, Sadd
567,31; giving the sense of prp. ati: Abh 1182; Rūp
p. 87,9; Sadd 881,9 (e.g. atikusala); Pj II 488,1 (na
tassa vacanena koci ~o atthi [cf.punavacana, ib.
487,19] a superfluous repetition); Vv-a 135,26 (~aṁ
adhigatā = 'visesam ajjhagā'); instr. ~ena (adv.),
exceedingly, Pay fol. ghaṁ 2 (~ena thutaṁ =
abhitthutaṁ); giving the sense of the comparative:
Pv-a 86,10 (sammā ~ena alaṁkatā = 'samalaṁkata-
(ta)ra'); Ud-a 103,17 (~mahaddhano = 'mahaddhana-
taro'); 275,15 (attano ~ piyaṁ = 'piyataram attanā');
abl. ~to, in a high degree, Ud-a 223,8. — mfn., Ud-a
109,19 (synon, anuttaraṁ).—• Ifc. v.nir-°, pasādâ°,
vikkamâ°, sâ°.
(pr. 3 sg., abs. °-sayitvā, see ati-seti.

m. (atisaya + 2attha), something
of importance, Dhp-a III 395,2.

m., further suppression, Vism
166,2. — °-tta, n. abstr., ib.

mfn., overfilled, Ps I 268,31
(~ā udaka-bhājanā; Ee atibharitā).

mfn., excessively clear, Pj II
441,30 (~āhi vijjāhi).

mfn., Ja IV 6,10* (according to Ja IV
6,12'; but see atisarati, aor. 2 sg.).

(pr. 3 sg. [ati + l/sî ]> (a) to go too far
or beyond; (b) to pass over, overlook, ignore; (c) to
transgress, to sin; aor. 3 sg. (a ) acc-asāri, Sn 8-13 (a)
(nâccasāri na paccasāri, — nâtidhāvi, Pj); (β) acc-
asarā, SN I 239,15 (c; = atikkami, Spk); Dhp-a IV
230,9 (a; impersonally ~ā te [butcf. MN I 304,20 below];
(γ) without augment: atisari, Ja IV 6,12' (c); — aor.
2 sg. (a ) acc-asā, SN III 189,27 (so Spk Se, noting
v. l. accasarā; = atikkanto si; Ee assa, v. l. accayā)
= SN V 218,19 (Ee ajjhaparaṁ) (a), ~ pañhaṁ, í. e.
to ask loo much); (β) acc-asarā (pañhaṁ), MN I 304,20
(a; = pañhaṁ atikkamitvā gato si, Ps) quoted Mp
I 362,22; (γ) ati-saro & acc-asaro, Ja IV 6,10* (c; by
Ct. taken as adjectives); — aor. 1 sg. acc-asariṁ, Ja
V 70,1* (went astray; = manussapatham atikkamitvā
. . . pāvisiṁ, Ct.); — fut. 3 sg. ~issati, Ja IV 6,12'
(c); — abs. atisitvā (b): Sn 908; DN I 222,9 (Bhaga-
vantaṁ~); MN I 111,10 (do.) = III 195,4 = 224,25
= SN IV 94,29 = AN V 226,23 = 256,27 ≠ Pj I
122,25; AN I 145,29 (attānaṁ yeva ~; = atikka-
mitvā, Mp). —- Cf. accāsarati.

m., excessive abstinence or chastity,
Mp I 162,26 (°-mukhena); — °-vutti, f., id., Ud-a
81,35.

pr. 3 sg. (denom, ati + sallekha),
to lay too much strain upon (abstinence); Ps ad MN I
449,12 (= 'adhisallikhati', cf. Mp ad AN I 236,30
& Sadd 330,19).

ind., too suddenly, roughly; Vin II
215,8 (~ pavisanti).

mfn., very sweet or delicious; ~uṁ,
As 204,2 (atimadhuraṁ + ; Ee °sādhuṁ).

ind. [ts.], too late, very late in the
evening; Th 231 = DN III 185,12*; DN III 184,5 (~
ti kammaṁ na karoti); Ja II 362,12 (etha, nâ° eva
gacchāma); Ja V 94,1 (ajja ~ āgatā si); 94,3* (~
vat' āgañchi).

m., very late evening; Ja VI 540,17
(see aha(n)).

(& atī-sāra), m. (& n., see 3 below)
[ts], 1. dysentery, Dhp-a I 182,25 (soko . . . kucchi-
ḍāhaṁ uppādetvā atīsāraṁ janesi); — 2. overstepping,
deviation, MN III 234,33 (samaññāya ~o, /•. e. from
the common language, janapada-niruttiyā abhiniveso
+ ; cf. samaññaṁ nâtidhāveyya, ib. 30); — 3. trans-
gression, sin, SN I 74,11* (~aṁ na bujjhanti; =
atikkamaṁ, Spk); Ja V 379,11* (atthi me taṁ ~aṁ
[ ˇ - - -]; = pakkhalitaṁ, Ct.). — °-diṭṭhi, f., see
atīsaraṁ-diṭṭhi below. —- Ifc. v. an-°, dhammâ°,
rattâ°, vinayâ°, sâ°.

mfn. (from ati-sarati), ifc. v. lak-
khaṇâ°. ati-sari

mfn., very violent, Mhv XX 58
(aniccatā).

[n., too much training, Mil 277,30
(only in Se 255,3: ~ena ummattako hoti).

m. [ati + isi°], a great crowd of
sages, Kacc-v 47 (Sadd 619,13).
abs. see (ati-sarati).

mfn., too loose (slack or weak), Vin I
182,33 = AN III 375,13 (vīṇāya tantiyo ~ā; opp.
accāyatā; = manda-mucchanā, Mp); ~aṁ, Mp ad AN
III 375,19 (= 'atilīnaṁ' scil. viriyaṁ). — °-viriyatā,
f., too weak exertion (determination), Ps I 298,15 (opp.
accāraddha-viriyatā).

mfn., too cold, rather cold or cool (opp.
ati-uṇha, acc-uṇha); Th 231 = DN III 185,11*; DN
III 184,4 (~an ti kammaṁ na karoti; Sv); Ja I
87,5* (nâ°) = Mp I 303,3*; Ja III 423,5; IV 44,8;
Dhp-a II 85,17. — °-tā, f. absfr., Mil 278,8 (udakaṁ
~āya nibbāpeti). Cf. next.

mfn. = prec; Ja III 55,17; 423,7;
VI 3,6.

mfn., going beyond the boundary,
Ja III 256,17* = 485,1*.

mfn., quite dry; Ps ad MN III 118,4
(nâtisukkhe bhājane, = 'āmaka-matte').

mfn., very fine or subtle; Ud-a
136,2 (°-tirokuḍḍa-vidūradesesu rūpadhammesu);
— °-ôdaka, mfn., whose water is very fine or ethereal,
Ja VI 100,15' (~ā, scil. Sīdā nāma nadī).

m., a mad dog(1), Abh 519 (or with
Tr. ummattâditaṁ āpanno alakko 'ti suno); Abh-
sūci: ati-suṇa.

mfn. [ts.], very beautiful; Ps III
675,11 (~ā kambalā); Pj II 155,16 ('abhikkantaṁ' ti
atikkantaṁ+) = Ud-a 286,11 = Sp I 170,28.

mfn., over-heroical, Ja V 473,16 (said
of a cannibal, worse than other giants ); — °-tā,
f. abstr., Abh 398 (vikkamo+).

pr. 3 sg. [ati + √çī], to excel, surpass, Ap
461,20 (read: sabbagandhe 'tiseti); 510,11; Mp III 21,16
(ad AN III 33,5: 'adhigaṇhātîti' abhibhavitvā gaṇ-
hāti [Ce 620,10 adhibhavitvā g° and adds ajjhottha-
rati atiseti]); part. act. °sento Ap 461,22 (Ee atisanto);
med. °-semāna, Pj II 140,25; abs. °-sayitvā, Mil
336,27 (sabba-ratanāni atikkamitvā ~ ajjhottharitvā
tiṭṭhati).

(pr. 3 sg.) [ati + √sev], to have too
much intercourse with (acc); part. gen. °-sevantassa
(apaññaṁ), Ja III 526,18' (= 'bālaṁ accūpasevato').

mfn. (ati + issara), very powerful
(masterful, self-willed), Ja IV 476,16. Cf. ati-issara.

mfn. (ati + pp. of √hṛ), carried too long
away, Ja III (484,29*) 485,25' (v. l. Cks for ati-gata).

mfn. (ati + pp. of √hrs), very pleased,
Mhv XV 17; Saddh 323.

pr. 3 sg. (denom, ati + hat-
thi(n)), to get over by means of an elephant, Kacc-v
441 (= hatthinā atikkamati maggaṁ) = Sadd 823,30
= Mogg-v V 12.

n. (from next), taking into, Ps I
260,33 foll. (: vītiharana, vossajjana) = Sv I 192,29
foll. = Vibh-a 355,1 foll.

pr. 3 sg. [ati + √hṛ], to move (from
one place to another); to bring, fetch; to carry into (or
home); 3 pl. ~anti, Vin IV 264,16; aor. 3 sg. acc-ahāsi,
Ja III 484,16* (= ativiya āhari, Ct.); atihari, Ja I
292,16; abs. ~itvā, Vin I 48,21; II 209,13; Sp I 9,1
= Pj I 93,22; Ja V 347,14'; pp. atihaṭa & atihita
(q. v.); caus. v. next.

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of prec), to make
carry into (or home), esp. to harvest (gather into barn);
to seize upon, confiscate; pot. 3 sg. ~eyya, AN I 242,1
(phalāni); 2 sg. ~eyyāsi, Mil 66,13, 20 (dhaññaṁ);
2 pl. ~eyyātha, ib. 81,15 (do.); aor. 3 pl. ~esuṁ,
Vin III 18,1 (aputtakaṁ sāpateyyaṁ ~); abs. ~etvā,
Vin II 181,2; AN I 242,1; Dhp-a IV 77,1 (tassa ge-
hato dhanaṁ rājakulaṁ ~); Ud-a 274,1 (taṁ ante-
puraṁ ~); grd. ~etabba, mfn., Vin II 181,2.

mfn. (pp. of ati-harati; but cf. sa.
ati-hita of ati + √dhā), harvested, Th 381 (m. pl. ~ā
vīhī; = koṭṭhāgāraṁ upanetvā ṭhapitā, Th-a).

mfn., mean, scanty, frugal (opp. acco-
gālha); AN IV 282,21 = 323,25 (jīvikaṁ).

(pr. 3 sg. [ati + hīḷeti, cf. sa. \/heā,
ved. √hiḍ], to despise; only part. med. ~ayāna, Ja IV
331,1* (sakaṁ niketaṁ ~o; = atimaññanto gara-
hanto).

ind., too much below (opp. ati-upari),
Sv I 252,27 = Ps III 324,11 (dvāraṁ . . . ~ dīghajā-
tikā koṭṭenti).

pr. 3 sg. [ati + √bhū], to be superior,
surpass, excel; to master; Ja I 163,6* (Ee perhaps
better atibhoti; = vañceti, Ct., suggesting also: kalā-
hati bhoti); III 341,9* (sabbe pañhe); 1 sg. ati-
bhomi, Ap 154,11.

mfn. [ts.], (a) past, passed away; no more
existing, former, belonging to past times (ifc. also: who
has passed, or overcome, cf. (b) below); ~aṁ rūpaṁ
(etc.), SN III 71,19 (+ niruddhaṁ vipariṇataṁ);
Vibh 1,14 (+ niruddhaṁ vigataṁ vipariṇatam at-
thaṅgataṁ; Vibh-a 8,2 : addhā-santati-samaya-khaṇa-
vasena catudhā ~aṁ nāma hoti, ≠ Vism 472,31);
~aṁ cakkhuṁ (etc.), SN IV 151,12 foll.; ~o addhā,
DN III 216,16 (+ anāgato ... paccuppanno); It
53,21; Mil 49,30; acc ~aṁ addhānaṁ, DN III 134,2;
220,9; AN I 197,11; esp. adverbially = in bygone
times (opp. anāgataṁ), DN III 99,17 foll.; MN I 8,1;
III 109,2; SN II 58,6 foll.; It 70,5; pl. ~ā dhammā,
Dhs (p. 2,14; As 45,31) 1038, 1416; acc ~e Buddhe
. . . anussarati, scil. Tathāgato, DN II 8,5; 53,16; loc.
~esu, Sn 373 (+ anāgatesu; scil. pañcakkhandhesu,
Pj); — (b) who has transgressed or neglected: Dhp
I 76 (ekaṁ dhammaṁ ~assa); = free from (with
abl.; cf. saṅgātīta, etc.): saṅgā jāti-jarā-bhayā
