~aṁ, scil. maggaṁ, Th 413; — (c) n. subst., (α) the
past, olden times, or what has passed; ~aṁ eko anto,
anāgataṁ dutiyo anto, AN III 400,1; Nidd I 109,1;
~aṁ nânusocati, Sn 851 (Nidd); SN I 5,6*; Ja VI
25,6* (cf. ib. 25,8*); 251,2* (= atīta-kammaṁ, Ct.);
~aṁ ādisati, Sn 1112; ~ena paṭisantharati, DN III
186,6 (Sv); ~aṁ nânvāgameyya . . . yad-atītaṁ pahī-
naṁ taṁ, MN III 187,21-22*; yaṁ ~aṁ taṁ pahīnaṁ,
SN II 283,32 (cf. Th 1036); loc ~e (adv.), formerly,
Ja I 98,8, etc. passim [cf. bhūtapubbaṁ MN II 74,24
and Mvu III 28,6]; ~e pi . . . anāgate pi, Ja I 486,15';
— (β) a tale of the past, Ja I 157,19 (~aṁ āhari, see
Ja I 154,1) etc. passim (cf. atīta-vatthu). — Atīta-
[sutta], title of more suttas, SN IV 151-2. — Ifc. v.
an-°, anantarâ°, kappâ°, kālâ°, khaṇâ°, khayâ°,
cakkhuvisayâ°, bhayâ° [bhayam-°], bhavâ°,
verabhayâ°, saṅgâ°, sabba-vākya-pathâ°, sabba-
verabhayâ , sabbasaṁyojanâ°.

m. (atīta + 1aṁsa), the past; ~ena
saṅgahitā (scil. dhammā), Dhs 1038 (= atīta-koṭṭhā-
sena, As); loc. ~e, Thī 314 (= atīte koṭṭhāse, Thī-a);
DN II 222,19 (n' eva ~e . . . na pan' etarahi); III
275,20 (~e ñāṇaṁ, v. l. atītaṁsa-ñāṇaṁ; = atītaṁ-
sârammanaṁ ñānaṁ, Sv); MN II 218,19 (~e satthari
saddhā; Ps); AN'iII 373,1* (read with Mp Ce : ahiṁs'
ete atītaṁse cha satthāṛo). — °-ñāṇa, n., knowledge
of the past, DN III 275,20, v. l. (Sv). — °-vāda, m.,
reference to the past for evidence, Ps ad MN II
218,19; hence °-vādi(n), m(fn)., ib.

m., the past kalpas, Cp I 1,2 (~e
caritaṁ; opp. imamhi kappe).

n., a former deed; Ja VI 251,10'
(= 'atītaṁ').

mfn., belonging to, or concerning
the past time; Pj I 194,24 (purāṇaṁ ~aṁ kammaṁ);
II 16,24 (~ānam pi hi chandasi vattamāna-vacanaṁ
. . . icchanti); Sadd 49,27. — °-tā, f. abstr., Sadd 52,33.

m., the past-division (of time),
As 361,16 (= 'atītaṁsa'); 393,1 (= 'pubbanta'; cf.
also Sv I 103,21).

mfn., whose Master has
passed away long ago, Th 1035 (abbhatīta-sahāyassa
°-satthuno); cf. atīta-satthuka and the formula abbha-
tīto kālagato; as to 'tautology in cpd.s' see āyata-
cakkhu-netta, kinnara-netta-cakkhu, (mānusa-deha-
vaṇṇa, Ja IV 438,22*, cf. ib. 439,1*), siṅgī-nikkha-
savaṇṇa, and perhaps aññāṇa-mūla-ppabhava. atīta-gata-sattha

f., title of Kv I ch. 7
(p. 143-51).

f., a former existence, Pv-a 10,21
(pubbe ~iyaṁ, — 'pure'); Pj I 133,21.

m., a deceased kinsman, Ps ad MN I
513,30 (°-kathā, = 'pubba-peta-kathā'; cf. Sv I
90,28).

n. (abstr. of atīta), the having passed,
or overcome; Pj II 528,20 (kilesa-sīmānaṁ ~ā 'sīmâ-
tigo'); Mp ad AN V 326,25 (antaṁ ~ā, etc., com-
menting accanta-°).

mfn. (atīta + 2attha), who has
missed his profit; AN IV 228,4* (vāṇijo; = hāpitattha,
Mp); Ja V 78,26' (= 'atīta-m-attha'). — m. something
mentioned before, the preceding; °-nidassana, n.,
reference to the preceding, Pj I 230,4 (= 'evaṁ').

m., 'the past way', i. e. a former
existence, Pj II 549,3 (°-âdi-bhedaṁ, scil. pubbam
antaṁ; cf. paccuppanne addhani, etc. ib. 4). atīt'-addha

f., a question about the past, Nidd I
340,19 (Nidd-a II 78,10).

m., a former existence; Ja V 382,28
{read: ~e n'eva); Ud-a 43,10.

mfn. (atīta + 2attha; as to -m-
see next), who has missed his aim, Ja V 77,23* = 80,2*
(= atītattho atikkantattho, Ct.); on both places pre-
ceded by guy ham atthaṁ.

loc. of atītam addhānaṁ, see
atīta (a), in times past, Ja III 43,1* (= atīte addhāne,
Ct.). Cf. atītam addhā, Ja VI 251,2* (see addhā, ind.).

mfn., surpassing human
power or standard; Ja VI 439,21*,29* (Cks atītaṁ
mānusakaṁ kammaṁ, Ee atītaṁ mānusaṁ, read
atītamānusaṁ; Ja VI 440,1' read atītamānusaṁ =
manussehi kattabbaṁ kammaṁ atītaṁ); Vv 966
(~am eva sabbaṁ; Ee °mānussakaṁ, and metr.
ˇ - ˇ - - ˇ ˇ). Cf. atikkanta-mānusaka. atīta-mānusa

mfn., one whose youth has
passed, Sn 110 (= yobbanaṁ aticca āsītiko vā nāvu-
tiko vā hutvā, Pj).

n., designation of the past, Sadd
590,22; pl. ~āni, ib. 49,28.

n., a tale of the past (ɔ: the central
portion of a Jātaka tale preceded by the paccuppanna-
vatthu and followed by the jātaka-samodhāna; cf.
atlta ɔcp)); Ja II 333,27; III 93,8; 524,15; IV 469,1.

mfn., unseasonable, Pj II 574,12 ( =
'ativela').

mfn. (from atīta + sattha(r)),
having no master more; ~aṁ pāvacanaṁ, n'atthi no
satthā, DN II 154,4 (quoted Mil 99,1); ~aṁ pāvaca-
naṁ ti maññamānā, Sp 14,19 = Sv I 2,32 = Pj I
90,1; ifc. an-°, mfn., still having a master, Sp 14,21
= Sv I 3,3 = Pj I 90,10 (yāva ca dhamma-vinayo
tiṭṭhati, tāva ~aṁ pāvacanaṁ hoti); cf. atīta-gata-
sattha(r).

mfn., disobeying the advice or
warning given, Ja III 256,17* — 485,4*.

n. (atīta + adhivacana), desig-
nation or term of the past; °-kusala, mfn., con-
versant with that, Nett 33,6 (+anāgatâ°, pacuppannâ°;
= atīta-paññatti-kusalo, Nett-a).

mfn. (atīta + an-antara), imme-
diately preceding; Ja V 458,27 (~e attabhāve); VI
200,21 (~e bhave); Mp I 313,18 (~āya jātiyā). Cf.
anantarâtīta.

mfn. (atīta + an-āgata), past and
future; SN III 19,16 (rūpaṁ aniccaṁ ~aṁ); IV 4,2
(cakkhuṁ, do.); loc. ~e (adv.), SN II 58,4 (= atīte
ca anāgate ca, Spk); Ja VI 364,22 (~vā etarahi vā);
—-°-paccuppanna, mfn., past, future, and present (this
order [3 + 4 + 4 syllables, cf. also ahū . . . bhavissati
. . . etarahi vijjati, DN III 100,20] is always observed,
except in cases as atītaṁ paccuppannaṁ anāgataṁ,
Pv-a 100,18; cf. Sadd 54,1 foll.): DN I 137,29 (Sv);
140,24 (~e atthe cintetuṁ); III 100,24 (~esu arahan-
tesu); 135,4 (~esu dhammesu); MN I 112,3 (~esu
cakkhu-viññeyyesu rūpesu); 139,6 (yaṁ kiñci viñ-
ñāṇaṁ ~aṁ); 234,33 (rūpaṁ); SN II 252,18 (do.);
III 47,12 (do.); 187,30 (do.); AN I 284,25 (do.); II
171,11 (do.), etc.; Vibh 1,9 (do); Mil 3,28 (gen. pl.
~ānaṁ); 90,14 (acc. pl. ~e sammā-sambuddhe);
226,14 (do. ~e pāpake akusale dhamme).
— °- -kathā, f., = Kv IX ch. 12 (p. 417—419).
— °- -buddha-vaṇṇanā-gāthā, f., title of a work, Gv
66,1. — °- -sut'ta, n., title of three suttas, SN III
19-20.

mfn. (atīta + ārammaṇa),
having the past as object; Dhs (p. 2,15; As 45,35) 1041,
1417 (dhammā); Abhidh-av 45,1* (quoted Sadd 54,10);
Vism 430,12 (cittaṁ); Vibh-a 157,20-21 (cuti ...
paṭisandhi). — °-kathā, f. — Kv IX ch. 6 (p. 410
— 411). — °-ttika, m., the triplet beginning with atītâram-
maṇa, = Dhs p. 2,15; Tikap 335,25; As 361,19
(°niddese); Vism 429,32.

mfn. (from a + tīra), unlimited; ~aṁ
ñāṇadassanaṁ, DN III 134,3 (= atīraṁ, aparicche-
daṁ, mahantaṁ, Sv).

mfn. (a + grd. of tīreti), impracti-
cable, Ja VI 57,11* (~aṁ idaṁ kammaṁ; = na tīre-
tabbaṁ, Ct.); cf. however apāraṇeyya, ib. 36,6*,13*,
where Ct. sees a-pāra-neyya (√nī prāpaṇe); thus here
a-tīra-neyya, cf. tiṇṇo, Ja VI 57,10*.

mfn., having no sight of the
shore; SN III 164,33 (m. ~ī apāradassī; Spk: tīraṁ
vuccati vaṭṭaṁ . . . pāraṁ vuccati nibbānaṁl); Ja I
46,14*; VI 440,15* (~ī puriso; = tīraṁ apassanto,
Ct.); Mil 220,23 (samuddam pi ~ī pakkhandati); Ja V
75,11 (loc. f. °-dassiniyā [Ee °-dassaniyāya] nāvāya,
cf. prec).

ind. [ts.] = ativiya (q. v.), cf. ateva;
Th 537; Thī312; Ja II 235,5* (~ hadayaṁ nibbāti);
Ps I 92,9; Pj II 366,12 (= 'aticca'); 407,16 (~ bhā-
santi); 424,16 (~ patthayamāno, = 'abhi-kaṅkha-
māno'); 496,4-5 (~ tosento, ~ tussati); 511,26 (~
attamano); sometimes v. l. for ativiya. — [atīva-
gandhā, w. r. Vv 967; read atīva gandho surabhiṁ
pavāyati].

f., heretical views; Sn 889 (~iyā
so samatto, v. l. B. atisāra-diṭṭhiyā; Pj: so evaṁ
tāya lakkhaṇâtisāriniyā atisāra-diṭṭhiyā samatto;
Nidd: atisāra-diṭṭhiyo vuccanti dvāsaṭṭhi diṭṭhiga-
tāni); probably atīsaraṁ diṭṭhiyā (atī-saraṁ part. m.
of ati-sarati with ī for i as in next).
m., see ati-sāra (1).

ind, [aty-ucca], too high; Ja III
255,18* (~ tāta patasi; = ati-uccaṁ gacchasi, Ct.).
Cf. ati-uccaṁ.

mfn., not empty; Ap 314,16 (atuc-
chôjjhāna-mañco, see ujjhāna(mañca)).
[w. r. for atraja (q. v.), DN III 162,2*.]

mfn. (a + pp. of √tus); discontented;
Ja VI 517,11* (~ā Sivayo); Sv I 52,2 (appatītā +).
— °-mānasa, mfn., id., Pv-a 127,17. — °-vācā, f.,
words of discontent, Mp ad AN I 54,20 (= 'anatta-
mana-vācā' or '-vacana'). — °-âkāra, m. (state of)
discontent; Mp ad AN I 79,31 and 238,1 (= 'ap-
paccaya').

f., discontent; Ps ad MN I 140,18 ( =
'anabhiraddhi').

mfn. (a + pp. of √tur), not hastening,
slow; Sv I 252,19 (so Bm and Se [Ee a-taranto]
— 'ataramāno'); Mp ad AN V 65,19 (do.). — °-gamana,
n., walking slowly; Mp I 303,8 (~ena cārikaṁ nik-
khami). — °-cārikā, f., id., esp. the quiet gait
of the Buddha, as described in Sv I 241,13—243,30;
Ja I 87,17 (~aṁ pakkāmi); Spk II 222,8, 13-15; Pj II
440,2-io; Ud-a 183,29-35; °-vasena, Ud-a 240,32;
377,15; 408,8.

mfn. [ts.], 'which cannot be weighed',
beyond measure, unequalled; Ja VI 213,10* (~o apeyyo,
scil. samuddo); Pv 246 (dānaṁ sahatthā ~añ ca
datva saṁghe; = appamāṇaṁ uḷāraṁ paṇītaṁ, Pv-a);
432 (~e; = mahārahe, loc. m., or = asadisarūpe,
voc. f., Pv-a); Vv 282 (~āya pītiyā; = anupamāya
appamāṇāya); Pj I 170,9* (ratanaṁ tena vuccati;
cf. ib. 171,28—174,6) = Ud-a 304,6*; Ps I 51,14 (~o
+ appameyyo anuttaro); Ja IV 234,3' (= 'anadhi-
vara'); Mil 117,8 (°-vipulânuttara); 208,1 (~aṁ vipu-
lam asamaṁ); 224,8 (bhiyyo somanassaṁ ~aṁ uppā-
desi); Saddh 345 (~o abbhutôruguṇâkaro); 496 (asu-
labham abbhutam +); 578 (~o asamo, etc.); Bv IV 2
(atulâsi, so Ct. giving v. r. atulyâsi) ≠ Mvu I 250,1*;
— opp. to tula (q.v.): DN II 107,3* = Ud 64,29* (tulaṁ
atulaṁ ca sambhavaṁ, according to Ct.s: 'inferior
and exalted birth'; Ud-a 329,6: na tulaṁ atulaṁ,
sadisaṁ assa aññaṁ . . . n'atthi ≠ Sv II 205,1) =
SN V 263,1* = AN IV 312,1*. — °-teja(s), mfn., of
unequalled brilliancy or efficacy, Bv IX 3 (°tejassa;
v. r. °tejā, scil. abhisamayā); Mil 343,10. — °-bala,
mfn., of unequalled power, Mil 343,10. — °-yasa,
mfn., of unequalled fame, ib. — °-ânubhāva, mfn.
= °-teja(s), Ja VI 313,6* (ṭhānaṁ); Vv 969 (vi-
mānaṁ).

m. Npr. 1. of an old physician, Mil 272,12.
— 2. of an upāsaka at Sāvatthi, Dhp-a III 325,18
foll.; his story °-upāsaka-vatthu, ib. 325—29. — 3. of
two different nāgarājas (Bodhisatta), BvV 15; Ja I
34,20; Bv XX 10; Ja I 41,12; Mhbv 10,18, resp. 11,15.
— 4. of a mango tree, also Atulamba, Ja IV 324,13-14.
— 5. (or in the full form °-vamsa) of one or more
theras, Sās 106,6; 124,1 foll.; 161,15. — 6. of a
vihāra, Sās 111,1; also °-bhūmivāsa, ib. 133,2.

mfn. (a + pp. of √tul), 'not weighed',
not examined; aditthaṁ +, Nidd I 339,10 (Nidd-a II
77,15); Ps I 52,26.

(or atulya, atulla, q. v.) [sa. atulya,
a + grd. of √tul], unequalled, invaluable; Thī 201
(akampitaṁ ~aṁ . . . dhammaṁ; Thī-a); Bv III 37;
XIII 32 (so Bv-a); 35; Mil 192,2 (bhikkhubhāvo ~o
appamāṇo anagghaniyo); 249,25 (pañca ~e guṇe);
357,1 (~aṁ dhutaguṇaṁ appameyyaṁ asamaṁ, etc.).
— °-guṇa, mfn., of unequalled virtue, Mil 343,10.
m. Npr. of seven cakkavattis, Ap 255,21.

mfn. = atuliya, Sn 85 (maggajjhāyī
kathaṁ ~o hoti); 683 (Bodhisatto ratanavaro ~o~);
Bv IV 2 (v. r. atulyâsi for atulâsi); XIII 32 (but
Bv-a atuliyo). —• °-dassana, mfn., of unequalled
beauty, Ja V 396,24*. — °-âkāra, mfn., incomparable
as to form, Ud-a 35,30 (abl. ~ato, representing the
abl. of an abstr. noun).

mfn. = prec, Ja IV 102,1* (mahabbalo
amitayaso ~o, Bds atulyo).

mfn. (cf. tikicchā, f., & tikicchati),
1. incurable; Ja II 214,24 (mūlôsadhâdīhi ~o); IV
226,22' (Ed. by misprint atikicchaṁ); Vv-a 322,25;
Dhp-a I 25,21 (°-bhāva, m.). — 2. incorrigible, not to
be rescued or saved, irretrievably lost; Vin II 202,8 foll.
(Devadatto āpāyiko nerayiko kappaṭṭho ~o); It 85,8
(do.); MN I 393,3 (do.; Buddha-sahassenâpi tikicchi-
tuṁ na sakkā, Ps); AN III 402,22 (do.; = na sakkā
tikicchituṁ, Mp); IV 160,16 (do.); AN III 146,26
(pañca āpāyikā nerayikā parikuppā~ā; = akattabba-
parikammā, Mp); Ps III 115,21 (+ anivatti, ariṭṭha-
kaṇṭakasadisa); 545,2 (do.); Sv I 166,29 (do.); Mil
344,1 (sa-tekiccha+); Ps (Ee) II 255,16 (do.).

mfn. [cf. sa. a-tejasvin], not vigorous,
feeble; Ja V 172,14* (tejassinaṁ hanti ~vanto, m. pl.). a-tejava

mfn., without oil; Cp I 1,5 (pavanā
ābhaṭaṁ paṇṇaṁ ~añ ca aloṇikaṁ); Ja III 406,23
(alonikaṁ ~aṁ kummāsaṁ). — °tta, n. abstr., Sadd
563,1.

ind. (ati + eva, cf. ativiya); Ja VI 529,10*
(ateva me acchariyaṁ; so Ja VI 531,1'; the text of
Ee has ath'eva; = ativiya me acchariyaṁ; quoted
Sadd 613,22); with instr. = much more than, Ja V
63,11* (atev'annehi māsehi; = ativiya, Ct.). Cf.
atev'anne, Mogg-v I 29 (= ati iva aññe, Pay).

ind. [sa. atas; abl. of *a-ḷ, (a) hence, from
here, from this (that); SN I 15,17* (~ sarā nivattanti);
II 259,17 (~ yāvadatthaṁ bhuñjantu, Ee aho) =
Vin III 107,6 (aho, no v. l.); AN IV 45,6 (~ 'yaṁ
āhuto sambhūto; v. l. ito; Mp III 205,9: ito hiayaṁ,
Mp Ce ato hiayaṁ); Ja V 398,21* (~ mutā;
— tato anumatā, Ct.); Pj II 457,20 (~ eva); MN II
101,31 (n'atthi te ~ bhayaṁ, fear from that); in Vin
I 345,18 the reading was anatthato, which Sp explains
as anattho ato or anattha-do; adjectivally to a subst.,
MN II 52,10 (~ kumbhiyā, do. from this jar); ib. 31
(~ kaḷopiyā; or adv. = therefore?); — (b) before com-
par.: [more] than that,MN I 498,1 (~ bahūhi bahutarā);
II 35,11 (do., o.l. tato; Ps); III 131,19 (~ mahanta-
tarena); 169,20 (~ dullabhataraṁ); SN II 184,8 (~
bahutarā); Mil 87,15 (~ dukkarataraṁ). Cf. ito, etto.

mfn. (a + grd. of √tuṣ), not worth
to be satisfied with; Pj II 32,12 = 33,21 (Dhaniyaṁ
~ena tussamānaṁ . . . paribhāsati; v. l. a-tuṭṭhab-
bena).

m. pl. ~ā (of unknown etymology and
meaning), a certain class of people; only Mil 191,4
(mallā ~ā pabbatā +, i. e. athletes, etc.; the passage
is omitted in Se). Cf. Trsl. I 266, note.

only found in acc. attaṁ and instr, attena
= atta(n), q. v.; Dhp 379 (paṭimāse ~am attanā; =
attānaṁ, Dhp-a); Ja IV 192,15* (~aṁ mahatte ṭhāpe-
tuṁ; = attānaṁ, Ct.); VI 416,16* (~aṁ jahissasi);
MN I 297,37 = II 263,26 (suññam idaṁ ~ena vā
attaniyena vā; cf. 7atta); SN IV 54,5 foll. (cakkhuṁ
[etc.] suññaṁ ~ena) = Paṭis II 181,4 foll. = Kv
67,5; Nidd I 222,32 (cakkhusamphassaṁ vivittaṁ
passati ~ena). Cf. atta(n) ifc. & 3atta (nir-atta).
mfn., w. r. for 4attha, q. v.

mfn. [sa. ātta, pp. of ā + √dā], taken,
grasped (opp. niratta, q. v.; cf. Jatta & 2atta ( =
4attha)): Sn 787 (~aṁ nirattaṁ na hi tassa atthi;
Pj, Nidd); 800 (~aṁ pahāya anupādiyāno; Pj, Nidd);
858 (~aṁ vā pi nirattaṁ vā na tasmiṁ upalabbhati;
Nidd); 919 (where the Mss read n'atthi attā kuto
nirattaṁ vā; Nidd attaṁ); Pj & Nidd give double
explanation stating a pun on atta (grasped, adopted,
supposed) and atta(n) (the soul); [the new form 1atta
for atta(n) was favoured by this pun, and likewise
the spelling nir-atta]. Cf. the comp.s below: attañjaha,
attadaṇda, (attamana?), attādāna.

mfn. [sa. āpta], full, complete; DN III
203,21 (~āhi paripuṇṇāhi paribhāsāhi, [cf. ib. 81,6] =
attabhāvaṁ upanetvā, Sv, pt; cf. 7atta); contained
in atta-rūpa (q. v.), and perhaps in atta-mana (q. v.).

or atra, n. [sa. atra], food; Kacc-v 658
(from √ad).

n. [sa. *a-tva], the being a, Kacc 90 (pañcâ-
dīnaṁ ~aṁ; í. e. the short vowel a before the termina-
tions of the numbers pañca, etc.).

mfn. [cf. sa. ātmyaḷ, relating to the self;
according to Sv (pt) ad DN III 81,6; 203,20.

m. [sa. ātman; other forms are tuma,
ātuma(n), q. v.; see also 1atta]; declension see Kacc
211-214 (giving the stem as atta-; Sadd 158,25); nom.
attā, Abh 92 (jīvo puriso +); 861 (citte, kāye, sabhāve
ca so ~, paramattani); acc. attānaṁ, DN I 13,1
(sassataṁ); attaṁ, Ja VI 416,16*, etc., see *atta; in
verses also attanaṁ, see below (2 c); instr, attanā,
Dhp I 65; attena, see *atta; gen. (dat. abl.) attano,
Sn 334; Dhp 343; abl. also attato (q. v.); loc. attani,
Sn 666; MN I 138,3. — 1. (a) the 'self, the 'ego', one's
self (whose existence as a permanent or eternal being
is always repudiated); selected passages where the
problem of 'soul' is discussed: some Brahmans (saññi-
vādā) maintain, in 16 ways, that the soul after death
is conscious (saññiṁ attānaṁ), DN I 31,1 foll.; some
(asaññivādā) maintain, in 8 ways, that the soul after
death is not subject to decay, and inconscious (asaññim
attānaṁ), ib. 32,4 foll.; do. hieva-saññinâsaññi-
vādā, ib. 33,3 foll.; others (ucchedavādā) maintain,
in 7 ways, the theory of annihilation, ib. 34,1 foll.;
olāriko attā rūpī, etc., DN I 186,3 (material); mano-
mayo attā sabbaṅga-paccaṅgī ahīnindriyo, ib. 15
(consisting of mind); arūpī attā saññāmayo, ib.
187,3 (without form, made of consciousness); sassato
. . . rūpī . . . saññī (etc.) attā, DN III 137,18—139,25
—-140,1; attā ucchijjati vinassati, na hoti param
maraṇā, ib. 140,1; kittāvatā attānaṁ paññāpento
paññāpeti, DN II 64,3 foll.; (n')atthi me attā, MN
I 8,17-18; attanā va attānaṁ sañjānāmi, ib. 19; na
hi no etaṁ attā vā attaniyaṁ vā, MN I 141,11 —;
SN IV 129,10; so loko, so attā (there is the world,
there is the self), MN I 136,31; 137,12; eso me attā,
Vin I 14,10; MN I 135,31; 138,15; 233,8; III 265,1;
271,25; n'etaṁ mama, n'eso 'ham asmi, na m'eso attā,
AN I 284,28; II 164,30 = MN I 421,35; AN II 171,15;
V 188,1; eso 'ham asmi, eso me attā, SN III 223,12:
atthi attā . . . hiatthi attā, SN IV 400,16-18; attanā
attānaṁ [ - ˇ ≃ ] nânupassat√Sn477 (Pj); ken' attanā
gacchati Brahmalokaṁ, Sn 508; rūpī arogo . . . arūpī
(etc.) attā, SN III 219,1 foll.; rūpaṁ (etc.) me attā, MN
I 230,27; rūpaṁ ca attaṁ ca advayam samanupassati,
As 353,14; cakkhuṁ (etc.) attā ... anattā, MN III
282,14-17 foll.; evaṁ-vaṇṇo attā hoti arogo param
maraṇā, MN II 33,28; 41,10; ekantasukhī attā hoti
sukhadukkhī vā, MN II 36,1 (cf. SN III 219,30); saññī
attā hoti arogo param maraṇā, MN II 228,15 ; rūpâdi-
saṁkhāto attā, Pj I 188,18; sarīra-parimāṇo, aṅguṭṭha-
parimāno, vava-parimāno, paramānu-parimāno attā,
Ud-a 339,32; Sv I 192,20 = Ps I 260,24 = ' Vibh-a
354,28 (attā abhikkamati); Sv I 194,12 = Ps I 262,2
= Vibh-a 356,11 (abbhantare attā); — (b) sometimes
the notion 'one's [own] self is nearly related to the
use of attā as a pronoun (see below (2)): Vin I 23,23
(yaṁ vā itthiṁ gaveseyyātha, yaṁ vā attānaṁ . . .);
185,10 (attho ca vutto, attā ca an-upanīto; cf. Sn 799:
attānaṁ anūpaneyya); SN I 71,28 (kesaṁ nu kho
piyo attā); AN IV 97,13* (attā hi paramaṁ piyo);
Ja III 169,16* (yass' attā nâlaṁ eko; Ct.); 279,16*
(tena jahissat' attānaṁ, cf. Ja VI 416,16*); Dhp-a I
6,13 (sarīraṁ attanā saddhiṁ na gacchati, scil. paralo-
kaṁ); — (c) in an ethical sense attā is nearly related
to 'conscience': SN III 120,18 (taṁ attā sīlato na
upavadati; cf. Ja III 523,27' and atta-garahi(n) (b));
AN I 57,27 (attā pi attānaṁ upavadati); 149,5 (sud-
dhaṁ attānaṁ pariharati); ib. 2 8* (attā te purisa
jānāti saccaṁ vā yadi vā musā; Mp); ib. 29*-30*;
Ja VI 283,21* (attā ca me so saraṇaṁ gatī ca (said
of a minister)); — (d) = a person's image in a
looking-glass; only Mil 54,11-13. — 2. very frequently
attā is used as a pronoun, thus: (a) as pron,
demonstr. (or indefinite) — sayaṁ, he himself (opp.
para, ubhaya; see comp, atta-vyābādha, attahita
below); nom. attā pi gutto rakkhito bhavissati, SN
I 89,17; acc. attānaṁ may be taken as nom. n.
(originally impers.): Vin I 94,18 (attanā ~ samman-
nitabbaṁ parena vā paro); III 82,24 (na . . . ~
pātetabbaṁ, quoted Mil 195,2); Ja IV 406,17* (~ me
na dessiyaṁ, quoted from Cp I 8,16, where Ee. has
attā na me na dessiyo); cf. Ja IV 372,18' (v. r.);
instr, attanā samāna-nāmako, 'a namesake of the
same (before mentioned)', Dhp-a IV 203,12; — (b)
likewise instr, attanā ts frequently used in the sense
'himself (nom.) = sayaṁ, with which it is combined
Sn 888 (sayaṁ ~ so kusalo vadāno aññaṁ vimāneti
. . .); 585 (hiṁsaṁ attānaṁ ~); MN I 161,36 foll.
(~ jātidhammo samāno); SN II 111,1 {read ~ voyogaṁ
āpajjati; cf. Pj I 243,12); AN III 264,6 (taṁ ~ pari-
bhuñjati); V 130,1 foll. (~ ca appiccho (etc.) hoti);
304,13 foll. (~ ca pāṇātipātī (etc.) hoti); Ja IV 371,8* (~
anasitvāna; Ct.: 'attānaṁ' with attanā as v. r.); Ja III
263,1* (~ kurute lakkhiṁ); Mil 204,29 (~ adhammo
pare adhamme niyojetvā); — (c) the oblique cases of
attā are very frequently (as in sa.) used in sg. as
reflexive pronoun for all three persons and genders,
thus expressing the different case-relations of sayaṁ];
acc. attānaṁ: referring to 3 sg. Sn 132; 438; 451; 583;
657; 705; 709; 799; 810; Nidd I 297,3; Ja III 528,6;
VI 304,13*; Dhp-a I 83,19; III 114,13; IV 1,1 (attā-
nam-ārabbha-kathita-vatthu, as title of IV 1-5); to
3 pl. Ja I 333,13 (paṇḍitā ~ rakkhantā param rak-
khimsn); IV 264,26 (Sāvatthiṁ pattaṁ eva ~ pas-
siṁsu); Ps I 88,36 (~ maṇḍetukāmā); to 2 sg. MN I
132,22 (~ khanasi); to 1 sg. Ja I 267,20* (passāmi vo
'ham ~); III 432,2* (~ ramayissāmi); 437,23* (yato
sarāmi ~); IV 142,13* (do.); in verses also = attanaṁ
[ - ˇ -], thus to 3 sg. Sn 477; Dhp 355; Ja I 488,22*;
III 441,22*; to lsg. Ja III 442,6*; IV 195,12* (Ed.
with Bds. sukhaṁ passāmi attani, but read evaṁ
passāmi attanaṁ (Cks attanā), and in the Ct. 196,1'
read: uddharitvā sukhī assa, 'passāmi attanan'ti
attānaṁ); — instr, attanā, to 3 sg. Sn 514 (pajjena
katena ~); 659 (sahâpi ~); Ja III 190,1* (sā maṁ
annena ... attanâpi; cf. Ct); Dhp-a I 8,9 (~ saha-
gāmino bhikkhū); ~ catuttho, see atta-catuttho, etc.;
attan' aṭṭhamaṁ, Vv 376 (i. q. attaṭṭhamaṁ); to 2 sg.
MN I 132,22 (~ duggahītena amhe abbhācikkhasi);
— gen. (dat. abl.) attano, to 3 sg. Sn 275; 334; 368;
592; 626; 782; 937; 940 = 1061-62; 962; Ja I 414,17;
II 332,2; III 223,20*; VI 106,11'; 388,14; Dhp-a I
79,21; III 115,13; Mil 36,6; to 3 pl. Ja III 211,8 (porā-
ṇaka-paṇḍitā ~ mātāpitaro ghātetvā); 265,6 (~
vasaṁ gatakāle, i. e. itthīnaṁ); Dhp-a III 112,1 (~
sarhkilesabhāvaṁ jāniṁsu); Ps I 88,34 (~ chāyaṁ
disvā); Ja VI 581,31 (brāhmaṇā ~ raṭṭhe deve
vaṭṭe); to 2 sg. Ja V 79,27' (attanā va ~ anattho
kato); VI 312,8 (tvaṁ maṁ ~ gharaṁ mā pesehi);
to 2 pl. Ja II 118,24 (~ ñātakānaṁ); 57,9 (tumhe ~
andhabālabhāvena); Dhp-a IV 203,1 (tumhehi ~
bhavanissaraṇaṁ kataṁ); to 1 sg. Ja III 265,15
(imam mayā... ~ vasaṁ āgatakāle khādituṁ vaṭṭati);
VI 326,24 (~ māraṇa-kāraṇaṁ); to 1 pl. Ja II 147,1*
(dīpaṁ nâkamha ~); VI 288,17' (taṁ ~ agāre vā-
seraa); — do. repeated: ~ ~ gharadvāraṁ sodhetab-
baṁ (each ought to sweep before his own door), Ps I
102,3; also combined with another gen., Ja VI 137,10'
(mama ~ mati); Ps I 268,35 (n'eva tassa bhikkhuno
~ hoti, na parassa); with abs. loc, Ja V 429,31 (~
eḷikāsu marantīsu); do. referring to the agens (instr.),
Ps I 60,1 (raññā ~ paccatthika-jane jite) = Pj I
111,14; — loc. attani, to 3 sg. Sn 666; 784; to 3 pl.
Ps I 114,10; to 1 sg. MN I 17,20 (etam ahaṁ . . .
~ sampassamāno); [Ja IV 195,12*, see above under
attanā, instr.] — In comp.s always atta-° (cf. attañ-
jaha, attantapa and atta-d-attha below), with ordinal
numbers, see atta-dutiya, etc. [for att' Udenaṁ MN
II 159,2 read tatth' Udenaṁ with B & Se] — Ifc.
([a]tta) v. akata°, ajjhatta(m) (ajjhattika), an-°,
anavosita°, abhinibbuta°, asamāna°, asamek-
khita°, asampādita°, upanīta°, ojita°, kata°,
khalita°, khema°, gata°, ṭhita°, dur-°, nir-°,
pakata°, paccattaṁ, parama°, pasanna°, pa-
hita°, pesita°, bhāvita°, majjha°, maha°, muta°,
yata°, rakkhita°, rūpa°, vaḍḍhíta°, viññāṇa°,
vimutti-'jjhasita°, vedana°, samkhāra°, sañña°,
saññata°, samāna°, samāhita°, sammata°, sup-
pasanna°, susamvuta°, susamāhita°, hīna°. atta

m. [sa. attṛ], an eater, Kacc-v 629
(etymol. of attā & ātumā).

mfn. [sa. ātma-kṛta], self-made;
SN I 134,24* (opp. parakata); Ja VI 183,5* (~aṁ
veraṁ = attanā kataṁ pāpaṁ, Ct.). — n. one's own
deed, Mil 166,25 foll.

n. [sa. ātma-karman[, one's own
deed; °-phalůpaga, mfn., reaping the fruits of ~,
Ja V 268,25* (= attano kammaphalena upagato, ib.
274,14'). — °-âparādha, m., one's own wrong action,
Ja IV 443,11*-i5* (= attano kammadoso).

1. mfn. [sa. ātma-kāma], who wishes
himself well (sometimes confounded with attha-kāma,
pursuing the (highest) good, synon, hitakāma, Vv 951;
cf. Cp III 4,6; AN I 231,21 (= attano hitakāmā,
Mp; see also attatthakāma): SN I 75,28*; 140,15*
(Ed. attha-°) = AN II 21,23* = IV 91,1* (v. l.
attha-°); Ps I 257,11 (~ā kulaputtā sāsane pabba-
jitvā, see AN I 231,21 above); II 236,21-30 (Ee):
attano hitaṁ kāmayamānasabhāvā, . . . yo . . . gā-
mantaṁ pahāya araññaṁ pavisitvā . . . vipassanāya
kammaṁ kurumāno vicarati ayaṁ ~o nāma.
— 2. m., one's own lust, Vin III 133,21'; — °-tā, f. abstr.,
Utt-vin359 foll.;
entry.re:
— °-rūpaatta-kāma-rūpa, mfn. = atta-
kāma (1); tayo kulaputtā ~ā viharanti, MN I 205,23
(Ps) = III 155,18 = Vin I 350,34 = Vv-a 11,29;
— °-sikkhāpada, n., title of 1Saṁghādisesa 4, — Vin
III 131-134.

entry.sense:
m. (acc. pl. ~āni, see below), (a) one's
own act (opp. parakāra, synon, purisakāra)), DN I
53,28 (in the heretical dialect nom. sg. °-kāre = °-kāro,
Sv); AN III 337,27 (n'atthi ~o, n'atthi parakāro);
— (b) personal exertion, doing one's best, Ja V 401,12*
(~āni karonti bhattusu, = yuddha-bhūmisu purisa-
kāre, Ct. [Ee purisākāre], but cf. 2kāra (√kṝ)).

n., one's own business; Ap 322,11
(parakicc°-āni;.

m., exhausting oneself, Ps III
100,19; 211,16 (opp. kāmasukha); — °-ânuyoga, m.,
the practice o/~, DN III 113,21 (paron. ~aṁ anuyutto,
opp. sukhallíkânuyoga); Sv III 108,12; MN III 230,10
(~am anuyuñjeyya); SN IV 330,30 (= attano kila-
manânuyogo, Spk); V 421,5 = Vin I 10,13 (= attano
kilamatṅassa anuyogo, Spk); Nett 110,1-22; Vism
5,18 (°-saṁkhātassa, scil. antassa); Ps II 384,9.

mfn., having oneself for refuge,
Sv ad DN II 101,2 = Spk ad SN V 154,5 (= 'atta-
saraṇa').

mfn., (a) who censures himself
only, Vin III 23,10 (pl. ~ino + an-añña-garahino;
Sp); MN II 5,18 (do.); — (b) for which one must blame
himself, or which makes him ashamed, Sn 778 (n. sg.(?)
yad ~ī tad akubbamāno [ - ˇ - ≃ ]; Pj, Nidd; see
SN III 120,18 s. v. atta(n) 1. c). — Ifc. v. an-°. atta-garahi

mfn., having regard for the self, Vism
13,35 (~unā attani gāravena pavattitaṁ).

n., self-respect, Abhidh-av 19,33
(+ paragārava; cf. attani gāravena, Vism 13,35).

m., belief in the ātman-theory, Nidd I
107,27 (~aṁ pahāya = 'attaṁ pahāya' [/. e. 3atta,
q.v.]; Ee °-gahaṁ). Cf. Nidd I 90,25 (v. L).

mfn., self-protected, guarding oneself;
Dhp 379 (upaṭṭhita-satitāya, Dhp-a); SN V 169,7
(+ atta-rakkhita); AN III 6,14 (Mp; = able to guard
oneself).

f., taking care of oneself; + atta-
rakkhā, atta-parittā, AN II 72,28 (Mp) ≠ Vin II
110,6.

n., or ~ā, f. (?), one's own de-
struction, Dhp I 64 (dat. ~āya phallati; Dhp-a).

m. [sa. ātma-ghāta] = prec, Dhp-a
III 156,21' ad Dhp I 64.

mfn. [sa. ātma-ghoṣa], 'blowing
one's own trumpet', MTD.

mfn. [sa. ātma-caturtha], one's
self with three others, MN I 393,21; AN II 136,29 ( =
attanā catuttho, Mp); cf. att'-aṭṭhama, atta-dutiya.

mfn., proceeding from one's self; Dhp I 61
(~aṁ + atta-sambhavaṁ; = attani jātaṁ, Dhp-a);
Mi] 98,19 (~ena vāyāmena). — m. (or n.), one's own
offspring, Mil 166,27 (~ena haññati); Pj II 550,10
(~âdayo = 'puttā', see atra-ja); Pay jlṛ 6 (~o =
putto); f. ~ā, a daughter, MhvLIV 69. — Ifc. v.
tad-°, patthiv-°, bhūbhuj-°, mātul-°.

m., one's own people, Ja IV 295,15*
(kathaṁ viññū . . . na vāyame ~assa guttiyā; Ct.).
m., self-conquest, MTD.

m., one's own determination or
wish; Pj I 125,18 (°-vasena kathitā apucchita-kathā);
II 46,16-18 (~to uppatti; opp. parajjhāsaya); 394,9
(do.); — mfn., due to ~, Sv I 50,25 = Ps I 15,24 ≠
Ud-a 29,26 (cattāro sntta-nikkhepā: ~o parajjhāsayo
pucchāvasiko aṭṭhuppattiko).

mfn. (3atta + jaha), abandoning
what has been grasped or assumed; Sn 790 (Pj: atta-
diṭṭhiyā yassa kassaci gahaṇassa pahīnattā ~o; Nidd
= attaditthi-jaho and (atta-)gaha-jaho; cf. Nidd-a
I 272,8).

f., disgusting with oneself,
Vibh-a 486,16.

mfn., who has his own self (or
conscience) for master (or witness of his actions), Mp
ad AN I 150,3* (= 'attâdhipako').

mfn. [sa. ātma-jña], knowing one's
self; DN III 252,14 = 283,3 (attānaṁ jānātîti ~, Sv)
= AN IV 113,10 (dhammaññū atthaññū +);
— °-utā, f. abstr., Nett 29,14; 80,14.

mfn. (atta-ṭṭha [often spelt
attattha, q. v.] + paññā), knowing or looking after
one's own profit, selfish; Sn 75 (= attani ṭhitā etesaṁ
paññā, attānaṁ yeva olokenti na aññaṁ, Pj; B,
Nidd, and Nidd-a attattha; v. r. diṭṭhaṭṭhapañña,
Pj ib.); Ja III 495,14* (= attano atthāya paññā,
paraṁ anoloketvā attani yeva vā ṭhitā etesam paññā,
Ct.); IV 56,24* (= attano atthāya eva yassa paññā,
Ct.); the Ct.s thus explain attaṭṭha now as att'-aṭṭha,
now as atta-ṭṭha (°ṭṭha — ṭhita).

mfn., the 8th with seven others,
Vv-a 149,17 (cf. attan' atṭhamaṁ, Vv 376); — °-ka,
mfn., id., Mil 291,13.

f. (abstr. of atta(n)), Vism 308,30 (instr.
sabbesu . . . ~āya = 'sabbattatāya', further explained
by attasamatāya).

ind. (abl. of atta(n)), esp. with verbs
meaning 'look on, admit, assume, take for' = as the
soul, or the self (cf. atta-vāda): rūpaṁ, etc., ~ samanu-
passati, MN I 300,8; III 18,7; SN III 3,15; 96,22;
IV 287,20; AN II 214,35 (quoted Ps I 182,2); Dhs
1003 (As 353,12); Paṭis I 143,20 (quoted Ps I 27,21);
II 232,12 (anupassati; quoted Ps I 143,8); — Ud
32,29* (rogaṁ vadati ~; Ud-a: attato vadati, attano
ti pi paṭhanti), quoted Nett 156,22; SN I 188,19* (saṁ-
khāre parato passa, dukkhato mā ca ~); II 94,22
(kāyaṁ ~ upagaccheyya); AN I 27,9 = Vibh 336,9
(~ upagaccheyya); SN II 109,8, 18, 28 (~ addakkhuṁ
. . . dakkhinti . . . passanti). — Ifc. v. an-°.

m., belief in the self and
things belonging to a self, Vism 478,12 (°-vatthussa
eta-paramato), 18.

m. [sa. ātmârtha; also atta-d-attha,
q.v.; cf. also attaṭṭhapañña above], one's own profit
or interest; ~ + parattha, ubhayattha: AN I 9,13
(Mp); SN II 29,16 (Spk); V 121,21—124,1; AN I
158,6; 216,18 (Mp); Ja IV 26,26'; — Ja II 101,6'
(= 'atta-d-attha'); dat. ~āya, Ja IV 380,25* ( =
attano vaḍḍhi-atthāya; quoted Ps III 76,17*, reading
attatthiyā, see next). — °-kāma, mfn., desirous of ~,
Vism 39,17.
entry.re:
— °-paṭipattiatt-paṭipatti, f., attainment of ~,
Saddh 28.

— °-paripucchāatt-paripucchā, f., see atthattha-
paṭipucchā.

entry.sense:
mfn. (from prec.), minding one's
own needs; acc. m ~aṁ, Th 1097; hence ~iyā, ind.,
on account of oneself, Ps III 76,17* (quoted from Ja
IV 380,25*, where Mss. and Edd. have attatthāya).

mfn. (3atta + daṇḍa), who has
seized the stick, using the stick, violent: ~esu nibbutaṁ,
Dhp 406 = Sn 630 (= MN ch. 98) = SN I 236,21*
(= gahita-daṇḍesu, Ps; paresaṁ pahāra-dānato
aviratattā ~esu, Pj & Dhp-a; para-viheṭhanatthaṁ
gahita-daṇḍesu sattesu, Spk); perhaps also Sn 935
(but see next for traditional interpretation). — Ifc. v.
puthu-°. Cf. ādinna-daṇḍa.

m. or n. (3atta + daṇḍa), the stick
seized, or according to Ct.s 'one's own violent acts',
as from 1atta + daṇḍa); ~ā bhayaṁ jātaṁ, Sn 935
(— attadaṇḍato jātaṁ, Nidd; attadaṇḍato jātan ti
attano kata-duccaritato uppannaṁ, Nidd-a; attano
duccarita-kāraṇā jātaṁ, Pj).

entry.re: — °-niddesaAttadaṇḍa-sutta-niddesa, m., — Nidd I 402-444.

— °-vaṇṇanāAttadaṇḍa-sutta-vaṇṇanā,
f., = Pj II 566-69.

entry.sense:
m. (= attattha; Kacc-v35; -d-
from sa-d-attha, and this from mad-attha, etad-attha,
etc.), one's own welfare (or salvation); Sn 284 (pañca
kāmaguṇe hitvā ~aṁ acārisuṁ; — attano atthaṁ
akaṁsu, Pj); Dhp I 66 (~aṁ abhiññāya; — attano
attho ti sallakkhetvā, Dhp-a); Ja II 100,25*; 101,2*
(passati ~aṁ paratthaṁ; = attatthaṁ, Ct.).

m. Npr. of a thera, Dhp-a III
158,14 foll. — °-tthera-vatthu, n. = Dhp-a III
158—160.

mfn. (atta(n) + pp. of √dam), self-
restrained; Dhp I 04 (Dhp-a); 322 ( — attano danta-
tāya ~o, Dhp-a; quoted Nidd I 243,24* (Nidd-a)); Th
689 (~aṁ samāhitaṁ) = AN III 346,12* (= attanā
yeva dantaṁ, Mp).

m. (cf. prec), self-restraining;
dat. ~āya, Nidd I 238,25 (+ atta-samatha, atta-
parinibbāpana; Nidd-a: vipassanā-sampayuttāya pañ-
ñāya attano damanatthāya); Paṭis I 173,29 (°aṭṭha,
m., the sense of, ~o yathattho).

n. = prec, Ja III 8,1' (°-saṁ-
khāto damo).

m. [sa. ātma-darça], a looking glass,
MTD.

mfn., oneself with one companion
(cf. atta-catuttha above), DN II 147,21 (v. l. adutiya);
158,36; MN III 271,1; Dhp-a I 143,16 (v. l. adutiya
= dena-ma pamaṇek, Rt; but see ib. 143,5); the
v.ll. seem to imply the meaning: 'with oneself as
companion', i. e. alone (cf. MTD).

mfn., oneself with eleven
others; f. ~ā, Ps II 537,12.

[m., the sinh, title
of Hatthavanagalla-vihāra-vaṁsa, an anonymous
work (sæc. XIII) in prose and verses, Geiger p. 29-30;
editions: Colombo 1887 (by D'Alwis with its ancient
translation) & Colombo 1909; Mss. see JPTS 1882
p. 50; 1883 p. 145.]

m., title of Mil 195,1
— 197,29 (Se).

n., the sign of the self, As 223,13
(so read with Trsl, for attha-° Ed.).

mfn. [sa. ātmanya, Buddh, sa. also
ātmanīya, Mvu III 66,8, etc.], belonging to the self;
Abh 736 (nijo sako ~o); 808 (~e so tiliṅgiko); MN
I 138,3 (attani vā sati ~aṁ me ti assa, ~e vā sati
attā me ti assa; Ps); 141,11 (attā vā ~aṁ vā); suñ-
ñaṁ attena vā ~ena vā, MN II 263,27; SN IV 54,6
(=» attano santakena parikkhārena, Spk), etc., see
1atta; SN III 127,28 (kiñci attānaṁ [or attain] vā
~aṁ vā samanupassasi (cf. AN II 165,13) = attano
parikkhāra-jātaṁ, Spk); SN IV 82,21 (na hi no hetaṁ
attā vā ~aṁ vā); 129,10; [SN V 6,10*: etad-atta-
niyaṁ bhūtaṁ, read attani sambhūtaṁ, Spk; cf. Tr.
PM p. 67]; Ud-a 344,9 (loko ti mamaṁkāra-vatthu
yaṁ ~aṁ ti vuccati). — Ifc. v. atta°, an-° (& an-
attaneyya). — °-tā, f. abstr., Mogg-v V 5.
— °-gaha, m., holding something for belonging to a self,
Ud-a 214,23. — °-bhāva, m. abstr. (cf. attabhāva, 1),
Pj I 179,15 (explaining SN IV 54,1). — °-suññatā,
f., emptiness as to a°, Vibh-a 262,1 (attasuññatā +).

n. (from atta(n) + nir-√yat),
devoting oneself (to), = atta-sannivyātana (q. v.), Sv I
234,18 = Ps I 135,18.
n., title of SN IV 148.

mfn. (atta(n) + tapa), mortifying or
vexing oneself (opp. parantapa); puggalo ~o hoti atta-
paritāpanânuyogam anuyutto, DN III 232,25 foll.;
MN I 341,1 foll.; 411,30 foll.; II 159,1 foll.; AN II
205,26 foll.; Pp 55,5 foll. = AN II 206,5 foll.
— Ifc. v. an-°.

mfn. (from atta(n) + ipakkha),
belonging to one's own party, Pj II 493,10 (~esu 'asā-
ratto'; opp. para-pakkhiya).

mfn., seen, experienced, or
ascertained by oneself directly; Ja VI 355,1' (~aṁ
katvā, = 'sakkhi'); Nidd I 235,10 (sāmaṁ sayaṁ
abhiññātaṁ ~aṁ dhammaṁ; = attanā paṭi-ikkhitaṁ
dhammaṁ, Nidd-a (Ce attanā paṭivekkhitaṁ pacca-
vekkhitaṁ dhammaṁ)); Pj II 591,3 (~aṁ dhammaṁ,
= 'anītihaṁ'); — instr, (adv.) ~ena, personally,
Ja V 114,6' (~ kātabbāni); 118,12' (~ kareyyāsi);
119,8' (~ ñatvā); Ps I 196,12; — abl. (adv.) ~to,
id., Ja V 124,27' (~ jānitvā — 'sāmaṁ'); Dhp-a
III 404,5 (~ ñatvā; cf. attanā paccakkhato ñatvā,
Ja I 262,16). — °-kathā, f., a tale of something seen
by oneself, Ps III 106,1 (Se °kkhaṁ kathaṁ); — °-tā,
f. abstr., Ps I 236,12; — °-vacana, n., one's own
(direct) words, Sp I 3,24 (idaṁ hi Ruddhassa Bhaga-
vato ~aṁ na hoti; — āhacca bhāsitaṁ na hotī ti
adhippāyo, Vjb).

[mfn., one who has been
present and has seen something; Ja V 119,8' (ubhin-
naṁ ~ānaṁ kathaṁ sutvā; prob. w. r. for attha-
paccatthika (q. v.); cf. Bd atta-paccatthika, which is
also the reading of Vin II 94,5).]

mfn., oneself with 14 others,
Dhp-a III 27,16.

m., 'acquisition of personality',
mode of personal existence; DN I 195,21 (tayo 'me
~ā: oḷāriko, manomayo, arūpo; = attabhāva-pati-
lābha, Sv); Dāṭh V 64. Cf. attabhāva-paṭilābha '&
manussa-paṭilābha.

mfn., sacrificing oneself; m.
~ī, Ja II 398,16* (sūro ~; attānaṁ pariccajanto, Ci.). atta-pariccagi

n., self-mortification; puggalo
attantapo °-ânuyogaṁ anuyutto, devoting oneself to
a°, DN III 232,23, etc. see attantapa; Ud-a 352,4,26;
Pv-a 18,9; 30,9.

n., id., or prob, protection of
life, Ja V 369,8'.

n., complete emancipation
of one's self; dat. ~āya, Nidd I 238,26 (= duvidhenâpi
ñāṇena attano anupādā-parinibbānatthāya, Nidd-a);
— °aṭṭha, m., the sense of ~, Paṭis I 173,30 (~o
yathattho).

m., despising oneself, Vibh
353,38 (attuññā + ; = attānaṁ paribhavitvā mañ-
ñanā, Vibh-a 486,21).

m., the destruction of life (cf.
loka-pariyăya), Ja V 368,14* (paṭibāhati . . . āpadaṁ
~āyaṁ, but metrically ~ayaṁ).

m., one's own initiative, Ja V
364.1 6*-i 8* (~ena ohito; attano payogena, attano
atthāya, Ct.).

mfn. [sa. ātma-praçaṁsaka],
self-praising, boasting, Ja II 152,13* (= attānaṁ
pasaṁsanasīlo attukkaṁsako, Ct.).

m. [sa. ātma-bandhu], one's rela-
tive, nephew, MTD.

mfn., breaking down one's
own self, Pj II 118,16 (in Nidd-a (Se) the reading is
attha-bhañjanaka, q. v.).

mfn., who administers to his own
wants (only); piṇḍapātikassa bhikkhuno ~assa anañ-
ñaposino, Ud 30,15* = 31,19* (Ud-a).

m. [sa. ātma-bhāva[, 1. (abstract),
existence of the soul, Pj I 179,15 (~ena vā attaniya-
bhāvena vā, quoting SN IV 54,1). — 2. the existence
as an individual, proper nature; but most frequently
concrete: a living being, or its bodily form, person,
personality, i. e. the various appearances of the attā,
opp. the continual existence of the attā; Abh 151
(among words denoting 'body'); 816 (= 'satta');
— SN V 442,1 (sukhumattā ~assa); AN I 279,2 (oḷāri-
kaṁ ~aṁ); — Vin II 238,17 = AN IV 200,6 -
204.2 = 207,2; DN III 111,10; MN II 32,8 (iminā
~ena); Mil 171,13 (imasmiṁ ~e); MN II 181,11 (kha-
ttiyakule ~assa nibbatti hoti); AN I 134,20 (yath'assa
~o nibbattati); Ps II (Ee) II 88,19 (tīhi aṭṭhi-satehi
ussāhito, etc.); Pj I 132,10 ('attā' ti cittaṁ vuccati
sakalo vā ~o); Dhp-a I 78,9 (~sate, ~sahasse); 291,23
(~e khaya-vayaṁ upaṭṭhapema); 316,6 (~o . . .
kulāla-bhājana-sadiso); II 64,14 (evarūpo ~o); 68,13
(dutiye vā tatiye vā ~e); III 115,8 (esā ~e balava-
sinehā, her own person); Vism 310,27 (~o vuccati
sarīraṁ khandhapañcakaṁ); Nidd I 42,16* (= rū-
pakkhandho, Nidd-a). — Ifc. v. anantara°, alam-
kata°, asampādita°, eka°, duggata°, dur-°, deva°,
niyyādita°, paṭiladdha°, purima°, brahma ,
manussa°, saṅgahīta°, sampādita°.
entry.re:
— °-paṭi-atta-bhāva-paṭi-
lābha, m., the becoming reborn as an individual;
Vin II 185,25 = AN III 122,24 (= sarīra-patilābha,
Mp); Vin III 105,20 = 107,35 = SN II 255,19: DN
III 231,16 (cattāro ~ā) = AN II 159,5; MN II 146,6
= 52,33 (duvidhaṁ); SN II 272,1; 283,33 (hc.
pl. ~esu; v. l. attalābha-paṭilābhesu); III 144,12
(= paṭiladdha-attabhāva, Spk); AN II 188,30.
— °-paramparā, f., a series of existences, Mp II 201,21
(AN I 173,15) (ācariya-p° +). — °-pariyāpanna,
mfn., 'forming part of the body', Dhs 597 (As
308,12-14) = Vibh 70,29; Paṭis II 131,21 (quoted
Vism 310,3).— °-pariyāya, mfn., being synonymous
with a°, Pj II 304,9 (~e, scil. attani). — °-va(t), mfn.,
see attabhāvi(n) below. — °-vatthu, n., one point
concerning the personality, Nett 85,20 foll. — °-san-
nissaya, mfn., established in the ego (or in the body),
Nidd I 14,13 (pāpakā akusalā dhammā uppajjanti
~ā; Nidd-a). — °-âbhinibbatti, f., rebirth, Nidd I
49,2 (~iyā ti attabhāvānaṁ abhinibbattiyaṁ, Nidd-a)
= 109,20; II 232,2 (~iyā ti tīsu ṭhānesu paṭisandhi-
vasena attabhāva-paṭilābhatthāya, Nidd-a).

entry.sense:
mfn. (from prec), possessed of a
body; AN II 17,14 (etad-aggaṁ ~īnaṁ yad-idaṁ Rāhu
asurindo); 17,22* (Rāh' aggaṁ~īnaṁ; = attabhāva-
vantānam . . .; Rāhu . . . cattāri yojana-sahassāni
aṭṭha ca yojanasatāni ucco, Mp). attabhāvi

mfn. (Ct.s = saka-mana(s), thus
taking atta = atta(n), cf. attano mano, As 143,27;
Budd. sa. has ātta-manas, ātta = 3atta (from ā +
√dā), 'whose mind is transported (with joy)'; but atta-
may be, as well, sa. āpta, cf. manāpa & manāpiya),
satisfied, pleased, cheerful; also: willing, benevolent;
sometimes used in an encouraging address: DN II 14,21
= MN III 122,28 (~ā devi hohi); — Sn 45 (careyya
ten' ~o) = MN III 154,19* = Dhp 328 (= upaṭṭhita-
sati hutvā) = Ja III 488,19*; — Sn p. 94,15 (~o +
pamodito udaggo pītisomanassajāto; = pīti-pāmojja-
somanassehi phuṭa-citto); Ud 16,13 (do., = sakamano,
Ud-a); DN II 201,16 (~ā pamuditā pītisomanassa-
jātā); Sn p. 149,15 (~ā te bhikkhū Bhagavato bhā-
sitaṁ abhinanduṁ; = tuṭṭhamanā, Pj) = MN I 6,24;
12,1 (= sakamanā tuṭṭhamanā, Ps), etc. = DN I
46,27 (= sakamanā . . . udaggacittā, Sv) = III 98,3
(= tutthamanā, Sv) = SN II 2,9 (do. Spk); — Sn 995
(+udagga); Ja VI 319,1 (do.); Mil 18,3 (do.); Vin 1
70,26 (with loc. abs., + udaggo abhiraddho); DN III
43,5 (+ paripunna-saṁkappo; = tutthamano, Sv)
= MN I 192,11; III 276,16 (do.); MN I 32,5 (~o atta-
mana-vācaṁ nicchāresi; = sakamano tuṭṭhamano,
pītisomanassehi vā gahitamano, Ps); MN I 378,27
(+ abhiraddha; with instr, rei); II 116,19 (do.); Ill
271,16 (do.); SN II 198,23 (with instr., sakena lābhena
~o hoti sumano; = tuṭṭhacitto sakamano, na doma-
nassena pacchinditvā (Ck acchinditvā) gahitamano,
Spk); AN II 241,34 (with gen. pers. & instr, rei: yena
me āyasmanto ~ā honti taṁ karomi); III 343,10
(do.: ten'ahaṁ tassa bhikkhuno ~o homi araññavi-
hārena) ≠ IV 344,1 (Mp = na sakamano homi); Ja
II 180,3* (sabbo loko ~o ahosi); IV 206,27* (pakatiṁ
pi te ~o asaṁsiṁ; i. e. 'willingly'); VI 15,28* (te pi
~ā dajjuṁ); Vv 4 (= (a) tuṭṭhamanā pītisomanassehi
gahitamanā, (b) sakamanā, Vv-a); 11; 1012; Pv-a
23,15: Pv 295—297 (Pv-a); Mil 239,29. — Ifc. v.
an-°.

f (abstr. of prec), joy, pleasure,
Abh 87; MN I 114,13 (labheth'eva ~aṁ, labhetha
cetaso pasādaṁ); AN III 237,25 (do.); SN V 350,11
(+ somanassaṁ); AN IV 62,2 (do.); AN I 276,22
(tuṭṭhiyā, ~āya, somanassāya); MN III 221,10 (Ta-
thāgato na c'eva attamano hoti, na ca ~aṁ paṭisaṁ-
vedeti); Dhs 9 (= attano manatā . . . sakamanatā,
As 143,27-33) = 86 ≠ 285 ≠ 373 (pīti +); 1341
(khanti + ; = sakamanatā, As 396,5) ≠ Nidd I 3,3
(= attano manatā, Nidd-a); Ps I 151,35; Pv-a 132,16.
— Ifc. v. an-°.
m. = prec; Ps I 152,1.

f., words of satisfaction; MN I
32,5 (attamano ~aṁ nicchāresi); 509,25 (do.); Vism
40,1 (do.). — Ifc v. an-°.

mfn. [sa. ātma-māna], thinking an
attā to be found (in, loc), Sn 756 (an-attani ~aṁ
passa lokaṁ sadevakaṁ; Pj: an-attani nāmarūpe
attamānim).
mfn., = prec; Pj II 508,26. atta-mani

mfn., causing one's own death,
suicidal; AN IV 98,1* (bhūnahaccāni kammāni ~āni
ca karontā nâvabujjhanti).

m., one's own (final) emancipation,
Ss 54,11 (Buddhasāsanassa niyyānikatte sati Milakkho
~aṁ karissati).

f. [cf. sa. ātma-rakṣaṇa & ātma-
raksā with diff. meaning], self-protection, Vin II 110,6
≠ AN II 72,28 (atta-gutti +; Mp); Pj I 157,24; Mil
116,31 (opp. pararakkhā).

mfn., self-protected, SN V 169,1
(atta-gutta +).

mfn., according to Ct.s 'wishing one-
self well'; AN II 120,6 (~ena appamādo sati cetaso
ārakkho karaṇīyo; = attano anurūpena anuccha-
vikena, hitakāmenā ti attho); SN IV 97,24 (do.; =
attano hitakāma-jātikena, Spk). — Ifc v. hīna°.

mfn., = 4atta (q. v.); DN III 81,6
(akkosanti paribhāsanti ~āya paribhāsāya; = attano
anurūpāya, Sv). Cf. DN III 203,20 (attāhi [pi] pari-
puṇṇāhi paribhāsāhi paribhāseyyuṁ).

m. [sa. ātma-lābha], coming into
existence, (birth); Abh 1168 (giving the sense of prp.
u-); Rūp p. 85,8 (do.; Pay; e.g. uppannaṁ ñāṇam
= Sadd III Ce p. 774,14). — [°-paṭilābha, m., the
being born and reborn(1), SN II 283,33 (v. l. for atta-
bhāva-paṭilābha)].

m., title of Dhp XII = vv. 157-166
(Dhp-a III 134-160).

f., despising oneself, Vibh 353,38
(attuññā +; = attānaṁ avajānanā, Vibh-a).

m., praise of oneself, Th 209 (na
c' ~aṁ parisāsu vyāhare).

m. [sa. ātma-vadha], suicide,
destruction of oneself; Vin II 188,10-19 = AN II
73,15-29 (Mp) = SN II 241,6-23 (~āya Devadattassa
lābha-sakkāra-siloko udapādi, . . . kadalī (+ veḷu,
naḷo) ~āya phalaṁ deti, . . assatarī ~āya gabbhaṁ
gaṇhāti; Spk); Ja VI 211,4* (āyācanti ~āya); 213,22*
(mantā ime ~āya kattā; cf. Ct. ib. 216,20')-

[mfn., self-possessed, see attha-
vasi(n); cf. attha-vasa, v. l.] [atta-vasi

m., theory of the soul; Ps I 182,3.
— °-paṭisamyutta, mfn., connected with attavāda;
MN I 40,17 (pl. ~ā, scil. diṭṭhiyo; 'rūpaṁ attato
samanupassati'ti ādi-naya-ppavattena attavādena
paṭisaṁyuttā, Ps; cf. AN II 214,35); Paṭis I 139,6
(~ā diṭṭhi); 156,23 foll.

[mfn., believing in a soul, see
JPTS 1912 p. 118,3, cf. puggala-vadi(n), paravādi(n),
& saka-vadi(n), thera-vadi(n).] [atta-vadi

m., destruction of oneself, Ja II
422,29'.

f., one's own misfortune, AN IV
160,9 (opp. para-vipatti; = attano vipattiṁ vipannâ-
kāraṁ, Mp).

m. [sa. ātma-vīra], a brother-in-law;
clown; MTD.

mfn., supported by one's
own earnings, being in no man's service, Sn 24 ( =
attaniyen'eva ghāsacchādanena bhato, etc., Pj).

m., one's own distress; always
dat. ~āya followed by para-v° and ubhaya-v°; (a) with
ceteti: MN I 89,37 (= attano pi dukkhatthāya, Ps)
369,30; II 139,29; III 21,28; SN IV 339,20 foll.; AN
I 157,1; 159,2; 216,6; II 179,1; — (b) with saṁvat-
tati: MN I 115,2; II 115,1 foll.; AN I 114,23 ( =
atta-dukkhāya, Mp).

f., paying regard to oneself, one's
own volition; DN III 231,17 (opp. para-s°) = AN II
159,8 (= attanā pakappita-cetanā, Mp).

mfn., self-restrained, SN I 106,28*
(muni ~o; Spk). Cf. saññatatta.

f., conception with regard to the attā,
or the illusion that attā exists; Nett 27,19; Ps I 251,3
(cf. sattasaññā, ib. 274,36); Vism 629,2. Cf. attu-
paladdhi.

n. [atta(n) + saṁ-nir-√yat],
devoting oneself (to); Sv I 231,17 (cf. attānaṁ niyyā-
temi, ib. 19-20) = Ps I 132,25 = Mp II 22,16 (quoted
Ss 67,1). Cf. atta-niyyātana.

mfn. [sa. ātma-sama], (a) like one's
self, SN I 6,19* (n'atthi ~aṁ pemaṁ, no love is equal
to the love to one's self); (b) equal to oneself, a second
self (said of an intimate friend), Ja I 365,14*,23'; III
103,17* (ib. 104,2' read: ativelaṁ na bhāseyya api
attanā same, ninnānākaraṇe puggale ti attho); IV
295,18' (= 'atta-jana').

f., likeness to oneself, Pj II
493,13 (opp. para-s°).

mfn., sprung from self, Th
767 (sallaṁ).

f., one's own wealth, As 376,21-22
(°-nigūhana + °-gahaṇa); Vv-a 226,16 (°-nigūhana).

f., the perfection of one's self,
SN V 30,26 (= sampanna-cittatā, Spk).

mfn., perfect as to one's self,
SN V 30,26 (see ib. 30,21).

(mf)n., produced by one's self,
or m., one's own existence; Dhp 161 (attanā va kataṁ
pāpaṁ atta-jaṁ ~aṁ); Th 260 (taṁ viditvā-m-aham
~aṁ; = attani sambhūtaṁ attâyattaṁ, Tḥ-a); Ud
64,30* (abhida [ ˇ ˇ - ɔ: abhidā; w. r. abhindi] kava-
atta-sambhavaDN II 107,5* (= do. Sv) — SN V 263,4* (= attani
jātaṁ kilesaṁ, Spk) = AN IV 312,3* (= attani
sañjāta-kilesaṁ, Mp).

mfn., arisen in oneself; Sn 272
(snehajā ~ā, scil. rāgo ca doso ca, etc.; — attani
sambhūtā, Pj) = SN I 207,34* (= do., Spk); SN I
70,34* (pl. ~ā, scil. lobho doso ca mono ca; = attani
sambhūtā, Spk) = 98,18* (≠ ajjhattaṁ uppajja-
mānā, ib. 70,21).

n., the right aspiration
(attention and preparation) of one's self; Nett 29,18
(~aṁ sīlānaṁ pada-ṭṭhānaṁ; misprint atta-samā°);
50,25 (~aṁ hiriyā ca vipassanāya ca pada-ṭṭhānaṁ).
Cf. next.

f. = prec; Sn 260 (pati-
rūpa-desa-vāso +; = attano sammā-paṇidhānaṁ,
niyuñjanaṁ ṭhapanaṁ, Pj I 132,11; cf. 134,1-4 &
AN I 62,10-14); DN III 276,6 (do.; = attano sammā-
thapanaṁ, Sv) — AN II 32,6 (= do., Mp); Ps I 6,13;
Pj I 103,8; 167,10.

mfn., having oneself for refuge,
atta-dīpa +, DN III 58,7, etc.; cf. Sv III 39,8 = Spk
II 326,17 (tass' eva [scil. atta-dīpa] vevacanaṁ);
Sv II 193,1 = Spk III 302,2 (atta-gatikā hotha, mă
añña-gatikā).

m., paronom. = that essence
which is called self-essence; Nidd I 409,16 (Nidd-a);
Nidd II 278,35 (rūpaṁ asāraṁ [Ed. assāraṁ] . . .
niccasāra-sārena vā sukhasāra-sārena vā ~ena vā,
etc.; = attattaniyasāra-sārena, Nidd-a).

m., selfishness; Pj II 125,30 (san-
tāso ~ena hoti, ~o ca taṇhālepo); Vism 195,33
(°-rāgarattā).

n., one's own happiness; Ja I 365,15*
(~assa hetu); VI 374,31* (do.); V 220,8*; Dīp I 66
(Cf. Oldenberg ad Dīp II 11 (agga-sukham, quoting
Mhv-ṭ (Ce 50,15*) ad Mhv I 11); — °atthika, mfn'.,
coveting one's own happiness, Saddh 30 (loke ~e); 335.

f., emptiness as to soul, Vibh-a
262,4 (+ attaniya-s°, niccabhāva-s°).
n., title of six suttas, SN V 30-37.

f., purification of one's self, Ud-a
352,6.

mfn. = attûpanāyika (q. v.); Vin-vn
306 (cf. Vin III 91,19**).
f. [sa. ātma-hatyā], suicide, MTD.

n. [sa. ātma-hita], one's own profit;
DN III 233,4 (~āya patipanno hoti na para-hitāya)
= AN II 95,13 ≠ Pp 54,3 (quoted Kv 24,18; Kv-a
8,17); AN II 179,9 (~aṁ parahitaṁ ubhayahitaṁ).
atta-hita
f. [ts.], mother, elder sister, MTD.

mfn. (a + tāṇa, sometimes also written
atāṇa), helpless, having no refuge; Th 449 (haññati
niccam ~o); MN II 68,22 (~o loko anabhissaro,
quoted Ud-a 142,17; cf. ~o lokasannivāso, Paṭis I
a-ttāṇavicarāmi); III 289,5* (~o 'si kuhiṁ gamissasi); VI
409,13 (pl. ~ā asaraṇā palāyiṁsu); Mil 148,19 (+ asa-
raṇa, asaraṇībhūta, etc.); 325,19 (do.); 357,23 (+ asa-
raṇo). — n., no refuge; Thī 476 (devesu pi ~aṁ;
Thī-a, read with Ce: devattabhāvesu pi tāṇaṁ n'atthi
rāgapariḷāhâdinā sadukkha-savighātabhāvato); Nidd
I 53,9 (~ato; = atāyanatāya c'eva alabbhaneyya-
khematāya ca ~, Nidd-a) ≠ Mil 418,30.

n. (atta(n) + ādāna),taking the initia-
tive of one's own accord, Vin II 247,7 foll. (= sāsanaṁ
sodhetukāmo bhikkhu yam adhikaraṇaṁ attanā
ādiyat√taṁ~aṁ,Sp; Vjb: ~an ti sayaṁ parehi codito
attānaṁ sodhetuṁ anādiyitvā paresaṁ vippaṭipattim
disvā sāsanaṁ sodhetuṁ attanā ādātabban ti likhi-
taṁ) = V 191,8.
entry.re:
— °-vaggaattâdāna-vagga, m., the fifth chapter of
Upālipañcaka, Vin V 190-92.

entry.sense:
mfn. (from atta(n) + adhipa), who
takes his own self for his master (see attâdhipateyya),
AN I 150,8* (~o sato care, + lokâdhipa, dhammâ-
dhipa; — attâdhipati atta-jeṭṭhako, Mp).

mfn. (atta(n) + adhipati) = prec,
Mp ad AN I 150,3*; As 125,38 (~ hirī).

(atta(n) + ădhipateyya, sa.
ādhipatya), (a) mfn., having one's own self as master,
controlled by one's own conscience; Ja I 129,26;
130,20-23 (hirī ~ā); Ps (Ee) II 313,30 (do., opp. lokâ-
dhipateyyaṁ ottappaṁ), cf. Vism 465,1; — (b) n.
attâdhipateyyalokâdhipateyyaṁ dhammâdhipateyyaṁ; = attānaṁ
adhipatiṁ jeṭṭhakaṁ katvā, Sv) = AN I 147,21
(= attānaṁ jeṭṭhakaṁ katvā, Mp); Vism 14,1.

mfn. (atta(n) + ādhīna, sa. ātmâ-
dhīna), (a) dependent (only) upon oneself, i. e. in-
dependent; DN I 72,25 (+ a-parâdhīno bhujisso yena-
kāmamgamo) = MN I 275,34; — (b) personally
possessed, Pj II 309,16 (anugāmikaṁ ~aṁ rājâdīnaṁ
asādhāraṇaṁ). — Ifc. v. an-°.

n., title of SN I 72-73
(cf. 77,27 arakkhito attā).

mfn. (atta(n) + anugata), belonging
to one's self; Pv-a 102,3 (nāmaṁ).

f. (atta(n) + anudiṭṭhi), view of
one's self, illusion with regard to one's own individu-
ality; Sn 1119 (= sakkāya-ditthi, Pj & Nidd); AN
III 447,23 (assāda-diṭṭhi +; = attānaṁ anugatā
vīsati-vatthukā sakkāya-ditthi, Mp); SN III 185,32;
attânudiṭṭhi160,17; 352,1. — Ifc. v. ananta°, arūpī-ananta°,
arūpī-paritta°, rūpī-paritta°.

n., title of a sutta, SN III
185-86.

mfn. (atta(n) + anupek-
khi(n)), watching or controlling one's self; AN III 133,13
attânupekkhinpekkhitā).

m. (atta(n) + anuyoga) and
attânuyogi(n), mfn., meditating upon one's self, Dhp
209 (gen. pl. ~inaṁ; = attânuyogaṁ anuyuttā,
Dhp-a).

mfn. (atta(n) + anurakkhi(n)),
taking care of oneself, Ja IV 292,20* (~ī bhava).

m. (atta(n) + anuvāda), reproach
of oneself [cf. attā sīlato . . . upavadeyya]; in the comp.
°-bhaya, n., anguish of conscience, remorse; AN II
121,19 (~aṁ + parânuvāda-bhayaṁ, daṇḍa-bhayaṁ,
duggati-bhayam; — attānaṁ anuvadantassa uppaj-
janaka-bhayaṁ, Mp); Vibh 376,34 (+ do.); Mil 196,29
(do.); Ja III 241,20' (°âdikassa ... bhayassa); V
attânuvāda

n., title of a short treatise in a
ms. of India Office Library No. 40,3 (JPTS 1882
p. 75); prob. — SN I 71,23—72,21 (Piya-sutta).

mfn. (atta(n) + āyatta), depending on
the self, Th-a ad Th 260 (= 'atta-sambhava').

f. (abstr. of 3a + tāyana = tāṇa, cf.
attāna above), the not being able to render aid; Nidd-a
I 209,4 ad Nidd I 53,9.

m., name of a vihāra;
Mhv XXXVIII, 49.

f., a wish for oneself, Kacc 439
(atticchatthe).

mfn., extolling or praising one-
self; MN I 19,3 (+ paravambhī; Ps); 98,36 (do.);
AN V 150,1 (+ paravambhakā, scil. Nigaṇṭhā); Ja II
152,14' (= 'atta-ppasaṁsaka'). — Ifc. v. an-°. att'-ukkaṁsaka

f. (in comp. °-ă; cf. MTD:
attukkaṁsana, n.), self-praise; + paravambhanā,
MN I 402,36; 406,2; °-a-paravambhana-, MN I 19,4;
Vism 13,28; °-a-kāle, Tikap-a 279,3. — Ifc. v. an-°.
— °-kamyatā, f., wish for self-praise, Pj I 11,17* (instr,
abl. °-tā). — °-māna, m., arrogance in praising one-
att'-ukkamsananaṁ upari-ṭṭhapana-māno, Nidd-a); II 226,14.

f. (atta(n) -√ uññā = avaññā, cf. atta-
vaññā), despising oneself; Vibh 353,38 (+ attavaññā
attaparibhavo; = attānaṁ hīnaṁ katvā jānanā,
Vibh-a 486,19).

mfn., intended for oneself; acc. ~aṁ
(or adv. = for the sake of oneself), Vin III 149,11**
(~aṁ, scil. kuṭiṁ, = attano atthāya, ib. 27'; Sp II
67,2: mayhaṁ esā ti evaṁ attā uddeso assā ti attud-
desā, taṁ attuddesaṁ).

mfn., = prec; f. pl. ~āyo
(kuṭiyo), Vin III 144,27 (= attānaṁ uddissa attano
atthāya āraddhāyo, Sp).

m., attack from oneself; °-duk-
kha, n., pain caused by oneself, Nidd I 17,14 (Nidd-a);
entry.re:
— °-mūlakaatt'-upakkama-mūlaka, mfn., caused by oneself; ~aṁ dukkhaṁ,
Nidd-a I 86,13 (ad Nidd I 17,14) = Vism 501,1.

entry.sense:
m. (atta(n) + upaghāta), hurting
or destroying of oneself, Pj I 156,17 (majja-pāna-
saṁyamena ~aṁ vivajjetvā).

mfn. (atta(n) + upanāyika;
cf. attānaṁ ahūpaneyya, Sn 799), dedicated to or
concerning oneself, applied to or belonging to oneself
(or the self); Th intr. 1 (gāthā ~ā); Pj II 255,6
(do.); Vin III 90,33**; 91,19** (uttarimanussa-
dhammaṁ ~aṁ); 91,33' (te vā kusale dhamme
attûpanāyikaupaneti; see Sp I 489,2 (Ee)); SN V 353,21 (~aṁ
dhammapariyāyaṁ desissāmi; = attani upanetab-
baṁ, Spk); Pj II 521,15 (taṁ ~aṁ vācaṁ abhāsa-
māno); Vism 27,1 (attûpanāyikâlapanā);
entry.re:
— °-bhāvaattûpanāyika-bhāva,
m. abstr.; Sp I 489,8.

entry.sense:
mfn. (atta(n) + upamā), using one-
self as an example; AN IV 97,13* (~ā hi te sattā,
attā hi paramaṁ piyo; no Ct., v. l. atthūpamā,
attahitā).

f. (atta(n) + upaladdhi), the
conception of attā as existing; Ps (Ee) II 12,14; Mp II
454,1. — °-ka, mfn., having that conception; Mp II
454,3. — Cf. attasaññā Se sattûpaladdhi.

m. Npr. [sa. Atreya, patronym. of a
descendent of Atri]; Kacc-v 348 (Rūp 352; cf. Pan
IV 1,122).

m. (atta(n) + ovāda), self-instruction,
MTD.

ind. [sa. atra], here; Abh 1161; Kacc-v
231; Kacc-v 274 (see 1añña, 1, c); only found in texts
as (doubtful) v. l. for ettha or tattha: etad-eva khv-
attha, AN IV 415,3 (Ee khv-ettha; Mp do. (Se) or
kho 'ttha (Ce)); pahut'attha, Ja II 289,25* = Dhp-a
III 325,10* (v. l. bahuṁ (bahū) tattha; read pahu
1attha

-m(n). [sa. artha, m.n..; "from √ṛ" Ct.s,
e. g. Vibh-a 386,24 (araṇīyaṁ) ≠ Pj I 236,6-7; Sadd
432,1; "from '√as", Kacc-v 662]; rarely used as n.,
see Ja III 334,18* (bahu ~aṁ me tīritaṁ); 540,21*
(kiṁ kiccam atthaṁ; gender attraction; Ct. assumes
'attha, mfn. = atthasaṁhita); pl. ~āni, Sn 58; DN
III 158,21*; Ja III 99,6* (~āni anāgatāni); Ap 614,21
(sabb° or sacc° (dvandva, cf. Sn 453); instr, sg.
atthasā = atthena Mogg II 110 (Pay adds: attha-
2atthaaṭṭha (q. v.); — the different meanings given by
Abh 785 (= payojane, saddâbhidheyye, vuddhiyaṁ,
dhane, kāraṇe, . . . hite; cf. Pj II 238,6 foll. & Sadd
253,3), although running into each other and not easily
distinguishable, may be itemized in the foll. way:
1. aim, purpose; end, way, result (cf. 4); SN
I 110,27* (~aṁ samecca; Spk); Ja III 141,3* (~aṁ
bhañjati attano; = vaḍḍhiṁ, Ct.); ib. 5* (tass' ~o
paripūrati); Pj I 236,6-7 (~o paṭipadā, yaṁ vā kiñci
attano hitaṁ taṁ sabbaṁ araṇīyato ~o ti vuccati);
Mil 39,23 (ekaṁ ~aṁ abhinipphādenti); — ifc. v.
abhiñña°, avipaṭisāra°, nipphanna°, nibbida°,
nibbidāvirāga°, pariñña°, passaddha°, pāmujja°,
pīta°, yatha°, yad-°, laddha°, vimutta°, virāga°,
visuddha°, samvara°, samādh'-a°, samma°,
sammad-°.
2. similarly certain oblique case-forms are used
mostly ifc, thus (a), acc. °(a)tthaṁ, for the sake of,
for that reason, see e. g. aññāṇa°, attha°, ārogya°,
etad°, etam-°, kim-°, gāthābandhasukha°, jā-
nana°, tad-°, tosana°, dāna°, nirodha°, pa-
hāna°, puñña°, plavana°, bīja°, bhesajja°, yad-°,
yāvad-°, virāga°, vīmamsa°, samvara°, sagga°,
sukha°; suplava°, cf. hattha°; — (b), atthā (dat.
— atthāya, or perhaps abl.), with gen. = for the
sake of, to the benefit of): pitu ~, Ja III 518,6* (Cks
atthaṁ) 15'; bhattur- ~, Ja V 401,14* (= sāmino
atthāya, Ct.); — ifc. v. āpad-°, bhojana°, sam-
gara°; —. (c), dat. atthāya, do. (cf. 4 below)
with gen.: yass' ~, Sn p. 16,7 ≠ DN II 153,4;
MN II 250,12; + hitāya sukhāya, AN III 46,25;
tav'eva ~, Ja III 426,27*; kiss' ~, Mil 82,6; [tesaṁ
~, Ja IV 293,5', see atthāya separately below]; — very
frequently ifc., e. g. aññad-°, atta°, attha°, anu-
bhavana°, āpad-°, ārogya°, etad-°, etad-eva°,
kim-°, gahaṇa°, tad-°, daḷhasamādāna°, dava°,
dāna°, dāra°, dāsa°, dhana°, nittharaṇa°, puñña°,
punadivasa°, phala°, bīja°, bhariya°, bhesajja°,
mamsa°, yañña°, vaddhi-°, vīmamsa°, sam-
vara°, samsagga°, sagga°, sukha°; — (d), instr.
atthena = for a certain purpose, on a serious errand
(or occasion); yen' ~ idhâgato, Sn 430; ~ atthiko,
Sn 460; ~ idhânupatto, Ja IV 97,9*; VI 274,2* (B.
akkhena); — ifc. e.g. kīḷana°.
3. use, need, want, desire (with gen. pers. & instr,
rei): Sn 21 (~o bhisiyā na vijjati); 25 (bhatiyā); 331
(ko ~o supitena vo, cf. Ja IV 84,22* = Pv 200);
431 (puññena); Vin I 40,25* (atthen'eva me ~o)
quoted Dhp-a I 92,19*; Vin I 80,3 (yass'ayasmato ~o,
so āgacchatu); 85,30 (ko tayā ~o); 206,29 (accha-
kañjiyā); III 132,8 (vadeyyātha yena~o); Ja I 254,14
(yadi vo dhanena ~o); III 232,6* (na ten' atthaṁ
abandhi); VI 304,6* (jīvitena, cf. ib. 27*); 306,29*
(maranena); 319,10* (yassa te hadayena ~o);
322,14* (yena tava ~o); Dhp-a I 29,11; 78,18; III
68,6; 201,17 (paṭicchanna-guṇe ... dassitena \Ee
dassite] ko ~o); IV 39,6 (ko ~o ... paṭivacanena
dinnena); Mil 78,9; — ifc. (mfn.) e. g. usīra°, kata°,
kāma°, jīvika°, dava°, paja°, pāna°,bala°, bhatta°,
bhikkhusamgha°, yāvad- °, yuddha°,rata°,sukha°.
4. advantage, benefit, interest, one's good (or best):
SN I 34,3* (sampassaṁ ~am attano); 126,14* (~assa
patti); IV 347,24 (~aṁ bhañjati); AN I 61,1 (kaṁ
~aṁ anubhoti); Dhp-a I 367,5 (do. with gen.); AN I
154,32 ≠ III 129,2-3 (~aṁ bhaṇati, to speak in one's
favour); Ja I 144,19* (= vadḍhi, Ct.) = Dhp-a I
143,21*; AN III 56,16* = Ja III 204,27* (= vaḍḍhi,
Ct.); 205,1* (yattha labhetha ~aṁ); 328,12* (thulíam
~aṁ jahissasi); 329,8* (interest); 394,3* (~aṁ karis-
saṁ); VI 310,13* (tass'eva ~aṁ puriso kareyya); Sn
583 (kañci-d-attham udabbahe); Ja IV 180,12 (lo-
kass'eva ~aṁ carati, to the benefit of the world);
V 121,2* (~aṁ vindati paṇḍito; = vaḍḍhiṁ pāpu-
ṇāti, Ct.); 339,25-26* (kam ~am abhijotaye . . .
~aṁ na bujjhasi); VI 312,11* (~aṁ mayi carassu,
help me); Vv 332 (~enâtandita, useful work; = attha-
kiccena, Vv-a; see however a-tthena below); Pv 511
(= dhana, Pv-a 219,26); Mil 94,9 (~o te abhikka-
mati); — dat. atthāya (cf. 2 c above) + hitāya
sukhāya, Vin II 289,20; DN III 211,6 foll.: MN II
250,12; ~ vata me, Sn 191 ≠ SN I 215,11* (Spk);
SN V 130,3 (mahato ~āya saṁvattati); AN I 145,12
(mama); — opp. to anattha: Sn 126; Dhp 256; AN II
46,15*; Dhs 1060; — ifc. v. atikkanta°, atīta-m-°,
atta(-d-)°, an-°, ubhaya°, kāraṇa°, nir-°, nihīna°,
para°, parihīna°, brahmañña°, saka°, sāmañña°,
sâttha, siddha°.
5. welfare; ~o samparāyiko, Sn 190 (cf. Pj II
238,6) = SN I 215,10* (Spk) ≠ AN III 364,14 (opp.
diṭṭhadhammikaṁ ~aṁ); Vin I 179,26 (diṭṭhadham-
mike ~e); SN I 82,20 (ubhayena ~ena ... diṭṭha-
dhammikena c'eva samparāyikena ca): ~aṁ hāpeti,
Sn 37; Ja III 262,17* (do.); n. pl. ~āni, Sn 58 (Pj;
see DN III 158,21* below 6 (a)); — ifc. v. atta-d-°,
parama°.
6. (a) thing, matter, question, affair, business;
also: case, occasion: Sn 30 (imam ~aṁ . . . abhā-
satha); 409 = 419 (do.); 241 (pucchāmi taṁ Kas-
sapa etam ~aṁ); 829; 838; 869-70; Vin I 53,33
(Bhagavato etam ~aṁ ārocesuṁ) etc., passim; DN
II 107,1 (etam ~aṁ viditvā) = Ud 1,18, etc.; DN
III 158,21* (sukhumāni ~āni); MN I 304,24 (etam
~aṁ puccheyyāsi); SN II 36,25 (ekena padena sabbo
~o vutto); Sn 251 (akkhāsi); Ja III 345,6* (akkhāhi
me etam ~aṁ; = kāraṇaṁ, Ct.; cf. Pj II 238,6:
karanass'etaṁ adhivacanaṁ); Ja IV 77,13' ( = kā-
raṇa); 97,20* (kaṁ . . . ~aṁ patthayāno); 348,12
(tam [or etam] ~aṁ pakāsento . . . āha), etc. passim;
Mil 122,31 (na kañci ~aṁ na vindanti); pl. ~ā, DN
III 185,14* (Sv; cf. Th 231 and atlta-m-attha, mfn.);
Ja III 447,24* (~ā vividhā); — ifc. v. atisaya°,
appa°, abhūta°, alam-°, idam-°, uttama°,
bavha°; — (b) also = good things, wealth, riches:
SN I 110,23* (~ā sampacurā); Sadd 71,13; (cf. 4
above); ifc. v. pacura°, vipula°, sabba°; cf. 4sattha;
— (c) esp. a difficult case or question; Ja I 387,4*
(~e jāte ca panditaṁ, scil. icchanti; quoted Pj
II 238,12; cf. iatthajāta); DN III 184,16* (yo ca
~esu jātesu sahāyo hoti, so sakhā); Ja VI 362,20*
(~esu jātesu tathāvidhesu); Ja III 133,28* = 266,24*
= 438,13* (yo . . . uppatitaṁ ~aṁ na khippaṁ anu-
bujjhati); Dhp 256 (~aṁ sahasā naye; Dhp-a); thus
almost = 3aṭṭa, cause, lawsuit: Ja III 334,18* (n.);
441,20*; Mil 48,8 (kassa tvaṁ ~aṁ dhāreyyāsi); acc.
pl. ~e anusāsati, DN II 20,20; 21,2 (Sv).
7. sense, meaning, explanation (a. the right under-
standing or explanation of a word or of a matter;
b. the truth; c. the fundamental idea), very frequently
used in Ctt. 'ti attho = 'this is the meaning' (Sv I
256,23), generally adding a new or more explicit ex-
planation to a previous grammatical one, e. g. Sv I
183,1; 208,27; 249,32-33; Ja I 470,23' (sometimes also
without the last one, e.g. Sv I 248,29; Ja I 471,3';
cf. vutta(ṁ hoti) & adhippāya): (a), SN II 51,19
(na etehi padehi . . . ~o vutto); AN I 23,28 (vitthā-
rena ~aṁ vibhajantānaṁ); SN IV 93,13 (vitthārena
~aṁ avibhajitvā); AN II 189,17 (vitthārena ~aṁ
ācikkhituṁ); V 194,22 (bhāsitassa ~aṁ ājānanti);
Vin I 40,24* (~añ ñeva me brūhi, atthen'eva me
attho, opp. vyañjana; quoted Dhp-a I 92,18-1.9*); +
ñāṇa, lakkhaṇa, ṭhānâṭhāna, Pj II 111,4; Mil 45,25
(~aṁ jappehi); cha ppadāni ~o, Nett 1,6*; 9,24
(saṁkāsanā, etc.); loc. pl. tīsu atthesu dissati (scil.
me-saddo), Pj I 101,17 = Ud-a 11,21, etc.; cf.
atthuddhāra; — (b), Sn 159 (mantā ~aṁ so bhāsati);
Vin I 185,10 (~o ca vutto attā ca anupanīto); ~assa
ninnetā, scil. Tathāgato, MN I 111,13 = SN IV 94,32
= AN V 227,6 = Nidd I 178,10 (quoted As 5,14);
— (c), Dhp-a I 228,8 ('appamado'ti padaṁ mahantaṁ
~aṁ dīpeti). — In this sense attha ts opp. to vyañjana
(q. v.), DN III 128,10; Nidd I 165,1-5; Dhp-a III 49,4;
to vacana, Mil 148,2; or to kāraṇa (q. v.), Ps (Ee) II
52,3; 393,29; to lakkhaṇa (q. v.),' Ps I 196,17; — abl.
atthato, Nidd I 165,2 (~ apaharanti, opp. vyañjanato;
= atthamhā paṭibāhanti, Nidd-a); do. adv. = 'as
to the meaning' (generally opp. to vyañjanato), MN II
239,6; Ps I 50,20; Pj I 154,23, etc. (see Pj II p. 801-2;
Vibhia p. 526); Ud-a 11,15, etc.; Mil 110,12; opp. to
ganthato, As 36,30 Pj II 447,26; opp. to pāṭhato, Ps I
108,1; — ifc. v. pada-°; — loc. °atthe, ifc. = 'in the
sense of; thus °atthe nipāto, see anussava° (= 'kira');
garahana° (= 'dhir-atthu'), codana° (= 'iṁgha'),
pikāra° (= 'va'); yācana° (= 'iṁgha'), vavassagga°
(— 'handa'); see also anādara°, upama°, upayoga°.
— Further exx. of the meanings above of attha ifc.:
akkhara°, añña°, attha°, anantara°, anāgata°,
aniyama°, anuggaha° aneka°, apa°, abhūta°,
avadhāraṇa °, asamāna °, ākāra °, āṇatty- °,
āsiṭṭha°, īsad-°, uttāna°, eka°, ekeka°, gaty-°,
gambhīra°, codana°, tatiya°, tad-°, tassīla°
dabba°, daḷha°, dhamma°, dhātv-°, nāna°, ni-
dassana°, nipuṇa°, nīta°, neyya°, pāḷi-°, piṇda°,
bhāsita°, bhusa°, bhūta°, lakkhaṇa°, vacana°,
saka°, saṁkhepa°, sadda°, samāna", sambhā-
vana°, sâttha, sāmi-°, subodha°, hanty-°.
8. originating from the sense of 'the aim pre-
scribed or aspired to', or 'the truth', attha ts com-
bined with and opp. to dhamma (cf. attha-dhamma
below), by Ct.s explained = 'theory' (opp. practice),
or 'the right aim (: the right practice); Sn 320;
323; 326 (Pj II 333,20: 'atthan'ti bhāsitatthaṁ,
'dhamman'ti pāḷidhammaṁ); 453 (sacce ~e ca
dhamme ca); p. 218,15 (Pj II 604,4: 'attham añ-
ñāyā' ti pāḷiatthaṁ aññāya, 'dhammam aññāyā'
ti pāḷiṁ aññāya) ≠ AN IV 296,7; Dhp 363 (= bhā-
sitatthaṁ c'eva desanādhammaṁ ca, Dhp-a); Nidd
I 234,30; AN I 69,23 (~añ ca dhammañ ca paṭibā-
hanti; = Aṭṭhakathañ ca Pāḷiñ ca paṭibāhanti,
Mp); IV 96,22* (kuddho ~aṁ na jānāti, kuddho
dhammaṁ na passati, quoted Pj II 12,3*); V 222,15
= 254,14 (opp. an-attha, resp. a-dhamma); Ja III
342,1 (rañño ~aṁ ca dhammaṁ ca anusāsi, he was the
king's adviser as to artha-çāstra and dharma-çāstra,
cf. attha-dhammânusāsaka); VI 389,32 (do.); V 57,20*
(Ct.: phalavipāka-saṁkhātaṁ atthañ ca tassa atthassa
hetubhūtaṁ dhammaṁ ca); 237,15* (Ct.: bhāsitattho
ca attha-jotako dhammo ca); 339,26* (kathaṁ . . .
dhamme ~aṁ na bujjhasi, see ib. 339,22*—340,5*);
VI 93,28 (rājānaṁ atthe yojetukāmo dhammaṁ
desento); 224,18* (~aṁ dhammaṁ ca ñāyaṁ ca, =
pāḷi-atthañ ca pāḷiñ ca kāraṇayuttiñ ca, Ct.); 299,29*
(~e ca dhamme ca yutto bhavassu); 327,16* (~e . .
ṭhito nipāko).
9. Title of a sutta, SN I 225 (otherwise Virocana-
Asurinda).

m. [masc. gender due to attraction by
pabbata; sa. asta; √ṛ, Sadd 432,1 (!)] according to
Grr. the western mountain, i. e. the place where the
sun sets; Abh 606 (aparaselo); 785 (= pacchima-
pabbate); in the texts (except cases as Kv 61,19)
used in acc. only atthaṁ, combined with the verbs
eti, gacchati, to set (a) of the sun: ~ eti (pabhaṁ-
karo), AN II 51,3*; suriye ~ ente, Ja III 37,12; V
2,23; suriyaṁ ~ entaṁ, Ja III 433,4; ~ gate suriye,
ib.; ~ entaṁ suriya-maṇḍalaṁ, Ja IV 334,1; suriyo
~ eti, Dhp-a IV 143,5; [taṁ ālokaṁ disvā yena suriyo
~ c'eva gamito (Se w. r. gato) uṭṭhāpito ca), Mp ad
AN I 228,15]; — (b) to go oat, become extinct (acc.
to grr: n., destruction, disappearance; Sadd 255,3
(Kv-a 32,10); Abh 785 (= nāse); 1154 (atthaṁ, ind. =
adassane)); Sadd 70,15 (= nibbānam); ~aṁ paleti,
Sn 1074 (Nidd II); ~aṁ gato, Sn 1075-76 (Nidd II,
= extinguished, gone out, scil. from existence; hence
Kv 61,19: parinibbuto puggalo atth'atthamhi n'atth'-
atthamhi etc.; ~aṁ gacchanti āsavā, Dhp 226 ( =
vināsaṁ, natthibhāvaṁ, Dhp-a); 293 (= parik-
khayaṁ, abhāvaṁ, Dhp-a); sabbe saṁyogā ~aṁ
gacchanti, Dhp 384 (= parikkhayaṁ, Dhp-a); viñ-
ñāṇam ~am agamā, Ud 93,13* = (vināsaṁ, Ud-a);
nirujjhanti vūpasammanti ~aṁ gacchanti, As 236,10;
ubhato chinnaṁ ~aṁ gacchati, Mil 52,2; ~ entamhi
sāsane, Ap 472,13; 475,3; atthaṁgataṁ ~aṁ gameti,
Kv 576,5 (quoted Ps III 235,5); — ifc. v. abbhat-
thaṁ, udayatthagāmi(n); cf. atthaṁ-gata (attha-
gata), atthaṁgama(na), atthami & attham-ita.

mfn. [sa. asta, pp. of √2as], thrown, cast,
sent; rendered by atta Abh 744 = khitta, etc.; cf.
nir-atta, âc Franke, Gesch. u. Krit. p. 85); other-
wise apattha, vipallattha.

ti. [sa. astra], a missile weapon; only in
the comp, issattha(ka), q. v.
pr. 2 pl. of atthi (q. v.).

mfn. [sa. ārtha], rich, skilled, MTD;
= atthasaṁhita (q. v.), Ja III 540,24-25'.
mfn. Ci), see attha-majjha

mfn. (from 2attha), ifc. v. an-°, nir-°,
sabba°, sâtthaka, siddha°. Cf. 1atthika.

f. (2attha + kathā), a profitable
talk; DN III 158,17* (= atthayuttaṁ kathaṁ, Sv).

mfn. [sa. artha-kara], serviceable,
useful; ifc. v. ujjota°, purisa°.

n. (2attha + karaṇa), 1. v. l. for
aṭṭa-karaṇa (q. v.). — 2. 'doing good', service; Ja VI
288,6' (sāmikassa ~aṁ).

mfn. (from prec. 2), clever in
business or service; Mil 264,1 (~o puriso); = artha-
siddhikāraṇikavū ekayodha puruṣayek, Hīnaṭ).

mfn. [sa. artha-kāma], 1 desirous
of one's good, wishing one well (gen.); Vin I 302,32
= AN III 143,24; DN III 164,1 (janassa ~o ahosi;
+ hitakāmo, phāsukāmo, yogakkhemakāmo); MN I
117,31 (+ hitak°, yogakkhemak°); SN I 44,2; 197,8
(tassa anukampikā ~ā) ≠ Ud 7,2 (= hitakāmā mettâ-
attha-kāma(+ hitesi(n), anukampaka; Ud-a) ≠ AN III 37,18 ≠
IV 267,9; Th 474 (~ā hitesino); Ja I 241,7* (~assa
hitânukampino; = vaḍḍhiṁ icchantassa, Ct.) = 244,7*
= 246,3*= III 243,13*'(=vaddhikāmassa); III 296,20*
(v. l. hatthakāma; = hitakāma, Ct.); 324,6' (= 'hita');
483,5; V 504,1* (anukampaka+); VI 4,25* (+ hita-
kāma) ≠ Vv 951; Pv 700 (~o si me); Pv-a 25,26
(+ hitesi(n); — 'anukampaka'); 112,1; Mil 188,3
(+ hitakāma, sukhakāma, visuddhikāma); Cp III 4,6
(tesâhaṁ evaṁ avacaṁ ~o hitesinaṁ; or to 2(?)).
— 2. pursuing the highest aim (cf. atta-kāma,
attatthakāma, and attatthiya: SN I 140,15* = AN
II 21,23* (Ee atta-°) = IV 91,1* (v. l. atta°); Ud
32,15* (Ud-a); AN I 231,19 (~ā kulaputtā sikkhanti;
quoted Ps (Ee) II 219,1); IV 227,25*.
entry.re:
— °-tāattha-kāma-tā, f. abstr.,
Sv ad DN III 236,35 (+ hita-kāmatā); Ps (Ee) 394,19
(Ee °kamya°). — °-vagga, m., title of Ja I 234-261.
— °ânukampaka, mfn., benevolent and compassionate.
AN IV 32,14* (mitto ~o, prob, sandhi for °kāmo
anuk°; see DN III 188,1*: 187,17; cf. SN I 197,8, etc.).

entry.sense:
mfn. = attha-kāma (1.); f. ~inī
(devatā), Sn 986.

see atta-kāra (2.). — Ifc. v.
an-°, cf. anattha-kāraka & anattha-kāriyā.

n. (2attha + kāraṇa), gain,
profit; Spk ad SN I 183,19 (= 'atthavasa'); abl. ~ā,
for the sake of gain, DN III 186,3*.

[wr. for anvakāri, Ja VI 208,22* (Se),
see anu-kirati.]

ind. (2attha + kāla, loc), at time of
need, when wanted; Ja IV 76,10* (= kassacid-eva
atthassa kāraṇassa uppanna-kāle, Ct.).

n., business, work of duty, Vv-a
147,13 (= 'attha'; v. l. atthena kiccena, cf. Ja III
540,21*).

mfn. 1. skilful as to what is good
(esp. one's own spiritual welfare); Sn 143 (karaṇīyaṁ
~ena; Pj); Ja I 366,3-5. — 2. conversant with the
'meaning' (regarding the explanation of the holy scrip-
tures); + dhamma-kusalo, vyañjana-k°, nirutti-k°,
pubbâpara-k°, AN III 201,23 (quoted PsI 4,11; =
attha-kusalaIfc. v. an-°.

mfn. (2attha + akkhāyi(n)),
who declares what is good or salutary; ~ī mitto, DN III
187,17; 188,3*; ~ī . . . nārī, Ap 595,26.

mfn. (3attha + gata), disappeared,
destroyed; Sn 472 = 475 (vidhūpita+; — atthaṁ-
gata, Pj) = AN IV 157,12* = 160,1*); As 170,16
(santa +). — °tta, n. abstr., Pj II 409,29. — Cf.
abbhatthagata & atthaṁgata.

n. (3attha + gamana), going
down, setting (of the sun, etc.); Ja I 101,15 ≠ Sp I
99,19 (yāva suriyass' atthaṁgamā); Ja I 209,5; IV
61,13' (uggamanañ ca ~añ ca, = 'gamanâgamana';
cf. Vv-a 326,22'). — Ifc. v. suriya°. — Cf. atthaṁ-
gamana.
mfn. = atthaṁ-gamita (q. v.).

mfn. (2attha + gavesaka),
looking for the meaning; Ps III 442,5 (tumhe pana no
~ā vyañjana-gavesakā gacchatha).

n. (2attha + gahaṇa), grasping
of the meaning, Sadd 318,1.

m. (3attha + ga) = attha(ṁ)-gama,
Ap 472,23 (read with Th-a ad Th 5 = sāsanatthaṁga-
sūcake, foreboding the disappearance of learning).

mfn. (3attha + gata), 1. gone
down, set (as the sun); suriyo ~o, Ja I 296,6; III
36,16; VI 62,19; 89,3; loc. ~e suriye, Vin IV 55,9**;
55,12'; Ja I 59,33; 175,10; III 433,1; 439,26; V 213,6;
Ud-a 31,33 (an-°); 289,12; Pv-a 55,28; Bv-a ad Bv
V 31 (= 'atthamf q. v.). —- 2. disappeared, ceased,
atthaṁ-gataDhs 1038 (atīta . . . ~ + abbhatthamgata); Vibh
195,21 (vinīta + . . . ~ + abbhatthaṁgata, etc.)
quoted Ps I 245,20; Ps III 235,5 (~aṁ atthaṁ gameti,
quoted from Kv 576,5). — Ifc. v. an-°. Cf. attha-
gata. — °tta, n. abstr., Pj I 187,18. — °-sikkhā-pada, n., title of Pācittiya 22 — Vin IV 54-55.
— °-suriya-kathā, f., title of Vin-vn 1145—48.
m. = attha-gama (q. v.).

n. (a ) = attha-gamana (q.v.);
Sv I 95,13 (= 'ogamana'; cf. Vin IV 55,12'); — (b)
= prec.; Mp ad AN III 314,25 (= 'atthaṁgama').
— Ifc. v. suriya°. atthaṁ-gamana

mfn. (2attha + cara), looking for
one's good; faithful, devoted; carrying out one's business,
being in one's service; Vin I 359,35* (mahājanass'
~o); SN I 23,14* (~aṁ narānaṁ; Spk); Ja IV 196,24
(Kosalarañño ~aṁ amaccaṁ). — Ifc. v. an-°.

mfn. = prec; DN I 107,20 (eva-
rūpena ~ena, by such a helper (ironically); = hita-
kāraka, Sv); Ja III 326,3 (amacca); IV 197,8 (do.);
230,14 (ekaṁ ~aṁ = ek amātyayek, Ja-pot); 230,17
(°-amacca); Ps III 13,15 (aññataro ~o); f. pl. ~ā,
Ja VI 369,20; ~ikā, a female attendant, Ja III 59,23;
~ikāya itthiyā, Ja VI 385,15. Cf. attha-cārikā.

f. = next; DN III 153,15* (read
dānam pi ca atthacariyatañ ca).

f. (2attha + cariyā), helpfulness,
friendly aid; DN III 152,18 (dāna, peyyavācā +);
190,18 (dāna, peyyavajja +); 192,20* (do.); 233,4
(do.) = AN II 32,19 = 248,7 = IV 364,11 ≠ IV
219,12; Ja V 330,28* (-dāna, †peyyavāsa +); Ja I
attha-cariyā(paron.: putto pitu caratī ~aṁ). — Ifc. v. an-°,
ñāta°, buddha°, loka°.

f. (adj.) (cf. attha-caraka, f. ~ikā),
helpful, ready to serve; Ja IV 37,20 (attano ~ikaṁ
dhātiṁ; cf. Dec 116: attha-yāriyā = sakhī).
mfn. = attha-cara; only ifc. an-°.

mfn. [sa. artha-cintaka], con-
sidering what is right; Ja V 374,5* (paṇḍitā nipuṇā
~ā); Vibh 426,11* (dhīrā nipakā nipuṇā ~ā).

mfn., intent on good,
Th 926 (cf. Trsl.).

m. (2attha + accaya), loss of
wealth; Ja III 158,25* (~e, = atthassa accayena, Ct.).

f. (2attha + chāyā), the shadow
of some (real) thing; Abhidh-s 39,24 (°âkārena).

mfn. (2attha + cheka), clever as
to what is advantageous; Pj I 236,8 (= 'attha-kusala')-

mfn. (2attha + jāta; cf. 2attha,
6 c: Ja I 387,4*; VI 362,20*), having some need or
task; SN I 37,5* (kiṁ mittaṁ ~assa; = uppanna-
kiccassa, Spk); 226,3-5* (sabbe sattā ~ā; = kicca-
jātā, Spk). 1attha-jāta

n. [2attha with suffix jāta], 'a sort of
things', means, wealth; kena ~ena attānaṁ parimo-
cayi, Ja VI 464,10* (= atthena jātena, Ct.).

mfn. (2attha + jāpika, cf. jāpeti),
mastering things or tasks, conquering or producing
wealth; Vibh 324,27 (~ikā paññā; Vibh-a 409,15
— 410,3; Sadd 485,28.

m., designation of the Brahma-jāla-
sutta, DN I 46,23 (~aṁ . . . Dhammajālaṁ . . .
Brahmajālaṁ . . . Diṭṭhijālaṁ; Sv I 129,9).

mfn. (2attha + jotaka), expriming
the meaning, setting a thing in its proper light; Ja V
237,30' (~o dhammo, opp. bhāsitattho); Dhātum
v. 155. Cf. idam-attha-jotaka.

n. (2attha + ajjhogāhana),
entering into the meaning, Pj I 157,19.

mfn. (2attha + °-ññū, cf. sa. artha-
jña), knowing the right meaning, understanding cor-
rectly; DN III 252,14 (dhammaññū + ; bhāsitassa
atthaṁ jānātîti ~ū, Sv) = 283,3; AN IV 113,10;
113,2]—114,2 (dhammaññū +); AN III 148,3
atthaññūpañca atthe jānāti); Th 1028 (pubbâparaññū +).
— Ifc. v. pāḷi-°.

or atthata, mfn. [sa. āstṛta], spread,
covered (with instr, or ifc); ~aṁ kathinaṁ, Vin I
254,25 foll; 265,33*; IV 287,3'; V 172,2; 177,18; Ja
V 407,28' (~ena ajinena); Pj II 377,28 (= 'santhata');
Mp II 172,19 (~e, scil. pallaṁke, quoted Ss 50,10);
— ifc. v. an-°, goṇaka°, paccattharaṇa°, paṭalika°,
patika°, veḷuriyaphalaka°, sabbattharaṇa°.
— atthataaṁkayutte? Se addharattâlaṁkatayutte).
entry.re:
— °-ka-atthaṭa-ka-
ṭhina, mfn., who has held the Kaṭhina-ceremony (see
kaṭhina), Vin I 254,8 foll.; 298,22 (/;. ~ aṁ, the K.
having been held).

entry.sense: ind. (abl.), see 2attha, 7 c.
m., three-fold meaning; Sadd 313,32.
entry.re:
— °-vibhāgaattha-ttika-vibhāga; m., the 14th chapter in Sadd; Sadd
314,1.

entry.sense:
m. (2attha + 2attha), (a) what is
really good or useful; Ja VI 290,1* (~aṁ evânuvicin-
tayanto; = atthabhūtam eva atthaṁ, Ct.); (b) dat.
~āya, for the sake of gain, Mil 264,4.
entry.re:
— °-paṭi-pucchāatthattha-paṭi-pucchā, f., inquiry as to one's good; Ja IV 96,8
atthatthaEd.);

— °-paṭipucchikaatthattha-paṭipucchika, mfn., Ap 611,19 = Thī-a
200,17* (v. l. a'ttatthaparip°).

entry.sense:
m., the being 'atthen'-
atthiko' (cf. iatthika, Sn 460), Pj II 405,19.

mfn. (2attha + dassa [sa. darça]),
looking for what is right or salutary, provident; Sn
385 (so for atthadassī; = hitânupassī, Pj II 373,25);
pl. ~ā, Ja VI 260,4* (— atthadassana-samattha,
mfn., ib. s'). attha-dassa

mfn. (from prec), id.; nom. m.
~ī, Sn 385 (prob, for attha-dassa, q.v.); Ja V 141,8*
(Maghavā Sakko ~ī); f. ~inī, Ja VI 470,21*; 473,5*;
instr, pl. ~ibhi, Th 4; gen. pl. ~inaṁ, Ja III 323,25*
1attha-dassinan-°, nipuṇa°. Cf. attha-dassima(t).

m. Npr. 1. of the fourteenth
Buddha; Bv XV,1 foll. (quoted Ja I 39,19*); Ja I
38,27; Ap 87,2 foll.; 99,11; 168,22; 204,20 (cf. Th-a
ad Th 6); 296,2 (Th-a ad Th 203 and 240); 369,11
foll; 428,18 foll; Mhv I 8; Mbv 11,3. — 2. of an
ancient king (in Benares), Dīp III 41. — 3. of a thera
in Ceylon, Ja I 1,14*; Gv 68,30. 2Atthadassin2Atthadassi

mfn. (cf. attha-dassi(n), and
see puttima(t)), clear-seeing, sharp-witted; Ja VI
286,26* (gatimā dhitimā mutimā ~ā); 287,11'.

mfn., explaining the meaning;
Sadd 178,19 (°pada).

mfn. (3a + thaddha [sa. stabdha],
sometimes written a-thaddha, metr. always - - ≃ ),
'not stiff, not obstinate or stubborn, not self important;
DN III 47,31 ≠ MN I 97,12 (amakkhī . . . ~ + ati-
mānī); It 113,2-12* (nikkuha +) = AN II 26,20; 27*;
a-tthaddhaSv) ≠ Ja VI 286,31* (= thaddha-macchariya-rahita,
Ct.); Spk ad SN IV 118,11* (= 'akhila'); As 332,22
(= 'muduka'); [Ja II 59,17 read apatthaddhā].
— — °-tā f. abstr., Ja VI 252,24* (°-ânatīsāko, see
ānat'-īsāka; = ~āya ānata-īso, Ct.); As 150,33 ( =
'avitthanatā').

n. (2attha + dvaya), two different
meanings; Pj I 101,23 (~e vaṭṭati) ≠ Sv I 28,13.

m. (dvandva, but mostly in two
separate words; cf. 2attha (8.)), theory and practice
(Ctt. 'meaning and text'); Ja III 339,16* (cf. Ct.) =
340,9*. — °-nirutti f. (dvandva), the three first pa-
ṭisambhidā; Ap 480,23 = 543,13 (~īsu paṭibhāne
attha-dhammabhidās, q. v.). — °-paṭisamvedi(n), mfn., appre-
hending a°, Ud-a 311,2; — °-yutta, mfn., con-
nected with, or containing a° Ja IV 214,11 (~aṁ
kathaṁ). Cf. dhammattha-yutta. — °-vid[ū/u], mfn.,
knowing a°, Ja VI 222,15* (according to Ct. acc
pl. ~ū ise; = pāḷi-atthañ c'eva pāḷi-dhammañ
ca jānante, Ct.).
entry.re:
— °-ânusatthiattha-dhammânusatthi, f., instruction in
a°, Ja V 58,26* (loc. ~iyā).

— °-ânusāsakaattha-dhammânusāsaka, mfn. or
m., one who gives advice in a°; (a) mfn., Ja III 21,10
(amacco); do. ib. 115,14; 317,8; 337,4; IV 197,7;
VI 255,28; — (b) m., Ja II 98,9 (Bodhisatto tassa
~o ahosi; III 400,22 (rañño ~o ahosi); VI 259,17
(mama ~o).

entry.sense:
m. (2attha + naya), way or method
of explanation, Ps 128,1; Sadd 23,19.

f. [sa. arthanā], begging, request; Abh
759 (bhikkhā yācanā ~ā); cf. patthanā.

f., difference in meaning; Sadd
340,30 foll.

n. (2attha + nigamana), a
concluding argumentation, Ps 154,8 (padayojanāya
~aṁ karissāma).

f. (2attha + nipphatti), a
result, Ps III 51,18 (kiñci ~iṁ apassanto).
[As 223,13, see atta-nimitta.]

mfn. (2attha + nissita), useful,
salutary; Ja III 367,31 (~aṁ kathentena); Sv ad
DN II 275,15 (= 'attha-saṁhita').

mfn. (2attha + antara), (a) 'being
inside', i. e. concurring or agreeing in the meaning (or
the matter); Th 374 (atthañ ca yo jānāti [ - ˇ ˇ ]
bhāsitassa, atthañ ca ñatvāna tathā karoti, ~o nāma
sa hoti paṇḍito; Th-a). — (b) intent on good; DN III
1atthantaratara).

n. [sa. arthāntara], difference in
meaning; Mil 159,1; Sadd 38,20; 266,1; — ifc. v.
sukhuma".

mf(~ikā)n. (2attha + pakā-
saka), explaining the meaning; Ja V 256,31' (~ikā
[v. l. ~itā], = 'attha-sandassanī').

m. pl. ~ā (= 1atthika (b)
+ paccatthika), the two parties in a litigation;
nom. ~ā (ubho), Vin II 94,5 (Ed. atta-p°); acc. ~e
(ubho), AN V 71,24 (v. l. atthike paccatthike); gen.
~ānaṁ (ubhinnaṁ), Ja I 338,11; V 119,8' (Ee &
Se atta-paccakkhikānaṁ; Ck attha-paccakkhikānaṁ
attha-paccatthikanaṁ).

f. (2attha + paññatti), notion,
idea, concept; Abhidhammatthavibhāvinī Se 253,13
ad Abhidh-s 39,15; Abhidh-s Trsl. p. 120 n. 2 (cf.
p. 4).

m. (2attha + paṭilābha) =
'atthâbhisamaya', q. v.

m. (2attha + paṭivedha),
penetrating the meaning (scil. of the dhamma); Ps I 6,4
(°samatthatā).

mfn. (2attha + paṭisaṁ-
vedi(n)), knowing the meaning (scil. of the dhamma);
DN III 241,7 (tasmiṁ dhamme ~ī + dhamma-paṭi-
attha-patisaṁvedin21,18 (Mp do.) =lV 361,18; DN III 241,17 - AN III
22,2 (quoted Pj I 141,12); AN I 151,4 (= aṭṭhakathaṁ
ñānena patisaṁvedī, Mp).
entry.re:
— °-tāattha-patisaṁvedi(n)-tā f. ábstr., Pj I
141,8.

entry.sense:
f. (2attha + paṭisam-
bhidā q. v.), analysis of the meaning, or expertness in
that (cf. dhamma-°, nirutti-°, paṭibhāṇa-paṭisam-
bhidā); AN II 160,22 (= pañcasu atthesu pabheda-
gatañāṇaṁ, Mp); Paṭis I 88,2; 119,22; 132,33; II
150,19; 157,31; 193,23; Vibh 293,3 foll. (atthe pa-
ṭisambhidā, etc., Vibh-a 386,9, 24 (≠ Ud-a 136,20);
393,24 foll.; quoted Ps I 174,4, cf. Sp-t ad Sp I 2,1*);
Nett 20,3.
entry.re:
— °-pattaattha-paṭisambhidā-patta mfn., possessed of a°; AN III
113,16 (Mp); 120,1.

entry.sense: m. [sa. artha-pati], a king, MTD.

n. (2attha + pada), 1. a right or
profitable word (often referring to the holy texts); Dhp
100 (Dhp-a); gambhīraṁ ~aṁ, AN II 189,14; III
356,21 — IV 362,2; + kāraṇa-pada, Ja II 236,22'≠
attha-padaVI 318,13* (sataṁ dhammaṁ ... anuttaraṁ ~aṁ
suciṇṇaṁ); Vism 442,19 (gaṇṭhipada +; yassa pa-
dassa attho duviññeyyo taṁ gaṇṭhipadam, yassa
adhippāyo duviññeyyo taṁ ~am, mhṭ). — 2. the
word giving the signification of another, Dhātum intr,
v. 3; Nidd-a I 95,8 (ad Nidd I 18,25; opp. mūla-
pada). — Ifc. v. aneka°, kovida°.
entry.re:
— °-kovidaattha-pada-kovida, mfn.,
skilled in the right doctrine, v. an-° (cf. kovidattha-
pada).

— °-samhitaattha-pada-samhita, mfn., consisting of right and
profitable words, v. an-°.

entry.sense:
