mfn., Ja IV 466,2*, metr.
haplol. (see s. v. accupati) for adāsa-sakuntâbhiruda
(Se ādāsa-°) i. e. 'resonant with (song of) birds (liv-
ing) in liberty', which is also the explanation of Ct.:
adāsa-saṁkhātehi-sakuṇehi abhirudā. adā-sakuntâbhiruda

f. (of a-dāsa), not a (female) slave; MN II
62,15 (sace je saccaṁ bhaṇasi ~ī bhavasi ɔ: you
are freed) ≠ Mp I 403,1.

mfn. [sometimes also addiṭṭha; sa.
a-dṛṣṭa], not seen, invisible,unknown; n. ~aṁ asutaṁ-
mutaṁ vā, Sn 1122; ~aṁ dakkhitabbaṁ, Nidd I
366.3 (Nidd-a); + assutaṁ, Ja III 233,16*(metr.fα«/ty);
+ asutaṁ aparisaṁkitaṁ, Vin I 238,8; III 163,34 ( =
'amūlakaṁ); MN I 369,8; + aviditaṁ asacchikataṁ,
1a-diṭṭha52,26; aññātaṁ ~aṁ + appattaṁ asacchikataṁ ana-
bhisametaṁ, AN IV 384,18; do. + aviditaṁ, etc., MN
I 475,29; SN V 221,4; Nidd I 178,11 (Nidd-a); do. +
atulitaṁ atīritaṁ avibhūtaṁ avibhāvitaṁ, Nidd I
339,10; padaṁ asokaṁ ~aṁ abbhatītaṁ, Vin I 40,34*
= Ap 25,13 ( - - ˇ , thus addiṭṭhaṁ); in comp. °-as-
suta-acintita-pubbaṁ, Dhp-a III 71,1; — instr. ~ena,
Ja VI 212,6*; 215,20' (devalokena); — loc. ~e diṭṭha-
saññino, Vin III 91,5 (Sp); ~e (a-)diṭṭhavādī, AN II
227,12(-14); ~e (a-)ditthavadita, AN IV 307,3(-9);
— f. ~ā, SN IV 329,21 (Ck addiṭṭhā + assutā);
— m. pl. ~ā, DN II 96,28 ≠ Vin I 232,13 (reading
aditthapubbā); rūpā ~ā aditthapubbā, SN IV 72,19
(Spk).

mfn. [sa. a-diṣṭa], not pointed out; see
a-diṭṭh'-antarāya below.

mfn. = iadiṭṭha; Ja VI 9,27 (āca-
riyehi ~aṁ nāma n'atthi).

mfn., showing something un-
seen (unknown); f. ~ā pucchā (tisso pucchā), Nidd
I 339,1 foll. (quoted Pj II 159,32; Nidd-a); Pj II
562,1; (pañcavidhā pucchā) Sv I 68,17 ≠ As 55,17
≠ Spk II 10,6 = Paṭis-a 70,15. a-diṭṭha-jotana

n. abstr. of 1adittha; abl. ~ā, SN V
456.11 (catunnaṁ ariyasaccānaṁ); Ja II 266,15'
(kiṁsukassa).

m., an obstacle for [a gift
to] a person not specified, Mil 156,17 (+ uddissakaṭ'-
antarāyo, etc.; 'anodissa adassanena' ib. 156,19 proves
that the author of Mil hesitated between 'not seen'
(√dṛç) and 'not pointed out' (√diç)).

mfn., not seen before; Vin I
232,13; SN IV 72,19 (adittha + ; Spk); 193,13 (kiṁ-
suko ~o; cf. Ja II 265,11); Ja V 396,26*; Dhp-a IV
57,14 (+ assutapubba).

mfn., considering a thing as
unknown;'AN II 227,14(-17) ((a-)ditthe ~ī). — °-tā,
f. abstr., AN IV 307,8.

mfn., who has not perceived the
truth; gen. ~assa, Dhp-a III 30,14; Mil 215,2; gen. pl.
~ānaṁ, Mil 149,1; Saddh 175.

m., one who is friends with
another whom he has not seen; nom. ~o, SN IV 288,4;
Th-a(O') 238,21; Ja I 377,16; 378,18 ;pZ.~ā, Ja III
364.12 (aññamaññaṁ thiravissāsā); 366,2 (aññamañ-
ñaṁ).
entry.re:
— °-sahāyakaa-diṭṭha-sahāya-sahāyaka, m. id.; Dhp-a I 187,16 (pl.
a-diṭṭha-sahāyaMp I 430,9 √tassa so seṭṭhi ~o hoti, scil. Ghosaka-
seṭṭhi).

entry.sense:
f., absence of (false) theories; instr.
~iyā + assutiyā, aññāṇā, Sn 839—40 (Nidd).

f. [ts.], Npr. of the mother of the gods,
Abh 83 (devamātā); MTD adds 'the earth'; gen. ~iyā
(putto = 'ādicco', í. e._suriyo), Sv III 194,9 ad DN
III 196,10* (Se reads Aditiyā). Cf. ādicca.

mfn., not given, (taken) without per-
mission; ~aṁ †hevya-saṁkhātaṁ ādiyeyya, Vin III
45,15**; 46,16**,32"' (Sp (II) 301,13); Vin I 96,31 (see
adinnâdăna); MN I 286,18; DN III 65,18 (gen. pers.:
paresam); ~am ādiyati, to steal, Sn 119; 156; 400;
633; Dhp 246: 409; DN III 49,1; 62,17 = MN III
a-dinna49,1; ~aṁ parivajjeti, to abstain from ~, Sn 395;
Pv 590 ≠ Dhp-a I 32,13*; — rañño dārūni adinnaṁ-
ādiyi, he look the king's timber without leave, Vin III
44,35 (cf. dhammam sajjhāyaṁ-karoti, AN III 22,15
[> sinh, (h)adāraṇa, 'to rehearse, study']; Buddhaṁ
saraṇaṁ-gacchāmi, Khp I, etc.; te nijjhapanaṁ-
karonti, Ja IV 495,11*; taṁ (scil. bhojanaṁ) antar-
āyaṁ-karoti, Mil 156,10-23 [cf. Schmalz-Hofmann,
Lal. Syntax § 18, Brugmann-Thumb, Griech. Gramm,
§443: 2 Anm. 2, Horn, Grundriss d. iran. Philol.
I: 2 p. 156]; — similarly: mittassa pānīyaṁ ~aṁ
paribhuñjisaṁ, Ja IV 116,17*; pupphaṁ~am upasiṁ-
ghasi, ekaṅgaṁ etaṁ theyyānaṁ, SN I 204,29* =
Ja III 308,16*. — n. ~aṁ, title of a sutta, SN V
469,1.
entry.re:
— °-pubbaa-dinna-pubba, mfn., not given before, Ja III
54,24 (Ç— nadinnapubbaṁ).

entry.sense:
m. Npr. of a brāhmaṇa, lit.
'who never gave anything (to anybody)', Dhp-a I 25,4
foll. — °-kula, n., a family which never gives anything
away, Pj II 287,23; cf. adāyaka-vaṁsa.

m., the not being given, Ja V
212,12.

n. [a-dinna + ādāna, cf. Buddh,
sa. adattâdāna], stealing, theft; ~aṁ āsevitaṁ, etc.,
AN IV 247,11 (quoted Kv 618,27); ~aṁ pahātabbaṁ,
MN I 361,14; ~aṁ pahāya ~ā pativirato, DN I 4,5
(Sv); MN I 179,25; 267,37; 287,29; III 33,21; do. ~ā
a-dinnâdānaV 469,3; appaṭiviratā ~ā, DN III 195,12; It 63,5;
SN V 469,2; ~ā veramanī (q. v.), Vin I 83,33; DN
III 195,7; 235,1; AN I 297,34; Pp 39,18; Khp II 2
(Pj); loc. ~e, Vin III 46,17**; AN I 297,31; cf. DN
III 67,11 foll; 181,26; 182,1* (against metre); 269,1.

mfn. [a-dinna + ādāyi(n)],
taking what is not given, stealing, a thief; m. pāṇâti-
pātī hoti, ~ī hoti, etc., Vin I 85,21; DN III 82,8;
MN I 286,16; III 46,25; 54,1; 163,20; 209,22; AN I
297,31; V 281,14; SN IV 243,8; Pp 38,32; pl. ~ino,
DN I 138,32; AN I 174,2; Mil 290,10; pl. ~ī, MN
I 42,7.

[w. r. for yajimha, Ap 482,18 = Th-a
(Ce) 436,28].
see Addila-°.
neg. abs. v. dissati and passati.

mfn., invisible; Ja VI 273,8'
(~aṁ ṭhapetvā, scil. assaṁ).

mfn. [ts.], not depressed, undaunted;
Th 173 (bhaddo ājañño . . . ~o vahate dhuraṁ).
— °-khattiya-kula, n., a noble royal family, DN I 115,32
- 132,9 = MN II 167,10 (ucca-kula +; Mss. & Edd.
ādīna-° ("derived from ādi", RhD), v. l. a-bhinna-0
a-dīnaspirit, Th 243 = 683 (~o naro); SN V 74,9 (~o +
avyāpanna-cetaso; Ee ādīna-mānaso); Nidd II 218,31
(= na saṁkucita-citta, Nidd-a).

mfn. = a-dīna(?), Ja V 340,19* (Ct'»
ib. 342,17' reads ādīnavan ti ādīnavam eva hutvā
[Ck ādinnam eva], cf. ādīnava, m.).

mfn. [sa. adīnasattva], noble-
minded, Ja V 29,7*-29' (so Ck, Ee Ālīnasatte, Se
Alīnasatte; allusion to the Npr. Alīnasattu, q.v.);
cf. alīnacitta, Ja V 491,25*).

m. Npr., v. r. for Alīnasattu, Ja V
26,8' (Tr. suggests Adhīnasattu; Cks read Adīna-°).
(ind., w. r. for ādu.)

or adu), pron. n. sg. (to asu, amu, q. v.),
that; DN III 49,1 (aduñ c'assa hoti tapassitāya; Sv =
etaṁ c'assa); MN I 240,37; 241,22; SN IV 315,8 (~
khettaṁ); Ja I 500,18* (opp. idaṁ); V 330,13* (evaṁ
1aduṁ[Ck (du)duñ ça duñ ca]). Hence, according to Ja III
54,1' & Sadd 278,9, the base du- in gen. m. n. dussa
= amussa, Ja III 54,1*.
aor. 3 pl., v. dadāti (deti).

mfn., causing
feeling of neither pain nor pleasure; SN II 97,3 (~aṁ
phassaṁ); IV 114,9 (do.); Nidd I 52,18 (~o sam-
phasso).

mfn., feeling neither
pain nor pleasure; nom. m. ~ī attā, DN I 31,14
(ekantasukhī +) ≠ MN II 234,3 ≠ SN III 220,6
(also title of a sutta, ib.). a-dukkha-m-asukhin

mfn. [sa. aduṣta], without hatred or
anger; Sn 623 (Pj) = Dhp 399 (Dhp-a); It 86,9* =
Vin II 203,12*; Vin V 165,11*; MN II 172,29 (alud-
dha +); AN I 191,6 (+ dosena anabhibhūto); 195,32
(+ avyāpannacitto).

mfn., whose mind is not (cannot
be) troubled with hatred (anger); Vin II 89,38 (alud-
dhacitta+); AN IV 151,1* = It 21,8* (= mettā-
balena suṭṭhu vikkhambhita-vyāpādatāya vyāpādena
adūsitacitto; quoted Pj I 168,16*); Ja II 172,21* (=
kilesehi adūsitacitto) = III 460,1* (= chandâdīhi
adūsitacitto) = V 267,17*; f. ~ā, Ja II 348,25* =
AN IV 93,17*. a-duṭṭha-citta

entry.re:
— °-âpattisaññi(n)a-duṭṭhullâpattisaññi(n), mfn., considering an offence not
to be a grave offence; m. ~ī, Vin IV 32,10; 128,8.

entry.sense:
mfn., not wrongly applied; Ps III
105,13 (~aṁ yeva duppayutto ti).
see a-dūbha.

n. (cf. dubbhati, dūbhati, sa.
√druh), not deceiving, faithfulness; Ja VI 311,ḷ,1',

(mf)n., not unwelcome; used in
salutations: svāgataṁ te . . . atho te ~aṁ, Ja IV
356,22* ≠ 434,5* ≠ V 323,29* ≠ VI 23,17*; 85,24*;
569,15*; Thī 337 (tassā te svāgataṁ bhadde tato(!)
te ~aṁ; = na durāgataṁ, Thī-a). a-dur-agata

mfn., not hating; As 150,9
(°-vasena).

f., absence of hatred; Dhs 33 = 105
= 313; As 150,10.
entry.re:
— °-âkāraa-dussanā-âkāra, m., behaviour in ~,
As 150,11.

entry.sense: mfn., not hating; As 150,11.
entry.re:
— °-ttaa-dussita-tta,
n.abstr., Dhs 33 — 105 = 313; As 150,11.

entry.sense: [v. l. for ajūtakara (q. v.)]

(also written a-dubbha or a-drūbha),
m. [sa. a-droha], freedom from malice or treachery,
not doing harm; Vin I 347,37 (sapathaṁ akaṁsu
adrūbhāya); SN I 225,19 (sapassu me ... adub-
1a-dubhakāretvā); V 222,14* (sādhu mittānaṁ adubbho
[ - - - , thus adrūbho, cf. Sv I 171,16* = Pj II
176,18* = Ps I 19,5*]; = adubbhanabhāvo, Ct.); VI
460,21 (aññamaññaṁ ~āya sapathaṁ kariṁsu); Mhv
VII 23 (adubbhatthāya).

mfn., not deceiving, harmless; Ja VI
199,15* (~assa tuvaṁ dūbhi).

mfn., id., Ja VI 311,6' (= 'adū-
bha'; Ee adrūbhakaṁ, Cks adrabhakaṁ, Se darū-
bhakaṁ(!)); pl. ~ā [ ˇ - ˇ - ], Mhv XXII 81 (añ-
ñamaññaṁ).

m., an innocent (and useful) hand
(i. e. a friend who ought not to be deceived), Ja VI
310,18* (~iṁ dahate mitta-dūbho, = adrūbhakaṁ,
Ct.; Se reads allañ ca pāṇiṁ, cf. 309,31* below s. v.
2adda); mfn., who has a non-deceiving hand, a bene-
factor; Pv 256 (°-pāṇī dahate mitta-dūbhiṁ ɔ: the
a-dūbha-pāṇiof) the treacherous; Pv-a 116,8).

mfn. [ts.], not distant, near; loc. ~e
(adv., cf. avidūre), Ja V 45,3*; 48,5*.
entry.re:
— °-gataa-dūra-gata, mfn.,
not having reached any distance, Mil 306,27.

— °-ṭṭhaa-dūra-ṭṭha,
mfn., standing not far, Ap 549,26 = Thī-a 134,16*
(cf. Mp I 343,2 foll.).

entry.sense:
(m. or n.?), prob, a sort of trap or
pitfall; Sp (II) 457,28 foll. (Vin-vn 303); Mp I 35,19
(°-sataṁ + pāsa-sataṁ, . . . sūlasataṁ); 36,13
(°~âdīni); Ss 53,21 (sūla-satañ ca pāsa-satañ ca
°-satañ ca yojetvā). —°-pāda, m., a trap-stake; Sp
(11)458,9 (cf. pădesu (!) ib. 457,29). — °-pāsāṇa,
adūhalatrap-stage; ib.

mfn. [sa. *a-dvaidhya ^ a-dvaidha],
not divided into two parts, not shared, united, concen-
trated (cf. sa. ekāgra); samādhi manaso ~o, Ja III
7,21* (= abhejja-samādhi, ib. 8,2'). See also
a-dvejjha-°.

mfn. [sa. adhi-jya; Ct.s explanation as
1a-dejjha ('not separated', united with) may account
for -e- and interchange of aspiration], strung (said of
a bow); Ja III 274,12* (dhanuṁ ~aṁ katvāna; =
jiyāya saddhiṁ ekato katvā, Ct.) — IV 258,24*
(jiyāya ca sarena ca saddhiṁ ekam eva katvā, Ct.)
≠ Ap 222,15.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. atti, I√ad], to eat; 2 sg. ~esi,
Ja V 31,25* (= khādeyyāsi, Ct.); 33,2* (= khādissasi,
Ct.); 92,1* (= khādasi, Ct.); 496,20* (na ... adesi
= mā khādi, Ct.); 1 sg. ~emi, Ja V 496,28*; also
adāmi (as from *adati, rhyming with vadāmi; Mvu
II 86,8*: yena açesi na tena vrajesi, etc.), Ja VI
365,23* (yenâdāmi = yena hatthena adāmi, Ct. [so
to read, Mss. ādāmi as from ā + √dā]; B reads
dadāmi); 3 pl. ~enti, Ja VI 106,22* foll. (= khā-
adeti~etu, Ja V 197,5* (etu bhavaṁ assam[am] imaṁ,
adetu(!) = bhuñjatu, Ct.); pot. 3 sg. ~eyya, Ja III
296,13* (Ct. reads against metre ādeyya = ādiyeyya,
from ādeti = ādiyati, q.v.); V 33,10*; = 493,9*;
3 pl. ~eyyu(ṁ), Ja II 183,6* (= khādeyyuṁ); V
107,9* (do. do.), 21*.

mfn. [sa. a-deya], 1. not to be given;
Ap 304,20 (~o kassaci); Ja V 392,1* (na câpi me
kiñci-m-adeyyaṁ atthi, Ct.). — 2. unworthy to receive
gifts; Ja III 12,1* (~esu dadaṁ dānaṁ, = pubbe
akatûpakāresu, Ct.).
[mfn., Ap 518,18, see ādeyya-°].

mfn. (cf. 1satta), not possessed by
a demon; Ja V 445,1* (nâdevasatto puriso thīnaṁ
saddhātuṁ arahati; Ct. ib. 446,18': devena asatto
anāsatto [cf. āsādeti] ayakkhagahitako abhūtâviṭṭho
a-deva-sattatâvaṭṭo.

m., not the right place; loc. ~e, Vin III
247,18 (patto na ~ nikkhipitabbo; Sp); Ja VI 442,15*
(~ vata no vutthaṁ).

mfn., not to be expiated by
confession only, f. ~inī, scil. āpatti: Vin II 3,8 (anā-
patti + desitá āpatti; Sp); V 115,6; 187,9. a-desanā~gāmin
aor. v. dadāti (deti).

mfn. [sa. a-doṣa], faultless, AN I 112,21
(avaṁka +; opp. sa-dosa). — m. a matter of no
consequence, not a fault, Mhv XXV 96. — °-tta, n.
abstr., AN 1112,23. 1a-dosa
[= adūsaka (q.v.), Ja VI 579,1*].

mfn., produced from non-hate, AN I
135,24 (~aṁ, kammaṁ; adosapakataṁ +); 203,25.

mfn., having a wish for non-
hate, Vism 116,24 (alobhajjhāsaya+).

mfn., caused by non-hate, AN I
135,24; 203,25.

m., exposition of non-hate,
As 150,9.

f., the being result of non-
hate; Vv-a 14,14.

mfn., originating in non-hate,
AN I 135,24 (~aṁ kammaṁ, + adosajaṁ, etc.).

mfn., caused by non-hate; AN
I 203,26.

mfn., sprung from non-hate,
AN I 135,25 (adosapakata+); 203,25.

mfn., abounding in non-hate;
Vism 103,19.

√2: himsāyaṁ, Sadd 544,7. Cf. addana,
addita, addeti.

(or addā), aor. 3 sg. of √dis2 [sa. adrākḷ,
see passati, dakkhati, dissati, addakkhi, addasa: Th
986 ≠ SN IV 207,16* (yo sukhaṁ dukkhato ~ . . .
addakkhi; Spk = addasa; quoted Ps 1246,3*) =
It 47,13* (Ee adopts the inferior reading dakkhi); [Sn
1addarājānam Aṅgatiṁ); — addā: Th 1244 (sabba-(ṭ)ṭhitī-
nam atikkamam ~) = SN I 193,21*; Ja VI 125,5*
(~ Sīdantare nage; = addasa, Ct.) ≠ 126,25*;
— 1 sg. addaṁ, Ja III 380,6*, 18* (ib. 8*, 20* addasaṁ).

(= alia, q. v.), mfn. [sa. ārdra], wet,
moistened; Abh 753; Ja VI 309,31* (~añ ca pāṇiṁ
parivajjayassu, keep ycur hand wet (do'nt bum so
useful a thing as your hand), i. e. do not offend against
your good (and useful) friends, = allaṁ tintaṁ
pāṇiṁ mā dahi, mā jhāpayi, Ct.); 310,1* (~añ ca
pāṇim dahate kathaṁ so); 310,26* see a-dūbha-pāṇi
above. — Cf. addāyati & kalaladda-gata.

n. [sa. ārdraka], green (undried) ginger,
Abh 459. Cf. adda-(or alla-)siṅgivera.
aor. v. passati.

m. abstr. from 2adda; Sadd 362,17
(= tintabhāvo); giving the sense of √kilot, Sadd II
401; √tim, ib. II 651.
see ajjava.

n., green (undried) ginger;
Ja I 244,1. See also alla-siṅgivera.

f. [sa. ārdrā], the 6th nakkhatta (lunar
mansion), Abh 58; Sadd 359,17.

(addāyanā, addāyitatta), v. l. ādā, etc.,
only ifc. v. an-°.
aor. v. *adda.

pr. 3 sg. med. (denom, of 2adda; cf.
sa. ārdrayati), to (seem to) be wet or moist; ~te ayaṁ
rukkho, Ja IV 351,26* (v. l. allāyate; = udaka-
bharito viya addo hutvā paññāyati). addāyate

entry.re:
— °-vaṇṇaaddâriṭṭhaka-vaṇṇa, mfn., having the colour of
that seed, Vibh-a 232,2 (kesā . . . kāḷakā ~ā) — Vism
249,11 (= abhinavâriṭṭha-phala-vaṇṇā, mhṭ);
— °-sadisa, mfn., like that fruit, Ps III 354,13 (~ena
addâriṭṭhaka°-samāna, mfn. id., Nidd I 355,8 (Nidd-a knew two
readings: bhaddâriṭṭhakas° = apanīta-taca-bhaddâ-
riṭṭhaka-phala-sadisa, and addâriṭṭhakas° = tinta-
kākasadisa; v. l. aḷāriṭṭhaka).

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. ārdra + avalepana],
newly daubed, MN I 86,36 (~ā upakāriyo; Ps; quoted
Nidd II 122,31; Nidd-a v. l. addhâ°); SN IV 187,1
(kuṭāgāra-sālā bahala-mattikā ~ā; v. l. addâvalim-
panā).

m. [sa. add], a stone, a mountain; Abh 605;
Sadd 429,16. — Ifc. v. indanīla°, cakkavāḷa°.

mfn. = a-diṭṭha (q. v.), not seen; for
-dd- cf. duddittha & suddittha; Sn 147 = Khp IX 5
(Pj); SN IV 329,21 (v. l. Ck.

mfn. [sa. ardita, pp. of √ard; cf. aṭṭita
above], pained, afflicted; Th 406 (kāma-rāgena); Thī
77 (do.); 89 (do.); Ja III 261,8 (f. ~ā); Pv-a 260,1
(dukkhena); Saddh 281 (bandhu-sokena); 295 (maccu-
vegena). — Ifc. v. tutta°, duk(k)ha°, bhaya°,
maccu-bhaya°. addita

[m. [sa. adri + pāvaka], 'mountain-
fire', a volcano, MTD.]

pr. 3 sg. [sa. √ard, cf. addita], =
aṭṭiyati (q. v.); to be worried, to feel loathing; Thī-a
221,32, v. l. for aṭṭiyati, see Th-i p. 204,23; 1 sg.
~āmi (+ harāyāmi), Thī 140 (w. r. for aṭṭiyāmi).

n. Npr., name of a country;
Sv (Ee) I 317,6 "(v. l. Addhila°, Se Damiḷa-r°) = Ps
II 524,20 (Se Adila°: pubbe kira ~aṁ nāma ahosi,
tato Kotūhaḷako . . . kedāra-paricchinnaṁ raṭṭhaṁ
[Sv: anantara-raṭṭhaṁ] . . . agamāsi, ≠ Ajitaraṭṭha,
Dhp-a I 169,14 (p. I. Allakappar° = Rt, cf. Dhp-a I
Addila-rattha

mfn. [sa. advan?], eating; Kacc-v 669
(derivation from √ad); Sadd 872,24 (v. l.).
v. a-dutiya.

(m.1), the knee; MN II 137,16 (na ca
~ena ~aṁ saṁghaṭṭento gacchati, scil. Gotamo;
Ps III 357,4 (Se): addḥavena addhavan ti jannukena
jannukaṁ; CkCe: aḍḍuvena adḍuvaṁ in Ck corrected
adduvanisīdati).
m.n. [sa. ardha], see *aḍḍha.

mfn. [sa. āḍḥya, or ṛddha], rich, Th
783; see 2aḍḍha.

m. [sa. adhvan] = addhāna, n. (q. v.):
extent of space or time, i. e. (a) way, road, (b) time,
addhaninstr, addhunā, gen. addhuno, loc. addhani; (gen.
addhānassa and loc. addhāne booked under addhāna,
n.) pl. addhā (cf. Sadd 166,1-19). — (a) Abh 190;
995; Ja VI 523,27* (dīgho c'addha suduggamo); etta-
kaṁ ~ānaṁ, Ud-a 85,21; 311,33; Ap 85,20 (~ānaṁ
paṭipannassa); dve addhā, Dhp-a II 166,2 (kan-
tāraddhā and vaṭṭaddhā). — (b) Abh 66; 995; nom.
sg. & pl. tayo addhā [cf. addha-ttaya] . . . atīto ~
anāgato ~ paccuppanno, DN III 216,16 = It 53,20
(It-a); 70,5-15; Ps I 53,17; Nidd I 212,28 (Nidd-a);
Mil 49,30; dīgho ~ā vītivatto, Ja II 312,5; acc. atītaṁ
(etc.) ~ānaṁ, DN I 200,20 = MN I 8,1 (quoted Ud-a
315,1; kālâdhivacanaṁ, Ps) ≠ MN I 265,2; DN II
82,12; MN I 339,14; SN I 140,2; AN V 32,1; paccup-
pannaṁ ~, MN I 8,12 (= vattamāna-kālam, Ps);
Nidd I 38,23 (Nidd-a); dīgham addhāna(ṁ) saṁsa-
raṁ, Sn 740 = AN II 10,10*; dīgham addhāna(ṁ)
socati, Dhp 207 (Dhp-a); dīgham ~ānaṁ khepetvā,
Ja I 137,28; ~ānaṁ āpādenti, keep it (scil. brahma-
cariyaṁ) lasting, SN IV 110,28 (Spk); cf. tarn brahma-
cariyam ciraṁ dīgham ~ānaṁ ṭhapesuṁ, Vin III
9,9; tāva ~ānam āpādi, Ja II 293,12* (= jīvitaddhā-
naṁ, Ct.); kittakaṁ ~ānaṁ, Vv-a 117,8 (= 'kīva-
ciraṁ' (w. r. kiṁ va ciraṁ)); ciraṁ dīgham ~ānaṁ
tiṭṭheyya, Mil 132,26; ~ānaṁ pharituṁ, Pp-a 180,19
(= dīghakālaṁ vyāpetuṁ, mṭ); instr, dīghena ~unā,
long (and thoroughly) opp. ittaram), SN I 78,26; Ud
65,29 (Ud-a); iminā dīghena ~unā, during this long
time (i. e. the eternity), DN II 50,1; MN I 82,1; AN
II 118,1; III 164,2; V 270,30; Pv-a 28,26; yen'
~ una, so long as, Ja VI 288,12* (= yattakena
kālena, Ct.); gen. dīghassa ~uno accayena, DN
117,19; III 84,27 (= Mvu I 338,14); MN III 169,26;
AN IV 100,22; Ja IV 87,16; Pv-a 148,6 (~ gatattā);
loc. paccuppanne ~ani, Pj II 549,1; with termina-
tions of a-stems acc. sg. addhaṁ dīghakālam, Spk I
163,26 ad SN I 97,1); acc pl. addhe, Nidd-a ad
Nidd I 120,29. — Ifc. (°addha(n) & °addhāna), v.
atīta°, atīta-m-°, anāgata-m-°, kantāra°, kāla°,
gata° (cf. gataddhi(n)), cullaka°, jivita°, tiy°, dasa°,
patha°, vaṭṭa°, vayo-°. Cf. duvaddhato.

mfn. (cf. sa. adhva-ga), advanced in
years, old, Mhv XLVII 44 (~o buḍḍho hessati).
— m. (or °-gū), a traveller, MTD.

mfn. (addha(n) + gata), old; who
has finished his course; cira-pabbajito ~o vayo anup-
patto, DN I 47,19 (= addhānaṁ gato, ɔ: dve tayo
rājaparivaṭṭe atīto, Sv); jiṇṇo vuddho mahallako
~o vayo anuppatto, DN I 1,14,15 (= magga-paṭi-
panno, o: vata-cariyādi-mariyādaṁ avītikkamma
addha-gata1,14 (= tiyaddhagato, Spk); Nidd I 120,29 (= tayo
addhe atikkanto, Nidd-a); Vin II 188,29; do. pl. ~ā,
Sn p. 50,14 (Pj = Sv ad DN I 47,19); p. 92,22; SN
I 97,1 ( = 'addhaṁ dīghakālaṁ atikkantā, Spk); Pv-a
149,11.

m. [sa. adhva-ga; see also Kāç ad
Păṇ VI, 4,10-41; cf. addha-ga above], a traveller,
wayfarer; Abh 347; Dhp 302; pl. Thī 55 = SN I
212,31* (BEe against metre panthagū; = pathikā,
Spk) = Ap 607,23; acc. ~uṁ, Ja III 95,17* (adj.
na ṭhitaṁ, nâsīnaṁ, na sayānaṁ na p'addhagum);
96,12' (reading paddha-gū, q. v. cf. sa. prādhva).

n. [sa. adhvan + traya], the three
times, viz. past, future, and present, Pj II 366,13 (cf.
addha(n)).

[m., every half month; Cp
I 9,15 (read with Ce & Cp-a anvaddhamāse; cf. Sadd
243,18)].
Ja VI 548,26*, v. andha-nakha.

mfn. (from addha(n)) (a), fit for a
journey; Th 529 (sukhā utu ~ā, — Mvu III 93,19*;
—: addhāna-gamana-yoggā utu, Th-a).— (b) lasting;
Vin III 9,25 (yatha-y-idaṁ brahmacariyaṁ ~aṁ assa
addhaniyaSp; "cf. SN IV 110,28 & Vin III 9,9) = DN II 119,28
(= addhāna-kkhamaṁ, Sv) = III 127,18 foll. =
211,1 foll. ≠ Sp I 5,3 = Pj I 90,14 (sāsanaṁ); Ja
VI 171,31 (uposatha-kammaṁ). — Ifc. v. an-°.
mfn. = prec; only ifc. v. an-°.

pr. 3 sg. (according to Ctt. and
addha-bhavatiabhi + √bhū), to be on the level'of, be master of, to
have the command of, predominate; — part. m. addhā-
bhavanto, Sn 968 (= abhibhavanto, Pj, Nidd [cf.
sa. addhā-puruṣa])); — aor. 3 sg. addhabhavi (old
error for ajjhabhavi, cf. sinhal. d < j), SN I 39,1*-3*
(kiṁ su [scil. nāmaṁ] sabbaṁ ~; = abhibhavati
anupatati, Spk I 95,6 (Sinhalese lectio facilior anva-
bhavi)); — pp. addha-bhūta q. v.; — caus. 3 sg.
addha-bhāveti, MN II 223,9 = 224,23 (na heva
an-addha-bhūtaṁ attānaṁ dukkhena ~, i. e. he does
not let himself be dependent of (or governed by) pain
(Ps III 424,19 read with Ce & Ck na nam an-addha-
bhāveti nâbhibhavati!).

mfn. (cf. addha-bhavati), de-
pendent, ensnared, unfree; SN IV 20,33 foll. (sab-
baṁ . . . ~aṁ; . . . cakkhu [etc.] ~aṁ . . . jātiyā
jarāya, etc. . . . ~aṁ; v. l. andhabhūtaṁ; = abhi-
bhūtaṁ ajjhotthataṁ upaddutaṁ, Spk); Sadd 79,9
(= adhibhūta). — Also title of the sutta SN IV 20. — Cf.
SN III 1,13 : aṇḍabhūta or addhabhūta (see aṇḍabhūta
above); the relation between aṇḍabhūta and addha-
bhūta (andhabhūta resp.) in the canonical texts before
the time of the Ct. is difficult to determine. — Ifc. v.
an-addha-bhūta (a-naddha-bhūta?).

m. [sa. adhvara], a kind of sacrifice;
pt ad DN I 237,10 (see next).

m. pl. [sa. ādhvarika, cf. adhvaryu],
a class of Brahmins; DN I 237,10-18 (~ā brāhmaṇā
+ Tittiriyā b. Chandokā b., Bavharijā b. (so Se);
pt: addharo nāma yaññaviseso, tadupayogabhāvato
addhariyā tv eva vuccanti yajūni, tāni sajjhāyantī
Addhariyā
v. adduva.

m., title of SN I 39—41 (Devatā-
saṁyutta ch. VII).

mfn., = addhāna-hīna (a. v.),
Utt-vn 435.

ind. [ts.], surely, certainly, ergo (in Ctt.
generally explained as ekaṁse, ekaṁsena); Abh 995;
1140; Sn 47; 504; 541; 766 (- ekaṁsa-vacanaṁ,
nissaṁsaya-v., nikkaṁkha-v., advejjha-v., adveḷ-
haka-v., niyoga-v., apaṇṇaka-v., avatthāpana-v.,
addhā273,4*; VI 251,2* (atītam ~ aparādhitaṁ mayā; =
ekaṁsena, Ct.; but cf. atīta-m-addhāne above); VI
414,24*; DN II 124,12; MN I 94,11 (Ps); [in AN I
279,26* Se reads: (na) Bhagavato dassanassa titti
(-m-)addha kudācanaṁ, but Ee ajjha, C* ajjhā may
be remnants of ajjhagă, °gaṁ, the whole of 279,26*-30*
being overlaid by unmetrical interpolations]; AN IV
153,25; with sandhi-m: Ja IV 131,4 (addhā-m-ahaṁ);
— combined with other particles: ~kho, DN I 61,7
(Sv: ekaṁsa-vacanam etaṁ); 239,19; 242,9, etc.;
III 48,9 (= ekaihsen'eva, Sv); MN I 240,6; 387,27;
SN IV 295,27; 307,3; — ~ have, Ja III 306,22* -
V 176,19*; — ~hi, Sn 375; 459; 1057; 1059; Ja V
166,13*; 222,3*; VI 284,1*; 285,9*; 318,5*; — with
future tense: Sn 1149; SN I 127,1*; Ja VI 324,24; As
199,34; do. {assumptive), Ja V 287,11; Ja I 103,13
(~ so etehi . . . khādito bhavissati).

(ɔ: addha° from addha(n)), f., title
of Kv XV,3 (p. 513).

n. = addha(n); the acc. addhānaṁ
(esp. dīgha-m-addhānaṁ) affording an -āna-stem, Sadd
166,14-19; Abh 192 (a long way); 1100 (kale dīghañ-
jase, time, a long (road); acc. (or nom.) idaṁ dīgham
~aṁ sandhāvitaṁ saṁsaritaṁ, DN II 90,10 = 122,15
addhānaaddha(n); etaṁ dīgham ~aṁ sambhāvitaṁ, Mil
49,26; gender not quite sure in the acc, but evident
nom. in Kārikās: Vism 90,2* (= magga-gamanaṁ,
ib. 94,14) and Pj II 34,28* (quoted Sadd 526,10*);
— gen. atītassa (+ anāgatassa . . . paccuppannassa)
~assa kiṁ mūlaṁ, Mil 50,10; evam etassa kevalassa
~assa purimā koṭi na paññāyati, ib. 20; — loc. ~e,
Ja III 43,6' (atīte, = 'atīta-m-addhāne'); III 410,1
(gate); 467,24 (do.); IV 84,10 (do.); V 264,5 (evaṁ
~e gate); Ps III 107,16 (ettake ~e); "Porāṇā" apud
Spk I 100,1 (addhāne gacchante; quoted Sadd 166,14).
— Also title of more sutta's: SN V 28,15; 236,8; 340,17;
cf. Dīgham-addhāna-pañha.

m. pl. ~ā, the (four)
postures on the way, Sv I 202,17; Ps I 269,10.
— °-kilamatha, m., fatigue after a long journey, Pj
I 198,21. — °-kovida, mfn., knowing the way; f. ~ā,
Ja V 194,24*. — °-kkhama, mfn. (1) who can endure
a long way, AN III 30,1 (: caṁkamo; Mp); Ja VI
253,32' (scil. ratho); — (2) lasting long, Ja V 508,11'
(na ~aṁ, = 'anaddhaneyyaṁ'); Sp I 191,17 ( =
'addhaniya'); Sv II 215,8 (= do.).
entry.re:
— °-gamanaaddhāna-iriyāpatha-gamana,
n., going on journey; Dhp-a II 227,16* (ekass' ~aṁ);
Ud-a 183,27 (~ °aṁ gacchanto, = 'cārikaṁ cara-
māno').

— °-darathaaddhāna-iriyāpatha-daratha, m., troubles from travelling;
Sv I 287,8.

entry.sense:
f. abstr. (from addha(n) +
anantara), immediateness as to extent of time, Tikap-a
114,2 (opp. kālânantaratā).

m., title of Mil 50,10-22 (only
in Se).
v. addha-bhavati.

n. (addha(n) + āyu), duration of life,
a long life; AN II 66,8 (ciram jīvāmi dīgham ~uṁ
pālemi); cf. dīghâyuṁ pālayāmi, Ap 321,19+ ciraṁ
dīgham addhānaṁ above s. v. addha(n). addhâyu
see addâvalepana.

ifc, in the gen. sg. m. gataddhino
addhin(as daḷhadhammino, nom. pl, to °dhamma(n) and
°gimhisu to gimha(n) with the -i- of yuvino, rājino
(cf. -u- in pumuno, kammunā, Brahmunā).

m(fn) (from adhva(n)), a wanderer,
traveller; m. ~o, Dhp-a I 18,3; II 166,3; (Ja VI 542,2*,
v. l. for atthika, q. v.); acc ~aṁ, Dhp-a II 3,19; pl.
~ā, Ap 358,13 (+ pathikā; Ee aṭṭhikā); DN I 137,25
(= pathāvino, Sv); Sv I 270,8 (kilantā); acc. pl. ~e
(brāhmaṇe), Ja IV 34,3*; 53,17*; 97,10* (= addhānam
agate, Ct.); gen. pl. ~ānaṁ, Pv-a 78,23. — Ifc v.
kapaṇaddhika, kapaṇiddhika.
entry.re:
— °-janaaddhika-jana, m. id.
Ap 5,15 (loc. adhane ~e); Pv-a 127,16 (v. l. perhaps
1addhikaCp-a (Ce): addhike jane).

— °-manussaaddhika-manussa, m. id., Ja
III 415,16-25 Ud-a 408,20.

entry.sense: [mfn., wr. for āḷhiya (q. v.), cf. 2aḍḍnal-

m., title of the
fourth chapter of Cha-k (JPTS 1885 p. 13).
[pp., misread for aṭṭita (q. v.), Pv 201].

(sometimes a-dhuva, see Ja III 63,9*
below), mfn. [sa. a-dhruva], not fixed, not permanent;
uncertain, doubtful; DN I 19,1 (aniccā ~ā asassatā
appāyukā, etc.) = III 31,26; DN II 198,20 (aniccā
a-ddhuva= AN IV 100,6 (-dh-); Anāg 135 (aniccā saṁkhārā
~ā tāvakālikā); Thī 489 (aniccā ~ā kāmā); SN I
198,11* (do.); IV 302,29 (aniccaṁ . . . ~aṁ . . . pahāya
gamanīyarb); Th 1131 (abl. aniccato ~ato asārato);
Nidd I 53,9 (do. + atāṇato, etc.; Nidd-a) ≠ Mil
418,30; Ud-a 210,17 (anicco + ; = 'aññathābhāvī');
Ja I 393,3' (anicca, khaṇika, ittara, ~, pabhaṅgu);
— MN I 326,25 (~aṁ yeva samānaṁ dhuvan ti
vakkhati); II 68,18 (loko ~o, + attāno ... assako
. . .atitto)≠Paṭis I 126,29(-dhi- quoted Ud-a 142,16);
Paṭis I 76,28 (-dh-; cakkhuṁ~aṁ asassataṁ vipariṇā-
madhammaṁ); Ja III 63,9* (niminni ... adhuvaṁ
dhuvena) ≠ 221,26* quoted Dhp-a IV 67,8* (cf. Mvu
II 176,12*); Ja III 286,17 (maraṇaṁ dhuvaṁ, jīvitaṁ
~aṁ); Dhp-a III 170,22 (~aṁ jīvitaṁ, dhuvaṁ
maraṇaṁ); Ja IV 111,24* (parijīyati ~aṁ sarīraṁ, cf.
MN II 68,18 above); Vv-a 77,26 (~aṁ attabhāvaṁ).
— °-sīla, mfn., frail, immoral, vicious; Ja III 73,29* (gen.
~assa = na sabbakālaṁ sīlarakkhaṇakassa, Ct.;
quoted Dhp-a II 23,2*); Ja III 19,23* (m. ~o, used as
a Npr., cf. Ct).

numeral (1addha [sa. ardha]
+ una + nava), eight and a half, Ud-a 4,27 (°-matta,
mfn., numbering 8½).

mfn. (1addha + oṭṭha), hare-
lipped; f. abs'tr. °-tā, Sv I 310,3 (Oṭṭhaddho ti ~tāya
evaṁ-laddhanāmo).
see a-dubha(ka), cf. adubbha°.

mfn. [ts.], not two, identic, not varying,
free from duplicity; As 353,14 (rūpañ ca attañ ca
~aṁ samanupassati); MN II 14,31 (paṭhavī-kasiṇam
eko sañjānāti uddhaṁ adho tiriyaṁ ~aṁ appamā-
ṇaṁ; Ps III 242,6: idaṁ pana ekassa aññabhāvânu-
pagamanatthaṁ vuttaṁ ≠ Vism 177,2) = AN V
a-dvayakatvā akatena, Sv II 245,3).
entry.re:
— °-bhāṇi(n)a-dvaya-bhāṇi(n), mfn.,
speaking without ambiguity, Nidd II 51,17 (acc.
°-bhāṇiṁ, scil. Buddhaṁ Bhagavantaṁ; = paric-
chinna-vacanattā dvevacana- (Cc vevacana-) vira-
hitaṁ, Nidd-a).

entry.sense:
mfn., (a) without door; Ud-a 333,8
(~aṁ gharam). — (b) not arisen through one of the
five organs of sense (see dvāra); Ps 1221,10 (~ānaṁ,
scil. vedanānaṁ).
n., want of reduplication, Mogg VI 22.

mfn. (or n.) (3a + dvejjha [sa.
ḍvaidhya], cf. 1a-dejjha), free from duplicity, not
ambiguous; only in the foll. comp.s and derivates. Cf.
a-dveḷhaka. a-dvejjha

f., sincere words, Sv III 161,12
(ad DN III 171,10*).

f. abstr. of a-dvejjha; Ja IV 76,22*
(instr, abl. ~tā); 77,29'.

mfn., with unwavering mind;
Bv II 143 (= ekamsamānaso, Bv-a), quoted Ja I
22,35* = As (Se) 66,1* (°mānaso (Bv (Ce) Ja As (Ck)
against metre; °-mānaso, Bv-a, As (Se). a-dvejjha-manasa

(a) mfn., speaking without
duplicity; Bv II 110 (~ā Buddha amoghavacanā jina;
Bv-a: ~ā ti dvedhā a-pavattavacanā, ekaṁsavacanā
ti attho; acchiddavacanā ti pi pāṭho, tassa 'niddosa-
vacanā' ti attho) quoted Ja I 19,20* = As (Se) 62,21*;
Mil 141,5 (amoghavacanā Buddha Bhagavanto ta-
a-dvejjha-vacanaNidd I 2,26 (ekaṁsavacana + ; = 'addhā'; Nidd-a).

mfn. — advejjha-vacana, mfn.;
DN III 171,10* (Sv (Se) III 161,12).

mfn. (from a + dveḷhaka <
*dvahihaka from *dvīḍhā < *dvizdhā, cf. dvi-dhā
Ai Gr III p. 426, Nachtr.) — a-dvejjha (q. v.);
Nidd-a I 21,14.
entry.re:
— °-vacanaa-dveḷhaka-vacana, n. (synon, advejjha-
vacana, n.), Nidd I 2,27 (ekaṁsavacana +; =
a-dveḷhakahakaṁ).

entry.sense:
mfn. (3a + grd. of √dhvaṁs), =
a-ppadhaṁsiya (q. v.); Saddh 308 (duṭṭhehi ~o).

n. (or ~aṁ, ind.) [adho +
akkhaka; cf. sa. adho-akṣa], what is beneath the
collar bone; Vin III 129,36' (opp. ubbn'-akkhakaṁ;
= akkhakato paṭṭhāya adho, Sp); IV 213,35** (=
akkhakānaṁ adho, Sp); 345,10'. adh'-akkhaka

mfn. [sa. adhas + skandha],
with head downwards; Ja V 269.19* (patanti ~ā; =
adhosīsakā, ib. 275,14'). Cf. adho.

m(fn)., with the point downwards,
said of the upper teeth; pl. ~ā, Ja V 156,1* (= uparima-
dantā, Ct.; opp. uddhaggā).

mfn. [sa. a-dhanya], unhappy; Pj II
152,31.

mfn. [ts.], destitute of wealth, poor;
DN III 61,10 (pl. ~ā); 68,9 foll. (gen. pl. ~ānaṁ =
dalidda-manussānaṁ, Sv); 185,3* (yo vā[ruṇī] ~o
akiñcano); Ja V 252,19* foll. (~assa anāgārassa
bhikkhuno); Ap 5,15 (loc. ~e addhikajane); 565,30
a-dhana249,30 (~o + hīnajacco, etc.).

f., (fictitious) Npr., Ja I 403,5-15
(Dhanapăliyo pi ~iyo pi duggatā honti).

mfn. [ts.; cf. adho, adhara], lowest;
vilest, worst; Abh 700; 1070; acc. ~aṁ, Ja V 394,22'
(opp. uttamaṁ); pl. ~ā, Ja V 397,28* (macchari-
pañcamâ°); 398,10'. — Ifc. v. uttamâ°, narâ°,
purlsâ°, migâ°, vasalâ°, sabbasattâdhamôcita. adhama

n. [sa. adhamâṅga], the foot,
MTD.

m., low people, Ja III 324,8';
°-janûpasevi(n), mfn., associating with low people,
Ja III 323,27* (yo uttamo ~ī; = adhamajanaṁ
upasevati, Ct.); — °-janûpasevita, mfn., honoured
by low people, Ja III 324,1* (acc. ~itam, o: ~inaṁ
adhama-jana

m. [sa. adhamarṇa], a debtor.
Abh 470 (opp. uttamaṇṇa). Cf. next.

m. (adhama + ina) = prec;
Kacc 638; Rūp 643.

[sa. a-dharma], m., unrighteous-
ness, injustice; wrong conduct (or speech), sin; nom.
~o, Sn 310; 312; Dhp 248; Th 304 (~o nirayaṁ
neti) = Ja IV 496,18* = V 266,9* quoted As 38,28* =
Dhp-a I 22,1* = Sv I 99,6*; Ja III 367,17*,20' (= assa-
1a-dhamma(dhammo ~o ca kuhiṁ sameti); VI 502,32* (~o
kira bho, cf. Sn 310); Ja III 29,17* (~o ācarito); AN
V 222,14 = 254,13; dhammo have pāturahosi pubbe,
pacchā ~o udapādi loke, Ja IV 101,24* (here as
Npr), quoted Ja III 29,5'; pure ~o dippati, Sp
I 6,2 (Sp-ṭ), quoted Mogg VI, 1; acc. ~aṁ, Sn 450
(dhammaṁ bhaṇe nâdhammaṁ, metre faulty; Pj); It
81,15 (dhammañ ñeva bhāsati no ~aṁ); ~aṁ dhammo
ti dīpeti, AN V 73,23; Vin I 354,21; II 88,21; 204,12;
~aṁ ācari, Ja III 530,13*; ~aṁ carati, Ja V 242,23*;

ind. [ts.], (a) prefix to nouns (subst., adj.,
adv.) or prp. to verbs, and here sometimes alternating
with or corresponding to ati-° (q. v.) or abhi-° (e. g.
adhibhavati, adhi-māna), before vowels taking the
form ajjh-° (see ajjha, etc.) = up to, towards, into;
adhicombined with other prp.s: adhi + ava (ajjho°);
adhi + ā (ajjhā°); adhi + upa (ajjhupa°); adhi + pra
(adhippa°); adhi + saṁ (see adhisamuppanna, adhi-
sallikhati); adhi + 2a see the prefix ajjha (perhaps
also addhabhavi, see addhābhavati); inserted in
iterative comp. v. chattâdhicchatta (cf. chattâtic-
chatta); Sadd 882,25-883,3; Abh 1177 (= adhik'is-
sara-pāthâdhiṭṭhāna-pāpuṇanesu [ nicchaye côparit-
tâdhibhavane ca visesaṇe); Pay fol gr 7 (adhike:
adhisīlaṁ; issare: adhipati, adhi Brahmadatte Pañ-
cālā; uparibhāve: adhirohati, paṭhavi[ya]ṁ adhises-
sati (Dhp 41); ajjhayane: vyākaraṇam adhīte;
adhiṭṭhāne: bhūmi-kampâdiṁ adhiṭṭhāti; nicchaye:
adhimokkho; pāpuṇane: bhogakkhandhaṁ adhigac-
chati (DN II 86,1); — (b) as governing prp. with loc,
Sadd 730,2-15 (adhi Brahmadatte Pañcālā, etc.,
cf. Kacc-v 316); cf. ajjh-āgāre above, and adhi-citte,
adhi-jegucche, adhi-deve, adhi-paññāya, adhi-sīle.
— Cf. also ajjhattaṁ, adhi-kumāri, adhitthi, adhi-
paññatti, adhi-(vi)mutti.

mfn. [ts.], exceeding, surpassing (in
number, etc.), differring in quantity: superior or in-
ferior; Abh 1176 (giving the sense of prp. abhi, e. g.
abhivassati, Abh-sūci); 1177 (do. of adhi, e.g. adhi-
sīlaṁ, Abh-sūci); Kacc-v 316 (the sense of upa ác
adhi; cf. Pay fol. gr v. 2; fol. ghu 7; Sadd 729,26
foll.); n. ~aṁ, Saddli 447; Sv I 141,3 = Mp II 140,3
= Ud-a 2,8 (~ hutvā, too great); Sv I 222,29; Sp I
126,13 = Ps II 202,11 = Mp II 287,32 (~ena ñāṇena
ñatvā, = 'abhiññā'); f. ~ā, Vv-a 80,26 (+ visiṭṭhā,
explaining 'an-adhi-varā'); m. ~o, Pp 35,34 ( =
atireko, Pp-a); pl. ~ā, Saddh 337; Mp III 345,16
(adhibhavanti ~ā visiṭṭhā jeṭṭhakā honti, = 'adhi-
gaṇhanti'); — with instr., Kacc-v 392 (catūhi ~ā
dasa = 'cuddasa'); Ja II 386,16 (jātigottabalâdīhi
~o samāno; Ed. avikkosamāno); Ps III 415,5 (manus-
sehi ~ā); Pj I 193,20; — with abl., Mil 240,10 (saṁ-
gharatanato uttaro . . . ~o vā visiṭṭho); — often in
comp, with numerals, e. g. agghati adhika-satasahas-
saṁ, ts worth more than 100,000, AN III 50,12;
kappa-sahassâ°, Dhp-a I 83,10, etc. — Ifc. v. an-°,
anattâ°, anūnâ°, ūnâ°, kappa-(sata)-sahassâ°,
guṇâ°, catu-nahutâ°, canda-sūrâ°, javâ°, therâ°,
paññāsâ°, mettâ°, rāgâ°, satta-māsâ°, sam-
ādhika [sa. sam-adhika, cf. Añjanāgiri above & kimā-
dhikaraṇa, etc.], sâdhika, hāsâ°.
see adhika-guṇatā.

n. [ts.], (a) 'placing at the head',

. . . codako (prosecutor), AN I 53,34 (see adhikaraṇa-
kāraka); ~aṁ uppannaṁ, Dhp-a IV 2,10; ~aṁ karoti,
MN I 122,18 (Ps: ~aṁ ākaḍḍhati); ~aṁ jānāti, AN
V 72,1; Vin V 185,13; ~e ubhato vacīsaṁsāro, etc.,
AN I 79,30 foll.; ~assa vinicchaya-kusalo, Vin V
185,15; ~aṁ vinicchitu-kāmo, Vin II 303,19; ~aṁ
vūpasammati, Vin II 74,1; V 155,14; MN I 443,3;
AN II 239,19; ~aṁ vūpasameti, Vin II 261,1; IV
301,11; V 199,34; MN II 248,3 (~ānaṁ vûpasamo); ~e
samuppanne, Vin V 224,13; vûpasantam ~am kārako
ukkoṭeti, Vin II 94,6 (cf. Ja II 387,14 & Vin IV 126,15**
above). — (c) cause, Abh 868 (kāraṇe); nom. ~aṁ,
AN II 159,2 = SN II 41,2 (khettaṁ . . . vatthu . . .
āyatanaṁ . . . ~aṁ); dukkhass'eva°, Ps I 212,35; acc.
~aṁ, ifc. (adv.) — on account of, in consequence of;
for the sake of, concerning (= °hetu); MN III 158,5
foll. (vicikicchâ°, etc.); dhammâ°, MN II 146,15;
sometimes also combined with °hetu: micchā-paṭi-
pattâdhikaraṇa-hetu, MN II 197,13 = SN V 19,1;
sammā-paṭipattâ°, MN II 197,16 — SN V 19,10; cf.
kimādhikaraṇaṁ, yatvādhikaraṇaṁ. — (d) also de-
noting a syntactic relation, see tulyâ°, samānâ°, esp.
the sense of the locative case (cf. ādhāra, bhum-
mavaçana); Abh 868 (ādhāre); Pj I 106,8-10 (adhi-
karaṇattho bhāvena-bhāva-lakkhaṇattho ca sambha-
vati . . . ~aṁ hi kālâkhyo samūhâkhyo ca samayo;
cf. Pāṇ 113,36-37) ≠ PsI 9,14-16; cf. Sadd 734,21;
Pj II 210,26 (°atthe bhummavacanaṁ). — Ifc., v.
an-°, anuvādâ°, appamādâ°, appâ°, āpattâ°,
ārakkhâ°, kāmâ°, kiccâ°, kimādhikaraṇaṁ,
tulyâ°, dosâ°, dhammâ°, nihatâ°, pabbajjâ°,
pamādâ°, bhogâ°, mahâ°, muddâ°, mohâ°,
yaññâ°, yatvādhikaraṇaṁ, rāgâ°, rūpâ°, vivādâ°,
samānâ°.

adhi-karotiadhi], Kacc-v 321 (cittaṁ ~ dhammā vattantîti

/. (cf. prec. & adhikoṭṭana), a

mfn. (adhi + pp. caus. of √krudh),

(sometimes adhiggaṇhāti), pr. 3 sg.

mfn. (pp. of adhigacchati), 1. pass.,

135,27 (aññāhi atisayam ~ā, f.); Ud-a 363,28 (taṁ

bhuccaguṇâ°, yuga-yogâ°, vinayâ°.

mfn. (pp. act. of adhigacchati),

abs. see adhigacchati.

m. [ts.\, attainment (esp. of final sancti-

kkhemassa); SN II 226,3 (do.); MN III 138,14 (pha-

amatâ°, arahattâ°, arahattaphalâ°, āgamâ°,
okāsâ°, tad-°, dur-°, nibbānâ°, mahâ°, visesâ°,
vedâ°.

f.,tfie highest

adhigamûpāya

abs. v. adhigacchati.
abs. v. adhigaṇhāti.

f., title of Kv
XVI,4 (p. 528—31).

mfn. (pp. of adhi-gaṇhāti), mas-
tered; taken or possessed (by, instr, or ifc); ye c'assa

mfn. (pp. of adhi + √car), accord,
to Ctt: excogitated (but cf. sa. (vy)abhicarati); only
in the phrase: ~aṁ te viparāvattaṁ, DN I 8,14
(Ed. aviciṇṇaṁ, v. l. adhiciṇṇaṁ; Sv has āciṇṇaṁ
(v. l. adhiciṇṇaṁ, Bm) and explains: yam tuyhaṁ
dīgharattâciṇṇa-vasena supaguṇaṁ) = III 117,14
(Ed. do.; v'.'l. adhiciṇṇaṁ) = MN II 3,28 (Ed.
aviciṇṇaṁ, v. l. adhiciṇṇaṁ; Ps — Sv) = 244,1 (do.)
adhi-ciṇṇadīghena kālena paricitaṁ supaguṇaṁ, Spk) = V
419,10 (Ed. āciṇṇaṁ, v. l. adhiciṇṇaṁ, B1) = Nidd
I 173,10 (= yan taṁ adhiciṇṇaṁ cirakāla-sevana-
vasena paguṇaṁ, Nidd-a) — 194,28 (Nidd-a = Spk
ad SN III 12,10). The Ctt. seem to favour the reading
adhiciṇṇa; a-viciṇṇa may be a burmese misreading
for adhic° (see also Franke ad DN I 8,14), Tr. thinks
that avic° is corrupt for ava-ciṇṇa. Cf. āciṇṇa.

n., (derived from next, taking adhi-
in the sense of adhika-, see Ct.-expl. under adhicitta
& ~e), a higher form of thought; Nidd I 143,3
(attharasassa . . . adhisīlassa ~assa adhipaññāya)
quoted mhṭ ad Vism 210,19; Paṭis II 243,3 (elliptical
for adhicitta-sikkhā, q. v.); Ud-a 363,1; Mp II 346,6-7
(rūpâvacaraṁ ... arūpâvacaraṁ); II 364,5 ('adhi-
cittaṁ' = samatha-vipassanā-cittaṁ); III 125,1
('adhicittaṁ', AN III 323,6, = samādhi-vipassanā-
cittaṁ); Nidd-a I 147,11. (vipassanā-pādakaṁ aṭṭha-
samāpatti-cittaṁ pana ~aṁ). — adhicittaṁ,
ind., in the citta (q. v.), as to, concerning the citta;
Kacc-v 321 (= cittaṁ adhikicca); AN I 230,33 (adhi-
sīlaṁ + ... sikkhissasi); Ps I 161,11 (='abhiceto');

(Ps); AN I 256,29 (quoted Vibh-a 229,24; Vism 246,32);
~am anuyuttānaṁ, Nidd II 141,19(Nidd-a II 335,17);
— adhicitte, ind. id. (cf. adhi as governing prp.
s. v. ajjh-āgāre): adhisīle ~e adhipaññāya, Vin I
adhi-cittasamāpatti-saṁkhāte adhika-citte) = Ud 43,9* (Ud-a)
= DN II 50,2*; Th 591; MN I 451,1 (sītāya chāyāya
nisinnaṁ ~e yuttaṁ); — °-ppavatti, f., the going
on to meditate, Ud-a 191,22 (°kāle). — °-va(t), mfn.,
attentive, Ud-a 255,8 (gen. ~vato, = 'adhicetaso'); Sp
ad Vin IV 54,16* (do.). — °-saṁkhāta, mfn., named
a°, Nidd-a II 335,18 (~aṁ samādhiṁ).
entry.re:
— °-sikkhāadhi-citta-sikkhā,
f., training of the mind; adhisīla-sikkhā +, DN III
219,13 (Sv); MN I 324,28; AN I 230,22 foll; III
444,20; Nidd I 39,12-20; Nett 126,25; ekodī ti ~aṁ
pucchati, Nidd I 478,20; samādhinā ~ā, scil. pakāsitā
hoti, Vism 4,25;

— °-sikkhā-samādānaadhi-citta-sikkhā-samādāna, n., under-
taking of mental training, AN I 229,1 foll.

entry.sense:
mfn., attentive, present-minded;
gen. m. ~asŏ appamajjato, Ud 43,20* (cf. adhicitte
āyogo ib. 43,9*, adhicittam anuyutto, ib. 43,14;
= adhicittavato Ud-a) = Vin IV 54,16* (= do., Sp)
= Th 68 (quoted Dhp-a III 384,11*) ≠ adhicetasi mā
pramadyataḥ, Udānavarga, see JAs 1912 p. 242
— 243. Cf. abhi-cetasi; adhi-manasa.

(from adhi + √i), 1. abs. having learnt
or studied; see adhīyati (adhīte). — 2. (adv.) 'in
passing, by the way', i. e. incidentally, fortuitously,
without cause or reason, rarely; see comp.s below.
— 3. (mf)n., occurring only by a mere chance; ~am idaṁ,
SN V 457,3-6 (= adhicc-uppattikaṁ).

f. (sa. adhityakā, Pāṇ V 2,34), table-
land, Abh 610 (opp. upaccakā).

mfn., rarely having the
sight of (gen.); m. ~vī kho panâhaṁ Bhagavato,
adhicca-dassavin

mfn., attained by accident or
by chance; Ja V 171,9*, 22* (= ahetunā laddhaṁ, Ct.)
≠ VI 315,24*—316,1* ( = akāraṇena laddhaṁ, Ct.)
= Vv 975-6 (= adhicca-samuppattikaṁ yādicchakaṁ
laddhaṁ, Vv-a); sayaṁkataṁ kin nu ~aṁ, Jināl 13.

f., incidental or spon-
taneous appearance; Ps 168,29 (°-ākāra, m., id.; opp.
sassatâkāra).
entry.re:
— °-samuppattikaadhicca-samuppatti-samuppattika, mfn., Vv-a 341,16
(= 'adhicca-laddha'); cf. adhicca-samuppannika
below.

entry.sense:
mfn., arisen incidentally
or without cause or reason, spontaneous (cf. paṭicca
samuppanna); ~o attā ca loko ca, Ud 69,30 ( =
yadicchāya samuppanno, Ud-a); DN III 33,33 (do.,
w. r. °-samāpanno); ~am attānaṁ ca lokaṁ ca, DN I
28,21 (= akāraṇa-samuppannaṁ, Sv); III 33,15 (~aṁ
ācariyakaṁ, the doctrine of adh°); a-sayaṁkāraṁ
a-paraṁkāraṁ ~aṁ sukha-dukkhaṁ, DN III 138,10

Pj I 107,5 = Vism 209,29 (~aṁ náma yădicchakan
ti vuttaṁ hoti; + āvatthikam, liṅgikaṁ, nemitti-
kaṁ).

m. pl. ~ā, those (philo-
sophers) who assert that things arise fortuitously; DN
I 28,21 (Sv); Sp I 60,20 (w. r. °-samuppattikā; Sp-ṭ);
Kv-a 6,21; Paṭis I 155,17 = Ps II 5,10; gen. sg. ~assa,
Ps 170,29.

mfn. (from adhicca (2) +
āpatti), rarely offending; MN I 443,22 foll. (~o + anā-
patti-bahulo; = kadāci kadāci āpattiṁ āpajjati, Ps;
opp. abhiṇhâpattika).

f., incidental origin; Ps I 163,1
= As 238,30.

n., see chattâdhichatta, Dhp-a III
443,10; Ap 170,20 (v. l. chattâti°) - Th-a Ce 189,19.

m., designation of a thera (ɔ:
Sāmidatta, Th-a ad Th 90); Ap 170,27 (Ed. Adhicch°).

n., cutting into pieces; Ps II
103,3]. ad MN I 130,29 (asisūnûpamā [scil. kāmā]
~aṭṭhena (so Se; Ee adhikuṭṭanaṭṭhena, q. v.).

ind. (prp. adhi with loc. of
jeguccha, mfn.), concerning what is loathsome or

jigucchanabhāve, Sv); also adhi-jegucchaṁ, DN I
174,24 (= uttamaṁ jeguccham, Sv; cf. Ct.s on adhi-
adhi-jegucche

& adhi-ṭṭhāti, pr. 3 sg. see adhi-
tiṭṭhati.

n. [sa. adhiṣṭhānaḷ, 'standing or
entering upon', thus: 1. that upon which something is

ifc. n. acquiring of, e. g. paññâ°): cetaso ~aṁ, SN II
17,16 (+ abhinivesânusaya; = cittassa patiṭṭhāna-
bhūtaṁ, Spk) = III 135,7 ≠ 10,9; 13,12; 161,30;

363,29 (adhippāyaṁ upavicāraṁ ~aṁ, etc.); MN I
136,34 (diṭṭhiṭṭhāna +); AN V 198,2 (do.); āvajjana,

(= kusalakaraṇe patiṭṭhābhāvo, Nidd-a); vikub-
banā+, Mil 343,17; Cp III 6,17 (adhiṭṭhitaṁ ~aṁ

(~aṁ adhiṭṭhahitvā); Ja VI 18,1 (attano ~aṁ
abhinditvā); Ja I 172,6 (Bodhisattānaṁ ... ~aṁ

~ena, Cp III 6,19 [ ˇ ˇ - - ˇ ?]; saha ~ena, Ud-a
432,30; Buddhānaṁ ~ena, Ud-a 381,16; Bhagavato

tassa ~ā . . . dve cīvarassa ~ā); 119,29*; — m. ~o,

n., the mental (momentous)

n., 'a moment of volitional
apperception', Comp, of Philos. p. 62,11.

f., breaking an adhiṭ-
than'-uposatha (q. v.), Sp ad Vin V 123,22 (see Vin I
163,25-32).

n., the strength of resolution;
Paṭis II 171,33; Ud-a 432,32.

m., the being the principal
base; Pj II 44,28 foll.; Ud-a 419,9; Abhidh-s 25,31.
— °-bhūta, mfn., Pj II 412,26.

n., the mind exercising
the (power of) adhiṭṭhāna; Vism 405,13 (instr. °-ma-
nena); cf. adhiṭṭhāna-citta. adhiṭṭhāna-manas

f., the mastery of predetermi-
ning (the period of jhāna); Ss 83,28 (cf. Abhidh-s
43,3-4 & Trsl. p. 207 n. 6).

n., rules for (preventive)
adhiṭṭhāna; Vism 706,1.

n., the 'void' applied to
adhiṭṭhāna; Paṭis II 183,21.

m., one of the 16 hara.s, modes

position; Nett 1,20; 4,10* (~āno hāro, split cpd.);
72,8—78,20. — °-sampāta, m., title of Nett 107—8.

f., the magic power of resolve

outside one's body; As 15,5 (Buddhānaṁ); Sp-ṭ ad

(quoted Vism 378,18); II 207,1—210,12. Cf. Comp, of
adhiṭṭhān'-iddhi

m., a sabbath held in
consequence of one's own volition; Vin V 123,22
(suttuddeso uposatho pārisuddhi-uposatho +); 133,3.

(or -ika), mfn. [sa. adhiṣṭhāyaka],
superintending, guarding; m. ~ako, superintendent,
director, MTD. — Ifc. v. kammâ°, kammantâ°,
navakammâ°, vajâ°.

mfn. (pp. of adhitiṭṭhati), 1. (pass.),
'trodden upon'; fixed, determined; wanted, adopted;
governed, superintended; corehí ~o maggo, Ja I 99,16
(infested with); ~aṁ adhiṭṭhānaṁ, Cp III 6,17; bhatta-
paṭipāti ~ā hoti, Vin I 57,27 = 248,19; ~aṁ rajanāya,
Vin V 218,13; taṁ mayā ~aṁ, Ja II 247,18' (= 'aṭṭhi-
taṁ'); pl. ~ā (iddhipādā, = 'anuṭṭhitā'), Sv ad DN II
adhiṭṭhita2. (act.), standing (upon), entered upon; adhering to,
applying oneself to; ekamantaṁ ~aṁ, Ap 59,1 (read

= Tn-a (Ce) 571,2*; dibbaṁ yānaṁ ~oj Ja VI 125,1*
(= yāne ṭhito hutvā, Ct.); taṁ dhammaṁ ~o, Ja III
269,11*; ekacariyaṁ ~o, Sn 820 (Nidd); Th 1143
(catubbipallāsa-vasaṁ ~am, scil. maṁ; = vipallā-
sānam vasaṁ ~aṁ anuvattantaṁ, Th-a!). — (3) n.,
used as an infinitive [like kirn . . . brahmacariyaṁ
ciṇṇe(na), Vin I 293,22]: kiṁ gihīnaṁ kammantaṁ
~ena, Vin III 87,17. — Ifc. v. an-°, dvâ°, svâ°.
— °-ṭṭhāna, n., (a) the spot where one has 'willed'
(allowed) something to be visible, Ja IV 384,28 (tena
padavalañjassa ~aṁ, cf. ib. 383,11); — (b) the
position occupied by (instr.), loc. ~e, Pv-a 141,6.

— °-saññi(n)adhiṭṭhita-saññi(n), mfn., considering something
determined; Vin III 251,35 (anadhitthite ~ī); 262,13
(do.).

entry.sense:
f., fixing, resolve; Abh 1032 ( =
'adhiṭṭhāna').
pr. 3 sg., see adhi-tiṭṭhati (4).

(or adhi-ṭṭhahati, adhi-ṭṭhāti,
adhi-tiṭṭhatiupon, enter

ind. (adhi + itthi; [sa. adhi-stri,

~îti vuccati). Cf. ajjhattaṁ, adhi-kumāri.

m., a god above the gods; Sadd 752,18
= Pay fol. ghaṁ 1 (adhiko devo atidevo, evaṁ ~o
adhisīlam).

mfn., leading to the position
of a super-god, see adhi-deve, ind.

n., a knowledge com-
prehending even all that concerns the gods; AN IV 304,23

mfn. = adhi-deva-kara;
Pj II 607,10.

ind. (adhi + loc. sg. or acc. pl. of

MN II 132,26 (~ mayaṁ . . . Bhagavantaṁ apuc-
adhi-devemānaṁ, ib.).

m. [ts.], a lord, ruler, king; Abh 725.

khamâ°, gaṇâ°, garuḷâ°, janâ°, tārakâ°, dijâ°,

n. (from adhi-pati) = ādhipacca
(q.v.); Ja V 57,14*,24'. Cf. adhipatiya.

pr. 3 sg. [adhi + √pad], to fall

ind., with regard to exposition
(cf. adhi); DN III 138,21 = 140,16 (Sv takes it as a
subst., 'higher exposition', viz. khandha-paññatti, etc.).

f., (from adhi-paññam, ind., see
adhicittaṁ above), higher understanding; adhisīlaṁ

sikkhā, ib. 244,1); Nidd I 143,4 (adhicittassa + , q. v.);
Ud-a 363,4. — adhi-paññam, ind., at to the paññā,

adhi-paññā. . . viriyavā, AN I 236,8* — adhipaññāya, ind.
id. (cf. ajjhāgāre), Vin I 70,17 (adhisīle +); AN
III 106,1 (do.); MN II 10,3 (~āya sambhāventi);
adhi-paññā, id. (v. l. °paññāya, °paññaṁ).
— °-dhamma-vipassanā, f., seeing through the things

360,10 (gen. ~āya = saṁkhāra-pariggaha-vipassanā-
ñāṇassa, Mp III 328,11); V 99,5; Pp 61,26 (Pp-a);
Paṭis I 20,29, etc. (Paṭis-a 125,19).
entry.re:

entry.sense:
pr. 3 sg. [adhi + √pat], (a) to fly

set to, to rush against, to attack (cf. √paṭ); abs. ~itvā,

95,30, w.r. adhibādhetvā), see Sadd 214,23; — caus.
adhipāteti (q. v.); cf. ajjhapatta, adhipāta.

n. (= adhi-patitta, q. v.; abstr.
from adhi-pati, prob, by influence from the prec, vidi-
tatta), mastery, supremacy; ~ā paññā, Paṭis I 2,22;
107,28—108,15 (nekkhammâdhip°, etc.; Paṭis-a 56,1:
nekkhammâdīnaṁ adhipati-bhāvena nekkhammâdīi
adhikāni katvā tad-adhika-bhāvena pavattā paññā
ti attho).

m. [ts.], 1. ruler, master, owner; Abh.
725; with gen. or loc, Kacc-v 305 (goṇānaṁ ~,
goṇesu ~); Sadd 724,19; Pay fol. ghī v. 7 (gunnaṁ
~, gosu ~); given as ex. of the sense 'issare' of prp.

( ˇ ˇ ˇ ≃ , however, possible): DN II 257,8*,13*,18*,23*
adhi-pati~, Yakkhānaṁ (ca) ~); do." DN III 197,5*; 198,5*;
199,3*; 202,11*; gen. pl. ~īnaṁ, Ja IV 223,1*; used
as epithet of Mara, Nidd I 489,6 (Nidd-a); II 227,11
(Nidd-a). — 2. a controller, dominant factor; acc. ~iṁ,
AN I 148,1 (Ed. attānaṁ adhipateyyaṁ karitvā; Mp
II 243,33 adhipatiṁ karitvā, and thus also quoted
Ja I 130,24 and As 126,1); Dhs 1034 (ariyamaggaṁ
~iṁ karitvā); As 126,1 (read attānam ~im jeṭṭhakaṁ
katvā); loc. ~iyā (feminine declension!), Tikap 84,1,
etc., Dukap 28,28. etc., cf. Sadd 298,26; pl. cattāro

cf. Vibh 216,11 foll.) ≠ Abhidh-av 59,26*; °-vasena
mano seṭṭho etesan ti manoseṭṭhā, Dhp-a I 36,3.
— Ifc. v. attâ°, ārammaṇâ°, uḷārâ°, cittâ°,
chadvārâ°, chandâ°, tārakâ°, Tāvatimsâ°, ti-
dasâ°, dipadâ°, dhammâ°, nāgâ°, nir-°, maggâ°,
manujâ°, morâ°, yakkhâ°, raṭṭhâ°, lokâ°, viriyâ°,

n. abstr. (from adhipati); Nidd-a
II 256,19 ad Nidd II 227,11 (abl. ~ā adhipati). Cf.
adhipatatta.

m., one among the 24 modes
of relation, viz. the relation of dominance; Tikap 1,8

31,5 (°-niddesa, m., analysis of~); Abhidh-av 134,14.

n. = adhipacca, q. v.; supremacy;
Mogg-v IV 60.
see ādhipateyya.

mfn. [pp. of sa. adhi-pra +
√arth], desired, wished, begged for; DN I 120,2 (icchi-
taṁ, ākaṅkhitaṁ, adhippetaṁ +) = II 236,1.

mfn. (pp. of adhi-pajjati), (a)
'fallen into', having done wrong (cf. āpanna, āpatti),
mistaken; gen. pl. ~ānaṁ, Ja V 379,14* (asmākaṁ ~

Ct,); Thī 345 (Ct. construes with kāmesu and ex-
adhi-pannafault, Ja III 38,9* (= attanā ~aṁ atikkantaṁ, Ct.);

bhūtassa) — VI 27,29*; pl. ~ā, Ja V 91,5* (~ pisā-
cena, = ajjhotthaṭā, Ct.). — Ifc. v. taṇhâ°.

f., a female chief; Ja V 393,11* (pl.
nariyo pamadâdhipā, = pamadānaṁ uttamā, Ct.).

m. (from adhi + √pat — √paṭ; cf.
adhi-pāteti), splitting, breaking; only ifc. v. muddhâ°.

m. (from adhi + √pat, cf. adhi-
patati), name of a flying insect, a moth (salabha);

pātā; Ud-a); Sn 964 (gen. pl. ~ānaṁ (ḍaṁsâ°,

2adhi-pāta

(or °pātika), m. = prec; Ud 72,10
(acc. pl. ~e, v. l. atipātake); Ud-a 355,10 (°pātakā,
v. l. °pātikā; dīpa-sikhaṁ adhipatanato ~ā ti adhip-
petā); Nidd I 484,22 (°pātikā, v. l. °pātakā).

mfn. (cf. 1adhipata), splitting,
breaking; ifc. v. muddhâ°.

ind., regarding the (code of)
discipline; MN II 245,17 (ajjhājīve + (g. v.); Ps);
— °-aṁ, n. (adj.), Vin V 1,18; 2,21 (distinguishing be-
tween pātimokkha and ~). Cf. ajjhāgāre.

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of adhi + √pat; cf.
1adhi-pāta); 'to let fly through', hence (cf. the con-
fusion of √paṭ and √pat): to break, split, cut off;
fut. 1 sg. °-pātayissaṁ, Ja IV 337,14* (pāsañ ca ty-
âhaṁ ~; — chind[ay]issaṁ, cf. ib. 336,22); abs. ~etvā,
Ud 8,17; 49,35; Ud-a (95,30); 2 89,9 is prob.w. r. for
adhi-patitvā, see adhi-patati (b). adhi-pāteti

ind. (adhi + pag[eva]), early in
the morning (?) see adhippāgā below.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. adhi-pra +
√ghṛ], to stream or flow over; part. ~antaṁ, Thī-a
284,1 (Ceabhippc; sabbakālaṁ~, = 'saki [ɔ: çakṛt-?]-
paggharitaṁ', Thī 466).

mfn., very serene, pleased; Ud-a
357,27 (°-âkāraṁ katvā, q. v.). Cf. abhippasanna.

aor. 3 sg. (of adhi-pra + √gam, cf.
Kern p. 63), he directed his step towards; Ja V 59,13*
adhippagāsantikaṁ; Cks mostly adhippăkā; = so . . . adhip-
pāgato [Cks adhippagāhato, Se adhippāgāgato]); Tr.
reads in the text: sv ādhippag āgā, and in the Ct.
adhippag āgato, see ati-ppag (eva); cf. pātarāsaṁ
bhuñjanavelāya, ib. 59,8-9.

m. (from adhi-pra-√i; cf. sa. abhi-
prāya), 1. meaning, intention; wish, desire; Abh 766;
nom. ~o, Th 542 (evaṁ me . . . ~ samijjhatu); DN
II 160,14 foll. (tumhākam ~o . . . devatānaṁ ~o);
Dhp-a I 403,17; Mil 148,(7)-n (= attano mati); 156,9;
161,16 (~o . . . adhimutti . . . chando); Ud-a 159,12;
in Ct.s (opp. attho . . . bhāvo): 'ti ~o, Pj I 166,25;
II 309,17; Ud-a 19,1; Pv-a 8,16; 16,1; 48,23; 'ti evam
~o veditabbo, Pj II 177,13; ayam ettha ~o, Ja II
108,3 (opp. akkharattho); ayam ~o, Pj I 238,15; II
36,16; 41,5; 45,21; 65,16-27; 91,24 (opp. padattho);
155,18; 256,1, etc.; ettha esa ~o, Pj I 139,19; — acc.
adhi-ppāya~aṁ viditvā); Ud-a 360,16 (tesaṁ ~aṁ pūrento);
assa ~aṁ vañcetvā, Ps III 192,6; — instr. ~ena,
Dhp-a III 461,15 ('ti ~ena, with that intention); Ps
III 192,5 ('ti ~ena vadati); ifc. Ps I 109,10—110,1
(out of desire for); AN IV 382,1 (pañhâ°, conform-
ably to; Mp); Kv 622,2 foll. (ekâ°, 'with united re-
solve', Trsl., see Kv-a 197,1-4); —abl. ~ā, Mil 148,1;
~ato, Pj II 329,19 (opp. padato); 330,8 (do.); Sadd
128,21 (opp. saddato, atthato); — pl.~ā, SN I 124,31
(uccâvacā kho purisānaṁ ~ā; quoted Ja I 79,8).
— 2. particular meaning, distinction, difference; ko
viseso ko adhippāyo kiṁ nānākaraṇaṁ, MN I 64,24
(in this formula adhippāyo is a modern correction
of a form due to the influence of viseso, viz. adhip-
pāyoso, adhippāyāso, this last supported by Mp-ṭ,
see below; = adhikappayogo, Ps); MN 84,15; SN II
24,11; III 66,4 (Ee adhippāyoso; = adhippayogo,
Spk); IV 208,3 (Ee adhippāyoso); V 108,10; 116,29;
AN I 200,1; IV 158,1 (v. l. adhippāyāso, Ee adhip-
pāyoso); V 48,25 (do.); ayaṁ kho ... viseso +,
AN I 267,17 (v. l. adhippāyoso and adhippāyāso;
Mp: II 370,1 adhippāyāso = adhika-ppayogo; Mp-ṭ:
adhikaṁ payasati payujjati etenā ti adhippāyāso).
— 3. what is aimed or appointed ɔ: a share, part, portion;
Vin I 301,23 (ekâdhippāyaṁ; = ekaṁ adhippāyaṁ,
ekapuggala-paṭiviṁsam eva dethā ti attho, Sp). — Ifc.
v. a-khiddâ°, an-ullapanâ°, apaharaṇâ°, ādānâ°,
itth(i)-°, ullapanâ°, ekâ°, evam-°, kalyāṇâ°,
kim-°, kīḷâ°, khanti-soraccâ°, khumsanâ°,
pañhâ°, parâ°, purisâ°, Buddha°, bhogâ°,
mokkhâ°, yathâ°, laddhâ°, vināsâ°, visamyogâ°,
vuttâ°, sambhāvanâ°, sâ°, sevanâ°, hassâ°.

mfn. (from adhippāya); only ifc.
v. bhedâ°.

m., a certain mode of inter-
pretation, Sadd 396,15.

n., indication of one's
wish; Pj II 176,21 (explaining 'tena hi').

n., the gain wished for; Ja
VI 36,15* (= adhippāyassa phalaṁ [sampassamānā],
Ct.; but perhaps we ought to take adhippāya (or adhip-
payya?) as abs. of adhi-pra + √i = abhi-pra + √i,
i. e. wishing for ?). adhippāya-phala

f., construction as to the
meaning (opp. padattho): Pj II 103,1; 156,5, etc.

mfn., perceiving the desires
(of others); Ap 464,23; 465,9; Mhv XIX 81.
[m., w. r. for adhippāya (2) q. v.]

ind. (adhippāya + anu-
rūpa), conformably to desire; Ud-a 159,10 (= 'yathâ-
dhippāyaṁ').

f. (dvandva of adhippāya
and anusandhi, q. v.), meaning and application; Pj II
65,16 (opp. padato atthavaṇṇanā; cf. ib. 27).

[(adhippāyosa), traditional read-
ings for adhippāya (2), q. v.]

[m., emprisonment, bondage; Ps
III 618,1 (Se) for anu-bandha, MN III 170,9 (= Ps

ind., about Brahma; MN II
132,29 (~ . . . Bhagavantaṁ apucchimha; adhi is

(or adhi-bhoti), pr. 3 sg. (synon,

628,26 (Se III 36,17 abhi°; = 'abhibho'smi', AN III

240,12* (mā vo kodho ~); 1 sg. ajjhabhaviṁ, Ja II
336,19* (= abhibhaviṁ, Ct.); [2 sg. ajjhabhū, It 76,6*
(yo tvaṁ dujjayam ~) lectio facilior for ajjhabhī,
cf. anvabhī, see Sadd 30,4; It-a, reading ajjayi[;
3 pl. adhibhaṁsu, SN IV 185,31 foll. (but see Sadd
29,30); — fut. 3 pl. °-bhavissanti, Ja II 387,17;
— inf. °-bhavituṁ, Mp (Ce) 530,36 = abhibhavituṁ,

124,10 (deva-māra-brahmāno siriyā ca tejasā ~, cf.

vitvā) = Thī-a Ce 226,1* (reading abhi°), quoted
Sadd 310,26; — pass. 3 sg. adhibhavīyate so ti adhi-
bhūto, Sadd 79,9; — pp. adhibhūta (q. v.).

n. (nomen actionis of prec.),
subjection; Sadd 882,26* ≠ Abh 1177 (giving the sense
of prp. adhi); Sadd 86,14 (= ajjhottharaṇaṁ).

pr. 3 sg. (cf. sa. abhi + √bhāṣ),
to address, speak to; forms of the present tense are
not traced; aor. ajjhabhāsi (see above).]

pr. 3 sg., to shine forth; Ud 73,10*
(v. l. na câdhibhāsati, na ca abhibhāsati; Ed. na
câpi bhāsati = Ud-a 358,12).
abs., v. adhi-bhavati.

m. [ts., cf. abhi-bhū], lord, master,
king; Abh 725; SN IV 187,22 (+ anadhibhūto; v. l.
abhibhū); Sadd 77,16. — Ifc. v. an-°, janâ°, Ti-
divâ°, māradheyyâ°, migâ°. adhi-bhū

mfn. (pp. of adhi-bhavati; cf.
abhibhūta), overpowered; SN IV 186,8 (+ anadhi-

dhâ°, taṇhâ°, domanassâ°, dhammâ°, pho-
ṭṭhabbâ°, rasâ°, rūpâ°, saddâ°.
pr. 3 sg., v. adhi-bhavati.

mfn. [sa. adhi-mātra], (a) above
measure, excessive, extreme, very great; Vin I 82,38
(~aṁ dukkhaṁ, opp. anappakaṁ); MN I 244,32 (~o
ḍāho) ≠ II 193,20; I 243,22 (~ā vātā) ≠ II 193,2
adhi-matta≠ II 193,8; Ja VI 115,29* (~ā vedanā); AN II 18,25
(saddhindriyaṁ ~aṁ); ~o chando, AN II 93,15; III
307,10; IV 320,25; V 93,23 foll.; n.~aṁ (opp. parittaṁ,
mattaso), AN IV 241,27; SN IV 160,5 foll. (~ā rūpā;
opp. parittā); Dhp-a II 85,12 (~aṁ sinehaṁ); Mil
146,14 (~ā attânudiṭṭhi); — (b) more (or most) power-
ful, superior; Ap 77,19 (sabbesaṁ ~aṁ va porisaṁ);
AN II 149,33 (pane') (indriyāni ~āni; opp. mudūni);
Pp 15.22 (paññindriyaṁ ~aṁ; = balavaṁ, Pp-a);
Ps I 260,32 (~ā honti balavatiyo; opp. omattā); Mil
189,6 (~aṁ balavataraṁ); 290,5 (do.); As 336,4
(quoted Sadd 108,6; 113,20);— °aṁ, ind. (a) highly,
extremely, Spk III 64,6; Mil 274,8 (~ vāyati);
— (b) in the highest degree, Mil 176,24 (dvīsu yeva di-
vasesu ~aṁ); — (c) in still higher degree, Pv-a 86,9
(= adhikataraṁ; cf. Pv 133: taṁ adhimattaṁ; v. r.
adhimattā = ativiya mattā, Pv-a, but perhaps for
tam-adhimattā, sa. *tvad-adhimātrā). — Ifc. v.
visayâ° (As 334,24: ajjhāsayato vā °~ato vā, by
one's own will, or by the excess of a (new) object;
Ed. visadâ°). — °-kasima(n), m., extreme meagreness;
MN I 80,10 (~ānaṁ patto; — ativiya kisabhāvaṁ,
Ps); 152,8 foll. (do.). — °-gatima(t), mfn., of extreme
mindfulness; m.~mā, As 15,38 (adhimatta-satimā+);
pl. ~manto, MN I 82,37. — °-gilāna, mfn., excess-
ively ill; Ud-a 60,24 (= 'bālha-gilāna'; Ed. °-gelañña);
Sv I 212,14 (do.); Mp ad AN III 295,16 (do.). — °-tta,
n. abstr., preponderance; AN II 150,24 (abl. ~ā).
— °-dukkha, n., extreme pain; Ja I 92,2. — °-dhi-
tima(t), mfn., of extreme fortitude; m. ~mā, As 15,38
(adhimatta-satimā +); pl. ~manto, MN I 83,1.
— °-paritta, mfn. (dvandva), excessive and trifling, only
f. abstr. ~tā, Nidd I 216,1 (= adhimatta-bhāvo ca
paritta-bhāvo ca, Nidd-a). — °-bhāva, m., excess;
Ud-a 404,23 (vedanānaṁ); Nidd-a II 11,6. — °-ve-
danā-patta, mfn., suffering extreme pain; Pv-a
281,22.
entry.re:
— °-sinehaadhi-matta-sineha, m., excessive love; Dhp-a
I 5,9.

entry.sense:
mfn. (cf. abhi-mana & sa. abhi-
manas), disposed, intent on; f. ~ā, Ja IV 443,22*
(vividham [Ee -aṁ, Cks -a; ˇ ˇ ˇ ] ~ā suṇom' ahaṁ
(metre: Aparavaktra); = pasannacittā, Ct.). — Ifc.

mfn. (cf. prec. & adhi-mānasa
and adhiceta(s)), with a well-disposed mind, composed,
unconcerned; pl. ~ā bhavātha, Sn 692.

m. (cf. ati-māna & sa. abhimāna),
arrogance, pride; illusion, fancy, conceit; nom. ~o,

430,4 (mānaṁ omānaṁ atimānaṁ +; = adhika-
mānaṁ, Mp) ≠ Nidd I 80,10; instr. ~ena aññam
vyākaroti, Vin III 91,7 (= adhigata-mānena vā . . .
adhi-māna100,30; MN II 252,22; AN V 162,23 foll.; °-mattam
pi pajahituṁ na sakkonti, Ps III 39,12. — Ifc. v.
an-°, arahattâ°, saggâ°.

mfn. (cf. adhi-mana(sa)), intent
on; ifc. cāgâ°, glad in sacrificing, Ja VI 488,13*
(= cāgena adhika-mānaso, Ct.).

mfn., who considers illusion
to be the truth; AN V 162,21 foll.

mfn. (from adhi-māna), conceited;
seized by, or ensnared in illusions; AN V 162,21 foll.
(= anadhigate adhigata-mānena samannāgato, Mp);
169,17 (saddhammesu) — 317,24; Ps III 463,12 (acc.
~aṁ); Ps I 186,4 (gen. ~assa bhikkhuno); Dhp-a III
adhimānikamānika-bhikkhūnam vatthu, n. title of Dhp-a III
111—112.

pr. 3 sg. (pass, of adhi + √muc),
['to become fastened, applied on something, cf. paṭi-
muñcati, āmuñcati as opp. to avamuñcati and vi-
muñcati], thus (a) to apply oneself to, to set one's
heart to (loc.); (b) to adhere to (loc. or acc.), to have
faith, to be sure; (c) to decide upon, to take pleasure
in (loc), to be inclined towards; (d) to conceive, realize,
to take a firm resolve, also to make a (magical) act
of volition (cf. adhitiṭṭhati); (e) to enter into another
body (loc), said of Bodhisatta, Mara, etc, i. e. to
adhi-muccatiadhitiṭṭhati); — pr. 3 sg. ñāṇena ~ati, Ap 161,21 =
Th-a Ce 169,9*; paññāya ~ati, MN II 262,16 (— ara-
hattaṁ sacchikaroti, Ps); kaṁkhati vicikicchati nâ-
dhimuccati na sampasīdati (b), Sn p. 107,16 (= tāya
vicikicchāya sannitthānaṁ na gacchati, Pj); DN I
106,2 (Sv = Pj); 109,5 foll.; MN II 135,8; MN I 101,1],
= AN IV 460,13 = V 17,25; cittaṁ pakkhandati
pasīdati santiṭṭhati ~ati, It 43,19 ≠ MN I 186,1 ( =
'evan' ti adhimokkhaṁ labhati, Ps II 225,35); Sv I
316,9 (desanāya(ṁ) cittaṁ nâdhimuccati; pt); ime
dhamme saddahati ~ati (b), SN III 225,9 ( = saddhā-
vimokkhaṁ paṭilabhati, Spk); piyarūpe rūpe ~ati
(c), SN IV 119,28 (= kilesavasena adhimutto giddho
hoti, Spk); 184,27; — part. m. ~anto (b), Pj II 606,29
(saddhāya ~); Nidd II 141,25 (= adhimokkhaṁ ka-
ronto, Nidd-a); pl. m. saddahantā okappentā ~antā
(b), Nidd I 62,13 (= sampasādana-vasena sanniṭṭhā-
naṁ katvā tesaṁ kathaṁ adhivāsentā, Nidd-a);
part. med. cetasā ~māno (b), AN IV 13,16 = 145,21
(= cittena sannitṭhāpayamāno, Mp); evaṁ ~māno,
SN III 56,5; — imper. 2 sg. ~assu (b), Sn 559 = Th
829; — pot. 3 sg. ~eyya (d), AN III 340,30 (amuṁ
dārukkhandhaṁ 'paṭhavī' tv-eva ~; = sailakkheyya,
Mp); SN I 116,32 (Himavantaṁ ... 'suvaṇṇaṁ' tv-eva
~, suvaṇṇañ ca pabbat'assa; = cinteyya, Spk) ≠
Dhp-a IV 32,14; — aor. 3 sg. ~mucci (d), Vin III
250,26 (Bimbisārassa pāsādaṁ 'suvaṇṇan' ti ~, so
ahosi sabba-sovaṇṇamayo; = 'sovaṇṇamayo hotū'
ti adhiṭṭhāsi, Sp)' = Vin I 209,8; sarīṝe ~ (e), Ja V
429,27; Ps II 415,13; — fut. 3 sg. ~issati (c), Mil
234,18 (loko oṇamissati okappessati +); — abs.
~itvā, Ud-a 213,1 (uccheda-ditthivasena, b); sarīre
~ (e), Ud-a 421,2:i; Dhp-a I 196,19; III 257,20; IV
170,23; Ja IV 272,21; V 103,12; Ps II 418,23; pharitvā
~ (e), MN III 101,5; 146,24 foll; Ps II 100,18 ( =
'pharitvā', MN I 127,8). — Cf. adhimoceti, caus.

m. (nomen agentis of adhi-
muccati), a believer; AN III 165,6 = Pp 65,12 (~ā

mfn. (pp. of adhi + √mūrch;

adhi-mucchita

mfn. (pp. of adhi-muccati), [Sn
1071—72 (w. r. for vimutta); B1-"1 and Nidd II 83,8

pressed with an idea; Vin III 85,21; MN II 12,34

191,20). — Ifc. v. avyāpajjhâ°, asammohâ°, ākiñ-
caññâ°, āṇañjâ°, upādānakkhayâ°, karuṇâ°,
kāmâ°, taṇhakkhayâ°, tad-°, dānâ°, nibbāṅâ°,
nekkhammâ°, paṇītâ°, pavivekâ°, brahmalokâ°,

m. Npr. of two theras authors of

— Th-a Ce II 11,24-32*), cf. Sadd 348.2.
n. Npr., v. l. for Atimuttaka.

mfn., whose mind is (thus) dis-
posed, or has (such a) conviction; Sn 1149 (evaṁ maṁ

f. abstr. of adhi-mutta; ifc. v.
kāmâ°, tad-°, saddhâ°, samādhi-°.

sense.hi: n. abstr. of id.; ifc. v.

entry.sense:
f., conviction, faith; intention, will,
inclination; Abh 766; [DN I 174,34 read adhi-vimutti];

naṁ~i: addhippāyo viññūnaṁ); 169,22 (Nandassa
~iṁ jānitvā). — Ifc. v. evam-°, hīnâ°.

mfn., manifested by

m. (from adhi-muccati), faith,
conviction; decision, resolve; Abh 159; Sadd 882,29;

= Vism 466,22); 264,3 (+manasikāro); Abhidh-s
6,6 (vitakko vicāro+); Ps II 68,16 (~aṁ na paṭi-
labhati, = 'nâdhimuccati'); 225,35 (~aṁ labhati =
'adhimuccati'); Vism 471,16 (vicikicchāya abhāvena
pan' ettha ~o uppajjati = Abhidh-av 26,3); Paṭis
II 101,12, quoted Vism 633,27 (= saddhâ, Vism
636,16); — Vibh 165,1 (vedanā-paccayā taṇhā,
tanhā-paccayā ~o, °-paccayā bhavo, etc., cf. Vibh-a
209,24 foll.). — Ifc v. a-laddhâ°, laddhâ°. —
— °-kicca, n., what is required for a°; Ps I 291,21.
— °-cariyā, f., life of a°; Paṭis II 8,23 (~āya vesā-
rajjaṁ). — °-bahula, mfn., full of faith; °-tā, f.

racteristic of a°; Mp III 5,14 (~aṁ saddhābalaṁ);
n. subst, loc. ~e, As 145,15 — Ud-a 305,1. — °-saddhā,

471,17 (Ed. °sambhāvato), prob. w. rr. for sabbhāvato.

entry.sense:
pr. 3 sg. (caus. of adhimuccati (a)
or (e)), to let another 'apply' himself to (loc); imper.

[w r. for
adhī°, see adhiyati.j

mfn. (pp. of adhi-rohati; sa. adhi-

ifc. mfn. v. dur-°, Mil 322,24. Cf.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. √adhi + √ruh], to
ascend; Sadd 882,29; Pay fol. gr 6 (uparibhāve ~,
illustrating the sense of prp. adhi).
f. [ts.], a ladder; Abh 216.

n. (ts.; cf. adhivutti), appellation,
designation: (a) title (of a dhamma-pariyāya): Sn
p. 218,18 (Pj II 604,6: ~aṁ āropetvā; = nāmaṁ
saṁkhā, etc., Nidd); DN III 116,10 (= nāmaṁ, Sv);
adhivacananirutti, accord, to Sv ad DN II 63,28 ; 68,18; As 51,28-3].
(mṭ Be 51,1-21), Nidd-a ad Sn 1076]: + adhivacana-
patha, nirutti, etc., DN II 68,18; pl. ~ā dhammā
(gender-attraction) Dhs p. 7,11 (As 51,81); 1306 (As
391,21;) = 'equivalents', Expositor II 499,1); — (c) a
metaphorical designation: It 15,1 ('puññāni' for sukhaṁ)
≠ AN IV 89,1; Ja I 117,31* ('rajo' for rāgo) = Th-a
Ce 521,2* (ad Th 566) ≠ Vism 388,25*-33* ≠ Divy
491,19*; MN I 27,9 ('angaṇaṁ' for pāpakāni . . .);
AN I 132,1 (brahmā, pubbācariyā and āhuṇeyyā for
mātāpitaro) = 1170,19 = It 110,6; AN IIl"310,28
(bhayaṁ, etc., for kāmā, cf. Sn 51); IV 340,2 (samaṇo,
etc., for tathāgata); Pj II 100,16,22; explaining the
terms of complete allegories: MN I 118,2-15; 144,2
— 145,6; 155,31-33; 460,10 . . . 461,17 . . . 35 . . . 462,14
= AN II 124,9 foll.; SN II 226,17-19; IV 180,10-28;
— (d) hence (in Ct.s): an approximate synonym
(different from vevacana, which is — pariyāyasadda,
Nett-a ad Nett 4,2*): Ud-a 304,27. 424,20; Pj II
115,10 ('ambucārī' for maccho), 146,30 ('mano' for
cittaṁ), 147,12 ('pājanaṁ' for patodo) etc., see Pj II
Index p. 802. — Ifc. v. anukkaṇṭhitâ°, khandhâ°,
gāravâ°; atītâ°-kusala, mfn.; anāgatâ°-k., anekâ°-
k., itthâ°-k., ekâ°-k., napumsakâ°-k., paccup-
pannâ°-k., purisâ°-k. — °-duka, n., tṅe couplet
adhiv°, etc. (viz. Dhs p. 7,11), As 51,28.

— °-pathaadhivacana-patha,
m., mode of appellation or expression (as to suff.
°patha see akusalakamma-patha); DN II 63,28 (Sv);
68,19; SN III 71,15 (tayo . . . niruttipathā ~ā pañña-
ttipathā); Dhs p. 7,11; 1306—1307—1308, sabbe

— °-pada, n. = 'adhi-vutti-pada' (q. v.), Sv I
103,30; Ps III 430,1; Mp III 376,18. — °-sam-
phassa, m., the coming into contact with a name;
DN II 62,17 (= mano-samphasso, Sv; opp. paṭigha-
samphasso); Nidd I 52,16 = 222,22 (cakkhu-sam-
phasso +);

— °-samphassa-jaadhivacana-samphassa-ja, mfn., produced by
that; Vibh 6,2 (~ā saññā sukhumā; Vibh-a).

entry.sense:
mfn. (grd. of adhi + √vac),
what is to be expressed (by a synonym?); AN II
180,23 (vacanīyâdhi-vacanīyésu; = atireka-vattab-
besu).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. adhi + √vṛt], to be
approaching or imminent; to issue, to fall to one's lot
(with acc. pers.); ~ati kho taṁ . . . jarāmaraṇaṁ,

adhi-vattati
