or adhi-vuttha, mfn. (pp. of adhi-
vasati δc adhi-vāseti), 1. (from adhivasati, generally
adhivattha), (a) inhabiting (as a ruler, a tutelary
deity, or a haunting demon, cf. adhi-tiṭṭhati, adhi-
adhi-vatthahoti, Vin III 58,13 (cf. Sp (II) 374,20, w. r. adhi-
vatto); (loc) ~ā devatā, Vin I 28,36; MN I 306,5;
SN I 197,1; III 250,1; IV 302,23; Ja I 223,23;
II385,28; IV 194,1; Dhp-a III 182,2; Pv-a 17,28;
voc. f. ~e (Makhādevasmiṁ), Ja III 327,26* (tasmiṁ
~e ti devataṁ ālapati, Ct.); acc ~aṁ devataṁ,
Ud-a 323,1; adhivuttha-devatā, Ja VI 370,14-25; ba-
hi-nagare tale adhivattho Dīghatālo (or Dīghataphalo)
nāma yakkho, Ps III 422,1 = Ss 103,10; Ap 530,6
= Thī-a 144,18* (upassayâ°, v. l. °vutthā). — (b) in-
habited by (ifc ) Ja V 416,22** (°kaṇerusaṁghâ°);
V 420,9** (°tāpasa-gaṇâ°, cf. ib. 422,32'). — 2. (from
adhivāseti [cf. paññatta to paññapeti, etc.], generally
adhivuttha), (a) who has received an invitation and
accepted it (with object bhattaṁ); Vin I 232,25 (adhi-
vuttho'mhi . . . Ambapāliyā gaṇikāya bhattaṁ, cf.
DN II 97,14 below); — (b) do. in a passive sense;
~o me vassāvāso, MN II 50,27 (/ consent to spend
the rainy season (there)); ~aṁ ca pana samaṇena
Gotamena (scil. bhattaṁ), MN II 92,5; ~aṁ kho me
. . . Ambapāliyā gaṇīkāya bhattaṁ, DN II 97,14 (cf.
Vin I 232,25); DN I 226,1 (adhi-vatthaṁ); ~aṁ mayā
. . . bhattaṁ, Dhp-a III 469,5. Cf. adhi-vāsita.

m(fn)., superior, surpassing; ifc. v.
an-°.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. adhi + √vas, cf. ajjhā-
vasati], to dwell, inhabit (acc); vihāram ~ati, Rūp
287; Sadd 717,11; gāmaṁ ~ati, Pay fol. gai v. 7;
pp. adhivattha (adhivuttha), q. v.; caus. adhivāseti,
q. v. adhi-vasati

m. (cf. adhivāseti), acquiescence,
holding out; Abh 958 (sampaṭicchane); — ifc. v.
khudâ°, dur-°. Cf. adhivāsaka, adhivāsana.

m. [ts.], perfuming, perfume; Abh
958 (vase dhūpâdi-saṁkhāre). Cf. 2vāsa, vāseti.

mfn. (from adhivāseti), enduring,
patient; Ja IV 77,1' (parehi vuttānaṁ duṭṭha-vaca-
nānaṁ ~o; — 'khantā duruttānaṁ').
entry.re:
— °-jātikaadhi-vāsaka-jātika,
mfn. (in Mss. often spelt adhi-vāsika°), enduring or
patient by nature; uppannānaṁ sārīrikānaṁ vedanā-
adhi-vāsaka= III 97,27 = 137,2 = AN II 118,3 = III 163,34
= 389,12 = V 132,12. — Ifc. v. an-°.

entry.sense:
n. = adhi-vāsanā, Ja IV 77,6'
(gender influenced by sotthānaṁ ib.).
entry.re:
— °-khantiadhi-vāsana-khanti,
f., patient endurance; Ja II 237,5'; III 263,20' (~iyā
samannāgato, = 'akkodhano'); V 174,32' (o: khanti-
pāramī); Ps II 99,22 (~iyaṁ ṭhito); Ud-a 263,11;
°-bala-vibhāvanaṁ udānaṁ, Ud-a 262,31 (ad Ud
45,30*). — °-tā, f. abstr., Dhs 1341 (khanti khama-
natā + ; As 396,1).

— °-viriyaadhi-vāsana-viriya, n., energetic endur-
ance; Ja V 174,31' (ɔ: viriya-pāramī)— Ifc. v. an-°,
īsam-°. adhi-vāsana

entry.sense:
f. (from adhivāseti; cf. 1adhivasa
& Buddh, sa. adhivāsanā); (a), consent, assent, accept-
ance; Vin II 104,5 (kammassa kiriyā karaṇaṁ upaga-
manaṁ ajjhupagamanaṁ+); Ap 39,15 '~aṁ aññāya);
305,25 (do.); MN I 236,15 (~aṁ viditvā); II 63,9 (do.);
Dhp-a I 33,10; Mhv XXX,2; AN III 31,15 (°-kālo);
— (b), endurance; acc. ~ aṁ sotthānaṁ (split comp.),
Ja IV 76,1* ≠ Mvu I 285,1*; instr., abl. ~ā, MN I
7,13; 10,24-33 (dassanā+ . . . pahātabbā, scil. āsavā)
= AN III 387,23 ≠ 389,6; ~āya, AN III 387,23
(~āya pahīnā) ≠ 389,6.

pr. 3 sg., see adhi-vāseti.
adhi-vāsāpeti, pr. 3 sg. (caus. of adhi-vāseti (a)),
to cause (or ask) someone to stay or wait; 2 sg. ~esi.
Ja I 254,22 (amhe aññaṁ saṁvaccharaṁ); /nf.~etuṁ,
Ja V 200,18 (yāva pitu āgamanā).

mfn. (from adhivasati), dwelling
in, inhabiting; ifc. v. Mahāvihārâ°.

mfn. (pp. of adhivāseti (b)) = adhi-
vattha (adhi-vuttha) 2 b: accepted (said of an in-
vitation); Dhp-a III 470,12 (satthārā Cūḷasubhaddāya
nimantanaṁ ~aṁ).

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of adhi-vasati, cf.
adhivāsana; for Ct.-analysis see As 395,31), (a) to
wait; (b)[prob, originating with the polite imper. ~ehi,
"suffer"] to consent (esp. to accept an invitation [to,
acc.]), to agree or grant; (c) to have patience (often
with a neg. part, as avihaññamāno), to bear, endure
(acc); to pardon; to give in; — pr. 3 sg. ~eti
adhi-vāsetiUd-a (c)); do. DN II 99,5 (sato sampajāno ~ avi-
haññamāno, ≠ 128,1, aor. ~esi) = SN I 28,3 (c);
~eti na-ppajahati na vinodeti, MN I 453,9 = SN IV
76,27 = It 115,14 (c); nâdhivāseti pajahati vino-
deti, MN I 11,12 (c); sarikhāy' ekam ~eti, DN III
224,21 = MN I 464,14 (c); — 2 sg. ~esi (ç), Ja II
386,10' (= 'titikkhasi'); — 3 pl. ~enti (c), DN II
158,3; — part. m. ~ento, Ud 21,7 (vedanaṁ,
— upari vāsento (cf. As 395,31) sahanto khamanto, Ud-a
(c)); °-vāsayanto (khudaṁ pipāsaṁ), Ja IV 330,5* (c);
an-adhivāsento, Ja IV 235,19* (b or c); gen. ~en-
tassa (mahādukkhaṁ), Ja I 46,20 (c); ~ayato (an°),
MN I 10,31 (c); pl. ~ayantā (an°, or n'adhiv°), Vv
961 (pipāsaṁ; = ~etuṁ asakkontā, Vv-a (c)); part.
med. øen.~ayamānassa, Ps II 227,11 (kakacôk(k)anta-
naṁ, c); — imper. 3 sg. ~etu me (bhante Bhagavā, etc)
svātanāya bhattaṁ (b, generally followed by aor. ~esi
kho Bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena), DN I 109,23 (= sam-
paṭicchatu, Sv, ɔ: sādiyatu, pt); 226,2; II 97,12; MN
I 236,12; II 50,1; Vin I 17,28; Sn p. 103,24; ~etu no
bhante Bh. āvasathâgāraṁ, DN II 84,19 (b); ~etu me
bhante Bh. Bārāṇasiyaṁ vassâvāsaṁ, MN II 50,24 (b);
— 2 sg. ~ehi tāva (a), Dhp-a II 191,17; Ja III 277,6;
~ehi svātanāya bhattaṁ (b), MN II 63,5; Dhp-a I
33,8; — 3 pi. ~entu (bhattaṁ), SN IV 289,5 (b);
— 2 pl. ~etha (a), Ja I 254,20; thokaṁ ~, Ja VI 588,6;
Dhp-a I 197,1; (b) Pv-a 17,8; — pot. 3 sg. °-vāsaye
(c), Ud 45,30* (~ aduṭṭhacitto; = adhivāsana-khan-
tiyaṁ ṭhatvā khameyya, Ud-a); °-vāsaye (phuṭṭho
ḍaṁsehi. . tatra), Th 31 = 244 (c) (= saheyya, Ct.);
°-vāsayeyya (sītaṁ accuṇhaṁ), Sn 966; Ja III 205,11*
(asocamāno ~) (c); °-vāseyya, DN II 115,33 (b or c);
— 2 pl. °-vāseyyātha (nâdhi°), MN I 129,27 = II
251,23 (c); — aor. 3 sg ~esi (b) Ap 39,14; Vin I
17,30 (tuṇhībhāvena); DN I 109,24; MN I 236,13;
II 63,1; Pv-a 17,8, etc. (cf. above imper. 3 sg.
~etu); — 3 pl. ~esuṁ (b), SN IV 289,1 (bhattaṁ);
— fut. 1 sg. °vāsessāmi, Ja IV 279,4 (a); — inf.
~etuṁ, Vv-a 337,1 (c); — abs. ~etvā, Ja II 352,18
(dve sāvanā, a); III 281,3 (dve tayo pahāre, c); IV
407,17 (vedanaṁ, c); V 51,25 (do.); —grd.n.~etabbaṁ,
Ja VI 288,20 (a); Mil 94,12 (chiddaṁ disvā ~, c);
— pp. adhivāsita (q. v.), adhivattha (adhivuttha), cf.
cudita: codita, Buddh, sa. rupta: ropita, etc.

mfn. (adhi + √vah; cf. sa. abhi-
vahati), carrying, bringing; only ifc. v. dukkhâ°,
sukhâ°.

mf(-l)n. = prec.; taṁ [scil.
yogakkhemaṁ] adhikatvā vāhiyyati, abhimukhaṁ
vāhiyyatī ti ~aṁ, Pj II 150,1. — Ifc. v. papafica-
saṁghāṭa-du(k)khâ°, yogakkhemâ°.

f., a chief wtfe(?), MTD (cf. sa. id.
with different meaning & adhi-vedana below).

ind. concerning, with regard to
the vimutti (q. v.); DN I 174,34 (Ee adhi-mutti; but
see Sv (II) 360,3). — °-tā, f. abstr., ifc. v. kāmâ°.

n. [cf. adhi-vacana, °vutti re-
presenting sa. ukti (√vac); orig, used paronomastically
as a verbal noun to abhi-vadati (see Sn 891)], (point(s)
of) theory, dogma, anekavihitāni ~āni abhivadanti,
adhi-vutti-padavacanapadāni, (b) as *adhi + vṛtti: "abhibhavitvā
. . . vattanato"); 30,5 foll. - MN II 228,13 (Ps = Sv)
= 233,ø; — tesaṁ tesaṁ ~ānaṁ abhiññā sacchi-
kiriyāya, AN V 36,25 (Ee adhi-mutti°; Mp ≠ Sv).

mfn. (pp. of adhi-vasati), see adhi-
vattha.

n. [ts.], taking a lesser wife,
MTD. Cf. adhi-vinnā.

m., excellent honour; Dhp-a I
111,23 (C*», blending of adhikāra and sakkāra, Ed.
adhikāraṁ; cf. Dhp-a2 (I) 94 n. 1; Gp seems to favour
adhikāra).

n. (pp. of adhi-sam-
ut-√pad + nāma(n)), a term whose meaning does not
agree with the literal meaning of it; opp. anvattha-
nāma (q. v.), quoted by Tr. only from the Burmese
Atthasālinī (Westergaard, Cat. p. 106b), ɔ: adhicca-
samuppanna (?). adhi-samuppanna-nāma
m. [sa. adhi-çraya], place, MTD.

f. [sa. adhi-çrayaṇī], fire-place,
bellows, MTD. '
see 1adhi-seti.

mfn. [ts., cf. 1adhiseti], lying or
sleeping on; f. ~ā (mañcaṁ viya), Pv-a 80,25 (so
CeEe; ɔ: adhisayānā, part. med.?).

mfn. (pp. of 1adhi-seti), (a) active:
lying upon (with acc, e.g. bed, eggs); Mogg-v V 59
(~o khaṭopikaṁ bhavaṁ); Ps II 193,28 (migassa . . .
pāsarāsiṁ °-kālo); — (b) passive: occupied (by a
person lying), brooded (by a hen); Mogg-v V 59 (~ā
adhi-sayitaditāni paribhāvitāni (scil. aṇḍāni), Vin III 3,32 (Sp:
tāya janettiyā kukkuṭiyā pakkhe pasāretvā tesaṁ
upari sayantiyā sammā ~āni) — MN I 104,4 (Ps =
Sp) = SN III 153,15 (Spk do.) = AN IV 125,21
, (Mp do.); ~aṁ dhanaṁ (nāgena), Ps II 128,19-20.

(pr. 3 sg. (adhi + √sṛ), to over-
power; pot. 3 sg. mā te ādhisare †mucca (ɔ: muccha?
the gloss patitthayatu meaning prob, patiṭṭhīyatu
(Tr)), Ja V 117,5* (so read with B. for avisare, Cks);
abs. ~itvā, ib. 119,2' (Cks avisaritvā; = atikka-
mitvā pavatte paresaṁ akusala-dhamme[su], taking
adhisara as a noun).

pr. 3 sg. (adhi-saṁ + √likh),
to lay too much strain upon (abstinence); MN I 449,12
(~t'evâyaṁ samaṇo — atisallekhati, ativāyāmaṁ
karoti, Ps) = AN I 236,30 foll. (= ativiya salle-
khati (Ee sallikh°), ativiya sallikhitaṁ katvā saṇha-
saṇhaṁ kathetîti attho, Mp). Cf. Sadd 330,19.

n., 'higher conduct' (origin as adhi-
citta); Sp I 244,2; Sadd 752,28. — adhisīlaṁ, ind.,
as to the moral conduct; DN I 174,18 (yad-idaṁ ~aṁ
+ adhijegucchaṁ. . . adhipaññaṁ . . . adhi(vi)mutti);
AN I 230,27 (~aṁ sikkhissasi); 236,8* (~aṁ adhi-
cittaṁ ca adhipaññaṁ ca viriyavā). — adhisīle,
ind. id. (cf. ajjhāgāre); ~ sīlavipanno (paron.) Vin
I 63,33 = 67,8 = 114,24; ~e adhicitte adhipañ-
ñāya, Vin I 70,16; AN III 106,1 (na sakkhissanti
adhi-sīlasee Mp II 378,1); mama sāvakā ~e sambhāventi,
MN II 9,15; ~e sampavattā hoti, AN III 133,1; ~e
samādapeti, AN III 263,28 (v. l. ~esu; Mp: adhisīlesu
= pañcasu sīlesu); ~e [+ adhicitte, adhipaññāya]
samādapetuṁ, A NV 73,15.
entry.re:
— °-pūraṇaadhi-sīla-pūraṇa, mfn., ful-
filling the moral precepts; Ps II 403,1 (so Ck; Ce Ee Se
asithila-pūrako).

— °-sikkhāadhi-sīla-sikkhā, f. (& °-sikkhā-samā-
dāna, n.), (undertaking of) moral training, see pas-
sages quoted s. v. adhi-citta-sikkhā above.

entry.sense:
m. Npr. of the chief pupil of Anoma-
dassi-thera at Sudhammapura; Sās 60,16.

(or adhi-sayati), pr. 3 sg. (adhi +
√çī), to lie in or on (acc. or loc); pot. 3 sg. °-sayeyya
(pāsa-rāsiṁ), MN I 173,81; 174,1; fut. 3 sg. °-sessati
(paṭhaviṁ), Dhp 41 (= paṭhaviyā upari sayissati,
Dhp-a) quoted Sadd 717,13; Pay fol. gr 7 (paṭhavi-
2adhi-setiadhi, cf. Sadd 882,29); pp. °-sayita, mfn. (q.v.).

pr. 3 sg. (adhi + √çri), to take refuge
or recourse to (acc); yañ-ñaṁ disataṁ ~, Sn 671 (Pj
= gacchati, giving as v. r. abhiseti = allīyati, apas-
sayati).

m. (sa. adhīçvara), a supreme lord;
Mhv LXXX 59.
pr. 3 sg., v. l. for abhi-harati (q. v.).

mfn. [ts. pp. of adhīyati], (a) learnt,
studied; ~o uggahīto, Sp-ṭ ad Sp I 7,15 (= 'pariyatto').
— (b) learned (in veda); Ap 411,13 (~ā vedagū sabbe).
pr. 3 sg. med., see adhīyati.

mfn. [ts.], subject to, belonging to, depen-
dent on (loc); Abh 728; Sv I 212,26 = Ps II 318,1
(na attani ~o, = 'anattâdhīno'); Sv I 212,28 (paresu
~o, = 'parâdhīno'); yaṁ khalu dhammam ādhīnaṁ
adhīnanaṁ vase vattati), Ja V 350,16*. — Ifc v. attâ°,
anaññâ°, anattâ°, aparâ°, dhammasaṁghâ°,
parâ°, Buddha°, Sâ°, Sīhaḷâ°.

[suggested by Tr. for Adīnasattu,
Ja V 26,1'.]

pr. 3 sg. (adhi + √i, sa. adhyeti &
ved. adhīyati; in Mss. also spelt adhiyati or adhiyyati),
lit. 'enter into, take possession of (cf. adhi-gacchati):
to read, study, understand, esp. to learn by heart
(acc); ~īyati, Ja III 28,22* (dhammaṁ; opp. sajjhā-
adhīyatiopp. vāceti); Mil 164,2 (vijjaṁ); 2 sg. nâdhīyasi bhik-
khuhi saṁvasanto, SN I 202,29* (= na sajjhāyasi,
nâdiyasī [ - - ˇ - ] ti vā pāṭho, Spk); 1 sg. ~īyāmi,
Ap 343,1 (mante); 3 pl. ~īyanti, Ja VI 458,24* (metr.:
adhĭyanti ve mahārāja = sa. adhi + yanti,
cf. ajjheti) quoted Sadd 322,30; 3 sg. med. ~īte
(vyākaraṇaṁ), Sadd 883,2; Pay fol. gr 7 (given as
ex. of the sense 'ajjhayane' of prp. adhi); Sadd
m,23 ≠ Mogg III 2 (sâggi ~); 2 sg. med. ~īyase,
Ja VI 458,19* (dibbaṁ~ māyaṁ); — part. gen. ~īyan-
tassa, Vin I 270,9 (satta me vassāni ~); part. med.
~īyamāno (mante), AN III 224,21. (quoted Pj II
316,14; = vede sajjhāyanto gaṇhanto, Mp);
— imper. 2 sg. med., ~īyassu, Dhp-a III 446,1 (tassa
santikaṁ gantvā~); — pot. 3 sg. med. ~īyetha, Ja III
218,26* (sabbaṁ sutaṁ); — inf. ~īyituṁ, Ps III
478,10 ad MN III 1,12 (tayo pi vedā na sakkā
ekadivasena ~); adhīyitu-kāma, mfn., wishing to
learn (mante), DN I 114,13 ≠ 130,23 (codd. adhiy°);
— abs. (a ) adhicca (q.v.); (b ) ~īyitvā, DN I 96,6
(mante); AN III 224,23 (do.); Ja IV 75,13' (suta-
pariyattiṁ); V 10,19' (paṭiggahetvā ~); (c) adhīyâ-
naṁ, Ja V 450,14*; 451,9' (= sajjhāyitvā); — pp.
adhīta, mfn. (q.v.); — grd. ~īyitabba, mfn., Ja III
219,8' (sabbaṁ ~aṁ). — Cf. ajjhāyati & 1ajjheti.
mfn. [ts.], timid; Abh 731 ('kātara').

mfn. (pp. of adhi + √īr), uttered, pro-
nounced; Kacc-v 46 (given as ex. of adhi before the
vowels i, ī); Sadd 619,10. Cf. abbhīrita.

m. [sa. adhîça], lord or master (over);
ifc. v. surâ°.

f. (sa. a + dhūrta, f.), not depraved;
~ī + athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā, AN IV 266,6 = 268,24
= 270,16; pl. ~í + do., AN III 38,8 (Mp: purisa-
dhutta-surādhuttatā-vasena ~iyo).

ind. [ts.; Kacc 235], (just) now, lately,
recently, newly; Ud-a 379,18 (= 'idāni'); 402,29 (do.);
Ja III 181,8'; Dāṭh II 94. In comp.s with pp.:
°-kārita, mfn., newly built; Ps ad MN I 353,20
(= 'nava'); — °-kālakata, mfn., just deceased; DN
III 117,5 (~o, scil. Nigaṇṭho Nāthaputto; = sampati
adhunāputto) — Vin II 185,23 (°-kālaṁkato); AN IV 75,25
(Tisso bhikkhu);
entry.re:
— °-âgataadhunā-âgata, mfn., newly arrived
(to, acc.); nava, acirapabbajita + (followed by acc.
imaṁ dhammavinayaṁ): MN I 457,32; SN III 91,16;
AN III 138,12; Vin I 40,20 ≠ Dhp-a I 92,11; Th-a
ad Th 552 (= 'ajjatana'); °-vadhukā-samena cetasā
viharissāmi, with the same mind as a newly arrived
daughter-in-law, AN II 78,34 (the simile styled adhunâ-
gata-vadhukôpammaṁ, Mp);

— °-âbhisittaadhunā-âbhisitta, mfn.,
just anointed (king, rajjena), DN II 210,24 (= sam-
pati abhisitto, Sv); 227,2; — adhun'-utthita, mfn.,
just arisen; Mil 155,10 (~ena Mārena); — adhunū-
papanna, mfn., recently reborn (in, acc); pl. ~â,
DN II 208,1 ≠ 221,9 (so read with v. l. 221, n. 3
for adhunuppannā).

entry.sense:
f., 'not a place of honour i. e. a mean or
unprofitable work; loc. ~āyaṁ niyuñjati, Ja IV 241,3*
(= saddhādhura-sīladhura-paññādhuresu a-yojetvā
a-yoge niyuñjati, Ct.), quoted Pj I 127,27*.
= addhuva, q. v.

mfn., without (seasoning by means
of) fumigation; Ja III 144,1 (aloṇena ~ena udakena
sinna-pannena, cf. ib. 21 and a-lona-dhūpana, Ja IV
236,27). ' a-dhūpana

ind. [sa. adhas], (a) below, down, down-
wards (opp. uddhaṁ); Abh 1156; with gen. or in
comp.s according to Mogg III 8 (= Pay: adho-
Gaṅgaṁ or adho Gaṅgāya; cf. adho-Gaṅgaṁ below);
uddhaṁ kātuṁ na pana adho (scil. telaṁ), Ud 14,10
(= heṭṭhā, Ud-a); ~ gaccha bho sappi-tela, SN
adhouddham adho ācamayamāno, Mil 152,17 (cf. adho-
virecana); gantā so nirayaṁ ~, Ja V 267,19*; 270,12*
(cf. 273,12'); patanti nirayaṁ ~, Ja VI 224,24*;
~ kesamatthakā (abl. downwards from) Thī 33 ≠ DN
II 293,11. (= kesaggato hetthā, Vism 240,30) =
MN I 57,14 = III 90,13 = Vibh 193,18 (Vibh-a
= Vism); akkhakato paṭṭhāya ~, Sp (III) 549,9 ad
Vin III 129,36'(= 'adli'-akkhakaṁ'); akkhakānaṁ ~,
Sp ad Vin IV 214,18' (do.); — (b) (a) denoting one
of the ten dimensions (disā), viz. nadir (uddhaṁ de-
noting zenith), or (β) opp. to uddhaṁ and tiriyaṁ:
Sn 1122 (disā catasso, vidisā catasso, uddhaṁ adho,
dasa disatā imāyo); SN I 122,17* (uddham adho ca
tiriyaṁ (ca)); 122,1 = III 124,4 (gacchati purimaṁ
disaṁ, etc.); Ud-a 178,20 (puratthimā disā +); in
connection with the appamañña exercises: uddhaṁ
adho tiriyaṁ sabbadhi . . . mettā-sahagatena cetasā
. . . pharitvā, DN II 186,30 = MN II 76,9 = SN V
115,29 (quoted Vism 308,1, - heṭṭhā, ib. 23) ≠ DN
I 153,20; paṭhavīkasiṇaṁ eko sañjānāti uddhaṁ
adho tiriyaṁ advayaṁ appamāṇaṁ, DN III 268,21
(= heṭṭhā bhūmitalâbhimukhaṁ, Sv = Vism 176,31)
= AN V 60,17; uddhaṁ ~ ca tiriyañ câpi majjhe,
Sn 537 = 1055 = 1068 = 1103; yathā ~ tathā
uddhaṁ, SN V 263,23*; 277,10*; 281,26*; Sn 150
= Khp IX-8 -(uddhaṁ ~ ca tiriyañ ca; = heṭṭhā,
and metaph, tena kāmabhavaṁ gaṇhāti, Pj); uddhaṁ
~ ca sabbadhi vippamutto, released from . . ., Ud
74,16* (Ud-a gives two explanations: (1) = kāma-
dhātuyā, (2) — atītakālagahanaṁ, cf. Pj II 434,8:
adho ti anāgataṁ!). — Cf. adhakkhaka, adhak-
khandha, adhagga above and comp.s below.

mfn., descending; ~ā vātā, Ps
II 228,23 = Vibh-a 70,22 (= 'adhogamā vātā').

mfn. (pp. of next), turned down,
upside down; Bv II 119, quoted Ja I 20,16* (kumbho
sampuṇṇo . . . ~o vamate udakaṁ nissesaṁ).

Npr. of a village in Ceyton; Mhv
LXX 171 (in the comp. Uddhâdhok[ū/u]ra; Ed. °-kuraṁ-
gāmesu).

n., despising; Sadd 530,6 (=
'avakkhepo').

ind., downwards the river Ganges
(cf. Mogg III 8), Ja II 329,19 (gatvā); III 52,15
(bhassi). — adho-Gaṅgāya, ind., downstream on the
G., Ja II 283,13 (opp. uddha-Gaṅgāya); V 3,1.

mfn. (or two words (?), cf. sa. ts.),
gone by, passed; ito māsaṁ ~aṁ, Ja VI 187,30* ( =
ito heṭṭhā māsâtikkantaṁ, Ct.); 188,28*.

f. [ts.], downward (or transversal)
movement; giving the sense of √tir, Sadd II 756 [=
431,32] (Mmd 640); cf. tiracchāna.

mfn. [ts.], going downwards; Abh 38
(m. one among the winds in the body); MN I 188,29 (~ā
vātā, opp. uddhaṁgamā vātā; Ps — Vibh-a 70,22)
= Vibh 84,9; SN II 87,27 ([rukkha-]mūlāni ~āni
yāni ca tiriyaṁ-gamāni).

mfn., leading downwards (i. e.
to hell); ~eṇa kammena, Ja V 273,12'.

ind. (adho + gala), down the
throat; Pv-a 104,21 (udakaṁ . . . ~ na otiṇṇaṁ; Ed.
misprint udhogalaṁ).

mfn. [ts.], going downwards:
(a) bound downstream; acc f. ~iniṁ (nāvaṁ), Vin
IV 64,32**; 65,20**, 31' (= ojavanikā; (opp. uddhaṁ-
adho-gamin(b) sinking, about to sink; f. °-gāmī [cf. an-ati-
māni(n)], SN IV 313,30 (sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā) =
V 370,10.

mfn.; m. ~ī, Sadd 423,20 (a
literal rendering of 'ocarako' (q. v.), but see Sp (II)
365,14).

ind. (cf. sa. adho-jānu),
below the knee-cap; ubbhakkhakaṁ +, Vin III 130,5'
(= jānu-maṇḍalato paṭṭhāya adho, Sp); IV 221,12'
(= jānu-maṇdalānaṁ heṭṭhā, Sp).

f. [sa. adho-jihvikā], the uvula;
MTD.

mfn. [sa. adhah-sthha√ standing
below (said of a final consonant); Kacc 10 (see Franke,
Gesch. u. Kritik d. Pāli-Gramm. p. 9 [: Sadd 611,5]).

mfn., unwashed; Vin II 116,23 (~ehi
pādehi kaṭhinaṁ akkamanti); [a-kakkase a-pharuse
~e satthake, Ap 309,5, read with Ce sudhote, cf. Ja
III 282,13*].

/. [sa. adho-diç], the lower region,
the nadir; Vism 308,22.

ind. [ts.], below the navel; + ubbha-
jānumaṇḍalaṁ, Vin IV 172,15'(= nābhiyā heṭṭhā, Sp).

n., = adho-virecana (q. v.),
Sv I 98,10.

n., falling down; Dhātup 455 ( =
2√bhas). Cf. adho-pāta.

m. [sa. adhah-prastara], a bed-
cloth; MTD.

m. [sa. adhaṇ-pāta], falling down;
Dhātum 695 (= ybhas). Cf. adho-patana.

m., designation of a thera; Ap
128,17—129,1].. — do. ib. 112,12-28 (where EeCe have
Avopupphiya).

m., [ts.], (a) 'the lower part' (of the
body), the anus; instr. ~ena nikkhamati, Ja VI
110,13'; Dhp-a I 126,10; 148,14; abl. ~ā nikkhamati,
MN I 423,10; III 186,8; AN IV 132,1. Cf. adho-
magga. — (b) the interior part; Abh 1166 (the sense
of prp. ni in ni-vāsana as opp. to pārupana; per-
adho-bhāga

mfn., belonging to what is lower,
or to a lower group (cf. adhobhāga); °-saṁyojanāni,
Abhidh-av 129,15 (scil. sakkāya-diṭṭhi, etc.).

m., the being below or down; Abh
1173 (giving the sense of prp. ava; do. Sadd 882,15;
Pay fol. gū v. 5, e.g. avakkhitta-cakkhu); Abh 1174
(the sense of prp. anu).

mfn., leading down-
wards (i. e. to lower existences); akusalā dhammā . . .
~ā, MN I 44,33 (opp. upari-bhāvaṁ-gamanīyā).

n. [ts.], the lower world, the
Nāga-world; Abh 649 (= pātāla).

m., the anus; Ja V 274,25' (~âdīhi
pavisitvā mukhâdīhi nikkhamanti). Cf. adho-bhāga.

mfn. [ts.], with the face downwards
(without looking up), with the mouth (or opening)
turned downwards; tuṇhībhūto . . . ~o pajjhāyanto
appatibhāno, SN I 124,12 ≠ DN III 53,22 (= hetthā-
mukho, Sv); MN I 132,29; 234,2; 258,29; AN I láè,29
adho-mukhaDN III 57,13; patta-kkhandhā ~ā madhuraka-jātā
jhāyanti, MN I 334,17; dukkhī dummano patta-
kkhandho ~o, etc., AN III 57,10; ~o bhuñjasi, SN
III 238,29; symbol, meaning explained ib. 239,14-17
(Spk); ~o bhunjat'eva, Dhp-a I 401,1; — pl. ~ā
(hayā), Vv 137 (= heṭṭhāmukhā . . . devalokato
orohanavasena, Vv-a); uddhavaṇṭā ~ā, Ap 124,15;
niruttarā +, Sadd 96,14; Ps III 228,10 (parissāva-
naṁ ~aṁ karotha); ~aṁ katvā, Thī-a 34,29 ( =
'nikujjiya', cf. Sadd 349,27);
entry.re:
— °-mukhamadho-mukha-mukham, ind.,
~aṁ ṭhapita-udakaghaṭā, As 15,21; comp. °a-ṭha-
pitā suvaṇṇa-paṭimā, Ps III 704,13. — Ifc. v. an-°.

entry.sense:
ind., towards the lee side; Ja III
233,3 (~ yāhi; opp. upari-vātaṁ).

n., the lee side; Ja V 39,1
(~e ṭhitā; opp. upari-vāta-passe).

ind., on the lee side (cf. adho-vātaṁ);
Ja I 489,26 (~ gantvā); III 85,2 (~ ṭhatvā); 308,1
(do.); Ja IV 430,27 (~ assamo; opp. uparivāte); Ja
V 138,22 (isīnaṁ ~ nisinnaṁ).

mfn. [from dhovati; see Pāṇ IV
4,20; Sadd 866,20, but cf. Pischel §602], which has
no need of cleansing in water; ~aṁ vatthakotiyaṁ
(°ikaṁ), DīpXII 2 = XVII 84 (quoted Sp I 75,17*)
≠ ~aṁ vatthakoṭiṁ, Mhv XI 29 (Mhv-ṭ ≠ Sp-ṭ
below); ~aṁ dussayugaṁ, Sp I 75,11 (= kiliṭṭhe
a-dhovimagacchantaṁ, Sp-ṭ).

n., purging, purgation; a purga-
tive; DN I 12,7 (virecanaṁ uddha-virecanaṁ ~aṁ;
= adhonīharaṇaṁ, Sv); MN I 511,16 (uddha-vire-
canaṁ+); As 404,11 (uddhavirecana-adhovirecanâ-
dīhi kilamati).
aor., v. dhunāti.

mfn. [sa. adhahiciras], with the head
downwards; ~o olambanto, Ja VI 306,17'; taṁ uddha-
pādaṁ ~aṁ katvā, Ja IV 194,2; uddha(ṁ)pādaṁ
~aṁ ṭhapetvā, MN III 166,29 — 183,9; AN I 141,20
adho-sira(cf. 305,27). — adho-siram, ind.; dhove pāde ~aṁ,
with bowed head, Ja VI 298,1* (= siraṁ adho-katvā,
Ct.). — Cf. avaṁ-sira.

mfn. = adho-sira; Ap 41,23 (panna-
gaṁ so gahetvāna ~aṁ) = Th-a 364,29* (Ce); Ja I
233,6 (~o patamāno).

mfn. = prec; ~aṁ olambetvā,
Ja V 472,5; ~ā patanti, Ja V 275,14'. Cf. adhak-
khandha.

[ts.[ negative prefix before vowels = 3a-
(q. v.); sometimes n' (— na) may be substituted: neka
[sa. naika] = an-eka; combined with 3a- we have an-a-
(see below).

√to breathe, to live: pāṇane, Dhātup 176 =
Dhātum 256 = Sadd II 537 [= 309,31] (cf. sa-Dhātup
24,62); see anati, pr. 3 sg. Cf. ud-āna, ud-āneti.

[ts.], the negative prefix doubled, see 3a-
(8—9); cf. also Vin Trsl. II 113 n. 4 and for biblio-
graphy Wackernagel, Altindische Gramm. II 1 § 32b.

base of the pron, ayaṁ (q. v.) in instr.
anena.
n. [sa. anas], a cart; Abh 373.

mfn., not unwilling; °-rūpa, mfn.
id.; pl. ~ā, Ja IV 33,9* (opp. akāmako, ib.uf; Ct.).

n., or mfn, not treading upon;
Dhp-a III 136,10 (°bhāva, m. abstr.).

m., not abusing; Ap 264,15 (~ass'
idaṁ phalaṁ).

mfn., not gambling, not playing at
dice; acc. pl. ~e (amacce), ' Ja V 116,22*; 117,31'.
Cf. 2akkha.

mfn., not told, not described; ~aṁ
kusaiaṁ, MN I 331,8 (cf. 503,5 v. l.); ~assa mag-
gassa akkhātā, SN I 191,2 — III 66,17; Nidd I
178,5 (Nidd-a); Ap 570,6 (~aṁ ca akkhāsi); ~aṁ
dhanaṁ, Sv (II) 385,9. — n. 'the undescribable' i. e.
nibbāna; Dhp 218 (chandajāto ~e; = nibbāne,
an-akkhāta

n., not telling or describing; MN I
503,5 (v. l. anakkhātaṁ; ~aṁ yeva akāsi, you made
it unnecessary to be told, i. e. you anticipated me).

mfn. [sa. an-akṣika], eyeless, blind;
°-kāla, m., a period of blindness; Dhp-a I 11,3.

n., not a town, i. e. deserted, depopu-
lated (see 3a-2); nagaraṁ ~aṁ karissāmi, Dhp-a IV
153,5; pl. nagarā pi ~ā honti, AN I 160,1.

mfn. [ts.], generally spelt an-āgāra
cf. sa. āgāra), houseless; m. a houseless ascetic; ~o,
Sn 639 = Dhp 415; Sn 640 = Dhp 416; Ja II
422,26* = III 32,10*, 13*; Ps I 111,18 (-ă-); gen. ~assa
te sato, Ja III 214,3*; adhanassa ~assa bhikkhuno,
Ja V 252,19* foll. (Ct.); pl. ~ā, It 111,19* (opp.
an-agāra292,2*); 99,26*; ~ā agārino, Ja V 99,28* (Ct.);
Nidd-a (E*) 1177,27 ad Nidd I 58,13; instr, pl. ~ehi
(asaṁsaṭṭhaṁ gahaṭthehi +), Sn 628 = Dhp 404 ≠
Th 581; gen. pl. ~āna(ṁ), SN I 236,13*,1 5*; — f. an-
ăgārā (aleṇā+), Pv 119 (= anāvāsā, Pv-a); — n.
~aṁ, 'not a house', the state of an ascetic; agărā
an-ăgāram eti, Sn 376 (/. e. pabbajati, Pj).
entry.re:
— °-munian-agāra-muni,
m., an ascetic, a hermit sage; pl. ~ayo, Nidd I 58,8
foll. (Nidd-a (Ee) I 177,20: °-mimino).

entry.sense:
(or an-āgāri(n)), m(fn.) = an-
agāra; Ap 424,31 (agārā abhinikkhamma an-āgārī
bhavissati) = Th-a Ce 294,23*.

(or an-āgārika), m. = prec; instr.
~ena, As 373,13 (anā°); gen. ~assa, Dhp-a I 239,4
(ana°); agārikânagārika-°, Ja III 453,18'. — Cf. an-
ăgāriya.
entry.re:
— °-mittaan-agārika-mitta, m., an ascetic friend; Nidd II
228,1.

— °-ratanaan-agārika-ratana, n., 'a jewel among ascetics',
an-agārikaan-āgārika,(agārika-vibhūsā +); ib. n (spelt anagāriya°; =
patta-maṇḍanâdi).

entry.sense:
(or anāgāriya), n. (cf. sa. ana-
gārikā), the houseless life (of an ascetic); acc. ~aṁ,
frequently in the phrase agārasmā ~aṁ (with pabba-
jati, etc., see agāra), Sn p. 16,1 (Pj II 157,29: n'atthi
ettha agāriyan ti ~aṁ, pabbajjay'etaṁ adhivaca-
naṁ); Sn 274; Ud 11,17; It 75,1; Pp 57,16 (anā°);
Vin I 77,37; DN II 42,23; 153,5; III 145,16; MN I
16,21, etc.; Mil 420,15; — mfn. = anagārika, Ps I
168,23; Pj II 73,12.
entry.re:
— °-paṭipatti-duggatian-agāriya-paṭipatti-duggati, f., mis-
an-agāriyaanāgāriyaAnecdota Pālica 63,1).

— °-munian-agāriya-muni, m., a hermit sage;
Ja I 109,26 (opp. agāriya-muni); Dhp-a I 375,1 (anā°).

entry.sense:
mfn., who has adopted a
houseless life; Sn 700 (gen. ~assa, = anagāriyaṁ
upetassa, Pj); SN I 48,14* (Spk); Ja III 390,1* (anā°).

m. (an-agāra + upanis-
saya), the necessaries of life of an ascetic; Thī 349
(scil. uttiṭṭha-piṇḍo, uñcho, paṁsukūlaṁ; = an-
āgārānaṁ pabbajitānaṁ . . . jīvita-parikkhāro, Thī-a
242,14).

mfn. (cf. 1agga), without beginning (or
end), endless; Vin II 95,26 (~āni ... bhassāni; =
aparimāṇāni ito c'ito ca vacanāni, Sp; Oldenberg's
Ms. of Sp reads anantāni for anaggāni) ≠ 305,5.
[w. r. for an-aggi-pakkika.]

m. Npr. of an ascetic, (an-agga
+ pāka), Mp I 252,11 (tassa pi ten' eva kāraṇena ~o
ti nāmaṁ jātaṁ, appamāṇa-pāko ti attho, i. e.
cooking to excess). Anaggapāka

mfn., not a first class one, or
not consisting of first class members; f. ~vatī parisā,
AN I 71,1 fol.. (opp. aggavatī parisā). an-agga-vat

mfn., not kept back (niggardly);
cattaṁ muttañ ca ~aṁ, AN III 50,21* (Ee anugga-
hītaṁ; Mp: an-apekkhacittatāya na aggahītan ti
~aṁ); cf. aggahitatta, n.
entry.re:
— °-cittaan-aggahīta-citta, mfn., liberal-
minded, AN III 172,10 (w. r. anuggahita-°).

entry.sense:
m. pl. ~ī, a class of ascetics (cf. an-
aggi-pakkika); Ap 18,23 = Th-a II 98,5* (Ce) (for
*an-aggi-pākī in aggipākī anaggl ca; as to brachy-
logy see Maitreya-samiti p. 192,14-16; A Hind Gr. II 1
§ 11 cβ; cf. anuppatta-rūpa below and Ap 308,25).

mfn. (cf. sa. pakva); not cooked
on the fire; n. ~aṁ, uncooked food; Ja IV 8,13 (danta-
musaliko hutvā ~am eva khādati).

m. (from prec); pl. ~ā, a
class of ascetics (cf. an-aggi); Pj II 295,9 (saputta-
bhariyā+); ib. 18 (~ā ti agginā apakkaṁ patta-
phalâdiṁ khāditvā yāpentā); Sv I 270,21; 271,19
(Ee in both places anaggapakkhikā; Sv-pṭ: aggi-
pakkena jīvantī ti aggipakkikā; na aggipakkikā an-
an-aggi-pakkika

mfn. [sa. an-argha, an-arghya],
priceless, invaluable; Ja I 126,2 (rajjaṁ ~aṁ); 253,6
(manto ~o, Ed. aggho); III 276,21 (°-manto); Dhp-a
III 120,16 (n.pl. ~āni); 186,3 (do.); IV 205,16 (~aṁ
maṇiratanaṁ); 213,21 (do.); Pj II 577,26 (pl.~ā); Sv
(II) 654,13 (cattāri ~āni).
entry.re:
— °-kāraṇaan-aggha-kāraṇa, n., the reason
for its not being thus valued; Ja IV 66,21 (Cks perhaps
better an-agghana[ṁ]-kāraṇaṁ; cf. ib. 66,9*).

entry.sense:
mfn. (an + grd. of agghati) =
anaggha; Mil 192,3 (atuliyo appamāṇo + ~o).

mfn. [ts.], sinless, blameless, pure;
see below s. v. anigha (SN I 54,26-27*).

n., not being a member (of one's own),
said of bad relatives; pl. (attraction ) ~ā va hi te bālā
(so read for anaṅgavā hi [ti, Bd], Tr.), Ja VI 297,14*
(Ct: ime dussīlā, tasmā aṅga-samā na honti).
m. Npr., see Anaṅga-bhaṅga.

mfn. (cf. 2aṅgaṇa), free from dirt
(depravity), pure, sinless; maggaṁ virajaṁ ~aṁ,
Vin I 294,17*; Sn 517 (vigata-rajam ~aṁ visuddhaṁ;
Pj); Dhp 236 (niddhanta-malo ~o; = nikkileso,
an-aṅgaṇasino, Th 652 = 1001 = SN I 205,3* = Ja III 309,10*
(= niddosassa, Ct.); suddhassa posassa ~assa, Sn 662
(Pj) = Dhp 125 = SN I 13,14* = 164,17* = Ja III
203,16* (Ct.), quoted Pv-a 116,14*; niṭṭhaṁgato +,
Dhp 351; samāpattisukhaṁ ~aṁ, Ja I 473,14* (quoted
Mp I 130,28*; = niddosaṁ, Ct.); evaṁ samāhite citte
parisuddhe pariyodāte ~e, Vin III 4,18 (Sp) = DN I
76,14,30 = 80,20 = MN I 22,9 foll. = 248,19
— 347,24 foll. = 522,1 = 1138,16 = AN II 211,11 -
Nidd I 280,12 (Nidd-a) = Pp 60,1 (cf. Vism 377,2 *
Nett 87,22 foll.); acc f. ~aṁ, Thī 368-9.

n. = Jhānasodhana-j° (Ja
I 473; named after the last word in the gāthā), Mp I
130,29.

n. abstr. of an-aṅgaṇa; Sp I
157,16; Nidd-a ad Nidd I 280,12; Vism 377,2.

n. = MN (ch. 5) 124—32;
referred to Ps (Ee) II 246,3; (Se) III 47,1; Vism 377,28.

m., the victory over Anaṅga,
i. e. Mara, Jināl 52* (cf. sa. An-aṅga = Kama).
[Ja VI 297,14*, see an-aṅga].
mfn., without tail; Ja III 335,12*.

f., not absolute purity;
Nidd I 98,14 (+ saṁsāra-suddhi, akiriya-suddhi).

mfn. [ts.], turbid; Abh 669 (= <ka-
lusa, āvila').

mfn. [sa. an-āçcarya], 1. lit. 'not
wonderful', i. e. appearing quite naturally or spon-
taneously; n. ~aṁ, Ja III 406,20; IV 153,1:1; VI
220,24; Ps II 65,19; Dhp-a II 121,19 (v. l. acchariyaṁ);
~aṁ etaṁ, Ja III 70,12'; ~aṁ etaṁ daharānaṁ, Pj
an-acchariyabhūto kālaṁ kareyya), DN II 93,11 = SN V 359,15;
cf. Vin II 17,31; SN IV 301,21; Ja VI 255,20 ; Dhp-a
III 212,20; Pj I 150,27; — ~aṁ . . . ārocenti (indie,
without yaṁ), AN IV 211,13 (Mp); 215,1 foll.; ~aṁ
... pasīdeyya (pot. without yaṁ), MN III 131,29;
~aṁ etaṁ yaṁ . . . jānāti, Ps I 122,18; — 2. in
the formula anacchariya . . . assutapubba it might be
suspected of being an old error for *an-ācariya (cf.
an-ācariyaka) = what is not received from one's
teacher (cf. Tuneld, Recherches p. 146,32); Morris
(Acad. 8/7 82 p. 33) connects it with iaccharā and
translates 'extemporaneous'; DN Trsl. II p. 30 n. 2
'instantaneous'; Franke (DN Auswahl p. 196) 'nicht
weiter auffāllig'; Bu. constantly explains by anu-
acchariya (ɔ: anu anu acchariya, Vjb ad Vin I 5,6);
pt ad DN II 36,13 (= Sp-ṭ ad Vin I 5,6) suggests: an°
in the sense of vuddhi, see 3a-): api 'ssu Bhagavantaṁ
imā ~ā gāthāyo paṭibhaṁsu pubbe assuta-pubbā,
Vin I 5,6 (= anu-acchariyā, Sp) = SN I 136,19 (= do.,
Sp) ≠ DN II 36,13 (=do. Sv); 38,1 ≠ MN I 168,3 (Ps
= Spk); api 'ssu maṁ . . . tisso upamā paṭibhamsu
~ā pubbe assuta-pubbā, MN I 240,30 (quoted Kacc-v
308) ≠ 1193,22 ≠ III 131,33 (cf. anacchariyam,
ind. ib. 131,29).

mfn. [an-adyatana], not referring
to to-day; loc. n. ~e, Mogg VI 5 (giving the endings
of the imperfect tense; cf. hiyyattanī, Kacc 429).

m. [cf. sa. an-ārjava, n.] lack of
honesty; Vibh 359,30 (— an-ujutâkāro, Vibh-a).
— °-tā, f. abstr. (from a possible an-ajjava, mfn.), ib.
(= an-ujubhāvo, Vibh-a).

mfn., who does not belong
to oneself, strange; voc. f. ~e, Ps III 319,12 (ad MN II
108,1: 'cara pi re' ti apehi amhākaṁ pare, ~e ti attho).

m., not transgressing; Nett 44,15
(see ajjhācāra); loc. ~e, Mil 127,24. — mfn., Sv (III)
913,1 (~ acalo asampavedhī).

f., non-transgression; Dhs 299
foll. (ārati+; As 219,1) ≠ Vibh 285,11.

mfn. (confounded with an-
ajjhopanna, q. v.), 1. (in active sense, with acc.) who
has not committed (offence); Vin III 166,12 (pārājikaṁ
dhammaṁ ~o); — 2. (passive) which has not been
committed; Vin I 103,28 (~ā vā āpatti āpajjitvā vā
an-ajjhāpanna

m., one who does not study, or
not skilled in (the Vedas); ~o anupanīto, MN II 154,1.

mfn., not overgrown, not domin-
ated (by, instr.); — °-tta, n. abstr., Vism 156,21.

mfn., not overgrowing; SN V 97,1
(cetaso ~; anāvaraṇa, anīvaraṇa +).

mfn., not inhabited, not occupied;
Vin II 210,32 (~aṁ, scil. senāsanaṁ); MN I 353,21
(santhāgāraṁ) = SN IV 182,16 (Ee °vuṭṭhaṁ); MN
II 91,1 (pāsādo); Pj II 566,26 (ṭhānaṁ; = 'anosi-
tam'). — °-ka, mfn., id., Sp (II) 349,18; Vin-vn 387. an-ajjhāvuttha

mfn. (cf. ajjhesati), not asked, not
requested; Vin I 113,5 (saṁgha-majjhe ~ā dhammaṁ
bhāsanti); Ps III 453,1 (~o dhammaṁ deseti); Nidd
I 230,1 (an-āpucchaṁ vā ~o vā dhammaṁ bhaṇati;
= an-āṇatto an-āyācito ca, Nidd-a); [Pv 86 (an-
ijjhiṭṭha v. l. for an-abbhita)].

mfn. = prec; Nidd I 68,9 (a-
puṭṭho + ; = 'anānupuṭṭho'; = an-āṇāpito, Nidd-a).

n. (or mfn.) (cf. ajjhottha-
rati), the not-overwhelming; As 51,15 (°-bhāvena).

mfn. (often confounded with
an-ajjhāpanna, see ajjhāpanna and ajjhopanna), not
addicted to; in the formula a-gathita, a-mucchita + :
DN III 46,28 (= taṇhāya an-otthaṭo a-pariyonaddho,
Sv), etc., see s. v. a-gathita. an-ajjhopanna
ind., neg. of ajjhosāya (q. v.).

mfn., not anointed, slovenly; + aman-
ḍita, Ja III 236,9'; IV 387,20'; VI 583,32'; Mil
163,24; Ps III 57,13.
entry.re:
— °-kāḷakaṇṇi(n)an-añjita-kāḷakaṇṇi(n) (q. v.), Ps III
58,8 (v. l. C anañjana-k°).

— °-'kkhaan-añjita-'kkha, mfn. (cf.
*akkha), with not anointed eyes; Ja IV 300,3' (cf.
rummakkha-rūpa).

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. an-anya], (a) no other; not
different, identical (as the negative complement of
pron, of identity (ayam eva, etc.), or of numerals (dve
va, etc. cf. eko adutiyo); m. ~o, Ja II 120,10*-n*;
f. pl. ~ā, Sn p. 106,9 — DN I 88,32 = II 16,13 (Sv);
≠ Mil 164,10; n. ~aṁ, Vin IV 43,10** (etad eva pac-
cayaṁ karitvā ~aṁ; 43,20') ≠ 93,18** ≠ 149,11**
≠ 150,21**); MN I 256,20 (tad-ev'idaṁ viññāṇam
an-aññanymous words

n. (abstr. of an-añña), the being the
same; Abhidh-av 85,26 (abl. ~ā).

mfn. (an + aññathā), 'being not
otherwise', i. e. true; n. pl. cattar'imani tathāni avita-
thāni ~āni, SN V 430,22 - Paṭis II 104,3 (quoted
Ps 149,16); Ud-a 141,1; 145,12; m. pl. ~ā, DN III
273,16 foll. (ime dasa [vīsati, etc.] dhammā bhūtā
an-aññathaUd-a 135,5.
entry.re:
— °-tāan-aññatha-tā, f. abstr.; SN II 26,5 (tathatá
avitathatā +, quoted Vism 518,16; Spk).

— °-vādi(n)an-aññatha-vādi(n),
mfn., speaking the truth; m. ~ī, Kv 65,5 (saccavādī + ).

entry.sense:
ind., 'not otherwise', true; MN II
170,32 (tañ ca hoti bhūtaṁ tacchaṁ ~; opp. musā).
— °-bhāvi(n), mfn., which cannot pass over into
another state; "Vin I 36,28* (acc. °bhāviṁ anaññaney-
yaṁ, scil. padaṁ santaṁ).

mfn., not compliant (sa.
vidheya) to others (as a faithful wife, metaph, of the
earth as the kings possession); f. ~ā (paṭhavī), Ja IV
111,27* (= an-aññâdhīnā, Ct.); yā sīlavatī ~ă, Ja VI
379,30* (= kilesavasena aññena a-gahetabbā, Ct.).

n.(pl.), cattāri ~āni, desig-
nation of four pācittiya-rules (q. v.), containing the
formula etad eva paccayaṁ karitvā anaññaṁ (cf.
an-añña above), viz. Pāc. XVI, XLII, LXXVII,
LXXVIII, Vin V 127,23 (Sp; in the uddāna 128,20*:
an-aññā); 146,26.

f. [sa. an-anya-pūrvā], a virgin,
MTD.

sense.hi:
mfn., not supporting others,
said of the houseless ascetic, who maintains no family
an-anna-posinSn 65 (Pj, Nidd) = Ap 11,28; akiñcano bhikkhu ~ī,
SN I 141,19* (Spk); acc. °-posiṁ aññātaṁ dantaṁ
sāre patiṭṭhitaṁ, Ud 4,27* (Ud-a); gen. °-posino
(attabharassa +), Ud 30,15* = 31,19* (Ud-a; quoted
Vism 67,19*).

entry.sense:
n., identity as to form; Sadd
292,5.

mfn., not obtainable by others;
Childers from Attanagalu-vihāra-vaṁsa 190.

mfn., not adhering to the doctrine
of others, free from heresies; Dīp IV 24 (~o sārattho
saddhammam-anurakkhano).

mfn., having no other teacher;
acc. ~aṁ tīhi saraṇa-gamanehi saraṇaṁ gataṁ,
Ud-a 288,17; Sp I 173,18 = SvI 236,1'i (cf. añña-
sattha(r)).

mfn., not taking refuge with
others; attadīpa, attasarana +, DN II 100,21 ≠ DN
III 58,7 (Sv) = 77,4 = SN III 42,8 (Spk) = V 163,11;
Ud-a 334,16.

mfn., not being in com-
mon with others; Pj II 231,25 (anugāmika +); Ud-a
141,35; 144,28.
entry.re:
— °-dīpanīgāthāan-añña-sādhāraṇa-dīpanīgāthā, f. pl., verses
elucidating that; Jināl 7—12.

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. an-ājñāta, cf. 2aññāta],
unknown; animittam ~aṁ maccānaṁ idha jīvitaṁ,
Sn 574 (Pj; quoted Ja IV 151,8 = Dhp-a I 355,1);
~aṁ mayā n'atthi, Ap 43,10; ~e aññātamānī, AN
III 175,14 (Mp); Dhs 296 (dhammānaṁ ~ānaṁ; As
218,9).
entry.re:
— °-ññassāmîtindriyaan-aññāta-ññassāmîtindriya, n. (an-aññāta +
ñassāmi + iti + indriya), the mental faculty of re-
an-aññāta+ aññindriyaṁ aññātāvindriγaṁ, It 53,3 (It-a ) =
SN V 204,19 (Spk) ≠ DN III 219,9 (Sv); bāvīsat'
indriyāni: cakkhundriyaṁ +, Pp 2,10 = Vibh 122,8
foll. (quoted Vism 491,11; Ps 1147,28; Vibh-a) =
Yam II 61,16; — Dhs 277, 296 (As 216,15; 221,14);
Abhidh-s 33,25; Nett 15,2; 54,6; 60,5; 191,13.

entry.sense:
mfn. (an-añña + adhīna), not
subject to others; f. ~ā, Ja IV 112,19' (= 'anañña-
dheyyā').

neg. abs. (from ājānāti), not having
known; Vin IV 231,32** (= ajānitvā, ib. 232,6'; Sp).

mfn., free from sham; Ja II 421,21* (cf.
ib. 422,12').

mfn. [sa. a-naṣṭa], not lost, unimpaired;
Vin III 251,36 (~e [scil. bhesajje] naṭṭha-saññī).

mfn. [sa. an-asthika, cf. 2aṭṭhi (2)],
without kernels; Nidd-a II 109,18 ad Nidd I 372,1
(~ehi kadalī-phalehi kata-pānam, = 'moca-pānaṁ').

f., the not acting steadfastly
(cf. 1aṭṭhita); asakkacca-kiriyatā asātacca-kiriyatā +,
Vibh 350,25 (v. l. aniṭṭhita-k°), quoted Pj I 143,21
(v.ll. aniṭṭhita-k°, anavaṭṭhita-k°).
[m. [sa. anaḍ-uh], a bull, MTD (cf. 3ana)].

(or an-iddha?), mfn. (cf. 2aḍḍña),
poor; Ap 565,30 (duggate adhane 'naḍḍhe, scil. seṭṭhi-
kule, v. l. 'niddhe).

mfn. [sa. an-ṛṇa; opp. sâṇa, cf. Tr.
notes p. 76 & iṇa, ānaṇya], free from debt (also from
sin), independent (of, gen.); Th 138 (pl. ~ā dāni te
[scil. Kama] mayaṁ); 789 (~o bhuñjāmi bhojanaṁ);
882 (do.) = MN II 105,16* (Ps: aniṇo ti pi pāṭho);
an-aṇadâdi-iṇaṁ pahāya ~o hutvā); 110 (~ā . . . raṭṭha-
piṇḍaṁ abhuñji 'haṁ; = niddosā apagata-kilesā,
Thī-a); Vin I 93,30 (~o, see ib. 76,8-19); Vin I 6,3*
= DN II 39,16* (voc. ~a; Sv (II) 471,6, misprint
aneno) = MN I 169,2* (Ps) = SN I 137,32* =
234,3* ≠ Mvu III 315,14* foll.; Ja VI 18,17*-18* (~o
ehi sārathi, ~assa hi pabbajjā, cf. Vin I 76,18; 93,30);
Ja VI 36,1* (~o ñātinaṁ hoti; = ~o hoti agārayho,
Ct); Mhv XLVII 28 (~o so mam' ajjato).
entry.re:
— °-sukhaan-aṇa-sukha,
n., the happiness of independence; AN II 69,11-26
(atthisukhaṁ +; Mp); 70,8* (metre favours v. l. ăn-
aṇya-sukhaṁ (ñatvāna); or a split comp. *anaṇa(ṁ)
sukhaṁ?).

entry.sense:
mfn. [ts], 'not bent', without inclination
(see nati, f.); nibbanatho ~o, SN I 186,26* (= taṇhā-
nati-rahito, Spk) — Th 1214 (reading nibbanathā
avanatho; Th-a: katthaci pi nandiyā (o: natiyā)
abhāvato avanatho (ɔ: anato)). — n. ~aṁ, Ud 80,19*
(duddasaṁ ~aṁ nāma, na hi saccaṁ su-dassanaṁ,
paṭividdhā taṇhā jānato, passato n'atthi kiñcanaṁ);
Ud-a 393,10-16 explains a-nataṁ = a+ natā: rūpā-
disu . . . namanato taṇhā natā nāma, n'atthi ettha
natā ti anataṁ, and continues: Nibbānan ti attho
[omitted in Ee], giving also the (unmetrical) v. r.
an-antaṁ (w. r. an-attaṁ) = anta-virahitaṁ (w. r.
atta-v°) . . . amatan ti attho; keci pana anantan (Ee
w. r. anatan) ti padassa appamāṇan ti atthaṁ vadanti.
Tr. corrects into amataṁ; anataṁ might possibly
represent sa. an-ṛtaṁ (opposed to saccam, cf. next);
cf. SN IV 368,24 (P. I.). — [°-īsa, mfn. w. r. for ānata-
īsa, Ja ¥1253,21'.]

n. [sa. an-ṛta-bhāṣana], speaking
untruth; = √kund, Sadd II 1479. [= 542,12],

pr. 3 sg. [√an; sa. aniti], to breathe, live;
3 pl. ~anti = balanti, etymology of bālā, Pj I 124,23.

mfn., not passed by (of space or
time); not having crossed; Ja IV 214,12 (suriye nabha-
majjhaṁ ~e); kāmoghaṁ ... atiṇṇo ~o, Nidd II
88,27 (= 'an-ogha-tiṇṇo', Sn 1081). — °-saññi(n),
mfn., not aware of the time elapsed; Vin III 251,34. an-atikkanta

m. [sa. an-atikrama], not trans-
gressing; ifc. v. velā-°.

n., non-transgression; dat.
~āya, Mil 356,12; 357,1; not flowing over (of water),
Vin II 256,30 (udakassa) = AN IV 279,11.

mfn. [sa. an-atikramaṇīya],
not to be transgressed, not to be violated; n. ~aṁ (sik-
khāpadaṁ yāvajīvaṁ ~), Mil 74,30 = 266,24; f. ~ā
(kenaci purisena), DN II 13,5 = MN III 121,1; pl. m.
~ā (aṭṭha garudhammā yāvajīvaṁ ~), Vin II 256,32
— AN IV 279,13; °-aṭṭhena, As 219,11. an-atikkamanīya

mfn., faithful, not committing
adultery; m. ~ī (mātugāmo), SN IV 244,21 (also title
of the sutta ib.); f. ~inī (bhariyā; susaṁvihita-kam-
mantā +), DN III 190,10 (Sv), quoted Pj I 138,21.

f., faithfulness (conjugal); instr.
~āya (sammānanāya +), DN III 190,β (Sv), quoted
Pj I 138,17.

m., freedom from self-conceit; MN
I 363,24 (acc. -aril).

mfn., free from self-conceit or
pride; m. ~ī, Sn 143 = Khp IX 1 (suvaco c'assa
an-atimaninJa VI 296,9' (= 'mudu'); Mil 207,14 (akkodhano +);
øen.~issa, MN I 363,34; pl. ~ī, MN I 43,9; f. ~(in)ī,
Vv 332 (read with metre, v. l. and Ce akkodhanā an-
atimānī, cf. s. v. adhogāmi(n) (b)).

entry.re:
— °-saññi(n)an-atiritta-saññi(n), mfn., thinking something not to have
been left over; Vin IV 83,1.

entry.sense:
f. abstr. (cf. atireka), the not ex-
ceeding the measure; Pj I 115,14 (meaning of 'kevala').

mfn., not (guilty of) trespassing;
Vin I 55,9; 326,27.

mfn. 1. 'not having overcome', i. e.
subject to (in future; with acc. negative complement to
°-dhamma); jarā-dhammo jaraṁ~o, DN II 23,10; AN
I 138,31; 145,28; vyādhiṁ ~o, DN II 24,13; MN III
181,10; maraṇaṁ~o, DN II 26,14; SN I 97,17 (sabbe
an-atīta~ā); jātiṁ ~o, MN III 179,27; evaṁdhammo evaṁ-
bhāvī etaṁ (or evaṁ) ~o, MN I 58,13 (Ps) = III
91,18 = DN II 295,11; [an-atītaṁ, Ja V 455,32',
ts w. r. for antâtītaṁ]. — 2. not passed away, still
existing; in the comp, an-atīta-satthuka, mfn., see
atīta-satthuka.
[(mf)n., Ud 80,19*, w. r. for a-nata (q. v.)].

m. \sa. an-ātman], not self, i. e. all
an-attantilakkhaṇa-formuZα also with a plural subj.: saṁ-

na attā ti, Nett-a ad Nett 6,31*]; yad anattā, taṁ
'n'etaṁ mama . . . na m 'eso attā' ti . . . daṭṭhabbam,
SN IV 2,9; yo kho anattā, tatra chando pahātabbo,
SN IV 146,22; sabbe dhammā anattā, Dhp 279 (a-vasa-
vattanaṭṭhena ~ā, Dhp-a; quoted Nett 6,31*, Nett-a
see above; cf. Ps I 73,10; Vin V 86,3*; Nidd I 94,1
(Nidd-a)); rūpaṁ (+ vedanā, etc.) ~ā, Vin I 13,19
foll; MN I 228,12; III 19,11 (cf. Sv I 122,31) ≠ SN
III 103,27; SN III 21,26; 66,27; 78,3; 179,3; 196,24
(~ā ~ā ti vuccati); rūpā (+ saddā, etc.) ~ā, SN IV
3,25; 6,8; cakkhuṁ (+ sotaṁ, etc.) ~ā, SN IV
2,20; 4,32; 146,24; cakkhuṁ (+ rūpaṁ, sotaṁ,
saddā, etc.) ~ā, AN V 109,12; aniccaṁ, dukkhaṁ,
~ā, Mil 39,12; Dhp-a I 379,24 (cf. Ja I 48,28); Paṭis
II 106,15; sabbaṁ ~ā, SN IV 28,22; —acc. ~ānaṁ,
MN I 8,20-21; instr. ~anā, MN I 8,20-21; abl. ~ato
(paṭhavi-dhātuṁ . . . upagañchiṁ), MN III 31,23;
~ato jānato passato, SN IV 148,1; ~ato anupassati,
Paṭis II 232,12 (quoted Ps I 243,8); ~ato manasi-
karoto, Paṭis 1148,19; 58,3 foll.; ~ato upaṭṭhānam,
Paṭis II 101,1; 101,25; loc. ~ani, Sn 756; AN II
52,15 (cf. ib. 21*; 30*) = Paṭis II 80,19 foll.); Ps I
64,20. — Also in titles of suttas: SN III 21; 178—79;
196; 199; 201; IV 2, 3, 4, 28; V 133.

mfn., not self-wrought; n. pl. ~āni
kammāni, MN III 19,12 ≠ SN III 103,27.

mfn., having nothing to
reproach oneself with; m. ~ī, Sn 913 (Pj; Nidd). an-atta-garahin

m., a phenomenon that is not-
self; SN III 196,29 foll. (anicca-dhammo . . . dukkha-
dhammo . . . ~o, scil. rūpaṁ, vedanā, etc.).

m. Npr. of a thera; Dīp XIX 6 (? ≠
Attinna, Thūp 58,13; Uttiṇṇa, Mhv XXIX 37).

mfn., not mortifying or vexing
oneself; m. ~o, DN III 232,30 = MN I 341,11 — 412,1
= II 159,14; AN II 206,2 ≠ Pp 56,35.

mfn., [see atta-mana(s) above;
as to etym, āpta-, see Udānavarga, ed. Chakravarti
p. 171—2; JAs 1914: 505,1] dissatisfied, offended,
an-atta-manasDN I 3,5 (SvI 52,14); kupita+, Vin II 189,2; DN
I 90,25; MN I 123,17; 125,20; II 43,18; 200,25;
Pp 33,36; — kupito ~o + āsādanâpekkho, Vin I
222,35; do. + anabhiraddho, Vin I 70,21; — do.
+ āhatacitto khilajāto, MN I 101,23; do. + anabhi-
raddho āhatacitto khilajāto, Vin III 163,30' ( =
'duṭṭho doso'; = na sakamano attano vase a-ṭṭhita-
citto, Sp); — DN III 60,17 (~o ahosi an-attamana-
tañ ca [paṭisaṁvedesi) ≠ MN III 221,22; AN I 54,19
(kāyena ~o ahosi, ~o samāno anattamanavācaṁ . . .
avaca); SN I 86,10; with gen.: Ja I 415,8 (mā etassa
bhikkhuno ~ā hotha); (acc. ~manasaṁ, possibly in
SN I 86,11, see next). — °-tā, f. abstr., SN V 349,1
(+ domanassaṁ); AN III 370,23 (+ anabhiraddhi,
q. v.); Pp 18,15 (cittassa; = 'kodho'); Dhs 418 ( =
'doso'; As 258,20); Pj II 141,14; acc. ~aṁ, Ja I
237,20 (āpajjitvā); DN III 60,17 (paṭisaṁvedesi);
Vv-a 67,3 (pavedetvā); [SN I 86,11: Pasenadi-Kosa-
laṁ ~aṁ viditvā, read anatta-manasaṁ?ḷ.
— °-dhātuka, mfn., in low spirits, melancholic, Dhp-a
I 89,22 (opp. haṭṭha-pahaṭṭho).
entry.re:
— °-vacanaan-atta-mana(s)-vacana, n.,
see next.

— °-vācāan-atta-mana(s)-vācā, f., words of displeasure; an-
attamanā ~aṁ nicchāresi, MN I 125,30 (Ps) = SN
II 215,30; anattamano samāno ~aṁ maṁ so bḥikkhu
avaca, AN I 54,20 (— atuṭṭha-vācaṁ, Mp; Ee°-va-
canaṁ, cf. ib. 55,6).

— °-suttaan-atta-lakkhaṇa-sutta, n., or
°-suttanta, m., the discourse about a°, i. e. Vin I 13,18
foll. = SN III 66,25 foll; Ja IV 180,14 (~aṁ ka-
thetvā); Ja I 82,18 (~aṁ desesi); Ps II 192,26 (Ee)
(~aṁ kathesi); Thī-a 3,13 (°desanāya); Mp I 100,12
(°-pariyosāne); 147,26 (°-desanā-pariyosāne). (Cf. An-
atta-sutta below).

— °-ânulomaan-atta-saññā-ânuloma, mfn., correspond-
ing to a°, fit for a°; anattaṁ vā ~aṁ vā, Nidd I
193,27.

entry.sense:
n., title of the discourse Vin I
13,18 foll. = SN III 66,25 foll.; Sp (Ce) II 154,28
ad Vin I 13,18 (cf. An-atta-lakkhaṇa-s° above).

mfn., conscious of, or reckon-
ing for an-atta; Ud 37,20 ≠ AN IV 353,13; SN V
345,25. an-atta-sannin

mfn. (an + atta + adhīna), not
his own master, not independent; dāso ~o parâdhīno
na yena-kāmaṁ-gamo, DN I 72,23 (= na attani
adhīno, Sv) = MN I 275,33 (= do., Ps).

mfn. (an-atta + an-attan[ī/i]ya),
neither the self nor belonging to the self; n. ~aṁ,
Ud-a 210,2.

f. (an-atta + anupassanā),
the looking upon something as an-atta; Paṭis 110,17
(aniccânupassanā+); 20,23, etc.; II 37,32; 42,2, etc.
(°-ñāṇaṁ) foll.; 63,25 (+ suññatânupassanā), etc.;
Ud-a 236,12 (°-saṁkhātā anatta-saññā); Ps I 157,11
(aniccânupassanā +), cf. 243,1: an-attato anupassati
no attato.

mfn. (an-atta + anupas-
si(n)), looking upon [loc] as an-atta; AN IV 14,15
(sabbesu dhammesu ~ī; = avasavattanâkāraṁ
anatta ti anupassanto, Mp); V 109,16; 359,15 (cak-
khusmiṁ). an-attanupassin

mfn., not extolling or
praising oneself; ~o a-para-vambhī, MN I 19,1;
96,27; pl. ~ă, Ap 19,12 (~ sabbe, na te vambhenti
kassaci); 426,27.

f., absence of self-exalta
tion MN I 404,6 (+ a-para-vambhanā), 407,5 (do.).

m. (or mfn. in comp.s)[sa. an-artha[,
no use, disadvantage, misfortune, harm; something
false, bad, hurtful, improfitable, or useless; Vin I
347,1 (~assa kārako); II 89,16 (dat. ~āya ahitāya
dukkhāya, with gen.) — It 11,2 — DN III 246,18 =
an-atthasaṁvatteyyuṁ); Ja V 117,1* (~ăya patārayi); Sn
126 (acc. ~aṁ anusāsati, opp. atthaṁ; = ahitaṁ,
Pj); Dhp 256 (atthaṁ ~añ ca . . . niccheyya; =
bhūtañ ca abhūtañ ca kāraṇaṁ, Dhp-a); Ud
67,35 (atthaṁ na jānanti, ~aṁ na jānanti); AN
II 46,16*-17* (atthe ~e ca ... kovido ~aṁ pari-
vajjeti); IV 95,2-3; 96,15* (~aṁ adhipajjati, or
patipajjati; Mp); V 150,16 (~aṁ me acarîti āghā-
taṁ bandhati) ≠ Dhs 1060 = 1231 ≠ Nidd I
215,17 (~aṁ me carîti kodho jāyati; = avuḍḍhiṁ
me akāsi, Nidd-a); AN V 275,5 (atthañ ca vo desis-
sāmi ~añ ca); 222,14 (adhammo + ~o); 254,13 (do.);
Ja I 55,19 (maṁ~e niyojessati, ≠ Mil 126,13); 250,29
(~am eva karonti); III 168,17 (~o te uppanno);
176,9* (karissāmi te . . . ~aṁ; = avaḍḍhiṁ, Ct.);
V 79,27' (attanā va attano ~o kato); VI 300,5' (mā
h'eva adhammesu ~esu apuññesu tava cittaṁ paṇi-
dahi); Pp 37,3 (~am pi me kareyya); Dhp-a I 20,9
(atthaṁ karissāmîti ~aṁ kari); Pj II 100,21 (~aṁ
janento); Pv-a 199,19 (= 'vyasanaṁ'); 61,2 (abl.
~ato + pātakato (so Ce)); ~ato, Vin I 345,28 (the
only reading known to Bu. was anatthato, see next);
Spk III 73,2 (āsīvisā gaṇhantā pañca ~e gaṇhanti:
duggandhaṁ, etc., cf. ib. 8* (Ce: pañca gaṇhanti
'natthāni, Se: pañca gaṇhant' anatthāya), io*: an-
atthā honti pane' ete, etc.). — n. ~aṁ te bhavis-
sati, Dhp-a II 227,17*. — Ifc., v. atthâ°.

mfn. [sa. an-arthakaḷ, of no meaning
or use, hurtful, bringing misfortune; Dhp-a II 209,2
(~ehi padehi saṁhitā, = 'anattha-pada-saṁhitā');
[Vin I 345,28: aho me ~o, v. l. anattako, anatta-
kārako; Sp reads an-atth'ato, = an-attho ato, etasmā
mama purisā an-attho ti vuttaṁ hoti; athavā: an-
atthato ti an-attha-do].

mfn. [sa. an-artha-karaḷ,
doing harm; Ps II 320,21; cf. ib. 321,8 (mahânattha-
karaṁ). (Cf. an-attha-kara(ka)).

mfn., (a) wishing to do harm
(gen.), wishing no good; MN I 117,25 foll. (+ a-hita-
kāmo a-yogakkhema-kāmo); SN III 112,30 (do.); Ja
V 229,27 (tumhākaṁ ~o); pl. n. ~āni (scil. kulāni;
+ ahita-k° aphāsu-k° ayogakkhema-k°)), Nidd I
473,14 (Nidd-a); pl. m. ~ā, Pj II 287,17 (karuṇā-
virahitā sattānaṁ ~ā, = 'nikkaruṇā'); — (b), who
does not care about profit; Ja II 205,11* = III
an-attha-kāma

mf(~ikā)n., doing harm, per-
nicious, bearing malice to (gen.); Ja III 260,18'
(sucirena~o, = 'upanāhī'); IV 22,11 (~o, scil. kodho);
179,4 (lokassa ~o); 196,26 (tumhākaṁ ~o); pl. ~ā,
Dhp-a I 55,14 (bhaṇḍana-kalaha-viggaha-vivādā);
gen. pl. ~ānaṁ (kilesānaṁ), Ja VI 473,19'; f. ~ikā,
an-attha-kāraka

f. abstr. (of *anattha-kāri(n)),
doing harm; Sv (III) 948,3 (ad DN III 184,19*; =
'an-atthatā').

mfn., not skilled in what is
good or salutary; Pj I 236,22; 237,10 (opp. attha-
kusala); instr, na ve ~ena attha-cariyā sukhâvahā,
Ja I 251,1* (= an-atthe an-āyatane kusalena, or
atthe āyatane (?) akusalena Ct.) = 252,15*.

n., conveying of bad things;
abl. ~ato, Spk III 72,10; 73,2.

mfn. (cf. 3attha), not having
set (as the sun); loc. ~e (suriye), Ud-a 31,33; Pv-a
216,27. — °-suriya, mfn., upon which the sun has
not set; Ja V 56,21.' (= 'anāvasūra', q. v.). Cf. an-
attham-ita. an-atthaṁ-gata

mfn., doing no good, doing
wrong; Ja V 78,24' (an-atthavā ~o); Mil 126,18 (~o
tvaṁ maññe); n. pl. ~āni, Ja V 432,3].; 433,1 (
— akiccakārīni, 435,29', codd. °kārinī from 434,27*!);
433,9* (metre only if reading: kicce jāte 'natthacarā
bhavanti).

f., wrong action; Mil 161,21
(instr. ~āya).

mfn., producing harm, per-
nicious; Pj II 286,3 (nir-atthaka +).

mfn. = prec; It 83,21* foll.
(~o lobho . . . doso . . . mono; quoted Nidd I 15,21*
foll. (Nidd-a); Ps III 127,1*); AN IV 96,20* (~o
kodho; quoted Sv I 52,26*; Pj II 20,14* and 12,9*).

[mfn., knowing what is dis-
advantage or loss; Dhp-a II 228,1 (~o; Rt supports
v. l. atthânatt.ha-j°)].

(or °-atthata), mfn., not spread, not
covered; Vin I 254,26 foll. (~aṁ, scil. kaṭhinaṁ);
Ps III 271,17 (attharaṇena ~āya, scil. bhūmiyā, =
'anantarahitāya', MN II 57,25) = Sp I 205,10.
see anatthaka.

f. abstr. (of an-attha), doing harm;
DN III 184,19* (= anattha-kāritā, Sv; pt: paresaṁ
kariyamāno anattho ettha atthī ti anattho, tabbhāvo
~ā). an-atthatā

mfn., bringing misfortune; Sp ad
Vin I 345,28 (= 'an-atthato', see an-atthaka above).

mfn. [sa. an-artha-darçin],
(according to Ctt.) showing what is useless, giving
an-attha-dassinanatthaṁ dassetī ti anatthadassī, Pj and Nidd-a
II 384,6).

mfn., concerning useless matter,
vain; Ja VI 287,15' (~aṁ ... vitaṇḍa-sallāpaṁ
lokāy ati ka-vādaṁ).

mfn., unskilled in mean-
ings and words; voc. f. ~e, Ja V 103,27* (cf. kovi-
datthapada).

mfn., consisting (only)
of useless words, or not containing useful words; f.
~ā (vācā), Dhp 100 (Dhp-a); pl. ~ā (gāthā), ib. 101
= Ap 478,22.

mfn., asking about what is
not profitable; Dhp-a II 227,1 (~aṁ brāhmaṇaṁ).
— °-brāhmaṇa-vatthu, n., title of the story ib. 227—29.

mfn. (cf. aattha), not having set
(as the sun); loc. ~e (suriye), Dhp-a I 86,9; III 127,12.
Cf. an-atthaṁ-gata.

mfn. = an-attha-saṁhita,
q. v.; Sv (III) 896,38 ad DN III 113,21.

m., the power (or influence) of
evil; Ja VI 473,14* (~aṁ āgataṁ, = anattha-kāra-
kānaṁ kilesānaṁ vasaṁ āgataṁ, Ct.).

mfn., talking of the improfit-
able; m. akāla-vādī, abhūta-vādī + ~ī, MN I 287,2
= III 48,14 = AN V 265,9 = 283,26 ≠ AN I 202,15;
an-attha-vadin

mfn., connected with the
improfitable, useless, not salutary; Vin I 10,13 (hīno
gammo... + ~o) = SN V 421,5 (= na attha-sahito [ti]
hita-sukhâvahaṁ kāraṇaṁ anissito, Spk) ≠ DN III
113,21 (= anattha-yutta, Sv); Vin I 59,16 (attha-
saṁhitaṁ tathāgatā pucchanti, no ~aṁ); DN III
134,20 (abhūtaṁ atacchaṁ + ; — na idha-lokatthaṁ
vā para-lokatthaṁ vā nissitaṁ, Sv); MN I 126,32
an-attha-saṁhita100—101); 395,9 (vācaṁ abhūtaṁ+); II 202,20
(vācaṁ); III 113,15 (kathā hīnā +); SN I 103,9
(mutto . . . ~āya dukkara-kārikāya); ib. 19* (~aṁ
ñatvā yaṁ kiñci amaraṁ tapaṁ); AN III 196,23
(akālena + ... ~ena codiyamānaṁ); Ja IV 5,2*
(icchaṁ na seveyya ~aṁ).

m., continuation or propaga-
tion of what is not salutary; Pj II 8,26 (~assa pahā-
naṁ).

mfn., one who does not spread
out; Vin V 172,5 (an-atthataṁ hoti kaṭhinaṁ ~assa
ca an-anumodakassa ca). Cf. atthāra.

mfn. (an-attha + āvaha), con-
veying or leading to loss, not useful for one's good;
SN I 103,20* (sabbânatthâvahaṁ hoti, cr sabbaṁ
n'atth°, v. l.); Ud-a 318,9 (pāpaṁ . . . ~aṁ); Pv-a
13,24 (kalaho); 116,11 (aparādho); Pj II 100,23 (avi-
dita-tibbâ° +); Saddh 99 (pl. ~ā). an-atthâvaha
n., or mfn. = prec;
entry.re:
— °-tāan-atthâvahana-tā,
f. abstr., Thī-a 242,6.

entry.sense:
mfn. (cf. 1atthika), not wanting, not
caring for (instr.); not wishing, without any serious
demand; Th 122 (bhaven' amhi ~o); 956 (dubbalā
te bhavissanti hirimanā [ ˇ - ˇ ˇ ] ~ā; 'unconcerned',
Ct.); MN II 139,12 (na ca ~o pattena hoti, not
an-atthika(~aṁ bhikkhuṁ ādāya, cf. pabbajjāya ko attho, ib.
276,16); V 454,1* (pamadāh' ~ā); 460,1 (nagarena
~o); Pj II 315,18 (~ā hi te aññena); Pv-a 20,11
(mayaṁ aññena ~ā); As 156,34 (~ā samānā pi,
without any (religious) need); Mil 76,26 (eko atthiko,
eko ~o).

n., causing damage; Pv-a
114,11.

f., not a river, no river (cf. anagara,
etc.); Ja II 126,18* (na tena ~ī hoti).

f., an-addāyanā, f., an-addāyitatta,
n., (cf. anuddā) want of regard; Vibh 371,9 (v. I.
anādā; anādāyanā; anādāyittatta; = anādiyanā
. . . anādiyâkāro . . . anaddāya ayitassa [v. l. an-
addāyitassa]-bhāvo, resp., Vibh-a 499,29). Cf. ādara,
an-addā

m(fn)., 'not going on the road',
walking through the air (said of the gods); gen. pl.
~gūnām api devatānaṁ, Ja V 14,27*.

or °-ika), mfn., not lasting; Ja I
393,3 (sabbe . . . aniccā khaṇikā, etc. + ~ā); Dhp-a
I 316,20 (+ tāva-kālika); 336,23 (abala-dubbala+);
an-addhaniyafoll. (~īyaṁ jīvitaṁ; Nidd-a I 155,2 (Ee Se anaddha-
nikaṁ)).

mfn. = prec; Ja V 507,28*
(thale yathā vāri . . . ~aṁ aciraṭṭhitīkaṁ; = na
addhāna-kkhamaṁ, Ct.).

mfn., not ensnared, indepen-
dent, free; (cf. addha-bhūta): MN II 223,8 (~aṁ
attānaṁ dukkhena addha-bhāveti; = an-abhibhū-
taṁ, Ps); 224,22.
[mfn., w. r. for an-āḷhiya (q. v.)].

mfn. [ts.], not exceeding, i. e. with
nothing redundant (opp. an-ūna); DN III 126,14
(sabbâkāra-sampannaṁ+); Dīp V 52 (anūnam~aṁ
[scan anūnânadhikaṁ] c'eva kevalaṁ jinasāsanaṁ,
an-adhika~aṁ); 13,2; Vism 478,11 (pl. anūnā~ā); Pj II 137,9
(n. pl. anūnāni ~āni pañca . . . = 'pañcamattāni').

mfn., not fond of litigation (cf.
adhikaraṇa (c)); Mil 383,21. (~ena bhavitabbaṁ
anavakāsa-kārinà).

entry.re:
— °-ârahattaan-adhigatârahatta,
mfn., who has not attained to perfection; Spk ad SN
II 229,24 (= 'appattamānasa').

entry.sense:
m., non-attainment; abl. ~ā
(ariyāya paññāya), MN I 81,33.

n., non-determination, not fixing
one's mind upon; Vibh 350,27 (Vibh-a), quoted Pj I
143,22; MN II 235,10 (abl. ~ā, kāmasaṁyojanānaṁ);
Ud-a 362,18 (~aṁ katvā); Vin V 128,35 (anāmanta-
cāro +). an-adhiṭṭhāna

mfn., not determined or fixed;
Vin III 196,19' (atireka-cīvaraṁ nāma ~aṁ avikap-
pitaṁ); 243,24' (atireka-patto nāma ~o avikappito);
251,34 (~e adhitthita-saññī); 262,13 (do.); IV 244,1'
(~o avikappito); instr, (adv.) ~ena, without having
determined, Vin I 258,3 (pakkamati); 299,22 (tassa
bhikkhuno taṁ cīvaraṁ ~). an-adhiṭṭhita

m., not a master, not conqueror;
SN IV 186,8 (rūpâdhibhūto, etc. + , v. l. °abhibhū).

mfn., not conquered; SN IV
187,22 (adhibhū +; v. l. an-abhibhūto); Ja III
442,22' (amucchito +).

mfn., whose heart is not at-
tached to, or not making light of (as from *adhi-
maññati, cf. atimaññati, Ja IV 320,27'); Ja V 29,10*
an-adhimanasˇ - - ; Ct.; v. l. an-adhimāna, free from arrogance).

mfn., not clinging to (loc),
undefiled; MN II 223,10 (read sukhe~o; Ps) = 224,24.

mfn., having no superior; Bv I 9
(sattuttamo ~o vināyako, - - ˇ - | ˇ ˇ ˇ ˇ - |
ˇ - ˇ - ); Vv 139 (idhâgatā ~aṁ namassituṁ; do.);
140 (iddhī ca te ~ā vihaṅgamā, do.; = adhikā
visiṭṭhā aññā etissā n'atthi ti ~ā, Vv-a); Ja IV
an-adhivaraappameyyā, Ct.); — m. = Buddha, Abh 2.

mfn., impatient, not able to en-
dure (with gen.); °-jātika, mfn., id.; Vin I 78,25 ≠
302,36 = AN II 153,20 (°-vāsika-) - III 143,29;
Ja IV 11,22' (°-vāsika-).
entry.re:
— °-jātikatāan-adhivāsaka-jātikatā, f. abstr., Ja
III 369,16 (abl. ~āya).

entry.sense:
f. abstr., impatience; Vibh
360,2 (akkhanti akkhamanatā +).

f. — prec; Mp II 353,10 (ad
AN I 236,29; = 'akkhanti').
= an-adhivāsaka, q. v.

f. abstr., see adho-mukha;
Pj I 34,8.

when not followed by two consonants,
often gives an-ānu-° [avoiding ˇ ˇ ˇ ≃ , cf. Añjanā-
giri, sam-ādhika (adhika ifc), anāparādha], see an-
anugiddha, an-anuloma, and v. lI. under an-anu-
tappa, an-anunīta etc an-anu-°

mfn., not agreeable, not suitable;
Sadd 527,28. — °-tā, f. abst, ib. 470,14 (= 'virodha').

mfn., (a) not followed; Pj II 297,29
(tena ~aṁ, = 'an-anvayaṁ'). — (b) not following,
not led by others, see next.

mfn., with independent, un-
obstructed mind; gen. ~assa, scil. Bhagavato, MN I
386,24 (= kilesehi an-anugata-cittassa, Ps).
mfn., see an-ānugiddha.

(or -iya), mfn., improper, un-
suitable, unbecoming; ~iyaṁ ananulomikaṁ appaṭi-
rūpaṁ assāmanakaṁ akappiyaṁ akaraṇīyaṁ, Vin
III 20,18 (Sp I 219,26); 128,13; 145,6; 59,24; 211,3;
an-anucchavikaJa I 418,20 (~aṁ te kataṁ); with gen. pers., Ja II
197,9 (attano ~aṁ, cf. Dhp-a I 79,81); Ja VI 264,18
(dhītu ~am pi kathaṁ kathesi); ~aṁ . . . parivi-
takkaṁ vitakkesi, Mil 13,22; ~aṁ . . . evarūpaṁ
maraṇam, Dhp-a I 224,6 (+ ayuttaṁ appattaṁ, ib.
10) ≠ Ud-a 384,26; ayutto appatto +, Mil 357,10;
Ja VI 509,1 (= 'appatto').
entry.re:
— °-ttaan-anucchavika-tta, n. abstr., Sp
I 219,27.

entry.sense:
mfn., without permission, not
allowed, not sanctioned; Vin II 169,27 (~o, scil. pāsāda-
paribhogo); Thī 129 (~o ito gato) ≠ Ja III 165,8* =
Pv 86 (nânuññāto!); MN II 56,17 (~aṁ mātāpitūhi)
≠ Ja I 92,3 ≠ Ud-a 71,13; Ja VI 270,31; Ud-a 220,17.
— °-samuṭṭhāna, n. (q.v.), title of Vin V 89,36*
— an-anuññāta

mfn., not to be mourned; DN III
122,21 (evarūpo . . . satthā sāvakānam kālakato ~o,
v. l. anānutappo; = anutāpa-karo na hoti, Sv).

mfn., not to be repented; AN II
69,1* (kataṁ ~aṁ) = III 46,20*.

mfn., not attracted; Pj II 497,19
(~o appaṭihato majjhatto; v. l. anānunīto).
see anānupassi(n).
see anānupuṭṭha.

mfn., not attained; MN I 104,29
(~aṁ . . . yogakkhemaṁ) ≠ 349,29.

n., not understanding; Sv (II)
495,13 (abl. ~ā, = 'an-anubodhā') = Spk II 96,5.

mfn., not taken up by pupils
(said of the bodhi of a pacceka-buddha, q. v.); Th-a
(Ce) 7,21 ad Th 1 (pacceka-bodhi ~o).

m., not understanding; abl. ~ā
appaṭivedhā, DN II 55,14 (dhammassa; — an-anu-
bujjhanā, Sv; quoted Kacc-v 298) ≠ SN II 92,13;
DN II 90,9 (ariya-saccānaṁ; = abujjhanena ajāna-
nena, Sv) ≠ AN II 1,9 = IV 105,15 foll.; aññāṇaṁ
adassanaṁ+, Pp 21,19; Dhs 390; 1061; 1162; Nidd
1an-anubodha

mfn., deprived of (higher) in-
telligence; puthujjano ~o, Vv 929 (so Vv-a 321,12,
Ce Ee; text anavab°, a conjecture, see Vv-a 319, n. 3).

mfn., not attained (enjoyed or
realised); n. ~aṁ, MN I 329,13 foll. (= a-ppattaṁ,
Ps).
entry.re:
— °-pubbaan-anubhūta-pubba, mfn., not enjoyed before; Ud-a
391,31.

— °-ârammaṇaan-anubhūtârammaṇa, n., an object of perception
not known (before); Mp I 30,4.

entry.sense:
mfn., not allowed, without per-
mission; Pv-a 64,8 (= 'nânuññāto', or better 'an-
anuññāto', cf. Thī 129 & Ja III 165,8*). .
see anānuyāyi(n).

n. = 'ananuyoga'; Mp III
206,5 ad AN IV 52,14.

mfn., not intent upon (acc.); MN
I 471,12 (jāgariyaṁ ~o); pl. ~ā (jāgariyaṁ), MN I
32,10 - SN IV 104,1 = AN III 199,3 ≠ SN II 218,19;
MN II 258,29 (rūpadassanaṁ ~assa); MN II 259,25
(vātâtape cārittaṁ); SN III 153,3 foll. (bhāvanânu-
an-anuyutta

m., the not applying oneself to
(gen.); AN IV 52,14 (ālasse . . . pamāde ~e appacca-
vekkhaṇāya; = an-anuyuñjane, Mp); V 136,12 (~o
apaccavekkhaṇā dhammānaṁ paripantho); MN III
231,1 (somanassânuyogaṁ ~o, paron.); ib. 6 (do.,

(kusalānaṁ . . . akusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ); Vibh
350,27 (kusalānaṁ dhammānaṁ bhāvanāya ... an
an-anuyoga

see anānuruddha; °-appaṭivi-
ruddha, mfn., MN I 65,9.

mfn., who cannot endure
being questioned (cf. anuyoga (2)); Vin I 176,19-30
(~o, gilāno).

mfn., incompatible, unsuitable, un-
deserved; Ja III 442,14' (aṭṭhānena akāraṇena attano
rājabhāvassa ~aṁ, = 'appaṭirūpaṁ'); VI 553,6'
(dānaṁ datvā pacchā anutāpo nāma tava ~o);
Dhp-a III 67,14 (attano ~aṁ maraṇaṁ patto); Vism
89,29; 118,1—122,22 (~aṁ vihāṙaṁ). an-anurūpa
m. non-compliance; Ud-a 30,25-27.
mfn., see an-ānuloma.

mfn., improper, unsuitable, n.
~aṁ (an-anucchaviyaṁ+), Vin III 20,18 (Sp), etc.,
see an-anucchavika; Vin IV 239,30' (~ena kāyika-
vācasikena [ellipsis of saṁsaggena] saṁsaṭṭhā); AN
an-anulomikasaṁsaggena, paron.); Ps I 257,7 (do.); Nidd I 473,12
(do. Nidd-a); Vin I 322,1 (gihi-saṁsaṭṭho viharati
~ehi gihi-saṁsaggehi, paron.); 341,15 (aññamaññaṁ
~aṁ kāya-kammaṁ); AN I 106,5 (~e kāya-kamme
+ vacīkamme, etc.; Mp); Pj I 237,5 (~ena saṁsag-
gena); Mil 266,22 (samaṇānaṁ ananucchavikaṁ
~aṁ). — °-tta, n. abstr.; Sp I 219,29 (abl. ~ā).

mfn. = prec.; Pj I 243,10 (°-gihi-
saṁsagga).

mfn., blameless; f. vācā . . . ana-
vajjā ca ~ā viññūnaṁ, Sn p. 78,10 (= anuvāda-
vimuttā, Pj) = SN I 188,32 (quoted As 86,8) ≠ AN
III 243,28; m. ~o viññūnaṁ (paṇḍito vyatto sap-
puriso), AN I 294,9 = 113,13; — with rhythmical
an-anuvajja
n., non-conformity; Ja II 449,22.

mfn., = prec; ~o cudito bhikkhu,
Vin I 173,9; vatta-sīse thatvā ovadanto ~o, Dhp-a
III 376,13.

ind. (neg. abs., cf. anuvicca),
without inquiry, not having examined (or ascertained);
~ + a-pariyogāhetvā, MN II 114,10; AN II 84,1].
(= ajānitvā avinicchinitvā, Mp ≠ Pp 48,30 foll.
(= atulayitvā apariggaṇhitvā, Pp-a). an-anuvicca

mfn., without 'connection' (see
anusandhi); na Buddhānaṁ ~ā nāma kathā atthi,
Pj II 142,31; As 135,15-18.

f., a discourse without
'connection'; Pj I 125,14 (pucchita-kathā+).

m., neg. nomen actionis of anuseti
(q.v.); abl. ~ā, AN III 246,20 foll. (= a-nibbat-
tiyā, Mp).

mfn., not to be grieved for; vítaṁ
~aṁ, Ja III 95,20* (w. r. °socitaṁ; = vītaṁ vigataṁ
mataṁ ~aṁ na anusocitabbaṁ, Ct.). — °-jātaka,
n., title of Jāt 328 (Ja III 92—97).

f., failing of memory; Vibh 360,39
= Pp 21,14 (a-sati+); Dhs 1349 (do.; As).

mfn., of which there is no tradition,
not heard before; pubbe ~esu dhammesu, DN II 33,6
foll. (cakkhuṁ udapādi; Sv) = SN II 9,11; 105,4
foll.; V 179,1; MN II 211,17 (sāmaṁ yeva dhammaṁ
abhiññāya); AN III 9,14 (abhiññā-vosāna-pārami-
an-atiussutasambujjhati); Nidd I 457,18 (do.); also title of a sutta,
SN V 178—79.
entry.re:
— °-dhammaan-atiussuta-dhamma, m. pl., ~esu, Ap
614,14 (prob, to be read ananussutesu dhammesu,
cf. v. l. S2).
— °-vaggaan-atiussuta-vagga, m., title of SN V 178—184.

entry.sense:
mfn. [ts.], infinite, endless, boundless
(cf. Vism 333,1); ~aṁ (viññāṇaṁ), DN I 223,12*
(= uppādanto (Ee uppādento!) và vayanto vā ṭhi-
tassa aññathatta-anto vā etassa n'atthi ti ~aṁ, Sv;
see also anantamānasa, n.) ≠ (as a quotation) MN I
329,30 (= uppăda-vaya-antarahitattā ~aṁ, Ps); ~aṁ
viññāṇaṁ, DN I 35,10; II 112,8; III 224,14; 253,23
(see Vism 331,26—333,7); ~ena ñāṇena, AN IV 428,24;
rūpī (arūpī) me~o attā (opp. paritta), DN II 64,7-10;
~o ākāso, DN I 34,35; II 112,5; III 224,12; 253,20;
AN IV 431,11 (see Vism 326,1—331,25); Mil 278,14
(ākāso ativitthāritāya ~o); 388,4 (ākāso ~o appa-
an-antacakkavăḷāni, sattakāyo, buddhañāṇaṁ); ~āni bhas-
sāni, Vin II 95,26 (v. l. for an-aggāni). — n. ~aṁ,
= nibbāna; Abh 7; Abhidh-av 82,14*. — Ifc. v.
antâ°. — Cf. ānañca.

m. Npr. of the nāga king (Çeṣa); Abh
651; Mhv LXXIII, 120 (°-bhoga-saṁkāsa-saṁnivesa-
silāyuta).
entry.re:
— °-pokkharaṇīAnanta-pokkharaṇī, f., a bathing pond in
the Dīpuyyāna, ib.

entry.sense:
m. Npr. of a man at the court of
king Milinda; Devamantiyo ca ~o ca, etc., Mil 29,29
foll. (Se Antakāyo; by Tr. suggested to be identical
with the greek name Antiochos, v. Tr. Notes p. 70).

mfn., of infinite virtue; m.
~o appameyya-guṇo, Mil 347,11. (scil. Bhagavā).
— °-sañcaya, m., a hoard of infinite merit; Ap 500,20.
— °-sāgara, m., an ocean of infinite virtues; Ap 127,12.

mfn., whose sphere (of per-
ception) is unlimited, with infinite scope; Dhp 179
(Buddhaṁ ~aṁ; quoted Ja I 79,25*; = apariyanta-
gocaraṁ, Dhp-a); icchā hi ~ā, Ja II 258,21* (Ct.);
Ap 477,12 (read with Ce sudassanaṁ daṭṭhum ~aṁ,
scil. arahattaṁ).

mf(~ikā)n., not adhering
to extreme standpoints (such as ucchedavāda or sassa-
tavāda), (cf. anta-(g)gahaka); na micchādiṭṭhiko hoti
~āya diṭṭhiyā samannāgato, DN III 48,2 (v. l. na
antagāhikāya; Sv (III) 839,$»: anta-ggāhikāyā ti sā
an-anta-ggāhakatattā anta-ggāhikā ti vuccati).

f., an assembly of in-
numerable people; Ap 500,21 (loc. ~ saṁsadi, so C
and v.L; Ee anantajanataṁ sarī).

m. Npr. of a cakkavatti(n) ( =
Bhājanadāyaka in a former existence); Ap 218,16
[~-nāmako, ˇ - ˇ - ˇ - ˇ - ! ɔ: Ananta-jjāli-?].

m., [cf. the fain Npr. Anantajina
and Anantavijaya; and the ājīvika term ananta-
mānasa below], of unlimited mastery, or conqueror of
the endless (Nibbāna), the ājīvika Upaka's term for
an arahat or a Buddha; Vin I 8,27 = MN I 171,13
≠ Mvu III 326,9, 13, 17; Pj II 260,1 foll. ≠ Ps II
an-anta-jinaBuddhas; ~ā anāvaraṇa-ñāṇā, Mil 105,24.
f. abstr. of an-anta; Sv (II) 487,27.

mfn., of unlimited radiance; ~o
an-anta-tejas(asamo+); Nidd I 178,1 = 451,1 (an-anta-ñāṇo +).

mfn., of infinite wisdom; ~ī
Bhagavâḥam asmi, SN I 143,16* (Spk) — Ja III
360,16* (Ct.); ~ī bhagavā Gotamo Sakyapuṅgavo,
Ap 95,9 (Th-a (Cc) 546,29*: Atthadassī sa bh°); instr.
an-anta-dassinan-anta-dassi

mfn., boundless in firmness; Mil
331,25 (asamo +).

mfn., with infinite methods; Ja
I 78,1 (~aṁ samanta-Paṭṭhānam).

mfn., of infinite understanding;
Sn 468 (Tathāgato hoti ~o; = aparimita-pañño, Pj).

mfn., with innumerable re-
tinue; °-tā, f. abstr., Pj I 33,27.
see Ananta.

f., the infinite splendour of
a Buddha; Pj II 408,20 (opp. vyāmappabhā, asīti-
ppabhā).

mfn., of unlimited strength; Mil
331,26 (asamo +). — °-porisa, mfn., with an in-
numerable army; Ja VI 221,12* (= an-anta-bala-
kāyo, Ct.; perhaps: of infinite strength and valour);
222,1*. — °-vāhana, mfn. id. Mil 4,1; Anāg 74; acc.
an-anta-bala

f. pl., name
of a poem; Gv 66,3.

f., being endowed with in-
finite revenue or prosperity; Pj I 33,30.

n., 'mind conceived as end-
less' ; ājīvikā ~aṁ (scil. paññāpenti), untraced quota-
tion in Ss 121,23. Cf. DN I 223,12* (viññāṇaṁ . . .
anantaṁ, = viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ); see also an-anta-
jina. an-anta-mānasa

mfn., of infinite fame; Nidd I
178,1 = 451,1 (anantañāṇo anantatejo +); — (Npr.)
m., designation of a cakkavatti (= Sakacittaniya
(read with Ce Sakacintaniya) in a former existence),
Ap 112,5 (asītikappe 'nantayaso cakkavatti ahos'
ahaṁ).

mfn. 1. [ts.], immediately following
(or preceding), next, adjoining (with gen.); Ja III
464,27* (sukhass' ~aṁ dukkḥaṁ; Ct.); ~aṁ gāthaṁ,
Ja IV 252,25; V 351,2; imassa akkharassa ~aṁ imaṁ
akkharaṁ kātabbaṁ, Mil 79,28; abl. ~ā Sakyakulā
pabbajito, DN III 83,25 (w. r. anuttaro; prob. =
next in rank, — antara-virahitā, attano kulena sadisā,
Sv (pt)); pl. ~ā, Pv-a 97,22 (see anantarā, ind.);
an-antara2. immediately appearing, ready at hand; paṭibhā-
naṁ ~aṁ, Spk I 150,14 — Ud-a 333,11 (v. l. an-
antaṁ). — 3. not interior, DN II 100,2 (desito mayā
dhammo ~am a-bāhiraṁ karitvā, making no distinc-
tion in esoteric and exoteric; Sv) — SN V 153,17 (Spk).
— Ifc. v. atītâ°, yasâ°.

ind., immediately after (with gen.,
or abl., or ifc); Th 553 (~ hi jātassa jīvitā maraṇaṁ
dhuvaṁ); Ja I 218,9 (mamâ°); Ja VI 224,28' "(ni-
sajja(na)to ~ eva); Abhidh-av 58,15* (javanānam
~). — ifc. v. anulomañāṇâ°, cuti-°, tad-°, nib-
bāna-pucchâ°, rūpâ°, sam-°, sotadvāra-javanâ°.

mfn., having immediate result
(— ānantariya); n. pl. kammāni ~āni, Dhs 1028
(= anantarāyena phala-dāyakāni, As 358,18).

m., the adjoining room; ~e
nisinno, Dhp-a I 397,15 (Ee antara-g°; Rt renders
āsanna-°). — °-gāthā, f., the next stanza; Ja IV 139,30
foll.—°-gehavāsi(n), m(fn.), a neighbour; Ja I 114,26
(gen. pl. ~īnaṁ, = asala geval ættanṭa, Ja-pota) —.
Dhp-a I 240,19 (= ikbiti gevalaṭa, Rt; sgh. ikbiti, ekbiti
an-antara-gabbhan., the next tetrad; Abhidh-av 76,10. — °-ṭṭhapanā,
f., arranging in consecutive order; Vibh-a 492,3
(paṭhamuppannassa ~ā; = 'aṭṭhapanā'). — °-tā,
f.abstr.; ifc. v. addhâ°, kālâ°. — °-[a]ttabhāva,
m., the last (preceding) existence; Dhp-a IV 19,1.
— °-ttika, n., the next triplet; As 45,35. — °-[a]ttha,
m., the sense 'next', 'immediately'; ~e nipāto (scil.
'tato'), Pj II 378,18 (cf. Ja VI 224,28'); Nidd-a (Se) I
375,18 ad Nidd I 180,10 (=- <atha'). — [°-dvāre,
Ja V 231,23 w. r. for antara-dvāre[, — °-niruddha,
mfn., immediately ceased; Abhidh-av 134,20 (~ā citta-
cetasikā dhammā). — °-paccaya, m., immediate
cause; Tikap 2,23 (Tikap-a 13,18); Vism (532,12)
534,14; Abhidh-av 134,20 (synon.anantarûpanissaya);
Abhidh-s 37,12; Dukap 26,25 (abl. ~ā); Ps II 348,24;
352,6; — °-paccaya-kathā, f., title of Kv XIV,3 (p.
495—98). — °-paṭivissaka-ghara, n., the next-door
neighbour's house; Ja III 502,2. — °-peyyāla, m. or
n., a repetition of a certain formula (cf. peyyāla);
Vin V 101,25 (~aṁ nitthitaṁ; scil. 97,17 foll.); Ja VI
304,19' (~o; cf. ib. 301,1* foll.; 303,14* foll).
— °-bhaṇḍaka, (n.), Npr. of a ford in Mahāvāluka-
gaṅgā; Mhv LXXII 16 (so Geiger; Wijesinha: nāmen'
Antara-bhaṇḍake). — °-bhāva, m. abstr.; Tikap-a
13,18. — °-vatthu, n., the next (preceding) story;
Pv-a 92,8. — °-vāra, m., title of several paragraphs in
Dukap 45; 65; 97, etc. — °-vimokkha, m., immediate
emancipation; Thī-a 98,32; 99,1. — °-vutta, mfn.,
said immediately before, Sadd 334,1.
entry.re:
— °-sāmantaan-antara-gabbha-sāmanta,
m., nearest neighbour king; Ja II 21,9 (~o Kosala-
rājā).

— °-suttaan-antara-gabbha-sutta, n., the preceding sutta; Ud-a
435,3. — Cf. an-antarā (ind.) etc. below.

entry.sense:
n., not disappearance; sad-
dhammassa thitiyā a-sammosāya ~āya saṁvattati,
AN I 17,37; 59,6; II 148,12; III 177,2.

mfn., not concealed, not covered,
open, bare; loc. f. ~āya bhūmiyā, Vin III 14,17 (~
nipanno; = kenaci attharaṇena an-atthatāya, Sp);
MN II 57,25 (~ nipajji; = attharaṇena an-attha-
tāya, Ps); Pp 56,16 (~ haritûpa]ittāya [this a lectio
facilior for haritûpatta (sa. harita + upâkta), smeared
an-antarahitaseyyaṁ kappeti; = a-santhatāya, Pp-a) = MN I
343,35 = AN II 207,21 (Mp — Pp-a); Vin I 47,2 (na
. . . patto nikkhipitabbo).

ind. (an+ antarā. ind. ts.), (a) adv.
immediately after, next, then; tato aññā ~, It 53,9*
(It-a) = 104,10* (Ee anuttarā) = AN I 231,16*
(?uotedPsI 63,27*); Ap 61,2 = Thia (Ce) 393,18* (in
uninterrupted sequence); AN III 202,26 foll. ≠ SN III
96,3; Ja IV 11,15* (opp. paṭhamaṁ); V 377,20* (tato
pucchi ~); VI 224,17* (do.; = paṭisanthārânantarā
pañhaṁ pucchi, Ct.); Pv-a 97,22: ~ā eva vaṇṇa-
bhūtā, forming the castes immediately after?); ~
— (b) prp. with gen. (or abl.); Ja V 377,5* (Dhataraṭ-
ṭhass' ~, next to, beside); immediately after, Kv
495,2; Ja IV 12,5' (vācāya ~, Ed. antarā, cf. ib. 6'
an-antarāav 9,28 (cakkhu-viññāṇâdīnaṁ ~).

mfn., immediately preceding (cf.
atītânantara); ~e attabhāve, Ja II 243,17 (Ed. an-
tarâtīte) ≠ VI 273,27; pl. ~ā, Nidd-a (Ee) I 150,28
ad Nidd I 42,22* (= 'anantarā').

m(fn.), an abettor of (cul-
pable or responsible for) a cardinal crime (see ānan-
tariya-kamma); Kv 478,18 foll. (= yena khandha-
bhedato anantarā vipāka-dāyakaṁ mātughātâdi-
ānantariya-kammaṁ ānattaṁ, Kv-a).
entry.re:
— °-kathāan-antarā-payutta-kathā,
f., title of Kv XIII,3 (p. 478—9).

entry.sense:
mfn., unprevented (see antarāya);
f. ~ā, Sp (Se) II 544,1 ad Vin IV 280,18** (dasasu anta-
rāyesu ekenâpi antarāyena ~ā, = 'an-antarāyikinī',
q. v.). — ~ena, instr, (adv.), without obstacles (or
dangers), Tikap-a 366,12* ≠ Yam-a 107,11*; Vv-a
351,24; As 358,18 (~ena phaiadāyakăni, 'without
intervening (time)'), cf. Kv-a 141,11).

mfn., not subject to any obstacle
(or danger); Kkh ad Vin III 186,13 (~o ti yassa
dasasu [rāja-cora-, etc.] antarāyesu eko pi n'atthi;
cf. antarāya); ~ā āpatti, Vin V 115,6 (opp. anta-
rāyikā āpatti); cattāro ~ā dhammā (sabba-buddhā-
naṁ), Ss 17,5 (from Bv-a Ce 248,34); f. ~inī, v. next.

f. (from prec.), unprevented;
Vin IV 280,18** (cf. ib. 26'~îti asati antarāye; Sp, see
above under an-antarāya); for the termination °-ikinī
see Mogg III 34.

mfn., immediately eman-
cipated; Thī 105 (f. ~âsiṁ; = agga-maggassa anan-
tarā uppanna-vimokkhā āsiṁ, Thī-a).

or °-iya), mfn., see ānantarika
(°-iya).

m., immediate condition;
Abhidh-av 134,27 (synon, anantara-paccaya).

mfn., of endless glory; Ap
319,5 (~o amitayaso). Cf. ananta-teja(s), and Sv I
288,10*-13* = (III)877,17*-20* = Ud-a 336,31*-34*.
m., see antânanta-vāda.

mfn., of unlimited energy; Mil
331,26 (Bhagavā asamo +).

mfn., considering something
as infinite; m. ~ī lokasmiṁ viharati, DN I 23,1 foll.
an-anta-sannin

mfn. (an-anta + adīnava), of
manifold disadvantages or dangers; ~o kayo visa-
rukkha-samūpamo, Ap 467,13 (= Th-a Ce 423,29*)
= Ja I 146,27*; ~ā kāmā bahu-dukkhā mahā-visā,
Thī 358 (Thī-a).
m., see antânantika.

mfn., 'without pupils', metaph.
= free from internal impurity; ~aṁ (brahma-
cariyaṁ), SN IV 136,5, etc.; cf. anto vasanti, ib.
137,10 (= antovāsanaka-kilesa-virahitaṁ, Spk Se;
an-antevāsika

mfn., not included, not contained
in; Sadd 294,9 (°-sampadānattha).

mfn., not pleased; m. ~ī (+ anigho),
SN I 54,27*. a-nandin

mfn. [ts.], not blind, seeing; m. ~o,
MN I 512,5; Ud-a 366,19 (kāmā nāma ~am pi
andhaṁ karonti); ib. 366,24 (~ā andhā katā, =
'andhīkatā', cf. PāṇV 4,50); Mil 367,13 (~en' eva
andhena viya bhavitabbaṁ); Vin-vn 547 foll.
— °-karaṇa, mfn., making to see; It 82,22 (+ cakkhu-
an-andha

mfn., without effect; ~aṁ piyaṁ
vācaṁ, Sn 254 (= ananugataṁ, Pj).

mfn., whose mind is not
perplexed; gen. °-cetaso, Dhp 39 (= dosena appaṭi-
an-anvahata-cetas

mfn., = anapeta (q. v.), Sp &
Sp-t ad Vin I 359,8* (= 'an-uyyuta'); Mp III 27,3
Se (Ce — AN III 41,5); Ps ad MN III 25,23 (see
anapāya below).

mfn., without offspring, childless; pl.
~ā adāyādā tālāvatthu-bhavanti te, SN I 69,31* =
Ja V 267,21* (= apaccaṁ vā dāyādaṁ vā na labhanti,
Ct.).

mfn., according to Bu: 'who is
unable to discern (what is an offence)', or 'not setting
a good example' (Tr), or 'who does not keep to the
appointed route', opp. sapadānaṁ caramāno (see
apadāna, n.); avyatto āpatti-bahulo ~o gihisaṁ-
saṭṭho viharati, Vin I 321,38 (= apadāna-virahito,
apadānaṁ vuccati paricchedo [√dā3 = sa. √do, sa-
an-apadānaSp) = 114,20 = V 121,28.

mfn., without argument, absurd,
incongruous; a-nidhānavatiṁ vācaṁ . . . ~aṁ apari-
yantavatiṁ anattha-saṁhitaṁ, MN I 287,3 (= suttâ-
padesa-virahitaṁ, Ps) = III 48,15 = AN II 22,22
(= apadesa-rahitaṁ, Mp) = V 265,11. = 283,28.

mfn., not bent away; Paṭis II 206,17
(quoted Vism 386,14 ≠ Ud-a 186,4, in both places an-
upanataṁ against Vism-mhṭ; cf. MN I 386,22*).
— f.abstr. °-tā, Ss 75,15 (≠ Pj I 34,16: acapalatā).

[mfn., not incorrectÇ!); °-padavyañ-
jana, mfn., as to words and letters; Mp (Ce) 545,10
[vācāya] ~āya, = 'aneḷagalāya', AN II 51,10; Mp
(Se) reads aviparīta-vyañjanāya, but Mp-ṭ: a-patita-
padavyañjanāya = a-virahita-padavyañjanāya].
mfn., see an-ava-mata.

mfn. [ts.], innocent; acc. ~aṁ
Mil 186,16 (akārakaṁ +); Ja V 225,6' (= 'adū-
siyaṁ'); Ud-a 289,19. Cf. an-āparādha-kammanta.

mfn., (not thrown away), not
discarded, without disregard; Pv-a 135,15 (sādaraṁ
[Ee ādaraṁ] ~aṁ anavaññātaṁ katvā, = 'sakkac-
caṁ'; so Ce (see MN III 22,20), Ee an-āviddhaṁ,
codd. S1 S2 anupaviddhaṁ). an-apaviddha

mfn. [ts.], without aversion; anu-
pāyo +, MN III 25,23 foll. (Ps: anupāyo ti rāgava-
sena anupagamano, anapāyo tl paṭighavasena an-
apagato).

mfn. [ts.], not passing away; f.
chāyā va ~inī, Dhp 2 (quoted Mil 72,22); Th 1041
— 43; SN I 72,16*; ib. 19* = 93,10* (quoted Vv-a
74,1*); Ja VI 473,1*; MN II 135,24. an-apayin

mfn., not of neuter gender;
Kacc 85 (~āni, scil. liṅgāni).

mfn. [sa. an-apekṣaḷ, (a) free from
desire or longing, indifferent, careless, incurious (with
an-apekkhaTh 699 = AN III 347,5* (yena yen'eva gacchati ~o va
gacchati); Thī 282 (~ā va.gacchanti) ≠ SN I 236,16*;
Th 707 (n'atthi . . . dukkhaṁ ~assa); SN II 281,16
(kāmesu ~o); III 19,18 (rūpasmiṁ ~o hoti) = 87,31.;
V 164,3 (~ā tassaṁ disāyaṁ hoti); AN III 6,13 (~ā
dhātī tasmiṁ kumāre); 258,15 (~o pakkamati);
434,3 (kāye ca jīvite ~o hoti); Ja III 164,24' (an-
olokento ~kho cḥaḍḍetvā gaccheyya); ~kho pab-
bajasi, Ja V 179,21.* (acc); 180,23* (acc); 181,14*
(gen.); Ap 369,4 (kāmagedhe ~ā); Anāg 53 (~o mahā-
sukhe); Ud-a 81,35 (jīvite ~o); Ps II 213,33 (rukkhe
~ā). — (b) autonomous; °-padāni, Sadd 74,33* (said
of terms denoting the Buddha without the help of any
epitheton, cf. ib. 75,1-8). — °-tā, f. abstr., Ud-a 174,10
(jīvite ~); Ps I 126,17 (kāye ca jīvite ca ~āya).

f., the being of an indifferent
mind; ~āya . . . na aggahītaṁ, Mp III 30,16 (= 'an-
aggahītaṁ', AN III 50,2].*).

n. (cf. apekkhati), not looking
for; °-sīla, mfn., free from desire; Pj II 112,8 (~o
apihāluko nittaṇho; = 'an-apekkhamāno').

mfn. = an-apekkha; m.
~vā (kāmesu), Ja I 141,25* (= apekkhā-rahito
vigata-cchandarāgo nittaṇho, Ct.); pl. °-vanto [-kh-],
MN I 32,11 (sāmaññe) — 1116,14 = AN III 199,4.

mfn. [sa. anapekṣin] = an-
apekkha; acc. ~khinaṁ, Sn 166 (kāmesu) = SN I
16,8*; Sn 857 (do.; Nidd); SN II 281,20* [-kkh-]; gen.
~khino (kāmesu), Sn 823; pl. ~khino kāmasukham
pahāya, Dhp 346 = SN I 77,19* (-kkh-) - Ja III

mfn., not deviating from (abl.); AN
III 41,5 (gihidhammā ~o; Mp Se: gihidhammā an-
apagato (q. v.) ti akhaṇḍa-pañcasīlo hoti).

mfn., [sa. an-alpa] = next; Dăṭh IV 36
(kusala-phalam ~aṁ); cf. an-appa-rūpa & °-sokâtura
below.

mfn. (compar. of prec); Ps III
204,13 ad MN I 505,24 (— 'paṇītatara').

mfn., with a great retinue;
f. ~ā, Vv-a 80,24 (= 'amita-yasā').

mfn., = appameyya, im-
measurable (i. e. pameyya, grd. with double negation);
only Th 1089 (Gotamo ~o, a prose "mantra" in a
çloka-jagatī stanza (cf. appamāṇo Buddho, etc., AN
II 73,6 = Vin II 110,16); Th-a: pamāṇa-kara-kile-
an-a-ppameyya

mfn., not small, considerable,
excellent; vaṇṇo ~o, Ja III 521,28*; dhanaṁ lacchasi
'napparūpaṁ, Ja IV 337,6* (= lacchasi anapp°, Ct.);
lābhā vata me ~ā, Ja VI 355,10* (cf. Sn 31).

mfn., suffering excessive
pains; Mil 148,19 (pl. ~ā).

[mfn., not unkind, mild; Nidd-a II

[an-appiya

m. (1an-a + bhāva; cf. 3a (9)),
non-existence, annihilation; ~aṁ gameti, to eradicate,

133,1: anabhāva-katā honti, yathā nesaṁ pacchā-
bhāvo na hoti tathā katā honti (— anu abhāvaṁ
katā) . . . anabhāvaṁ gatā ti pi pāṭho (= anu abhā-
vaṁ gatā) . . . yathā anu-acchariyā an-acchariyā ti;
thus °-katā (the first reading of Bu. and that found
in most mss.) seems to be due to influence of the pre-
ceding tālâvatthukatā, °gatā being in accordance with
anabhāvaṁ gameti (above); as to k:g cf. kālagata:
°kata, Chandoka, indagu (Sadd 466 n. 4), ajakara, and

135,22 foll. (°-kataṁ; = anu abhāvaṁ gataṁ, Mp);

f., absence of covetousness; + avyā-

mfn., not covetous; DN I 139,1

ni. (neg. nomen agentis of

mfn., not known; AN I 46,18

mfn., not bent upon (passion);

n. (or f. ~ā), displeasure,disgust;

[f. = prec.; prob. w.r. for an-

an-abhinandita

mfn., not to be overcome,

mfn., unconquered; abhibhū ~o,

mfn., unlikely, unacceptable; Sadd

mfn., discontented, displeased, not

310,1; Mil 332,19;

entry.sense:
f., discontent, disaffection; (a) said

675,14 (tesaṁ . . . na attano ruciyā pabbajitānaṁ
~i uppajji); Dip XV 3 (anabhīrati, metr.). — °-jā-
taka, n., title of Jāt 65 (1301—302); of Jāt 185 (II

f., discontent; Abh 164 (kodhâ-

n. = an-abhiraddhi; Mp II

neg. abs., v. abhisameti.

mfn., having no clear

mfn. (neg. grd. of abhi-

n., the not being able to

mfn. (generally written an-abhis-

— II 87,2 (= na tāva abhisitto, Mp). Cf. acala-
