mfn., see an-abhisara.
mfn., see an-āmata.

mfn. [cf. anavarâgra, Mvu
I 34,1, etc., Divy 197,15, Vyu 37,10 (tib. = without
top and bottom: thog-ma daṅ tha-ma med pa, cf.
Dp 64,9 ad Mhbv 2,14: anavarâgra = ag-mul næti,
an-amat'-aggaanavarâgra is an adaptation of ≠ Amg aṇava(d)agga,
e. g. Bhagavatī I 1 § 18: anāïyaṁ aṇavadaggaṁ . . .
cāurantasaṁsārakantāraṁ (where Abhayadeva sees
*) an + avayagga [this said to mean anta; cf. the late
Ernst Leumann's suggestion, in a letter 2-V-28: an-
apavarga], or 2) an + avanatâgra (ɔ: an-āsannâgra),
or s) an + avagatâgra (o: aparicchinnâgra)]; — for
Western exegesis see Pischel § 251 note l and Sadd
396 note 10, where the editor suggests: an + amuto +
agga (as to suff. -to cf. ajjatagge) = "of which you
cannot say that it begins from there or there (ɔ: an-
ādima(t), or anādika)", with -a- for -u- under in-
fluence of the words quoted under ajjatagge, and
ushered in by the synonymous couple (a)-muta =
(a)-mata [see maññati, and cf. the gloss amata =
avidita below]; thus Amg aṇavadagga would be <
anamatagga, with v (v) for m after a syllable with
-n- (cf. Pischel § 251; MSL 1929,271); Pali Ct.s:
'not ending in [amata = amṛta ɔ:] Nibbāna', see
below; — this word is generally used as an epithet of the
saṁsāra: m. ~o 'yaṁ saṁsāro, pubbā koṭi (or pubba-
koṭi, cf. purimā koṭi, As 10,38 foll.) na paññāyati
.. . sattānaṁ . . . saṁsarataṁ, SN II 178,8 foll. (Spk:
anamataggo 'ti anu-amataggo, vassa-sataṁ vassa-
sahassaṁ ñāṇena anugantvā pi amataggo avidi-
taggo, nâssa sakkā ito vā eto vā aggaṁ jānituṁ,
aparicchinna-pubbâpara-koṭiko 'ti attho) = III
149,24 = 151,3 = V 226,2 ≠ V 441,3; Kv 29,19;
quoted Nidd II 273,29 (= avidita-koṭi, Nidd-a),
Dhp-a II 13,18; — As 11,8 (saṁsāra-sāgaro); n. ~aṁ
saṁsāravaṭṭaṁ, Vism 198,28 (= anu anu amataggaṁ,
aviññāta-koṭikaṁ, mhṭ); loc. ~e saṁsāre, Vism
481,27; Pj I 187,17; Ud-a 383,27 ≠ Dhp-a I 221,9;
III 176,7 (~asmiṁ saṁsāre); Ps III 236,19; Saddh
505; ~e vaṭṭa-dukkhe, Ps II 168,33 (Ee); ~asmiṁ
saṁsāra-vaṭṭe, Dhp-a I 11,2 (= anu-amato apari-
cchinno aggo yassa, Gp); Ps III 126,21; As 216,21.
— abl. ~ato saratha, Thī 496 (= aviditaggattā. Thī-a)
≠ 499; loc. ~e, Thī 495 (pitu maraṇe, etc.); 498
(~e [with ellipsis of saṁsāre] saṁsaranto).
— °-kathā, f., conversation about a°; ~aṁ kathesi,

gato'). — °-dhamma-desanā, f., moral instruction
about a°, Dhp-a II 32,15 (referring to SN II 187,6

m., not doing reverence;

mfn., (a) (prepared) without acid;

(m. or n.), distress; only in the comp.

m. [ts.], (a) neg. nomen actionis from

m. [ts.; cf. a-gati; na ayo ti anayo,

Sv) ≠Vin I 10,13; Ja I 233,10* (nânariyaṁ [ - - ˇ -]
karissāmi); II 280,17* (ariyo anariyaṁ [ - ˇ ˇ ] kub-
bānaṁ; Ct. as acc. m.: dussīlaṁ pāpadhammaṁ,
or as acc. n.\ hīnaṁ lāmakaṁ . . . kammaṁ); III
131,9* (anariyam [w —w] ariyena; = lāmakaṁ
pāpakammaṁ, Ct.); IV 41,29* (kataṁ ~aṁ Sākhena,
ˇ - ≃ ); 53,8* (scan anāriyaṁ parivajjemu sabbaṁ;
= ariya-garahitaṁ sabbaṁ asundaraṁ aparisud-
dhaṁ, Ct.); Mil 156,16 (chavakaṁ lāmakaṁ parit-
taṁ pāpaṁ +); 206,27 (~aṁ garahantī); m. ~o,
Vin I 10,13 = SN V 421,5 (hīno gammo pothujjaniko
~o anatthasaṁhito; = na visuddho, na vā ariyā-
naṁ santako, Spk); acc. ~aṁ, Th 48 (nâbhijānāmi
saṁkappaṁ ~[ ˇ - - ] dosasaṁhitaṁ) — 603 = 645;
Ja VI 63,16* (piṇḍaṁ luḷitaṁ ~ [ ˇ - - , or ˇ - ˇ - ;
= asundaraṁ); f. ~ā, MN I 161,35 (pariyesanā, cf. AN
II 247,18); MN III 113,14 (yâyaṁ kathā hīnā gamma
pothujjanikā +). — compar. n. anariyataraṁ, Ja V
375,26* ( ˇ - ˇ ˇ - ). — °-kathā, f., malicious talk;
Mp (Ee) II 313,3; — °-kamma, n., sinful deed; Ja IV
57,3* (here and in the foll. cpds. ˇ - ˇ ); — mfn.,
acting sinfully; Ja VI 206,8* (do., maccaṁ ~aṁ; =
pāpakammaṁ purisaṁ, Ct.). — °-guṇa, m., fault;
AN I 199,2* (Mp). — °-carita, n., mean practice; pl.
~āni, Ja V 453,20*- — °-dhamma, m., meanness;
~o + bāiadhammo, Nidd I 144,13 (+ bāla-dh°,
mūḷha-dh°, aññāṇa-dh°, amarā-vikkhepa-dh°); Ja V
375,27* (~[aṁ] avassito; query: anariya(ṁ) [ ˇ - - ]
dhammam assito?); — do. mfn., mean, base; acc.
~aṁ, Sn 782 (Nidd); loc. pl. ~esu saṭhesu, Ja III
12,6*. — °-pariyesanā, f., search for a°; catasso
~ā, AN II 247,18 (cf. MN I 161,35). — °-bhāva,
m. abstr., Ja V 360,10'.
entry.re:
— °-bhūmian-ariya-bhūmi, f., the stage
of an a°; Ud-a 47,25.

— °-maggaan-ariya-magga, m., the path of
an a° (cf. ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo); Ja III 131,19'.
— °-rūpa, mfn., mean, shameless; m. ~o, Ja V
48,11* (ahirikabhāvena ~o, Ct.); 87,3* (= ahirika-
sabhāvo, Ct.) = VI 306,24*; ~o puriso, Ja VI
414,13*; 437,28* (= asappurisa-jātiko nillajja-puriso,
Ct.); f. ~ā bhariyā, Ja IV 48,14* — 49,18*. — °-vo-
hāra, m., a wrong (unbecoming) expression (statement);
(aṭtha) ~ā (scil. aditthaṁ diṭṭhaṁ me, etc.), Vin
IV 2,16' (Sp); AN IV 307,2; Dlip-aIV 3,10; cattāro
~ā, DN III 232,5 (musā-vādo, etc.), 10 (aditthe
diṭtha-vāditā, etc.) = Vin V 125,9 = AN II 246,1;
DN III 232,16 (diṭṭhe adiṭṭha-vāditā, etc.; Sv) =
Vin V 125,12 = AN II 246,14.

— °-samyuttaan-ariya-samyutta, mfn.,
connected with a°; Ja V 360,12* (~e kamme).
— °-sukha, n., ignoble pleasure; MN I 454,14 (kāma-
sukham + ; = anariyehi sevita-sukhaṁ, Ps); AN I
81,12 (= puthujjana-sukhaṁ, Mp).

entry.sense:
m. [ts.], fire; Abh 33; Sadd 334,1*;
Ja V 63,18* (jalamāno caraṁ kacche ~o kaṇhavat-
tanī ghatâsano dhūmaketu; according to Ct. ib. 64,10'
= atitto (mfn.); thus from an + alaṁ [a not at all
improbable etymology, better than derivation from √an,
Tr.]); pl. ~ā, see 2anala. — Ifc. v. davâ°, nāga-
rogâ°, yugantâ°.

mfn. (according to Ct.s: an + alaṁ),
not to be satisfied, insatiate; f. pl. ~ā (scil. itthiyo;
at any rate the meaning 'fires' is alluded to, cf. Ja I
288,13*), Ja II 326,13* (= etāsaṁ na alaṁ, Ct.) =
IV 471,21* = V 451,1* (= tīhi dhammehi 'alan' ti
vacana-rahitā, Ct.); m. ~o, see *anala.

ind., not enough; MN 1455,1 foll.
(idaṁ kho ahaṁ . . . analan ti vadāmi); with dat.
(& gen. pers.) ~ ca me antarāyāya, MN II 257,13 ≠
259,10. Cf. prec.

mfn. [sa. *an-alaṁkṛta], 1. not
adorned, not prepared; Ap 600,21 (paṭhaviṁ na pas-
sām' ~aṁ); Ja II 276,5'; VI 488,16' foll. (D-Uhānam).
— 2. insatiated; m. pl. ~ā, SN I 15,21* (kāmesu ~;
= atittā apariyatta-jātā, Spk); cf. Sn 59: an-alaṁ-
karitvā (scil. kāma-sukhaṁ, etc.; = 'alan' ti akatvā,
Pj). an-alaṁkata

n., not finding satisfaction in;
Pj II 112,7 (see alaṁ-karoti).

[m., Ja V 213,28', read:
'aggi-sikhā' ti nala-jāla-kkhando, cf. Cks],

mfn. [ts.], not lazy, diligent, active,
energetic; f. utthāyikā [or better utthāhikā] ~ā, Thī
413; 415 (= akusīta, Thī-a) ≠ AN III 38,17* = IV
269,10*; Vin I 70,12 (na dakkho hoti na ~o); Vin
III 135,9 (kumārikā abhirūpā . . . dakkhā ~ā; =
an-alasakhunī . . . abhirūpā, etc., = ālasya-virahitā, Sp);
DN III 190,11 (dakkhā ... ~ā sabbakiccesu; =
nikkosajjā, Sv); 192,11* (uṭṭhānako! [cf. Ja VI
246,2; v. l. uṭṭhāhako] ~o; = nikkosajjo, Sv); 224,30
(dakkho + ~o sampajāno patissato; = sātacca-
kiriyāya ālasiya-virahito, Sv) = AN II 27.27 ( =
do., Mp) - Nidd I 497,4 (Nidd-a) = II 107,1 (Nidd-a);
SN I 44,18*,22* (acc. m. alasaṁ ~añ ca); AN III
37,29 (pl. dakkhā bhavissāma ~ā); IV 265,26 (f.
dakkhā hoti ~ā) ≠ 281,26 (m.) - 286,6; Ja III
402,9' (= 'atandito').
entry.re:
— °-tāan-alasa-tā, f. abstr.; Pj I 34,19;
Vv-a 229,21. Cf. an-ālassa.

— °-vatthaan-alla-vattha, mfn., with
dry clothes; Ud 91,33.

entry.sense: m., see an-ālāpa.

mfn., not sticking fast, detached; not
clinging to, or not devoted; [°-gatta, mfn., w. r. for
an-allagatta (q. v.), SN I 169,31* = 183,31*]; - °-tta,
n. abstr.; Ja IV 218,1' (abL cittena ~ā, from infidelity);
an-allīnafesting a state of detachment,

n. (or mfn.), not clinging to; Sp
(11)500,19 (°-bhāva).

mfn. (cf. ava + √kr), without elimi-
nation; Ps I 206,8 (kañci dhammaṁ ~aṁ karitvā,
not eliminating (not singly or partly, but in whole)
(ad MN I 47,23)) ≠ an-avakāriṁ karitvā, Vibh 393,6
foll. (prob, to read with B: an-avakārīkaritvā, cf.
an-avakārabhogaṁ katvā, ekekato agahetvā, Vibh-a 515,1, v. l.
anavakkārī, q. v.).

m. [sa. an-avakāça, mfn.; see also
an-okāsa], not place, non-place, impossibility; only in
the phrase: aṭṭhānaṁ etaṁ ~o, AN I 26,30 (Mp
II, 1,6); V 270,29 (quoted Pv-a 28,25), etc., see quo-
tations s. v. 2aṭṭhāna. — °-kāri(n), mfn., not occa-
sioning (quarrel); instr. ~inā, Mil 383,22 (an-adhi-
karaṇena +).
entry.re: — °-tāan-avakāsa-tā, f. abstr., ifc. v. aṭṭhāna-m-°.
— °-ttaan-avakāsa-tta, n. abstr., Sadd 294,13 (aṭṭhānatta+).

entry.sense: see an-āvakūla.

mfn., not trodden upon, not over-
come by or filled with (instr.); MN III 115,9 (pl. ~ā
pāpimatā; = Mārena an-okkantā, Ps); SN II 173,26
(dukkhâvakkantā ~ā sukhena) ≠ III 69,15.
— an-avakkanta

abs. [sa. *an-avaskarī-
kṛtya], v. r. for an-avakārī-karitvā (Vibh 393,6, see
an-avakāra above), mṭ ad Vibh-a 515,1.

mfn., not depreciated; Sv I 281,21
(= 'a-kkhitta').

m., the not understanding, the
being unknown; Mogg-v IV 30 (tadatthâ°; Pay); IV 41
(sambandhi-visesâ°; Pay).

mfn. [sa. an-avadya; haplol. from
*anavavadya; see avajja, sâvajja; for traditional
exegesis see Paṭis II 170,17 (quasi an-a-vajja, cf.
anabhāva)], irreproachable, blameless, faultless; Sn
p. 78,15 (vācā, na dubbhāsitā ~ā ca ananuvajjā ca
viññūnaṁ; Pj) — SN I 188,32 (Spk; quoted As 86,8)
an-avajjaV 6 (Pj); Th 698 (bhuñjati ~āni; opp. sâvajjāni, cf.
anavajja-piṇḍa); It 102,18 (cattāri ~āni) = AN II
26,31; It 103,7* (~ena tuṭṭhassa, cf. anavajja-piṇḍa
below) = AN II 27,10*; Pp 41,18 (puggalo ~o) ≠
AN II 136,12; Vin I 82,36 (yañ ca kappati yañ
ca ~aṁ) = 280,20; DN I 230,8 (bhūtā tacchā
dhammikā ~ā, scil. codanā); AN I 97,29 (dhammā
akusalā +; cf. IV 363,11); 104,16 (~ena kāya-
kammena, etc.) = 292,31; 294,9 (~o ca hoti ananu-
vajjo ca viññūnaṁ) = II 3,13; II 135,25 (sâvajjo
vajjabahulo appavajjo ~o); 192,10 (dhammā kusalā
~ā); [Ja VI 64,2* (bhakkho ~o, read anavayo,
q. v.; — anuavayo . . . anavayo paripuṇṇaguṇo, Ct.,
cf. anavajja-piṇḍa)]; Paṭis II 116,26 foll. (°aṭṭhena
bojjhaṅgā, etc.); ' Nidd I 178,19 (Nidd-a); 398,17
(Nidd-a); II 163,14 (Nidd-a); Dhp-a II 31,14 (opp.
sâvajja); Mil 229,18 (viññatti ~ā, opp. sâvajjā);
246,10 (~ā paṭipadā); 266,23 (gihīnaṁ ~aṁ). — Cf.
Tr. Notes p. 64 n. 20. — Ifc. v. sāvajjâ°. — — °-ka,
mfn., id.; Abhidh-av 2,10* (= 'kusala' ≠ As 62,32;
63,1). — °-kamma, n., blameless work; Nidd I 313,18
(ad Sn 900); pl. ~āni, Pj I 141,28; °-tā, f. abstr.,
ib. I 156,15. — °-guṇa, m., faultlessness; Vism
8,24*; Mil 140,11 (°-bah'ulatāya). — °-tā, f. abstr.;
Pp 25,9 ≠ MN I 10,13 (yātrā ca me bhavissati ~ā ca
phāsuvihāro; quoted Nidd I 240,31) = 273,28 — II
139,*2 = III 2,33 — 134,33 - SN IV 104,27 = 176,32
foll. = AN II 40,11 = 145,30 - IV 167,23.
— °-'ttha-pucchā, f., the question (or theme) of the
sense of a°; Nidd I 340,23 (+ nikkilesattha-p°, vodā-
nattha-p°). — °-dhamma, mfn., faultless; gen. pl.
~ānaṁ gāthānaṁ, Ja V 493,15; do. m., the quality
of a°; Ud-a 336,22,24. — °-pada, n., the right or
irreproachable track; Sn 88 (~āni sevamāno; i. e. the 37
bodha-pakkhiya-dhammā, Pj). — °-piṇḍa, m., un-
objectionable or allowable food (cf. anavajja-bhoji(n)
and It 103,1*); Ja V 252,23*(y./.); 253,14' (do.); 253,20'.
— °-bala, n., the power of faultlessness; AN II 142,3
(paññābalaṁ -√) = IV 363,8; 364,4-8; n'atthi kiñci
vajjan ti ~a, Paṭis II 170,17 — 176,25. — °-bhogi(n),
mfn., enjoying only allowable things (see anavajja-
piṇḍa and cf. Th 698); m. ~ī, Mil 362,3.
— °-bhoji(n), mfn., = prec; m. ~ī, Sn 47 (Pj;
Nidd (Nidd-a)); pl. ~ino, Pj II 94,17 (self-designa-
tion of some Paccekabuddhas: 'not particular about
food'). — °-bhoji-gāthā, f. =- Sn 47 (Pj II 94—95);
Pj II 109,29, — °-rasa, m., faultlessness; Vism 8,27.
entry.re:
— °-saṁkhātaan-avajja-saṁkhāta, mfn., named (so-called) a°; dhammā
~ā, AN IV 363,12. — °-saññi(n), mfn., considering
something to be a°; Sp I 213,21.

— °-sukhaan-avajja-sukha, n., the
feeling of perfect ease; ajjhattaṁ ~aṁ patisaṁvedeti,
DN I 70,5 (Sv) = MN I 180,26 = 269,1 - 346,10
= AN II 210,1 = V 206,10 = Pp 58,26; AN II 69,11
(atthi-sukhaṁ +); 70,11*; Saddh 436; Ud-a 321,6
(°âdhiṭṭhāna, n. keeping to ~); As 39,17 (°-vipāka-
lakkhaṇa); 63,18 (do.).

— °-madaan-avaññatti-mada, m., see an-
avaññāta-mada.

— °-saṁyuttaan-avaññatti-saṁyutta, mfn. = °-paṭi-
saṁyutta; It 73,3* (It-a).

entry.sense:
m. (cf. next), attainment
of regard; dat. ~āya + lābhasakkārasiloka-p°, AN II
143,16.
f., = 'an-avaññatti', It-a ad It 72,22.

mfn., not disregarded; Pj II 463,4
(jātiṁ ārabbha 'kim so' ti kenaci ~o; = 'a-kkhitto');
Sv ad DN III 153,18* (= 'an-avamata'); Pv-a 135,15
(sâdaraṁ anapaviddhaṁ ~aṁ katvā = 'sakkaccaṁ').
an-avaññātaVibh 345,6 (Ee an-avaññatti-m°; cf. 350,11, but see
Vibh-a 467,17).

n., instability, unsteadiness; Dhā-
tup 219 (giving the sense of √bham); Dhātum 314
(do.); cf. Sadd 426,3 (= sambhamo); Sp-ṭ ad Sp I
60,19 (~ato ito c'ito sandhāvati) ≠ pt ad Sv I 115,18
(ekasmiṁ sabhāve ~ato); instr. ~ena paribbhamanato
(restlessly), mhṭ ad Vism 16,24 (cf. Ud-a 223,30: an-
avadānena).

mfn. [sa. an-avasthita; sometimes
written an-avatthita, cf. 2an-avattha], unsteady, not
lasting; Ap 534,14 (ittaraṁ ~aṁ) = Thī-a 148,12*;
Spk II 208,17; Pv-a 87,34 (bhogā . . . ~ā tāva-kālikă
pahāya-gamanīyā, = 'na ... sassatā'); Nidd I 43,19*
= 119,1* (aññamaññaṁ ~ā ime [metre - ˇ - ≃ |
ˇ ˇ - ˇ - ˇ - ɔ: Vaitālīya b ≠ Rathoddhatā];
Nidd-a).
entry.re:
— °-cārikāan-avaṭṭhita-cārikā, f. (cf. an-avattha-cārikā),
wandering unsteadily (i. e. without staying long any-
where); dīgha-cārikaṁ ~aṁ anuyutto viharati, Nidd
an-avaṭṭhita°-citta, mfn., with restless, unsteady mind; gen.
~assa, Dhp 38(Dhp-a; quoted Ja I 400,21*); Ja III
73,28* (quoted Dhp-a II 23,1*).

— °-tāan-avaṭṭhita-tā, f. abstr.,
Thī-a 259,15.

entry.sense: m. Npr., see Anotatta.

mfn. [sa. an-avastha], = an-
avaṭṭhita (q. v.). — [anavatthâdi, Saddh 217 read
anna-vatthâdi].

neg. abs. of ava-tiṭṭhati, without
due consideration; ~ cintitaṁ (anisamma kataṁ +),
Ja IV 451,1* (Ct. na avatthapetvā, v. l. anavatth°).

[n., not interruption; instr. ~ena,
Ud-a 223,30 (~ paribbhamanato; prob. w. r. for an-
avaṭṭhānena, Se) ≠ mhṭ ad Vism 16,24 (reading
an-avaṭṭhānena)].

[mfn., Vv 929, w. r. (conj.) for
2an-anubodha, mfn. q. v.)].

mfn., not despised, esteemed; ~ena
guṇena, DN III 153,18* (— an-avaññātena; v. r.
an-apamadena = na apa-madena, na dīnena na
gabbitena, Sv (III) 929,6).

mfn., finished (master), experienced (in,
loc); (Tr. derived it [prob, under the influence of
Nirukta VI 11 ad RV VII 104,2: 'anavāyá'] from an-
avayava, with (haplol.) loss of one -va, = "in whom
there is nothing fragmentary", see Notes p. 65—66
(and n. 23); also an + *ava-vaya(s) [with haplol.] =
anavayafit the meaning, or perhaps better
mfn. [ts.], see an-āvara.

mfn. [ts.], uninterrupted; Abh 41
(~aṁ, ind.; satataṁ+).

mfn., not overflowing; Ja I
400,6' (= 'an-avaseka'); Nidd-a II 172,19 ad Nidd I
471,18* (do.).

mfn., not overflown, not bespattered,
not soiled; Ps II 214,8 (kilesehi °-sukhaṁ, = 'avyā-
seka-sukham').

n., 'not sinking down', non-ex-
haustion, activity, energy; kăyassa ~aṁ, Pj II 122,14.
Cf. osīdana.

mfn., not overflowing; samatitthikaṁ
~aṁ telapattaṁ yathā parihareyya, Ja I 400,1* (so
read with Se and Nidd-a Ce; Ee against metre anava-
sesakaṁ; — an-avasiñcanakaṁ a-parissavanakaṁ),
quoted Nidd I 471,18* (w. r. an-avasesaṁ; = an-
avasiñcanakam a-parisiñcanakaṁ, Ct.) and Ja III
an-avaseka

mfn., 'without remainder', all, com-
plete, altogether, or of which nothing is left, all done
away; Vin I 354,31 (~ā āpatti; opp. sâvasesa); II
88,27 (do., cf. Trsl. Ill 35, n. 2); 204,22 (do.); V 115,4,
etc. (do.), cf. AN I 21,1; 88,9; pl. ~ā, all, Sn 146
— Khp IX 4 (ye keci . . . ~ā; = sabbe pi, Pj); Vism
328,25 (= 'sabbaso'); n. aniyāmitavasena ~aṁ
pariyādiyati, Pj I 169,20 (= 'yaṁ kiñci', cf. an-
avasesa-pariyādāna, °-vacana, and °-vyāpaka); II
an-avasesafully, completely;

m., not overflowing, the not being
overfilled, or overwhelmed by (gen.); āyatiṁ ~, Vin II
89,22-24 (cf. V 92,22) = DN III 246,24-27 = MN II
246,9-12 = AN III 335,1-3 (pāpakassa vivādamū-
lassa); MN I 93,1 (navānaṁ kammānaṁ akaraṇā
āyatiṁ ~o) = II 214,10 foll.

mfn., 'not overflown', not leaking;
f. ~ā (nāvā), Ja IV 20,22* (= udaka-pavesanâbhā-
vena ~ā, Ct.); n. ~aṁ (kūṭaṁ), AN I 262,15; more
frequently metaph. — free from lust and moral defile-
ment; Sn 63 (~o apaṁiayhamano; = kilesa-anvās-
sava-virahito, Pj & Nidd-a); Th 154 (appa-lābho ~o;
taṇhâvassuti-abhāvena ~o, Ct.); MN III 221,11 (~o
ca viharati sato sampajāno; = patigha-avassavena
~o, Ps); SN IV 186,12—187,25; pl. ~ā, SN IV 70,28*
an-avassutaassutā? cf. āsava, assavati; = atintā, Spk); AN I
262,6 (kāyakammaṁ ~ aṁ; quoted As 68,32); IV
228,12* (sadā sato viharetha ~o); Ud-a 306,28 (kiie-
sehi ~o parisuddha-sīlo samāhito).
entry.re:
— °-cittaan-avassuta-citta, mfn.,
whose mind is free from defilement; gen. ~assa,
Dhp 39 (quoted Ja I 400,24*; = rāgena atintacit-
tassa, Dhp-a).

— °-pariyāyaan-avassuta-pariyāya, m., a discourse
about a°; title of SN IV 184,20—187,29 (quoted Nidd
II 85,3—86,11 (Nidd-a)). — See also an-ussuta.

entry.sense:
mfn. [by Tr. taken as vosita, pp. of
vyava + √so, with the negative prefix doubled; more
probably a blending of an-avasita [ts.] and an-osita
(q. v.), cf. ajjhavodahi, nirassajati), not fulfilled or
fixed, not determinated; only in the comp. °atta,
mfn., whose mind has no firm conviction or determina-
tion, Th 101 (hitvā gihitvaṁ ~o). Cf. av(y)ositatta.

mfn., not called, not summoned; ~o
tato agā, Ja III 165,1* (quoted Sadd 456,17, reading
anavhito; = anāhūto [so Ee; Se anabbhito] ayācito,
Ct.); pl. ~ā, Ap 331,13 = Th-a Ce 410,3; Pv-a 64,6
(~o = 'anabbhito').
n. [ts.], ifc. v. mahâ° (kitchen).
neg. abs., see as(a)nāti.

(or °sūyaka), etc., see an-usuy-
yaka, etc.

m., absence of rudeness (in speech);
Dhs 1341 (definition of khanti: adhivāsanatā acaṇ-
ḍikkaṁ ~o = Sv (III) 981,9; in As 396,3 explained
by su-rutta-vācā; cf. asuropa).

mfn., (a + nassana-
dhamma), imperishable; Ja IV 168,12 (kiñci saṁ-
khāragataṁ ~aṁ nāma n'atthi).

mfn. [sa. an-āçraya], without sup-
port; Vv 958 (v. r. for an-āyasa; = sukhassa appa-
tiṭṭhānabhūtaṁ, Vv-a 335,28).

mfn., disobedient; SN I 176,18*,31*
(puttā ~ā); Nidd I 37,22 (pl. ~ā + avacanakarā,
paṭiloma-vuttino, — ovādaṁ asuṇamānā, Nidd-a)
= II 195,10 (= vacanaṁ a-ssavanakā, Nidd-a);
mahallakassa . . . hatthapādā ~ā honti, Dhp-a I 7,1,
cf. 10*; Mp III 58,13 ad AN III 151,20 (kassaci
an-assavanāma hoti).

mfn., who cannot recover his
breath; uttanto ~o kālam akāsi, Vin III 84,22 ( =
nirassāso, Sp) — IV 110,33 (= upacchinna-assāsa-
ppassāsa-sañcāro, Sp); purisaṁ jīvantaṁ . . . jiyāya
~aṁ māretvā (i. e. to strangle), DN II 334,20-22.

aor. 1 sg. (perhaps for anasāsiṁ),
SN IV 43,17 foll. (= naṭṭho ahaṁ, Spk); see nassati.

mfn. [Buddh, sa. an-āçvāsika],
discouraging, comfortless, unreliable; DN II 198,20
(aniccā . . . addhuvā . . . ~ā . . . saṁkhārā; — assāsa-
virahitā, Sv) = SN II 191,15 = III 146,32 (Spk =
Sv) = AN IV 100,19 (— do. Mp); cattāri ~āni
an-assāsikahitāni, Ps); rūpaṁ . . . abalaṁ virāg(un)aṁ ~aṁ,
MN III 30,31 (Ps).
aor. 3 pl, see nassati.

mfn. (?), see SN IV 70,28* above
s. v. an-avassuta.

mfn. [sa. a-snāta], not bathed; m. ~o,
Ps II 137,22 (Se anhāto).

mfn., not decently at-
tired; pl. bhikkhū . . . dunnivatthā duppārutā ~ā
piṇḍāya caranti, Vin I 44,1 (= na ākappena sam
pannā, samaṇa-sāruppâcāra-virahitā, Sp); 60,24;
II 213,1; 215,1; f. ~ā (thūlaṅgapaccaṅgā +), Ja I
420,24.

m., not a receptacle for (gen.); Ja V
122,29' (lābha-yasa-sukhānaṁ ~o = 'anāyatanaṁ';
v. l. anācāro; as to 'āyatana' = ākara see Sadd
577,3, etc., Mp II 278.1; 279,24).

mfn., not lilted, not crowded; n. ~aṁ
(appasaddaṁ +), Ap 547,15; Mp ad AN VI 5,26
(= 'appakinnam'); m. pl. ~ā gahatthehi (scil. selā),
Th 1069.

mfn. [ts.], not beset, not crowded, not
confused; unembarrassed, calm, quiet; Abh 1035 ( =
ekagga); Sn 262 = Khp V 5 (~ā kammantā, 'a quiet
husbandry'; Th 1144 (~e tattha nage ramissasi);
Pj II 118,10 (rasa-visesesu ~o, explaining 'alolo');
Vin-vn 3 (~aṁ asaṅkiṇṇaṁ, scil. vinayassa viniccha-
yaṁ; cf. Pv-a 287,8*); As 429,20* (gen. pl. ~ānaṁ
an-ākula

mfn., not to be embarrassed;
Pv-a 118,1.

mfn. [ts.], 'not come', i. e. (1) future
(opp. atīta; cf. nâgata); Sn 373 (atītesu ~esu; scil.
pañca-kkhandḥesu, Pj); Th 950 (~amhi kālamhi);
978 (~a[ṁ]- mahabbhayaṁ); ~o addhā, DN III 216,16
= It 53,21 (cf. addha(n), (b)); acc. ~am addhānaṁ,
an-āgata106,3; gen. ~assa dukkhassa, Mil 80,30 foll.; loc.
~amhi addhāne, Bv II 73—75; Mil 90,10*; ~e
addhāne, Mil 94,23; rakkheyyânāgataṁ bhayaṁ, Ja
III 35,14* = 399,18* (Ee nâgataṁ bhayaṁ); III
399,1* (Ee do.); ~aṁ vādapathaṁ, MN II 10,5
(opp. uppannaṁ; — āgamanakaṁ, Ps); yam
~aṁ taṁ patinissaṭthaṁ, SN II 283,33; ~ā dhammā,
Dhs (p. 2,14); 1039. — (2) not yet arrived; Th 547
(~aṁ); DN II 75,11 (~ā arahanto); AN I 84,9 (~aṁ
bhāraṁ; Mp); Mil 116,22 (~ā yācakā; opp. āgatā);
147,25 (ye ~ā sabbe te agaṇitā). — (3) not learnt,
not told, not known; see an-āgatatta and an-
āgatattha below. — (4) (according to Ct.) not yet
passed away; Ja VI 221,13* (purime yāme ~e; =
pariyosānam appatte anatikka[ma]nte, Ct), cf. Ja
I 496,11* (aḍḍharatte ~e). — n. (subst.), (a) the
future; nom. ~aṁ dutiyo anto, AN III 400,1; acc.
~aṁ, MN III 187,21*; Ja VI 25,6* ≠ SN I 5,6* (cf.
Ud-a 229,5*, read na ppajappam anāg°, see v. l.);
Mil 194,17; Ja V 378,9* (kacci nânāgataṁ dīghaṁ
samavekkhasi; Ct); loc. ~e, Sn 697; 851; Kv 313,12
(ñāṇaṁ); Dhp-a I 83,22. — (b) in gramm. = the
(sense of the) future tense; Kacc 423; Mogg V 68.
— Ifc. v. atītâ°, āgatâ°, dasâhâ°.

m., the future; Dhs 1039 (~ena
sañgahitā rūpā, etc.); Vibh 1,22; ~aṁ ñāṇaṁ pesetvā,
Mp I 138,18 = 153,16 (here Ee anāgataṁ saññāṇaṁ
p°!); ~e ñāṇaṁ, knowledge as to the future, DN III
275,20 = °-ñāṇa, n., Tikap 156,2; 322,30; Abhidh-av
107,25*; 108,3*; 111,3*; Vism 434,12; Vibh-a 373,12
(°-catutthaṁ, cf. catuttha-jjhāna).

mfn., belonging to the future
tense; Sadd 49,31.

m., the future part of time;
As 393,4 (= 'aparanta')-
f., title of Kv V ch. 8.

n. abstr. of an-āgata (3); abl. ~ā
(ganthesu), Sās 121,1.

mfn. (cf. prec.), who has not
learnt the truth (cf. āgama); acc. m. ~aṁ, Sn 318
(= anadhigata-pariyatti-paṭivedhatthaṁ, Pj).
m., title of Mil 80,28—82,11 (Se).

f., a question about the future;
Nidd I 340,19 (atīta-pucchā + ).

f., longings as to the
future; instr, (abl.) ~āya + atītassânusocanā, SN I
5,8* (= anāgatassa patthanāya, Spk) = Ja VI
25,8*.

mfn., who has not attained the
fruit; Sadd 491,25 (āgataphalo + ~o, scil sāvako).

n., fear for the future, future
peril; MN I 305,24 (kāmesu ~aṁ); Ja IV 159,1 (~aṁ
anoloketvā); abl. ~ā, Ja III 35,15* (cf. anāgataṁ
bhayaṁ, ib. 14*; Ct. ib. iβ': dve ~āni diṭṭha-
dhammikañ c'eva samparāyikañ ca) = 399,19*
an-āgata-bhaya~āni, AN III 100,30 foll' ("Āraññikasutta" [Sutta-
saṅgaha ch. 84]; prob, alluded to in the Bhabra
Edict by the title Anāgatabhavāni, see Vin I p. XL
ni; JPTS 1896 p. 95—97;" R. Mookerji, Asoka
p. 118 & 218,1).
entry.re:
— °-hetukaan-āgata-bhaya-hetuka, mfn., caused by a°; Ja
III 35,19' (~aṁ bhayaṁ).

entry.sense:
[n., the future; loc. ~e,
Mil 126,3 (cf. addhāna & anāgata above)].

n., a form of the future tense;
Ps II 285,8 (Se anāgata-vacanaṁ, q. v.).

m., title of a short poetical
work, containing the history of the future Buddha
(Metteyya), said to be composed (in Ceylon) by Kas-
sapa, Gv 61,1. Edited by J. Minayeff, JPTS
1886 p. 33—53, and by E. Leumann, Maitreya-
Anāgata-vamsaby

n., the future tense (cf. anā-
gata-rūpa); Ps II 284,35.

m., connection with a
future (tense or meaning); Sp (II) 481,2-3 (Sp-t refers
to Pāṇ 1114,1).

mfn., bringing happiness
for the future; Ja III 169,10* (nâ ~o, scil. soko).

n. = anāgata-vacana;
°-kusala, mfn., versed in a°; Nett 33,1.

mfn., having the future as
object; Dhs (p. 2,15) 1042; 1417 (dhammā).
entry.re: — °-ka-thāan-āgatârammaṇa-ka-thā, f., title of Kv IX ch.l (p. 411—12).

entry.sense:
m., a non-returner; only (explain-
ing or replacing anāgāmi(n)) with acc. itthattaṁ
(q. v.): sg. ~ā, It 95,10; MN II 132,6; AN I 64,1
an-agantar

(or nâgama), m., non-arrival; n'atthi
maccussa ~o, Ja VI 82,29* (Ct.).

n., not coming, not returning; Ja
I 203,29 (asurānaṁ ~°atthāya, in order that they might
not return); 264,25 (°-bhāvaṁ); abl. °-to, Vibh-a 48,1.
— °-tā, f. abstr., Ja VI 151,1'.
entry.re:
— °-diṭṭhikaan-āgamana-diṭṭhika, mfn.,
not considering the retribution to come, ~o dānaṁ deti
(scil. asappuriso), MN III 22,21 (= no phala-pāṭi-
kaṁkhī [Ck °-paṭisaṁkhī] hutvā deti, Ps) = AN III
an-āgamana392,22 (= na kammañ ca phalañ ca saddahitvā deti,
Mp).

— °-sīlaan-āgamana-sīla, mfn., characterized by a°, Ud-a 306,9
(kāmalokaṁ ~o, = 'anāgāmī', °sīla giving the mean-
ing of stiff, -in).

entry.sense:
mfn., neg. grd. of āgacchati;
abhabbo ~aṁ vatthuṁ paccāgantuṁ, AN III 439,6
(= ananugantabbaṁ kāraṇaṁ, pañcannaṁ verānaṁ
dvāsaṭṭhiyā ca diṭṭhigatānam adhivacanaṁ, Mp).

mfn. (= an-āgu, sa. an-āgas),
without guilt, innocent; m. ~vā, Mhv XXXVII 115
(mahā-nāgo, cf. Nidd I 201,20).

m(f.) [ts.], a person who does not
return (to this world), i. e. who has attained the 3rd
stage of sanctification and only is born again in the
Brahma world before his entrance into Nibbāna
[~ī anāgantā itthattaṁ]; this term is sometimes
an-āgāmi— Vin III 87,28 (sotāpanno, sakadāgāmī, ~ī, arahā)
≠ II 161,15; Ud 56,24 (= paṭisandhi-gahaṇa-
vasena kāmalokaṁ anāgamana-sīlo, Ud-a); It 96,6*
(m. pl. ~ī); DN III 237,2]. (pañca ~ino: antarā-
parinibbāyī, etc.); 255,5; MN III 254,33 (~issa dā-
naṁ deti); SN I 149,15 = AN V 171,8; SN III
168,21 (instr. ~inā); V 200,19; 202,18; AN I 64,8 (~ī
hoti anāgantā itthattaṁ); It 95,11 (do.); AN II 160,1
(pl. ~ino, do.); V 85,3 foll. (sakadāgāmī vā ~ī vā
apaṇnakaṁ vā sotāpanno); Pp 16,20 (puggalo ~ī; cf.
KviÔ0,8 foll; Mil 103,31); Pp 37,19; 71,1; Paṭis II
194,5 (sakadāgāmissa paññā ~issa paññāya dure);
Yam I 268,26 (~issa mānânusayo anuseti); II 212,8;
Pj I 183,2 (catuvīsati ~ino); II 421,3 (pañcâbhiñño
~ī ahosi); 476,15 (Sahako nāma bhikkhu ~ī hutvā
Suddhāvāsesu uppanno, cf. Abhidh-s 25,6: ~ino [Ee
°ito] Suddhāvāsesu uppajjanti); Dhp-a I 380,11 (scil.
Chattapāṇi nāma upāsako); Vism 710,4 (tatiya magga-
paññaṁ bhāvetvā ~ī nāma hoti); — f. pl. ~iniyo
(upāsikā), Dhp-a I 222,1. — °-ariyasāvaka, m., a
noble (ɔ: buddhist) lay disciple of that stage, Dhp-a I
380,12 (~ānaṁ . . . uposatha-kammaṁ nāma n'atthi).
—°-upāsaka, m.,a lay disciple of that stage, Ja 1381,20
(Chattapāṇi, cf. Dhp-a I 380,10); f. ~ikā (scil. Gha-
raṇī), Dhp-a III 209,10; °-putta, m. (scil. Cūḷa-Anā-
thapiṇḍika), ib. 210,12. — °-tā, f., the state of an
a°; ditthe va dhamme aññā sati vā upādisese ~ā,
Sn p. 140,15 (Pj) = It 39,17 = MN I 62,37 foll.
(= anāgāmi-bhāva, Ps) = SN V 129,19 = 181,18 =
AN III 82,1 = 143,11 — V 108,15; ahaṁ vo pāṭi-
bhogo ~āya, It 1,6 foll.; mettā-cetovimutti ~āya
saṁvattati, AN V 300,13. — °-tthera-vatthu, n,.
title of Dhp-a III 288—90. — °-phala, n., the fruit
of 'the third path', the third among the four sāmañña-
phalāni: sotāpatti-phala +, Vin I 293,35; II 254,32;
III 93,10'; IV 26,6'; DN III 277,15; SN III 168,20;
AN III 272,31; IV 276,9; Vibh 335,21; Mil 35,28;
333,29; — SN V 177,27 (vyākataṁ); 178,15 (do.);
AN III 421,7 (sacchikātuṁ); Ps III 12,10 (paṭivid-
dhaṁ bhavissati); Dhp-a III 289,7 (pattaṁ); 318,17
(pāpuṇiṁsu); — °-phalatthika, mfn., desirous of
anāgāmi-phala; Ps III 12,9; — °-phala-sacchi-kiriyā, f., realization of anāgāmiphala; Vin II 240,16;
DN III 255,5; MN III 255,1; SN V 202,17; 411,9;
AN I 23,2; 44,34; IV 204,8; 292,14; Ud 56,24 (Ud-a);
Nett 189,34; — °-phal'-uppatti, f., arising of do.;
Vism 708,30; — °-phalûpanissaya, m., qualification
for do.; Dhp-a I 199,14; — °-bhāva, m. = anāgā-
mitā; Pj II 504,4; Ps 1302,1; It-a ad It 1,6;
— °-magga, m., the path of an a°; Nidd I 7,22 (Nidd-a);
Vibh 335,20; Dhp-a III 289,21; IV 148,17; Ps I 206,0;
As 376,26; Vism 672,9;
entry.re:
— °-magga-cittaan-āgāmi(n)-magga-citta, n., con-
sciousness of that path; Abhidh-s 4,11 (Abhidh-s-ṭ);

— °-sukhaan-āgāmi(n)-sukha, n., the happiness of an a°; Dhp-a III
400,1 (= 'nekkhamma-sukha').

entry.sense:
an-āgāri(n), an-āgārika, an-āgā-
riya, see an-agāra, etc.

mfn. [sa. an-āgas; cf. anāgava(t)],
sinless, blameless; ~u jhāyāmi asocamāno, SN I
123,7*.

mfn., not taking offence, without
anger; ~aṁ (sabrahmacārīsu, scil. cittaṁ), AN V 80,3
(= āghāta-virahitaṁ vikkhambhanena vihatâghā-
taṁ, Mp) = Vin II 249,1.

mfn., (a) without a master, not
dependent of a master; Nidd I 457,18 (Buddho ...
Bhagavā sayambhū ~o; Nidd-a); Pj I 193,28; Mil
236,20 (sayambhū Tathāgato ~o); Vin I 60,23 (bhik-
khu upajjhāyesu pakkantesu . . . ~ā anovadiya-
mānā ananusāsiyamānā, etc.); Ja VI 158,7 (porāṇaka-
paṇḍitā ~ā); Mil 105,2 (pacceka-buddhā . . . sayam-
an-ācariyakaSN IV 136,6 foll. (anantevāsikaṁ . . . brahmacariyaṁ
~aṁ; = ācaraṇaka-kilesa-virahitaṁ, Spk).

mfn., without master and
teacher; m. ~o (read anācariya-up°?), Ap 437,21 =
Th-a Ce 258,22*.

mfn. [ts.], immoral, unchaste; appa-
ssuto+ ~o, AN V 158,28; 161,7; Ap 30,20; bhikkhuṁ
bhinnâjīvaṁ ~aṁ pāpamittaṁ, etc., Mil 300,13; f.
~ā, Ap 613,10 (+ jina-sāsana-dūsikā); Ja I 495,28
(Ee anācārī, Se anācārā); f. pl. ~ā dubbatā [v. l.
dubbacā] pagabbhā, Ps II 95,28; [DN II 179,16 w. r.
1an-ācāra

m. [ts.]; (a) misconduct; (b) (euphem.)
immorality, adultery; ~aṁ ācarati (paron.) Vin I
56,34; 79,25; 85,18; II 9,31; III 177,15 (Sp); 179,32
... 182,17 (Sp); IV 144,10, etc.; Ja I 300,14 (~aṁ
ciṇṇadivase); 495,30; 496,5; IV 472,25 (tena saddhiṁ
~aṁ cari); ~aṁ karoti, Ja II 133,18; III 276,12
(udakasappena saddhiṁ ~aṁ akāsi); 278,8 (karosi);
Ap 430,10 (niyojito ~e); Vibh 246,19-27 (quoted Vism
17,3 foll.); duvidho ~o, kāyiko vācasiko ca, Vism
2an-ācāra

[mfn. = *an-acara; suggested by
Tr for an-ādhāraka (q. v., Ce Se anārādhaka), Ps
III 671,7 (ayaṁ puggalo apaṭipannako ~o, opp. lajjī
pesalo ācāra-sampanno).]

f. = 2an-ācāra (b); Dhp-a II
201,19.

[w.r. (B.) for ărā-cāri(n), q. v.;
as to Ja I 495,28, see 1an-acara]. [an-ācārin

mfn., not done, not practised; n. ~aṁ
Tathāgatena, Vin I 354,25 ≠ II 88,24 = 204,16 ≠
AN V 77,21 foll; °-divase, Ja I 300,16.

mfn., of inferior race; acc. pl. añña-
titthiye paribbājake ~e va samāne ājānīyā ti amañ-
ñimha, MN I 367,30 (as to traditional etym, see Ps:
gihivohāra-samucchedanassa kāraṇaṁ ajānanake).
entry.re:
— °-bhojanaan-ājānīya-bhojana, n., food (as it were) for (horses of)
inferior race; MN I 367,35 (~aṁ bhojimha; = kāra-
an-ājānīyabhojanaṁ, Ps).

entry.sense:
mfn., not proper to live upon;
~ena paribhogena, Ja V 469,25'( = 'avutti-paribh°').

mfn., = next; Nidd-a II 31,19 (ad
Nidd I 230,13; = 'an-ajjhiṭṭḥa'); Sp (II) 337,2.
— °-tta, n. abstr., ib. 8.

mfn., not claimed; Nidd-a (Ee) I
198,15 (ad Nidd I 68,9; = 'an-ajjhesita').
m. [ts.], shadow, coolness, MTD.

mfn., without ardour or energy; ~ī
an-ātāpinII 195,28 (= yaṁ viriyaṁ kilese ātapati tena rahito,
Spk) ≠ It 27,13 (It-a); It 27,20*; 115,16 (It-a) =
AN II 13,8 (= nibbiriyo, Mp); gen. ~ino, Ps I 243,25.

mfn. [ts.], free from sickness (or
nervousness, excitement), healthy; Dhp 198 (susukhaṁ
vata jīvāma āturesu ~ā; = kilesâturesu manussesu
nikkilesatāya ~ā, Dhp-a); Th 276 (vijānanti ca ye
dhammaṁ āturesu ~ā); SN III 1,18 (ātura-kāyassa
me sato cittam ~aṁ bhavissati); Pj II 495,4 (nicchāto
hoti ~o parama-titti-ppatto). — °-tā, f. abstr., Ja
I 366,3].' (explaining ārogya); As 151,12 (~ā + niggi-
lānatā). an-ātura

mfn. [ts.], without protector (master,
leader), helpless, deserted, destitute, poor, miserable;
SN I 61,15* (pl. apaviddhā ~ā; = appatiṭṭhā, Spk)
= 204,13*; AN V 23,12 (sanāthā viharatha mā ~ā,
dukkhaṁ ... anātho viharati) = 25,22; Ap 531,7
(acc. pl. f. ~āyo) - Thī-a 145,17*; Ja III 222,6 (f.
~ā); IV 377,9 (acc. f., kasmā mam ~aṁ katvā pab-
bajito si); V 18,23' (niravassayo ~o viya; = 'anā-
thamāno'); VI 10,24 (mā maṁ ~aṁ kari); Dhp-a I
78,7 (~o hoti nippaccayo); Pv-a 65,9 (vidhavā ~ā
honti). Cf. Sadd 366,5-20. — Ifc., v. nāthâ°.

f., = anātha-maraṇa; Ps
III 328,4 (anāthasālāyaṁ ~aṁ katvā nipanno); 686,21
(~aṁ karissati).

[n., Ja VI 515,1 (°gamane agate
disvā, paron.; read with BdLk anāthâgamanena, arriv-
ing as poor creatures).]

m., protector of the helpless, epithet
of the Buddha), untraced quotation in Sadd 508.32.

m. Npr. [cf. Anāthapiṇḍi(n);
Buddh, sa. also Anāthapiṇḍada], a surname of Sudatta
(q. v.), a wealthy merchant at Sāvatthī and a famous
lay disciple of the Buddha; this surname A° was due
to his great munificence (= 'feeder of the poor'), Abh
437; dāyakānaṁ [aggaṁ] Sudatto gahapati A°, AN I
26,3 (Mp I 384—5), cf. AN III 451,9; Pj I 111,28
Anāthapiṇdika

m. abstr. of a-nātha; As 193,12
(°dassana) ≠ Abhidh-av 21,25.

m. pl., poor people; Ps I
266,30 (anāthasālāyaṁ ~e disvā).

n., a miserable death (mostly
paron.: ~aṁ marati); Ja II 190,16; 191,22; IV 207,16;
VI 461,10; Mp III 301,17 (ad AN IV 283,6; explain-
ing 'ajaddhu-mārikaṁ marissati'). Cf. anātha-kāla-
kiriyā. anātha-maraṇa

mfn. (part, of *anāthati, denom,
of anātha (?), cf. √năth & √nādh); ~o upagāti nac-
cati, Ja V 16,1* (= nir-avassayo anātho viya, ib.
18,23', í. e. 'like a homeless wight').

m., a life out of house and hold;
~aṁ vasimha (paron.), Sp I 83,1 ≠ Mhv XVII 2
(read here with metre, v. lI., and Mhv-ṭ Ce: anāthavā-
sam avasimha) ≠ Mhbv 140,16.

n., a corpse left without se-
pulture; Sp II 154,37 (Ce) ad Vin I 20,34.

f., a rest house; loc. ~āyaṁ, Ps I
266,30; III 328,4; Pv-a 3,29 (cf. Ja VI 514,16 +
515,1-2).
n., see anātha-gamana.

m. [ts.], disrespect, contemptuous
neglect; Abh 172; in Sadd II (Dhātumāla) giving
the sense of √√aṭṭ, tand2, dhī, putth, roḷ, siṭ, sukkh,
suṭṭ, hīḷ, heḷ, hoḷ; in syntax (from Pāṇ 113,38) used
1an-ādaracases: Kacc-v 307 (~e chatthī vibhatti hoti sattamī
ca) = Rūp 308 (Sadd 725,8) ≠ Mogg II 37 (í. e.
'in spite of); cf. Sp-ṭ ad Sp I 55,9 (tassa passan-
tass'eva ti, ~e sāmi-vacanaṁ, tasmiṁ passante yevā
ti attho); Ud-a 382,19 (~e hi idaṁ sāmi-vacanaṁ;
ad Ud 79,9: Udenassa uyyānagatassa); 435,11 (ad
Ud 93,23); Ps II 170,32 (°-atthe sāmivacanaṁ; ad
MN I 163,29: akāmakānaṁ) = Sv I 284,17 (ad DN I
115,18); — °-vasena (adv. = contemptuously, indiffer-
ently), Pv-a 257,25.

mfn. [ts.], disrespectful, regardless,
indifferent, making no account; Vin IV 218,15** (uk-
khittaṁ bhikkhuṁ . . . ~aṁ apaṭikāraṁ akatasa-
hāyaṁ); 218,33' (= nâdiyati); Sn 247 (pl. ~ā; =
ādara-rahitā, Pj); It 34,17* (yato ca hoti pāpiccho
ahirīko ~o; = ādara-virahito, It-a); Ap 504,30 (pl.
jāti-tthaddhā ~ā); SN I 96,4* (micchā-diṭṭhi ~o);
AN II 23,14* (pāpa-diṭṭhi ~o); Ja IV 414,2 (rājā ~o
bhavissati); Pv-a 3,22 (samaṇa-brāhmaṇa-gurujanesu
~o; v. l. agāravo); 54,31 (pl. ~ā); 67,25 (f. sādhu-
janâcāra-rahitā ~ā).
entry.re:
— °-tāan-ādara-tā, f. abstr., Dhs 1325 ( =
anādāniyâkāro, As 393,23, read anādiyanâkāro, q. v.)
= Vibh 359,22 ≠ Pp 20,13 (anādariyatā).

— °-bhāvaan-ādara-bhāva,
m. abstr., Vibh-a 478,3 (= 'anādariyaṁ').

entry.sense:
n. (from 2an-ādara), disrespect, dis-
regard, carelessness; Vin IV 113,17** (~e pācittiyaṁ,
= anādarakaraṇe, Kkh, cf. anādaravṛtta, Vyu 261,82);
113,18-25'; I 176,21 (do.); ~am paṭicca, Vin IV 113,8;
185,20 foll. = 349,17 foll; Pp 20,13 (dovacassatā +)
= Dhs 1325 = Vibh 359,21; AN V 146,1 i foll. (+
dovacassatā, pāpamittatā); Vibh 371,1; Mil 266,11.
(~ena vā ajānanena vā). — Ifc. v. dhammâ°,
puggalâ°.

mfn., disrespectful; Pv-a 5,29 (so
CeEe; a clerical blending of anādariko (so v. l.) and
anādariyo?).
f., title of Vin-vn 1604—9.

f. abstr. = an-ādariya (q. v.),
Pp 20,14, etc.

[m., prob. w. r. for an-
ādiyanâkāra, q. v.; Vibh-a 499,26 (= 'an-ādaratā').]

n., title of Pācittiya
LIV (Vin IV 113—14).
see an-addā.
= an-ādāya, neg. abs. of ādiyati (q. v.).

n., not grasping, not desiring; Ja IV
354,21'; Ud-a 202,10 (°attha, m.); Ps III 442,2:1
(°-diṭṭhi, mfn. = 'a-daḷhadiṭṭhi' (q. v.)).

mfn., not grasping, free from desire;
vītataṇho ~o, Dhp 352 (= khandhâdisu niggahaṇo,
Dhp-a); Sn 741 = It 9,1* (It-a) - 109,18* = AN II
10,13* = Ja IV 354,14* (Ct: an-ādānena [see *an-
ādāna] ~o); Mil 342,14* (vītataṇhā~ā dhammanagare
2an-ādānaSn 1094 (Pj, Nidd-a); Sn 620 = Dhp 396 (= catūhi
upādānehi ~aṁ, Dhp-a); Sn 630 = Dhp 406 (sâdā-
nesu ~aṁ; Dhp-a) ≠ SN I 236,22* (pl. ~ā); gen.
~assa, Ja IV 372,2* (= niggahaṇassa, Ct.).

[m., prçb. w. r. for an-ādi-
yanâkāra (q. v.), As 393,22; cf. an-ādariyanâkāra.]
neg. abs. of ādiyati (q. v.).

an-ādāyitatta, v. l. for anad-
dāyanā, anaddāyitatta.

m., time without beginning, and mfn.:
having no beginning in time; °-tā, f. abstr., Ud-a
366,12 (vipula-visayatā +).
entry.re:
— °-ppavattaan-ādi-kāla-ppavatta, mfn.,
going on from eternity, Pj II 441,17 (~aṁ saṁsāra-
an-ādi-kāla°-bhāvita, mfn., fostered from eternity, Ud-a 194,19
(°ehi kilesehi āhitaṁ).

entry.sense:
mfn., not burst (or split); Vin-vn 562
(acchinnaṁ vā ~aṁ [Ed. °dinnaṁ] dhārentassa ticī-
varaṁ, cf. Vin I 297,29).
see an-ādiyitvā.

mfn., not taken (etc., see ādinna);
— °tta, n. abstr., Paṭis I 49,27 (Ee an-ādiṇṇattā).

mfn. [cf. sa. an-ādi], without be-
ginning; loc. ~mati saṁsāre, Ud-a 391,30 (cf. an-
an-adimat
neg. abs., v. ādiyati.

n., not accepting, want of regard;
As 393,21 (ovādaṁ °-vasena). — °-tā, f. abstr. (to
an-ād° used as an adj.), Pj II 516,29 (Buddhâdīnaṁ
vacanaṁ ~āya). — °-bhāva, m. abstr. (do.), Sp (II)
an-ādiyana

f. = prec; Vibh-a 499,28 (= 'an-
addā').
entry.re:
— °âkāraan-ādiyanâkāra, m., the mode of not accepting
(advice); Vibh-a 499,29 (= 'an-addāyanā'); As 393,22
(Ed. anādāniyâkāro; = 'anādaratā'); Vibh-a 499,26
(? Ee: anādariyanâkāra).

entry.sense: mfn., neg. part, of ādiyati, q. v.
neg. abs. of ādiyati, q. v.

mfn., not seeing the disad-
vantage (or danger); Vin III 18,3:1 (Sp).

mfn., — prec; m. ~ī,
Th 730—31 (so dukkhā na hi muccati); pl. ~ino
an-ādīnava-dassāvinSv) = MN I 173,28 (v. l.; = do., Ps) ≠ DN III
43,29 (sg. ~ī; Sv) ≠ AN I 274,21. = SN IV 332,28.

mfn. = prec, Saddh 409.
— °-tā, f. abstr., Ud-a 365,23.

mfn., not worth noticing; °-vācā
(tαZA-), AN IV 248,8 (°-saṁvattanika, mfn., leading
to ~; — agahetabba-vacanaṁ saṁvattati, Mp).

mfn., who does not insist on
(or stick to) his standpoint; asanditthi-parāmāsī +,
DN III 48,3 (see Sv (III) 839,13); MN I 97,14 foll. an-ādhāna-gāhin

mfn., without support; SN V 20,24
(kumbho ~o suppavattiyo; opp. sâdhāro); Vin II
113,23 (pattā ajjhokāse ~ā nikkhittā); unsettled:
n. ~aṁ (cittaṁ), SN V 20,26. — [°-ka, mfn., Ps III
671,1 (so Ck; see an-ārādhako).]

mfn., Mp ad AN IV 153,7,
see next.

mfn. (an + anugiddha, with
rhythm, lengthening), free from greed; Sn 86 (nibbānâ-
bhirato ~o [vaitālīya]; = kañci dhammaṁ taṇhā-
gedhena an-anugijjhanto, Pj); 778 (phassaṁ pariñ-
ñāya ~o [triṣṭubh]; — rūpādisu sabbadhammesu
agiddho, Pj; Nidd); — an-ănugiddha, Sn 144 (appa-
an-ănugiddhagiddho [çloka]).
neg. part., see anu-jānāti.
neg. part., see anu-tappati.

mfn. (an + anupassi(n), with
an-ānupassining; ayam aham [scan ayâham, cf. Nett 63 n. 3]
asmîti ~ī, Ud 74,17* (Ud-a), quoted Nett 63,20*.

mfn. (an + anupuṭṭha, with
rhythm, lengthening), not asked, not questioned; Sn 782
(~o ca paresa pāvā; = apucchito, Pj; Nidd (Nidd-a));
Ja IV 226,3* (yo attano dukkham ~o; = punappuna
puṭṭho, Ct. [as for anu-anu-puṭṭho]).

mfn. (an + anuyāyi(n) with
rhythm, lengthening), 'not following', i. e. who remains
firm and unshaken, without re-entering into saṁsāra
or yielding to passions; Sn 1071—72—73 (tiṭṭhe nu
so tattha ~ī; = a-vigacchamāno, Pj; = a-vedhamāno
an-ānuyāyinetc., Nidd).

mfn. (an + anuruddha with
rhythm, lengthening), not taking anyone's part; SN IV
71,16* (~o aviruddha kenaci; Spk).

mfn. (an + anuíoma with rhythm,
lengthening), improper, unsuitable; f. ~ā, DN II 273,1].*
(upapatti). Cf. an-anulomika.
mfn., see an-anuvajja.
neg. abs., see āpajjati.

n., the not getting into, not meeting
with; Mp III 227,7 ad AN IV 108,6 (tāsaṁ °atthāya,
= 'aparitassāya').
m., title of AN I 20—21.

f., unpunishableness; ~iṁ āpattîti dī-
peti.Vin I 354,29 = II 204,20 ≠ 88,25; AN I 20,15; V
78,23; Vin III 35,10 (~i asādiyantiyā); IV 35,19 (bīje
abījasaññī ~i); 142,21 (. . . ummattakassa ādikammi-
an-āpattietc., discussed Mil 158,19); AN I 84,27 (~iyā āpatti-
saññī), 31 (~iyā anāpatti-saññī); IV 140,8 foll. (~iṁ
jānātí); Ja III 486,24 (~îti vatvā) = Ps II 394,18;
Dhp-a I 54,12; Vism 69,25 (anatiritta-paccayā ~i);
Sp I 29,17 (Sp-ṭ); Vin-vn 545—50 (na karoti ~iṁ,
scil. andho). — °-ka, mfn., who has committed no
offence; suddha +, Vin I 114,30; 127,11; 314,21;
321,33. — °-kara, mfn., effecting no offence (o: pre-
venting guiltiness), Vin-vn 549; Sp I 281,12. — °-diṭṭhi,
mfn., considering (an offence) as no offence; Vin I
337,6 (pl. ~ino); Ja III 486,19 (tassā āpattiyā ~i
ahosi) = Ps II 394,8 ≠ Dhp-a I 54,6. — °-bahula,
mfn., who is not in the habit of offending; MN I
443,22 foll. (adhiccâpattiko +). — °-bhāva, m., the
state of not offending; Sp-ṭ ad Sp I 20,9 (~e pi aku-
sala-cetanā upalabbhati).
entry.re:
— °-vāraan-āpatti-vāra, m., the section
of a°, Sp-ṭ ad Sp I 29,17.

— °-saññi(an-āpatti-saññi(n), mfn., not
conscious of offence; AN I 84,27-31.

entry.sense:
mfn. (an + apara, with rhythm,
lengthening), 'with no other beyond', matchless; dīpaṁ
~aṁ, Sn 1094 (= apara-paṭibhāga-dīpa-virahitaṁ,
Pj & Nidd-a); cf nâpara, ib. 1089. Cf. an-āvara.

mfn. (an-aparādha
(q. v.) + kammanta, with rhythm, lengthening), whose
works do not give offence, acting without offence,
innocent, guiltless; Ja VI 477,14* (Fsb. °kamman
taṁ as from anaparādhakamma(n); = kāyika-kam-
mâdisu aparādha-rahitaṁ, Ct.).

mfn., being out of reach, not acces-
sible (to, gen.); cakkhu-viññāṇassa ~o, Ps II 101,7 ( =
'anidassano'); aññesaṁ ~o, Ps II 414,10. — °-gata,
mfn. id.; ~o luddassa (scil. āraññako mago), MN I
174,1]. (quoted Nidd II 148,30; = migaluddassa pa-
rammukhagato, Nidd-a), cf. MN I 174,16: adassanaṁ
gato pāpimato; pl. ~ā rūpâdayo, As 72,1. — °-ga-
tatta, n. abstr., Ps II 229,31 (rūpānaṁ ~ā). an-āpātha

(m)f(n)., according to Ct.: not taken
away, unmarried; loc. f. pl. ~āsu itthisu, Ja IV 178,3*
(= aññehi akatapariggahāsu, Ct.). Cf. āpāda &
apādāna.

ind. (neg. abs. of āpucchati, or a
short instr, from *an-āpucchā, f., cf. abhiññā, instr.
& abs., etc.), without having asked (for permission),
without paying regard to (acc. pers.); Vin I 50,11
(upajjhāyaṁ); 85,1 (upajjhāye); 243,29 (gahapatiṁ);
II 219,35 (vuḍḍhaṁ); IV 100,10* (cf. s. v. an-āmanta-
cāra); 165,17**, 33**; 166,11**, 15'; 226,31' (= 'anapalo-
an-āpucchā343,25**; MN I 106,34 foll. (so puggalo ~ pakkami-
tabbo nânubandhitabbo (cf. pahāya gamanīyo, etc.);
Ps) ≠ AN IV 366,14 (Ee pakkamitabbaṁ; Mp); Ja
I 368,6 (maṁ); III 326,22 (taṁ); Dhp-a I 81,6 (maṁ);
Nidd I 229,5 (anāpuccham pi (neg. part.); anāpuc-
châpi, Nidd-a); Pj I 242,18 (buḍḍhe); Mil 224,4 (~
yeva); Vism 18,24-35 (there bhikkhū); 115,31 (ācari-
yaṁ ~ va). Cf. sa. an-avapṛchya, JAs 1914, 521,10, etc.

mfn., not asked; Vin IV 272,29
(~e °-saññā, abl. f., in consciousness of that).

m., freedom from pain or trouble,
Pj II 29,14 (gunnaṁ makasâdīhi ~aṁ).

mfn. [ts.], free from pain or trouble,
unhurt; + anuppīḷa, Vv-a 351,23 (= 'akkhata').

mfn. (an + ābhata + udaka),
who has not fetched water; Ja V 201,26*.

m., lack of attention or interest,
disinclination; As 196,1. — mfn. [ts.], not enjoying,
disinclined; Kv 343,23 (= nirābhoga, Kv-a); Ps II
63,9 (anāvaṭṭano ~o, = 'anāvaṭṭī').
m., bamboo, MTD.

[ind., only Ja VI 443,24' (ādū ti anā-
matthe nipāto; read with Ck & Se nāmatthe (ɔ:
"synonymous with nāma"), cf. Ja III 499,16').]

mfn. [ts.], nameless; As 391,29 (yassa
nāmaṁ na jānanti tam pi ~o nāmā ti vadanti); f.
~ikā, see below.

mfn., untouched, not eaten up; Ja
I 98,25-26 (tiṇaṁ); Sp (II) 472,24 ("-piṇḍapāto =
apabbajitassa hatthato laddho attanā aññena vā
pabbajitena a-ggahita-aggo piṇḍapāto, Sp-ṭ); cf. an-
āmasita.

mfn. [cf. sa. an-ā-mṛta], where nobody
has died; n. n'atthi loke ~aṁ, Ja II 56,2* (4*) (Ct.:
an-amatan ti pi pāṭho (unmetrical), lokasmiṁ hi
an-amata-ṭṭhānaṁ a-susāna-ṭṭhānaṁ nāma n'atthiti
attho), quoted Dhp-a II 99,4*-6* (cf. Sadd 809,24 foll.).

(or an-āmantā), ind. (neg. abs. of
āmanteti), not having consulted or asked for permission
(cf. an-āpucchā above), Ja VI 266,28* (~akataṁ kam-
maṁ taṁ pacchā-m-anutappati; = an-āmantetvā,
Ct.); without announcing oneself (uninvited), Ja VI
an-āmantapetvā, Ct.).

m., going (for alms) without
having asked for permission; ~o + a-samādāna-cāro,
etc., Vin I 254,9; V 128,34; 205,6 (cf. Vin IV 100,9**
foll.: santaṁ bhikkhuṁ anāpucchā); ~e āpajjati,
Vin V 132,20 = AN III 259,1 (Mp, quoting Vin IV
100,9**). Cf. Vin-vn 2725 (anāmantâsamādānaṁ);
Utt-vn 620 (anāmantâsamādāna-caraṇaṁ).

mfn. [is.], not unwell or feeble, sound,
healthy (of body & of mind); m. ~o, Utt-vn 944
(but v. l. lasuṇādayo); f. ~ā, Vin I 294,19* (sukhinī
+ ); tasmiṁ homi ~ā, Ja III 260,15* (= niddukkhā,
nissokā, Ct.); sukhitā c'amhi ~ā, Vv 134 (= kāyika-
cetasika-dukkhâbhāvato ~ā arogā, Vv-a); sambodhi-
dhamme niyatā ~ā, Vv 155; apeta-sokā sukhitā+,
Vv 410. — n., health; Abh 331; kusalaṁ +, Ja V
323,16* ≠ VI 418,22*-24*; VI 515,6* foll; 584,11*;
kacci bhoto ~aṁ, Ja IV 427,27*; 428,1*. an-āmaya

mfn., (untouched), not taken into
consideration; Vv-a 113,30 (°-khettavisesaṁ).

mfn., not to be touched; Ja II
360,16' (n. pl. ~āni = 'anāmāsāni'; Ee anāmāse-
tabbāni).

mfn. = prec, Ja II 360,12* (°āni
āmasiṁ, paron.).
entry.re:
— °-dukkaṭaan-āmāsa-dukkaṭa, n., the fault of
touching something forbidden; Sp-ṭ ad Sp I 20,8 (keva-
laṁ lolatāya gaṇhantassa [scil. jātarūpa-rajataṁ]
~aṁ).

entry.sense:
f. [ts.], the ring-finger; Abh 266. Cf
a-nāmaka.

mfn., regardless of profit;
Saddh 521.

mfn., without guide; acc. pl. ~e, Ap
390,20 (vippanatthe [Th-a vipannaddhe] +) = Th-a
Ce 507,1*.
mfn. [ts.], short, MTD.
entry.re:
— °-bhadra-an-āyata-bhadra- .
katta, n., a luck of short duration (?)); Ja V 480,21'
(abl. ~ā; prob, better with C* an-āyati-°; Se āyatiṁ
abhaddakattā).

entry.sense:
n. [ts.], not the right place, an
unworthy object; Ja I 178,16 (paṇḍitā ~e pi viriyaṁ
akaṁsu, even in hopeless circumstances) = 180,25,
cf. 181,1; Ja I 251,3' (read anāyatane akāraṇe, =
'anatthe'; cf. 2a-kāraṇa (3)); Ja V 122,28' (~aṁ
vuccati lābha-yasa-sukhānaṁ anākaro, q. v.).
— °-bhūta, mfn., not a home (receptacle), unworthy, Ja
an-āyatanawith wrongly applied morality;

mfn., unlucky(1); Vv 958 (n'atthi
ettha āyo sukhaṁ (v. l. sukhassa āyo) ti anāyasaṁ
. . . attha vā na āyasan [Ce āyusan] ti anāyasaṁ
. . . anassayan ti ca keci paṭhanti, Vv-a; thus the
Ct. hesitates between 'unlucky, not of iron', and 'with-
out support' (sa. an+ āçraya)).

mfn., not asked; Nidd I 68,9 (apuṭ-
ṭha +; = 'anānupuṭṭha'); Nidd-a (Se) II 31,19 ad
Nidd I 229,5 (= 'an-ajjhiṭṭha').

mfn. [ts.], not grieving; upasanto ~o,
Th 1008; appakodho~o, Ap 312,25; m. pl. vītakodhā
~ā, AN IV 98,1* (= anupāyāsā, Mp).

mfn. [sa. an-āyuṣya], not imparting
long life; m. pl. ~ā (pañca dhammā), AN III 145,4
(= āyûpacchedanā, na .āyu-vaḍḍhanā, Mp).

mfn., not striving (as a swimmer);
SN I 1,22* (brāhmaṇaṁ parinibbutaṁ | appatiṭṭhaṁ
~aṁ; cf. nom. sg. an-āyūhaṁ, ib. 15 foll., neg. part,
m. of āyūhati).

m., non-watching; Pp 21,2 (agutti,
agopanā + ~o) = Dhs 1345 (As 401,20). — mfn.,
not watchful; AN I 174,12 (gen.pl. ~ānaṁ; = nirā-
rakkhānaṁ, Mp).
ind. [ts.], continually; Abh 41.

mfn., not yet begun, future; Mogg-v
VI 2 (~e atthe; = 'bhavissati').

mfn., free from damage or trouble
(scil. to different living creatures); vatthuṁ ~aṁ,
Vin III 149,14** (= na kipillikānaṁ vā āsayo hoti,
na upacikānaṁ vā hoti . . . na saṁsaraṇanissitaṁ
hoti, ib. 151,23'-25', cf. 6'-19'; = an-upaddavaṁ, Sp). 1an-ārambha

m. [ts.], (a) non-commencement,
not undertaking (of action [kamma]); ~e-vimutti,
mfn., 'liberated in non-exertion', Sn 745 (gen. ~ino;
= ~e nibbāne vimuttassa, Pj). — (b) not attacking,
not injuring (or killing); see the third of Asoka's Rock
Edicts (Girnar-Inscription, 5): prāṇānaṁ sādhu an-
ārambho; cf. ārambha, sârambha & prec. 2an-ārambha

mfn., (a) not having an object,
(b) without mental object; sabbaṁ rūpaṁ, etc.,
Dhs 584 ≠ 595; ~ā dhammā, Dhs (p. 5,10; As
49,24); 1186 ≠ 1509 (opp. sârammaṇa); Vibh 12,24;
Abhidh-s 28,2 (Abhidh-s-ṭ; 'not subjective, i. e. only
being object', see Trsl. p. 158 n. 5); anusayā ~ā, Kv
405,34 foll.; assāsa-passāsā ~ā, Paṭis I 170,32* foll.
entry.re: — °-ttaan-ārammaṇa-tta, n.abstr., As 347,15.

entry.sense: mfn., v. I. for an-araha, q. v.

mfn., not successful, not pleasing
(one who fails in satisfying [the bhikkhus]); Vin I
70,3 foll. Cf. ārādhaka. [Ps III 671,1, so C* Se; Ck
an-ādhāraka, by Tr. corr, to an-ācāraka, q. v.]; cf.
an-ārādhakabhikkhu)].

mfn., not to be approved; Vin I
70,29 (aññatitthiya-pubbassa ~asmiṁ); Ps II 381,13.
— °-bhāva, m. absír., Ps III 443,18.
mfn. (an + āriya), = an-ariya (q. v.).

mfn., who has not intered into, or
not been embodied in (acc.); pāḷiṁ (w. r. and misprint
paḷiyaṁ) ārūḷhaṁ ~aṁ ca, Sv (II) 636,1; Spk II
201,24; Sp ad Vin IV 15,9. — °-pubba, mfn.; Vism
an-ārūḷha

f., omission of announcement; Vin
II 34,1 (sahavāso, vippavāso +).

f. abstr. (cf. ālapana), failure to
persuade; abl. ~āya (Mārassa), MN I 331,31 (v. l.
anol°; = anullapanatāya, Ps).

mfn. [ts.], without hold; loc. n. appa-
tiṭṭhe ~e ko gambhīre na sīdati, Sn 173 (Pj) = SN
I 53,17* (Spk: heṭṭhā appatiṭṭhe upari ~e); appa-
tiṭṭhe ~e giriduggasmi, Ja V 70,12* (= ālambita-
[v. l. ālambitabba]-ṭṭhāna-rahite, Ct.); Ap 469,29
(appatiṭṭhaṁ ~aṁ duttaraṁ sīghavāhiniṁ, scil.
an-ālamba~o); Vetaraññe ~e, Ja VI 250,19*; ~e ākāse, Ja VI
305,27 (cf. ākāso nirālambo, Mil 295,17).
entry.re:
— °-caraan-ālamba-cara,
mfn., moving without support; pl. ~ā, Mil 343,15
(anālamba here possibly neg. abs.).

entry.sense:
mfn., lit. 'homeless, houseless', (a) in-
dependent, free from desire; f. ~ā, Ja III 260,29'
(aññattha ~); n. ~aṁ (= Nibbāṇa), Abh 6; m.
~o appadhano daliddo, Ja VI 360,28* (but cf. v. l.
Ck anāḷhiyo, not noted in Ee); Spk I 187,21 = 188,5
(= 'anoko'); Dhp-a I 317,18 (= 'anivesano'); loc. ~e
dhamme desiyamāne, AN II 131,32 (= ālayapaṭi-
pakkhe vivaṭṭanissite ariyadhamme, Mp). — (b) not
ambitious, impartial; m. ~o, Mhv XLII,42; XLVI,4.

m., 'the homeless state', freedom from
desire, epithet of Nibbāṇa; taṇhāya asesa-virāga-niro-
dho cāgo paṭinissaggo mutti ~o, Vin I 10,35; = SN
V 421,31; MN I 299,25; III 251,5; anokaṁ vuccati
~o, ālayato nikkhamitvā °-saṁkhātaṁ nibbāṇaṁ
paṭicca, etc., Dhp-a II 162,11; title of a sutta, SN IV
372,9. — Ifc. v. aniketâ°.
entry.re:
— °-gāmi(n)an-ālaya-gāmi(n), mfn.,
leading to Nibbāṇa; SN IV 372,11 (anālayañ ca vo
desissāmi ~iñ ca maggaṁ).

— °-c[ā/a]raan-ālaya-c[ā/a]ra or (belter?)
°-cāri(n), mfn., wandering homeless; Dhp-a IV 174,2-3
(= 'anokasāri(n)') ≠ Pj II 468,10.

entry.sense:
n. = next; Ja III 466,16' (°-cheka-
kusala-bhāva).

n., energy; AN V 136,20 (uṭṭhānaṁ~;
Ee and one MS anālassaṁ uṭṭhānaṁ, cf. ib. 6).

m. [ts.], not addressing, no conversa-
tion; DN II 141,15; Mil 57,16 (Ee an-allāpo (see
allāpa, sallāpa) tesaṁ aññamaññehi).
entry.re:
— °-karaṇaan-ālāpa-karaṇa,
n.; Sadd 507,9 (= 'apanayanaṁ').

entry.sense: [mfn., w. r. for an-ālhiya, q. v.]

mfn. (cf. ālinda), having no veran-
dah; Vin II 153,1 (vihārā ~ā honti apaṭissaraṇā); Sp
ad Vin II 153,3: s. v. osaraka).

mfn., not turbid, not disturbed; Nidd I
353,12 (so Nidd-a Se C; Nidd Ee a-hilito; = na kalalī-
bhūta).

mfn., without sight (or light); Mil
side 296,11 (nâhaṁ andho ~o); loc. (adv.) ~e, in the .
dark, Vin IV 268,32' (= 'appadīpe'); °-thāne, id.,
Spk III 264,20 ad SN V 123,34 (= 'andhakāre').

mfn. [sa. an-āḍhya, cf. 2aḍḍha], not
wealthy, poor; puriso daḷiddo assako ~o, MN I 450,34
(= na aḍdho, Ps); II 178,18 = AN III 384,11; AN
III 352,1 foll. (Ee anāḷiko, v. l. anāḷhiko, Se anaddhiko;
Mp: anaddhiko = na addhiko); pl. daḷiddā kapaṇā
~ā, Ja V 96,23* (= naāḷhikā, Ct.); cf. Ja VI 360,28*
(anālayo appadhano daḷiddo, Ck anāḷhiyo for an-
an-āḷhiya

mfn. (an + avakūla with rhythm,
lengthening), with no steep beaches; f. ~ā (Ee anāva-
kulā), Ja V 168,24* (said of a lotus pond, pokkharaṇī,
cf. Ct. ib. 169,1': anāvakūlā ti na avakūlā *a-khă-
nimā, ukkūla-vikūlabhāva-rahitā vā samasaṇṭhitā).

n., inattention, inadvertence; instr.
~ena, Ud-a 247,16.
entry.re: — °-tāan-āvajjana-tā, f. abstr. id., Ps III 85,5.

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. an-āvṛta], uncovered, (a) not
closed (or shut up), (wide) open, (β) not checked (cf.
anāvaraṇa); n.~aṁ, DN I 97,17 = 98,1 (api nu 'ssa
itthīsu āvaṭaṁ vā assa ~, would he be shut off or
not from the women); II 179,16 (read puṇḍarīkaṁ
an-āvaṭato all people; E
[mfn., w. r. for anāvaṭa, q. v.]
mfn. = next; Ps II 63,8.

sense.hi:
mfn., one who does not let himself be
an-āvaṭṭināvaṭṭati); MN I 91,30 (so n'eva tāva ~ī kāmesu hoti;
= anāvaṭṭano anābhogo na hoti, sâvaṭṭano sâbhogo
yeva hoti. Ps; cf. Kv 343,23, Kv-a 97,24-27.

entry.sense:
mfn., As 269,9 (kiriyamanodhātuyā
bhavaṅge ~e = 'before the adverting door-conscious-
ness has affected the subconscious life-continuum',
Expositor).

n. = next; only in comp. °-dham-
ma, mfn., Sv I 313,15 (Ee na āvatt°; Se an-āvatt°)
& °-sabhāva, mfn., Mp ad AN IV 402,13 (= 'an-
āvatti-dhamma').

f., not turning back; only in comp.
°-dhamma, mfn., not liable to return; opapātiko hoti
tattha-parinibbāyī ~o tasmā lokā, DN I 156,21 (=
tato brahmalokā puna paṭisandhi-vasena na āvat-
tana-dhammo, Sv (5e anāvattana-dhammo)) =1192,16
foll.= III 107,22 = 132,25 = MN I 34,9 (= anāvatti-
sabhāvo, Ps) = 465,23 = 490,33 = II 52,3 = 146,18
an-āvatti= 89,13 = IV 12,29 = V 343,29 = Pp 16,22 (Pp-a)
= 17,14 = 62,25 (quoted Vism 677,25); do. f. ~ā,
DN II 92,16 (= anāgamana-sabhāvā, Sv) = MN I
466,20 = SN V 357,2; do. m. pl. ~ā, MN III 80,27 =
SN V 406,16. — n, ~aṁ me cittaṁ kāmabhavāya,
AN IV 402,13 (= anāvattana-sabhāvaṁ, Mp) =
404,7.

mfn. (see āvāha), not admitted as
a partner in the āvāha ceremony, DN III 203,19
(amanussā ~aṁ pi naṁ kareyyuṁ avivayhaṁ ɔ:
excluded from connubium; = na āvāha-yuttaṁ, Sv).

mfn., uncovered, free from obstruc-
tion; SN V 97,3 (bojjhaṅgā ~ā anīvaraṇā cetaso
anajjhārūhā; Spk: kusaladhamme na āvarantîti ~ā)
= 126,4; ~aṁ ñāṇaṁ, Nett 99,30 (cf. anāvaṭa);
~aṁ passeyya samantā dvādasa-yojanaṁ, Anāg
107; — °-ñāna, n., all-pervading understanding; Paṭis
I 131,11 foll.'(quoted Sv I 100,5); Ud-a 144,81; Ja I
78,25 (+ sabbaññutañāṇa); Sp-ṭ ad Sp I 16,24 (~aṁ
sammāsambodhîti vuccati); Nidd II 80,28 (~aṁ
an-āvaraṇa'from whose grasp nothing is hid',

mfn., not to be outshone, who
cannot be overshadowed; cattāro . . . Tathāgatassa
kenaci ~ă guṇā, Mil 157,11.

mfn. (an + avasūra, with rhythm,
lengthening; cf. sa. utsūra & otsūryaṁ), as long as
the sun does not set, or whereupon the sun does not set;
Ja V 56,3* (= na avasūraṁ, anatthaṁgata-suriyaṁ,
Ct. ɔ: as if the sun had not set upon it, as a fresh
event). an-āvasūra
m., a cart-bullock, MTD (cf. 3ana).

m., (a) a place not fit for residence;
Vin I 134,26; II 22,31; 32,26 foll.; — (b) want of
residence; dat. ~āya, AN IV 345,2 (bhikkhūnaṁ ~āya
parisakkati); Vv-a 46,2 (Bhagavato ~āya parisak-
1an-āvāsa

mfn. (a) homeless; f. ~ā, Pv-a 80,22
(= 'anagārā'); — (b) uninhabited; Ja II 77,9 (gāmo
āvāso, ~o ti pucchi, but see 1an-āvāsa (a)).
neg. abs., see āvikaroti.

n., want of clear manifestation;
Pp 19,31 = 23,32 = Nidd I 79,26 = 378,26 (māyā
. . . anuttānikammaṁ +; = na pākaṭaṁ katvā
dassetîti ~aṁ, Nidd-a). an-āvikamma

[mfn., not neglected (cf. āvijjhati);
Pv-a 135,15 (sâdaraṁ [Ee ādaraṁ] ~aṁ anavaññā-
taṁ katvā, = 'sakkaccaṁ'), prob. w. r. for anapa-
viddhaṁ, so Ce, cf. v. l. anupaviddhaṁ.]

mfn. [ts.], not turbid, clear; undisturbed
(orig, said of water, and the citta); Sn 160—61 (cit-
taṁ); 483 (cittaṁ yassa ~aṁ); 515 (tiṇṇo samaṇo);
637 (candaṁ va vimalaṁ . . . vippasannaṁ ~aṁ,
Pj) - Dhp 413 (Dhp-a); Sn 1039 (manasā ~o
siyā); Dhp 82 (rahado); Thī 369 (acc. f. ~aṁ); Vv
20 (bhikkhuṁ vippasannaṁ ~aṁ); Ap 111,27 (pava-
an-āvilasannaṁ ~aṁ); 379,3 (cittaṁ); DN I 76,22 (maṇi
veḷuriyo); 84,14 (udaka-rahado; = nikkaddamo, Sv)
- MN II 22,5 = AN I 9,18; DN II 129,22 (nadikā);
SN I 169,29* (rahado; Spk) = 183,29*; III 83,20*
(cittaṁ tesaṁ ~aṁ); IV 118,10* (cittaṁ ca susamā-
hitaṁ vippasannaṁ ~aṁ); V 125,24 (udapatto accho
vippasanno ~o) = AN III 236,6; Ja I 339,24 (uda-
kaṁ . . . acchaṁ vippasannaṁ ~aṁ); III 157,11*
(vītasoko ~o); IV 351,28* (acchaṁ vāriṁ ~aṁ);
Paṭis I 49,21 (°aṭṭhena samādhi); Mil 35,1 (cittaṁ);
35,13 (udakaṁ); Sadd 882,3 (giving the sense of pa-)
≠ Pay fol. gū 5. — °-tta, n. abstr., AN I 9,26.
— °-pasann'-akkha, mfn., having clear and bright
eyes; Ap 312,18.
entry.re:
— °-lakkhaṇaan-āvila-lakkhaṇa, mfn., characterized
by calmness; Nett 28,9-11 (~o pasādo).

— °-sam-kappaan-āvila-sam-kappa, mfn., of undisturbed disposition; DN III
269,13—270,14-17 — AN V 30,1—31,17-20; Nidd I
21,9; Thī-a 297,3.

entry.sense:
mfn. (cf. āvasati), not dwelt in;
DN II 50,1 (°-pubbo; v. l. means anajjhāvuttha°, q. v.).

mfn., not destroying, not wasting; acc.
pl. m. ~e, Ja V 118,2' (so Cks; Bds & Se perhaps better
avināsake).

mfn., not eating; only m. pl. ~ā,
designation of a class of Brahman ascetics, Ja V 241,28*
(+ thaṇḍilaseyyakā); 243,27'; (in a comparison) Ja
V 17,23* (+thaṇḍiladukkhaseyyā; = nirāhārā, Ct.),
see anāsakā. — °-tta, n. abstr., the a° wow; Sn 249 (na
macchamaṁsaṁ nâ°; Pj). — °-maraṇa, n., death
an-āsaka

f. [sa. anāçaka, n ], fasting, abstaining
from food; Dhp 141 (nâ° + thaṇdilasāyikā; = bhatta-
paṭikkhepo, Dhp-a) ≠ Mvu III 412,16*; SN IV 118,1*
(+ do.; = ekāhadvīhâdi-vasena anāhārakā [so CeSe
Ee; prob. w.r. for anāhāratā], Spk).

mfn., trustworthy; Mhv LXVII 58
(jane 'nāsaṁka-sammate [Geiger's conjecture; mss.
nāsaka°, Wijesimha: nāyaka], acc. pl., considered
trustworthy).

mfn., not taken hold of, not attacked
(from ā-√sañj, or ā-sādeti, cf. adhivattha: adhivāseti?);
Ja V 446,17' (devena asatto ~o ayakkhagahitako,
not possessed by a demon).
entry.re:
— °-cittaan-āsatta-citta, mfn. [ā +
√sañj], with unaffected mind; f. ~ā, Thī-a 259,25 (=
'asaṅgamānasā')-

entry.sense:
n., an unseemly sitting (place); MN
111,2 = AN III 389,23 (~e nisinnaṁ (paron.); =
ayuttaṁ āsanaṁ, Ps & Mp); MN I 11,1 (quoted Ps I
63,2) = AN III 389,26.

mfn., not near; loc. (adv.) ~e, in the
distance, Nidd I 28,4 (dure + ; = na accanta-samīpe,
Nidd-a).
entry.re:
— °-varaan-āsanna-vara, mfn., one who is best when not
approached, f. pl. ~ā, Th 34 (= anāsannā anupagatā
dure eva vā ṭhitā hutvā vara ,. . hitāvahā, Ct.).

entry.sense:
neg. part, [ā + √çī], Pj II 365,3
(v. l. for an-āsasāna, q. v.).

mfn., 'free from intoxicants', i. e. free
from passions (see āsava); Sn 178 (sambuddhaṁ ogha-
tiṇṇaṁ ~aṁ) = 1145; DN II 261,10* (pavuttha-jātiṁ
akhilaṁ ogha-tiṇṇaṁ ~aṁ); Sn 212 (saṅgā pa-
muttaṁ akhilaṁ ~am); 219 (chinnaganthaṁ asitam
an-āsava(pl. ~āse); 1105 (katakiccaṁ ~aṁ) = Dhp 386 ≠
Ap 86,15 = Th-a (Ce) 499,13* ≠ Pv 214; Sn 1133
(~o sabbadukkhappahīno); AN I 273,14-33* = It
55,26*—56,10* (quoted Nidd I 58,3-5* = sabbâkusala-
ppahāna-vasena anāsava-muni, Nidd-a); Dhp 94 (pa-
hīnamānassa ~assa; — āsavānaṁ abhāvena ~assa,
Dhp-a); 126 (pl. parinibbanti ~ā); Vin II 148,4*
(yaṁ so dhammaṁ idhiaññāya parinibbāti ~o) =
164,37* quoted Ja I 94,4*; cf. SN IV 128,7* (parinib-
banti ~ā) & Vibh 426,14* (do.); AN IV 98 8*; Th
100 (parinibbissaty ~o); Ap 86,14 (nibbāyissaf ~o)
= 345,12; Th 900 (~o ca so hoti); Ud 23,33 (āsavā-
naṁ khayā ~aṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ . . .
upasampajja viharati; = pahīnâsavaṁ, Ud-a) = It
75,19 = 97,1 = Pp 27,11 foll. = Nidd II 160,26
(Nidd-a) ≠ SN II 214,19= 222,6; = DN I 156,24
= AN I 107,12 foll. - 123,23 foll. = 273,30
= 291,11 - 116,1 = 36,14 = 87,35 = 146,2 ≠
III 19,18 - 29,21; = 114,9 = IV 140,14 foll. =
314,24 foll. — V 10,20 foll. = 36,8 = Paṭis II 176,4;
— It 97,18* (bhikkhuṁ ~aṁ); Ja III 411,8* (acc. pl.
~e; = kāmâsava-virahite, Ct.). — DN II 144,20
(padhānaṁ anuyuñja khippaṁ hohisi ~o; quoted
Ud-a 16,31 and Sv I 10,8); III 112,9—113,9 (iddhi
~ā anupadhikā; = niddosā, Sv); MN III 72,16
(sammādiṭṭhi); 73,7 (sammāsaṁkappo); SN I 123,9*
(~o jhāyāmi [metre faulty; *jhāmi? cf. pajjhā[ya]ti,
Vin I 359,9*]; - nittaṇho, Spk); 130,23* (f. ~ā,
viharāmi) ≠ Ap 513,27 (Sadd 913,8); SN III 83,21*
(pl. brahmabhūtā ~ā); IV 206,3* = 218,23* (diṭṭhe
dhamme ~o); AN I 81,1 (~aṁ sukhaṁ; opp. sâsa-
vaṁ); — Paṭis II 40,38 (~o vimokkho, opp. sâsavo);
99,24 (~o hoti nirodhagocaro, a jagatī-pāda ≠
ib, 26); 117,12 (°aṭṭhena bojjhaṅgā, etc.); Dhs (p.
3,8; As 48,24); lioij 1104 (dhammā ~ā); 1451 (do.).
— n. ~aṁ, = Nibbāṇa, Abh 7; SN IV 369,3 (title
of the sutta ib.); 373,20* = Nett 55,6*.
entry.re:
— °-kathāan-āsava-kathā,
f., title of Kv IV ch. 3 (p. 271—274). — -gāmi(n),
mfn., leading to Nibbāna; SN IV 369,3 (~iṁ mag-
gaṁ).

— °-cittaan-āsava-citta, mfn., whose mind is free from
passions, MN III 72,18.

entry.sense:
mfn. (neg. part aor. of ā + √çaṁs),
not wishing, not hoping, not longing for anything;
Sn 369 (so nirāsayo ~o; in Pj CkfJn the doubtful
reading an-āsayāna (from ā + √çī). See āsasāna.

f., no hope (expectation or longing); acc.
~aṁ (karitvā), MN III 138,14 = 142,3; Ja III 101,21
(read ~aṁ katvā (āsaṁ) chinditvā pajahitvā); abl.
~āya, when having no hope, contrary to one's ex-
pectation, Vin I 259,13.

mfn. (neg. grd. of āsādeti), not
to be approached, not to be outraged; abl. kenaci ~to
durāsado, Vv-a 213,26; acc. Buddhaṁ ~aṁ āsāda-
yitvā, Mil 205,5.

mfn., where nothing needs to be
poured into, needing no condiment; Thī-a 61,7 (=
'asecanaka'); 168,22 (do.); Spk I 316,10; Sp (II)
403,28; 404,4; Mp III 85,8 ad AN III 238,1 (do.), cf.
Ps 1178,27.

f., lack of assiduous practice; Pj I
143,22 (+ abhāvanā, etc.).

mfn., not assiduously practised; AN
I 46,9 (+ abhāvita, etc.).

mfn., that has not been brought near
to, or conveyed to; Vin IV 195,1** (~e kabaḷe; = an-
āharite, Sp; anāgate ālope, JAs 1914, 553,1); Vin I
121,11 (~ā hoti pārisuddhi, scil. to the saṁgha).

n. [ts.], new cloth, not yet washed;
MTD. Cf. a-hata.

mfn. (neg. grd. of āharati), not
to be taken away; Dhp-a IV 206,13 (parehi ~aṁ).

mfn., not brought near to; Sp ad
Vin IV 195,1** (= 'anāhaṭa').

m., non-food, non-fuel, SN V 102,24
(nīvaraṇānaṁ āhārañ ca ~añ ca); 105,16 (~o an-
uppannassa kāmacchandassa uppādāya . . .).

mfn., taking no food, without food or
sustenance; Sn 985 (ussussati ~o); Th 702 (mahāgini
pajjalito ~o 'pasammati; = anindhano, Ct.); MN I
188,20 (tejodhātu ~ā nibbāyati; = appaccayā niru-
pādānā, Ps); 487,30 (~o nibbuto, scil. aggi); III
245,7 (~o nibbāyati, scil. telappadīpo) ≠ SN III
2an-āhāraAN IV 72,20 (~ā nibbāyeyya, scil. papaṭikā); V 113,6
(avijjaṁ . . . sâhāraṁ vadāmi no ~aṁ); Vibh 419,28
(Asaññasattā devā ahetukā~ā, etc.; quoted Pj I 77,16);
Nett 16,31 (viññāṇaṁ ~aṁ).
entry.re:
— °-kaan-āhāra-ka, mfn.(?), id.,
Spk ad SN IV 118,1* (= 'anāsakā', q. v.).

— °-tāan-āhāra-tā, f.
abstr., Ja IV 239,10 (tayo divase ~āya dubbalo).

entry.sense:
mfn., not called or summoned; Ja III
165,16' (E* an-āhuta; = 'anavhāta').

mfn., not near, far from (the goal);
— °-kāya, mfn., whose body is not present (scil. in
the forest mode of life); AN II 137,17 foll. — °-citta,
mfn., not present with one's mind, ib. (= an-upa-
viṭṭha-citta, Mp, but 'nikaṭṭhakāyo', ib. = niggata-
a-nikaṭṭha
part. v. nikāmeti.

mfn., [cf. v. l. SN I 9,6: a-nik-
a-nikīḷitāvinhas not yet enjoyed sensual pleasures in full;

neg. part, of nikubbati; not
cheating or defrauding; gen. m. ~ato (paresaṁ), Ja II
233,2*.

mfn., houseless; n. ~aṁ, the houseless
state, Sn 207 (+ asanthavaṁ; ubhayaṁ . . . nibbānas-
sâdhivacanaṁ, Pj; quoted Mil 211,7* foll., 385,29*);
≠ Ja VI 61,4* (Tr. proposes to read nâniketaṁ, and
Fsb. has another conjecture ib. note 4); Mil 244,11
(pabbajito appiccho hoti san-tuṭṭho . . . nirālayo
~o); SN I 199,22* (~ā viharanti bhikkhavo, cf. Mvu
III 421,7*: praviviktā), quoted Nidd 1494,24*.
— a-niketa(do.). — °-vāsi(n), mfn., dwelling houseless; Mil 201,17
(vanacāraṇo ~ī); 385,23.
entry.re:
— °-vihāraa-niketa-vihāra, m., houseless
life; Th 36 (sādhu sadā ~o; quoted Nidd I 494,26*).

— °-sāri(n)a-niketa-sāri(n), mfn., wandering about houseless; Sn 844
(okam pahāya ~ī; Pj; Nidd; quoted SN III 9,20* ét
Dhp-a I 289,5); Sn 970 (sekho ~ī; Pj & Nidd-a, reading
°-cārī; see above). Cf. vagga-sari(n)

— °ânālaya-karaṇa-pañhaa-niketânālaya-karaṇa-pañha, m., title of Mil 211—213 (only in Se
262,6; cf. santhava-pañha, ib. 291,1).

entry.sense:
n. (or ~ā, f.), not turning out,
not expelling or repudiating; Ja III 22,15 (imissā ~aṁ
karissāmi),
mfn., see a-nikkhanta.

mfn., 'not free from impurity',
impure; m. ~o, Dhp 9 (— rāgâdīhi kasāvehi sa-kasāvo,
Dhp-a) = Th 969 = Ja II 198,8* = V 50,26*.

mfn., not gone out, who has not left;
f. pl. ~ā (mānus(s)ikaṁ), Ap 597,13 (Ed. anikkantā,
v. l. (= Ce) atikkantā (surpassing), cf. DN II 175,25:
atikkantā mānusaṁ vaṇṇaṁ); Ja I 294,2' (mātu
kucchito °-kāle). — °-rājaka, mfn., from which the
a-nikkhanta(rājā sayani-gharā anikkhanto hoti; Sp (Se) II 480,2:
anikkhanto rājā ito 'ti anikkhanta-rājakaṁ; JAs
1914, 522,7: aniṣkrānte rājñi; cf. rājaka, n., Mogg
IV 69 (but see also Divy 543,21-25).

(mf)n., not going out; Dhp-a I
388,17 (bahi °-kulāni, families which do not ordinarily
go out).

mfn., not laid down, not put off;
°-kasāva, mfn., not free from impurity, v. l. for
aninnīta-kasāva, AN I 254,1 = avajjita-kasāva, Mp
Ee II 362,1. — °-chanda, mfn., with not slackened
will, assiduously striving; Nidd I 59,18 (Nidd-a) ≠
376,17 (Nidd-a). — °-chandatā, f.abstr.; Dhs 13
a-nikkhitta(Nidd-a); Dhs 1367 (= kusala-chandassa anikkhi-
panaṁ, As 408,1).
entry.re:
— °-dhuraa-nikkhitta-dhura, mfn., not refusing
the 'yoke", persevering; āraddhaviriyo . . . thāmavā
daḷhaparakkamo ~o kusalesu dhammesu, Ud 36,22
(= anorohita-dhuro [sic CeSeEe] anosakkita-viriyo,
Ud-a) = MN I 356,17 (Ps reading anoropita°) = II
95,26 = 128,24 = SN V 197,8 = 225,17 = AN
II 250,22 — IV 153,3= 154,30; cetasikaviriyavasena
~o, Pj II 236,9 (= 'dhuravā'); anikkhittachando +,
Nidd I 59,18, etc., see above.

— °-dhuratāa-nikkhitta-dhuratā, f.abstr.;
anikkhitta-chandatā +, Dhs 13, etc., see above.

entry.sense:
n., not laying down; As 408,1
(kusala-cchandassa).
m. [sa. an-ikṣu], a reed, MTD.

m., not a town, cf. 3a 2; MN II 98,1
(nigamā pi ~ā katā) ≠ AN I 160,1.

mfn., one who does not con-
ceal his schemes; vikiṇṇa-vācaṁ ~aṁ, Ja V 77,10*
(— apaṭicchannamantaṁ, Ct.).

mfn., from which the royal
ladies have not gone out; loc. ~e, Vin IV 160,15** (~e
ti mahesī sayani-gharā anikkhantā hoti, ib. 23'; Sp
(Se) II 480,4: ratanaṁ vuccati mahesī, nībhaṭan ti
nikkhantaṁ, anībhaṭam ratanaṁ ito ti anībhaṭa-
ratanakaṁ, thus the old reading was anībhaṭa or a-niggata-ratanaka

not aniggata; ≠ anirgṛhīteṣu (Divy 543,21:
aniṁṛteṣu) ratneṣu, JAs 1914, 522,7). Cf. a-anik-
khanta-rājaka & Vin Trsl. I 52 n. 2.

n., not going out, not leaving; abl.
~to, Vibh-a 48,2 (opp. anāgamanato).

mfn., ungovernable, licentious; loc. f.
pl. ~āsu, Ja V 435,23* (= niggahena vinetuṁ asak-
kuṇeyyāsu, Ct.).

mfn., not checked or refuted; AN
I 177,34 (+ a-saṅkiliṭṭha, an-upavajja, a-ppaṭi-
kuṭṭha; Mp: aññehi ~o, niggahetuṁ asakkuṇeyyo)-

(or anīgha), mfn., free from repugnance
(anger or resentment); unconcerned, not depressed, easy,
safe and sound (possibly a + nigha from ni + √han;
a-nighanigha, m. n. — dukkha, (b) from īgha (cf. sa. īhā,
nir-īha, an-ehas) = rāga, dosa, moha; Abh 89 gives
nīgha, m., which Abh-sūci explains thus: n'atthi adhi-
gamanatthaṁ īhā etthā ti nīgho, hassa gho, athavā
nihanti puññaṁ hiṁsatîti vā nīgho (nigho?) puññaṁ
nihanti gacchatîti vā; hence the frequent spelling
anīgha, which, however, in most cases is unmetrical
( ˇ ˇ - is possible always except Ja IV 424,21.* = V
359,29*, see below); cf. also Amg aṇiha, not afflicted
by anger, and see Weber, Ind. Sir. III 394; Morris,
JPTS 1891—3 p. 41 foll.); — Sn 17 (anigho +
tiṇṇakathaṁkatho visallo; C-mss anīgho against
metre; Pj: īghâbhāvato anīgho); 460 (santaṁ vidhū-
maṁ anighaṁ nirāsaṁ; Pj: dukkhâbhāvena ani-
ghaṁ); 491—2 (dantā vimuttā anighā nirāsā; Pj:
āyatiṁ vaṭṭadukkhâbhāvena); 534 (akathaṁkathiṁ
vimuttam anighaṁ sabbadhi; Pj: rāgâdīhi īghehi
anīgho); SN I 141,26* — Sn 1048 (santo vidhumo
anigho nirāso; Nidd: yass' ete nighā pahīnā so
vuccati anigho; Pj Se Nidd-a: rāgâdi-īgha-virahito)
quoted AN I 133,10* (= do. Mp)) ≠ Pv 541 (
— niddukkho, Pv-a); Sn 1060 (vītataṇho anigho
nirāso); 1078 (anighā nirāsā, Gkb anīghā); MN
III 69,25* (ye sattasārā anighā nirāsā; = nid-
dukkhā, Ps); SN I 12,12* (taṁ chinnaganthaṁ ani-
ghaṁ nirāsaṁ; = niddukkhaṁ, Spk) = 23,1*; Dhp
294—5 (. . . hantvā anīgho [ ˇ ≃ - ] yāti brāhmaṇo;
= niddukkho, Dhp-a) ≠ Th 745; Th 1234 (pl.
saṁyojana-bandhana-cchidā anīghā [ ˇ ˇ - ); Ud
76,27* (anīghaṁ [ ˇ ≃ - ] passa āyantaṁ chinnasotaṁ
abandhanaṁ; = niddukkhaṁ, Ud-a) = SN IV
291,22* (= do. Spk); It 97,20* (anīghaṁ [ ˇ ≃ - ]
chinna-saṁsayaṁ); 123,2* (esa khīṇâsavo Buddho
anīgho [do.] chinna-saṁsayo) = AN II 24,18*; MN
I 288,27 (ime sattā averā avyābajjhā anīghā sukhī
attānaṁ pariharantu, referred to in Ja II 62,6, Vism
309,23) = III 50,10 ≠ Paṭis II 130,26 foll. ≠ AN
I 193,1; cf. Mil 410,5; MN I 386,4* (dhīrassa . . .
anighassa, etc.); SN I 54,20*,22* (anigho ... atho
nandī na vijjati); ib. 27* (anandī anigho, cf. the
antithesis nandī: agha, ib., which seems to indicate
that anigho was taken = an-agha; see also Thī
491); Ja III 443,17* (akkodhano nicca-pasannacitto
ḷ anīgho [ ˇ ˇ - ]; = niddukkho, Ct.); V 343,8* (jīva
tvaṁ anigho ciraṁ); — Ja IV 424,21* (mā anīghāya
hāpesi, here the metre requires anīghāya, which might
be instr, of *anīghā, f., want of energy (cf. sa. an-
īhā); thus: don't give up on account of inactivity
(or indifference); Ct.: mā anīghāyā ti ito gantvā
pattabbāya niddukkhabhāvāya viriyaṁ mā hāpesi,
but cf. atthaṁ hāpeti) = V 359,29* (Ct. do.).

mfn. [sa. a-nitya], impermanent, in-
constant, transitory; Dhp 277 (sabbe saṁkhārā ~ā . . .
dukkhā, sabbe dhammā anattā) ≠ AN I 286,10 22 (Mp);
Th 183 (~āni gahakāni, metre faulty); 247 (~ā hi calā
saddhā); 1117 (~aṁ dukkhan ti vipassa); Thī 489 (~ā
addhuvā kāmā) = SN I 198,11*; Ap 563,20 (asu-
bha +); Ud 33,16 (sabb' ete bhavā ~ā dukkhā vipa-
riṇāmadhammā; Ud-a: udaya-bbaya-paṭipīḷitattā);
DN I 21,6 (mayaṁ tamhā kāyā cutā ~ā addhuvā
appâyukā cavanadhammā itthattaṁ āgatā) = III
31,26; DN I 36,32 (kāmā . . . ~ā dukkhā vipariṇāma-
dhammā; = abhāvaṭṭhena ~ā, Sv); II 66,30 (sukhā
pi . . . dukkhā pi . . . vedanā ~ā saṁkhatā paṭicca-
samuppannā, etc.; = abhāvato ~ā, Sv); II 140,10
(~ā saṁkhārā); SN III 96,27 ≠ IV 214.28; DN II
157,8* (~ā vata saṁkhārā uppāda-vayadhammino) =
199,6* = Ja I 392,19* = SN I 6,1* (Spk) = 158,31*
= II 193,13* = Th 1159= Dhp-a I 71,11* - Ps I
235,3*; MN I 232,34 (~aṁ, scil. rūpaṁ); 326,24
(~aṁ + addhuvaṁ, asassataṁ, akevalaṁ, cavana-

dhammā) ≠ AN V 84,24; MN III 18,20-26 (rūpaṁ
. . . viññāṇaṁ ~aṁ dukkhaṁ vipariṇāmadhammaṁ);
SN III 195,21 (aniccaṁ aniccan ti vuccati . ..);
MN III 271,19 foll. (~aṁ, scil. cakkhuṁ, etc.); SN
II 26,8 (jarāmaraṇaṁ ~aṁ; Spk); II 53,16 (vedanā
~ā, yad ~aṁ taṁ dukkhaṁ) = III 22,1, cf. AN

ib. ii, read °dhātu?] ~ā dukkhā vipariṇāmadhammā;
