+ addhuvā, anassāsikā) = AN IV 100,6; V 109,6
(rūpaṁ, etc. ≠ Mil 144,29); SN II 244,23 (cakkhuṁ,
etc., ~aṁ; — hutvā abhāvâkārena ~aṁ, Spk); III
76,18 (yaṁ ~aṁ tatra te (vo) chando pahātabbo)
≠ 177,27 = IV 148,28; III 85,23 (~ā ... mayaṁ,
+ addhuvā, asassatā) = AN II 33,25; SN IV 1,12
(cakkhuṁ, etc., ~aṁ, yad ~aṁ taṁ dukkhaṁ; quoted
Vism 640,19); SN IV 4,2 (cakkhuṁ ~aṁ atītânāga-
taṁ); 5,12 (rūpā, etc., ~ā); 67,28 (cakkhu ~aṁ
vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi); 131,5; V 345,25 (~e
dukkhasaññī); DN III 243,1 (~e dukkhasaññā; Sv);
AN V 105,25 (do.); AN II 52,20* (~e niccasaññino
= Paṭis II 80,25*); 28* (~aṁ ~ato dakkhuṁ = Paṭis
II 81,6*); V 343,24 foll. (~aṁ + nirodhadhammaṁ);
Ja I 236,26 (aniccaṁ dukkhaṁ anattā, allusion to Dhp
277) = II 447,12 ≠ Dhp-a I 379,23 ≠ Ja I 275,22';
Mil 39,11; Ja I 393,2' (sabbe p'ime ~ā khaṇikā ittarā,
etc.); II 185,16' (read: pañca kkhandhā aniccā ti);
III 57,13 (sabbe saṁkhārā ~ā, hutvā na honti);
IV 51,12 (nanu ~ā sabbe saṁkhārā, hutvā abhāvino);
Vibh 12,34 (~aṁ jarâbhibhūtaṁ, scil. sabbaṁ rūpaṁ)
≠ 319,17; 70,1 foll. (cakkhuṁ, etc., ~aṁ dukkhaṁ
anattā vipariṇāmadhammaṁ); 324,37 (rūpaṁ, etc.,
~aṁ) ≠ 328,24; Paṭis I 191,32 (pañca kkhandhā ~ā);
Vism 290,6 (~an ti pañca kkhandhā); Ps II 298,33
(do.); Pv-a 60,15 (na cirakālaṭṭhāyi ~aṁ vipariṇāma-
dhammaṁ; — 'ittaraṁ'); — abl. ~ato (adv.), Th 1091
(~ sabbabhavaṁ vipassaṁ); 1131 (satthā ca me
lokam imaṁ adhiṭṭhahi ~ addhuvato asārato); It
a-niccaNidd I 53,1 (tīreti; Nidd-a); MN I 435,33 (samanupas-
sati); 500,3 (samanupassitabbo); SN II 110,26(addak-
khuṁ); III 167,26 (manasikattabbā; Spk); Paṭis I
53,6 (sabbaṁ rūpaṁ ~ vavattheti; quoted Vism 607,27);
II 28,22 (~ upaṭṭhānakusalo hoti); 48,17-21 (~ ma-
nasikaroto . . . khayato saṁkhārā upaṭṭhahanti);
232,11 (paṭhavīkāyaṁ ~ anupassati; cf. Ps 1243,6).
— In the title of several suttas: SN III 21; 76; 177
— 78; 195; 199; 200; IV 4—5; 28; 152—55; 214; V
132. — °-kammaṭṭhānika, mfn., meditating on a°,
Mp III 222,21 ad AN IV 100,5 (~ānaṁ pañcannaṁ
bhikkhusatānaṁ). — °ṭṭha, mfn., [anicca + 1aṭṭhaj,
falling under the notion of a°; Paṭis I 131,27 foll.
(n. ~aṁ). — °-tā, f. abstr., MN I 185,30; 488,28
(instr.-abl. °ā; = aniccatāya, Ps); III 217,30 (rū-
pānaṁ ~aṁ viditvā); SN I 61,11* (loke ~aṁ ñatvā)
= 204,9*; III 43,4 foll. (rūpassa, etc., ~aṁ viditvā);
IV 325,1 = Nidd I 5,2 (Nidd-a); Nidd I 410,19
(~āya jātiyā anugatā; Nidd-a); Ud-a 291,11* (~aṁ
khaya-vayataṁ viditvā); Ja III 159,1' (°vasena);
rūpassa ~ā, Dhs 596; 645; 738; 871; 872; Abhidh-s
27,20 (rūpassa upacayo santati jaratā ~ā); Vism
290,8; MhvXX,57 (~ā sabbaloka-vināsinī). — Title
of suttas SN III 44—45; 155. — Ifc. v, cakkh°,
jivhâ°, dhammâ°, manâ°, rūpâ°. — °-tākathā,
f., title of Kv XI ch. 8 (p. 460—462). — °-tâkāra,
m., the notion or aspect of impermanence; Ja III 97,3.
entry.re:
— °-ttaa-nicca-tta, n. abstr., Ap 64,14 = Th-a (Ce) 478,16*.
— °-dassāvi(n), mfn., v. l. for adhicca-dassavi(n), q. v.
— [°-dukkhamanattā, Ja I 48,28 read " anicca ;ṁ)
dukkham anattā" ti ... cf. Dhp-a I 379,24.]
— °-dhamrṇa, mfn., impermanent by nature (or m. the
perishable thing); SN III 195,28 foll.

— °-paṭisaṁ-vedi(n)a-nicca-paṭisaṁ-vedi(n), mfn., feeling the impermanence (of every-
thing); AN IV 13,15 foll. (aniccânupassī, anicca-saññī
+ ) ≠ 145,20 foll.

entry.sense:
mfn., not firm; °-buddhi, mfn.,
having no firm understanding; gen. ~ino, Ja IV 429,13'
(= 'saṁhīrapaññassa'; v. l. B. niccaṁ phalanabud-
dhino [i. e. calanab°]).

n., the characteristic of imper-
manence (cf. ti-lakkhana); Abhidh-s 43,32 (~aṁ +
dukkha-l°, anatta-l°); Vism 640,13 (do.); Pj II 246,16
(dukkha-lakkhaṇaṁ +); Dhp-a III 405,8; Ud-a
236,13; Mp III 224,21; Vibh-a 50,(i), 15. — Title of
Tel 29—43.
entry.re: — °-vatthuanicca-lakkhaṇa-vatthu, n., title of Dhp-a III 405—6.

entry.sense:
m., title of SN III 21—25; IV
1—6; 28—30.

f., the conception of a°; Thī 481
(~ā su-bhāveti; = ~ā suṭṭhu bhāveti, Thī-a; the
plural implying dukkhasaññā, etc, cf. Thī-a 286,26);
Ud 37,18 (Ud-a); Ap 64,19 (bhāvayâniccasaññ' ahaṁ)
= Th-a (Ce) 478,21*; Ap 274,5 = 385,1 (~aṁ ug-
anicca-saññāsaññaṁ, asubha-s°, ādīnava-s°, etc.), cf. III 253,3
= 283,1 (satta saññā); III 243,3 (~ā + anicce
dukkha-saññā; Sv) = 251,9; 289,28 (nava saññā:
asubha-s° +); 291,9 (dasa saññā); SN III 155,15
(Spk); V 132,10; AN III 79,22; 85,19 (Mp); 334,1
(Mp); 452,14; IV 51,11; 353,11; 396,1; V 106,5;
109,1; 111,8; 310,3; Pv-a 62,16, etc.; Nett 27,18;
Saddh 490—92.
entry.re:
— °-bhāvanânuyogaanicca-saññā-bhāvanânuyoga, m., the ap-
plying oneself to promote a°, MN III 82,13 (~aṁ
anuyuttā, paron.). — °ânuloma, mfn., adaptable to
a°; Nidd I 193,26 (aniccaṁ vā ~aṁ vā; Nidd-a). __
°-paricita, mfn., familiar with a°; AN IV 51,14
foll. (~ena . . . cetasā; quoted Ps II 420,9).

entry.sense:
mfn. from prec; m. ~ī, AN
IV 13,15 foll. (aniccânupassī +); 145,20 (do.); gen.
~ino, Ud 37,19 (Ud-a); AN IV 353,12; etc.

mfn., produced from some-
thing impermanent; SN IV 129,32 (~aṁ cakkhuṁ).

f. abstr. (cf. sādhana), the
having (only) something impermanent as result; Ja V
100,23' (read: kasmā: ~āya, matassâpi hi . . ., etc.).
aniccâkāra, m., the aspect, state, or condition of
anicca; Nidd I 360,3 (~aṁ dukkhâkāraṁ anattâ-
anicca-sādhanatā

f., 'looking at', or contempla-
tion of anicca; Ps I 157,10 (+ dukkhâ°, anattâ°, etc.);
II 298,32 (= pañca kkhandhe khayato vayato das-
sana-ñāṇaṁ); Mp ad AN III 334,1 (°-ñāṇe uppanna-
saññā, = 'anicca-saññā'); Paṭis I 10,16 (+ dukkhâ°,
etc.) = 20,22; etc.; II 185,1 foll; Vism 289,29; 290,10;
629,19; Abhidh-s 43,33.

mfn., contemplating anicca;
It 80,13 (sabba-saṁkhāresu ~ino viharatha); MN I
251,26 (vedanāsu ~ī viharati; Ps) = 254,26; 336,24
(sabba-saṁkhāresu ~ino); III 83,12 (~ī assasissāmîti
sikkhati) = Vin III 71,10 (Sp (II) 434,10) = Paṭis I
(176,3); 191,30 (Ct. in Vism 290,1-14) ≠ SN V 324,22
aniccânupassinSpk); V 345,24 (sabba-saṁkhāresu ~ī viharāhi); AN
II 150,36 (sabba-saṁkhāresu ~ī) = 155,34 = III
83,10 = 143,1; IV 13,14 foll. (~ī + anicca-saññī,
anicca-paṭisaṁvedī); V 109,9 (pañcasu upādāna-
kkhandhesu ~ī viharati); IV 145,19 (cakkhusmiṁ
~ī viharati) ≠ V 359,13.

mfn., subject to imperma-
nence, inunction and rubbing off, dissolution and
annihilation (said of the human body); DN I 76,18
(ayaṁ kayo rūpī + ; Sv) = MN II 17,6; MN I 144,3
(vammīko ti . . . imass' etaṁ . . . kāyassa adhiva-
canaṁ . . . ~assa; Ps) ≠ SN IV 83,27 (gando ti. . .)
= AN IV 386,24; MN I 500,2 (ayaṁ kāyo'rūpī . . .
~o aniccato dukkhato . . . samanupassitabbo); Ja I
146,10 (ayaṁ hi kayo n'eva devanimmito na brah-
manimmito . . ., atha kho kuṇape jāto ... ~o
kaṭasivaḍḍhano taṇhupādinno, etc.).

mfn. (ts., an + icchā), having no
wishes; Sn 707 (icchāya nicchāto ~o hoti nibbuto;
Pj ≠ Mvu III 387,14*); pl. ~ā, SN I 61,10* (bhikkhū
Gotama-sāvakā; — nittaṇhā, Spk) = 204,8*; Ps III
401,8 (= 'appiccha', Sn 628).
entry.re:
— °-ttaan-iccha-tta, n. abstr., Pj
II 495,1.

entry.sense:
n., absence of wish, aversion (or
mfn. = aniccha); Ja IV 32,10' (°bhāvaṁ; Cks
anicchita-).

entry.re:
— °-paccupa-ṭṭhānaa-nicchaya-paccupa-ṭṭhāna, mfn., causing uncertainty; f. ~ā (vicikicchā),
As 259,11; Abhidh-av 25,33; Vism 471,11.

entry.sense:
mfn., not desired, unpleasing; Dhp-a
III 482,19; Sv (II) 520,33 (= aniṭṭha, pt); (III) 947,11
(= 'apatthita').

mfn., unable to be persuaded;
pl. ~ā, AN I 75,32 (asaññattibalā +; Mp).

[w. r. for an-ajjhiṭṭha, Pv 86 (v. l.)].
an-iñjana, n., immobility; Paṭis I 49,22 (°-aṭ-
ṭhena samādhi); Ud-a 185,3]. (°-aṭthena āneñjan ti
vuccati); Ps ad MN I 455,1 (~aṁ acalanaṁ nipphan-
danaṁ).

mfn., immovable; Ud-a 185,30.
an-iñjita, mfn. (an + iñjita, n.), unmoved, with-
out affects); Th 386 (~o viharanto); n. ~aṁ, tranquil-
lity; MN I 455,1 (idaṁ kho ahaṁ~asmiṁ vadāmi; Ps).
an-iṭṭha, mfn. [sa. an-iṣṭa], not wished for, un-
desirable; Kacc-v 336; Sn 154—55 (iṭṭhe ~e); MN III
66,17 (~o akanto amanāpo vipāko) ≠ AN I 28,26;
an-iñja-ppatta~o, etc.); pt ad Sv (II) 520,33 (= 'an-icchita'); Vibh
100,30 (pl. ~ā akantā amanāpā rūpā, etc.); Vibh
2,22 (rūpaṁ ~aṁ, etc.; = appiyaṁ patilābhatthāya
vā apariyesitaṁ, 9,s); Pv-a 221,17 (= 'katuka');
116,20 (papa, abhaddaka +); Ud-a 203,9. — Ifc.
v. iṭṭhâ°. —. °âbhimata, mfn., considered undesir-
able, Ud-a 203,10. — °-gandha, m., undesirable
smell, Bv II 103 (= duggandho, Bv-a); As 320,1
(~o; — 'duggandho'). — °-nimitta, n., an un-
pleasant omen; Saddh 285 (~āni atighorāni).
— °-phala, mfn., with disagreeable result; Pv-a 60,13
(= 'kaṭuka-pphala'). — °-phassa, m., unpleasant
touch; Tli-a (C) II 36,31 (ad Th 783: phassaṁ).
— °-rasa, m., unpleasant taste; As 320,25 (= 'asādu'
(raso)).
entry.re:
— °-rūpaan-iñja-ppatta-rūpa, n., a disagreeable object; SN IV
126,6 foll. ≠ V 450,32 (= aniṭṭha-sabhāvam, Spk
III 413,1)

— °-sammataan-iñja-ppatta-sammata, mfn., considered un-
desirable; Ja VI 205,28 (yaññayajanaṁ nāma ~am
[allusion to iṣṭa from √yaj?] na saggâvahaṁ).
— °-âkanta-vipāka, m(fn.), (of) disagreeable and un-
lovely consequence; n. abstr. °-tta, Ps I 192,35.

entry.sense:
mfn., not finished, not fulfilled; Dhp-a
III 172,1; Sv(III) 740,11 (°-manoratho, = 'apariyosita-
saṁkappo').
entry.re:
— °-kiriyatāa-niṭṭhita-kiriyatā, f., v. l. for an-aṭṭhita-
kiriyatā (q. v.);

— °-chadanaa-niṭṭhita-chadana, mfn., whereof the
roof is not yet completed, Ja III 317,12 (vāsâgāraṁ
vippakataṁ hoti ~aṁ).

entry.sense:
mfn. (according to Nidd neg. of
niṭṭhuri(n), q. v., cf. sa. niṣṭhūrin & niṣṭḥura, Açoka:
ni(ṭ)ṭhŏliya-, absir.; Tr. refers to sa. iṣṭu), not fastidi-
ous, not contemptuous; Sn 952 (~[ī/i] [ ˇ - ˇ - ] ananu-
giddho ḷ anejo; Nidd I 440,30: yass' etaṁ niṭṭhuri-
yaṁ pahīnaṁ ... so vuccati ~ī; Pj II 569,2 reads
a-niṭṭhurinnuṭṭhubhati?) = anissukī, aniṭṭhurī ti pi keci pa-
ṭhanti).

mfn. [an + iṇa], free from debt, v. r. for
an-aṇa (q. v.), MN II 105,10* (Ps (Se) III 318,12).

mfn., not impermanent, not insigni-
ficant, effective, prominent; Ja VI 200,26* (~ā ...
yaññā ca vedā ca; = na lāmakā mahânubhāvā, Ct.).
mfn., see a-nitthiṇṇa.

f., (a) 'not a woman', Vin III 143,34*;
144,10; Ja II 126,25' (:ucchiṭṭhitthī); — (b) in gram-
mar: not female gender (i. e. masc. or neuter); Abh
791, etc.; Kacc-v 556 (loc. ~iyaṁ). an-itthí

mfn., free from all taint of
womankind; Ja III 501,10 (°-vanasaṇḍaṁ); Ps III
62,5 (pañcasata-tāpasā ~ā).

m. Npr. of a prince; Pj II
68,4; Dhp-a III 281,3—284,3; Ja II 329,2; 331,9; IV
469,3—473,9 (°-kumāro = Bodhisatto ≠ Anitthi-
gandha-paccekabodhisatto, Ps II 144,1); Jināl 89.
— °-kumāra-vatthu, n., = Dhp-a III 281—284.

(or a-nittiṇṇa), mfn. (cf. nittha-
rati), untraversed; SN II 98,15-18 (kantārâvaseso ~o).
mfn., not feminine; Sadd 243,10.

mfn., not of feminine gender;
Sadd 112,2.

mfn , which cannot be characterized,
(Ct.s invisible); DN I 223,12* (viññāṇaṁ ~aṁ; Sv:
taṁ nidassanâbhāvato ~aṁ) = MN I 329,30 (Ps:
cakkhuviññāṇassa āpāthaṁ anupagamanato ~aṁ
nāma); MN I 127,36 (ākāso arūpī~o; Ps); Vibh 70,29
a-nidassanaDhs 597 (As 308,15); Dhs 585; 598 (quoted Pj II
211,18); 648 (As); 1088; Vibh 13,5; 64,5. — n. synon,
of Nibbāna, Abh 7; SN IV 370,12 (also title of the
sutta, ib.);
entry.re: — °-gāmi(n)a-nidassana-gāmi(n), mfn., leading to a°, ib.

entry.sense:
mfn. or n. (adv.)[ts.], causeless, without
causal basis, unfounded; MN II 9,26 (+ appāṭihā-
riyaṁ, opp. sa-nidānaṁ); SN II 151,10 (sa-nidānaṁ
uppajjati ... no ~aṁ); V 213,17 (animittaṁ ~aṁ
asaṁkhāraṁ appaccayam, scil. dukkhindriyaṁ); AN
I 82,22. — °-va(t), mfn., see a-nidhāna.

entry.re:
— °-lakkhaṇaa-niddiṭṭha-lakkhaṇa, mfn., for which (definite)
rules are not laid down, Kacc-v 393 (ye saddā ~ā)
= Sadd 800,18. — Ifc. v. paccayâ°.

entry.sense:
mfn. (an + sa. ṛddha) = an-iddhi,
Ap 565,30 (v. l. for an-aḍḍha, q. v.

mfn., not settled; °-sāmatthiya,
mfn., the fitness of which is not settled, Ud-a 93,19
(so Ce & Se for anu-dhārita-s° Ee).

mfn. [an + iddhi (sa. ṛddhi)], poor;
Ja VI 584,18* (acc. ~inaṁ ... damet' assaṁ va
sārathi; = an-iddhiṁ asamiddhiṁ daliddapurisaṁ,
Ct.). — f., poverty; v. r. aniddhi naṁ damet' assaṁ
va, see Ja VI 584,25'.

mfn., poor; Ja VI 584,19* (ty-amhā
~ā dantā); ib. 2 6' (~ā dantā nibbisevanā katā).

mfn., not preserved, not hoarded
up; Nidd I 43,1* (~ā bhaṅgā; Nidd-a: ye khandhā
bhinnā, te nidhānaṁ nihitaṁ (so Ce Ee Se) nicayaṁ
na gacchanti) = 118,9*, quoted Vism 625,1* (reading
bhaggā; = ye bhaggā, na te katthaci nidhānaṁ
gatā, atha kho abhāvam eva gatā, mhṭ).

mfn., not worthy to be kept or
preserved (thus according to the etymol. explanation
of Ctt.; Tr.: not well-founded? cf. sa. a-nidāna-vat);
MN I 287,3 (~vatiṁ vācaṁ bhāsitā; akālavādi, etc. + ;
= hadaya-mañjūsāya nidhetuṁ ayuttaṁ vācaṁ
bhāsitā, Ps, cf. Sv I 76,23-25) = III 48,15 (Ed. w. r.
a-nidhāna-vatvatiṁ; = na hadaye nidhetabba-yuttakaṁ vācaṁ
bhāsitā, Mp) V 265,10 = 283,27 [real meaning un-
known, see nidhānava(t)].

m. (dvandva) freedom from blame
and anger; MN I 360,25 (~aṁ nissāya nindā-roso
pahātabbo); 362,33 foll. (= anindā-bhūtam aghaṭ-
ṭanaṁ, Ps).

mfn. [ts.], not blamed, blameless, irre-
proachable; Dhp 227 (n'atthi loke ~o); SN I 91,21*
(~o saggam upeti ṭhānaṁ) = Ja IV 274,20* (Ct.)
≠ Pv 161; pl. ~ā + agarahitā, Pj I 140,11 (=
'anavajjā').
entry.re:
— °-[a]ṅgaa-nindita-[a]ṅga, mfn., with unblamable (i. e.
beautiful) limbs; f. ~ī, Ja IV 106,6* (Ct.); f. pl. ~iyo,
Ja V 96,13*.

— °-locanaa-nindita-locana, mfn., see anindilocana
a-nindita

entry.sense:
mfn. (neg. grd.) = prec; m. ~o,
Ap 532,4 (v. l. ānandito, anindito) = Thī-a 146,12*.

mfn., with beautiful eyes (or:
without harmful eyes? *nindi(n)?); Ja VI 265,23* (voc.
f. ~e; so Fsb. & Tr., explaining it = a-nindiya-
locane [Se (conjecture?): aninda-F quasi anindya-[;
Ck a-nindita-locane; = aninditabba-locane, Ct.). a-nindi-locana

mfn., inorganic, inanimate;
Pj I 177,21 (aviññāṇakaṁ . . . ~aṁ suvaṇṇa-raja-
tâdi); Ja VI 210,1' ('asaññakāyan' ti ~aṁ acitta-
kāyaṁ); Ps III 487,14.

mfn., destitute of fuel; Ja IV 27,10'
(~o aggi; — 'anedho'); Th-a ad Th 702 (= 'anāhāro').
Cf. nir-indhana.

mfn., from which the filth
has not been removed; AN I 254,1 (jātarūpaṁ . . .
a-niddhantaṁ a-nihitaṁ ~aṁ; v. l. a-nikkhitta-
kasāvam [ɔ: *a-ninnitta? cf. sa. nirnikta]; = avajjita-
kasāvaṁ, Mp II 362,1).

mfn., injudicious in life-conduct
(cf. nipaka & nipaka-vutti); Ps III 4,6 (an-esanāya
jīvitaṁ pakappento ~i nāma hoti).

[mfn., w. r. (Se) for a-vini-
pāta-dhamma, Spk I 221,14].

mfn., (a) not clever; Mil 239,28 (m.
~o p'etaṁ sutvā attamano bhaveyya); — (b) in-
delicate, low, vulgar; Sp I 221,10 (n. thūlaṁ asukhu-
maṁ ~aṁ).
mfn., w. r. for a-nibbatta (q. v.).
f. = a-nipphāda (q. v.), Ja I 456,11.

mfn., (in gramm.) not derived;
Sadd 586,5* (dhātucintāya ye muttā ~ā ti te matā).

[m., non-accomplishment; ~āya
saheyya dhīro, Ja VI 381,1* (unmetrical; Ee here
a-nippādāya) — 388,19* (-ya is prob, dittographic,
and we ought to read: ā nipphādā saheyya dhīro, the
wise man should keep (the secret) to himself until his
undertaking is accomplished (so Tr., cf. ā, prp.)].

mfn. [ts.], (a) not fixed, undecided,
uncertain; Ja I 437,20 (jaya-parājayo ~o); Ps II
245,22 (gocaragāmo ~o, kocid eva gocaragāmo bha-
vissati; Ee anibandho, Se anivaddho); — (b) not
permanent, transitory; Ps III 229,8 (puthujjaniddhi
acalā ~ā). — °-cārikā, f., a wandering for no certain
purpose; SvI 243,11-13; Ps II 152,3 (so Ck; Ee & Se
anibandha-c°).
entry.re:
— °-vāsaa-nibaddha-vāsa, mfn., without regular
a-nibaddhayattha yattha phāsukaṁ hoti tattha tatth'eva vasi);
Ps II 165,1 (Bhagavā paṭhamabodhiyaṁ vīsati vas-
sāni ~o ahosi; Ee anibandha-°).

— °-sayanaa-nibaddha-sayana, mfn.,
having no permanent lair; Mil 398,20 (hatthī ~o).

entry.sense:
mfn., often found as w. r. for
a-nibaddha (q. v.).

mfn., not able to adhere; Vin
II 151,14 (seta-vaṇṇo ~o hoti).

mfn., not to be explained or
analyzed; °-tta, n. abstr., Sadd 285,11 (~ā vīcchā-
saddānaṁ).

mfn. [sa. anirvṛtta], not (yet) pro-
duced (or arisen); Dhs 1036; Nidd I 42,25* (Nidd-a)
— 118,5*, quoted Vism 625,5*. — °-phala, mfn.,
whose fruits are not developed; Mil 72,27 (rukkhāni
~āni).

n., the not producing or developing
(cf. nibbattati, nibbatteti); Pj II 118,15 (aññassa
attabhāvassa ~ena).

f. (cf. sa. anirvṛtti), the not being
re-produced; Mp III 92,21 (abl. ~iyā, = 'an-anusayā').

mfn., who will not be born again;
m. ~ī, Ja VI 573,2* (quoted Ps III 576,14*; = manus-
a-nibbattinSe and C v. l.) anivattī, perhaps a good conjecture,
cf. anāvatti(n)).

mfn., not produced; Pv-a 150,1
(= 'akata').

mfn., not conducive
to Nibbāna; It 82,14 (~o, scil. kāmavitakko); MN I
115,4 (do.); pl. ~ā (tayo akusala-vitakkā), It 82,11;
SN V 97,16 (pañca nīvaraṇā; = nibbānatthāya na
saṁvattanikā, Spk); n. ~aṁ (sabbaṁ rāgatamaṁ,
a-nibbāna-saṁvattanika

mfn. [sa. anirvista], unmarried, f.
~ā, Sadd 364,1. Cf. a-niviṭṭha.

mfn., not pierced; in which there
has not been made a breach, not open; SN V 88,2
(°-pubbaṁ appadālita-pubbaṁ lobha-kkhandhaṁ);
Ps III 303,4 (~a-pubbe lobha-kkhandhâdayo); ~ā
racchā, a street in which there is no thoroughfare, a
a-nibbiddha

mfn. (neg. abs. of nibbin-
dati + kāri(n)), acting unweariedly (without despon-
dency); gen. ~issa samma-d-attho vipaccati, Ja V
121,16*.
neg. part., see nibbisati.

f. abstr. (a + nibbisa), the state of
one who has not been deprived of his venom; Ps I
194,11 (abl. °-tāya 'adanto') ≠ Nidd-a (Ee) I 107,5,
a-nibbisatānaṁ 107,1 for Ps nibbisaṁ.

mfn. [sa. a-nirvṛta], unhappy, not
emancipated; It 91,18* (nibbutassa ~o ... passa
yāvañ ca ārakā).
entry.re:
— °-kilesatāa-nibbuta-kilesatā, f. abstr. (cf. kilesa),
the state of one whose passions are not extinguished;
Ps I 194,12 (abl. ~āya 'aparinibbuto' — Nidd-a (Ee)
I 107,6).

entry.sense:
mfn., not free from doubt (cf.
vematika & nibbematika); °-bhāva, m. abstr., Dhp-a
I 34,1.

mfn. [ts.], free from marks (attributes
or characteristics), causeless, unconditioned, unlimited;
n. ~aṁ, 'the signless' (void of niccaṁ, sukhaṁ,
attā [cf. As 223,12-13], i. e. Nibbāna); — (a) 'sign-
less': Sn 342 (~aṁ ca bhāvehi; Pj) — Thī 20
(quoted Pj II 242,8* & As 223,10*; cf. Thī 105: ~añ
a-nimittaca vimokkho, Dhp 92 (Dhp-a; quoted Pj II 343,30)
= Th 92; suññato ~o vimokkho, Paṭis II 36,8; 59,3;
Mil 413,6*; Abhidh-s 44,1; Vism 658,9; suññataṁ
~aṁ appaṇihitaṁ, Abhidh-s 31,9; suññato ~o appa-
ṇihito ti tīṇi maggassa nāmāni, As 223,3; suññatassâ-
nimittassa lābhinī, Thī 46 (Thī-a); suññato samādhi
+ ~o, appaṇihito, DN III 219,21 (Sv) = SN IV
360,17 (Spk) = Vin III 93,1'; Mil 337,5; do.~ā samā-
patti, Vin III 93,3' (cf. IV 26,26' foll.); ~ā ceto-
vimutti, DN III 249,16; MN I 297,10 (Ps); AN III
292,1; ~o ceto-samādhi, SN IV 268,33; AN IV 78,27;
DN II 100,18; suññato phasso + ~o, appanihito,
MN I 302,22 ≠ SN IV 295,14; Nidd I 52,21 = 222,27
(Nidd-a); Dhs 506 (paṭhamam jhānaṁ . . . ~aṁ) =
524; 535; Paṭis I 60,16* (~aṁ sukhaṁ); 66,20 (~aṁ
pakkhandati); 91,27 (~o vihāro); — (b) unaccoun-
table: Sn 574 (~aṁ anaññātaṁ maccānaṁ idha
jīvitaṁ; = kiriyâkāranimitta-virahitaṁ, Pj; quoted
Ja IV 151,8 = Dhp-a I 355,1); abl. n. ~ato (adv.),
Vism 230,25; 236,13—237,6. — (c)causeless: AN I
82,19 (sa-nimittā uppajjanti pāpakā akusalā dhammā,
no ~ā); SN V 213,17 (~aṁ anidānaṁ asaṁkhāraṁ
appaccayaṁ, scil. dukkhindriyaṁ); — (d) without
(sexual) marks: f. ~ā + nimittamattā, alohitā, etc.,
lacking female characteristics, Vin III 129,24' (= ni-
mitta-rahitā, Sp) ≠ II 271,17; — (e) without boundary
marks: paṭhaviṁ sàgara-pariyantaṁ akhilaṁ ~aṁ,
DN III 146,20 = 177,12; — — — °-kata, mfn., of
which no decision has been made; Vin I 255,10 (~ena
atthataṁ hoti kaṭhinaṁ, cf. Vin Trsl. II 156,3);
— °-kata-disa, mfn., going in an occasional or chance
direction; f. ~ā (papaṭikā), Mil 181,4; — °-phala-samāpatti, f., attainment of the fruit of the signless,
Mil 333,30 (suññata-phala-samāpatti +); — °-mag-ga, m., the 'Signless Path', As 223,19 (cf. 290,5 foll);
— °-rata, mfn., delighting in 'the Signless', Ap 390,12
(suññatā-bahulo ~o) = Th-a (Ce) 506,33*; — °-vipas-sanā, f., the insight to 'the Signless', As 223,7;
— °-vimutta, mfn., having attained the deliverance called
a°, Nett 190,8; — °-vimokkha, m., the deliverance
called a°, As 223,20 (cf. Dhp 92);
entry.re:
— °-ânupassanāa-nimittânupassanā, f., con-
templation of 'the Signless', Paṭis I 20,27; II 42,8
(°-ñāṇaṁ = 67,26); 44,8, etc.; Abhidh-s 45,15; Vism
629,8; 695,1.

entry.sense:
mfn. \sa. a-nimiṣa], not winking
(said of the eyes); Ja V 34,13 (yakkhānaṁ akkhīni
rattāni honti ~āni); Ud-a 52,9 (Bodhi-rukkhaṁ ~ehi
akkhīhi olokayamāno sattâhaṁ vītināmesi, taṁ
ṭhānaṁ Animisa-cetiyaṁ nāma jātaṁ) — Ps II
184,11 ≠ Ja I 77,30 ≠ As 12,37 ≠ Mhbv 36,1; acc.
n. pl. ~e, Dāṭh V 26 (nayane) — m., a god, a fish,
Abh 12 (pl ~ā); 1044 (~o).
or ~anta, neg. pari, see nimisati.

n. Npr. of a sacred place near
the Bodhi-rukkha (cf. a-nimisa); Ud-a 52,10; Ps II
184,13; Ja I 77,3]..

f. abstr. of a-nimisa; instr. ~āya
(akkhīnaṁ), Ja VI 336,39'; 337,10'; 338,32'.

mfn., with unwinking eyes (as
a god or demon); Ja VI 339,3' (abhīto ~o eso Sakko).

mfn., according to CI: not caused
to be created or constructed [if not = sa. *a-nirmātṛ,
without a creator]; satt' ime kăyā akaṭā +, DN I
56,21 (= a-nimmāpitā, Sv = kassaci animmāpakā,
improductive, pt; Amg: animmiyā animmāvittā) =
a-nimmāta

mfn., additional reading in
DN I 56,22 (after animmātā), Sv I 167,11 = Spk II
341,23.

mfn., not created; in the same for-
mula as prec. = iddhiyā pi animmitā, Sv I 167,10
— Spk II 341,21.

[mfn., w. r. for a-nimmātabba;
Spk II 341,23].

[mfn. = animmita; Spk II
341,21 (~ā ti animmitā, etc., w. r. in Se for a-nimmātā
ti animmāpitā, so Ce = Sv I 167,ío[.

mfn. [ts.], undetermined, uncertain,
doubtful; irregular, casual; dve ~ā dhammā, the two
rules (Vin III 188,17-25**, and 191,27—192,2**) re-
garding undetermined matters (i. e. matters involving
penance only according to circumstances), Vin III
187,1—194,9; I 112,18 (dve ~e uddisitvā); V 8,15 (dve
a-niyatapadaṁ); ~o rāsi, DN III 217,2 (undetermined, i. e. not
coming within the items mentioned; = avasesānaṁ
dhammānaṁ etaṁ nāmaṁ, Sv) = Nett 96,26 ≠ Pp
13,21 (avasesā puggalā ~ā) ≠ Nett 49,20; Tikap
335,15 (micchatta-niyata, sammattaniyata +); 354,25
(~aṁ cittaṁ); ~ā dhammā, Dhs (p. 7,1; As 50,25);
1030; 1414 = 1595; Dhs 584 (~aṁ aniyyānikaṁ);
Ja V 452,17* (uddhatā ~ā asaññatā, scil. pamadă;
= aniyata-cittā, CI, i. e. capricious, changeable);
V 453,25* (gacchatī ~o gaḷāgalaṁ, tumbling, tossing
about); Dhp-a I 431,10 (parihīnajjhānassa . . . ~ā
gati); Ps III 322,4 (senāsanaṁ pan'ettha ~aṁ);
Nett 99,6 (purā veneyyattaṁ [v. r. aniyataṁ, Nett-a
quoted p. XXXVIII n. 27] samatikkamati).
— Aniyata, n. (pl), title of Vin III 187—194 (cf.
°-dvaya, n., Sp (Sṝ) II 445,21); ct. thereon Sp (III)
631—635 (°-(khaṇḍa-) vaṇṇanā); — °kathā, f., title
of Vin-vn 542—50. — °-kālika, mfn., indefinite as to
time; Sadd 56,18. — °-gatika, mfn., whose path
(through the various existences) is uncertain, Dhp-a
III 173,3 (cf. (opp.) niyato sambodhi-parāyano).
— °-citta, mfn., capricious; f. pl. ~ā, Ja V 454,22' (=
'aniyatā'). — °-tta, n. abstr., As 50,25 (~ā aniyatā).
— °-yevāpanaka, m. pl, a class of yevāpanakas
(q. v.) comprising karuṇā, muditā, etc., Nāmar-s
10,8-9. — °-liṅga, mfn., of undetermined gender;
Sadd 78,23.
entry.re:
— °-vacanaa-niyata-vacana, n., an indefinite (or relative)
pronoun; Pj I 228,12 (yā ti ~aṁ); see aniyamattha
below.

— °-saṁkhāa-niyata-saṁkhā, f., an indefinite number; Sadd
18,18. — Aniyat'-uddesa, m., title of Vin III 187
— 194 (see Aniyata above).

entry.sense:
(or a-niyāma, q. v.), m. [ts.], absence
of rule or fixed order, uncertainty; Abh 949; °-vasena,
adv., without rule or order, indiscriminately, in general
(without summoning any certain persons, Tr.), Ja III
532,5 (~ bhikhusaṁgham sannipătetvā).
entry.re:
— °-[a]tthaa-niyama-[a]ttha,
mfn., with indefinite sense (ind the sense of the rel.
pron., see aniyāmita); Pay fol. khai 3—4 (said of
aññatara, aññatama; do. ya-saddo); Sadd 266,28;
Ud-a 321,1 (vā-saddo).

entry.sense: mfn., see a-niyāmita.

m., = aniyama; only instr. ~ena
(adv.), indiscriminately, at random; Ja V 337,26
(nesādo tattha ~ pāse oḍḍeti).

mfn. (or a-niyamita; cf. niyameti
& niyameti), indefinite, mostly = the sense of the
rel. pron, (which is niyămita by a foll demonstr.);
°-vasena (adv.), Pj I 169,20 ('yaṁ kinci'ti ~ anava-
sesaṁ pariyādiyati). — °-niddesa, m. = a-niyama-
a-niyāmitamfn., nominative of the rel pron., Pj I 236,9 ('yan'ti
~aṁ, opp. niyāmita-upayoga, í. e. acc. of demonstr.
pron. ('taṁ')).
entry.re:
— °-paricchedaa-niyāmita-pariccheda, m., a term of
indef.-rel quantity, Ja IV 173,26' ('yāvā' ti ~o).
— °-paridīpana, n., expression for 'indefinite', Pj I
104,17 ('ekaṁ samayan' ti ~aṁ); Ud-a 18,30 (do.).

— °-vacanaa-niyāmita-vacana, n., an (indefinite or) relative pronoun,
Pj I 167,4 ('yānîdha bhūtāni samāgatānī' ti ~ena
bhūtāni pariggahetvā); Vv-a 231,8 (aniyămita°);
— °-samkhā-niddesa, m., expression for an indefinite
number, Pj I 123 7 ('balm').

— °âlapanaa-niyāmitâlapana, n. addres-
sing no certain person, Ja III 177,18' ('passā' ti ~aṁ).
— [aniyāmif]-uddesa-vacana, n., = aniyāmita-
vacana, Pj I 184,13 ('ye').

entry.sense:
mfn. (cf. niyyāteti), who
has not entrusted pr resigned oneself, Vism 115,29.

n., not marching out; DN I 9,31 (=
puna āgamanaṁ(l), Sv).
entry.re:
— °-dīpakaa-niyyāna-dīpaka, mfn., not
throwing light upon the emancipation, Dhp-a II 209,2
(~ehi padehi).

— °-maggaa-niyyāna-magga, m., a path which does
not lead out (to emancipation; see next); Ps I 237,24
a-niyyāna

entry.sense:
(as to the spelling (a)nīyānika see
Sadd 804,16-24), mfn., 'not leading out' (or to the goal),
not conducive to salvation; dhammo dvākkhāto hoti
duppavedito ~o, SN V 379,29 (spelt anīyāniko); durak-
khàte dhamma-vinaye duppavedite ~e an-upasama-
saṁvattanike (loc. abs.), DN III 118,3 = MN II 244 7
(cf. MN I 67,1 = DN III 119,1); Dhs 584 (aniyataṁ
~aṁ); ~ā dhamma, Dhs p. 6,35 (As 50,23); 1593 (cf.
a-niyyānikadhammesu); Ja VI 287,16' (saggamaggānaṁ adāya-
kaṁ ~aṁ); Ps I 188,21 (ayathāva +;; III 253,4 ad
MN II 33,19 (= 'appāṭihīrakata'); 254,9 (amhākaṁ
katha ~ā); 446,1 (mama laddhi ~ā); 579,16 (~aṁ
sāsanaṁ hoti; cf. III 14,3: ~e pi sāsane); Sp.(HI)
604,15 (uddhammaṁ ubbinayaṁ vilomaṁ ~aṁ satthu
sāsanaṁ bhaveyya). — °-kāraṇa, n., unconclusive
reasoning; Ja I 105,6'-ll'.
entry.re:
— °-ttaa-niyyānika-tta, n. abstr., Sv I
89,16 (abl. ~ā) = Ps III 209,15.

— °-bhāvaa-niyyānika-bhāva, m.
abstr., Ps II 234,16 (°-kathana, n.).

entry.sense:
mfn., not dissatisfied; Vism 135,16
(~aṁ . . . cittaṁ, alīnaṁ anuddhataṁ +).

mfn., one who is not inter-
rupted or disturbed in his religious meditation; It 39,11
(ajjhattaṁ cetosamatham anuyuttā ~ā, etc.; = bahi
anīhata-jjhānā avināsita-jjhānā vā, It-a) ≠ MN I
33,10 ≠ 216,31 ≠ AN V 131,14 ≠ Nidd I 375,5
a-nirākata-jjhāna

mfn. [ts.], unobstructed, not checked,
not ceased; MN I 455,1 (upekhāsukhaṁ ~aṁ hoti).
— °-patha, m. [ts.], the sky, MTD.
mfn., indestructible, Ud-a 393,15.

m. [ts.], air or wind; Abh 37; Ja II 219,21*
(giri-m-eva ~ena duppasaho); V 418,3**= 422,13** (~o
viya yena-kămaṁ-gamāyo). — Ifc. v. lokadhammâ°,
hadayâ°. — — °-jaIa-vega-sañchādita, mfn.,
anila116,12 (gaganaṁ ~aṁ; Hīnaṭ renders vega by pra-
vega; read bala-vega- for jala-v°?) — °-java, mfn.,
(running) with the speed of the wind, Mil 141,16
(assâjāniyo . . . sīghagati ~o). — °-ñjasa, m(77).
(anila + 2añjasa), 'the wind's path', the air, space;
Bv I 31 (ambare ~e); Ap 253,24 (do.); āgacchi ~ā
[instr, as from *anilañjas-, cf. añjasā, ind.], Ap 381,1;
loc. ~e (gacchantaṁ), Ap 409,14. — °-ñjasâsaṁ-khubbha, mfn. (id. + a-saṁkhubbha), imperturbable
as the space; Ap 113,26 (~o yathi ākāso asaṁ-
khiyo; scan anilañjasa-asaṁkh°) = Th-a (Ce) 494,17*
(anilañjaso va sambuddho!). — °-pacupita, mfn.
[sa. pracupita; cf. copeti], see anila-pamuccita below.
— °-patha, m., = anilañjasa; Abh 46; Ja III
377,22 (~ena ... agamāsi) ≠ IV 119,4; III 382,20'
(hatthato muttā sakuṇī ~aṁ laṁghayitvā).
— °-pamuccita, mfn. and °pamuñcita, etc., unmelrical
readings at Vv 622 (~ā (metr. °pamucitā) pavāyanti
(melr. pavanti) surabhiṁ; Vv-a: anilapavūsitā [v. l.
°padhūpitā ɔ: °pacupitā, q. v. = set in gentle move-
ment by the wind] ti pi paṭhanti, vātena mandaṁ
(so Ce) ādhūyamāna-hemamaya-pupphā ti attho);
— -pariyāya, m. [sa. °-paryăya], swelling of the
eyelids, MTD. — °-bala, n., the power of the wind;
Mil 161,14 (°-vegâbhihata, mfn., struck by the violence
of a°, scil. rukkho); 181,6 (°-samāhata, mfn., struck
or carried away by a°, scil. rajo); 254,18 (do., scil.
mahatimahārukkhe). — °-sakha, m. [ts.], 'friend
of wind', fire, MTD. — °-âmaya, m. [ts.], distending
of the stomach, MTD. Cf. āmaya.
entry.re:
— °-âyanaanilâyana, n.
[ts.], = anilañjasa, Ap 157,1 (ambare ~e). Cf. ayana.

— °-âsayanaanilâsayana, n., the sky (misreading of prer.1),
MTD. Cf. āsaya.

entry.sense:
mfn., not niggardly (Tr.), Ja
VI 569,32 (so Cks; Ee, Se & Bd anolīna-mānasa).

mfn. (anila + upama
+ s°), swift like the wind, Ja VI 223,15* (pl. ~ā, scil.

padā; Se anīluppa-°).

mfn.. (anila + īrita or erita), moved
by the wind, Ja V 404,1* (~ā lohitapattamālinī).

ind. (cf. nivatta), incessantly, Mhv
(see Index to Cūlavaṁsa p. 636, without reference).
mfn. — a-nivattika (q. v.).

n. (cf. sa. a-nivartana, mfn.), the
not turning back (esp. to the worldly life); abl. gatassa

entry.re:

— °-sīlaa-nivattana-sīla, n., a steadfast moral con-
duct, ib. 16.

entry.sense:
n., going away for ever;
Dhp-a I 63,9.

77?. Npr. of a king in
Benares, Pj II 114,16.
[mfn., see a-nivatti-m°].

mfn. [sa. anivartin], (a) not turning
a-nivattinmacariya-parāyano; Mp) — III 75,14* (Mp); pl. ~ino

mfn., = 'anivatti(n)', Mp II 243,4

mfn., with a firm grasp,

mfn., = anivattana-dham-
ma, trustworthy, true to one's word, Ps III 517,11

entry.re:

entry.sense:
mfn., of resolute mind, Bv
XXII 15 (Ee anivatta-m°; = an-osakkiyamāna-

m. Npr. of a place in Southern India,

m. = prec, Mhv LXXVI 212.
mfn., not forbidden, Sadd 204,28.

mfn., 'not placed', f. unmarried; Mp
III 188,2 (pl. ~ā, explaining kula-kumāriyo, AN IV
16,25). Cf. a-nibbiṭṭha.

mfn., not having dwelt in; n. abstr.
°tta, Sadd 95,17 (ācariya-kule; cf. Ja I 436,19*).

mfn. [sa. a-niveçana], homeless, not
attached to worldly things; Dhp 40 (= anālaya, Dhp-a).

neg. abs. (from ni + √çam, see nisā-

entry.re:
— °-kāri(n)a-nisamma-kāri(n), mfn.,

id. (for anisāmiya or anisāmya?),

mfn., see a-nissita.

f. abstr., want of docility, Mil

mfn., not (necessarily) to be aban-

mfn., not given up, not abandoned

ṭhaṁ, Sp).

mfn., without supplies or habitations,

mfn. [sa. an-īçvara], (a) not owner
or master, powerless; m. ~o, Mil 253,4 (+ assāmī

an-issaraasmiṁ] sarīre ~ā), Ja III 57,20*. — (b), without a

— Th 713 (sabbaṁ ~aṁ etaṁ, iti vuttaṁ mahesinā,

entry.re:

entry.sense:
f. abstr. [sa. an-īçvaratā], the not

mfn., not to be controlled(1); abl.
~ato, Nidd II 279,31 (= attano issariye avasavatta-
nato, Nidd-a).

f., freedom from envy; MN I 44,20;
45,30; AN I 95,23 foll. (~ā ca a-macchariyañ ca).

neg. abs. of nissayati (q. v.).

n., absence of envying; — °-rasa,
mfn., having the property of a°, As 193,14 (pamoda-

21,27. an-issāyana

mfn. (a + nissita, sa. niçrita; prob,

neyyo (a), ib. 364; sabbâhāraṁ ~o, ib. 748; āhāre
ca ~o, Dhp 93 = Th 92; sabbattha .. . ~o, Sn
811; ñatvā dhammaṁ ~o, ib. 856 = 947; pubbam
antam ~o, ib. 849; ~o no visahāmi tārituṁ, ib. 1069
(without a support, = anallīno, Pj); ~aṁ sabbabha-
vesu, Th 1141; ~assa calitaṁ n'atthi, Ud 81,6 (Ud-a);
~o na calati, Sn 752; Paṭis II 206,18 (~aṁ cittaṁ
diṭṭhiyā na iñjati, quoted Ud-a 186,5; Vism 386,15);
~ena tādinā, It 38,24* (scan: nibbānadhātū 'nisitena

= Ps); ~o anupādāno, Sn 753; tesu dhammesu
anupāyo anapāyo+, MN III 25,23 foll.; ~o aññam
aheṭhayāno, SN I 7,19* (Spk = Sv, Ps above); SN I
46,26* = 52,28* (Ee asito; scan: sucetaso 'nisitŏ [or
asitŏ] tadānisaṁso?, metre as Sn 691a); SN II 280,8
(poriyā vācāya . . . ~āya, i. e. unworldly; Spk) =
AN II 51,17 (Mp); Mil 320,30 (duppasaho acorâha-
raṇo ~o, etc., scil. ākāso); 351,26 (dhutaṅgaṁ sud-
dhâjīvaṁ . . . + ~aṁ, etc. = self dependent, Trsl.).
entry.re:
— °-cittaa-nissita-citta, mfn., whose mind is independent; pl. ~ā,

entry.sense: mfn., w. r. for an-ussuka (q. v.).

mfn. (cf. an-issā), not envious;

entry.re:
— °-itāan-issuki(n)-itā,

entry.sense:
mfn., 'not laid', not cleansed or pre-
cipitated (?); AN I 253,32 (a-niddhantaṁ ~aṁ a-nin-

n(m). [ts.], an array (of troops), an army;

entry.re:
— °-dattaanīka-datta, m. Npr.,
see Anikaratta.

— °-dassanaanīka-dassana, n., going to see reviews

dassanaṁ, Sv = Nidd-a).

entry.sense: (or an-īgha), mfn., see a-nigha.

mfn., immodest, impertinent; Ps III
452,13 (appatissayo + ; = 'appatisso', MN II 245,28)
= Ss 101,5.

f. [ts.], freedom from ill, plagues, or distress

308,2 (anupaddavo ~i ca); Anāg 40 (pl. iddhā phītā
ca khemā ca ~ī anupaddavā). an-īti

entry.re:
— °-dhamma-gāmi(n)an-ītika-dhamma-gāmi(n), mfn.,
leading to that state, SN IV 371,22.

entry.sense:
f., the success of being free from
plagues (of the season); AN IV 238,16* (= kīṭa-kimi-
ādi-pāṇaka-ītiyā abhāvo ekā sampadā hoti, Mp).

mfn. (an + itiha, with rhythm, length-
ening as in an-āpara, etc.), not received through tra-
dition (or from others' instruction), being of one's own
invention, devised by oneself; Sn 934 (sakkhi dham-
maṁ ~am adassī; = atta-paccakkhaṁ, Nidd &
Nidd-a; = paccakkhaṁ, Pj); 1053 (dhammaṁ diṭṭhe
an-ītiha1066(santiṁ diṭṭhe dhamme ~aṁ, quoted Nett 166,6*;
Nett-a: 'iti hâsā' ti evaṁ na iti-kirāya pavattaṁ,
attapaccakkhan ti attho); Th 331 (anuppatto sac-
chikato sayaṁ dhammo ~o); It 28,14* (brahma-
cariyaṁ ~aṁ; It-a) = 29,15* = AN II 26,10* (=
itiha-parivajjitaṁ aparapattiyaṁ, Mp); Ja I 450,28*
(~aṁ, scil. phalaṁ; cf. 451,6').

mfn. (neg. pp. of nir + √bhṛ, cf.
nīhaṭa), not carried out; °-ratanaka, mfn., the old
reading for aniggata-ratanaka (q. v.).
see a-niyyānika.
v. l. for a-neḷaka, q. v. a-nīlaka

mfn., free from obstacles; pl. boj-
jhaṅgā anāvaraṇā ~ā cetaso anupakkilesā, SN V 93,6
foll. (kusaladhamme . . . na paṭicchādentîti ~ā, Spk).

mfn., not subject to hindrances;
pl. ~ā (dhammā), Dhs p. 4,25, 31; 1165; 1489.

(or °nīhata), mfn. (neg. pp. of nīharati,
cf. sa. niṁṛta), not thrown out, not removed; °-jjhāna,
mfn. (bahi ~ — 'anirākatajjhāna', q. v.); It-a 220,2
ad It 39,11 = Nidd-a II 122,1 ad Nidd I 375,5; see
a-nībhaṭa. a-nīhaṭa

mfn. neg. part, of īhati, not
endeavouring, not exerting oneself; Ja II 233,1* (na . . .
~assa; = avāyamantassa, Ct.)

ind. [ts.], (a) prefix to nouns (subst., adj.,
adv.) or prp. to verbs (before vowels also anv° (q. v.),
but cf. anu-acchariya, anu-anu-°, etc., and ano° =
anu + ava-°) implying: in the company of, along,
after, behind, inferiority; according to, concerning; un-
interrupted, intensity, repetition, distribution, Abh 1174
1anu1) anugate, 2) anupacchinne, 3) pacchātthe, 4) bhu-
satthe, 6) sādisse, 6) hīne, 7) tatiyatthe, 8) lakkhaṇe,
β) itthambhūtakkhāne, 10) bhāge, ") vīcchāyaṁ (see
these words). — (b) as governing prp. (a) with acc. in the
senses 6—11 above; cf. anv-aḍdhamāsaṁ, anu-cha-
māsaṁ, anu-jeṭṭhaṁ, anu-dhammaṁ, anu-pañcâhaṁ,
anu-pariveṇiyaṁ, anu-maggaṁ, anu-māsaṁ, anu-
rathaṁ, anu-rūpaṁ, anu-vattaṁ, anu-saṁvaccharaṁ;
also in the sense of saha, Pay fol. gau 2 (pabbatam anu-
tiṭṭhati = pabbatena saha); — (β)[with prec, abl.,
Mhv LXXVI 119, but read nu . . . nu, q. v.]; (γ) with
instr., see anu-maggena; (6) with loc, see anu-tīre,
anu-nadī-tīre, anu-pathe, anu-magge, anuvāte.
— (c) sometimes in Ctt. used to explain the neg. prefix
an-, see anu-acchariya, anu-abhāva, anu-amatagga,
anu-avaya. — (d) lengthened into ānu-, see (a ) an-
ānuyāyi(n), (β) ānu-pubba° (& °pubbī), ānu-bandhi
(s. v. anu-bandhati), ānu-bhāva, ānu-satthi.
— (e) repeated: anu anu . . . bhāveti vaḍḍhetī ti anu-
bhāvo, Sp-ṭ ad Sp I 6,11 (1*. e. more and more); also
in anu-anu-abhāva (see anu-abhāva), anu-anu-gijjhati,
anu-anu-nayana, anu-anu-passana, anu-anu-vyañjana
(see anu-vyañjana), anu-anu-seti. — (f) sometimes a
verb is repeated with anu-° (in the sense of 'again'),
e. g. Vin II 73,27 (pekkhati anu-pekkhati, dasseti
anu-dasseti), gajjati anugajjati; cf. also netā vinetā
anunetā (q.v.). — (g) frequently inserted in iterative
comp.s: kālânukāla, kīḷitânukīḷita, khuddânukhud-
daka, therânuthera, dhammânudhamma, padânu-
pada, pubbânupubba, poṅkhânupoṅkha, Buddhânu-
buddha, mūlânumūla, sākhânusākha, sissânusissa,
seṭṭhânuseṭṭhi(n).
[mfn., w. r. for aṇu (q. v.), Saddh 271; 346.]

mfn., Bu.'s explanation of an-
acchariya (f. v.), Sp I 133,12; Spk I 196,29 (Ee).

pr. 3 sg., strengthening of
anu-gijjhati (q. v.), Nidd-a (Ee) I 55,17 (ad Nidd
I 12,1).

n., to fawn on repeatedly;
Nidd-a (Ee) I 38,1 (~ato 'anusayo', ad Nidd I 8,14).

n., to contemplate repeatedly;
Sp (II) 435.7.

pr. 3 sg., to develop more and
more, see 1anu (e) above.

pr. 3 sg., (cf. anu-seti), to be
closely attached to; Nidd-a (Ee) I 41,23 (thāmagataṭ-
ṭhena ~îti 'anusayo', ad Nidd I 9,5).

m., Bu.s explanation of an-a-bhāva
(q. v.), Sp I 133,10. Cf. anu-anu-abhāvaṁ gameti,
Ps I 81,29 (= 'anabhāvaṁ gameti').

mfn., do. of an-amat'-agga
(q. v.), Spk Ee II 156,1.

mfn., do. of an-avaya, (q. v.), Sp (II)
287,18; ~o + paripuṇṇaguṇo, Ja VI 64,6' (cf. ana-
vajja).

(mf)n., (a Ct.-fictiori) where one
is sheltered from the rain; Ja V 317,28' (= 'anvāvassa',
q. v.), cf. an-ovassa.

mfn. (cf. anvesa), seeking; only ifc. v.
kusalâ°, kim-kusalâ°.

mfn., covered all-over; Vin I 32,8
(so padeso udakena ~o hoti).
mfn. [ts.], greedy, lustful, MTD.

mfn. [sa. anu-kāṅkṣin], longing
anu-kaṁkhin

pr. 3 sg., [anu + kaḍḍati, the
m-ind. substitute for sa. karṣati, see f. inst. Turner:
Nepali Diet. s. v. kāṛ(h)nu]; to refer back to; pt ad
Sv I 259,25.

n. (cf. sa. anukarṣaṇa and anu-
kasati below), drawing or referring back (scil. to a
former rule), Kacc-v 72 (ca-sadda-ggahaṇaṁ~atthaṁ);
279 (see Kacc. ed. Senart p. 138,1); Sadd 330,17.

mfn. (pp. of anu-kaḍḍhati, 'drawn
after', trailing, leaving a trail (said of a footprint);
duṭṭhassa hoti ~aṁ padaṁ, Pj II 544,2* (cf. 584,1),
(quoted Vism 105,1* (cf. 104,30); mhṭ: . . . kaḍḍhanto
viya pādaṁ nikkhipati . . . anukaḍḍhitaṁ = pac-
chato añchitaṁ hoti) = Dhp-a I 201,1* (reading
avakaḍḍhitaṁ) = Mp I 436,17* (do.) ≠ Divy
anu-kaḍḍhita

f., agreeable speech, words of com-
pliance, MTD.

pr. 3 sg. [anu + √kṛt], to cut, to
scratch; Dhp 311 (kuso yathā duggahīto hattham evâ°;
= phāleti, Dhp-a) = SN I 49,14* (cf. Udānavarga
ed. Chakravarti p. 126—28).

m. [sa. anukalpa], a substitute,
MTD.

mfn. [ts., f. ~ikā or ~akā; cf.
anu-kampati], compassionate, merciful, pitiful, kind,
tender (with acc. or gen. pers.); Thī 210 (f. ~ikā;
= anuggāhikā, Thī-a); [Thī-a 152,23* read anukam-
pitā with Ap 538,29]; Ud 7,1 (do., scil. devatā, +
anu-kampakakāmena hitesinā ~ena anukampaṁ upādāya; Ud-a);
It 110,16*(pajāya~ā, scil. mātāpitaro) = AN I 132,13*
= II 70,26*; Khp VII 3 (pl. ~ā, = atthakāmā hitesino,
Pj I 208,20) = Pv 16 (Pv-a = Pj); Pv 9; 52 ≠ Ja
IV 87,12*; Pv 97 (= anugaṇhanaka, Pv-a); 100; Ap
595,26 (nārī ~ikā; atthakkhāyī +); DN III 187,1
(atthakkhāyī + ~o mitto); 188,1*; DN II 143,29 (yo
mamaṁ ~o); sāvakānaṁ hitesinā ~ena. MN II 265,36;
III 302,1; SN IV 359,19 (w. r. anukampena); V 157,24;
AN IV 139,24; ~o + hitesī, MN II 238,21; III 117,20
= 221,6; yassa (vo) mātāpitaro bhattuno dassanti
atthakāmā hitesino ~ā, AN III 37,18 = IV 265,19 ≠
267,9; Ja IV 4,20* (~ānaṁ ñātīnaṁ); IV 292,18*
(yaṁ hoti kiccaṁ ~ena); IV 19,13* (~ikā no ca
paduṭṭhacittā); V 159,31* (yathā maṁ ~o); f. ~akā
(scil. mātā), Ja V 329,17* (= mudu-hadayā, Ct);
Pj I 162,2 (Buddha nāma ~ā); Mil 126,8 (~o attha-
kāmo Sakko); Anāg 86 (~o kāruṇiko Metteyyo).
— Ifc. v. paramahitâ°, bālâ,° mittâ°, sabbabhūtâ°,
sabbalokâ°.

n. (see anukampā), a kind
heart, tenderness; Spk III 189,1 (~ena pariggahetvā,
= 'anukampaṁ upādāya', SN IV 359,19).

pr. 3 sg. [anu + √kamp], to have
pity on, to commiserate (w. acc. (once gen.) pers.), AN
III 263,27 (gihīnaṁ); Ja IV 197,26* (tato naṁ nâ°);
Sadd 555,30 (= 'bhāveti'); 2 sg. ~asi, Ja III 309,21*
(athomaṁ~); 3 pl. ~anti, DN II 89,1* (tato naṁ
~); [part. ~aṁ, Ap 35,13 (v. l.; read anukampa, see
anu-kampati~o = Ap 8,17; Nidd & Nidd-a); Sn 378 (satte ~o); 695
(bhāgineyyaṁ sayam ~o); Ja I 241,11' (hitena ~assa,
— 'hitânukampino'); Pv-a 35,18 (tarn ~ā); 104,18
(do.); 62,19 (pitaraṁ ca ñātake ca ~o); — imper.
2 sg. ~a (maṁ), Pv 99 (Pv-a); Ap 35,13 [Ee ~pī, v. l.
~paṁ] = Th-a Ce II 67,19*; Nidd II 88,1 (anugaṇha
+ ); Bv 11 (anukamp' imaṁ pajaṁ; = anukampaṁ
anuddayaṁ karohi, Bv-a, see abs. below) ≠ Jināl
176; 2 sg. med., ~assu, Pv 407 (— anugaṇha anud-
dayaṁ karohi, Pv-a); — pot. 2 pl., ~eyyātha (ye
~), AN I 222,8 = SN V 189,1-10 = 434,31; — aor.
3 sg. ~i, SN I 82,20 (ubhayena vata maṁ so Bha-
gavā atthena ~); Th 334 (anusāsi. . . ~ + anuggahi;
cf. anukampi(n), mfn.); 3 sg. med. ~ittha, Mhv
XXXVII 109 (satte); — inf. ~ituṁ, SN I 206,25*
(na taṁ arahati sappañño manasā ~); — abs.
anukampa, Ja III 442,8* (~ yoniso; cf. above Bv 11,
where Bv-a takes it as an imper. 2 sg.); — pp. ~ita
(q. v.); — grd. ~itabba, mfn., Sadd 556,2 (synon.
bhāvetabba).

n. [ts.], compassion; Abh 1193
('handa' hāse ~e); abl. [~ā, Pv-a 88,6; prob. w. r. for
anukampamānā, Ce]; ~ato (pacchimaṁ janataṁ ~),
Ps II 236,2.
entry.re:
— °-sīlaanu-kampana-sīla, mfn., compassionate, Pv-a 16,2
(= 'anukampaka').

entry.sense:
f. [ts.], compassion, pity; kindness;
Abh 160; with gen. or loc. pers., Vin III 42,15 (pāṇesu
anuddayā ~ā; = paradukkhena citta-kampanā, Sp);
Sv (II) 456,31 (ad DN II 28,33,= mettāya pubba-
bhāgo); anukampana-vasena ~ā, Nidd-a II 190,6 (ad
Nidd I 488,11) = As 362,10 (ad Dhs 1056); atthi me
tumhesu ~ā, MN I 12,16; atthi me kumāre ~ā,
MN I 395,1 (cf. 2 3); ~ā no katā . . . tayā, Mhv I
anu-kampā~ā, AN I 92,29; acc. ~aṁ (anuddayam, anurak-
khaṁ+), SN IV 323,22 foll.; frequently in the
phrase ~aṁ upādāya, out of pity or kindness, Ud 25,21
(atthakāma +); AN III 37,19; IV 265,10; MN II
238.22 (dhammaṁ deseti) ≠ III 117,21 = 221,6;
MN II 265,36 (yaṁ Satthārā karanīyaṁ sāvakānaṁ
~) = III 302,7 = SN IV 359,19 (Spk) = V 157,24
= AN IV 139,24; with imper. = 'please', 'kindly'
. . . : upasaṁkamatu ~, DN I 204,16 (quoted Ud-a 7,1)
≠ MN I 161,15 ≠ II 192,10 ≠ III 153,6 ≠ AN
I 64,28 ≠ II 145,7; paṭigaṇhātu ~, DN II 133,13
(= mayi ~aṁ paticca, Sv) ≠ MN II 116,32 ≠
AN III 49,17; MN'il 113,9; SN II 199,25 (kāruñ-
ñaṁ . . . anudayam paṭicca +; = muducittataṁ,
Spk); abl. (or dat.) ~āya, Th 492 (pāṇinaṁ) =
1258; 560 (me); 1223 (nibbāpanaṁ brūhi ~); Thī 136
(so me dhammaṁ adesesi ~) ≠ 148 ≠ 155; AN I
98.20 (gihīnaṁ, dat., cf. ib. 22); AN I 125,8 (aññatra
anuddayā ~ā(ya), quoted Dhp-a II 24,6) — Pp 35,20;
AN II 176,33 (dat. pāṇānaṁ anuddayāya ~āya paṭi-
panno); Ja III 280,18 (tava); IV 471,16* (tass' eva);
Cp I 9,38 (~āya dārake; sg. for pl. dārakesu, or
anukampāya governing the acc. ɔ: anukampitvā?;
quoted Ja VI 514,8*); Ud-a 196,32 (sattesu); Dhp-a
I 166,11. (taṁ ... ~āya paṭijaggi); Pv-a 47,13
(tassā); 147,20 (do.); Mil 129,18 (tassa kulassa);
224,16 (janakāyassa). — Ifc. v. āmisâ°, dhammâ°,
bhūtâ°, mittâ°, lokâ°, sâ°.
entry.re:
— — °-jātikaanu-kampā-jātika, mfn.,
merciful; MN II 205,5 foll. (~aṁ dānam).

entry.sense:
mfn. [ts.], sympathizing with
(acc), compassionate; m. ~ī, Th 334 (if not aor. 3 sg.);
It 21,10* (with acc. sabbe va pane manasâ°, v. l. anu-
kampaṁ) = AN IV 151,3* (v. l. do., quoted Pj I
168,18*); [Ap 35,13 (~ī and aṁ, w. rr. for anukampa)].
— Ifc. v. ahitâ°, sabbabhūtâ°, sabbalokâ°, hitâ°.

entry.re:
— — °-rūpaanu-kampita-rūpa,
mfn., id.; MN I 23,37 (°âyaṁ bhotā Gotamena
pacchimā janatā; = °-jātika, °-sabhāva, Ps I
129,14-15).

entry.sense:
mfn. [ts.], imitating; Child, without
reference.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √kṛḷ; 3 pl.
anu-kubbanti « kurvanti), hence a possible 3 sg.
anu-kubbati (not in our texts), cf. part, anu-
kubbaṁ; (a) to do after or in return; (b) to imitate;
(c) to equal, to emulate (with gen. pers.); Sn 221
(gihī nânukaroti bhikkhuno, c); Ja V 434,2** (ka-
taṁ anu-karoti, b; Ct. ib. 436,29') quoted Dhp-a
anu-karoti211.23 foll. (Mp) ≠ IV 249,7 foll. = 388,19 foll.;
pr. 3 pl. anukubbanti (duddadaṁ dadamānānaṁ . . .
asanto nâ°, c), SN I 19,4* = Ja IV 65,8* (Ct. tesam
gatamaggaṁ nânugacchanti) = VI 571,16*; passa-
mānâ°, (b), AN I 153,1* = III 44,23*; — part. m.
anukubbaṁ (mamâ°, c), Vin II 201,24,27* (cf. anu-
kubba, mfn. below) ≠ Ja I 491,15 (mama anukaronto)
≠ II 162,15 (mayhaṁ anukaronto) ≠ III 112,20
(tumhākaṁ anukaronto); tassânukaraṁ, (c), Ja II
150,14* (= tassa anukaronto, Ct.) quoted Dhp-a I
144,11*; gen. m. °-kubbantassa, (a), Ja II 205,19' (=
'anukubbassa'); III 108,26' (do.).

(pr. 3 sg. [anu + √kṛṣ], to adduce,
recite, quote; fut. 1 sg. anukassāmi, DN II 255,23*
(silokaṁ ~; = akkhara-pada-niyamitaṁ vacana-
saṁghāṭaṁ pavattayissāmi, Sv);

n. [sa. anu-karsana], persua-
sion(1), MTD.

mfn. [sa. ts. with different sense],
loving in return, enamoured; instr, f. & m. anukā-
māyânukāmena . . . saha, Ja II 157,22* (Ee anukā-
măyâ°, Se anukāmayakāmena; cf. ib. n. 20 and Ct.).
ind. [ts.], at will, MTD.

m. [ts.], imitation, resemblance; Dīp
V 39 (tesañ ca ~ena; quoted Kv-a 4,3* and Sp-t ad
Sp I 37,6).

n., a secondary tenet; Sv (II) 349,18
ad DN I 161,15 (Gotamena vutta-kāraṇassa ~aṁ
kathenti); [also w. r. for anu-karaṇa, q. v.]
ind. [ts.]; ifc. v. kālâ°.

mfn. (pp. of next; sa. anu-kīrṇa),
strewn with, crowded or filled with; ifc. v. bhamara-
gaṇâ°, rajâ°.

[pr. 3 sg. [anu + √kṛ], (a) to scatter
along; aor. 3 sg. anvakāri, MN II 100,6* (itv-eva coro
asim āvudhañ ca sobbhe ... ~; = khipi chaḍḍesi,
Ps) = Th 869 (Ee anvakāsi); — (b) to bestrew,'over-
heap; aor. 3 sg. anvakāri, so read Ja VI 208,22* (lo-
[anu-kirati]matthakāri, Ck kim annukāri, Cs kimattvakāri; =
adhammena kiṁkāraṇā lokaṁ anvākiriyaṁ yojaya-
tîti [read: anvākiri, saṁyojayîti] attho, Ct.; Se
sabbalokaṁ anatthakārī nirattha-saṁyojayîti!); pp.
anu-kiṇṇa, q. v.

f. [sa. anu-kriyā], imitation, mimi-
cry; Ja II 39,3 (mama ~aṁ karonto); Dhp-a I 144,3
(tumhākaṁ ~aṁ kari, Ed. (misprint ) hari); ib. 5
(mama ~aṁ kātuṁ vāyami).

mfn. (pp. of anu + √krīḍ); — ifc.
v. kīḷitâ°.

mfn. (from the present stem in
anukubbati, see anukaroti above); only ifc. v. kiccâ°.
(pr. 3 sg.,) see anu-karoti.

ind., in each family, according to
family-custom; yajanti ~ sadā, SN I 76,24* = AN
II 43,4* (anu-kūlaṁ against metre; yajanti anukulan
ti anukulesu yajanti, Spk; yajanti anukulaṁ sadā
anu-kūlaṁ

n. (gender as in niccadāna),
an offering offered according to family-custom; DN I
144,9 foll. (nicca-dānāni ~āni, text constantly anu-
kūla°, Sv I 302,29 reads anukula°); AN II 43,28
(niccadānaṁ ~aṁ; anukūla° Ed.). Cf. prec.

mfn. [ts.], sometimes wrongly spelt
anu-kula; (I.) growing along the beach; Ap 347,1
(jātassarassânukūlā ketakā, but v. l. anukulaṁ ɔ: °kū-
lam); 368,25 (~ ā ketakā, v. l. anukūle). — (2) (a)
willing, compliant, faithful, devoted; Saddh 312 (gu-
ṇaḍḍho ~o); Mhv X 1,5 (duve dhītā ca anukūlā (so
with v. l. and metre) kulânucchavikā ahuṁ; = sa-
māna-vaṇṇā, Mhv-ṭ); — (b) favourable, agreeable,
anu-kūlahetvā); II 32,3 (°-dhammadesana°). — (c) in gramm.
= agreeing with; Sadd 266,12 (~āni . . . tiliṅgānaṁ).
— Ifc. v. an-°, itthiliṅgâ°, caritâ°, maggañāṇâ°,
yathâ°, liṅgattayâ°, sāsanâ°. Cf. ānukūlya, n.

ind., along the beach; Ap 347,1
(v. l.). Cf. anu-kūle.

mfn. = anu-kūla 2b); Abhidh-av
90,12-14* (rāga(dosa-)caritassâ°). — Ifc. v. icchâ°.

mfn., = anukula-vatti(n),
q. v.; Vv-a 280,22 (= 'anubbatā', [so Ce; Ee anu-
pubbatā[).

f. abstr. = next; Sadd 485,8 (=
'anurodho').

m., an agreeable or faithful
friend; As 127,22 = Abhidh-av 19,26.
[w. r. for anu-kula-yañña].

mfn., compliant, being at
anu-kūla-vattinwith Tr. & Se for °-vattanī, Ee; — 'kāmakaro');
Pj II 28,21 (samānena ~inā parijanena saddhiṁ vāso
yassa, so 'samānavāso').

m. Npr. of a brāhmaṇa (cf. Ke-
vaṭṭa); Ja VI 406,8; 407,29 foll.

n., not a (mendicants)
robe stricto sensu; Vism 64,2 (cf. ukkaṭṭha, paṁ-
sukūlika).

mfn. (an + pp. of ut + √kvath)
not boiling, not come to a boil; AN III 234,15 (uda-
patto agginā a-santatto ~o an-ussadaka-jāto).

f. (cf. ukkaṇṭhati & next),
contentment, patience; Ja VI 4,26 (°-atthāya); Mp III
120,19 (~ā appaṭisaṁ(g)haraṇā = 'appaṭivānī').

mfn., not coveting, not longing,
content, pleased; ramanti abhiramanti ~ā hutvā niva-
santi, Pj I 112,5 = Ps I 60,19; abhiramamānā va ~ā
va, Ja III 58,5; ~ā vasatha, Pv-a 13,29. — an-
ukkaṇṭhitā, f. abstr., Nidd II 235,24 (°âdhivacanaṁ,
scil. 'rati'). Cf. ukkaṇṭhitā, f. an-ukkaṇṭhita

m. [sa. anukrama], (a) succession,
order; instr, iminā ~ena, Pj I 88,30; 201,13; 216,18;
frequently ~ena, adv., in due course, gradually, by
and by, Ja I 157,3; 255,22; 262,20; 290,3; VI 275,6;
Dhp-a I 84,19; III 20,3; Ud-a 240,17; 408,10; Th-a ad
Th 727 (= 'anupubbaṁ'); Ps I 249,11; Pv-a 5,30;
Mhv XIV 38 (v. l.), etc. etc. — (b) a certain element
in the training of war-horses; loc. ~e MN I 446,17
anu-kkamaca nikkhipane ca, etc.). — Ifc. v. anusayâ°, jeṭṭhâ°,
desanâ°, bhavâ°, bhāvanâ°, vuttâ°, sah'-°. —
°-âgata, mfn., handed down in this order; Ps II
199,27 (~aṁ . . . pāḷipadaṁ; Ee anukkamagatam).

pr. 3 sg. [anu + √kram], to go
after, to step along, to follow; metaph, to conceive,
understand; 3 pl. ~anti, (sudesitaṁ maggaṁ), It
80,8* (= anugacchanti, paṭipajjanti, It-a); part. m.
~aṁ, AN III 41,8* (= anukkamanto, Mp); Vv 742
(= gacchanto, Vv-a); part. med. ~amāno, AN V 195,2
(anupariyāyapathaṁ); pot. 3 sg. ~e (hatthikkhan-
dhâvapatitaṁ, I. e. walk over, trample upon), Th 194;
inf. ~itave, SN I 24,8* (na-y-idaṁ bhāsita-mattena
. . . ~ (Ee anukkamituṁ ve) sakkā; = okkamituṁ,
paṭipajjituṁ, Spk); abs. ~itvā, Ps II 336,13 (ito vā
etto vā); intens. anucaṅkamati, q. v.

mfn. (an + pp. of ukkhipati), not
suspended, not excluded or expelled; Sp (Se II 409,1)
ad Vin IV 82,30'; Vin-vn 505.

pr. 3 sg. [anu + √kṣip], to throw
along, to trundle; part. m. vaṭṭaṁ ~aṁ, Cp III 11,6
( = bheṇḍuka-kīḷaṁ kīḷanto ti attho, Cp-a; cf. Ja
IV 30,27); grd. ~itabba, see next.

m., compensation (Utt. throwing
back, delivering in return, cf. anu-kkhipati); Vin I
285,30 (~e dinne; anukkhepo nāma yaṁ kiñci anu-
kkhipítabbaṁ anu-ppadātabbaṁ kappiya-bhandaṁ,
Sp).

pr. 3 sg. [anu + √khan], to dig
after (or deeper); pot. 3 sg. ~ṇe, Ja V 233,13* (= anu-
khaṇeyya, Ct.).

mfn. (abstracted from khuddâ-
nukhuddaka), minor, less important; ~āni sikkhā-
padāni, Mil 144,3; dubbhāsitaṁ ~aṁ sikkhāpadaṁ,
ib. 5 (quoted Sv (II) 592,26). — Ifc. v. khuddâ°.
[w.r. for āyu-khepana; Ap 405,1].

mfn. [ts.], going after, following, with
gen. pers. (ifc. (a) following (cf. anugāmika, a),
dependent on (upapada-cpd.); (β) followed by (bahu-
vrīhi-cpd.)); SN I 72,16* (kiṁ c'assa ~aṁ hoti) ≠
anu-ga~aṁ bhavissati); Ja IV 426,24* (hotu rājā tavânugo;
= tava vasaṁ anu-gato hotu, Ct.) — V 343,28*.
— Ifc. v. ejâ°, tathāgatâdāyâ°, therapadâ°, thera-
matâ°, puññakamma-pathâ°, maggâ°, māra-
dheyyasarâ°, vasâ° (atthacintā-°, chanda-°, bad-
dha-°, Māra-°), sattâmacca-satâ° (β).

pr. 3 sg. [anu + √gam & √gā],
to follow, to go or fall into (acc); MN I 178,19; Ps III
214,11 - Spk (Ee) II 338,29 = Sv I 165,29; Nidd I
17,2 (= 'anveti'; samīpaṁ gacchati, Nidd-a); Dhp-a I
21,15; 24,1; 3 pl. ~anti, Dhp-a I 6,12; Sv (TH) 868,33
(= 'anupadanti', DN III 86,26); part. m. ~anto, MN
I 178,20; SN II 105,37 foll; Ja II 209,9'; Pv-a 141,27;
gen. ~ato, Paṭis I 164,1 (satiyā), quoted Sp (II) 421,15;
pl. ~antā, Mp II 233,9 (opp. paccuggacchantā); pot.
3 sg. ~eyya, SN II 105,37; aor. anv-agū, 3 sg., Sn 586
(sokassa vasam; Pj; cf. the adj.s in °g[ū/u]); 3 pl., SN
I 39,1*-16* ([nāmassa] . . . sabbe 'va vasam ~); do.
for 1 sg. Ja IV 121,20* (jarāya vasam); 3 sg. anv-agā,
anu-gacchatiMhv VII,10; annagā (3 sg. for anvagaṁ, 1 sg. as
quoted Sadd 464,24; 843,12), Ja V 258,1* = 25* foll.
(kāmānaṁ vasam ≠ Mvu III 457,20* foll.); anu-
gamāsi, Vin I 16,15; anu-gañchi, Dhp-a II 137,15;
1 sg. anv-agañchiṁ, Ja V 166,23*; anu-gacchiṁ, SN
II 106,7 foll.; 3 pl. anv-agamuṁ, Ja VI 512,12*; fut.
2 sg. anu-gacchissasi, Ps II 407,23; abs. anu-gantvā,
Dhp-a I 14,9; II 137,20; Ud-a 275,14 (cittena); [Ja I
337,5 by Tr. corrected into an-uggantvā (confirmed by
Ja-pota; uḍa no nægī), see uggacchati]; pass, anu-
gammati, q. v.; pp. anu-gata, q. v., cf. anvagata,
anuggata; grd. anu-gantabba, mfn., Ud-a 249,28;
Dhātum v. 152.

f., nomen actionis of prec; Paṭis
I 164,13* (cf. ib. 164,4 âc Sp (II) 421,8).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √garj], to shout
again, to repeat with emphasis (cf. buddha-gajjita);
Sv (II) 395,26 (. . . gajjati, dutiyena ~ati; Ee anu-
gacchati); 396,(6)-:u (do.).
[Ap 410,27; w. r. for gajā mattā].

anu-gaṇhana, see anu-ggaṇhăti,
etc., below.

mfn. (pp. of anu-gacchati; cf. anva-
gata & anuggata), following (ifc. also followed by), come
into (acc), included, conformable to, relating to; Abh
1174 ≠ Sadd 883,14 (the sense of prp. 'anu'); Ud
37,23* (~ā [unmetrical] manaso ubbilāvā; = cittena
anu-gataanuṭṭhitā ti attho); DN III 173,10* (parisā 'ssa hot(i)
~ā acalā); Ja IV 385,27' (= 'anvagata'); 426,27'
(tava vasaṁ ~o; = 'anugo'); V 444,7' (kāmam
anugatassa); VI 473,8' (f. ~ā, = 'anuggata' [B anu-
bbatā]); Nidd-a Ee I 65,17 (atthaṁ ~āya paṭipadāya,
= 'anvattha-paṭipadāya'); Ps II 223,6 (itaresu tīsu
koṭṭhāsesu ~āya, included in); Mil 191,24 (Savarapu-
raṁ ~aṁ, = caṇḍāla-nuvaraṭa pæmiṇa, Hīnaṭ);
204,27 (saṁsāra-sotam ~ā); 343,20 (dhutaṅgam ~ā,
conforming themselves to dhutaṅga).
entry.re:
— °-vedhaanu-gata-vedha, m.,
a following (second) stab; Spk III 150,2 (= 'anu-
vedhaṁ' in SN IV 208,12: dutiyena sallena (anu-
vedhaṁ) vijjheyyuṁ, paron.). — Ifc v. accanta-

salohitâ°, taṇhâ°, tad-°, thīnamiddhâ°, dosâ°,
dhaminâ°, nāmâ°, pāḷi-°, pemâ°, vaṁsâ°, vaṭṭâ°,
samuddâ°, sarīrâ°, sugatâ°, sotâ°, snehâ°.

entry.sense:
f. [ts.], going after, following; ifc. v.
diṭṭhâ°. — °-ka, mfn.; ifc. v. cittâ°, diṭṭhâ°.
anu-gantvā, see anu-gacchati.
m. [ts.], = next; ifc v. dur-°, mfn.

n. [ts.], coming after, following,
attending; Ja IV 321,15' (Ed. anuggamana-) ≠ VI

421,8. Cf. anugacchanā. — Ifc v. kāyâ°. anu-gamana
aor., see anu-gacchati.

(pr. 3 sg. (pass, of anu-gacchati),

part. med. pass., see anu-
ggaṇhăti.

mfn., as long as the bull; ~aṁ
(scil. sakaṭaṁ), Mogg III 48 (= Candra IV 4,69, see

mfn. [ts.], following, persecuting
(a certain direction or object); m. ~ī, Kacc-v 536; pl.

anu-gamin

mfn. (from prec), following, accom-

samo +); 22 (cf. āveniyaṁ dhanaṁ); ~aṁ attâ-
dhīnaṁ rājâdīnaṁ asādhāraṇaṁ (explaining 'vasutta-
maṁ'), Pj II 309,16 (cf. v. /.); ~aṁ anaññasādhāra-
ṇaṁ (saddhā-vittaṁ), Pj II 231,25; ~aṁ nidhānaṁ,
Pv-a 132,19 (sampatti-nidāna-°); 253,8 (do.; Ce Ee
anu-gāmikaTathāgatassa ~ā).

mfn. = prec, (a); Saddh 443
(~a-cchāyā; Ee ~ā chāyā).

n., wealth, that never can
be lost; Pj II 28,10 (dāna-sīlâdi ~aṁ).
entry.re:
— °-nidhianu-gămika-dhana-nidhi,
m., a treasure never to be lost; Ja IV 280,6',23' (=
'nidhi'; cf. KhpVIIIδ, etc.); VI 494,28'.

entry.sense: mfn. = anu-gāmika; Saddh 311.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √gai], to (sing

(+ anubhāsanti, anuvācenti, scil. porāṇaṁ manta-

yanaṁ; — Bhagavatā gītaṁ ~, Pj; = Bhagavato
gītaṁ ~, Nidd-a Sc); pass, anu-gīyati; pp. anugīta, q. v.

n. (from prec); Sadd 696,10 (+
patigāyanaj.

[m. Npr. of a paribbājaka; MN II 1,5
(~o Varadharo Sakuludāyī ca paribbājako) ≠ AN II

& Mp)].

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √gāh], to plunge
into, enter (acc); Saddh 611 (sabhāvaṁ); part. m.
~anto, ib.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √gṛdh], to be

anu-gijjhatihutvā punappuna allīyanti, Ct.); part. neg. m. an-
anu-gijjhanto, Pj II 163,8 (= 'anānugiddho'); pot.
3 sg. ~eyya Sn 922 (rase ca nâ°); pp. anu-giddha, q. v.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √gṙ3, cf. Dhātup
√gi = √ge, Sadd 493,23], to say after, to repeat (the
words of another); to approve or assent; Kacc-v 279
(p. 136,17 see PāṇI 4,10): tassa bhikkhuno ~āti,
tassa bhikkhuno patigiṇāti; cf. Sadd 696,17; Pay fol.
gah 8: tassa bhikkhuno chando ~āti patigiṇāti,
sādhukāra-dānâdinā taṁ ussāhetîti attho.

mfn. (pp. of anu-gijjhati), greedy
after, constantly coveting (with loc. or ifc.); Th 580
(rasesu ~assa). — Ifc v. an-° (anānugiddha), rasâ°,
sukhâ°.

mfn. (pp. of anu-gāyati), (a) recited,
intoned; (β) praised, celebrated in song; Ja IV 233,14*
(a, read: bhūmibhāgo yathâyam anugīto, B. mss. Ec:
yathā samanuglto, Se °bhāgo 'yaṁ samanu°; =

saha saccam-anugītena mahāmegho pavassati).

f. (cf. prec), a summary or recapitula-
tion (in verses, of a preceding exposition in prose);
Nett 2,1 (tassâ°; = vuttass' ev' atthassa ami pacchā
gāyanagāthā, Nett-a); 3,10* (suttassa; = saṅgaha-
gāthā, Nett-a); 10,23. (~iṁ vicinati); 21,10 (suttassa);
175,16 (~i sakavacanaṁ); Ps I 39,11 (ayaṁ pan' ettha
~i); III 285,5 ad MN II 72,25 (~iṁ avoca, Se w. r.
anugatiṁ). anu-gīti

ind. [ts.], behind the cows; gunnaṁ
pacchā ~u, Mogg-v III 48 (cf. Pāṇ V 2,15). Cf. anu-
gava.

mfn. [ts.], of similar quality, confor-
mable to; Ud-a 353,5 (tad-°aṁ uccheda-dassanaṁ).

mfn. [ts., pp. of anu + √gup], pro-
tected; m. ~o, Ja V 399,23* (tayâ°).

or anu-ggaṇhāti, pr. 3 sg. (often

3 sg. °-gaṇhātu (bhikkhu-saṁghaṁ), MN I 457,31; SN

(+anukampa; = 'anusāsa'); Pv-a 181,22 (= 'anu-

14'; 1 sg. anu-ggaṇheyyaṁ (bhikkhu-samghaṁ), SN

n., nom. act. of prec. = anug-
gaha; As 403,27 (tassa ~atthāya); Dhp-a II 107,13
(ñātaṁ ~atthāya); Ja I 135,23' (v. l. for anuggaha).
— °-ka, mfn., helpful; pl. ~ā, Pv-a 69,14 (= 'anu-
kampakā').
entry.re:

haṇa-s°; cf. anuggaha-sīla & anuggāhaka).

entry.sense: see anu-ggaṇhati.

mfn., [*anu + ud-gata], arisen along

mfn. (an + pp. of uggacchati),
(a) not risen, not high, not rising above; Ap 245,7

= MN I 169,13 = SN I 138,10 ~ AN III 26,21 =

not bristle; m. ~o, Ud-a 163,16 (= 'panna-lomo').

[n., Ja IV 321,15' (read anu-
gamana; cf. VI 118,34')].

mfn. (cf. uggaṇhāti), not taking up,

manifested by a°, As 117,18. anu-ggahaṇa

f.; instr. ~iyā (mam an°
or mamân°, out of ktndness for me), Ap 546,21 =

mfn., helpful, merciful; Ud-a
82,21 (= 'anukampaka')-
neg. abs. of uggaṇhāti (q. v.).
aor., see anu-ggaṇhăti.

mfn. (pp. of anu-ggaṇhăti), (a)

vipassanâ°, samathâ°, sākacchâ°, sīlâ°, sutâ°.
neg. abs. of uggaṇhāti (q. v.).
part, of anu-ggaṇh[ā/a]ti (q. v.).

-f(~ikā)n., [sa. anu-grāhaka],

~akā brahmacārīnam; quoted Ps II 221,33); SN III

part. neg. m. of uggirati (q. v.).
an-ugghaṭetvā, neg. abs. of ugghāṭeti (q. v.).
an-ugghāta, m. (an + ugghāta, sa. ud-ghāta),

mfn., not hurting; Vv 33 (~ī
mitaṁ gacchati vāraṇo; = na ugghātī, attano upari

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √ghat], to

ind., along the houses or in each

ind. id.; Vin 1249,23 (~aṁ
~aṁ āhiṇḍatha; i. e. from house to house).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √ghrā], to

pr. 3 sg. (anu + intens. of ka-

227,30; II 118,17; III 128,11; AN I 136,22 (Ed. anu-

kamiṁsu, DN III 80,20 (Bhagavantaṁ caṅkamantam

m. [ts.], a companion, follower, func-

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √car], 'to follow
after', (α) to walk along or parade with (acc); (β) to

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of anu-carati), to

mfn. (pp. of anu-carati), (a) pervaded

f., (a) service; DN II 264,8 (acc

mfn. [ts.], following or walking along;

f., an attending or serving woman;

mfn. (pp. of anu-carati), (a) followed,

[pr. 3 sg.; part. m. ~anto (vana-

[mfn., w. r. (Se) for an-acchariya,

or anu-cchavi), mfn. (anu +

mfn. = prec; Abh 715; Ja I

309,4 (brahmacariyaṁ carantānaṁ ~āni vatthāni);
Ps II 399,9 (~am idaṁ tumhākaṁ); Mp II 220,5
(nâyaṁ aññassa kammassa~o); Pv-a 13,9 (tumhākaṁ
~aṁ); 26,1 (~aṁ, = 'kappiyaṁ'); 66,1 (na c'etaṁ
~aṁ); 81,11 (bhikkhusaṁghassa ~e); 286,9 (pāpa-
anu-cchavikabhavituṁ ~o); Vv-a 68,12 (āsiñcituṁ ~ā). — °-vo-
hāra, m., a suitable designation; Ud-a 72,18 (pabbaji-
tānaṁ ~ena, scil. 'ayyo'). — Ifc. v. an-°, kaṇḍâ°,
kulâ°, tad-°, thūpâ°, purisâ°, Buddha°, rājâ°,
samaṇâ°.
mfn., see an-ucciṭṭha.

m. (or f. ~ā), [ts.], a younger brother (or
sister); Abh 254; Mhv XLVIII 20 (tassânujo); XLIX
65 (do.); LIX 11 (~aṁ); LXXXVIII 20 (nijânujaṁ);
LXXXIV 29 (°-rājaṁ, younger brother and sub-king);
— f. ~ā; Vin-vn 487 (gen. ~āya). — mfn., = anu-
jāta; Ja II 99,4' (t'-anujo ti tassa anujo, anurū-
anu-jamean:
see anojagghati.
pot. of anu-jānāti (q. v.).

pr. 3 sg. (anu + √ju), to run after,
to pursue; part. m. ~javaṁ, Ja VI 452,6* (Cks anu-
jjavaṁ; and metre demands ˇ - ˇ ˇ or ˇ ˇ - - ;
= ~javanto, Ct.); fut. 2 sg. ~javissasi + anu-ban-
anu-javati

mfn. [ts., pp. of anu-jāyati], 'born
after', like, equal, taking after or following the example
of one's parents (or teacher); Mogg V 59 (Pay; passive
and active (with acc.)); Sn 557 (Sāriputto anuvatteti
~o Tathāgataṁ; Pj) = Th 827; Th 1279 (~aṁ mahă-
vīraṁ); voc. Ap 25,1 = Th-a Ce II 104,1* (mahāvīra
~a mahāyasaṁ)?); It 63,1-15 (atijāto +; It-a);
anu-jāta380,19* (~o pitaraṁ; kulatanti-kulapaveṇi-rakkhako
. . . ~o nāma, Ct); Dāṭh II 66 (~o . . . suto).
— °-putta, m., a worthy son; Dhp-a I 129,15 (pl. ~ā).

n. (from anu-jānāti), assenting, ad-
mission; Ps I 96,6 (kiñcâpī ti °-pasaṁsanatthe
nipāto, cf. anuggaha (b)).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √jñā], to give
permission to (acc. or gen.), to grant, allow (acc.
or gen. pers. & dat. or acc. rei); to acknowledge,
consent, appreciate, advise, recommend; (in Vinaya)
when the Buddha speaks, nearly = to ordain or
prescribe (with acc. or foll. inf.); sg. ~āti, DN III
anu-jānāti254,6 (na Bhagavā ~ mātugāmassa . . . pabbajjaṁ)
= AN IV 274,22; MN II 61,14 (sace maṁ Bhagavā
~); Ja III 136,5* (hadayaṁ nâ°; i.e. opposes); 2 sg.
~āsi, Ja VI 285,26* (subhāsitaṁ n'~ mayhaṁ; = na
desi, Ct.); 1 sg. ~āmi, with inf. Vin I 54,10; 56,7;
83,25; III 39,7 (quoted Ps I 62,10); Ja II 15,15; ~tāni
bhesajjāni . . . paribhuñjituṁ, Vin I 200,3 (quoted
Ps I 90,21); with acc. Vin I 280,35 (gahapaticīvaraṁ;
quoted Ps I 90,7); II 146,28 (pañca leṇāni; quoted
Ps I 90,17); 175,32 (saṁghabhattaṁ; quoted Ps I
90,12); MN I 398,26 (idam assa ~); III 212,13 foll.
(do.); SN IV 225,23 (idaṁ nesâhaṁnâ°); Vin II 162,19
(quoted Ja I 219,21); Ja VI 425,10* (taṁ ~ rattiyo
sattamattiyo, I give you leave for seven nights); 3 pl.
~anti, MN II 58,34 (na taṁ mātāpitaro ~ . . . pabbaj-
jāya); 1 pl. ~āma, MN II 58,7 (na taṁ mayaṁ ~ . . .
pabbajjāya); — part. m. ~anto, Ja VI 433,29' (tassa
cittaṁ, favouring; v. l. ajānanto); do. neg. with rhythm,
lengthening an-ānujānaṁ (parassa dhammaṁ), Sn
880; neg. m. pl. an-anujānantā, Ud-a 212,27; part,
med. m. pl. ~amānā, Ps III 273,14; — imper. 2 sg.
(a ) anu-jāna (pabbajjaṁ), Ja IV 423,11; 482,30* (~
maṁ, pabbajissāmi deva); (b) anu-jānāhi, Sn 982
(me); Thī 332 (me); Ja VI 505,30* (maṁ); Dhp-a I
137.1 (maṁ); 3 sg. ~ātu, Vin I 280,27; DN II 46,22;
Pv 574 (yathāmatiṁ ~ saṁgho); Ja IV 120,24' (=
'anumaññatu'); 2 pl. ~ātha, Thī 457 (maṁ); MN II
56,28 (maṁ . . . pabbajjāya) ≠ Vin III 13,1; Vin IV
225.25 (ekaṁ me itthiṁ ~, allow me the power over
her, i. e. allow me to kill her); Dhp-a I 355,13 (mamaṁ
kulaghara-gamanaṁ); III 80,17 (parinibbānaṁ me
~); Pv-a 55,6 (mamaṁ); 3 pl. ~antu, DN I 136,21
(~ me . . . yaṁ mama assa . . . hitāya); — pot. 3 sg.
(a ) ănu-jaññā [sa. anu-jānīyāt], Sn 394; 395; 397, 398
(with gen., to approve of); (b ) anu-jāneyya, AN IV
355,18 (sace maṁ Bhagavā ~); Ud 58,11 (sace maṁ
upajjhāyo ~); 2 sg. °-jāneyyāsi (anuññeyyaṁ), MN
II 158,26; AN II 197,10; Ja V 343,1' (= 'anumañ-
ñesi'); 1 sg. °-jāneyyaṁ, DN II 45,29 (bhikkhū); Vin
I 21,33 (bhikkhūnaṁ); — aor. 3 sg. (a ) anu-jāni, Ja
I 317,12 (sādhū ti~); Dhp-a III 76,17 (araññavāsaṁ);
Ud-a 220,16 (assa tattha gamanaṁ); Ja V 380,20
(tesaṁ saṁgamanaṁ, Ck gamanaṁ); VI 345,28 (°assa
. . . upaṭṭhānaṁ); Pv-a 142,7 (ekaṁ . . . dīyamānaṁ);
(b) anuññāsi, Ja V 380,24* (= gacchathā ti ~, Ct.);
Mhv XXX,10; 1 sg. anuññāsiṁ, Ja V 346,20* (= anu-
jāniṁ, Ct.); 3 pl. anujāniṁsu, Ps III 271,16 (nâ°);
Pv-a 79,7 (tassā pavesanaṁ); — fut. 1 sg. °jānissāmi,
MN II 158,30 (anuññeyyaṁ [Ee anumaññeyyaṁ] ~;
opp. paṭikkosissāmi) ≠ AN II 197,24; 3 pl. ~is-
santi (maṁ . . . pabbajjāya), MN II 56,20 ≠ Vin III
12,30; 2 pl. ~issatha, MN II 60,1; 1 pl. ~issāma, MN
II 57,5; — inf. ~ituṁ, Ja V 24,27* (~ āgamanāya
paṇhe); — abs. ~itvā (uposathâdīni), Dhp-a I 55,9;
— pp. anuññāta (q. v.); — grd. (a ) anuññeyya (q. v.);
(b ) °-jānitabba, Sv (III) 838,28 (= 'anuññeyya');
— caus. v. anu-jānāpeti & anu-jāneti.

pr. 3 sg., caus. of prec, to cause
one to give permission to (acc), to ask or obtain per-
mission (from acc); part. m. ~ento, Ja IV 449,20
(attānaṁ ~); VI 505,29 (pabbajjaṁ); fut. 1 pl. ~es-
sāma, Ps III 272,16 (mātāpitaro); abs. ~etvā, Ja I
156,14 (mātāpitaro); IV 423,11 (pabbajjaṁ anujăna
devā ti ~); Ud-a 322,10 (Bhagavantaṁ); 431,9
(parinibbānaṁ). Cf. next.

pr. 3 sg. = prec.; fut. 1 pl. ~essāma
(agate bhikkhū), Vin II 301,3; abs. ~etvā, Ap 569,1
(tadâhaṁ [v. l. tadā taṁ] ~ pabbajiṁ anagāriyaṁ).

mfn. [sa. anu-jīrṇa, pp. of anu + √jṛ],
grown old (along with); according to Mogg V 59 (Pay)
with active or passive sense: ~o vasaliṁ Devadatto, ~ā
vasalī Devadattena; cf. Pāṇ 1114,12; — It-a ad It
86,5* gives anujiṇṇo or anujīno [Se anu-jino] =
parihīno as v. r. for anu-ciṇṇo, q. v. anu-jiṇṇa

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √jīv], to live
dependent on, by the merits of, thanks (acc); 2 sg.
~asi, Ja IV 271,1* (alīnacittassa tuvaṁ vikkantaṁ
~; = upajīvasi, Ct.).

mfn. [ts.], living dependent on; m.,
a dependent, servant, follower; Abh 342 (~ī + sevako);
pl. ~ino, [usually in the formula ye c'anne (c'assa) ~]:
Ap 315,10 (dāsīdāsā ca bhariyā (ca) +); SN I 93,5*
anu-jivinñātisaṁghā +) = III 44,21*; III 78,10* (antojanassa
atthāya ye c'assa ~ino); Ja III 256,14* (puttā ca
dāsā ca + ; — taṁ nissāya jīvanakā, Ct.) = 485,1*;
V 173,29* = VI 302,3* = 317,21*; IV 53,29* (dāsā
ca dasso+); 216,26' (tavânujīvino).
entry.re:
— °-janaanu-jivi(n)-jana, m.,
a serving-man, dependent people; Dāṭh V 43.

sense.hi: n., living after; only ifc. v.

entry.sense:
m. Npr. of a Damiḷa-chief;
Mhv LXXVII 33 (°avhaṁ, named A.).

mfn. [sa. an-ṛju] (sometimes spelt an-ujju,
see below anujjaṅgī, anujjuka), not straight, crooked,
bent; wicked; Abh 737 (nikata, saṭha +); Sadd 323,22
(vaṁka +).

mfn. = prec; SN IV 299,13 foll.
(+ saṭho, māyāvī). See also an-ujjuka below.

f. abstr. from an-uju; °âkāra, m.,
dishonesty; Vibh-a 494,17 (= 'anajjavo').

m. abstr. = prec; Vibh-a 494,17
(= 'anajjavatā').

ind. [sa. anu-jyeṣṭham], according
to seniority; Mogg III 2; Pay: = jetthânukkamena).
Cf. Kāç 11,1,6.

n., after-illustrating; Paṭis I 18,25
(°aṭṭho); II 122,27.

f., [fern, of an-ujju-aṅga, cf. sa.
natâṅgī], with curved body (round-limbed); ~ī, Ja
VI 500,14*-26* (= anindita-agarahita-aṅgī, Ct., as
from an-udyao: anavadya, Tr.); voc. ~i, Ja V 40,13*
(Bd anucc°; = kañcana-sannibha-sarlre (!), Ct.). an-ujjaṅgī

[pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √jval, caus.],
to kindle (in a row); aor. 1 sg. dīpā 'nujjalayiṁ, Ap
579,15 = Thī-a 69,29* (read: dīpān' ujjalayiṁ, cf.
Ap 373,25-26)].
see anu-javati.

f. Npr. of the wife of Vidhura; Ja VI
290,11*,15' (Bd Anojā, cf. the Amg Npr. Aṇujjā
(*Anudyā)).

mfn. = an-ujuka (q. v.); f. pl. ~ā
(gopānasiyo, crooked, bent), Ja III 318,11*; instr, sg.
~ena cittena, Ja V 293,27' (= 'anujjubhūtena').

mfn. (an-ujju = an-uju +
gāmi(n), 'crooked-going'; m. a snake; m. voc. °-gāmi
uraga (d)dujivha, Ja IV 330,3*. an-ujju-gāmin

mfn. (an-ujju = an-uju +
bhuta), not straight, crooked; instr, n. ~ena, Ja V
293,22* (see 293,14: kācaṁ ādāya; = an-ujjukena
cittena, Ct.).

mfn., not easily taking
offence; Mil 352,16 (saddho hoti hirimā . . . ~o mettā-
vihārī; cf. Dhp-a III 377,2).

f. [sa. anu-jñā], permission, appro-
bation, command; Abh 1133 (= 'sammuti'); 1192
(connotation of the particle 'nanu'); Mogg-v VI 9 (do.
of the pot. mode); Ps III 659,13 (dvīsu ṭhānesu ~ā,
tīsu an-anuññā); Mhv IX 8 (raññânuññāya, with the
king's permission). — Ifc. v. an-°, pabbajjâ°, rājâ°. anu-ññā

mfn. [sa. anu-jñāta, pp. of anu-
jānāti], permitted, allowed, granted (by a king);
sanctioned, ordained (by the Buddha); Vin I 75,1
(Bimbisārena ~aṁ hoti); II 169,27 (Bhagavatā pā-
sādaparibhogo ~o); DN III 130,9 (mayā piṇḍapāto
~o); Pp 28,18 (Bhagavatā gilānabhattaṁ ~aṁ); MN
II 56,13 (~o si . . . mātāpitūhi); Ud-a 71,11 (dḍ.);
Vin I 93,30 (cf. 83,12) (do.); Ja VI 16,6* (~o ahaṁ
anu-ññātaSabbadattena rājinā); V 28,28* (~o sotthi paccehi; =
tena ~o sotthinā paccehi, Ct.); 380,28 (tena~o); Pv-a
12,29 (therena ~o); 81,1 (~aṁ bhante); f. ~ā, (kap-
piyabhūmi), Dhp-a II 81,15; m. pl. ~ā (raññā), Ud-a
259,15 = Ja II 416,16; Sv I 267,28 (= 'anumatā');
n. ~aṁ (opp. paṭikkhittaṁ), Nett 161,30 (cf. 184,26;
192,9-13); n. pl. ~āni (Bhagavatā tīṇi cīvarāni),
Dhp-a III 72,15. — Bhagavatā ~a-vidhinā, in the
way recommended by Bh., Ud-a 229,1. — Ifc v. an-°,
nâ°.
entry.re:
— °-ttaanu-ññāta-tta, n. abstr., Ja II 353,6; Ps I 90,5; Vism
34,27 (mhṭ).

entry.sense:
mfn. (grd. of anu-jānāti), worthy of
approval or appreciation; DN III 47,25 (pariyāyaṁ
~am; = anujānitabbaṁ anumoditabbaṁ, Sv); AN
II 197,19 (~aṁ ... anujāneyyāsi) ≠ MN II 158,25
(w. r. anumaññeyyaṁ).

f., a gloss or supplement to a ṭīkā
(q. v.); Gv 60,16 (Līnatthavaṇṇanā nāma ~ā).
— Ifc., v. Abhidhamma-°.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √sthā], see
anu-tiṭṭhati.

an - uṭṭhahanta, an - uṭṭha-
hāna, neg. part, of uṭṭhahati, q. v. an-uṭṭhaha(ṁ)

m. (neg. nom. agentis of uttiṭṭhati),
one who does not rouse himself, being without energy;
nom. ~ā, Sn 96 (= viriya-teja-virahito, utthāna-sīlo
an-uṭṭhātaran-uṭṭhāta

n., the not getting up, or the not
minding one's business, negligence, want of energy;
ālassaṁ +, SN I 43,19* (= kamma-samaye kamma-
karaṇa-viriyâbhāvo, Spk); AN V 136,6 (ālassaṁ ~aṁ
bhogānaṁ paripantho).
entry.re:
— °-malaan-uṭṭhāna-mala, mfn., suffering
from negligence; pl. ~ā gharā, AN IV 195,15 (=
uṭṭhāna-viriyâbhāvo gharānaṁ malaṁ nāma, Mp) ≠
ib.' 23* = Dhp 241 (Dhp-a).

entry.sense:
n. [sa. anu-ṣṭhāna], carrying out,
undertaking; ifc. v. kammantâ°, kusaladhammâ°,
pāricariyâ°.

mfn. [anu + uṭṭhita], Ud-a 237,4
(= 'anuggata', q. v.).

mfn., not having arisen; Dhs 1036
(ye dhammā ajātā, abhūtā, etc. + ~ā) ≠ Vibh 1,23.

mfn. [sa. anu-ṣṭhita; pp. of anu-
tiṭṭhati], carried out, practised; bhāvita +, DN II 103,2
(cattāro iddhiDādā bhāvitā . . . ~ā; = adhitthitā,
Sv [Ee adhitiṭṭhitā!]) = SN I 116,30 (= avijahitā
niccânubandhā (so CeEeSeo: °baddhā?), Spk) =
anu-ṭṭhitaDN II 103,6, quoted Mil 140,22; SN II 264,15 (mettā
...~ā; = adhitthitā, Spk) = AN III 290,24 (=
do., Mp) — IV 300,2 ≠ IV 150,11 (mettāya . . .
~āya; = paccupatthitāya, Mp) ≠ AN V 342,3
(quoted Ja II 61,1: see Paṭis II 130,5); SN IV 200,30
(kāyagatā sati . . . ~ā); V 259,19 (iddhipādā . . . ~ā;
= adhiṭṭhitā, Spk) ≠ MN III 97,16 (kāyagatāya
satiyā . . . ~āya; Ps); Paṭis I 172,18-30 (cattāro
bhāvanaṭṭhā yānikatā + . . . ~ā); [Ud-a 237,4 (pl.
~ā, = 'anuggata'), see anuṭṭhita]; Ud-a 352,19 (ime
antā, te ca evaṁ gahitā, evaṁ ~ā); Pv-a 132,27
(mayā ~aṁ); — also in active sense = who has fol-
lowed or tended (acc.); Ja VI 563,2* (ahaṁ patiñ ca
putte ca . . . ~ā divārattim; = pāricariyânuṭṭhānena
~ā a(p)pamattā hutvā paṭijaggāmi, Ct.). — °(a)ṭṭha,
m., the notion of a°, Paṭis I 18,8.

f. [sa. anuṣṭubh], a class of metres;
°bhâdivasena isīhi pavattitaṁ catuppadaṁ chappa-
daṁ vā vacanaṁ, Th-a Ce 7,3 ad Th introd. v. 1
(= 'gāthā'); Abh 945 ('chando'); Vutt 47—51 (citra-
padā vijjummālā, etc.). Cf. ānuṭṭhubha, mfn.

neg. abs. of niṭṭhubhati (or
nuṭṭhubhati), q. v.
mfn., see a-niṭṭhuri(n).
see anu-d°.

[pr. 3 sg. (anu + sa. √daṁç), to bite;
aor. 3 sg. anu-ḍasī, Ja VI 192,2* (kacci fānuḍasī tāta,
prob. w. r. for kacci taṁ nu ḍasī tāta (Tr.); Bd kacci
[anu-dasati
anu-dahana, see anu-d° below.
= anunnata, q. v.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √tark], to
consider, to bear in mind; MTD & Child, (without
reference).

or anu-tappati, pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu-
√tap, anu-tapati, pass, (reft.) anu-tapyate, cf. Pāṇ III
anu-tapatiindiscriminately

mfn. (grd. of prec), to be re-
pented; Ja III 341,11' (dānaṁ nāma datvā n'eva
~aṁ).

mfn. (grd. of anu-tapati; cf. anu-
tāpiya), to be regretted, deplorable; DN III 122,3, 12
(satthā sāvakānaṁ kālakato ~o hoti; = anutāpakaro
hoti, Sv); AN I 22,19 ([Tathāgatassa] kālakiriyā
bahuno janassa ~ā; = anutāpakarā, Mp) ≠ 77,6;
III 294,12. — Ifc. v. an-°, pacchâ°. anu-tappa

n., regretting, repenting; Ja VI
552,25 (dānaṁ datvā (Lk inserts pacchā) ~aṁ nāma
sataṁ dhammo na hoti); Sv (III) 910,12 ad DN III
122,1 (idaṁ tesaṁ °âkāra-dassanatthaṁ vuttaṁ).
n. [ts.], freight, MTD.

[pr. 3 sg. (anu + √tṛ), to pass along];
pp. anu-tinna, q. v.

m. [ts.], repentance, regret (often with
pacchā, cf. pacchā-tāpa); Abh 169; Ja VI 267,2'
(pacchā ~aṁ āvahati); 553,6' (dānaṁ datvā pacchā
~o) ;Vv 445 (hoti ca me ~o; = vippaṭisāro, Vv-a);
As 384,17 (duṭṭhu mayā idaṁ katan ti evaṁ ~o
anu-tāpa(111)910,11,15; f. ~ā, Mp I 115,10.

mfn. [ts.], repenting, regretting; only
ifc. v. pacchâ° (Thī 57 = 190; Vv 226).

mfn. (grd. of anu-tapati; cf. anu-
tappa), to be regretted; ifc. v. an-°.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √taḍ], to beat
repeatedly; aor. 2 sg. °-tāḷayi, Ja II 280,1*, 6* ( =
tāḷesi, Ct).

or anu-ṭṭhahati, 3 sg. [sa. anu +
√sthā], (a) to stand by, assist; (b) to carry out,
practise (acc); °-tthahati (dhammaṁ, b), Ja V
anu-tiṭṭhati113,10* (= anugacchanti, Ct.; cf. uṭṭhahato, ib. and
anuṭṭhita above); — part. m. °-tiṭṭhanto (therena
vutta-vidhaṁ), Ud-a 310,6; pl. ~ā (paṭipattiṁ), Th-a
ad Th introd. v. 1; — imper. 2 sg. °-tiṭṭhāhi (sak-
kaccaṁ), Pv-a 78,21; 2 pl. °-tiṭṭhatha (tathā tam),
Ap 531,28 = Thī-a 146,6*; — pp. anu-ṭṭhita (q. v.);
cf. anu-ṭṭhāna Se next.

n. (nomen act. from prec), the
carrying out or practising; Ud-a 351,12 (etesaṁ ~aṁ
= 'upaṭṭhānaṁ', cf. Nett-a ad Nett 173,29).

[p.p. of anu-tarati, if not from √tṛd?,
cf. otiṇṇa; only ifc v. sokânutiṇṇa, v. l. for sokâva-
tiṇṇa \q. v.), SN I 123,1* ≠ Mvu III 284,13* (çokâ-
bhituṇṇo, v. l. °tuṇḍo)[.

m. Npr. of an otter; Ja III
333,19 foll. ≠ Dhp-a III 141,3 foll.

ind. (anu + tīra, loc), alongside or
near the bank (of a river); ~ Mahiyā, Sn 18—19
(= tīra-samīpe, Pj). Cf. anu-nadī-tīre.

mfn., not produced by the creative
power of nature (or 'not produced by physical change',
Comp, of Philos. 161,6 foll); Mil 268,13 (a-kamma-
ja +). Cf. utu-ja, utu-nibbatta.

entry.re:
— °-kālikaan-utta-kālika,
mfn., id., Sadd 57,18. Cf. a-vutta. an-utta

entry.sense:
mfn., 'not grainy'; Sp (III) 703,5
(~aṁ akilinnaṁ, etc., scil. odanaṁ, o: properly boiled).

mfn. [ts.], without a superior, in-
comparable, supreme, highest, best, excellent; Abh 694
(— vara); 952 (= seṭṭha); Sn p. 16,8 (tad ~aṁ
brahmacariya-pariyosānaṁ; Pj) = DN I 177,1 (Sv
(II) 363,28) = MN I 40,1 (Ps 1180,11); Sn 179 (tvan
an-uttara193,27); Sn 330 (pl. ~ā te vacasā); 345 (tvam ~o si)
≠ Ja VI 261,10* (= n'atthi tayā uttaritaro, Ct.);
Sn 478 (sambodhi(ṁ) ~aṁ sivaṁ); 486 (puññakkhet-
taṁ ~aṁ) ≠ DN III 5,23 (Vism 220,27); MN I
37,27; SN I 220,13; AN I 208,28; MN I 163,32 (~aṁ
santivarapadaṁ); Sn p. 103,9 (~o purisa-dhamma-
sārathi; Pj) = DN III 76,6 = 227,9 = 237,8 = Vin
III 1,14 (Sp I 120,1; Vism 207,13 ≠ Nidd-a II 263,21
— 265,2); Sn 554—5 (dhamma-rājā ~o); 557 (dhamma-
cakkaṁ ~aṁ) ≠ DN II 108,24 ≠ SN I 191,14; Sn
560 (sallakatto ~o) ≠ Th 830 (cf. It 101,15: ~o bhi-
sakko sallakatto); Sn 690 (anuttar'ayaṁ); 1003
(arahā bhavati ~o); Dhp 23 (yogakkhemaṁ ~aṁ;
Dhp-a) cf. SN II 195,29; 226,3; IV 125,12; Dhp 55
(sīlagandho ~o; = asadiso appaṭibhāgo, Dhp-a); Th
615 (sīlaṁ gandho ~o); [It 104,10* (aññā ~ā, read
anantarā, q. v.)]; It 121,20 (~aṁ sammāsambodhiṁ)
≠ DN II 108,19; Pv 701 (Buddhaṁ dhammañ câpi
~aṁ); SN III 84,1* (Buddha loke ~ā) = Ap 2,22
(cod. Paris anāgatā); Ap 81,25 (satthavāho ~o)
= Th-a Ce 66,3*; DN I 46,25 (~o saṁgāmavijayo;
Sv) ≠ MN III 67,31; DN I 80,10 (~aṁ cittaṁ,
opp. sa-uttaraṁ = MN I 59,34; cf. AN V 36,31);
Dhs (p. 7,2) 1293; 1597; DN II 123,1* (vimutti ~ā);
246,6* (esa maggo ~o); [III 83,25 (~o, read anan-
tarā)]; MN I 303,36 (~esu vimokhesu); SN I 124,27
(~e upadhisaṁkhaye vimutto); Ja VI 318,13* (~aṁ
atthapadaṁ; Ck anussaraṁ, cf. anussarati); Ps I
51,14 (atulo appameyyo ~o = Mp I 111,3); Mil
70,17 (Buddho ~o); 236,19 (n'atthi Tathāgatassa
~o anusāsako). Cf. ănuttariya, sa-uttara Se next.
— Ifc v. atula-vipulâ°, paramâ°.

m. abstr. = 'ānuttariya', n.,
Sv (III) 883,20 ad DN III 102,10.
[n., w. r. for ānuttariya (q. v.)].

entry.re:
— °-pada-dīpanāan-uttāna-pada-dīpanā, f., explanation of do., Ja III 380,29';
— °-pada-vaṇṇanā, f., id., Ps I 207,8 (ifc v. apubbâ°);

— °-sabhāvaan-uttāna-sabhāva, mfn., of obscure nature; °-sabhā-
vatā, f. abstr., Th-a ad Th 4 (~āya 'gambhīraṁ').
Cf. next.

entry.sense:
mfn. (neg. pp. of uttānī-karoti),
not made clear; AN I 117,32 = IV 152,6 (~aṁ uttānī-
karonti) ≠ MN I 221,25. Cf. next.

n., not making clear, omis-
sion of explanation; Pp 19,31 (~aṁ + anāvikammaṁ)
= Nidd I 79,25 = 378,25 (Nidd-a).

mfn. = an-utrasi(n); Ap 323,1
(asambhītaṁ ~iṁ) = Th-a Ce 225,1* (reading an-
utrāsiṁ). an-uttasin

mfn. (neg. pp. of uttarati), (a) not
having crossed; Vin IV 228,13; — (b) not leading up-
wards (from the water); Ja I 171,17* (disvā padam
~aṁ; = ekam pi uttiṇṇaṁ padaṁ nâddasa, Ct.).
(pr. 3 sg.), see 2anu-tthuṇāti.

or °-tthunāti, pr. 3 sg. [cf. sa. anu
+ stan; see Tr. notes p. 76; as to °ṇāti for °ṇati cf.
bhaṇāti], to wail (for: acc), to moan, lament; 3 sg.
~ṇāti, Sn 827 (= vippalapati, Pj); J sg. ~nāmi, Ja
1anu-tthuṇāti97,13 ad MN I 388,18 (= 'rodāmi'); 3 pl. ~ṇanti,
Pv-a 60,1:1 (= 'jhāyare'); part. m. ~naṁ (sg. for pl.),
Dhp 156 (purāṇāni; = anutthunantā socantā, Dhp-a);
Ja III 114,6* (seti bhumyā ~naṁ; = nitthunanto,
Ct.); ~ṇanto (kālakataṁ), Sn 586 (= anusocanto, Pj);
aor. 3 pl. ~niṁsu, DN III 86,22 (= anubhāsiṁsu, Sv)
≠ Mvu I (340,16+) 341,8-11.

or °-tthunāti (or °-tthavati),
pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √stu], to praise, to speak of
repeatedly (acc.); 3 pl. ~ṇanti (suddhiṁ), Sn 901 (=
vadanti kathenti, Pj & Nidd); part. m. ~nanto, Ja V
346,18* (= vaṇṇento, Ct.); aor. 3 sg. ~ni, Ap 22,5
(17. I. anutthavi)' = Th-a Ce II 101,13* (anutthavi).

f., nomen act. to 1anutthunāti, formed
by Nidd I 167,12 commenting on 1anutthunāti (= vācā
palāpo vippalāpo, etc.).

mfn. [sa. an + uttrasta], not
frightened; Ud 19,31 (abhīto+); SN I 54,2* (sace
atthi ~aṁ, Scil. cittaṁ, quoted Ps 1235,27* reading
anutrāsaṁ).

mfn. [sa. an + uttrāsa], free from
fear; see prec.

mfn. = prec; Th 864 (bhaddo ~ī
pahīna-bhayabheravo); SN I 99,11 (abhīru +) =
an-utrasinkubhūto +); also spelt anuttāsi(n), q. v..

m., the next thera in the order; opp.
to maḥā-thera: Dhp-a II 211,17; III 412,21 foll.; opp.
to saṁgha-thera: Ps II 121,14. — Ifc v. therâ°.

ind., according to seniority; Bālāv
113,3 (= anupubbo therānaṁ; cf. anu-jeṭṭhaṁ above
and Sadd m,14).

(or an-ūdaka, an-odaka), mfn. [sa.
an-udaka & (in the Rāmāyaṇa) an-ūdaka], without
water, dried up; n. anodakaṁ (sinānaṁ), SN I 38,8*
an-udakaanūdakaṁ, ib. 234,3'); loc. an[ū/u]dake ṭhāne, Ja I 99,7;
anūdake (pallalasmiṁ), Ja VI 189,11* (v. l. anod°) ≠
501,11*, 13*, 15*; anodake, Ja VI 442,10* (=anūdaka-
ṭṭhāne, Ct.); f. anodakā (nadī), Ja I 307,13* (Ee
anodikā; read anud°: - - ˇ- ˇ ˇ ˇ - ?) = VI
508,17* (v. l. anud°); — n. (subst.), drought; Dhp-a
I 52,18-20 (~ena, opp. ati-udakena or accodakena).
— °-bhūta, mfn., not being water, Ps I 242,17 (an-
udaka-bhūtāya marīciyā).
[see anu-dassati.]

anu-dayati, anu-dayā, see below
under anu-dd°.

or anu-dayhati, pr. 3 sg. (pass,
of anu-dahati), to be burnt or tormented afterwards;
part. f. ~amānā (-ḍ-), Ja V 426,22' (kilesena); VI 423,4
(do., kāmaratiyā); [anu-ḍayhanti, 3 pl., is v. l. Ck
for anu-dahanti SN IV 190,28]. anu-dayhati

n. [sa. anudarçaṇa], keeping in
view, consideration; ifc v. nibbidâ°. Cf. anu-passana.

mfn. (pp. of next), thoroughly shown
or demonstrated; Mil 119,5.

3 sg. [caus. of anu + √dṛç], to
teach or instruct (again and again); Vin II 73,27
(saññāpeti . . . pekkheti anupekkheti dasseti +).

or anu-ḍahati pr. 3 sg. (anu +
√dah), to burn (gradually), consume, destroy, tor-
ment; rāgo satte ~ati jhāpeti, Sv (III) 994,21 ≠
Ss 129,12; 3 pl. ~anti, Thī 488 (ukkôpamā, scil.
kāmā; Thī-a); SN IV 190,28 (kiṁ te kāsāvā ~anti,
Ck °-ḍayhanti; = sarīre paliveṭhitattā uṇhapariḷāhaṁ
anu-dahatiti attho, Spk) = V 53,21 - 301,2; Ja II 326,16*
(jātavedo va saṇ thānaṁ khippaṁ ~anti naṁ; =
jhāpenti, Ct.) =' 330,10* — IV 471,24* = V 451,6*
(-ḍ-; = mahāvināsaṁ pāpenti, Ct.); inf. ~ituṁ,
Dhp-a III 28,7 (visaṁ anu-ḍahituṁ na sakkoti);
pass, anu-dayhati, q. v.

or anu-dahana, n. (from prec),
burning up, consumption; Thī-a 287,32 (°aṭṭhena) =
Nidd I 6,18 (°atthena; = hatthâdi-jjhāpanaṭṭhena,
Nidd-a); Mp (Ee) II 171,22 (do. + duggandhaṭṭhena);
(Se) III 203,21 ad AN IV 41,2 (aṭṭhena); Ps II 287,22
(°-vasena pariḷāho).
entry.re:
— °-tāanu-danana-tā, f. abstr.; gen. ~āya
(rāgassa), Ss 130,27.

— °-balavatāanu-danana-balavatā, f., the force of
burning; Ja V 271,20' (-d-); Ps III 639,16.
