entry.sense: f., see anu-ddayā, anu-ddā.
f., see anu-ddāyanā.
n., see anu-ddāyitatta.
[mfn., w. r. for anuddiṭṭha (q. v.)].

f. [sa. *anu-dṛṣṭi, see anupassati,
anupassi(n)], a (dogmatical) view on things, theory
(Ct.s: secondary or minor theory, cf. diṭṭhi); gen. pl
anudiṭṭhīnam [prob, ˇ ˇ - ˇ - ] appahānaṁ, Th 754
anu-diṭṭhisakkāyadiṭṭhi] appahānakāraṇaṁ, Th-a). — Ifc v.
attâ°, aparantâ°, parittattâ°, pubbantâ°.

mfn. (from prec), holding the
theory of; only ifc. v. aparantâ°, pubbantâ°.
ind. [ts.], every day, MTD.

ind. (anu + disā, acc), around in
all directions (cf. anudisā below); gacchati ~, DN I
222,29 = AN III 368,28 ≠ SN I 122,4 = III 124,4;
~ anuviloketi, AN IV 167,10. anu-disam

f. [orig, abstracted from anudisaṁ,
ind.], an intermediate point of the compass; Abh 29
(= vidisā); ~ā anuviloketabbā . . . anudisaṁ anu-
viloketi, AN IV 167,9 (cf. anu-disam above & Ps I
261,29; Sv I 194,3; Ud-a 178,20); gen. ~āya (pura-
tthimāya, etc.), Paṭis I 112,21 foll; II 131,16 foll.;
anu-disāI 339,4; loc. disā-anudisāsu, SN I 122,17*, quoted
Dhp-a I 433,3*; ~āsu (= 'tiriyam'), Vism 308,23.
— °-pekkhana, n., spying in all directions; Ps 1261,15
(= 'vilokitaṁ') = Sv I 193,18.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √dīp, caus.],
to make known in turn; abs. ~ay it vā (dhammâdham-
maṁ), Mil 227,19-23.

m., a companion messenger; Vin II
19,29 foll.; 295,9; Dhp-a II 76,6; Mhv IV 15—16
(= attadutiyaṁ bhikkhuṁ, Mhv-ṭ); also adjectivally
to a subst: Vin II 295,10-13; 298,10-12; Dhp-a II 78,18.

ind., oehind, afterwards; so Bu. ex-
plains anvad-eva (q. v.) Mp I 73,20; Spk ad SN V
1,14; the form has crept into the text SN V 1,14 (Ee;
B. anvadeva), and as v. l. in AN I 11,12; V 214,11.

[Dip XYII 76, ~ī Anulā ca, accord, to
Oldenberg w. r. for Anulādevī Sīvalī ca; cf. tr. XI 7.]

[misreading for anunesi (so Ce); see,
however, v. l. anujasi ɔ: anuesi) at Pv-a 99,12.]

f. abstr. of anuddayā (q. v.), also
written anudayatā; SN V 169,19 (instr. ~āya, khan-
tiyā + ; Spk); AN III 184,20 (~aṁ paṭicca; Mp).
— Ifc. v. kulâ°, janapadâ°, parâ°.

(or anudayati), pr. 3 sg. (replaces
sa. day ate as anudayā stands for dayā), to be compas-
sionate; ~ī ti anuddā, As 362,1 = Nidd-a II 190,3
anuddayatiruṇāyamāna'; = anukampamāna, Nidd-a). Cf. anu-
ddāyitatta & next.

f. (nomen actionis from prec),
practising compassion; Nidd-a II 190,4 ad Nidd I
488,10 (Nidd Ee anudāyanā, v. anuddāy°; = anud-
dayâkāro).

(or anudayā), f. (from anu + sa. dayā,
ttje prefix prob, due to the synon, anukampā; -dd-
unexplained, avoids ˇ ˇ ˇ - , see above s. v. Añ-
janāgiri), compassion, mercy; Abh 160; Vin III
anuddayārakkhaṇā, Sp); SN I 206,27* (anukampā +); II 199,24
(kāruññaṁ + ~aṁ); AN III 189,15 (kāruññaṁ+);
SN IV 323,21 foll. (Ee Ck anudayaṁ + anurakkhaṁ,
anukampaṁ); AN I 125,1 = Pp 35,20 (abl.-instr. ~ ā;
quoted Dhp-a II 24,1); AN II 176,33 (instr. ~āya +
anukampāya, w. gen. pāṇānaṁ); Dhp-a I 227,9 (~aṁ
paṭicca); Pv-a 70,1 (~aṁ karohi = 'anukampa');
181,22 (do.; = 'anukampassu'); Mil 384,15 (kāruññaṁ
+ , w. loc). — As the first member of a comp, generally
anuddaya-, v. khantimettâ°-sampanna; cf. Ja I 214,1
(saccâ°); II 240,13 (paresu °mattam pi). — Ifc. v.
kāruññâ°, kulâ°, khanti-mettâ°, parâ°, balava-°,
sañjātâ°, sattâ°.

m. (anuddayā + ākāra), state
of compassion; Nidd-a II 190,1 (= 'anuddayanā').

(or anudā), f., [secondary nomen act.
to *anu(d)dáyati on the pattern of mettā: mettāyanā,
anuddā(As 362,1); Nidd I 488,10(anudā = anuddayā,Nidd-a).

m. — anuddayâkāra (q. v.); As
362,8.

f. (denom.,see next) = anuddayanā;
Dhs 1056 (As 362,8); Nidd I 488,10 (Nidd-a).

mfn. (pp. as from *anuddāyati <
(haplol.) *anu(d)dayāyati, denom, of anu(d)dayā), com-
passionate; ~assa bhāvo, As 362,8 (= 'anuddāyanā');
Nidd-a II 190,1 (do. = 'anuddāyitattaṁ'). — °-tta,
n. abstr., Dhs 1056 (As 362,9); Nidd I 488,10 (reading
anuddāyita

mfn. (anu + uddiṭṭha, cf. anud-
disati), pointed out (as a gift) in connection with
another; Pv 63 (samanantarā ~e, [Ee unmetrically
samanantarânu°] loc. abs.; Pv-a) = 123.

& an-uddissa, neg. abs. of uddi-
sati (q. v.).

pr. 3 sg. (anu + uddisati), to point
out (your special intention, in connexion [anu-] with a
gift); DN II 354,19 foll. (= anu-uddisati. Sv; = anu
anu katheti, pt); pp. anuddiṭṭha, see above.

m., non-recitation, Ud-a 296,24 (cf.
pāṭimokkhuddesa).

mfn., without any special aim or
intention; Pj I 29,14 = Sp (II) 444,1. — Ifc. v.
parâ°.
see anu-ddhasta.

mfn. (pp. of anu-ddhaṁseti),
accused (of: instr.), Vin III 164,3-5 (yena vatthunā;
Sp (III) 593,11 = adhibhūto ajjhotthaṭo); Vin I
173,13 (amūlakena pārājikena). — Ifc v. rāgâ°. Cf.
anu-ddhasta.

pr. 3 sg. [caus. of anu +
√dhvaṁs], litt. to let the dust fall upon, to stain, i. e.
(a) to corrupt, degrade (acc); (b) to reprove, accuse, to
charge with (acc pers. & instr, ret); (a) rāgo cittaṁ
~eti,Vin III 110,17 (= dhaṁseti padhaṁseti vikkhipati
c'eva milāpeti ca, Sp); MN I 462,11 (= kilameti milā-
peti, Ps) — SN II 231,20 = 271,10 = AN II 126,5
— III 95,15 (Mp); SN I 185,15; AN III 393,18 = 397,17;
anu-ddhaṁseti= anuvadati codeti, Sp) = It 42,15 (= dhaṁseti
padhaṁseti codeti akkosati, It-a) = AN I 266,3
(Mp); Vin II 125,25 (amūlikāya sīlavipattiyā); Utt-vn
25; 288—89; 3 pl. ~enti (b), Vin IV 147,30 (amūlakena
saṁghādisesena; = codenti, Sp); 2 pl. ~etha (b) ib. 33;
III 163,8 (amūlakena pārājikena dhammena) ≠ II
79,29; pot. 3sg.~eyya(b), Vin III 163,22** (= codeti vā
codāpetivā, ib. 36'; = (vid)dhaṁseyya padhaṁseyya
abhibhaveyya ajjhotthareyya, Sp (III) 587,1); 168,2**
≠ JAs 1914: 481,6; 482,3; Vin IV 148,6** (amūla-
kena pārājikena dhammena); (a) MN II 256,25 (rāgo
cittaṁ ~eyya; = soseyya milāpeyya, Ps); aor. 3 sg.
~esi (a), MN II 257,11; SN I 185,11; 3 pl. ~esuṁ
(b) Ud-a 431,24; Th-a Ce 45,6 ad Th 5; fut. 3 sg.
~essati (a), MN I 26,11 (rāgo cittaṁ); 3 pl. ~essanti
(b), Vin III 163,12 ≠ 1179,32; IV 147,32; 2 pl.
~essatha (b), Vin III 163,18; pp. anuddhaṁsita &
anuddhasta (q. v.).

mfn. [an + sa. uddhṛta]; not
picked up, not gathered;
entry.re:
— °-kaṭṭhaan-uddhaṭa-kaṭṭha, mfn., who has
no fire-wood in stock; Ja V 202,1' (= 'abhinna-
kaṭṭha'!, cf. ib. 202,1').

entry.sense:
mfn. [ts.], not elevated, not puffed
up, not proud, gentle, calm: Sn 850 (akkodhano
. . . mantabhāṇī ~o; = uddhacca-virahito, Nidd,
Pj); Dhp 363 (mukhasaññato . . . mantabhāṇī ~o;
= nibbuta-citto, Dhp-a); ~o + acapalo nipako
saṁvutindriyo, Th 682 = 1081 = Ja VI 293,28*;
MN I 470,9 foll. (+ acapala); ~aṁ acapalam assa
an-uddhatasammitabhāṇi subbato, Th 209; santavutti ~o, It
30,14* (cf. ib. 121,2*); appamiddho ~o, ib. 72,10*;
uddhacca-kukkuccaṁ pahāya ~o, AN II 211,3 = IV
437,11 = Pp 59,22; alīnaṁ ~aṁ anirassādaṁ (cit-
taṁ), Vism 135,16; f. ~ā, Thī 113 (akusītā +; here
Ee αndThī-a 116,22 spell anuddhaṭā); pl. ~ā (+ anun-
naḷā), MN I 32,17 = III 6,20 = AN III 199,10 ≠
AN I 70,11 ≠ 266,25 ≠ III 392,13; mudukā+, Vv
749 (khobhaṁ akarontā, Vv-a 278,19); Thī 281 (man-
tabhāṇī + ; = na uddhatā, Thī-a).

mfn., whose senses are
calmed; Pj I 242,3 (= 'santindriya').

mfn. (neg. grd. of uddharati),
not to be raised, who cannot be saved (from world-
liness); Ps III 307,15.

mfn., not proud; v. l. for ani-
ṭṭhuri(n) (q.v.), Sn 952 (Pj II 569,2; Nidd-a ad Nidd I
440,23). an-uddharin

mfn. (pp. of anuddhaṁseti, cf.
anuddhaṁsita), corrupt, degraded; w. r. anuddhaṁsa,
see MN I 462,11 note; only ifc. v. rāgâ°.

m. [a secondary noun, cf. anu-
loma, adhicitta, abhidhamma, etc.], (a) (right) method
(as hypostasis of anu-dhammaṁ [yathânudh°, dham-
mânudh°] ind.): dhammânudhammaṁ paṭipannassa
ayam ~o hoti veyyākaraṇāya, It 81,13 (= anu-
cchavika-sabhāvo paṭirūpa-sabhāvo, It-a); SN III
anu-dhammavassa . . . ayam ~o hoti veyyākaraṇāya . . ., MN
III 30,8 (= sabhāvo, Ps; cf. dhammassa cânudham-
maṁ vyākaronti, Vin I 234,19); sāvakassa . . . satthu
sāsane pariyogāya [Ps Se °gayha] vattato ayam ~o
hoti . . ., MN I 480,32 (= sabhāvo, Ps); — pl.
katame bodhiyā ~ā, Nidd I 481,31 (explaining yathâ-
nudhammaṁ, Sn 963), see akatânudhamma. — (β), a
minor dhamma (abstracted from dhammânudham-
maṁ, cf. anukhuddaka), Ps III 366,6 ad MN II 146,15,
quoted under anudhammaṁ, ind.). — Title of four
suttas, SN III 40—41. — Ifc. v. akatânudhamma.

ind., (a) in accordance with the
dhamma; (b) in accordance with . . . (cf. O. Franke,
DN Trsl. p. 131, n. 5). — (a) anu-pubbaṁ + ~aṁ
vyākarohi, Sn 510—11 ≠ Mvu III 394,19* . . . 399,19*.
— (b) mostly (paron.) with dhamma: ((α) dhammesu
anudhamma-cārī, dhammânudhammaṁ, ind. (q.v.)
and dhammassânudhammaṁ: Ud 8,32 (paccapādi;
Ud-a) ≠ MN II 146,15 (Ps: dhammo nāma arahatta-
maggo, anudhammo nāma heṭṭhimā tayo maggā, cf.
Ct.s on adhipaññā, adhicitta, abhidhamma) ≠ III
270,4; SN IV 63,16; V 346,15; (β) dhammassa cânu-
dhammaṁ vyākaroti [cf. Sn 510 and anudhammo
veyyākaraṇāyaḷ, Vin I 234,19; DN I 161,16 (= °-kā-
raṇassa anukāraṇaṁ, Sv); III 115,3; MN I 368,30;
482,25; II 127,4;' 243,11; SN II 33,24; III 6,23 (Spk
— Sv); IV 51,13; V 7,1; AN II 190,31. — Ifc. v.
tad°, dhamma°, yathâ°.

m., the next
one to turn the 'dhammacakka', Ja I 218,8 (cf. Sn
555—56; SN I 191,14).

mfn. — next; Sv (II)
556,13 (pl. ~ā = 'anudhammacārino'); Spk ad SN V
261,4 (do.); Vv-a 130,18 (f.~ā ='anudhamma-cārinī').

f. abstr., Vin IV 142,20' (— 'sā-
mīcī'); AN II 46,13* (acc. ~aṁ); — ifc. v. tad-°.

[Ud-a 93,19 w.r.for
(Ce & Se) a-niddhārita-sāmatthiya (q. v.)].

(pr. 3 sg. (caus. of anu + √dhṛ),
to hold up behind (as a parasol); aor. 3 pl. anu-dhārayuṁ
(setaṁ chattaṁ), Sv I 61,26* = Ps I 46,35* = Mp I
105,11* (cf. anu-hīramāna, part, pass., see anu-hīrati);
— [pp. anu-dhārita, see above.] (anu-dhāreti)

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √dhāv], to
run after or up to, to follow, pursue (acc); Dhp 85
(tīraṁ) - SN V 24,18* = AN V 232,24* foll.; Th
1174 (ku-maggaṁ); Mil 372,6 (nâññattha-m-); anu-
sarati +, Ps III 668,21; 1 sg. ~āmi, SN I 9,9 (san-
diṭṭhikaṁ hitvā kālikaṁ ~); 3 pl. ~anti anupari-
vattanti (kāyaṁ), Mil 253,10; aor. 3 sg. ~āvi; Mhv
anu-dhāvati(do.); 2 pl. mā ~āvittha (kālikaṁ), SN I 117,26; fut.
pl. ~āvissāma, MN I 474,6 (kālikaṁ).

loc. (adv.), along the bank of the
river; SN IV 177,28 (~e gocara-pasuto). Cf. anu-kūle.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √nam], to
incline, bend, give way; Mil 372,17 (yav'aggamulaṁ
samakam eva~ati); pot. 3 sg. anuname, Ja VI 295,9*
(read capo vânuname with Ck(s) and Mil 372,23*;
Bd capo dhanudharo; Ee capo vûnudaro from ib.
anu-namati

m. [ts.], (a) bias, affection, inclination;
MN I 191,1 (chando ālayo +; = taṇhā, Ps); Dhs
1059 (rāgo sārāgo ~ anurodho; As 362,28); Vibh
145,2; 195,14 (quoted in full Ps I 245,14); Nidd I 8,14
(Nidd-a); — (b) indulgence, benevolence, mildness; Ja
VI 141,10 (°-atthaṁ, in order to appease him; read
anunayanatthaṁ, cf. v. l. ?); Nett 69,1 (= pītimanatā);
opp. patigha: Nett 69,8; Dhp-a II 149,3; Mil 44,33;
anu-naya(c) conclusion, inference; Ps III 325,19 ad MN II 120,8
(dhammassa ~o [but Ce anvayo, v. l. anu-yo o: anu-
ayo?] anumānaṁ anubuddhi, = 'dhammanvayo').
— Ifc. v. avijjâ°, kāmarāgâ°, kopâ°, diṭṭhâ°,
paṭighâ°, bhavarāgâ°, mānâ°, vicikicchâ°.

n. (from anu-neti), = anu-naya;
As 362,28.

m(nl) (dvandva), affection and
dislike; Mil 165,24;
entry.re:
— °-vippamuttaanunaya-paṭigha-vippamutta, mfn., free from
that; Mil 122,28; 165,25; 187,15;

— °-vippahīnaanunaya-paṭigha-vippahīna,
mfn., who has abandoned that; Nidd I 114,26 (= sine-
hañ ca kodhañ ca pajahitvā ṭhito, Nidd-a). anunaya-paṭigha

entry.sense:
n., the fetter of affection;
+ patigha-saṁyojanaṁ, etc. (satta saṁyojanāni),
DN iil 254,6 ≠ AN IV 7,20 (~aṁ; = kāma-rāga-
saṁyojanaṁ, Mp).

m. (anunaya + abhāva),
absence of affection; Ud-a 187,23.

m. [ts.], echo; Mp (Se) II 382,13
(attano va nādassa ~aṁ suṇāti) = Spk II 285,2.

m. (cf. sa. anu-nāyaka, mfn.), sub-
chief, vice-president; Childers MTD.

mfn. [ts.], nasal, or m. ~o, or f.
~ā, a nasal sound, here not distinguished from the
anusvāra (see this and niggahīta, Sadd 606,17-27);
~aṁ katvā, Pāt (ed. by Minayeff) p. 30 n. i; m.
~o (gāthābandhasukhatthaṁ): Pj I 192,24 (ad Sn
anu-nāsika730.14 ad Vin III 263,19** (scil. the adventitious -ṁ
in the abs. upavassa-ṁ [and in upasampajja-ṁ, Vibh
257,32]; ~assa lopo, Pj II 105,19; — f. ~ā, Ja III
15,5' (cf. Sadd 147,2 foll.). — Ifc. v. sâ° (mfn.).
— °-lopa, m. [ts.], dropping of a°; Pj II 410,13; 508,17;
Vv-a 114,12; 154,22; 253,7; 275,4 (akata-°); 333,24.
entry.re:
— °âgamaanu-nāsikâgama, m. (cf. āgama), insertion of a°; Ud-a
345,3.

entry.sense:
mfn. (pp. of anu-neti), led, attracted,
induced; Pj II 520,28 (diṭṭhi-chandena ~o); ifc. v.
an-°, chandâ°.

pr. 3 sg. (pass, of anu-neti), to be
induced or persuaded; part. m. ~amāno, Thī-a 221,34.

m. (nomen agentis of next), one who
leads or persuades, a (spiritual) guide; DN III 192,17*
anu-netar194,18 (netā vinetā ~ā + paññāpetā (or saññāp°),
etc.) — Nidd I 178,2 (= dhammadesanākāle saṁ-
sayacchedanena ~ā, Nidd-a); Mp (Ee) II 314,17 ad
AN I 199,23 (Bhagavā dhammānaṁ netā vinetā ~ā)
= Ps II 374,33.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √nī], to lead,
instruct, appease, persuade; Mp (Sc') II 467,2 (+ jānā-
peti = 'neti', AN II 180,21); part. f. ~entī, Thī 514
(= paññāpentī (Ce saññāpentī), Thī-a); part. med. m.
~ayamāno, SN I 232,22 = AN I 143,30 = 144,18
(MpEeCe: 'anusaññāyamāno' [a w. r. contamination
of anunay° with a gloss *saññā(payamāno)?[ =
anubodhayamāno!); Pj II 262,32 (rājānaṁ~o); aor.
3 sg. anunesi, Pv-a 99,12 (so Ce; Ee anudesi); pass.
anu-nīyati (q. v.); pp. anu-nīta (q. v.).

or an-uṇṇata, mfn., not lifted up,
not proud (opp. an-oṇata); santo anuṇṇato care, Sn
702 (- - ˇ - ˇ - ˇ - ! v. l. santo va an° for santo
cân° ≠ Mvu III 387,7* Mss: kṣānte cânumato bhava;
Pj: uddhaccaṁ nâpajjeyya, quoted Ss 58,2); Paṭis II
206.15 (~aṁ (-nn-) cittaṁ; quoted Vism 386,12; Ud-a
186,2); Mil 387,11 (pabbato ~o (-nn-) anoṇato). Cf.
next.

mfn., not wanton or arrogant (see
unnaḷa, esp. Ud-a 238,20); + anuddhata, MN I 32,17
= 1116,20 (-1-); AN I 70,12; 266,25; III 199,10 (-1-);
392,13.

mfn., neither rising nor
sinking, even; n. ~i, AN IV 237,27 (khettaṁ).
[mfn., w. r. for anūpa, q. v.]

n., unfittingness, uselessness;
Pv-a 49,6.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu-pra +
√kamp], to shake, to quiver; selûpamaṁ cittaṁ
ṭhitaṁ nânupakampati, Th 191 (192) ≠ Ud 41,1*
(= na pavedhati, Ud-a).

mfn., not helpful; Ps II 348,21
(upakārânupakārāni aṅgāni); Mil 38,1 (ime dhammā
~ā); Pp-a 182,23 (°-dhamme pahāya).

mfn., not attacked (by sickness),
in °-dehava(t), mfn., with such a body, m. ~ā, Ap
380,11 (rūpavā +; Ce anavakkanta-°).

m., no attack; ~ena Tathāgatā
parinibbāyanti, Vin II 194,20 (í. e. not by attack from
external enemies).

m., not a molestation, blemish (or
corruption); DN III 45,23 (pl. ~ā); SN V 93,7 = 95,8
(cetaso ~ā; = na upakkilesā, Spk).

mfn., blameless, irreproachable;
akkhitto ~o jātivādena, Snp.115,15 (= MN ch 98)
= DN I 113,27 fott. (— na upakkuṭṭho, na akkosaṁ
vā nindaṁ vā patta-pubbo, Sv) = MN II 165,2],
(= do. Ps) = AN III 223,17 (. . . 228,27) = Vin IV
160,20'. an-upakkuṭṭha

pr. 3 sg. [sa. *anu-pra-
√skand], to follow, or to advance hot-foot upon (acc);
to push oneself forward, or encroach on; DN I 122,7
(Gotamassa vādaṁ, is going over to the doctrine of G.;
= anupavisati, Sv); abs. anupakhajja (q. v.); — pp.
anu-pakkhanna, mfn., going along with each other,
flowing together; Ps III 176,9 (nadiṁ otiṇṇa-udakaṁ
(so Ce; Se w. r. uttiṇṇa°) viya ~āni, scil. bhojanāni). anu-pakkhandati

pr. 3 sg. [sa. *anu-pra +
√kṣip], to place in under; abs. ~itvā, AN II 245,3
(antarā satthīnaṁ naṅguṭṭhaṁ ~; Mp: naṅguṭṭhaṁ
antara-satthimhi pakkhipitvā; cf. Vin II 161,28; Ja
V 243,23' & I 218,28).

entry.re: — °-kathāanu-pakhajja-kathā, f., title of Vin-vn 1079—88.
— °-sikkhā-padaanu-pakhajja-sikkhā-pada, n., title of Vin IV 42—43 (= iPācittiya, 16).

entry.sense:
mfn., instr. ~ena, Vin V 163,5,
a hybrid formation from anu-pakhajja and anu-
pakkhandanta; the meaning required is an-anu-
pakkhandantena, not encroaching on.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. *anu-pra +
√gam], to go over to, to pass into, to be dissolved into
(acc); pathavī pathavī-kāyaṁ anupeti ~, DN I 55,22
(Sv) = 'MN I 515,11 (Ps) = SN III 207,1 (Spk),
quoted Ja V 239,28'; some mss. of DN, MN, SN give
here a reading anupigacchati [i. e. anu-(a)pigacchati;
cf. sa. apy-eti], see MN Ip.572,10; but the Ctt. (Sv I
anu-pagacchatialways anupagacchati; Ja V 239,17* (yato ca rūpaṁ
sambhoti tatth'eva ~; = tatth'eva gacchati, Ct).

mfn., who has not approached, not
pursuing, Ps III 498,4 ad MN III 25,23 (dubious
reading).

n., non approaching; abl. ~ato,
Ps II 413,11. — mfn., who does not approach (or
pursue), Spk I 265,29 (= 'anūpayo'); Ps III 498,3
(rāgavasena ~o; = 'anupāyo' (Se anuppādo), MN III
25,23).

mfn. (neg. grd.), not to be
approached; abl. ~ato, Vv-a 213,26 (+ anāsādanīyato
. . . 'durāsado').

ind. (neg. abs. of upagacchati),
'not having approached', i. e., not having adopted or
embraced; avoiding; diṭṭhiṁ ~, Sn 152 = Khp IX 10;
ubho ante ~, Vin I 10,15 = SN V 421,7 (Ee anu-
pakamma) = MN III 230,12; SN II 17,23; Ud-a
301,14. an-upagamma

n., = anupaghāta, m., Dhp-a
III 238,2.

mfn., not hurting; Vin I 359,19*
(read with metre: viyākaraṁ pañham anūpaghāti-
kaṁ).

m., non-vicinity; Ps I 112,21. (ma-
nussānaṁ ~-ṭṭhānaṁ, yattha na kasīyati, na vapī-
yati; = 'vanapattha'); Sv I 210,7.

entry.re:
— °-ñāṇa-sambhāraan-upacita-ñāṇa-sambhāra, mfn., do.
of knowledge; Ud-a 393,5.

entry.sense:
[part, neg., w. r. for an-apavī-
ṇanta, Ja V 339,6* (see apa-vīṇati)].

mfn., uninterrupted; Mhv Ap-
pendix A 10 (sattâhaṁ ~aṁ pavattati ca taṁ cha-
naṁ); (a sense of 'anu' f. i. in 'anu-saya') Rūp Ce
85,36; Sadd 883,18 (= Pay); Abh 1174.

m., not interruption; Ps III
700,16 (dīpa-sikhāya ~o); ib. 19 (vedanānaṁ ~o), so
CeSe, Ck reads anuccheda.

pr. 3 sg. [*anu-pra + jagghati,
cf.sa-Dhatup § 5,53 g(h)aggha hasane, § 5,6 k(h)akkha
(do.)], to laugh at, to make fun of; AN I 198,20 (=
parena pañhe pucchite pi kathite pi pāṇiṁ paharitvā
mahāhasitaṁ hasati, Mp).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √pad], to enter
or appear (together with), to accompany; aor. 3 sg.
°-atha, Ja IV 304,6* (na ... so rāgo ~; = na upeti,
Ct. Cks); V 407,2* (vijju mahāmegha-r-ivâ°; Ct); pp.
anu-panna (q. v.).

mfn. (cf. upajjhāya, m.), having
no preceptor; Vin I 89,24 (na . . . ~o upasampāde-
tabbo); pl. ~ā + anovadiyamānā, etc., Vin I 44,6.

ind. (anu + pañca + aha(n)),
every five days; Pv-a 139,28 (+ anu-dasâhaṁ).

& °-paññatti, see anu-ppañ-
ñatta, etc.

mfn. (from anu + paṭi-
pajjati), following the practice of (gen.) or siding
with; pl. ~ā, Sp (III) 611,13 (tassa diṭṭhi-khanti-
ruci-gahaṇena ~ā; = 'anuvattakā', Vin III 175,5).

entry.re:
— °-kathāanu-paṭipāṭi-kathā, f., regular
exposition; Sv I 277,25 (= 'ānupubbi-kathā'); (II)
471,32 (do.); Ps III 86,19 (do.).

— °-nirodhaanu-paṭipāṭi-nirodha, m.,
— anupubba-nirodha (q. v.), Mp III 349,19 = Sv
(III) 1046,22.

entry.sense:
neg. abs. of upaṭṭhapeti, not
having made present (or set up); Spk Ee II 209,8
(kāyagatā-satiṁ).

entry.re:
— °-kusalaan-upaṭṭhāna-kusala, mfn., skilled
in what is not present, etc.; Paṭis 1128,6 foll.;

— °-tāan-upaṭṭhāna-tā,
f. abstr.; Paṭis I 101,13-35 = II 230,3-25 (°-paññā).

entry.sense:
mfn. [sa. an-upasthita], not
present, not set up; f. ~ā c'eva sati na upaṭṭhāti,
MN I 104,27 (Ps); AN IV 374,22 (sati); instr, f. ~āya
satiyā, SN II 231,17 (Spk: kāyagatā-satiṁ an-upa-
ṭṭhapetvā); IV 112,29;
entry.re:
— °-satian-upaṭṭhita-sati, mfn., whose mindfulness
an-upaṭṭhitaJa V 452,10* ( ˇ ˇ - ˇ - ˇ - ; our text anupaṭṭhitā-
satī [an 'alupta-samāsa', cf. kāyagatā-sati]; original
reading anupaṭṭhita-ssatī? cf. AN III 69,4*: muṭṭha-
ssatiṁ tā bandhanti).

entry.sense:
pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √pat], to run
after, to follow, to pursue; to fall on or into, to attack
(acc); MN I 517,31 (vivaraṁ; = pavisati, Ps) = SN
III 211,19 (v. /.; Spk) = DN I 56,34 (Sv; cf. Ja VI
226,14*); Sp-ṭ ad Sp I 32,2 (ekadhammo sabbesu
dhammesu ~ati, i. e. is contained or included in);
1 sg. ~āmi, Ja V 61,11* (godhaṁ ~ām'aham); 3 pl.
~anti, Dhp 221 = SN I 23,4* (akiñcanaṁ nânupa-
tanti dukkhā); Dhp 347 (~anti sotaṁ, scil. rāga-
rattā); Th 41 = 1167 (vivaram ~anti vijjutā); DN
III 86,26 (aggaññaṁ akkharaṁ ~anti, v. r. for anu-
padanti (q. v.), Sv-pṭ); [SN I 111,3* (v. l. for anuta-
panti)]; Ja V 449,5*[7*] (sadhanam ~anti nāriyo);
— part. med. f. ~amānā, Ja VI 555,25'; — pot. 2 sg.
anu-patatipânupatiyāsi no); ib. 8* (Bd anupatheyyāsi, Se
anuppateyyāsi; scan tam evânupateyyāsi); — fut.
3 pl. ~issanti, AN I 280,7 (makkhikā nâ°; = nânu-
bandhissanti, Mp); — inf. ~ituṁ in anupatitu-kāma,
mfn., wishing to come up with, Ja VI 555,6* (= pa-
dânupadaṁ āgantukāma, Ct); — abs. ~itvā, Vin
III 105,16 = SN II 255,13 (gijjhā . . . ~ ~ ... vitu-
denti [or vitacch°] = anubandhitvā, Sp & Spk);
Vin III 105,38 foll. = SN II 256,8 foll. ≠ MN I 364,30;
MN II 99,12; Dhp-a III 352,10; — pp. anu-patita,
q. v. — Cf. anupāta, anupāti(n).

n. (from anu-patati), following,
pursuing, attacking; Mp II 257,33 (cf. anupāta).
— °-sīla, mfn., disposed or given to that; Ja III 523,24'.

f. = prec; Sp (II) 418,26 (v. l. for
anupadahanā) = Vism 278,17 (Ee: anuvahanā, so
also mhṭ Be Se).
[mfn., w. r. for anu-paviṭṭha, q. v.]

mfn. (pp. of anu-patati), (a) fallen
on, following; (b) befallen, subject to, accompanied
by; pl. ~ā (dukkhena), Dhp-a III 463,6; — ifc. v.
anottappâ°, upekkhâ°, dukkhâ°, domanassâ°,
anu-patitavitakkâ°, viriyâ°, satâ°, saddhâ°, samādhâ°,
somanassâ°. Cf. Kv Trsl. p. 238 n. í (Kv 412,32,
Kv-a 118,24).

mfn. & anu-patti, f., see anu-ppatta
& anu-ppatti below.

ind. [sa. anu-patham], Cp-a ad Cp
I 9,32 (= 'anumagge'); [also unmetrical v. l. to anu-
panthe, q. v.].

n. [ts.], a next following word (or
quarter of a stanza); Vin IV 15,1 (padaṁ + ; — du-
tiya-pādo, Sp); padaṁ ~añ câpi, Ap 43,13 = Th-a
C 366,6*; ~ena-~aṁ kathayissāmi, Mil 340,6-7 (pa-
dena-padaṁ +). Cf. next etc. Se anu-padika, mfn.

ind. [ts.], 1. word by word; Ud-a
336,28 (+ an-avasesato); As 15,36. — 2. hot-foot
upon, on one's track (gen. pers.); padenânupadaṁ
yanto, Ap 140,6 (with acc; following step by step
= Th-a Ce 124,6*); Ap 206,15 (do. w. gen. Vipassissa
mahesino = Th-a Ce 116,13*); Ja I 113,4 (Bodhi-
sattassa ~ pakkanto); II 230,4 (tassā ~ agamāsi);
anu-padaṁ(corānaṁ ~ gantvā); Ps II 199,8 (nāgassa ~ āgato).
— 3. in accordance with, Ja III 497,4 (bodhiñāṇassa
~ caramānā; = pade pade achaḍḍetvā carantā,
pt)). — Ifc. v. padâ°. (Cf. paccakkhânupadaṁ, Ja
VI 422,31*; so Ct., but perhaps meant as paccakkhā
nu padaṁ).
pot. 3 sg., see anu-ppadeti.

pr. 3 sg. (denom, of anu-padaṁ),
'to follow in one's footstep' (or follow word by word),
i. e. to repeat (slavishly); 3 pl. ~anti (aggaññaṁ
akkharaṁ), DN III 86,26 = anugacchanti, Sv (III)
anu-padatireading adopted by

f., 'insight into
the (individual) states'; MN III 25,11 (= anupaṭipāṭiyā
dhamma-vipassanā, Ps); As 208,3! (opp. kalāpa-
sammasana).

m., title of MN III 25—103
(ch. 111—120).

f., word-by-word explana-
tion; Pj I 124,4 (: piṇḍattho); As 168,24. Cf. Pj I
249,6 (anupadato atthavaṇṇanā).

mfn., individually set up
or fixed; MN III 25,19 foll. (Ps).

f., successive exa-
mination; Ud-a 335,18.

n., title of MN etc.HI (III
25—29).

ind., as to the single words in
question; Ps I 87,26 (sabbaṁ vuttânusārena ~ pacca-
vekkhitabbaṁ).
fut., see anu-ppadeti.

f. (from sa. *anu-pra + √dhā),
putting in successive order; Sp (II) 418,26 (doubtful
reading = 'anu-bandhanā'; v. l. anu-patanā & anu-
vahanā) = Vism 278,17 (reading anuvahanā). anu-padahanā

m., anu-padāna, n., see anu-pp°
below.

mfn.; only apparently ifc. v. padâ°
(in fact derived from padânupadaṁ).

mfn. [sa. an-upadiṣṭa], 'untaught',
not being object of special rules; Kacc 51.

& an-upadinna, mfn., see anu-
ppadinna & an-upādiṇṇa.
see anu-ppādeti.
see anūpa°.

mfn., uninjured, safe, free from
distress; Dhp 338 (mule ~e; Dhp-a); Ap 125,15
(anīti+) ≠ Anāg 40; Ap 308,2. (+ anīti); Vin III
162,20 (abhaya, anītika+) = 1179,2 = 124,31;
an-upaddava127,15); Ja V 378,26' (= 'akutoci-upaddava'); Pv-a
250,25 (= 'siva'); Mil 304,9 foll. (anītika+). — m.,
freedom from distress, Ud-a 156,31.

mfn., not annoyed, not oppressed,
free from distress; Vin I 15,30 (~aṁ + anupa(s)sa-
ṭṭhaṁ); Vv-a 351,22 (~aṁ= 'akkhataṁ'); Pv-a 195,16
(kenaci ~o); pl. ~ā, Pj I 155,8 (+ anupasaṭṭhā);
— °-tta, n. abstr., Vv-a 95,25.

ind. (neg. abs. of upadhāreti),
not having taken into consideration, inconsiderately,
inadvertently; Ja I 229,20 (~ . . . kathesiṁ); II 8,2', 5'
(asamekkhitvā+); Dhp-a IV 197,18 (~ kata-kam-
maṁ); Ud-a 261,17 (~ abbhācikkhante); Vv-a 200,8
(magga-parissayaṁ ~); 260,17 (~ mayā varo dinno).

& (in verse) an-ūpadhīka (as
required by metre in Mvu III 445,2*), mfn. (from an
+ upadhi (q. v.); free from attachment (or condition-
ing factors); Sn 1057 (sukittitaṁ Gotam' ~aṁ; =
nibbānaṁ, Pj) = 1083; Vin I 36,26* (padaṁ santaṁ
~aṁ); DN III 112,10—113,9 (iddhi ... ~ā, opp. sa-
an-upadhika

[mfn., Vism 386,14 = Ud-a 186,1,
w. r. for an-apanata, q. v.].

mfn., not delivered; Sp (Se) II
409,1 ad Vin IV 82,30'.

m. [ts.], freedom from rancour;
AN I 95,21 foll. (akkodho +).

once in verse an-ūpa°), mfn.
(from prec), not rancorous; akkodhano + ~ī: Th 502
an-upanahinSN II 207,12; AN V 124,16; 125,20; Ja IV 463,20*
(anūpanāhī, metr.); — SN IV 244,7 (saddho, hirimā,
ottāpī +); also title of the sutta, ib.

mfn. (a) (cf. upanisā in the sense
of upanissaya, i. e. paccaya), unconditioned; SN II
30,2 foll. (opp. sa-upanisa, see Spk II 53,19);
— (b) (cf. çraddhayā upaniṣadā, Chāndogya-up. I 1,jo),
not attentive (to a guru); AN I 198,26-27 (an-ohita-
soto . . . ~o hoti); cf. Sn 322 & AN IV 391,13.

mfn., unqualified (for Arhat-
ship); Ps II 105,4 (opp. sa-upanissaya).

mfn., not endowed
with qualifications (for Arhatship); Pj I 175,7.

(once in verse an-ūpa°), mfn. (neg.
pp. of upa + √nī), (a) not led near or into, not ad-
duced, not propounded; Sn 846 (anūpanīto so nivesa-
nesu; Pj, cf. AN III 359,28*); Vin I 185,10 = AN III
359,25 (attho ca vutto, attā ca ~o, see attūpanāyika);
an-upanīta'adantaṁ'). — (b) not initiated, not having received
brahmanical education; MN II 154,5 (an-ajjhāyako
+ ~o).

neg. abs. of upa + √nī (or neg.
pot. 3 sg.?), not having presented, Sn 799 (samo ti
attānaṁ ~; = sadiso 'ham asmī ti attānaṁ na upa-
neyya, Nidd, see an-upanīta (a)).

mfn. (pp. of anu-pajjati), entered,
appeared, following; Ja VI 216,24' (°brāhmaṇānaṁ
vacana-pathaṁ ~ā, Mss. anuppannā, or perhaps for
anu-ppattā, cf. Ja VI 417,3'). — Ifc. v. kavyapathâ°,
panthâ°, māradheyyâ°.

f., not entering into a new existence;
Paṭis 111,5 foll.

m., not a first member of a com-
pound; Kacc-v 392; Sadd 491,30.

mfn. [ts.], (a) who has not entered
upon or into, not reborn in (acc); SN IV 400,2 (añña-
taraṁ kāyaṁ ~o; Ee anuppanno; Spk); AN V 270,23
(taṁ ṭhānaṁ ~o; v. l. anuppanno); — (b) not
accomplished (in, instr.); AN II 6,25 (sutena~o; Ee
an-upapannahence: without competence, etc.: DN I 97,22 (mātito
. . . ~o, not of pure descent on the mother's side; Ee
anuppanno; — khattiyavaṁsaṁ appatto apari-
suddho, Sv); — (c) in gramm. = not to be formed
accord, to the given rules (said of words given as
nipāta), Kacc 393; (quoted Sadd 800,17). — Cf. an-
uppanna.
mfn., see an-uppīḷa.

pr. 3 sg. & anu-pabandhanā,
f., see anu-pp°.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + pra +
√vraj], to adopt a homeless life after or in imitation of
another; 3 pl. ~anti (Bhagavantaṁ pabbajitaṁ), Vin
II 180,6; part. m. pl. ~antā (Bhagavantaṁ ~ nikkha-
miṁsu), Mil 108,2; aor. 1 sg. ~iṁ (ahaṁ taṁ), Ap
anu-pabbajatiagārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitaṁ ~), DN II 30,11;
cf. Kacc-v 301; fut. 1 sg. ~issāmi (taṁ purisaṁ ~),
Ja I 56,32; 1 pl. ~issāma, DN II 244,9* (v. l.); pp.
anu-pabbajita, q. v.

f. (from prec), adopting a homeless
life after another; It 107,11 (~aṁ pâhaṁ . . . tesaṁ
bhikkhūnaṁ bahukāraṁ vadāmi; It-a) = SN V 67,21
(Spk), quoted Ps I 160,6; Ap 49,23 (nikkhantenânu-
pabbajjaṁ ... mayā) = Th-a (Ce) II 3,13*; Dhp-a
I 105,17 (~aṁ pabbajitvā, paron.); Anāg 65 (Met-
teyyassânupabbajjaṁ pabbajissanti, paron.).

mfn. (pp. of anu-pabbajati),
who has adopted a homeless life after another; n. pl.
~āni (°sahassāni), Sv (II) 457,22 (Ee anupabbajjitā
ti); gen. pl. ~ānaṁ (gaṇanā na vijjati), Mhv V 168.
see anūpa-°.

(or with rhythmical lengthening an-
ūpama & an-opama, q. v.), mfn. [ts.], incomparable,
peerless; excellent, highest; Mil 156,15 (asama -√);
246,13 (sāra, vara, etc. +); 278,18 (Buddho ati-agga-
an-upama(~ena Buddha-vesena).

(pr. 3 sg., to rejoice together
with; part med. ~amāno, Pj II 378,22 (= 'anu-
modamāno', ɔ: anupadam modamāno?).
mfn., see anūpaya.

m., not stopping, non cessation; abl.
~ā, Mil 44,26.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + pari +
√gam[, to go round or to hover about, to go the round of
(acc); part. f. sg. ~antī, Dhp-a I 416,14 (pāsādaṁ;
v. l. anupariyāyaṁ gacchantī; cf. ib. 417,10); pot. 3
sg. ~eyya, Spk III 181,7 (= 'anuparisakkeyya', SN
anu-parigacchati(= parito parito agamāsi, Pj) = SN I 124,5*; do. 3 pl.
for °~guṁ, It 21,13* (rājîsayo yajamānâ°) = AN IV
151,6* (Ee anupariyayā, v. l. anucariyagā; = vica-
riṁsu, It-a & Mp), quoted Pj I 168,11*; inf. ~gan-
tuṁ, Vin III 151,21'; abs. (a ) ~gamma (sabbā disā),
Ud 47,21* (Ud-a) = SN I 75,25*; (b) ~gantvā, Vin
III 119,28 (gabbhaṁ); Ja IV 267,26 (gumbaṁ); Ps
III 390,9 (mahantaṁ gacchaṁ).

pr. 3 sg. [aṇu + pari +
√dhāv], to run round and round (acc); MN II 233,1
(sā gaddūla-baddho . . . khīlaṁ vā thambhaṁ vā ~
+ anuparivattati) ≠ SN III 150,9 foll.; 3 pl. ~anti
(+ anuparivattanti), MN II 232,24; 233,3; III 72,27
foll; part. m. ~aṁ, SN III 150,18.

n. nomen actionis of prec;
Ps III 435,15 (ad MN II 232,24 foll).

mfn. [anu + pari + sa. sphuṭa,
pp. of √sphar], pervaded throughout; As 117,3 (sakala-
sarīraṁ . . . ~aṁ hoti) = Vism 144,25.
aor., see anu-parigacchati.

ind. (anu + pariyanta, loc), all
round the boundaries (of.,ifc. devalokâ°, Ap 307,12).

(or anu-pariyāyati, q. v.), pr. 3 sg.
[sa. anu + pari + √yā], to go round about; Ja V
anu-pariyātiJa VI 121,6* = 122,2* (najjo ca ~; cf. ib. 121,22'
and Sadd 739,14); Dhp-a I 417,10 (pāsādaṁ ~; v. l.
pariyāyati; cf. ib. 416,14); Pv-a 217,1 (samantato);
Mhv XVII 40 (~ taṁ thānaṁ); 3 pl. ~anti, AN IV
254,26*; Ja V 322,17* (samantā); Pv 434 (udakas-
miṁ ~ (metre faulty); — anuvicaranti, Pv-a);
— part, acc.m.pl. ~ante, Ja VI 278,18* (Sineruṁ; =
anupariyāyante, Ct.); — [pot. 3 pl. anupariyeyyuṁ
(samantā), SN I 102,20*, prob, to anupariyeti];
— aor. 3 sg. ~āsi, Vin II 111,19 (tikkhattuṁ Rājagahaṁ
~). — Cf. anu-pariyeti.

entry.re:
— °-pathaanu-pariyāya-patha, m., a path leading round
(within the parapet of a fortress); AN IV 107,2 =
109,26 (~o hoti ucco c'eva vitthato ca; = anto-
pākārena saddhiṁ gato mahāpatho, yattha ṭhitā
bahi-pākāre ṭhitehi saddhiṁ yujjhanti, Mp); acc.
~aṁ (samantā ~ anukkamamāno), DN II 83,12 =
III 101,4 (= anupariyāya-nāmakaṁ pākāra-maggaṁ,
Sv) = SN V 160,21 (= do. Spk) = AN V 195,1
(= do. Mp).

entry.sense:
pr. 3 sg. = anu-pariyāti (q. v.);
Spk I 175,29; part. acc. m. pl. ~ante, Ja VI 279,5'
(= 'anupariyante'); pot. 3 pl. ~eyyuṁ, Mil 38,30
(taṁ yeva ~); aor. 3 sg. ~āyi (sattakkhattuṁ),
Dhp-a III 202,17; abs. ~āyitvā (āḷāhanaṁ), Pv-a
92,25.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + pari + √i;
cf. anu-pariyāti, which may be scanned ˇ ˇ - - ˇ
except perhaps at AN IV 254,26* and (the corrupt)
Pv 434], to go round and round; Th 125 (makkaṭo
. . . dvārena ~; cf. Trsl. p. 112 n. 2; quoted Pj II
31,18 reading anu-pariyāti); Th 1235 = SN I 192,2*
(samantā ~ sāgarantaṁ mahiṁ imaṁ); Th 1250 =
SN I 195,10* (cetasā ~; metaph. = to scrutinize, cf.
ceto-pariya-ñāṇa); [SN I 109,2* (āyu ~ maccānaṁ;
anu-pariyetipariyeti (codd. S1-2), anu- from Spk I 175,29]; part,
m. acc. pl. ~ante, see under anupariyāti; pot. 3 pl.
anupariyeyyuṁ, SN I 102,20*.

m. (anu + sa. parivarta),
turning after (in conformity with); only °-ja, mfn.,
arisen from that; MN III 227,34 foll. = SN III 16,11
foll. (rūpa-vipariṇāmâ°, viññāṇa-v°, vedanā-v°, saṁ-
khāra-v°).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + pari +
√vṛt], to move or turn after, to follow in moving, to
keep on moving; SN III 150,9 (anuparidhāvati+);
3 pl. ~anti, DN I 240,26 (pañjalikā namassamānā ~,
scil. candima-suriye); Ud-a 75,23 (candima-suriye
~enti, read with Se~anti); MN II 232,24 (anudhāvanti
+ ); III 72,27 (do.); Mil 253,10 (do.); AN II 188,32
(aṭṭha lokadhammā lokaṁ ~) = IV 157,3; Sp I
anu-parivattatica Bodhisatto ca ekato ~anti); part. m. ~aṁ, SN
III 150,18.

n. (anu + sa. parivartana)
— anu-parivatta above; Ps III 669,18 ad MN III
227,32. — Ifc. v. ādiccâ° (Mp II 32,13).

mfn. (anu + sa. parivartin),
following in moving, conforming to; only in comp.
rūpa-vipariṇāmâ°, etc. MN III 227,32 (°ânuparivatti
anu-parivattin

pr. 3 sg. (anu + parivatteti
in the sense of sajjhāyati, cf. Pv-a 97,25), to repeat (a
text again and again); [3 pl. ~enti, Ud-a 75,23, w. r.
for ~anti; see anu-parivattati]; part. m. pl. ~entā,
Pv-a 97,26 (vedaṁ ~ homaṁ karontā japanti).

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of anu + pari
+ √vṛ), (a) to surround, enclose, shut up; (b) to em-
brace, follow, side with; imper. 2 pl. ~etha (b), Vin I
338,8 (mā . . . anuvattittha +); pot. 1 pl. ~eyyāma
(a), MN I 153,19; aor. 3 pl. ~esuṁ (a), ib. 153,23
(Ps); abs. ~etvā (b), Ja III 487,6 = Dhp-a I 55,3.

ind. (anu + pariveṇa), about
to every cell (or hut); Mp I 67,12 (~ gantvā). Cf. next.

ind. (anu + pariveṇa +
suff. °iya, cf. Wackernagel, AiGr II 1 p. 108,17),
round in every cell; Vin I 80,1 (~ bhikkhūnaṁ āro-
cehi); 106,36 (~ pātimokkhaṁ uddisanti).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. *anu + pari +
√ṣvaṣk with var. √ṣvakk, sa-Dhātup § 4,26], to go
round about, to escort; pot. 3 sg. ~eyya, SN IV 312,18
foll. (āyāceyya thomeyya pañjaliko ~; = anu-
parigaccheyya, Spk).

n., nomen actionis of prec;
SN IV 312,22 foll. (°-ḥetu).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. *anu + pari +
√hṛ], to surround, cover, embrace; pot. 3 sg. ~eyya
(sālaṁ), MN I 306,28; abs. ~itvā upari viṭabhiṁ
kareyya, ib. 29.

m., 'not disagreement', conformity
(scil. with the language of the holy texts); instr. ~ena
(tad-), Kacc 56; Kacc-v 405 (jinavacanâ°; cf. Sadd
809,1); 644 (yathânuparodhena Buddhasāsane[na]).
aor., see anu-parigacchati.

f. [sa. an-upalabdhi], non-occur-
rence, Sadd 230,17 (abl. ~ito). Cf. next.

n. (cf. pass, upalabbhati),
non-existence; Ud-a 275,19 (kassaci attanā piyatarassa
°-vasena).

mfn. [an + part. pass, of
upa-√labh; sa. an-upalabhyamāna], not existing, not
to be found; MN I 138,6 (attani ca . . . attaniye ca
. . . ~e); Ud-a 14,24.

(and anūpalitta in çloka- and
triṣṭubh-met/-e), mfn. (an + pp. of upa-√lip), 'un-
smeared', undefiled (by: instr.); not cleaving or clinging
to (loc); Sn 211 (sabbesu dhammesu ~aṁ; Pj) =
an-upalittaMN I 171,4* (Ps) = Mvu III 326,6*; Sn 392 (etesu
dhammesu ~o); 468 (~o idha vā huraṁ vā; = taṇhā-
diṭṭhi-lepehi alitto, Pj II 409,9; cf. Mil 361,27); Sn
790 (puññe ca pāpe ca ~o; Pj, Nidd); 845 (jalena
paṁkena ca ~aṁ; Pj, Nidd-a); Ap 508,24 (~o lo-
kena toyena padumaṁ yathā); Ud-a 281,30 = Ps
III 87,5; MN I 319,15 (āmisena ~ā); 386,30* (bud-
dhassa vītadhūmassa ~assa; Ps = Pj (above)); SN
I 141,23* (bāhetvā pāpāni ~o; Spk = Pj (above));
III 83,21* (loke ~ā te); 140,18-20 (uppalaṁ . . .
~aṁ udakena . . . Tathāgato . . . ~o lokena) = AN
II 39,1-2 (Mp); Nidd I 55,24 (= 'na lippati'; Nidd-a);
Mil 318,15-16 (udakena . . . sabbakilesehi ~aṁ); Jināí
132 (~o lokena).
entry.re:
— °-tāan-upalitta-tā, f. abstr., Ps I 13,3 (lokena
~aṁ).

entry.sense:
mfn., without attachment; Ud-a
371,1.

mfn. (an + grd. of upavadati; cf.
an-avajja, sa-upavajja), irreproachable, not blamable
(not leading to evil results); AN I 177,34 (aniggahīto
asaṁkiliṭṭho ~o appaṭik(k)uṭṭho; = upavada-vini(m)-
mutto, Mp); IV 82,16 foll. (tīhi [scil. nimittehi] ~o
an-upavajja97,34 (adaṇḍâraho ~o); Pj II 523,1 (kena dosena . . .
vadeyya, evaṁ ~o ca so . . .); Ps I 50,2:1 (sabbaṁ
atthato ca vyañjanato ~aṁ) = Sv I 66,21. = Mp I
110,1; — ~aṁ Channo satthaṁ āharissati, SN IV
57,26 (60,4) = MN III 264,26 (266,31) (speaking of
Channa's suicide; = an-upapaltikaṁ a-ppaṭisandhi-
kaṁ, Spk & Ps, thus taken = *an-upapădya);
Sāriputta, in SN IV 59,29 = MN III 266,24, mis-
takes it for *an-upavrajya = an-upasaṁkamitabba,
cf. Spk III 23,2, Ps III 726,18).
entry.re:
— °-tāan-upavajja-tā, f. abstr., MN
III 266,22 = SN IV 59,27.

entry.sense:
(or anu-ppavattaka), mfn., one
who keeps rolling on (after another); Pj II 454,18
(dhammacakkassa ~o); Mil 362,16 Cdhammacakkam
~o; cf. 343,11 and anu-dhammacakkaṁ-pavattaka).
— Ifc. v. dhammacakkâ°.

n., nomen actionis of prec, Ud-a
361,11.

f., continued dealing with, cri-
ticism.(?); ifc. v. vādâ°.
mfn., see a-ppavattika.

mfn. (pp. of next), kept advancing;
Ps III 554,13 (= 'anuṭṭhita', MN III 99,9).

(or anu-ppavatteti), pr. 3 sg.
(caus. of anu + pra + √vṛt), to keep moving on (after
anu-pavattetiIII 149,3= Mil 362,23 (dhammacakkaṁ pavattitaṁ
samma-d-eva ~); 2 sg. ~esi, SN I 191,15 (do.); pot. 2
sg., ~eyyāsi (idaṁ kalyāṇaṁ vaṭṭaṁ nihitaṁ), MN
II 75,27 foll; 2 pl. ~eyyātha (do.), ib. 83,5; aor. 3
sg. ~esi (do.), ib. 82,24.
n. = next (q. v.).

(or an-ūpavāda, with rhythm,
an-upavādapaghāto, Dhp 185 (anūpavādo ti anupavadanañ
[anupavādanañ, Ed] c'eva anupavādāpanañ ca,
Dhp-a) = Ud 43,7* (= vācāya kassaci pi an-
upavadanaṁ [Ed. anupavādanaṁ], Ud-a) = DN II
49,28* (quoted Sp I 187,1*; Ud-a 298,31*; Sv = Ud-a).

mfn., not abusing (gen.); pl.
ariyānaṁ ~ā, MN I 23,2 = 248,33. = III 178,29 =
Pp 60,28 = Paṭis I 115,16.

n., not inciting others to abuse;
Dhp-a III 238,1.

mfn., not making use of blame
or reproach; m. ~ī (an-ovādī +), MN I 360,9 (Ps). an-upavadin
see anūpa°.

mfn. (an + pp. of upavisati),
not (entered or) sat down, not engaged; °-citta, mfn.,
whose mind is not present; Mp (Se) II 438,3 (= 'a-ni-
kaṭṭha-citta', AN II 137,17).

(or anu-pp°), mfn. (pp. of anu-
pavisati), having entered (pervaded), come near; Vv 959
(imaṁ padesaṁ ~ā (-pp-); Vv-a); MN I 332,6 (koṭṭham
~o); Ja VI 200,8'(= 'ogāḷha', immersed); 206,17* (~o
sukkhesu kaṭṭhesu (-pp-), scil. aggi); Dhp-a III 129,3
(mama cittaṁ visaṁkhāraṁ nibbānaṁ . . . gataṁ
~aṁ); Kv-a 94,20 (pl. ~ā; Ee °patiṭṭhāl); Mil 209,10
anu-paviṭṭhaconvinced

(or anu-pp°), pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu +
pra + √viç], to enter or go into, to engage, to force
one's way into, Ja III 282,26' (adhikaraṇiṁ); As 145,4
(ogāhati bhinditvā viva ~); Mp III 43,13 (micchāvi-
takkasmiṁ saṁsīdati (or visīdati) ~ati, ad AN III
90,10)= Pp-a 249,27; 2 sg. ~asi, Vv-a 42,28 (= 'ogā-
hasi'); pot. 2sg.~eyya (channaṁ), Vin IV 221,2**(29');
aor. 1 sg. anu-pāvisiṁ (samanarfi brāhmaṇaṁ vā),
Ja VI 60,14* (= anupaviṭṭhapubbo, Ct., but prob, from
anu + upavisati, to serve apprenticeship withl); abs.
(a ) anu-ppavissa, Ja IV 447,1* (= anu-pavisitvā, Ct;
here, also, originally *anūpavissa from anu + upa-
vis-?); (b) ~itvā, Dhp-a I 375,14 (vanasaṇḍaṁ); Sp
(IV) 780,12 (= 'anupakhajja', q. v.); Ps III 60,3;
Spk II 311,18; ogahetvā ~itvā, Ps II 158,26 (= 'anu-
māssa') = Mp II 116,27 (= 'anuvicca'); pp. anu-
paviṭṭha (q. v.); caus. anu-paveseti (q. v.).

n. (from prec), entering into,
penetrating into; Ja I 155,15' (kaṇḍaṁ °(a)ṭṭhena
sallan ti vuccati; cf. Pj II 100,28).

(in all verses quoted below anu-
ppavecchati), pr. 3 sg. [seems to represent both anu-
paveseti [caus. of sa. anu + pra + √viç, by which it
is explained in Ctt.], and *anu-prayacchati as well,
see pavecchati]; Utt. 'to cause to enter, to pour into
or down, to water or irrigate', i. e. to give or yield (in
anu-pavecchati221,29* (das' assa ṭhānāni ~; Ee has the Burm. mis-
spelling °pavacch°) ≠ AN II 64,10* (cattāri ṭhānāni
~; = cattāri kāraṇāni ~ dadāti, Mp); MN I 446,26
(vaṇṇiyañ ca valiyañ ca~); III 133,3 (tiṇaghāsôda-
kaṁ ~); AN I 160,14 (devo na sammā dhāraṁ ~; =
vassaṁ na vassati, Mp); II 75,10; 3 pl. ~anti, AN V
270,18 (yaṁ vā pan' assa to ~ mittā, etc.) quoted Pv-a
28,15 = Pj I 211,20; imper. 2 sg. ~asu (yass' icchasi
tassam ~), Ja V 394,9*; pot. 3 sg. (a ) ~e, Sn 208
(jāyantam√?) assa nâ°; = anu-paveseyya, Pj); 209
(sineham assa nâ°); (b) ~eyya (devo (na) sammā
dhāraṁ ~): DN I 74,25 (= [anu]-paveseyya . . . (na)
vasseyya, Sv) = II 353,9 (Sv do.) = MN I 277,5
(= (na) paveseyya, Ps) = II 16,2 - III 93,15 =
SN V 379,25 = AN I 135,5 (= anu-paveseyya, Mp)
= II 166,32 = III 26,3 = IV 283,19; aor. 3 sg.
anu-pavecchi (devo, etc.), Sp I 87,7.

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of anu-pavisati)
= anu-pavecchati (q. v.); Mp ad AN II 64,10* (~ati
dadāti, = 'anu-pavecchati'); pot. 3 sg. ~eyya (=
'anu-paveccheyya'), Mp II 210,19; Sv I (218,17); (III)
813,26 ad DN II 353,9; Pj II 256,19 (= 'anu-ppa-
vecche').

(in triṣṭubh verse scanned anū-
pasagga, see below), mfn. [sa. an-upasarga; opp. sa-
upasagga], (a) free from (resp. not causing) trouble
or misfortune; ~o paṇḍito, AN I 101,18 = MN III
61,23 (quoted Pj I 127,15); Nett 55,16* (scan anū-
pasaggaṁ 'nupasagga-dhammaṁ); — (b) in gramm.
= not in compound with prp., ~o (suta-saddo), Sv
I 28,14 = Ps 14,24 = Spk I 6,5 = Mp I 6,18 =
Pj I 101,24 = Ud-a 11,33 (quoted Sadd 491,29).
— an-upasagga(see above).

mfn., [sa. an + upasṛṣṭa] not
afflicted, free from trouble; n. ~aṁ, Vin I 15,30 (an-
upaddutaṁ +; -ss-); m. pl. ~ā, Pj I 155,9 (an-
upaddutā + ; -s-; v. l. an-upasaggā (q. v.)).

[f., not causing to be stop-
ped (1); prob. w.r. [blending of saṇṭhapanā & anu-
(p)pabandhanā] Pp 18,21 (saṇṭhāpanā ~ anu(p)pa-
bandhanā) ≠ Vibh 357,13 (reading anusaṁsandanā
anu-ppabandhanā, q. v.]

m., restlessness; Mp (Se) II 434,8
(°-patipakkho ~o, an-upasantatthena vā vattam eva
~o nāma; Cf. AN II 132,5).

mfn., not con-
ducive to tranquillity; aniyyānika +, DN III 118,3
(Sv) = MN II 244,8 (Ps) ≠ SN V 379,29.

mfn., not delighting in tran-
quillity; AN II 132,5 (cf. an-upasama above).

mfn. = prec; AN II
132,5 (Ee °samudita).

mfn. (an-upasama + ārāma)
= prec. AN II 132,5 (Ee an-upasamarāmā; but see
Mp ad AN II 131,31).

entry.re:
— °-saññi(n)an-upasampanna-saññi(n),
an-upasampanna143,34 foll.

— °-sīlaan-upasampanna-sīla, n., the precepts for novices;
Vism 15,17 (sāmaṇera-sāmaṇerīnaṁ dasa sīlāni ~aṁ).

entry.sense:
mfn. (anu + √paç; cf. next),
(a) beholding, regarding as; Th 420 (with acc, bhavam
aṅgārakāsuṁ va ñāṇena ~o, scil. ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko
maggo); — (b) looking at, observing (= anu-passi(n));
ifc. v. nagarâvayavâ°, rathasambhārâ°.

pr. 3 sg. [anu + √paç], to see,
behold, look at, contemplate, observe; Vin I 184,22
— AN III 378,6-2 4 = IV 404,15 (vayañ c'assa ~ati);
Vin I 185,8* (Sp) = AN III 379,4* (do.); Sn 477 (yo
attanā attānaṁ nâ°; Pj); Paṭis I 57,31 (cittassa
bhaṅgaṁ ~); 183,4 (kāyaṁ); 187,23 (taṁ vedanaṁ
~); Pj II 298,11 (randham); Ud-a 362,13 (nâ°); Ja
IV 429,2* (rūpāni thūlāni-m- ~); Abhidh-av 66,18*
anu-passatisamanupassati; mṭ as Abhidh-av), quoted Sadd
507,27 (with a quaint padaccheda: rūpāni manu
[= satto] passati); Abhidh-av 102,19* (suññam evâ°);
116,28* (addhāsu tīsv-evam ~); part, acc m. ~an-
taṁ, Dhp-a I 74,14; gen. ~ato, Abhidh-av 123,17*
(saṁkhāre); ~antassa, Pj II 503,31 (dvayadhamme);
part. med. ~amāno, Ps I 241,27 (kāyaṁ) ≠ Vibh-a
217,20; — caus. see anu-dasseti.

n., = anu-passanā; Paṭis I 186,25
(aṭṭha ~e ñāṇāni, v. I. ~ā-ñāṇāni). — Ifc. v. anu-°,
chinnam-°, nibbidâ°, bhaṅgâ°.
entry.re:
— °-sīlaanu-passana-sīla, mfn.,
being in the habit of viewing, considering, Ps I 241,26
(kāyaṁ ~o, = 'kāyânupassi(n)' ≠ Vibh-a 217,20 (v.l.).

entry.sense:
f. (nomen actionis of anu-passati;
sometimes anu-passana, n.); viewing, contemplating,
consideration, point of view; Sn p. 140,9 (ekâ°); ib. n
(dutiyâ°); Vibh 194,25 (yā paññā pajānanā . . . amoho
dhammavicayo sammādiṭṭhi, ayaṁ vuccati ~ā);
Abhidh-av 120,7* (~ā (viñ)ñāṇan ti); tividhā ~ā, Mp
III 254,3 (aniccaṁ dukkhaṁ anattan ti ~ā), cf. Paṭis
I 96,25; II 37,29; sattavidhā ~ā, Ps 1157,9 (scil.
anu-passanāvirāgâ°, nirodhâ°, paṭinissaggâ°, cf. Paṭis I 10,16);
Ps I 243,6 (sattannaṁ ~ānaṁ); Mp I 31,9 (sattasu
... ~ āsu); ten ~ā-ñāṇāni, Paṭis II 41,34; 67,17;
eighteen ~ā, Paṭis I 20,22 foll., cf. Mp I 31,10: aṭṭhāra-
sasu mahā-vipassanāsu). — Ifc. v. anattâ°, aniccâ°,
animittâ°, appaṇihitâ°, ādīnavâ°, kāyâ°, khayâ°,
cittâ°, dukkhâ°, dvayatâ°, dhammâ°, nibbānâ°,
nibbidâ°, nirodhâ°, paṭinissaggâ°, paṭisaṁkhâ°,
vayâ°, vipariṇāmâ°, virāgâ°, vivaṭṭanâ°, veda-
nâ°, satipaṭṭhānââ°, suññatâ°.

mfn. (neg. part, of *upas-
sayati, see upassaya), not associating with (acc);
na ca sappurise ~assa savanaṁ atthi, Sv I 30,6 =
Ps I 6,17 — Mp I 9,1 = Spk I 8,3 (Ee anupaniss°)
= Ud-a 16,13.

mfn. (from anu-passati), (a) looking
for, contemplating, observing (with acc); Sn 255 (ran-
dham evâ° ~ī; Pj) = Ja III 192,29* (Ct), i. e. tmesis
of randhânupassī; — (b) regarding as . . .; this last
mostly ifc. see anattâ°, anānupassi(n) (with metrical
anu-passinitthi-purisâ°, udakâ°, udayabbayâ° (or udaya-
vyayâ°), ekadhammâ°, kāyâ°, citta-dhammâ°,
cittâ°, jāti-ppabhavâ°, dukkhâ°, dvayatâ°, dham-
mâ°, nâññadhammâ°, paṭinissaggâ°, paravajjâ°,
(randhâ°), vayadhammâ°, virāgâ°, vedanâ°, sa-
mudaya(vaya)dhammâ°, samūhâ°, sukhâ°, sud-
dhâ°, subhâ°.

f. abstr. of prec.; only ifc. v.
assādâ°, nibbattibhavâ°, nibbidâ°.

ind. (neg. abs. of upa + √han),
without hitting (or cutting, spoiling, reducing, impairing,
destroying) (acc); Vin I 24,37; DN II 336,2 (= a-vinā-
setvā, Sv); MN III 274,33 (= an-upahanitvā, Ps);
Dhp-a I 373,20 (~ saddhaṁ, ~ bhoge); Ud-a 200,18
an-upahacca71,27 (seyyathā pi . . . papaṭikā nibbattitvā uppa-
titvā ~ talaṁ nibbāyeyya, í. e. without (ɔ: before)
striking against the ground, cf. tala; Mp).

mfn. (an + pp. of upa + √han),
(a) uninjured; akkhato + ~o, SN II 227,17-18;
akkhataṁ + ~aṁ, AN I 294,8; Mp III 151,9 (=
'akkhato', AN III 373,24*); — (b) not struck down,
not removed (or kept down); Mil 274,6 (~aṁ, scil.
rajojallaṁ).
entry.re:
— °-jivh[ā/a]pasādaan-upahata-jivh[ā/a]pasāda, mfn., one whose faculty
of taste is not hebetated; Dhp-a II 33,11 (~o puriso).

entry.sense:
n., not injuring; Dhp-a III
238,2 (~aṁ + an-upaghātanaṁ, = 'anupaghāto').

m. (cf. upa-harati), 'not bringing
near', non-supply; abl. ~ā; MN I 487,29 (aññassa ca
~ā an-āhāro nibbuto, scil. aggi); — also written
an-upāhāra [influenced by an-āhāra; as from upāha-
rati] in similar phrases: MN III 245,7; SN II 85,24;
an-upahāra

ind. (anu + loc. of pākāra, m.),
along the wall (or rampart); Ja VI 400,19 (~e caṁka-
manti); 406,10 (~e ṭhatvā); — in comp.s anupākāra-°:
Ja VI 401,28 (°-matthake, above along the wall); ib.
390,2 (°-dvāraṭṭālake, do. gate-tower).

mfn., who has not come near or
entered into; Mp (Se) II 328,13 (~o = 'an-upapanno',
AN II 6,25).

m. [ts.; from anu-patati, q. v.], follow-
ing (one's views); at AN I 161,10, etc., v.r. for °-anu-
vāda (Mp II 257,33: 'vādânupāto' ti vādassa anupāto
aṇu patanaṁ pavattîti attho; Mp-ṭ: anu-pāto ti
anu pacchā pavatti), cf. Nett-a ad Nett 52,4: vādānu-
pātā ti pi pāṭho, vādānupavattiyo ti attho, see Nett
anu-pāta

mfn. (from prec), following; attack-
ing, hurting; ifc. v. khaṇâ°; paṇḍitâ°, vidurâ° (Ja
V 399,26* ≠ Mvu II 59,11*).

ind. (anu + pāda), at the foot;
Vism 182,32 (= pāda-samípaṁ, mhṭ; opp. anu-sīsaṁ).

(mostly used before nouns, as it were
a subst, in compound, while an-upādāya (q. v.) is
preferred before finite verb forms, cf. MN III 227,25
with 227,36 ; see aññā-citta), ind. (neg. abs. of upādiyati),
'without taking aliment', i. e. without clinging to (world-
an-upādā117,4 (Sv); II 70,26 (=catūhi upādānehi a-gahetvā
vimutto, Sv); SN II 18,16 (= catūhi upādānehi kiñci
dhammaṁ an-upādiyitvā vimutto, Spk); 48,22 (Spk);
115,5; 253,16; III 59,34 foll; 80,33 foll; 161,12;
170,11; 193,15; IV 83,22; 141,12; 255,2; V 194,18;
205,25; MN I 235,17-23 (no Ct; Tr. an-uppādā; no
v. l.); — ~ vimokkho, AN V 64,23; ~ cittassa vimok-
kho, Vin V 164,34; MN II 265,31; AN I 198,34 (Mp);
Paṭis 1145,18 foll; — vimuccanti, MN III 187,8*
— AN I 142,19*; — ~ parinibbānatthāya or °-atthaṁ,
Vin V 164,32; MN I 148,1 foll.; SN IV 48,1; V 29,5 foll.;
~ parinibbānaṁ, AN I 44,22; IV 70,1; V 65,1; Nidd-a
II 38,1; Dhp-a I 286,3; Mil 31,31; — ~ paritassanā,
MN III 227,25; ~ a-p'aritassana, MN III 228,10; SN
III 17,6-7; — ~punabbhavo na hoti, Ud 33,20* (metre:
anupādā(ya\ pun°; Ud-a; w. r. anuppādā), quoted
Nett 157,21* ≠ Mvu II 418,14* (omitting anup°).

mfn., (a) having no aliment, esp.
said of a fire, or a lamp, = without fuel; (b) 'not
drawing upon existence'', free from attachment (or
clinging to existence)[both senses inseparable in com-
parisons]; Ap 101,8 (nibbāyi ~o dīpo va); 463,1;
540,22 (pl. ~ā dīpaccī viya nibbutā, — Thī-a 154,16*);
SN IV 399,20 (aggi sa-upādāno jalati no ~o); Dhp-a
II 163,9 (~o viya padīpo); Ud-a 216,19 (~o viya
jātavedo) = 353,27 ≠ 433,34 (cf. 269,11). — Sn 546
(sīho si ~o pahīna-bhaya-bheravo) = 572 = Th 840;
Sn 751 (anejo~o); 753 (anissito +); Ap 463,1 (sikhī
va ~o pāpuṇissāmi nibbutiṁ); SN IV 102,24 (~o . . .
parinibbāyati); 109,17 (do.); 399,19 (sa-upādānassa
. . . upapattiṁ paññāpemi no ~assa); MN II 237,13
foll. (nibbuto 'ham asmi, ~o 'ham asmi); Sv I 109,11
(vigatacchandarāgatāya ~o, = 'anupādā vimutto');
Nett 31,28 (upādānehi ~o bhavati); Mil 32,18 (sace
~o bhavissāmi na paṭisandahissāmi) = 49,1.

n., freedom from attachment; dat.
~āya dhammo desito, Vin III 19,36 (virāgāya+ . . .;
= a(g)gahanatthāya, Sp) ≠ 111,23; ~āya santike,
MN I 411,25 (asārāgāya santike + ; the dative due to
influence from the Vinaya formula?) = 498,30.

mfn., not favourable to 'attachment'
(fostering of existences); Dhs (p. 5,29) 1220; 1539.
— Ifc. v. an-upādiṇṇâ°.

(or an-upādā, q. v.), ind. (neg. abs.
of upādiyati); (without taking aliment ɔ:) without
clinging to (worldliness); (a ) Vin III 8,30 (~ āsavehi
an-upādāya(id.) = Snp.149,17 (Pj) = MN III 20,23 — SN II
189,2; Vin I 17,6; 19,35; 20,33; 35,11 = SN IV 20,27;
Vin I 182,6; II 286,14; Ud 8,13 (Ud-a); 74,13; Ud-a
303,30; MN III 30,15; 31,9; SN II 187,17; III 45,13
(Spk); IV 107,29; V 317,11; Nidd I 67,1 (Nidd-a).
— (β) Sn 363 (~ anissito kuhiñci); — (γ) AN I 162,22*
(~ nibbuto) = III 214,12* ≠ SN II 279,8* ≠ Sn 638
= Dhp 414; Thī 105 (nibbutā); Dhp 89 (ye rata) =
SN V 24,27* = AN V 233,2*, 22*. — (ḍ) Ud 33,20*
(~ punabbhavo na hoti, so read for anupādā, q. v.).
— (ε) It 94,3 (~ aparitassato) — MN III 223,13;
MN III 223,12; 227,36; SN III 17,18-26. — (Q Th 673
(virago desito dhammo ~ sabbaso). — Title of a
sutta SN V 29.

mfn., in Abh 189 given to explain
the sense of 'sassatī' I

mfn. (from prec, b.); Pj II 464,9
≠ Ps III 396,15 (~aṁ jātim; speaking of plants and
trees); Ps 1214,18 (~ā āhārā); Mp I 353,17 (lotus
flowers); — Sv I 187,26 (nṭ: anupādinnaṁ = oda-
nâdi-vatthu, upādinnaṁ = udara-paṭalam) = Ps I
256,19; As 234,1 foll; 343,1; 378,26.

mfn., not conscious but
favourable to the rise of conscious existence; Dhs 991
(cf. 585).

neg. part. m.; an-upādiyamāna
& an-upādiyāna, neg. part. meal. mfn. ~; an-upā-
diyitvā, neg. abs., see upādiyati.

mfn. (cf. upādi & an-upādā,
opp. sa-upādi-sesa; cf. Buddh, sa. an-upadhi-çeṣa),
(a) completely free from the elements of 'attachment' (the
five khandhā); n. ~aṁ, Vism 509,13 (= n'atthi ettha
upādi-seso); m. ~o puggalo, Nett 109,13; loc. ~e
kusalā vadānā, Sn 876 (i. e. those who pretend to be
an-upādi-sesakusalavādā samānā, Pj = Nidd-a); ~e . . . ~o, AN
IV 75,24 (Mp); f. pl. ~ā suvimuttā, AN IV 75,17 (Mp);
— generally epithet to nibbāna-dhātu (f.): nom. ~ā
nibbāna-dhātu, It 38,7 foll.; 39,1*; Nett 38,6; 108,33;
127,18; acc. ~aṁ nibbāna-dhātuṁ, Nett 14,22; 92,23;
instr. ~āya nibbāna-dhātuyā (parinibbāyati): Vin II
239,27 = Ud 55,32; Ud 85,9 ; It 121,21; DN II 108,33;
136,5 (quoted Mil 175,16); III 135,13; AN II 120,32
(parinibbuto); IV 202,26; 313,20; Paṭis I 101,2; Ja I
28,12; 55,28; Vv-a 165,9 (parinibbute); Mil 95,22
(parinibbutassa); Nett 12,21 (muccati); 40,15 (anissi-
tacittā ~ niddisitabbā); cf. Nidd II 245,11 (Nidd-a
II 215,20-21); Ud-a 131,5; 216,31; 406,11; Sās 3,6;
— (b) in a physical sense = without any germ of
infection left, MN II 257,1 foll.

pr. 3 sg. (ami + *upādeti ɔ: upā-
diyati), to become attached to (?); Nidd II 93,35 (abhi-
nandati + ; conjectural reading; Ee Se and Nidd-a Se
anuppādeti; Nidd-a II 353,5 explains: rūpasmim anu-
vyañjanaṁ disvā allíyati).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu-pra + √āp], (a) to
reach, attain (acc. rei), or (b) to reach, i. e. to fall to
one's lot (with acc. pers.); MN I 349,30 foll. (anuttaraṁ
yogakkhemaṁ, a?) = AN V 343,7 foll.; MN II 173,32
(saccaṁ, a?); Ja II 65,2* (samaññaṁ, a); SN II
229,25 ≠ 236,2 (lābha-sakkāra-siloko ~, b); 1 sg.
~āmi, MN I 105,5 (anuttaraṁ yogakkhemaṁ nâ°
(a) cf. 349,30); imper. 3 sg. ~ātu, SN II 235,30 (b);
anu-pāpuṇātivimuttiṁ, a); pot. 3 sg. ~eyya, DN I 73,6 (gāman-
taṁ, a); aor. 3 sg. °-pāpuṇi, Ud-a 408,3 (Pāṭaligā-
maṁ); 1 sg. °-pāpuṇiṁ, Ap 490,30 (aggattaṁ, cf.
AN I 23,24); fut. 3 sg. ~issati, Nett 92,24 (nibbāna-
dhātuṁ); — abs. anu-ppatvāna, Pv 272 (Dvārakaṁ;
= anu-pāpuṇitvā, Pv-a 123,8); — pp. anu-ppatta
(q. v.); — caus. see anu-pāpeti.

mfn. (pp. of next), made to be
reached (understood); n. ~aṁ, Mil 252,28 (Jinasā-
sanaṁ).

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of anu-pāpuṇāti); to
make reach or attain, to take or convey to (acc. pers,
and rei); imper. 2 sg. °-pāpaya, Ja VI 88,26* (yāva
Sāmânupāpaya, Ct); pot. 3 sg. °-pāpeyya Mil 276,21
(patthitaṁ desaṁ); aor. 1 sg. °-pāpayiṁ, Cp III 11,4
(tam ahaṁ . . . ārogyam ~); pp. ~āpita (q. v.). anu-pāpeti

mfn. [ts.], 'not coming near', not
devoting oneself to (loc); MN III 25,23 foll. (tesu
dhammesu ~o + anapāyo anissito, etc.; = rāgavasena
anupagamano, Ps) ≠ Nidd II 219,10; SN III 53,9
(~o vimutto; cf. upāya, mfn. ib.; Spk).

m. [ts.], bad means, wrong manner of
proceeding; Ja VI 402,12 (ayam pi~o); instr. ~ena,
Ja I 256,6*; ib. 14 (+ aṭṭhāne); As 401,24 (— 'ayo-
niso'); Saddh 405 (~enûpagatā).
entry.re:
— °-pariggahaan-upāya-pariggaha,
m., the choosing bad means; Ps 1243,27.

— °-pari-vajjanaan-upāya-pari-vajjana, n., the avoiding bad means; Ps 1243,26.
— °-manasikāra, m., the wrong way of applying of one's
thoughts; Vibh-a 270,3 (= 'ayoniso manasikāra'). 2an-upāya

entry.sense:
mfn., unpractical; Ja I 98,13
(bālo avyatto ~o).

m., non-irritation (cf. next) Paṭis
I 11,7 foll. (asoko, aparidevo + ~o).
entry.re:
— °-bahulaan-upāyāsa-bahula,
mfn., full of serenity; DN III 159,7 (akkodhano
ahosi ~o).

entry.sense:
mfn., free from irritation, peaceful;
free from troubles; Ud 92,17 (asokā te virajā ~ā);
SN II 102,35 foll. (asokaṁ ... adaram ~aṁ); III
8,23 (sukho vihāro . . . avighāto ~o apariṭāho; =
nirupatāpo, Spk); MN III 231,2 (adukkho eso dham-
mo anupaghāto ~o apariḷāho); n. acc. (adv.) SN II
2an-upāyāsa~aṁ apariḷāhaṁ); m. pl. ~ā, Mp III 222,9 (= 'an-
āyāsā', AN IV 98,7*).

mfn., free from hostility (or
polemic disposition); Sv (III) 895,12 (niddosā ~ā,
— 'anāsavā anupadhikā'(!) DN III 112,10).
entry.re:
— °-cittaan-upārambha-citta,
mfn., not disposed to polemics; AN IV 26,12*; V 149,6.

entry.sense:
m(fn)., (from anu-pāleti), guarding,
preserving; Ps I 210,19 (kammajānaṁ ~o hutvā pac-
cayo hoti, scil. āhāro, opp. janako as in the foll.);
Abhidh-av 116,15* (janako hetu akkhāto, paccayo
~o); pl. ~ā, Mp II 122,5 (vaḍḍhakā + ; = 'āpādakā').
— Ifc. v. ariyavaṁsâ°.

n. (nomen actionis of anu-pāleti),
continual keeping, preserving, maintenance; Ps II
350,14 (usmāya ~aṁ); As 310,30—311,5 (upakāra,
upatthambhana + , cf. ib. 310,24-25) ≠ Vism 446,11-15;
447,24; Dīp III 2 (āyuñ-ca-anupālanaṁ ɔ: āyu-anu-
pālanaṁ ca?).
entry.re:
— °-lakkhaṇaanu-pālana-lakkhaṇa, mfn., characterized
by ~, As 123,29 foll.; Abhidh-av 19,8 (~aṁ, scil.
jīvitaṁ).

entry.sense: f. = prec, Spk II 266,12,14*.

mfn. (pp. of next), guarded, main-
tained; Mp II 122,6 (puttā hi mātāpitūhi vaḍḍhitā
c'eva ~ā ca).

pr. 3 sg. [anu + √pāl], to keep up,
preserve, maintain; Ja II 432,14* (yāva so ~eti; =
rakkhati, Ct.); III 19,25* (yo dhammaṁ ~eti; =
pāleti rakkhati, Ct.); Abhidh-av 19,12 (te dhamme
~eti); Ps 1268,5 (āpodhātu sineheti ca allattaṁ ca
anu-pāletiVism 447,18; imper. 2 sg. ~aya, Ja VI 317,25* ( ˇ ˇ
- ˇ - , Ee spells anupālayā; scil. asampadosaṁ; =
anurakkha, Ct.) = 321,14*; aor. 1 sg. ~esiṁ, Ap 218,13
(bhājanaṁ); ~ayiṁ, ib. 14 (do.); 243,10 (sīlaṁ);
— pass. part. ~iyamāna, mfn., As 310,25 ≠ Vism 447,32;
— pp. anu-pālita (q. v.).

mfn., without shoes; ~o, Vin I
187,7 foll.; Th 946; f. ~ā, Ja VI 586,3* (pattiyā+);
pl. ~ā, Ja VI 552,1* (pattikā +); gen. pl. ~ānaṁ,
Nidd I 228,20 (= upāhana-virahitānaṁ, Nidd-a).
m., see an-upahāra.

pr. 3 sg. [anu-api + √gam(?)],
see anu-pa-gacchati.

[pass. 3 sg. (*anu+ (a)pi+ √dhā),
to be shut in (or up); 3 pl. (med.) ~are, Ap 152,20
= Th-a C 151,36* (v. l. in Th-a for anusuyyare or
anusūyare) for anuvidhīyare, and this substituted for
anuvijjhare?]. [anu-pithīyati

n. or Anupiyā, f. [prob. Anūpiya in
spite of Ms. tradition; cf. anūpa], Npr. of a town
(fn.) and a mango-grove (n.) in the Malla country,
where Gotama spent the first week after his renunciation
before he went to Rājagaha; (a) n., Vin II 180,4 =
DN III 1,4 (~aṁ nāma Mallānaṁ nigamo; Sv (in
Se spelling Anuppiya) reports a v. r. Anopiya, cf.
AnupiyaII. ib.
mfn., w. r. for an-uppīḷa (q. v.).

mfn. [pp. of anu + √pīd], strongly
pressed; Dhp-a I 201,6* (padaṁ . . . duṭṭhassa hoti
sahasânupīḷitaṁ) = Mp I 436,18* = Pj II 544,3* (584,1)
= Vism 105,5* (— aggapādena paṇhiyā ca sahasā
anu-pīḷitacf. ib. 9*).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu + √prach], to
question, to inquire for; sg. ~asi, Sn 432 (evaṁ maṁ
pahitattam pi kiṁ jīvaṁ ~); I sg. ~āmi, Sn 1113
('n'atthi kiñcī'ti passato ñāṇaṁ ~); part. med. m.
~amāno, Sn 841 (diṭṭhiñ ca nissāya ~); pot. 1 sg.
~eyyaṁ, Ja IV 249,24* (read kim evâhaṁ Tuṇḍilam
ānupucche[yyaṁ] kaṇeyya(ṁ)saṁ (so Ck) bhātaraṁ
Kālikāya), for pot. 1 sg. ~e (with ahaṁ) cf. MSL 1927
anu-pucchati227,30* (only Ck, meaning ānupucchi or *anv-apucchi
[cf. ānucāri s. v. anucarati]; = anu-pucchi, ib. 221,24');
— pp. anu-puṭṭha, mfn., asked; ifc. v. an-ānu-
puṭṭha.

mfn. [sa. anupūrva], following in
successive order, regular, gradual (increasing or de-
creasing); pl. ~ā ūrū, Ja V 155,22* (regularly formed).
— n. ~aṁ, regular (systematic) order, As 135,13;
Th-a (Ce II 19,9) ad Th 727 (+ anukkamo = 'ānu-
pubbaṁ'); — do. ind. & instr. ~ena (adv.), abl. ~ato
(adv.), see below, and cf. anupubbaso, ănupubbī f.,
and ānu-pubba, n.

ind. [sa. anupūrvam], in regular
order, in turn, by and by; Sn 510—11 (= pañha-
paṭipāṭiyā, Pj); 600 (~aṁ yathātathaṁ); MN I
338,12* (do.); Th 548 (~ paricitā yathā Buddhena
desitā) quoted Paṭis I 172,5* (see ib. 173,17-28); Th
647 (~ paricitaṁ); SN I 3,5* (vayoguṇā ~aṁ jahanti;
Spk) = 62,33* = 63,1* = Ja IV 487,19* foll; SN
IV 217,4-18; 220,13-19 (see v. l.); ~aṁ suvaṭṭitaṁ,
Ja III 282,22* (said of a needle; 'tapering', Tr.); ~aṁ
kathaṁ datvā, Ja VI 469,24* (= in what order).

mfn. = anu-pubba; ifc. v. ānu-
pubbi-kathâ°, pubbâ°. Cf. ānupubbika.

f. = anu-pubbi-kathā or
ānu-pubbi-kathā (q. v.); Ja I 50,3; Mhv XXII 1.

n. (or more prob. f. ~ā),
gradual training; abl. ~ā, MN I 446,8 (abhiṇha-
kāraṇā +).

f., gradual or regular work-
ing; anupubba-sikkhā +, MN III 1,10; Ud 54,30
(Ud-a) = Vin II 238,29 = AN IV 201,2 = 207,19,
quoted Kv 219,21; instr, abl. ~ā, MN I 479,36 (Ps:
karaṇatthe paccattavacanaṁ).

f., the 21st anuvyañjana
of the Buddha; Dharmapr 13,15 (ad Mhbv 1,1*); Vyu
18,20 (anupūrvagātra)

mfn., walking about in
regular turn; avokkammacārī ~ī, = 'sapadānacārī',
anu-pubba-carin

mfn., gradually narrowing
(upwards); Sp ad Vin I 91,13 (uddhaṁ ~ena sīsena
samannāgato = 'sikhara-sīsa'; Vmv: ~ena sīsenā
ti cetiyathūpikā viya kamena kisena sīsena).

f., [(a) 'acting in turn', compliance;
~ā (instr. ?) tā tava mānase rata, Vv 755—56—57
(= anukūla-kiriyā, Vv-a 280,22), Ce (better ) anu-
bbatā]. — (b) succession, series; ifc. v. gaṇanâ°,
padâ°.

ind. = anupubbaṁ; Vibh-a
226,22, 26-33 = Vism 243,30, 34—244,1 ≠ Pj I (41,5)
70,19-27 (= anupaṭipāṭiyā); Abhidh-av 106,10.

mfn., gradually deepening;
~o + anupubba-pono, °-pabbhāro (scil. mahāsa-
muddo), Ud 53,9 foll. (Ud-a) = Vin II 237,19 foll.
= AN IV 198,1 foll. quoted Kv 219,19.

m., successive cessation (of
consciousness) (in jhāna, q. v., cf. anupubba-vihāra);
nava ~ā, DN III 266,6 (= anupaṭipāṭiyā nirodhā,
Sv) = 290,6 ≠ AN IV 409,1 (= anupaṭipāṭi-nirodhā,
Mp) ≠ 456,6; Paṭis I 35,3.

f., gradual progress; anu-
pubba-sikkhā anupubba-kiriyā +, MN III 1,10; Ud
54,30 (Ud-a) = Vin II 238,30 - AN IV 201,2 =
207,19, quoted Kv 219,22; instr. abl ~ā, MN I 479,36.

f., successive ex-
planation of words; Ps I 54,7 (so Ck & Se; Ee
a-pubba-°).

mfn., with precipice
succeeding precipice; Ud 53,9 (anupubba-ninno +,
scil. mahāsamuddo) = Vin II 237,19 — AN IV 198,8
quoted Kv 219,19.

f., gradual equipoise
(or rest); AN IV 456,2.

mfn., with slope following on
slope; Ud 53,9 (anupubba-ninno+, scil. mahāsa-
muddo) = Vin II 237,19 = AN IV 198,9, quoted Kv
219,19.

f., the 26th anu-
vyañjana of the Buddha; Dharmapr 13,17 (ad Mhbv
1,1*); cf. Vyu 18,20-21 (anupūrva-gātra, çuci-gātra).

f., word-by-word commen-
tary; As 54,31 (mātikāya ~ā).

n., the having been
put in due order; Pj I 13,29*; 20,21-30.

f., discerning knowledge
in due order; ifc. (mfn.) pavattâ°, Ud-a 35,1 =
Vism 700,22 (tassa (evaṁ) ~assa).

m(pl)., gradual (ascending)
stages (in meditation); nava ~ā, DN III 265,19 (=
anupaṭipāṭiyā samāpajjitabba-vihārā, Sv); 290,3 (cf.
II 156,1-14); AN IV 410,1 (Mp = Sv); Paṭis I 5,12
(Paṭis-a); gen. sg. ~assa vasībhūto, Ap 30,1 =
Th-a Ce II 108,17*.
entry.re:
— °-samāpattianu-pubba-vihāra-samāpatti, f., attainment of
anu-pubba-vihāra(paron.); gen.~īnaṁ, SN II 216,31; 222,1; Nidd I 143,8
(Nidd-a); Ud-a 135,30 (°-ñāṇāni); 269,2 (°-yogaṁ).

entry.sense:
mfn., gradually passing
through the (nine) stages (in meditation); m. ~ī tattha
so kalen'eva tare visattikaṁ, Ud 78,3* (Ud-a).

f., gradual attainment
(= anupubba-vihāra-samāpatti); Ps 1130,13 (navan-
naṁ ~īnaṁ).

f., gradual (systematic) train-
ing; + anupubba-kiriyā, °-patipadā, MN III 1,10;
Ud 54,29 (Ud-a) = Vin II 238,29 - AN IV 201,2 =
= 207,18, quoted Kv 219,21; instr, abl. ~ā, MN I
479,36.

m. Npr., surname of a
young merchant; Dhp-a I 298,11 (so evam anupubbena
puññakammassa katattā ~o nāma jāto).

mfn. (anu-pubba + adhi-
gata), gradually acquired or attained; ~ena arahatta-
maggena avijjaṇḍakosaṁ padāletvā, Mp III 233,14.

m. (cf. abhi-
saññā-nirodha), gradual cessation of conscious ideas;
DN I 184,26-—185,8 (°-sampajāna-samāpatti, f., =
anupaṭipāṭiyā sampajāna saññā-nirodha-samāpatti,
Sv (reckoning abhi for "upasagga-mattaṁ" and in-
verting the order of samp° and nirodha)). anu-pubbâbhisaññā-nirodha

m. (anupubba + abhi-
samaya), gradual apprehension or penetration; Kv
212,32; 219,16.
entry.re:
— °-kathāanu-pubbâbhisamaya-kathā, f., title of Kv II 9 (p.212
— 220).

entry.sense:
(& anu-pubbika, anu-pubbi-kathā),
f. [sa. ânupūrvī] see ānu-pubbī.

mfn. (anu-pubbaṁ + upa-
santa), gradually expired or died away; ~assa yathā
na ñāyati gati (scil. jātavedaso), Ud 93,24* (Ud-a)
= Ap 543,16 = Thī-a 157,2*.

entry.re:
— °-vaddhanaanu-pubbena-vaddhana, mfn., successively increasing; Sp
I 95,5 (avasesā navuti ~ā, scil. mahāmūlā; v. l.
°-vaḍḍhanakā).

entry.sense:
m., an under-purohita (ɔ: the
purohita of a sub-king), Sv (II) 663,1; pt ad Ja IV
304,19 (= 'upapurohita').

f., not disinterestedness; As
143,11 (Ee an-upekkhatā). Cf. next.

(or °pekkhanatā), f. (from
anu-pekkhati), sustained consideration; cittassa anu-
sandhanatā + (cāro, vicāro, etc. +), Dhs 8 — 85 =
284 = 372; As 143,12 (Se: ārammaṇaṁ anu-
pekkhamāno (!) viya tiṭṭhatī ti "anu-pekkhaṇatā
anu-pekkhaṇatāupekkhanatā").
f., see an-upekkhaṇatā.

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu-pra + √īkṣ], to
look or consider carefully; cetasā anuvitakketi anu-
vicāreti manasânupekkhati, DN III 242,8; AN III
23,3 = 87,13 = 361,23= 382,5; pāpakena manasâ°,
anu-pekkhati303,16; Nidd II 87,23 (= 'anukampamāna'); As
143,10; pp. anu-pekkhita (q. v.); caus, anu-pekkheti
(q. v.).

f. (cf. upe(k)khā), the being
interested, interestedness; gen. upe(k)khā-ñāṇena ~āya
(scil. pahānaṁ), Pj II 9,8 = Ud-a 32,18 = Ps I 23,19.

mfn., considering, intent upon;
ifc. v. attâ°, kāruñña-phalâ°, parâ°.

mfn. (pp. of anu-pekkhati), care-
fully considered or dwelt on; m. pl. ~ā, Vin II 95,36
(dhammā (sutā) dhatā vacasā paricitā manasâ °~ā
ditthiyā suppaṭividdhā) = MN I 213,5 (= cittena
~ā,' Ps) = 216,12 = 356,14 = AN II 23,5 (= cit-
tena ~ā, Mp) ≠ MN III 115,20 ≠ AN II 185,(e)-io
≠ Sv I 30,28 ≠ Ud-a 17,19; 31,18; 293,8.

m., nomen agentis of anu-
pekkhati ; nom. attānaṁ ~ā, one who controls himself,
Mp III 53,9 (= 'attânupekkhī', AN III 133,20).

pr. 3 sg. (caus. of anu-pekkhati),
to cause one to consider; Vin II 73,27 (pekkheti + ;
Sp: yathā so (Ce: yathā-yogaṁ) atthaṁ pekkhati
c'eva punappunañ ca pekkhati, evaṁ karoti).

pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu-pra + √i, or *anu-
(a)pi + √i (Tr.), cf. anu-pagacchati above], to go over
to, to pass into, to be dissolved into (acc); ~eti anu-
pagacchati, DN I 55,22 (= anuyāti, Sv) = MN I
515,11 (do. Ps), etc., see passages quoted under anu-
pagacchati.

pr. 3 sg. caus. [sa. anu-pra + √iṣ],
to send forth after; pot. 3 sg. ~eyya (anusāreyya +),
Mil 36,28.

°only in the iterative comp. poṅkhâ°,
q. v.

m., not a fast-day; Vin I 136,7
(na . . . ~e uposatho kātabbo; Sp).

mfn., not keeping fast-day; Ps
III 290,6 foll. (opp. uposathika).

ind. (from anu + posatha =
uposatha), every fast-day; Vin IV 145,2' = 315,27'
(= 'anvaddhamāsaṁ').

mfn. (grd. of anu + poseti, caus.
of √puṣ), to be nourished (afterwards); nânuposiyaṁ
(sabbasampatti-bījaṁ), Saddh 318.

ind. (cf. atippageva), in the morn-
ing; Sp ad Vin I 239,24 (~ yeva; = pāto va, Sp-ṭ,
Vmv).

n. = an-uppāda (q. v.); pṭ ad
Ja I 406,18.

(or anu-paññatta), mfn. (anu
anu-ppaññattaAN I 99,20 (paññatte ~aṁ; Mp II 165,30); Vin V
223,35.

(or anu-paññatti), f., an ad-
ditional or secondary order or rule; Vin II 286,28; V
1,7 foll.; 54,14; 115,13; 120,18; Sp (II) 502,21; (III)
636,13 (ad Vin III 195,23); Ja I 162,12 (ɔ: Vin IV
16,31**); Ps Ee III 323,8 (ɔ: Vin II 129,16); Mp II
anu-ppaññattianu-paññatti

(or anu-patta, metrical at Ja IV 97,9*,
etc., and at Pv 573 = 578, cf. anu(p)patti), mfn. (pp. of
anu-pāpuṇāti, sa. anu-prāpta), (a) with passive sense:
attained, reached, being within one's reach or compe-
tence; Th 112 (sadattho me~o; cf. anuppatta-sadattha,
mfn.); 331 (~o sacchikato ... dhammo); DN III 113,18
(~aṁ taṁ Bhagavatā; Sv); — (b) with active sense:
anu-ppattaanu-pattadhaṁ) = Dhp 411; Ap 53,28 (tâhaṁ bhūmiṁ ~o)
= Th-a Ce II 126,18*; Ap 86,15 (paṭisambhidā ~aṁ)
= Th-a Ce 499,13*; SN III 83,20* (read: anejan te
~ā); Pv-a 59,3 (dukkhaṁ~ā); Mil 139,19 (sotthim
~o); 276,5 (amhākaṁ samayaṁ ~o); 343,23 (ara-
hattaṁ ~ā); — vayo ~o, aged, old, Vin II 188,29
(jiṇṇo . . . addhagato +); DN I 48,3; do. pl. ~ā, Sn
p.50,15 = p.92,22; Pv-a 149,12; — arrived: («) (at,
acc. loci), DN I 87,14; 111,14; 1184,15; MN I 146,20;
349,10; Ja VI 417,3'; Dhp-a I 64,11 (read Sāvatthiṁ
~ānaṁ); — (β) as verb neutre; Raṭṭhapālo . . . ~o,
MN II 62,19; athatvaṁ~o, ib. 1119,5; atha Bhagavā
~o, ib. 89,7; ayam aham ~o, SN I 11,19; issaro
si ~o, Ja IV 214,23* (= āgato, Ct.) ≠ IV 434,6*
= V 323,30*; (yenâsi) atthena idhânupatto, Ja IV
97,9*,19* ≠ VI 274,2* (akkhena) ≠ 314,11*; Mil 287,4
(so 'yaṁ antimabhavo ~o); tav'eso pañho ~o, Mil
95,18 (here a question for you; the pronom. gen. may
stand for an acc); pañho tavânupatto, Mil 108,22;
113,29; 124,3; 131,6; 139,6; Abhidh-av 79,4* (~o
vibhāvana-nayakkamo ≠ Yam-a 52,1* (cf. Vibh-a
1,9*, Sp (II) 285,1*). — Ifc. v. an-°, vādâ°.
— °-dhamma-rajja, mfn., possessed of the sovereignty
of truth; Mp I 134,19 (~o dhammarājā). — °-rūpa,
mfn. = anu(p)patta (brachylogically for *anupatta
daṇḍa and thus:) who has incurred (penalty); Pv 573
— 78 (paṇītadaṇḍo ~o (-p-); = rājâṇaṁ anupattapaka-
tiko, Pv-a). — °-sadattha,mfn., who has reached the
good (real) thing (ɔ : arahatta), or who has reached
his own (highest) goal [sad- representing sa(t) and
sva- as well; cf. Th 112 and Sn 627; Buddh, sa. anu-
prāpta-svakârtha]; arahaṁ khīṇâsavo, etc + ~o, Vin
I 183,24; It 38,10 (It-a) = 79,9; DN III 83,16 (Sv);
MN I 5,11; 235,11; SN III 161,13; V 302,5; AN I 144,9
(Mp); III 376,18; Abhidh-av 128,18*; do. gen. ~assa,
MN III 30,6; do. pl. ~ā, MN III 80,22; Mil 104,17-28;
~ā viharanti, AN V 207,25 foll.

entry.re:
— °-dhammatāan-uppatti-dhammatā, f.
abstr.; ~aṁ āpajjati, Ud-a 214,3-7 (khīyati +); 433,18
(antaradhāyati +); Thī-a 35,2 (°âpādanena, so Ce;
Ee °âpadān°!).

entry.sense:
f. [sa. *anu + prāpti], attainment
(of one's desire); SN I 46,24* = 52,26* (hadayassâ-
nuppattiṁ [ ˇ ˇ - - ˇ - - , thus anu-pattiṁ, if not
an-upattiṁ (sa. *an-upātti; cf. 2an-upādāna)]; =
arahattaṁ, Spk; cf. appatta-mānaso = appatta-
anu-ppattiin order that he may recover his health), Mil 112,9.
abs. of anu-pāpuṇāti, q. v.

pādāta(r), see anu-ppadeti), m., Utt. one who gives
in addition (freely), i. e. who encourages, confirms,
or incites; DN I 4,20 (-ppā-; sahitānaṁ ~ā; = san-
dhānânuppadātā . . . dalhikammaṁ kattā, Sv) =
64,2 (-ppā-) = MN I 179,34 (Ps do.) = 288,13 -
345,16 = III 33,30 = 49,6 = AN II 209,9 (Mp) =
V 267,16 = Pp 57,34 (Pp-a) = Nidd I 220,15 (Nidd-a);
472,16 (Nidd-a); — bhinnānaṁ ~ā, MN I 286,34
(= bhinnānaṁ a-sandhānāya ~ā, Ps) = III 48,9
(-ppā-) = AN V 265,5.

(mostly misspelt anu-ppādāna), n.
(nomen actionis of anu-ppadeti), (a) giving, administer-
ing, furnishing; DN I 12,10(mūla-bhesajjānaṁ anu-ppā-
dānaṁ (anuppādanaṁ cod. Bm Sv I 98,22); °attham,
AN I 49,16 (cīvara-°, etc; Mp (Ee) II 92,13 v. l. anu-
ppādan°); instr. ~ena (cīvara-°, etc.), MN III 254,12
foll.; AN I 123,32 (Ee °ânuppādan°); Mil 315,9 (°dan-
takaṭṭha-mukhodakâ°); — (b) spending, granting;
instr. ~ena, AN III 56,24* (= satassa vā sahassassa
vā dānena, Mp) = Ja III 205,6* (= lañcadānena,
Ct.); Mp III 204,1 ad AN IV 41,3 (mātugāmassa
sayana-vatthâlaṁkārâdi-°); sabba-dhammaṁ ~ena,
Ja V 433,12 (°ppādan°; but see ib. 17* °-padānena).
— Ifc. v. aggaḷadānâ°, alaṁkārâ°, āmisâ°, issariyâ°,
upāyanâ°, dānâ°, pakka-bhikkhâ°, pattâ°, balâ°,
bhatta-vetanâ°, bhesajja-parikkhārâ°, madda-
anu-ppadāna

mfn., taking a pleasure in
giving; AN IV 79,15 (dānapati ~o).

mfn. (pp. of anu-ppadeti), given,
bestowed; Khp VII 13 (balañ ca bhikkhūnam ~aṁ;
Pj) = Pv 25; Ap 153,14 (~ā Buddhena sabbesaṁ
bījasampadā) = Th-a Ce 153,34*.

(or anu-padeti), pr. 3 sg. [sa. anu-
pra-√dā, by scribes confounded with *anu + up +
anu-ppadetippādāta(r) above], to give (in return or in addition),
to bestow, to hand over (acc. gen.); to supply (acc);
DN III 187,8 (tad-diguṇaṁ bhogaṁ ~°ppădeti);
[Nidd II 93,35 (anuppādeti, prob, to be read anupādeti,
q. ».)]; Mil 210,21 (yathicchitaṁ °-ppadeti); 2 sg.
°-ppadesi, SN I 162,8 (khādanīyaṁ, etc.); 1 sg. °-ppa-
demi (khādanīyaṁ, etc.), SN I 162,10; °-ppadāmi,
DN III 67,10 (better with v. l. °-ppadassāmi); part,
m. °-ppādento, Ja V 124,3'; part. med. m. °-ppada-
damāno, Mp (Ee) II 194,28 (bhesajjaṁ); imper. 3 sg.
°-ppădetu, DN I 135,21 (tesaṁ . . . b[ī/i]jabhattaṁ, see
ib. note 9; Sv); 2 sg. °-ppadehi (amhākaṁ kālena
kālaṁ), AN I 117,7; pot. (a) 3 pl. °-ppadajjuṁ
(vatthaṁ . . . rajakassa), SN III 131,9 (Spk); (b) with
double pot. suffix, cf. Sadd 833,9, 12, etc.: 2 sg. °-ppa-
dajjeyyāsi, DN III 61,10 (tesaṁ dhanaṁ); MN I
416,23 (evarūpaṁ kāyakammaṁ ~, cf. v. l.; opp.
paṭisaṁhareyyāsi ib. 17; = anuppadeyyāsi upattham-
bheyyāsi punappunaṁ kareyyāsi, Ps); 1 pl. °-padaj-
jeyyāma (āyasmantānaṁ kiñcimattaṁ), Vin III
259,11** (ib. 13** pot. 3 sg. °-padajjeyya ≠ upasaṁ-
haret, JAs 1914, 500,1); aor. (a) 3 sg. °-ppadāsi, DN
III 65,15 (adhanānaṁ dhanaṁ); 66,2; Ja III 342,1
(assa yasaṁ ~); 3 pl. °-ppadaṁsu, DN III 93,10
(assa sālīnaṁ bhāgaṁ); (b) 3 sg. °-ppadesi, DN III
66,30 (tesaṁ rājā dhanaṁ; ímtcf. 66,2); °-ppădesi,
DN I 136,2 (tesaṁ . . . bījabhattaṁ, v. l. °ppadāsi));
fut. 3 sg. °-padassati, Sn 983 (me yācamānassa nâ°);
°-ppadassati (upadhismiṁ vā kāyaṁ upasaṁharis-
sati cittaṁ vā ~), MN II 260,25 (v. l. for uppădes-
sati); °padassati (dhammikaṁ baliṁ [v. l. balaṁ, Ee
phalarh]), SN IV 303,21 (v. l. anupassati, Ee anusaris-
sati); °-ppadassati (petānaṁ kālakatānaṁ dakkḥi-
ṇaṁ), AN III 43,19, 25*; 1 sg. °-ppadassāmi, DN III
189,9 (petānaṁ kālakatānaṁ dakkhiṇaṁ); 67,10
(v. l.); 1 pl. °-ppadassāma, DN III 92,30 (assa sālīnaṁ
bhāgaṁ); inf. °-ppadātuṁ (amhākaṁ kālena kālaṁ),
AN I 117,5 (Mp); abs. °-ppadatvā (diguṇaṁ dha-
naṁ), Pj II 35,24; grd. °-ppadătabba, mfn., MN II
178,20 = 181,4 = AN III 384,13 (mūlaṁ~aṁ; Mp);
pass, [anu-ppadiyati], neg. part. loc. an-anu-ppādiya-
māne (adhanānaṁ dhane), DN III 65,16 (Sv: dhane
nânuppadiyamāne(l) ti na anuppadiyamāne [Ee
anuppādeyyamāne], ayam eva vā pāṭho); pp. anu-
ppadinna (q. v.).

mfn. [sa. an-utpanna], unborn, not
(yet) appeared, not arisen; ~aṁ yasaṁ uppādento,
Ja VI 380,23'; ~assa maggassa uppādetā (scil. Bha-
gavā), MN III 8,11; SN I 191,1 (quoted Ps II 381,7;
Spk); Nidd I 178,4 (Nidd-a); Ap 570,5 (= Thī-a
91,33*); Mil 217,9 foll.; ~assa lābhassa uppādanaṁ,
Ja V 117,16'; — ~e Buddhe, Dhp-a I 88,15; 196,9;
IV 87,20; pl. ~ā, Dhs p. 2,13 (As 45,29); (apātu-
bhūtā +), Dhs 1036; ~ā me pāpakā akusalā dhammā,
SN II 196,9 foll. (Spk); ~ā (akusalā dhammā), Mil
385,2; gen. ~ānaṁ ... dhammānaṁ anuppādāya,
DN II 312,20 (Sv); MN II 11,12 (Ps); 26,24; SN V
268,8; AN II 74,7 ≠ AN I 153,7; loc. ~esu kicc(h)esu,
SN I 54,1* (Spk), quoted Ps I 235,26* = Sv (III)
750,16*; — ~assa maggassa uppāda-pañho, title (in

concerning a case not yet occurred; paññatti anu-
paññatti +, Vin V 1,8 foll; 54,14; 115,13; 120,18.
entry.re:
— °-pubbaan-uppanna-pubba, mfn., not arisen before; Pj I 161,17;
Nidd-a ad Nidd I 178,4.

— °-bhoguppattian-uppanna-bhoguppatti, f., gaining
goods not yet acquired; f. abstr. ~tā, Pj I 33,30.
— °-vevacana, n., a synonym of the word a°, Spk I
277,28 (scil. asañjāta).

entry.sense:
m. (verbal noun of anu-ppaban-
dhati), continuity, continuing; As 115,2; Ps I 207,30
(°vasena avicchedāya = 'ṭhitiyā'); Sp-ṭ ad Sp (II)

(E^ II 203,24. — Ifc v. dukkhâ°. — °-tā, f. abstr.,
Abhidh-av 71,12* (for anuppabaddhatā or anuppa-
bandhanā?)

— °-bhāvaanu-ppabandha-bhāva, m.abstr.; Sp (II) 464,1 (so CeEe; Se
anuppabandhâbhāva). — Ifc. v. kodhâ°.

entry.sense:
pr. 3 sg. [sa. *anu-pra-
√bandh], to follow continually, to keep on, continue;
part. ~anta, Mil 132,16 (megho aparāparaṁ ~o abhi-

n., continuing, not stopping;
°-tā, f. abstr., Mil 132,19;
entry.re:
— °-pavattianu-ppabandhana-pavatti, f. , continu-
ous motion or activity, As 115,16 (= santānena pa-
vatti, mṭ).

entry.sense:
f. = prec, Pp 18,21 =
Vibh 357,13; see Abhidh-av 71,12* s.v. anuppaban-

pr. 3 sg., caus. of anu-
ppabandhati (q. v.); pot. 3 pl. ~eyyum, Mil 132,24
(°-meghavassaṁ aparāparaṁ ~).

m. [sa. anu-prayoga], additional
use of another word in similar sense (as the preceding
one), Mogg-vVI 13; °-vacana, n., a word used in
that way; Sp (III) 728,19 (ad Vin III 261,25).
[see anu-pavecchati].

anu-ppavattaka, anu-ppavatteti, anu-ppa-

ppaveseti,

entry.sense: see above under anu-pa°.

m. [sa. an-utpāda], not coming into
existence, not arising, non-appearance; kāmacchan-

54,28; 409,18); Nett 15,13; 54,6, etc.;

ma, mfn., not liable to come into existence again;
anabhāvaṁ gato āyatiṁ ~o, DN III 270,30 ≠ Vin

entry.sense:

ducing, not fulfilling, neglecting; Ud-a 304,28 (°-pa-
